reviews.review: A must -see. Lovely bridge and so iconic. It's a must-see whilst on a visit to the capital. You can get a lovely view by going underneath it in a boat trip
Interesting to see but not a must have. Not what I was expecting. The main atraction seemed to be the glass floors but nothing else impressed me.
Beautiful Landmark. Even if you don't do the Bridge experience, just walk across it - it's beautiful and the views are terrific. And it's free!

Probably prettiest bridge in London . We walked around there, during day and night and it's really nice. It was not far from our hotel, the bridge is beautiful and you could cross it ( right not they have some construction work to fix the road so it's a little noisy but no cars drive there) At night it's slightly purple - very nice to seeThere's an army ship you could see between tower bridge and London bridge but I'm not quite sure what's the story about it
Nice walk.. The bridge is undergoing roadworks at the moment but the pedestrian access is not affected except for some noise and dust. Great views of the Tower and the river.

Short but very interesting exhibition!. The Tower Bridge is undoubtedly the most famous bridge in the world and has its own little museum packed with interesting information on its history.The tour started with a lift ride to the top where it showcases how it is built and the milestones it has been through. You will get to walk across the 2 glass bridges on top of the bridge where you have good views over the Thames. Part of the bridge comes with glass floor which can be scary for some!Also, visit the engines rooms!
Love this. The Architectural is just amazing. Its a best place to meet up with friends and family. Great view of the whole london

We didn't go inside. We didn't go inside, but it seemed like it would be fun. Worth the trip to get your London photos. Right near the tower of london. Do tower of london, walk over the tower bridge, then go to Borough Market. About a 20 -25 minute walk.

View it at the right time. As a keen photographer I think that such landmarks are best seen/captured in the right light.As it happens, very early morning and evening light are also the best times to view with less traffic (it's relative)It is conveniently located very close to the Tower of London so that the two attractions can be viewed together.

Flood-lit photo session. I picked the wrong time to visit. The bridge was undergoing extensive repairs and was largely covered in scaffolding. Lots of view points though. Will return when the repairs are complete.
great bridge. it was fantastic to watch this bridge! it was a perfect vacantion visiting all around! is great on a sunny day

Visited Sep 2016. One of the great and oldest London (iconic) attractions.There is not much to do there besides learning the history of the bridge. The admission fee is not as high as other city attractions and we managed to get 20% discount by showing a qualifying London printed map to the attendant. The bridge is right next to The Tower of London and has a nice view over the river Thames from both sides - east and west. There is a glass floor on the upper bridge section allowing you to view the traffic below. There are also ceiling mirrors for quirky selfies. We used a vending machine that takes photos of you and your beloved or family, and pasting them on a postcard template with professional images of the bridge. I guess these would make a good memento in any family album. It is not cheap (I think we paid 10 pounds for 4 different postcards) but nothing in London is!After the bridge, you are taken to the boiler room which is on the south side of the river, where, the now redundant machinery powering the bridge is on display.

Great design, fantastic views from the top. One of London's great icons. Bridge lift times are available at towerbridge.org.uk. I have visited the bridge several times and it never fails to impress. This time we visited the museum and also experienced walking over the Thames River via the glass floor high up the bridge. The museum is fascinating and explains the history of the bridge, its design and its operation. The views from the top are breath taking (maybe it had something to do with the glass floor). When we were in the museum we were told that Tower Bridge was soon to be closed to traffic for the resurfacing of its bascules. However we were also told that visitors to Tower Bridge Exhibition will still be able to go inside and enjoy all the exhibition has to offer.

Iconic London. The tower bridge is an iconic landmark of London so for every tourist is well worth a few photos/a selfie. The bridge is a suspension bridge and is about 120 years old positioned over the Thames. It's probably best viewed from a distance but is a nice addition to the usual London scenery/backdrop in a well placed photo.

Incredible part of English history. I was born just down the road from here at the London Hospital in Whitechapel, London E1 and Tower Bridge will always be special to me. I had my 21st birthday in the (then) Tower Hotel which is alongside Tower Bridge.
Very beautiful. It's a very beautiful place. The sightseeing is amazing. It crosses over the Thames river, on the symbols of London.
Check bridge open times before you go. This place is awesome if you go during bridge opening time. Check the official site for bridge opening times.

Had fun. We decided to do this on the spur of the moment since we had just visited the Tower of London. We enjoyed our visit and believe it or not, had some laughs. Two of us were scared of heights so the glass walkways were a bit of a challenge that we took in stride.
Fantastic. Tower Bridge is so worth the visit and a walk across. It is a beautiful bridge and on a nice day the walk is just terrific. So worth it. Be careful though, closed for three months.

Landmark monument - must picture for your travels. There is a nice broad walkway along the river right outside the Tower of London that provides an ideal spot to get pictures with your group or stepping to the waterfront, eliminating all foot traffic from your shot.

Impressive/historical bridge. I used to work nearby Tower Bridge and I never appreciated its history and impressive look until last winter when me and my wife crossed the bridge that covered full of snow. Such a romantic feeling! Also you can easily get the views from both sides of the Thames river. What are you waiting for!

Well worth the visit. Very interesting, told the story of how the tower bridge was built and fantastic views across the Thames and also an experience walking over the glass floor. When in London its one of those things on the must do list

Well worth the visit. Visited London a number of times and slowly running out of things to do but took an opportunity to walk over the Thames higher up and over the glass floor! Great views and experience and well worth the monies paid.
Tip- Book the dual package which includes the 'Monument' visit.

Good place to visit, awesome view when the bridge opens. Good place to visit, awesome view when the bridge opens and a ship passes by.
Recommend you to google the bridge opening times and then visit this attraction.

Very nice walk. Walked across the bridge and around the London tower with 2 girls 6, and 8 and they ware in awe just from histories that I told them about the places, did not even bother to go inside for the museums.

Good tourist attraction . Spectacular tourist attraction! We took several photos on both sides of the bridge. We also walked over the bridge, were slightly disappointed to see building works happening on the bridge, however they were well contained by barriers.
Would visit this attraction again
Impressive. A very nice spot to walk through in this region. Rocommended after a visit at the tower of london and viewing from the tower.

Iconic London Landmark. Another "must do" when in London. This beautiful Victorian bridge has something for everyone. Great to take photos of, interesting engineering, and fantastic views from the walkway above which includes glass floors. Do not miss it!

Glass floor view is surrealistic. What a trip to be able to walk on glass, across the bridge!! Freaky really, but seriously, this is probably something, you should experience. We were lucky enough to be on the walkway, when the bascules or leaves, were raised to allow river traffic to pass. Towers are 213 ft, standing on the glass, looking down between your feet, is surrealistic. Probably not for you, if problem with heights. Nice views, in all directions. One interesting note, German pilots never bombed the bridge in WWII, as they used it for a point of reference, when bombing London, and other points in England. Lots of informative historical info boards, all the the bridge, a good tour if you want to see how the bascules worked then (early 1800's), and now. Would highly recommend, if your sightseeing, in London.

Go for the walkway.. Timed the visit to coincide with the bridge lifting not just once but twice. You get up to the upper part of the bridge via a lift, at each end is a video showing various aspects of the bridge & its life. There is a glass section of the floor on both sods of the bridge, each one is about 11m long & it's well worth trying to walk over it. The view out of the windows on both sides of the bridge are pretty spectacular when we were there, there was a super yacht moored up & also we saw a double rainbow over Canary Wharf. But the bet bit of the whole trip was to be there when the bridge was raised to allow the iconic paddle steamer The Waverley underneath, after a brief turnaround it went back under the bridge again, so it had been raised twice in the time we were up there.A fantastic experience & great value for money, part of the impact is going to be lessened as the bridge is going to permanently open for a while to allow works to be carried out, but it is still spectacular.

Glass floored viewing station. Booked tickets on-line for £6 per person (cheaper than buying the tickets on the day). One of the most stunning bridges built. Interesting displays across the viewing platforms. The glass floor view points give a new perspective - you've got to be brave to sit or stand on the glass but well worth it if you can! A great vantage point for a number of other London attractions. Friendly and informative staff.

Glass floor on top walkways adds to the experience. Good visit, with many - although brief - descriptions of history. Some, however, seemed to have little relevance to Tower Bridge itself. It requires some walking to get to the various elements. Fine views of the Tower and the Thames. Sensibly too, you can take photos directly through open windows on the high walkways.
Love this bridge. Best bridge in London. So great to look at and look out from with views of the Thames and the wonderful Tower of London. Love it!

Favourite London monument. The Tower bridge was the biggest surprise for me when in London. The place with area next to it combines the old special London atmosphere with that new modern one. It's a must see for me!

Good photo ops. There are some amazing photo ops around the tower bridge. Get there during early morning when the mist is covering the bridge and the Tower of London or during the evening/night when the entire area is lit up. You can check up to when there are scheduled openings of the bridge for the ships to sail through and that'd be one experience that you would never forget!
Amazing, ornate structure. A great way to do the Tower Bridge is on the open top deck of a Big Bus tour! You get a great view of the structure.
Breathtaking . I was just overwhelmed by the size of the bride. Is a fascinating leaving and moving piece of history and you should definitely make the time, while in London to visit it.
A must see. A beautiful Bridge a must see in London, the restaurants by the Thames are absolutely perfect and borough market just a walk away
Overall. Very nice bridge...it opens up to allow big ships to pass under very thrilling. You can easily walk across or visit the galleries...nice to see in the evening.

Walk Across the Top of the Bridge!. We enjoyed our tour of the Tower Bridge. The exhibits inside the Tower Bridge are interesting but walking across the top of the bridge, the sights of London and the Thames are great. A must see if you are visiting London.
Nice bridge. Maybe the most beautiful bridge in London, you can go up the London Bridge and know more about its history

Amazing view and fun.. We were very glad we had the London Pass and did not have to wait in the long line. This was a fun stop. For those of you afraid of heights be aware of the glass floor! It was a fun stop and worth the time. The Engine room tour was a bit of a let down but interesting to see.

Interesting views of passing boats. The glassfloor on the tower's two walkways make for interesting views of the boats passing underneath the bridge. Signage is adequate, and visitors aren't rushed, but it can get crowded (and noisy) at times. Certainly an icon every visitor to London should see once in their life.

Looking below from the glass panes is amazing. No trip to London is completed without doing London Bridge. Highly interesting and the Thames views are just magic. Walking on the glass panes and looking on to the road below is certainly different if not for everyone.

London bridge is falling down. Very enspiring bridge and it still works after hundreds of years. This is a must see in London. No tickets required and no entrance. Great place to take beautiful fotos!

Wonderful . Another great day out. We bought the tickets for this place along with entry to the Tower of London, I found that by booking 2 attractions you can save more money.The engineering of this place is staggering! Being able to see the mechanics and how it works is great. The top is also brilliant, a long walk to the top but we'll worth it. The glass floor section is a nice addition, but understandable that it can make people queezy. You can see right down to the river and all the people cats and boats passing underneath you. A nice touch, if your not too sure of the history of the place is the big screen inside one of the coloums where you can watch a brief documentary about how the bridge was made. The type of the bridge has the history in pictures and with the faces of the men behind it, along with other images of famous bridges around the world. A nice day out for everyone

An awesome structure. Seen so many times on TV and in movies but nothing beats seeing it in real life. The best view was from the Tower of London but we also walked to the other side were there was a party atmosphere that afternoon.
1990s. How can one visit London and not talk about the tower bridge. Have ridden across it on the famed London taxi and have walked across it. Just love the structure.....
Emblematic!. A must see on any trip to London, this place is unique. At the moment it is closed to traffic as they seemed to be just staring some big repair work.

Iconic. Tower Bridge is a convenient experience to have after visiting Tower of London. It is easy to walk across and from there you will find many great spots for photos. You can go inside and access from midway point, but the line can be very long.

Awesome!. To me, this is the essence of London. Building the bridge started in 1886 and was completed in 1894. The bridge measuring 244 metres, spans the Thames, connecting the London boroughs of Tower Hamlets (north side) and Southwark (south side). For some reason, the bridge was heavily criticised when built, but is now a major tourist attraction.

Iconic bridge. We had fun going up and across Tower Bridge. To add to the experience, there's information about how the bridge was built and other innovative bridges around the world. We enjoyed taking pictures on the glass floor and seeing it go up and down to let boats pass through. It's not a must do in London, but definitely worth doing before or after visiting the Tower of London, especially if you have the London Pass.
architecture and a half.. I see this bridge everyday on my way to work and i never one take for granted the beauty. It is one of the best.

The best bridge to date. Tower bridge is for me the best, the nicest and most beautiful bridge that I have seen to date. It is amazing to see and to hear stories about it. You can visit it (climb onto it), but we did not because it seemed expensive. We did get an amazing view of the bridge because we took the boat tour. Very very nice.

Lovely walk to the Bridge. In September I was in London with a friend who had never before been to the city. Inevitably, one of the first things we went to was the Tower Bridge. It was a warm and sunny morning, but the light was not right for taking pictures. So we walked along the length of the river till we came to the road and crossed over to the other side. It was perfect. Following the facelift of 2012, it is bright and gleamed in the sunlight. The jetty a little ahead takes one by the riverside; from here the Bridge literally towered over our heads. Built in between 1886 and 1894 across the Thames, it opens up to let ships pass through it and is most certainly the iconic symbol of London. With the Tower of London behind us and the Tower Bridge in front, the setting was remarkable, to say the least.
The most beautiful bridge!. The majesty of Tower Bridge never fails to stun whatever the weather. A must-see for any visitor to London.
Glass floor!. Historical site which provides the details regarding the construction of the tower. You have to walk across the catwalk to gain a different perspective of the bridge and Thames.

Over the Thames. The entrance is on the north side and the lift takes you to the top level. All is enclosed, so no need worrying about the wind. From there is a beautiful stroll on the east side towards the south side. Views are amazing. West side is also available to walk across. Partially glass floor is a lovely feature. History of the bridge and world bridge engineering is very nicely displayed. Descend is several flights of stairs on the south side to shop level and then with the lift to the bottom. Very dissapointing, the engine workshop was not open and no one informed us about this.

What's in a name ?. The Tower Bridge is fondly thought or remembered as the London Bridge. I think the confusion is a great conversation starter and by the time one finishes with London : you may hear it some 100 times. But then does it really matter :).? The Tower Bridge it's self is pretty majestic and awesome. We actually took a long walk over and around the bridge in the evening (best way to take in the magnificent views around it). I enjoy thinking of all the different types of carriages which moved over it over the years. Has some great hues once the lights come out at night. I would recommend the long walk to the millennium bridge (both of them imprinted thanks to Harry Potter films). Fuel your self up around the Tower of London : some good eating spots there and places to capture a digital image too :)

Top of the Tower. Okay... The glass floor is pretty cool. Traffic is zooming by below and there's just something about seeing it though the glass and standing right above it. This is the real highlight of the Tower Bridge. The rest of it is interesting but we didn't devote tons of time here. We had 3 children to think about... And 3 adults who can't pay attention that long either.

Nice view. Excellent view and a very nice walk.
Did not go to exhibition
Shame we had a lot of noise from roadworks

Lovely bit of history, great view. The architecture and beauty of the bridge is amazing. It's very easy to walk over, and you get a nice view of the Thames. Make sure you see the Tower of London while you're there.
very interesting visit. The glass floor is a fabulous visitors attraction as is the workings of the bridge explanation that was shown to us.
Bigger than in pics. A stunning big bridge in the middle of London. A nice place to walk around, have a drink nearby (there are some bars around) and watch the sunset.

Being fixed. Lots of work being done at the moment which actually is a bonus since it id now pedestrian only for the duration of the work. Watch out for the odd illegal cyclist though...most push their bikes but some selfish riders don't care. Iconic view of London from one of its icons.
Another beauty. A must see on your visit to London....right along with the Tower of London and the Crown Jewels....its simply gorgeous to see!

Nice bridge. Some Constraction are going there, hotel to finish soon.
Stairs side has very bad smell, not cleaned since long time.

Fabulous Views. If you can visit this bridge during the day and at night. The difference is remarkable. The view at night is stunning as the Thames lights up in front of you. If you also feel so inclined you can pay to go up and walk along a glass floor above the bridge. It is quite busy and so isn't easy to get photos but there's something very moving about it.
Brilliant experience. A very informative attraction that gave a lot to see and great clear information about the history and working of the bridge. Well worth a visit.
Unique Structure. Scene for the upcoming Transformers movie was being shot in the day I visited Tower Bridge. It did worth the visit.
London personified. This iconic bridge is well worth spending time on. Saw a lift operation, magnificent. Butlers Wharf, very close by, is worth visiting too

Beautiful landmark in London. It's a gorgeous bridge in a very vibrant part of central London. Worth walking over for some great views although rather windy. Also plenty of places to stay nearby and good restaurants and cafes/bars in the vicinity.

Beautiful and breathtaking!. We did the Tower of London but the bridge was actually my favorite part of the whole experience. It's simply beautiful and probably the most beautiful bridge I have ever seen besides my SF Golden Gate Bridge. I would definitely recommend coming just to see this bridge even if you don't go to the Tower of London.

Tower bridge. Really amazing. Saw the bridge go up to let a large boat go through. Walked over the top with glass floor, and mirrored ceiling and glass floor, with visit to engine room. Amazing experience!

Interesting, you can also go inside. This magnificent bridge can not only be admired from the outside, but also from the inside. The museum allows you to look into the history of the bridge and the way it works.

great view at night. great view at night
there are plenty of resturants in the vicinity some are facing the bridge
the view at night gets more beautiful than the day time
i highly recommend it during the evening or sunset and night time

Great Bridge. Always wanted to visit this bridge. I walked across on the way to the Tower of London however the road works here at the moment are a nightmare. Still worth a visit though especially on the way to the tower.
Perfect!. One of the most beautiful place ever! Perfect spot for photography and view.. Make sure you choose a sunny day to enjoy there.
Amazing . What an awesome and historically iconic bridge. A must see if you visit London and of course you need to cross it to reach the Tower of London

Best views of the Shard. Everyone living or visiting the UK should go see the Tower Bridge. Situated right next to the Shard one can walk over the bridge to capture fabulous pictures of London and the Shard.

Private Hire. We hired the two function rooms at the top of the bridge in March 2016, the events company handling the whole process were very professional the whole time managing almost everything for us. The canape offering was nice and varied with the drinks to match. Overall value for money was fair which is why it gets booked up very early, its very obviously why it makes such a amazing wedding venue too! Only downside was that the main lift wasn't working but that's more bad luck than anything else.

Brilliant Views of London and cheap. Loved it new open walkway to look into traffic, most adults walked on the edge in fear of dropping. I looked at the perspex and glass closely and you ain't going to fall through. Views are amazing and the engine room is cool. Can't believe it is so cheap to visit for everything you get.
Iconic Bridge. Beautiful peice of architecture worth a visit and a walk across - we were lucky to see the bridge open as a galleon in full sail passed beneath - awesome.

Incredible feeling when you're in front of the tower bridge. I am very lucky myself to have visited London. It's incredible just being in front of the Tower Bridge and all the history. I do have to say though it's not worth the price just to go to the top of the bridge £10 is what they charge per adult. Just save your money and spend it elsewhere. Even though I say that this place is still worth visiting though.
uk rocks. it was a wonderful experience planing the day i left home almost 3 hours we spent they took out same nice pics

An iconic landmark. One of the iconic landmarks of London. I enjoyed the trip up to the top level of the bridge, and also enjoyed looking around the engine room. I found it interesting to see the mechanism that raised the bridge before it was electrified. Good views of the city and tower from the top.

Second most pictured in London. Probably Tower Bridge is the second most photographed site in London after The Big Ben. It's nicer when it opens to allow ships sail by. I think it will be under repairs in the next weeks so it won't open till November or December
glass walkway. popular with the family as an opener and not too expensive but wouldn't go out of our way to do it again
This isnt the London Bridge. Often mistaken for the London Bridge, this is the most beautiful bridge in the world and you can cross and experience this for free.

Worth a visit, but not worth paying for unless you're a bridge-phile. Very picturesque, impressive architecture, and great photo opportunities, but very touristy. Have fun stepping over/waiting for the 80% of travelers who absolutely MUST get the 'I'm laying on thin air!' selfie over the glass floor in the upper tier walkway.Staff is helpful and knowledgeable, but many of them seem very bored, lol (understandably).Wouldn't pay the $12 (£9) for admission again. Honestly the only thing I would say that about the entire trip. A walk across it will suffice.
Great view when historic ships pass the bridge. This time I was lucky to have the opportunity to watch beautiful sailing ships, when they passed the bridge

Lovely day out sightseeing!. Great views over the iconic Tower Bridge that displays amazing realisation of British engineering.
If googled in advance you can find out when the bridge lifts and is a spectacular thing on its own.
What makes London, London! . Lovely views across the river. Had a lovely, causal romantic time walking across it with my husband!

Brillant!!!. This is an exquisite architectural bridge. We had seen it several times on previous tours, boat trip and other times in London. But this time thanks to Breakaway Bike Tours we actually got to ride across the bridge and see it up close. Absolutely stunning.

Great views and glass floors!. Not a big fan of heights, but I had to try the glass partitions on the bridge! Scary but fun, with one section having mirrors above you, so you can take great pics standing on them!
Stunning at night time. Absolutely beautiful to see at night! we were on a dinner cruise and got to get up nice and close to take a lot of pictures.

Great place to visit - but I wouldn't like to live there!. A very imposing building on the River Thames. People from all over the world come to see and hear of the horrors that have taken place in "The Tower" over the Centuries and few are disappointed - a grand and historic spot on your tour of London that should not be missed - lots to see and lots to do in this very cosmopolitan City and the Tower is up there with the best

Worth walking across and seeing from the river bank. Another London icon. It is a must see with your spouse and take a picture with the bridge behind it. It is fun to walk across the bridge and see it up close as well. We didn't visit the exhibit in the bridge, and believe it would be worth taking the trip up if you have time.

Very Touristy but Worth A Visit. Iconic bridge that is mistaken as the London Bridge but is actually the Tower Bridge. This is an excellent attraction for a tourist and really worth a visit. You can walk right across the bridge and marvel the engineering feat up close.

Enjoy!!. Had wonderful time to see to bridge opened at nightwalking along riverside way form the London bridge to tower bridge was great as well. however it not far from Tower hill station. it's really comfortable to get there.

Well worth a visit . Got 2 for 1 with days out guide and rail ticket. £9 for two of us. Ticket includes exhibition of history and building of Tower Bridge, visit to the engine rooms and you get to walk over the glass floor! If you are scared of heights I wouldn't recommend it. If you have time I would suggest visiting the bridge and glass floor during one of the bridge lifts which happen throughout the day. Well worth a visit and great value.
Great Photo Op. One of those "must sees" in London. Takes only a few minutes to walk across, and offers a great view of the London skyline.
Heart of London. It is a place to enjoy the Thames view and to be close to London history and past. Place to spend time only enjoying.

Fun tourist Attraction. We went to the Tower Bridge back in March 2016. We enjoyed walking over the glass Bottom floor and did all of the fun photos. It was not to crowded the day we went. We climbed all the stairs but they do have an elevator if you need one.

Totally unique. There is only ever one word to describe this landmark - magnificent! Architecturally, and in practical terms, it can have few equals. Even the raising operation is majestical. The added bonus these days is to be able to view the Thames from the glass floor which is even better still if timed to coincide with an actual raising.
Great views. Thoroughly enjoyed this visit. Staff were friendly & informative. Enjoyed every aspect. Great views from the walkways. Loved the glass floors. Highly recommend.

Slice of History . A gorgeous bridge which is well maintained with a lovely glass viewing platform. Very popular with tourists, walking across felt like taking part of a small slice of history with me. It's amazing how large it is and what a stronghold it was all those centuries ago!
beautiful. Didn't go inside, but crossed the river several times through this bridge.this is the best access to north bank river
An historical bridge.. I combined the tower of London with tower bridge by purchasing a London pass and save a lot of money. This is a fine bridge and do visit.

Good value for money. We really enjoyed the tower bridge experience. It was good value for money and the glass floor was brilliant. There's touch screen computers placed around which tell you what you what you can see from that side of the bridge which I found really interesting and helpful. The gift shop has some really cute bits in which again were priced reasonable, some of the baby clothes were to die for. We stopped off for a cocktail at a near by river bar and then got to see the bridge open to let a boat come through. I'd highly recommend it to anyone sight seeing in London.

Best bridge ever!. An amazing piece of history, a stunning piece of architecture and the atmosphere around the Tower is great. Fantastic views of the River Thames and plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. A must see for visitors to London.

Great view. A walking tour of the bridge would be worth it so you can understand more abouts it history. I would also suggest a river cruise where you can get off and walk around the tower. Very nice.

Very impressive construction - watch opening . The construction itself is very impressive - check the Tower Bridge museum to learn about the details - and, if you're lucky, you will witness when it is opening for big ships to pass through which is stunning considering it is opened hydraulically up to an angle of 86 degrees.Make sure to take pictures of the bridge from different angles - from the Tower, from Southwark/Bermondsey side of the Themse, from St. Paul's Cathedral (outside the dome), from London Eye...If you're there at opening time, be creative in taking funny pictures (holding down, pushing up); if it is closed and open for traffic and pedestrians, make sure to walk over to the other side and take pictures from ON the bridge (find the best angle to catch the Tower and maybe the Gherkin and/or St. Paul's Cathedral in 1 picture).Best to be combined with a visit to the Tower and great at any time of the day as there is always something interesting to see around Tower Bridge. Enjoy!
Great spot. Went there without any prebooking, there was no big line. enjoyed the mini tour, and we were lucky to be there when the lifting was happening.

Glad we visited- fun to see the inside of the bridge. We visited Tower Bridge on a crazy weather day, with rain, hail and sleet forcing us to wait about 20 minutes in Dead Man's Hole (at the bottom of the bridge) before we could go up. Luckily the weather cleared, as there wouldn't be much point going up there if it was raining. We enjoyed walking along the length of the bridge, looking through the clear glass to the road, and taking in the nice view. There are small windows along the length of the bridge that open for photos, but it would be tricky if it was raining. We weren't all that interested in the text panels that talked about different bridges around the world. We then had a quick look at the pump room, but didn't linger long. I think the price is a little high for the amount of time spent here, and the amount of things to do. Glad we have done it once though.

Worth a Visit. Iconic London landmark which I have passed under many times so decided to visit one wet Saturday morning. Access was easy, short queue and good flow to the visit. Personally I felt the start/finish videos were a bit disappointing but there are some more interesting ones on the walkway which provide background on history. Also some good views of London and an interesting perspective from the glass floors. Engine room worth a visit.

A landmark not to be missed. The tower bridge to me is the symbol of London and stands firm and in it's full glory on the Thames. The detail that has gone into building the bridge and the stories and mysteries behind it are endless.Walk passed the bridge and combine it with a visit to the Tower of London, you can't feel more alive in London than being right here. Hopefully you have a chance to see it function and open from time to time or take a tour bus and cross the bridge to see it on a higher level and be amazed by it's detail.A piece of art in architecture and absolute a must see on your London travel list...
Beautiful Bridge. We saw the bridge from our river cruise. Beautiful sight. You can go across and inside it, but we did not do that.

A London must see. The bridge is amazing and definitely worth seeing if visiting London even only for a day. Don't think it's necessary to pay to go up in the bridge, because most great views in that area are OF the bridge itself. But definitely worth crossing and admiring it from different angles. Also looks amazing lit up at night.

Iconic place.. Walking to the different sides of the Thames though this brigde is fantastic. I was lucky that I also saw how they handle for a ship to go through interrupting the traffic and elevating the bridge.

My London Vacay. Took the glass bottom tour. Great experience and photo opportunities. This bridge is beautiful, especially seeing it at night. Go online to see the bridge opening times. Easy to walk. Definitely a must do and of all the bridges, this one is the most beautiful.

Terrific Tower Bridge. Visited Tower Bridge for the first time, Would highly recommend for terrific views over London, the glass walkway makes it all the more special. We were part of a coach group and were given our tickets and the option of either waiting in line to get the lift, or we could go straight in and go up the stairs, without really thinking about it we opted for walking up the stairs. If you are in the same position, beware ... its a long long way up! Worth it though. On the way down, we got the lift and also visited the engine rooms, which are accessed over the bridge at road level and included in your entrance fee. Very good value for £9.00 per adult.

My favorite place in London..... It is unbelievable that after so many years and wars this bridge is still standing with all its glory. It is a beautiful place and worth every minute. Highly recommend you to walk through it ..and be close to it during sunset...it is beatiful!
Well worth a visit. Well worth visiting tower bridge. Very informative. The glass walkway was also an experience. Easy to get to. Good photo opportunities.

Icon Of London. Every time I go to London I love to go and see this marvelous structure....just so awesome in size and how the bridge actually moves up and down...my last trip was the first time I caught a taxi over the bridge.....but I think much better to walk and see feel the might of it. also a point to take note when the day turns to dusk is a good time to view the bridge as the lights certainly throw a totally new perspective ...well worth the effort to go and see.
Enchanting. Enjoy walking along the bridge and pausing occasionally to take in the wonderful view. If you have time, try to visit the bridge at night and see how dramatic it looks when lit up.
The Famous bridge of London. Nice to visit, have a walk to the bridge and walk across the walkway to the other side. Halfway you ha a good view across the Thames.

Must see the lifting of bridge. i checked the website for the time of lifting and was fortunate to witness the lifting procedure which begins with a siren to stop all traffic over the bridge before lifting..

Bus and boat tiue. Been on a few of these now and they are so worth the money. Also they save harm to the feet with walking :) there's quite a few different tours and routes and I've done them all. Decided to do the boat this time as never done it. It's cold so wrap up it's not as choppy as I thought it would be. Went to Greenwich which is a lovely Wee place and there were market stalls. Would definitely recommend.

Amazing walk across the bridge. Walking across the bridge provides wonderful views of the Tower of London and the Shard. Easy to walk across but it was busy during the day, we did get held up in the evening as they were raising the bridge for a ship to sail through but it was a wonderful sight. The bars along the river on the south bank were very inviting and there are plenty of places to eat and drink within a few yards of the bridge.

Great eperience. Good value for money, Tower Bridge Experience, well worth taking a look.
If you can catch it when the bridge is opening even better...
Can check for bridge openings easily on the net

my bridge. this bridge was seeable from by bedroom window for many years , you can't fail with tower bridge for a day out together . tower bridge is london although its owned by a german family , its a good place to view an old expensive hat ( family jewels ) .with beefeaters looking like they eat lots of beef and general jolly time . go there ... its fun :)
Interesting. This attraction is great & very knowledgeable. The visit at end to the engine works is particularly good. Glad we visited this place during our visit to London.

Fabulous . Our 7 year old absolutely lobes the bridge experience. We go everytime we're near bye. There's a passport trail.for kids where they can collect stickers to make up.their passport. The glass floor g is a massive hit. Beautiful views. It's a must
Always exciting. I am always excited when visiting or just crossing the Tower Bridge. It is one of the most famous London’s landmarks with great view and an engineering miracle at the same time!
Great!. We walked the tower bridge and it has a very good pedestrian pathway. The views of the river are wonderful. Very historic and wonderful engineering.
Fantastic photo opportunity. This historic bridge is iconic in London a must see in all weathers for all ages. Beautiful from the river cruises as well.

Amazing History and Architecture. Its incredible all that is still preserved here at the Tower Bridge, and its fun to walk across and see the view of the Tower of London from the other side. It's also fun to access both via a boat tour, located at the river front of the Tower of London.
Must See!. A historic must see! Wonderful experience for young and old alike. Great views from the top. Beautiful!

Tower Bridge Experience. And what an amazing experience! All the staff are very friendly and helpful, from the ticket office staff right through to the inevitable "leave through the gift shop" staff.Even going up in the lift was interesting! Amazing views from the walkway and the glass floor! Fantastic fun!We were lucky enough to be on the walkway when the bridge was raised to let the paddle steamer through, it was great to see it raised from that viewpoint.Great experience, great staff, great value for money! Do it!

I would skip paying. This is of course one of the most iconic London buildings, and surely it makes for great views from the ground. I totally do not recommend paying like 10 pounds to go up, honestly you might as well pay to get in the London eye. This place is beautiful as a background drop for your photos.

Tower Bridge Exhibition. Loved the beautiful, iconic Tower Bridge! The Tower Bridge Exhibition allows you to go to the top and walk across the bridge from up high - it has a glass floor which is awesome! A "must-do" when in London!!
Awesome tower bridge. The bridge significant for London's identity. The value it take international level is awesome. The strength in the construction is superb. Must see it in night.

Beautiful bride at night. It's quite a majestic sight at night. By far the best bridge for photo ops in London.
Didn't see it during the day, but it's a must-see at night.

Wonderful at night. You've probably seen Tower Bridge on television, movies, or elsewhere, but have you seen it at night? It is even more impressive and the surrounding area attracts locals and visitors alike.
Very nice to have a wander around, and there are a few souvenir shops nearby with a decent product selection.
Beautiful. Tower bridge is as pretty as is looks on the photographs, it is a must see when visiting city of London, that is for sure.
Iconic London!. Amazing Landmark!, Especially at night when the lights are on. It is one of my favorite sights in London. I have been to London several times and it leaves me in awe each time.

Offers amazing view ,s of the city, glass floor, and more...perhaps. Iconic destination, so certainly worth the visit the cost is not very high, and depending on when you visit the lines are that bad at all. This is a very easy walk and a place that could be visited after the Tower of London. Tickets can be purchased online or onsite, prices vary (family packages available), standard adult ticket (at the time we visited was £9.00 and about half that for children 5-15).In addition to the excellent views, and glass floor (very cool to walk over, if you dont mind heights), they have several video stations that tell the story of the bridge, very good stuff.Assuming the lines arent very long, you can easily visit in an hour.
Great views. Another must do attraction. The glass floor is great for snapping photos down at the river Thames and cars below.

It was Beautiful .must do in London. . It was great to see famous landmark we have always seen in movies and photos.It Was beautiful. We took a train from our accommodation and then maybe 10 to 15 minutes walk to this land mark. There is a safe pedestrians area to walk on bridge . Looks beautiful when you are on top of bridge. A must do when you are in London.

Majestic Spans the Thames. we visited here many times , most recently in the summer months and it never fails to please the eye . its an iconic photographic tourist spot , superb views from the tower of london , close to all amenities bars , food outlets etc . you can double your day by visiting theTower first and then the bridge. tube station within 5 min walk and buses by the dozen !!it is possible to go up into the top of the bridge and walk across to the other side . views from here are limited , the windows are small for obvious reasons , cant remember the fee involved but its more than fair , or we wouldnt have done it . was a worthwhile experience something that you wouldnt expect to be able to do , so would recommend it its part of London's history , its a beautiful bridge

Beautiful bridge, great experience. The Tower Bridge is a London icon. Besides the impressive bridge, the glass floor is also a good reason to visit. Both kids and adults have fun walking on the glass floor. The bridge is located just minutes away from the Tower Hill underground station.
British landmark . The bridge is steady and the river walk makes it easily accessible Good for wheelchair or footpath kids also You could walk your dog along the bridge also

A must see . I've always wanted to see it and I finally have! Definitely worth the walk... The only thing I didn't like is if you get on the tour bus and stop to see/walk the bridge. You need to walk across and back again because there's NO bus tour stations on the other side of the bridge. Besides that, totally worth seeing.
Awesome. This bridge is wonderful and from there you have many possibilities to eat or to visit other sightseeing places by foot.

went during the summer holiday!!. Tower Bridge is an iconic part of London and we enjoyed the view walking along the river from London Bridge station. On a sunny day, it's lovely, and there's plenty of cafes and pubs to stop in for refreshments. We went up into the bascules which feels like a touristy thing to do when you live here but still worth a visit. There are photos and stats of iconic bridges from around the world and a glass floor where you can see below into the river and watch the ships going past. It's slightly dizzying but very fun. Maybe not for those afraid of heights. From there you can take the lift/stairs down on the other side of the river and get to Tower Hill easily.
Must go! . It is absolutely incredible here. It is an engineering marvel and they really explain everything to you. The views are great as well. I recommend this to everyone
great view. Always great to visit the bridge every time I visit I am amazed how beutiful this bridge is. Will go back again.
Intersting. The Tower Bridge is worth seeing as it symbolizes London. The bridge machinery was interesting to me as an engineer but did not enthuse my wife.
Feeling the history. It was a great experience crossing this historical bridge. It has also great view that you can take perfect photos.

By far a favorite . I am not sure what it is about this bridge but it is by far a favorite of mine. Every time I stop in London I am sure to pass by the bridge to enjoy it's beauty and the river Thames
Do not skip the famous Tower Bridge. Impressive tower bridge; you have to cross it and get your 'postcard' pictures of this famous site. Boat rides will pass this bridge as well.
Interesting!. It can be reached from many directions so after exploring others destination around, it would be lovely to take a break seeing the Tower Bridge from distance on the bank of Thames.

Beautiful. As a student of great bridges, I have to rate this as excellent. While the walk across the bridge is nothing spectacular, the views leading up to and looking back are just tremendous. A memorable view, especially from the South Bank.
Best view . Great view of city of London, we went there with my wife for my birthday and had a great time. Good bars and restaurants around specially by water front.
Tower Bridge. I've traveled over this bridge a few times and it always puts a smile on my face. The best way to do it is on top of a double decker bus. It's a tourist must do!

It Is Still A Marvel. I Had been through the Tower Bridge years ago but this was my wife"s first time. It is still a marvel of engineering but if it had not been included for free on our London Pass, I would have skipped it because of all the stairs. However, once you get to the top and walk over the river from so high and get such a great view, it becomes worth it again. If you can climb stairs then this is must do in London.

Tower Bridge Exhibition is excellent for the price. This is a great place to go when visiting London. It's relatively cheap to get in and you get some fantastic views of London from up there. There is a lot of interesting information about the bridge and it has got some great history from its building and during WW2Definitely worth visiting while there and you can combine the Tower of London easily in the same day.It is an attraction you can do on a rainy day, although the views out may not be as good.
A piece of history. A very beautiful piece of history. I think every tour bus will pass by this bridge also, you walk through it.You will be impressed.

Step on the glass...... .....and you'll see what's underneath! What a view....and the engine room was intriguing. Looking at the bridge from far is impressive enough, but I recommend going inside for the exhibition for more discoveries.

Surprising. We, me and my fiance, was going to Tower Bridge know the place without much expectativa. A London sightseeing and only. But it was a very good surprise, the ride is cool and the glass floor is fantastic. Worth it.

Bridge tour was fun!!. Buy the tour tickets and get on top of the bridge. If timed well (like we did) you get to watch the drawbridge go up and the ships pass from the top through the glass bottom surface . Not for someone who is afraid of heights. Great views of the tower of london, the financial district , the Thames. You also get to visit the engine rooms and see how the drawbridge operates. The bridge looks beautiful at night too, when it is all lit up!

Very cool architecture. Love this bridge, you can see it very nicely from London Bridge, and get some really nice pics from there too. The landmarks in London are not to be missed. You really can spend a little or a lot of time at many of them.

Tower Bridge. There are a few things you can do on Tower Bridge if you dare. You can walk across the bridge to get to the Tower of London. You can go up the elevator to get a great view of the Thames river from the glass floor. There are also times you will be able to see the draw bridge open. It did not happen while I was there. There is also the Monument that offers great views of London. Please be sure to wear comfortable shoes. There is a fee for visiting the Tower Bridge Exhibit and the Monument.
X5PILOT. The most impressive bridge in London! The tourists are just swarming the bridge as well as and traffic. This bridge was built to impressed and definitely does!
Great day out . We have been here a few times and really enjoyed ourselves, must see is at night when it's all lighted up, a must see.

Stunning views of the Thames and London. The walkways above Tower Bridge offer great panoramic views of London and the river Thames. The new glass floor gives you a birds eye view of the traffic on the bridge and the river 42 metres above the Thames. We were lucky enough to see the bridge open twice through the glass floor which made the trip even more worthwhile. A good way to spend an hour above the hustle and bustle of London.

Got to be done while you're on London surely!! . I'm a little obsessed with Tower Bridge! I love London & everything in it, I only live 20 odd miles away and visit all the time as there is so much to do there. I think as soon as you see Tower Bridge, you know you REALLY are in London. Such an iconic sight. I've seen it a billion times but never really knew you could go up it!! Go on to their website and book a ticket, it was only about £8 and it was valid for a year. I went with my daughter in August and only had to queue for about 5 minutes. The glass walk way freaked me out a bit :) but as there were children jumping up and down on it and 3 grown up (slightly largish) men standing on it I thought I would be pretty safe. The views are amazing, as always. I'm so glad I've been up there now.

Who can't be impressed. Such an icon landmark that never fails to bring a smile and hint of British pride to the heart.Very lucky to see on a sunny day and also on an evening cruise when lit up.The look is so recognisable and still beautiful nestled amongst the more modern buildings.

London attraction. Take the classic postcard photo with the tower bridge on the backdrop. Also go into the tower bridge exhibition and walk the glass floor. You can see london traffic below your feet. Nice london day out!

Beautiful Bridge. Though there are bigger and more modern bridges in the world, this is the most beautiful bridge I've ever seen. We were on our way to the Tower of London and didn't have a lot of time, so we didn't take the tour. It's on our to do list for next visit.
A must while in London. The Tower Bridge is a gorgeous site. You can cross it on a big red bus or take time to walk to it and enjoy the view.

Tower bridge... a must see & great value. Well worth a few hours and visiting the top viewing section with the glass floor. Engine rooms also v interesting, lots of history & reasonably price gift shop too. Pre school aged kids may be little bored but mine were 11 and loved it. If you check out their website timetable before hand you can plan your visit around the lifting of the bridge, happens a couple of times a day I think. We did the trip in daylight but its also worth a walk over the bridge at night when its all lit up, looks mazing. Great value for money for a half day out.

Walk over the Bridge . The perfect picture can be taken of the bridge from the river bank although my walk was on an overcast day I did not have time to visit the actual construction and not sure in the cost .Certainly a must do when in London !
Outstanding. We really loved the view on the Tower Bridge! It look exactly same as on my wallpaper in the bedroom! It was amazing!

Iconic place, one picture with it will tell the whole story to the world. It is an Iconic place, one picture with tower bridge will tell the whole story to the world where you have been and how much you must be enjoying... Nice Place to visit with family and friends. When the gates open (the website gives the timing for this exercise), it is a wonderful engineering work in play.
cycling it. I used to cycle through Tower Bridge every single day for more than 1 year a couple of years ago. A unforgettable experience!

See the inside as well. Tower Bridge looks great from the outside but it is even more interesting on the inside! well worth the visit to see all the mechanical equipment and power generation that is involved in lifting the bridge recommend it highly
This is "Tower Bridge" not "London Bridge".. Tower Bridge is another monumental and impressive landmark. Couldn't wait to visit it! It was amazing!

Treat. Loved seeing the bridge all lit up and night and we had a real treat as the bridge lifted for a large boat as we were walking along it. Great place to be and felt completely safe on a Friday evening.

Iconic and beautiful!. I think the part I like the most was walking toward or thought the bridge. The view was just amazing, I could see most of the central London and the financial district. Some of the skyscrapers got weird looks and River Thamse , but that just made the city much more charming to me. It doesn't matter day or night, I just like it here very much, my hubby and I enjoyed the walk here. it was really beautiful and romantic.The bascules are still open time to time, since it bridge is the a very busy crossing. The bascules only raised for the limited number of times, if you want to see that, better check out their time table online. We were quite lucky that was able to saw it during our walks. I didn't realize that was a thing till the tour guide on the boat tour told us that. It was quite a sight. Right, there are also many boat tour services around. I tried the London Eye River Cruise, quite nice one. It is another cool experience to see the city on the river Thamse, especially when the weather is great.

Summertime. With my friends used to visit Tower bridge every Sunday in summertime. It's a vibrant place, with lot of people, English and tourist people like us, Dj playing a different kind of music. people drinking and dancing, while the night is coming and the lights are going on. It is an amazing view.

Fun?. Wasn't sure what to expect - walk across the top and look at the views. Maybe see how it all worked. What you get (for £9) is to go around the engine rooms, see a video about the bridge then walk back to one of the towers go up a lift with a great guide, watch another interesting video and walk across the top - which is when it got scary...glass floor scary. And that's on one walkway, the other has a glass floor and mirrored ceiling. Very weird. O and great views horizontally as well as vertically!Thoroughly recommend it.

Iconic. Glass viewing floor the bomb with kids. Brilliant. Two kids 9&11. Loved the climb to the top and the exhibition. Kids were engrossed in the way the bridge was constructed. The walk along the glass viewing floors was a hoot. But once they got over their fear we couldn't get them off the glass. A nice quick visit one can use as a filler while in the area filled with attractions.
well worth it even if not on 2 for 1. went here on a 2 for 1 deal after using the train good views from both towers and informative along the way - even at £9 a person its probably worth it

More than Meets the Eye!. The Tower Bridge is a beautiful sight, even more exciting is witnessing the open to let tall ship pass, but what many people don't know is you can go up into the towers. The Tower Bridge Experience is a rather low cost (versus other London attractions) and is well worth it. You can walk from the north to the south tower and take some breathtaking photos. Well worth an hour of your time!
Historical visit. Full of history around. Has all facilities around the bridge, even a tourist centre nearby. When checking it you can go to see the london bridge as well.
Take a Boat Trip. The boat ride under this bridge was thrilling and it really is a masterpiece in art! Very ornate and very unusual compared to what we have in the states.

Interesting exhibit. This is yet another iconic site in London, not to be confused with London Bridge! The exhibit on top is about bridges of the world, and it's pretty interesting. It's hard to get a good view from the top, if not impossible, so that was a bit of a disappointment.
Amazing. This amazing piece of art so amazing when you look at it online but you view it in real life its breath-taking.

Beautiful Bridge. It was interesting to find out that out of the dozens of drawings that were submitted for this bridge, the one that was finally chosen happened to be designed by one the judges on the review panel ;)

Waste of money IMO. You get to walk across the top level of the bridge and see some brightly painted equipment turning around in the engine room. Total bust for me, other than taking your picture on the glass floor with the water below you. Save your money.
cool. It was cool to see how the bridge worked, nothing too crazy though. If we didnt purchase the london pass we might have skipped this one.

A slow stroll along the bridge. A long bridge parallel to the famous London Tower Bridge across the River Thames connecting City of London and Southwark. This modern bridge is approximately 300 meter long and the popular nursery rhyme "London Bridge has fallen down" was linked to this bridge.

My favorite London landmark. I've never done any tours at the bridge, but it's one of my favorite landmarks in London. It's beautiful and just walking over it allows you to see how detailed and pretty it really is. I recommend viewing it at night from somewhere along the Thames so you can see it lit up as well!
Diff view of the Thames. A good hour getting a different view of the Thames although it may be better if you have a circular walk around. May be done in the soon to start work.
Iconic but worth visiting. Although we have all seen images of the bridge, up close it is impressive and of course, big. Take a walk across the bridge to get a reals sense of it's size.

The Surprise Experience of our time in London.. We had purchased the London Pass which has a ton of places to see at a set price. This was on it so we took the tour on our way to the Tower of London and it was great! All along the overpass you read of great bridges around the globe, the views are excellent and you can even walk over a thick piece of glass to see the road far below. A bit unnerving.

Nice views and fairly inexpensive. Bought the tickets online for 8 GBP which is reasonable. No line ups and not real busy on the pedways. Glass floors are a nice touch to get a view like no other. We looked at the schedule online to see when the bridge would be opening and timed our visit for that, worked out well to see a tall ship pass under the pedway. Guides on the bridge were nice and helpful.
Landmark . This is just another of London's landmarks. This one was particularly cool to me because of the architecture. Definitely go see
Very pretty bridge. Lovely bridge. If you can see it open, it's really something special! I wasn't disappointed by this iconic London landmark.

It opened , we were overjoyed.. This iconic bridge doesn't open very often these days but as we arrived it did open for a tall ship.
What more could you ask for?
Take a walk across it as well. Surely one of the most iconic and historic walks anyone could take.
So exciting!. It was so exciting to finally cross this iconic bridge. Such a beautiful bridge! A must see in London

Must visit . We took tower bridge tower... It was not that good... Took 30 mins for the tour and not worth it but the bridge is spectacular, one of the best in the world... Definitely worth a visit...
Walk over Thames . I love bridges so I am biased. Tower Bridge is not the most beautiful bridge I have seen but it ties the city together well. Walk over or take a water taxi.
Tower Bridge with magnificent views. Easy to do, part of nice walking tour of London attractions; provides stunning views and is close to public transport and restaurants
Must See.. A quick visit is easy. Take lovely photos. Enjoy the beautiful design of the building. One of London's best icons.

Visit to Tower Bridge Exhibition last Sunday. We purchased tickets for the Tower Bridge Exhibition as part of the 2 for 1 offer linked to train tickets so paid just £9 for two of us. The exhibition was very interesting and the views from the glass floor were impressive. It would be great for a family with boys as the engine room was really well laid out and explained without needing to buy a guide book which is good. We were really fortunate that the bascules lifted that afternoon so we have some lovely pictures.
Iconic. Recent visit to shard just had to walk across the most iconic British bridge. A totally must do thing when your in london

Don't be afraid to look down. Having been to London several times, I had never been on the Tower Bridge Experience. I am very glad we did this time. It was interesting to learn the history of the bridge and it was provided great view. The glass walkway was a little nerve wracking, but makes for great photos.

A must see, but only from the outside. The iconic Tower Bridge is an absolute must-see in London, and the view doesn't disappoint, no matter where you're standing. I personally would advise against the museum unless you take a strong interest in how bridges work. The price was reasonable, it just wasn't that interesting and there wasn't much to see. The view was nice, but there are a ton of other places in the city for a view. Walk over and around it and take lots of pictures from the outside, it's amazing!

One of "must see" when visiting London !. Tower Bridge, one of the main attraction of London, must see destination. No need further explanation... just a word of advice: Plan your visit here.. we visited here in the morning and evening.. it's a pity if you don't watch the bridge raise. It's a spectacular view !

Lovely. This bridge is so beautiful from a distance but you must go inside to get the full experience. We loved the glass floor. It was hilarious watching people avoid stepping on it. It's a great experience you shouldn't miss.

Exciting. We were surprised how quickly we got into the attraction and it didnt cost much. The glass floor was especially good...mind you a bit scary but perfectly safe and all of the parts of the exhibition were interesting.

Impressive sight to behold. Was in the area to visit London Bridge and Sky garden, the Borough market was nearby as well. This tower bridge is an impressive piece of work and has really intricate details. We didn't have time to go up but it was enough to take photos outside.

Great walk over the bridge even in the rain!. My family and I walked over the Tower Bridge after visiting the Tower of London. Worth it even in the rain. We were able to get great pictures of the Tower of London by walking over the Thames. Bustling, busy, but worth it.
awesome. awesome place i recomended is very nice place My wife and I went here recently to celebrate our 10th anniversary.

Fun to walk and to see the drawbridge. Beautiful at night.. We walked across the Tower Bridge and it provided great views. We also watched as the drawbridge opened and closed to let a large boat through - it was great fun.

Great architecture . Rented a bike a road around London and visited tower bridge The architecture is wonderful and s must seeYou can walk across the bridge and are able to take pictures from multiple vantage points On the weekend it is very crowded
Beautiful. This is the most beautiful bridge I've ever seen in person. Take the boat tour so you can get an even better look!
Beautiful . Was amazing view , it so excited place encourage every one to visit it.to many things to see there as the river side .

Great Walk. The whole time we visited my friend continually wanted to visit the Tower Bridge because this is where the Olympic Rings were displayed in 2012. The bridge itself is absolutely a stunning piece of architecture, and with the option to now cross the top of it if you want to pay I can't imagine the photos you could get! Standing in the middle of a crosswalk on either side of the bridge in a pedestrian path that is safe gets some of the coolest photos. And waiting around for a double decker red bus is absolutely worth it.

Elevator to get a good view of London. A quick visit into this tower was easy with an elevator to the top. Then you have to walk through two sides of the observation deck to see everything. The plexi-glass viewing areas of both sides wasn't too scary and did allow you to step around it if you were afraid. There were a few videos and separate machine room tour which I didn't have time for but this site wasn't crowded at all and easy to get to.

Amazing drawbridge! . We arrived at the Tower Bridge just before noon and, after waiting a short while, were treated to the raising of the massive drawbridge, which allows ships to pass through along the Thames. Two huge ships came through while we were there. They looked HUGE as they passed right by us! It was so cool! We waited for the bridge to be lowered before moving on because that's not a sight one experiences every day. It's quite an experience if you time it right!
It has it's opens and downs. Tower Bridge a lot of people call it London bridge which is wrong a beautiful piece of Victorian engineering a must for all visitors to the smoke!
Amazing bridge. Another amazing monument to see, impressive...you have the impression of leaving at the beganning of 1900's.

Beautiful bridge to walk acros. The tower bridge is stunning completely beautiful and complements its neighbour the Tower of London. I would recommend walking across the bridge at street level only and not paying money to go upstairs to see the exhibition. Not worth it. There is information on other bridges around the world, how they made the bridge and a glass viewing platform which looks onto the road below.Also worth seeing at night if you are close by. It gets lit up and there are fewer people around so you can take better pictures.
Night time is best. I've seen the bridge during the day but nothing beats the night time view! I took photos of it from so many different angles! A night time walk down Butler's Warf is worth it too!
Iconic. This bridge is very historical. Read and heard so much about it that it was a must see on our agenda of things to do. Not disappointed, pretty magnificent edifice.

It's a very impressive landmark but not a priority to visit . Visiting the bridge is a bit of a waste. Inside you learn about it's 100 year old history and the way the drawbridge used to work. There are better things to do. The unique perspective of the partially glass walkways are to be considered.
Very cool and iconic lanmark!. Make sure you walk across it - great photo opportunities and grab a custom made pizza at the park area on one side - it was yummy! (and a beer of course!)
Iconic Landmark. Bring your camera.. This is one of the more spectacular London landmarks. Wait around for it to open up to get some great pictures.

plenty to do. overall good destination to start from but to fit everything in in a day you need to get there early from visiting other well known places like the monument, st pauls cathedral,the tower,or go on a short boat ride on the thames also look for special offers to make your money go further.

A must see. If your travelling to London this is a must see,
Very educational and the exhibits are great,
the knowledge of the staff is excellent,
Learning about the history of this bridge was amazing,
the glass walkways was a special treat, well done there,
Definitely a must see and you won't be dissapointed,
no rush tour of the Bridge too.
Billy the beef eater is the best!. How interesting this was , Took our two children ( 9,11) along and they found it very interesting . They learn"t a lot of History.

Good value to visit an iconic London landmark.. When you visit London you can only see so much. On our previous visit we could not fit in touring the Tower Bridge much to my daughters disappointment, so this time it was a must. And am I glad we did. The Tower Bridge is of course an iconic part of what makes London. Walking across it and looking up and around is already awe inspiring, but taking the tour takes it to a whole new level.You start off exploring the older exhibitions of the technology that once powered the raising of the bridge. Truly amazing the ingenuity that is on display. You then climb to the upper structure where you can enjoy spectacular views of London. The glass floor is not for faint of heart but if you can steel yourself to stand on it, it is quite the experience. Tip, wait for a boat to pass beneath the bridge and point your phone at the mirror on the ceiling, capturing a unique picture of yourself seeming to float above the river below.Take some time to look at the pictures of the many other examples of truly wonderful bridge architecture the world over. There are numerous stands where you can watch historic videos of the bridge. I was fascinated to learn that the Luftwaffe deliberately avoided targeting the bridge, electing instead to use it as a navigation beacon.If you don't have the time or money, enjoy the bridge from the banks of the Thames, but if you have the time, it is well worth it. We went there on a very hot day, might be best to avoid days like this as it is quite crowded and hot.
Literally unmissable!. Epic structure, great walk across the river as the photo opportunities are brilliant. There's an exhibition too if you have time. Iconic London landmark!

Tower Bridge = Phenomenal. I had no idea that I would enjoy visiting the tower bridge so much, but i did! Walk around and enjoy the view, the history and learn about the other bridges highlighted. I enjoyed the inside as well as the outside pics! Beautiful at night!! I stumbled upon some folks Swing dancing afterwards, definitely a lovely end to an already eventful afternoon!

Worth a visit. Perhaps the most iconic of London bridges - it certainly looks very impressive and majestic as you approach. We visited after exploring the Tower of London and the ticket office is on the Tower side of the Thames. We had a two for one ticket offer because we travelled to London by train, so felt this was good value for money. You can choose to take the lift up to the upper walkways - but if you're able I'd suggest taking the stairs at a steady pace, since you get to see more of the inside architecture - and there is a rest landing halfway up! The glass floor on the upper walkways is very popular and you have to virtually walk across people laid out taking photos! This could be a real pain at busy times. The glass floors could be a little unsettling for anyone uneasy with heights, but you can just about skirt round the outside of the glass floor. The view from the upper walkways is fab - it was a lovely sunny day when we visited so could see quite far down the river. There's lots of photos and info about other famous bridges on display, which makes for an interesting read. And there's obviously information on the Tower Bridge history. It seems the bridge only raises on average about 3 times a week - so you'd have to be lucky to catch that. There is a screen at the end of one of the walkways, which gives you the times of the next scheduled bridge opening, so you could always plan to come back and watch from the riverside, if you're still in London. Ticket price, also includes admission to the engine room. Unless you're interested in machinery and such like it's probably not that exciting, but you have to admire the remarkable feat of engineering that was used to raise the bridge before technology took over! Overall the Tower Bridge is definitely worth a visit - kids will love the glass floor!
Gorgeous!. It's so beautiful and bigger than i thought! We also see it from the Thames river cruise and the view is different!

Best view when the bridge is up for a boat to pass.... Tower Bridge is just stunning, the details of the bridge is just mind blowing. (i have been to a wedding on the top and was beautiful). Keep going back there, just can't have enough of it. One tip, on a nice/sunny day, make sure to walk all the way from Tower Bridge to London Eye, walking past Borough Market and the whole South Bank. It would take you a good 2 hours (with a quick stop in one of the pubs on the way) but is well worth it. The best walk in London...
Well worth the visit. Take your time walking through the bridge. The displays offer a wealth of information and the view is beautiful.

Amazing experience. I really enjoyed walking up tot the top of the tower bridge, one of the most iconic bridge in the world. The ticket included both the access to the top of the towers with the experience of walking on a glass floor, watching cars and boats passing beneath our feet, and also access to the museum of the tower bridge engines, where they explained how the bridge worked before the coming of electricity. Very interesting and overall a peculiar experience for a cheap price.

Walk on the Glass on the Tower Bridge - amazing. I got assurance from the staff on the tower bridge that the glass in front of me was tested to suit allowing more than 3 elephants to pass by - even then I shivered and felt the chill when I walked on the glass, My Daughter 12 was walking and running around on it merrily, my wife avoided it completely even though my daughter tried to drag her on it, And I could hear some screaming :-) this was amazing
Nice views. Go using the London Pass after you see the Tower of London. They have done a good job modernizing the attraction.
Beautiful. One of my favourite views in London, especially during late evening/night. It's the second think you see as a sign of London. Just after Big Ben!
Beautiful . Came here after being disappointed with the London bridge. Beautiful structure, worth a visit. The bridge takes you to the Tower of London... We didn't tour but saw from the outside.
English culture. Fantastic bridge - built and maintained in the finest way.It's truly glamorous and a high light of Londons beauty.
Nice view. Going over the Tower Bridge give one a really nice view over London. Further, the steam room is eorth the visit.

Icon of London. Simply cant skip this place. The trip to the top of the bridge is a must. It has beautiful views and the glass floor adds to the experience. Check out the bridge opening times on their website beforehand. It is a great experience to see it opening. 5 minutes walk from the tube station. As it is near the Tower of London, you can combine your viisit.
not a very old bridge but very impressive. do they Tower Bridge Experience where you walk over and have the possibility to stand on some glass and look down (if you are brave enough)
Beautiful . Must visit when in London as it's the most identifiable London landmark! A feat of engineering combined with a thing of beauty!
A very historical site.. This is a beatiful bridge and has Alot if history. It's next to the London tower and was the way to the castle when London was first becoming the what it is today.
Great Value . Really enjoyed it,great views, kids loved it,discount tickets available and disabled friendly venue.
Beautiful site. One of the must visits in this London Town! Day or night, very beautiful. Need more words but it is simply just something you have to check of your list.

Glass floor to see the ships. I love the building from inside - the constructions and the exhibitions. The glass floor is a good idea and the mirror on the top ceiling is good for selfies. The ground, outside exhibition with machines was nice too. It is good to reserv 1,5 hours to see everything.
Pretty bridge . Must see when in london.. make sure you look up the times when it opens and watch the bridge open! Worth the walk over it for some amazing photos

Thames View. Excellent walk at leisure.
Went up to the Walkways. Each has 6 Panes of glass that you can walk over.
Engine Room, houses the old Boilers and Steam Pumps. Do not get to see the New Electrical Kit.
Good Value for Money and very interesting.

Go Inside!. Of course take the pictures of the famous bridge both day and at night but DO take the time to tour inside! Great photo op looking through the glass floor at the top of the bridge. Interesting ohotos of how the Tower Bridge was built and make sure you go into the engine room.
Another "must see" when in London. Although we didn't do the tour, just walking over it is great, we were lucky enough to see it open, you can check the scheduled opening times of the bridge on line.

Proposal. I recently proposed at this venue. John was more than attentive, taking care of a song playlist for me, going along with the storyline used to deceive my now fiance. Very happy with whole experience.
