A must see in London !!. First of all, this is not London Bridge, this is Tower Bridge as it is just beside Tower of London. The best part of the bridge is a walk on the sky walk at the top of the bridge. There is a nice selfie spot on the sky walk and the view is nice from up there !
Beautiful Blue. Love the new colour. Was lucky to be there when they raised the bridge to let a boat pass. A must go when in london

Interesting. Spent about 2.5 hours here. Went London on the train. So we were entitled to the buy 1 get 1 free offer for this attraction. Well worth it for the b1g1f offer. Glass floor isn't very high, been higher. Plenty of reading to do and seeing pictures inside regarding other bridge's all over the world. Plenty of details about this bridge itself reading as well as watching short videos. Great and very helpful, cheerful staff.

Beautiful huge Tower Bridge. Another iconic site in London that is a must see. We walked across the bridge after our tour of the Tower of London. The site is within a few blocks of the tower and one can take pictures from it and of it all along the river Thames.

Great Tower Bridge Views. Walked across Tower Bridge on a sunny, Saturday afternoon. Didn't go inside. Great views of the Thames and surrounding areas, the bridge is beautiful to look at. Would definitely recommend visiting when in London.
A rather garish monument to royalty. Apparently this bridge is painted in the queen's color of blue. It's an icon across the Thames and hard o miss.

An iconic bridge over the Thames. We took the optional (for fee) Tower Bridge Experience, which allowed us to use the upper level (glass bottom) and visit the engine room that historically provided power for the bridge lifts (the bridge still is raised several times a week).

Another Must See at London. It's definitely should be on your must visit list during your trip at London. The bridge looks amazing, you can see the beauty of the river and the city from here. They offered a tour as well, but unfortunately I didn't go for the tour as it was quite crowded and we only got a limited time at London.
Stunning . The Tower Bridge was beautiful from a far but get closer and even walk over it is breath taking. So much history in one bridge is awesome!

Interesting . This was an interesting tour you go up to the top of Tower Bridge and they have a talk about the history of the bridge,They have glass panels on the bridge that you can walk across and see the water/cars below depending on the angle

Quintessential London Landmark. If you are going to take a picture with only one landmark in London, it has to be the Tower Bridge. No other landmark in London is more identifiable. You can get a good view of it from a river cruise or from just outside the London Tower.

Just beautiful. This bridge is located at about an hours walk from "Big Ben" and the London eye. It is unique and worth the visit. Fortunately, the bridge was raising on our visit ... but unfortunately, there was no crowd control and they could not deliver once we were up there.But then again, this bridge is pretty unique and does offer a beautiful view of the city as well as a glass floor where you can see the traffic on the bridge below.

Amazing Piece of London's History!. Do not leave London without visiting this amazing bridge. Just only a few minutes walk from Tower of London and indeed, you will be amazed how beautiful this bridge. A piece of London's History that you don't want to miss when you visit London. A must-visit attraction in London.

Real working bridge . Tower bridge is and enjoyable visit about 1hr is enough. The glass walkways is pretty awesome. My husband like the working room as well. On Wednesday we arrived to see the bridge open for passing boat then 45 mins later same again. That was pretty good on a hot 25 sunny day.

Not as Old as you think. This bridge looks as old as the Tower of London beside, but apparently was only built during the 18th century but was required to blend into the surrounding area, this they did to erfection

A London classic!. We rushed through here and glad we did. I've been here before but the new layout made the viewing more interesting as the history of the tower was shared. The line moved fast so don't be alarmed by that when you first approach the Crown Jewels part of the Castle.

A must when visiting London. This was my first time visiting London and all I can say is WOW. This is the place to be to get great photos and you can walk along the river all the way to Big Ben. Highly recommended

Epic. Great British engineering at its best. Still standing after all this time and will continue to do so unless there is another great fire London (and it should withstand). Would love to see the bridge drawn up and allow HMS Belfast cruise through. Spectacular in the day and better at night when it's all lit up like a Xmas tree. Walked over a few times and the views are magnificent. Hard to believe it's British sometimes. Enjoyed just sitting on the banks and taking in the views (and pictures). Driving over it doesn't do it justice as you have to feel the the bridge as a double decker passes over the middle. One of London's major tourist attraction and has to be seen.
Tower Bridge!. Nice day to spend out specially on a sunny day, can sit around it with family or friends. A lot of food and drinks options nearby as well.
Must see. The symbol of London. Impressive. They open it for ships. It seems to be the most beautiful at night

Inside was Meh.. The bridge itself is beautiful and worth walking across and getting some photos. We decided last minute to go to the top because we had extra time that day. Maybe if you buy tickets in advance it would be much better but there was a long line to buy tickets. Once we realized one cashier(there were three) was just sitting there avoiding eye contact not calling for the next person to come up. No one was going up to him so we just walked right up and helped us right away.After the ticket line, you can wait in line for the elevator or take the stairs. The elevator looked at least like a 15min wait so we took the stairs. It is neat inside and the glass walkway is fun just not sure it was worth $12. So if you have time and money go for it. I think teens would enjoy the snapability of the glass floors. If you are limited in time I would maybe suggest something else.

The Jewel in Britain's Crown - Shame About the Staff. Truly indulgent - my eyes became drunk as I poured over a Millennium of British history - superb! Then came the staff - my lord - what a collective of self-important - preaching - Jobsworths. Shut Up - I just want to look - not pretend i am interested in what you have to say - when you ambush me at every turn. Then it's - "oh that camera equipment looks professional - you can't use that in here." - nonsense - I am just a very ordinary person with a mid-range camera and camcorder - doing no harm at all. I honestly left feeling like a criminal and highly embarrassed - but very, very angry.

Must do for the London tourist. We bought our tickets on the day for £9 each which we thought was reasonable. This included the Bridge and the Engine Room.We loved it. So cool to see it up close and then see the view from the top. There is also a glass floor for those who are willing to brave it (well worth it though IMO).There is a lot about the history of the bridge which was great as we didn't know a lot about it. Allow around 45 minutes (give or take) for the Tower Bridge.We caught the tube to Tower Hill station and it is only a 5-10 minute walk to the bridge. It is also well sign posted so look out for the signs.The Tower of London is right next to it so if you plan on doing both on your London visit, schedule them in for the same day (allow around 3 hours).Also the Shard building is about a 10-15 minute walk if you are interested in going up 310m to view a 40 mile, 360 degree view of London (allow around 45 minutes). You can also get some great photos, and there are lot's of cafés on the walk to the Shard. If you book advance tickets online you save 15%, which is worth doing as our tickets were around £30 each on the day.
Tower Bridge. A must see Iconic landmark in London. A great pleasure just walking across it. Nice little café near by, reminds you of the time gone by during The Blitz in WW2.
spectacular\. i saw it at night and didnt got in or on top.from downstairs i find it fantastic ,next time wil try to visit it well,

Under it and on it now. I've sailed under the bridge and walked over it as well as driven over this beautiful bridge many many times. Only recently did I go into up and over the bridge. From the old steam engines to the covered walkway it's like walking through time, great views especially on a good weather day. It's busy so suggest you book ahead
Romantic . I live this place, I have been passing in front, everyday for the past 4 years and I cannot get enough! I find it the most romantic view and such a grace! Best to see is in the evening!
Not as impressive as the long lines.. The lines are 1 to 2 hours long. Multiple stairs to climb. Save your $8.00 entrance fee. The afternoon would be better spent in one of the beautiful parks.

Lovely Place...can't forget. I have seen this place in Lot of movies and on wall paintings. Whenever I thought of London, this bridge is the major attraction. The city looks very beautiful in Night from this place.

a real highlight of any trip - walk along the south bank to really appreciate it. Nothing apart from Buckingham Palace and the Houses of Parliament represent London more than this fantastic bridge. I walked from Westminster bridge to Tower Bridge on the south side of the Thames in full flow, and it was a chance to view a fantastic array of the wonderful sights of London, popping over a bridge to take a look at St Pauls, the Monument, and the Tower of London. This really is a great city, such history.
WOW. We drove through the bridge on The Big Bus.It is totally amazing. August is a great time to go as the weather is great and you can walk across the bridge and see the sights.

Impressive as it stands . We walked over the bridge as well as driving over it. It would have been great to see the bridge raise the road section to allow a tall ship to pass but there were none scheduled during our visit. The bridge still has an immense presence as it is.

An epic climb to the top!. If you are planning a visit it is advisable to pre book tickets. Well worth the climb to the top. The lift was out of order on our visit. A lot of interesting information about the engineering and structures of other bridges. I enjoyed walking over the glass floor but for some people this may be a little daunting.

Beautiful Landmark. Tower Bridge is simply beautiful. Very well maintained, and a spectacular sight after dark. Easily accessible by car/tube/bus, and nearby to other attractions. Well worth a visit. Fantastic!
And they have a licence for civil weddings...perfect!
Iconic!. I regularly walk over Tower Bridge on my trips to Town and look at it from the office window - never fails to rouse the patriotism! Iconic - that's all i can say!

Tower Bridge Walk & Tour. We had assumed we would just walk across, but in the end decided to take the tour through the interior. At only £9 each it was well worth it. The views are amazing, and the Mr loved the glass floor (me not so much). Definitely take the time to see the engine room at the end - this was a highlight for the Mr. We stayed to watch the bridge rise also, which was nice and quick but still very cool to watch.

Oh I love this place!. When I was dreaming to go to London, I had this place's photo on my wall. I agree that dreams come true. About this place I love this spot because (1) It is one of the most famous place for tourists (2) Nice ice cream shot at the open ground (kind of little underground, I am talking about 2007, not sure if its still there) (3) Good restaurants nearby and nice and caring people around (We, me and my friends have asked them about the addresses and they explained how to get there very nicely)
Great bridge. Beautiful bridge and great views of the River Thames and the city. An interesting mechanism of the bridge should wait for when the ship will be held.

Legendary Tower. I was only seeing it on the movies or documentaries and being just under or walking on it, it gives you something indescribable, you should live it to feel it, it's just amazing experience.

If you've not been to Tower Bridge, you've not been to London I guess :-). Nice to use the bridge walking. Nice to view it from a little distance, it is a very nice bridge. It is good to see when it opens for ships to pass by. It is free as such, but you need to buy a ticket if you want to go for a tour.
Astonishing!. What an astonishing bridge! Yes, a bridge can be that beautiful! Near of it there´s a lawn for a nice pic nic with friends!
Great iconic attraction . The bridge is an awesome sight and even better if your lucky enough to see it being opened. No trip to London is complete without seeing the bridge

Amazing. This is one of my most favourite place in London whether it's. Daytime or night the view is magical and so relaxing. I go there often to relax myself if you haven't been there at night try it out u will love.it
Beautiful bridge.. Beautiful architecture; nice to look at, lovely to walk on, an easeful way to get to the other side of the river; what else is there to say?
Good old London attraction. Visited with friends & family. A good old part of the list' attraction that doesn't disappoint. Worth a trip if you're visiting London

Scary, for some. Great site for a short visit. Fantastic views, awesome engineering, especially if you are an engineer and an interested teenage boy, great fun walking across the glass floor looking down on the tourists and cars, a bit scary for the teenager and many others too. Managed to persuade an elderly lady it was safe and inspiring, she stepped out cautiously and very bravely. Great stuff.

Truly Iconic...fun to walk across. Love walking across this iconic Bridge. It is a pretty bridge and quintessentially British. Dreamed of walking it for years. Being a California Yank I had visited Lake Havasu Arizona...the place where some rich guy bought, disassembled and reassembled the London Bridge in the Arizona desert of all places...and rumor has it that he thought he was buying this one. LOL.

A sight to see!. Walking over London Bridge is a perfect thing to do as a tourist in London. It is a magnificent structure and you can't begin to imagine the scale of it until you see it. It's free to visit but there is an additional charge of you want to go in for the tour. We didn't do this and thoroughly enjoyed walking it and appreciating it from all angles!
Very nice. Tower Bridge entry was included in our London Pass. I would definitely recommend to go there, because everything is prepared for visitors to really have a great experience.

The Tower Bridge - awesome Victorian engineering!. This is one of many must see's in London. Built in Victorian times it is amazing. The views of the Tower of London are great, and of course the views of the river Thames awesome. It is worth walking the bridges length as the views are different from all angles. You will need to pay for the upper level, which I skipped
Absolutely Amazing. The Tower Bridge Experience is very well worth it. You get to experience this beautiful bridge from the inside. The glass walkway is insane, and a must see for everyone.

beautiful. what a beautiful place this is highly recommend it is steeped in history, and is a marvel to behold, easily reached via public transport the stories behind Tower Bridge is amazing, they also offer guided tours a must see if in London most definitely! and what a background to take family snaps!
See it from river cruise. I attended one evening river cruise which was really good. It went past this tower bridge and it really looked magnificent.

The bridge the yank thought he had bought. Anyone who watched Reginald Perrin has to stand on the bridge which made him late for work or even be there for the London Marathon as it is part of Great Britain and its greatness. Be there to watch a boat go through and marvel at the working bridge.

Iconic. Tower bridge of London is iconic and been the face of London for ages. Centuries of age and still standing tall. the area around the bridge is cool and awesome sight. Lovely back drop and a must see place when you are in London. should keep a time watch and i missed going inside the bridge and to see what is in store. Should be there before 4 pm.

An engineering marvel. Tower bridge (not to be mistaken for London Bridge) is a true engineering marvel of its era and is still functioning today, albeit with some modern upgrades.You can tour the upper walkways of the bridge and the engine rooms (through not when it is opening). There is a glass floor walkway in the upper tower so you can look down at the cars beneath you and the engine room has detail panels on how the bridge was built and how the original steam boilers worked. Great for kids and adults alike. But maybe not if you a thing for heights.
Pretty. Very pretty and so much to do around the bridge. The atmosphere is great and there's lots of little places to have a drink near the river. Pretty location with nice views.
Good fun . Lots of stairs to climb but worth the effort. Great views of the boats etc on the Thames. Loved the glass floor, found the second walkway quieter so easier to take photos.

Fabulous view. It was my dream to visit this place since childhood due to the poem "London bridge is falling down"in India . The very first time I saw the Tower Bridge I was amazed to see the view and this beautiful structure a true iconic and symbol of London. This place brings a sparkle in my eyes and new hopes to keep dreaming of new places. We also got an opportunity to walk through the glass ceiling through student discount on the entry fare. But the price is worth the view. I really enjoy every moment spend near London bridge. I wish soon I can visit this place again. I would recommend a visit to this place.

Lovely backdrop. Such a lovely back drop on a lovely day so beautiful and just amazing to look at. If your lucky and time it right you will see the bridge open. Dont forget to see Shad Thames which is 10 min walk from there of the lovely buildings.

Visited with friends. Really interesting how the bridge was planned and built. Wonderful views of the river. The bridge is beautiful and was raised for a ship. Surrounded by restaurants and easy for transport.
Great views. Iconic in itself, nice to know the history and to see it in action, the views are an amazing in both directions.

Must see. The Tower Bridge.....no not the Lindon bridge is beautiful and if you walk across be sure to walk the shore all along to WAterloo station. It's a hike but great places to see along the way including historic buildings great pubs the Globe theatre and Art museum. Lots of places to eat and drink. Really made for a great afternoon especially on a nice day.

Tower Bridge walk. This experience is well worth the queues, and at a reasonable price. It's just a shame we didn't do this at a time the bridge was going to be opening as it would have been spectacular! The glass walkway was brilliant.

Built to last. This area is very crowded because it is near to the Tower of London and I believe they have an exhibition on at the moment too.It is a beautiful structure and gives a sense of history and endurance. If you have a decent camera take a picture at night when it looks stunning.
London icon. Beautiful area and bridge. Luckily bridge was opening and one ship was passing by. That view was amazing.
Iconic. Always feels special walking across tower bridge, true british icon. Even better if you go up on the walkway above the bridge, brill views
Amazing. On our trip sight seeing we had a river boat trip.How lucky we were the Tower Bridge lifted up for a tall boat to pass.Lovely trip on the Thames.
A lovely surprise. . This was an inexpensive attraction but so interesting. The staff were helpful and knowledgable. Not a long attraction with amazing views of the city.
A London Highlight. We viewed the Tower Bridge along the side of the river for great photos. This is a must see London attraction.
Stunningly beautiful . A truly amazing masterpiece and an iconic British and London landmark. It is a must see when visiting London

Good views. I recommend pre-booking this, as a long queue can build up. The staff are informative and the history is interesting. The glass walkway was a bit disappointing as I thought it was longer. But it's a very picturesque site. The engine rooms are ok.The gift shop had all sorts of merchandise and at a good price. All in all, is it worth it?.. The answer is yes!
Glass floor view!. Good value for money. The tour is well worth the price and only takes around 90 minutes. The view from the glass floor is amazing.

A must see!. There is a lot to see while in London. This bridge should not be missed. The tour is interesting, if you have the time. The line can be very long. If you're limited on time skip the tour but make sure you at least see the bridge.

Nice location. Great to finally see it in person last week, it's also near a few other attractions like a castle and the Shard and the Gherkin.
And also there's lots of cafes and restaurants to go eat and grab something to drink too!
Outstanding. The view speeks for itself ... a must see london sight and well worth the walk through the crouds of tourists !

Impressive Bridge. This bridge dominates the skyline and is the most impressive bridge in London. You can walk over and also go around the workings underneath the bridge. I found the exhibition there very interesting as it showed how the bridge was built. Great place to visit

Walk on the glass gallery and wave hello to everyone below you. Even with my fear of heights I have to admit that this was a great experience. I might not have gone if it had not been part of our very useful London Pass, but the kids (teenagers actually) insisted and had a great time sitting down on the glass gallery with nothing below them but the view to the lower level of the London bridge. Great family activity.

Must see is London. Amazing experience at Tower Bridge. There are two glass floors that you can walk over. I was lucky enough to be in the bridge when it was lifted to let a ship through. It was great to see this from on the bridge. Also very educational.
Nice to see. Not as big as I thought it would be but nice to see. Nothing much to say it's a bridge over water. Maybe it would have been better to view this from the water rather than the banks.

Blight over London generally. The one thing that has irreparably spoiled London is the city council allowing developers to build around and mostly over all the great things to see. There are residential tower blocks everywhere and their existence is ghastly. Even over the back fence of Buckingham Palace tower blocks everywhere. This is something that cannot be made right and was totally unnecessary they could have been completely out of the boughs and caused no harm but big money has robed the world of what was London just so the elite few can have the Tower Bridge as their dining room back drop.

Loved it!. I am sure most people thought this was London Bridge, well at least I did till I got to London. It was on my bucket list to see this place and check all done. It is a must visit when you go to London. My advice is walk around that area. You will see both Tower Bridge and London Bridge, the tower of London plus other things in that area. I did not go into any tourist attractions in London as I was on a budget but you get equally awe struck when you walk around this area.

More to see than I imagined. I'm not sure how long the glass floors have been installed but that seems to be a favourite with visitors. Short queue to get in and mercifully a lift to take you to the walkway across. Engine rooms that used to power the opening of the bridge also very interesting.

Well worth a look. This site is well worth going to.
If you have a fear if heights give it a miss as there is a glass floor on the crossovers.
Views from top are great.
Once again the history is real... Nothing plastic here.
Well worth going to allow at least an hour.
OMG beautiful as expected. Amazing just as expected was first on my list to see. Was lucky enough to see it with the bridge up and as dusk fell in London a must to do and see and walk over.
Awesome. Really informative and love the glass bridge. and you could take really nice photos of the river thames and both sides of the river.

Fascinating view of the river. Getting there by metro is easy. Inside the bridge is a museum of the building and history of the museum in the walkway area above the bridge. The exhibits also include other bridges that are engineering marvels. You can walk up or take an elevator, the view is great both up and down the busy Themes. Well worth a visit.
Best bride in the world . I know London Bridge is infamous but tower bridge is the most beautiful bridge. Never saw another bridge like it. Great for pictures on a sunny day out. Views are amazing.

Just as you would expect unbelieveable . We went over it twice on hop on hop off (greys) which offered different perspective. Also exited Tower of London and walked it then back to the Thames to ride the boat over to the London Eye. So three different photo opportunities of an iconic structure. Just keeps getting better Zlondon

Tower Bridge. I enjoyed touring tower bridge. The bridge has a glass walkway and it gives you a great view down to the bottom of the deck. We were lucky enough to view the deck opening up to let a large masted ship through.I saw a lot of families with children up at the pedestrian walkway looking through the glass walkway. Everyone seemed to enjoy it. This is a place that would likely be fun for anyone.
Interesting. Walking around the bridge was very interesting and provided great views of the river. Also of the banks with all the places to eat along there .

Crossing the river can be FUN!. Must visit in any London tour. Glass panels on East and West walkways floor offer an amazing view of world below.A quick 60-90 minutes and you would have very happy kids, if you coming as a family. As a solo visitor, I took longer and read about so many bridges across globe, including this one, in the walkways.Visit to Engine room is must, for any one who likes to see huge machines.

Landmark of London. When you are thinking of London, you think - Big Ben and Tower Bridge, for sure. It is truly a masterpiece of engineering and architecture and it looks so great live and on pictures.

Bucket List - Check. When you come to London there are a few places that are just a given to see, and one of those places is the Tower Bridge. I stayed at the Tower Hotel which was great with a view of the bridge at night, all lit up, plus the Tower of London across the street. They do a tour on the bridge, but I didn't go on it.

Must visit. A must to visit, very interesting visited the north south and lower south towers, and walked along the glass walkway fantastic views up and down the Thames. If possible find out the times of the bridge opening we saw it at 9.45pm when a large liner went through, a sight not to be missed.
Favourite bridge. Loved seeing it and walking over it, away with my wife and just such a lovely sight as we're walking along the river, so detailed

Different kind of bridge... Victorian at its best ..history unreal....rumour has it this was the bridge the Americans thought thy were going to get instead of London that they bought, view the metal work look to the booms at top,..unreal..check when ( if ) it gong to open......
Fixed attraction for our visits to London.. Dine at a restaurant or better a terrace near the shore with a view of the bridge is a priceless. Have been back and will be coming back.

Unusual bridge. Didn't go up because we were rushing. Did walk on the bridge and looked up the towers and also looked down to the river (quite scary). Loved the breeze and how grand and ornate the architecture of the towers on the bridge. Do visit if you have time.

Tower bridge experiencd. We really enjoyed the tower bridge experience last week. We didn't book tickets and didn't have a long wait to get into the exhibition, we thought £9.50 was a good price also. The exhibition was really well organised and we loved the glass walkways and the views from the top, would recommend to people who want a different view of London.
Great attraction. We did this as part of the London Pass straight after the Tower of London. Enjoyed this attraction an informative display.

Great glass walkways!. The glass walkway looking down below to the traffic is amazing. I'm scared of heights and after doing this the girl gave me a sticker to proudly wear to say I'd done it.....cool.

A bridge to remember. Much nicer looking than the London bridge, this is a must. It's only £9 but free if you have the london pass. There are two glass floor areas on either walk ways which you an walk across. They have a video on the construction of the bridge and also a brief intro when you go up the lift to the tip.
Great value. Amazing value - £20 for a family of four. A good mix of history, engineering geek and thrills. About 1 1/2 hours total. Excellent attraction.
Unusual experience. Great for anyone interested in mechanics. Good for all the family.Loved lying on the glass bridge.Helpful, informative staff.

Lovely to admire the views and river. I have visited Tower Bridge a number of times and have enjoyed it every time. The view from the top are great and the new glass viewing floor is a cool addition to see the views of the roads. Try and look up when the bridge will be opening and aim to get there around then as it is a good spectacle to see!

Impressive!. My small grandson really wanted to see this, but it was a long bus ride and he tired of it pretty quickly. However, the bridge is very impressive, and beautiful all painted in blue and white. The view from the top of the tower should be spectacular, but we didn't have the energy to climb up it.
Wow! It was great!. A little bit scary, but very fascinating to look down on the traffic. Very interesting old building.

This is a must!. This cost us £27 for 3 adults and three kids and was SO worth the money.Not oly was it very interesting and the views amazing but the floor is made if glass!Us adults were ver timid and it took us a while to tread one the glass floor but the kids had no hesitation and were lying face down looking at the Thames and road far, far below them.We were able lie down as a family's and take selfies - we all felt so brave, especiallyUs older people.We explored the engine room then went and stood by the Thames to watch Tower Bridge open.We all agreed it was fantastic.
Another of Londons great attractions. Probably the most famous bridge in the world attracting visitors from here and far. The location overlooks the Tower of London.

Cruising down the Thames. We went on a short cruise down the Thames with all the attractions to see on either side. e.g. Tower of London, Sky Gardens, Houses of Parliament, The Shard, we had a tour commentator who was excellent, The actual boat was very modern, toilets, snack, tea/coffe, free rain-macs on board, very enjoyable trip.

Took it in at night with kids. Enjoyed it to the max. Took the kids at night since they wanted to do something fun. Well they were not disappointed! They learned a bit of history too at the same time!
Just okay. Fun to walk across but not a special destination by any means. However lots of tourists take a tour. I'd prefer to spend the money on a water taxi to enjoy being on the Thames.
Really nice. Good walk and worth going up to have good view and some historic information about bridges all over the world. It's so close to the Tower of London and a must visit.

Amazing engineering!. A fascinating piece of Victorian engineering. The exhibition made the most of what there was to see (with films and helpful guides). As a bonus our visit managed to coincide with the bridge actually going up whilst we were there, and we could see this from above, through the glass floor. As we'd travelled by train we manged to get two for one entry (with voucher from stations)
Great view from the glass floor. Great views of the London skyline for half the price of the London Eye! Interesting story of the construction of the bridge.
Great views. Great view and the a lovely place to visit you are given a full history of the bridge and you have get to see the bridge rise if you time it right
Beautiful . Was beautiful, clean & proud to be British, so lovely. We had drink by the side of Thames & fish & chips was gorgeous evening & only cost us £20 so not as expensive as everyone saysxxx
The Tower. Always thought this was the tower of London, silly tourists. Very impressive looking. We walked all around the area. Very different to see very old against the very new.

Great views!. We might have skipped this if we didn't have the London Pass but the glass walkway made it worth while. It's a crazy feeling being up that high looking straight down but my fearless 6 year old had no problem posing laying down on the glass for a cool picture!
Good for a short visit. I wouldn't go out of my way to visit, but good coupled with a trip to Tower of London, and then across to Burrough Markets.
Amazing building. My boys loved the dinosaurs. The staff in the gift shop were lovely and extremely helpful. A must for anyone visiting London.
U great experience at Tower Bridge. An extremely interesting visit with amazing views.great value for money. Fascinating watching the traffic below and the Victorian machine house
Wow. What a beautiful sight at night and if it opens you are taken away like magic different from anything else I seen
A must see . I loved this - came with my niece as part of her birthday celebrations . There's a see through floor - I loved it and it's very reasonably priced .

This is a must!. Absolutely amazing views, You can take some great pictures up here. Make sure to have pounds with you , there is a photo booth that you can take pictures with all the different back grounds. Make sure to walk on the glass look down to the water. A little scary but amazing.

A beautiful British icon. Stayed in The Tower hotel which is very close. Bridge is beautiful, very historic and has great views. Was lucky enough to see the bridge opening and lit up at night. A London must see.

Iconic bridge. We're staying near here and crossed many time.
It is so beautiful whether during the day or at night. Amazing piece of architecture.
Lovely.

Iconic!. Just a beautiful bridge. Fabulous to see with its marvelous history! My first view three years ago was one of amazement! That has not changed. Walk around and photograph it from all angles. It's worth it.

Spectacular British landmark. I visited Tower Bridge a few days ago with my family of 4 on a visit to the City. After watching a video about why Tower Bridge was built you can then walk into the high level Walkways 42 metres above the River Thames. Take your time and wonder around this Spectacular British landmark with outstanding views from inside and outside of the tower including St Paul's Cathedral, The Monument and just below the Great Tower of London and HMS Belfast.

Walking across!. What an amazing place! We stayed at an Airbnb close by and had to cross this bridge every day for a week! What an amazing site!! Safe for kids! Wonderful at night! And lovely shops under the bridge for dinner and drinks and some night life that we happened up ... Even forKids!! Safe area and worthy seeing!! If u wanna stop and have a nice dinner St. Katherine's docks have great choices!!
a must to visit. SO much history and "old" technology, alongside new technology, this is what makes Britain great. Who else has a bridge that is SO ornate and awesome AND rises for vessels?
Lovely. This famous Landmark in London is a must see. The suspension bridge crosses the river Thames . The construction is magnificent.

Gorgeous views, interesting history. This was a very cool exhibit, being able to walk across the top the this iconic bridge. Across the top they have the history of the bridge as well as other impressive bridges around the world. In the catwalks they have sections of glass floor with mirrors on the ceiling so you can see the road below and even lay down and take a picture. See how the raising of the bridge works was really cool. You can also go into the engine rooms to see how they were able to accomplish such a feat in Victorian times.

Iconic bridge . This is the iconic bridge that is in every London tour magazine. However, most tourists think it is London Bridge. That was sold and moved to the US. Regardless, a stroll across this bridge is still a walk for the ages

Glass walkway!. Paid half price because we used the 2 for 1 travel card. Amazing views from the top of the bridge. Great hairier of bridges too and all the ones around the world. Lucky enough to see the bridge raise too! Glass walkway was fun and many "selfie" selfers snapping away!
wonderful view of the city. Visited the tower bridge on our way to the Tower of London. We didn't go to the exhibits , but it is a great view of the Thames River and London.

Walked over tower bridge. Walked over tower bridge to catch train, took a few photos of the bridge, early morning it's amazing, strolled along with the mrs n we had a great time.. If in London, don't miss it

A monument !!!. First from the distance enjoy the view and take some pictures of the bridge. Then Climb up the steps to Tower Bridge and walk across, you can also tour inside. The main entrance is on the north side by the Tower of London. The bridge is a ombined bascule and suspension bridge built in 1886–1894. The bridge deck is freely accessible to both vehicles and pedestrians. The twin towers, high-level walkways with glass bottoms 131 feet up (new addition) and the Victorian engine rooms form part of the Tower Bridge Exhibition have a 9 pound fee. For more information about other London attractions visit thetravelingroom.com
fascinating bridge.. fantastic site so iconic, superb when the bridge is up. brought to playable scale by lego great build so life like.

BRILLIANT !!. Just recently back from London where we enjoyed a great tour at the Tower Bridge Very interesting day and history behind it all Great Views from the Top Must see and visit when in London !!
Great spot to visit. This is a great part of London and the bridge is amazing, you got al ot of other stuff to watch and do around it
Great to see opening. We were lucky to see the bridge opening and then we walked across it. What a great structure this is!

Go to the Tower Bridge Experience!. I did not realize you could go up in the Bridge. I really enjoyed the views from up top and there is two glass floors to look down below at the traffic. So If you are over by the Tower of London it is just a short walk to the Bridge.
Get into the English learning book :). You can go up and walk through the galleries with transparent floor. There is even a mirror on the ceiling for perfect selfies :))
Don't miss this iconic bridge. The Tower Bridge is beautiful! You can easily see from a Hop On Hop Off bus tour or Thames river cruise. The bridge can also be seen from the Tower of England:

Wonderful view & great experience!. The exhibition in itself is very interesting, plus you get to experience the AMAZING glass floor! It is astonishing! Take your time and enjoy the view, and also be prepared to experience the feeling of walking on the air. If you are not a fan of heights, you can enjoy the exhibition and skip the glass floor sections (or walk them very quickly). I personally loved it - Highly recommended!!!
Beautiful. We got the hop on hop off tour which was really good. We got to see most London attractions in two days.
Great. We had walked along the Thames and then walked across the bridge. Great views and spectacular bridge.

Worth going inside to see!. I took two small children inside a few year ago and they absolutely loved it! They still rave about it today! It's a great chance to hear some of the history of the bridge and a really unique view of the river! Having lived in London over 30 yrs I had no idea that you could go inside! It's worth it!
Enjoy from a water cruise..... Enjoyed viewing from a water cruise down the Thames Thames. Awesome sight to see and hear the history of the famous bridge.
Not that impressive. Its just a draw bridge. I think the appeal is mainly that its cute and really old but that card is played just a little to often to have value around here.

Good experience. Enjoyed the Tower Bridge experience, the best bit was the glass floors in the viewing towers - a little scary if like me you haven't got a head for heights, but worth taking the risk!
Worth Seeing!. Walked the bridge and stopped by the beer garden right next door to the bridge. Very pleasant to walk around the area and take time out for a beer.

great london attraction. A very interesting visit with lots of fun and well organised ! For all family from small to grown ups. The glass floor is amazing! Very nice photo boot where you can make unforgetabble memories- not expensive!!

Timing is the key!. Tower Bridge is a fabulous place to visit. We booked tickets for the Tower Bridge Exhibition. It is so interesting and educational. The glass floor is brilliant and an amazing experience. If you go, try to time it for when the bridge lifts for a passing ship. We waited 30 minutes and it was well worth it.
Wow. Walked across the bridge. We have always wanted to do this. The views are spectacular. The history speaks for itself. Photos are a must.

Great for walking. I highly recommend to do this visit walking and not by bus, so you don't miss all of the details of the bridge. On one side of the bridge you'll have the traitors gate where Ana Bolena was executed, and on the other side, you'll have most of the modern buildings of London. This is also the place where the man with no face posses so you can take a photo (don't foger to tip him!)

Overhyped tourist attraction, but still okay.. I was expecting something more interesting, I think it's quite overhyped but definitely worth checking. Although, you should not expect a quiet, lovely place. It's nice to visit once, but there are much better places all around London.
Tower Bridge. If you're looking for the London Bridge, don't bother, take a half mile stroll to the Tower Bridge, its a site to see for sure.

Stunning. This should be a highlight to anyone visiting London. I make a point coming here everytime I am here and stroll to St Pauls back to the city. Tower Bridge is just amazingly beautifil and keep on thinking about the hands involved building this. Unfortunately I never had the time to go inside, but have witnissed the bridge lifting for a boat. That was great! When coming here work London Towers into your schedule. Its next to the Towers.
Tower Bridge. The tower bridge is an amazing place to visit, specially when you walk across the glass floor and see all the tiny cars. Defiantly worth a visit

How could you not see the Tower Bridge?!?. A must see in London! We didn't opt for the tour but waking underneath it and all around it was awesome. Fun to hang around the grounds on either side of the Tower. We happened to be there during the Rio Summer Olympics kick-off, such a fun celebration around the Tower.
Tower bridge. It was very very pleasant view straight after coming out of Castle & Tower of london. It was a nice experience with my family to get out and share this fun day out...marvellous.
Interesting!. I wouldn't have expected this to be as interesting as it was. Beautiful inside and out, and a glass floor where we watched the bridge raise.
Fantastic. We rode over the bridge with the Old Line Tour bus. It is quite a sight. Unfortunately we did not go by while it was being raised. Quite a sight from the London Eye as well
Fabulous!. Really interesting tour round the bridge - you start on one side and finish on the other - especially good early evening when it's a great way to see the sun set over London.

Very interesting . Really enjoyed this visit, very interesting history about the construction of the bridge, the glass floor is the focal point and gets quite busy in this area, very highly recommend, great for kids!

Tower Bridge on 2nd. Every season there is something new happening around the tower bridge area. Being one of the icons on London, still I came back for the second time. Activities are going on the area. The summer fest for the children. Salsa dance on the street, shows, zip line, trade and food. Suggest to visit when you are in London.
Where I live. 5 mins walk from home, I enjoyed tower bridge in her rainy and sunny and of course what i called british-weather days,which means the weather you could look up and see all year around.

Awesome if you are brave enough. Paid for a voucher do got discounted entry. Very interesting. Standing on the glass floor 42 metres up is a little freaky though. Staff are fabulous, knowledgeable and friendly. A good visit.
I like it !. If you're in London I suggest the cruise on the Thames. Enjoy the view of Tower Bridge and listen to the history while you breathe London fresh air...

Great Bridge but not worth the money for a tour.. Don't get me wrong, this bridge is pretty cool to view from afar or even from below, and the glass viewing panels were alright. But paying to go up and look out at an obstructed view of the thames river, with swarms of people crowding the glass viewing panels, plus no actual guide, is not my idea of a good experience or value for money.

Best Value in Town. Visited Tower Bridge for the second time in 2 years, Wonderful Piece of British Engineering at its best.Very Informative tour, Much more than I had expected, Great Views of London and the City.And The admission price is reasonable too, and includes the power house/boiler rooms too.Gift shop prices ar reasonable tooIf you had to choose just one hing to do in London then Choose this.
Marvelous Bridge. This is a state of the art landmark, great design aesthetically marvel, worth the trip, it wows visitors every time.

Do take the Tower Bridge Tour. I have been to the Tower of London many times over the years are realized this time that I had never ventured onto the bridge let alone take the tour. Well worth doing - great experience!
History . Anyone who doesn't love this there's something wrong with them ... gotta be the greatest bridge in the world.. fact...

Fun for the family. This attraction takes about 30 minutes. It's a lot of fun but if you're scared of heights make sure to avoid the glass panels in the bridge's floor (you can easily walk around them). You get a good but not great view of London seeing as parts of the windows are obstructed by the bridge's support system. We would still recommend it! It's great fun!

Tower bridge expetirnce. Amazing to go inside the bridge and st and on glass floors looking down at the traffic and Boston the river You visit the engine rooms and see the working machinery that lifts the bridge for big ships

Must see and climb to the top. Recently updated to include new glass floors in each walkway. 206 steps to the top but there is a elevator/lift if needed. View is magnificent and displays very well done. check out the engine works to see how the bridge has been operated over the years

A Must See. Obviously, you can't go to London and not take a tour! We opted for the hop-on hop-off bus tour. They gave a great historical tour of London. If by chance, you end up with a great guide... STAY on that bus!! We had one guide who was fantastic, but then hopped off to see a sight. When we got back on, the next guide was nowhere as good!

True London must see, best at night. Great sight to see in London, if you see it open- consider yourself lucky as it doesnt happen often!Best seen at night- after 3 years living in London its still one of my favourite night views!

Stayed 2 nights in The Tower hotel on a special deal hotel/ theatre . We stayed next door to this icon London landmark.You could sit in the Tower Brasserie by the river and people watch. There were several food stalls along the river too as well as several restaurants around St Katherine's Marina.It was August, a w/e and the school summer holidays so it was very busy.Best of all was seeing it lit up at night and walking around at 7 am when there were only a few joggers around.Unfortunately we were not able to see a bridge Lift but dud take a Thames boat trip from the Tower of London to Greenwich which sails under the bridge.

Worth a trip. I had heard of a museum at Tower bridge but when we had the opportunity gave it a go, the views across London are wonderful and although the whole trip was only about 45mins it was well worth it.
Beautiful. Must see and combine with the Tower of London. The stonework is amazing. Make sure to look up when you are waling across.

Somehting you have to do. It is something you just have to do. Walk the old roads, fwel the history. The bridge is a bit crowded but easy to access and something you have to see when in London. I can only imagine how many jars it dropped when it was built. It must have feltnhuge!

Ok, but not great. The "Tower Experience" is really the glass floor on one side and mirrored glass floor for narcissistic photos aka "selfies".The engine room was interesting for hubby. Not much for me but the size of the equipment used considering the period in which it was built was impressive. Not sure I would want to pay for it however. London Pass used.
Amazing. Managed to visit Tower bridge on my last night and the view was fantastic. Along the river you may also enjoy some great food.

Stunning. weather you go over the bridge or under it the bridge is amazing to look at,we took a thames river trip that went under the bridge and got of at st catherines pier near the tower of london from there you get a real close up of the bridge,great for taking photos.

What a fantastic view . We decided to have a tour of Tower Bridge and was pleased we did. The glass walkway was a lovely surprise and wandering around the old engine rooms very interesting. Well worth an hour of your day.
Take a walk over for free. There are paid tours, but we enjoyed a casual stroll over the bridge for free. Lovely views over the Thames.

Great. Another amazing London landmark. Worth a visit... we went under it by boat, sat by it for lunch and walked over it. Highlights for the children was standing on the opening and feeling the pressure as the buses drove past. Memories made here will stay with me for a long time. Absolutely worth exploring.

The Tower Bridge Experience. Great value for money. The film show is a great way to start the tour of the bridge so sit for a while and be entertained about the life of the bridge. Once you have done that the the views and walk across the glass bottom floors are amazing and so much fun taking photos on them. There is a couple of machines that take photos of you and put them onto postcards what a great and cheap idea this is and we did 5 to send to friends. Make sure once you have done the bridge you go into the bottom to see the working mechanisms before coming out of the gift shop. Really interesting to find out what the bridge is made of!!!!

A must see.. Over 50 years ago I used to bunk off school and buy a twin rover to see the sights of London. You could travel on the tube and buses. Today the kids travel for nothing. I wonder how many know what delights are on their doorsteps?
Landmark of London. It is recommended to visit Tower Bridge by the Thames River cruise or by bus tour. You can take very nice picture from the Thames River.

Spectacular. We were staying very close to the Tower Bridge & could see it everyday. It looks nice during the day but spectacular by night when it is lit up, especially from a distance. The visit inside the bridge is ok where there is a glass bottom floor to see the river Thames & road below. It is nice to stand on the bridge & just view & take in the city of London from there. A must see when u visit London.
Walk across. It's an iconic sight, and best appreciated by walking across. We didn't take the tour, and felt no need to. Grab a bite and drink at Coppa Club and sit outside looking at the bridge.

Excellent value.. 2nd time here this year and we love it!!! I don't like heights but this makes me feel secure and safe and unafraid to walk across the glass floor. The kids loved the history of the bridge and asked the very knowledgeable staff loads of questions. My daughter has cartwheeled across the glass floor and I am sure my son would have slept quite happily on there. Thankful for the lift although my son arrived via the stairs at the same time as the lift!!I liked the videos too and was under no obligation to rush through.

Tower Bridge Exhibition interesting engineering. Lots of stairs to walk up. Walk across the glass platform to look down on the bridge far below. Don't forget to tour the engine room to see how the bridge operates.
It is a history . It was really very good tours for us where we enjoyed so much and we see this famous Tower Bridge. nice place.
London visit of my cousin from Milan . Ah Tower Bridge the one of the top three most iconic symbol of Britain a definite must see and should not be missed when touring London .
Walking this is how i do it!. I love this city, most the big attractions are free and by just walking you can see them all and take amazing pictures.

An interesting visit. Tower Bridge is worth visiting even just to say that you were actually on/ in it. The history thereof is also worth a look. Professional and efficient staff, book ahead online to avoid the queues during summer. A few good photo ops as well.
Overpriced. Go to the walkie talkie building if you want good views . It was O.K. but expensive for what it was. There are better places to visit in London. Staff were friendly.
Really fun. Loved looking down from the glass on top. Kids loved it. Fast pass with "the London pass" really was helpful here. Such great pictures from the top.
Walk accross the bridge for great views. I walked across Tower Bridge on a few times and enjoyed the view from there. There is so much to look at that I took endless photographs.

Do it if you have time. There are so many things to see and do in London, that if you get time to do the bridge do it...but in my opinion it's not really worth the time...you do get to walk over the glass panneled floor which again was not that thrilling for me..it was nice to see the old part of the bridge as in the hydrolic side of it... I must say though the view is very nice..

An interesting bridge. I was disappointed by this experience. We walked up the steps in the tower as the wait for the lift was not for us. The views from the top are great and the see through walk way a photo opportunity par excellence, but it was taken up with tourists laying on the glass and not wanting to move away. A move along crowd manager would help after 10 or so minutes to give others a chance would have been much appreciated.
Mistaken as London Bridge. Beautiful. We bumped into a gentleman selling fresh peanut brittle. Over all the view was breath taking.
Wall across London Bridge. The photo op standing outside the London Bridge is fantastic!!!! Walk across the bridge both ways....the view is great on both sides. Very safe & wide walkways.
Really detailed bridge. Yeah it's a nice bridge you can see so much detail and effort token into it I would recommend walking not driving to see the full expirience

Picture Postcard. The Tower Bridge is a sight to behold. Walk across it and enjoy the views of the Thames River. There are Thames River Cruises and you are right next to the Tower of London- so much to see and do!

Stunning!!!!. This is my second time here but each time I am breathless at the beauty...I felt the same way on the Brooklyn Bridge in New York...though the Tower Bridge is much different....It was sunset and the sky was filled with shades of orange and pink...I suppose this also helped create a great atmosphere.
Interesting place to know history. It takes about 2-3 hours to visit. Get an umbrella/rain coat. The lines could be big for the gold/diamonds display - well worth the visit.

Fabulous experience. We were lucky enough to get onto the walkway during a bridge lift which was a great experience. It is tricky to get a good view on the glass floor during a lift as everyone crowds onto it but if you do catch a glimpse it's amazing. What we found frustrating was the selfishness of other people when it came to taking photos. We waited 20 minutes to get onto the glass floor so we could take a picture of ourselves stood on it. One lady was constantly keeping a 2m square area clear of other people for her selfies of which she proceeded to take at least 30!! We stepped on, took one photo each and moved on to give others a chance.We paid £22 for 2 adults and 4 children which was excellent value.I would definitely recommend this attraction.

A must when in London. Every time I've been to London I always visited this famous landmark. It's very easy to get there with the underground stop at Tower Hill. Tower Bridge is near the Tower of London and near St Katherine's Dock. There's an art gallery on top of the bridge and an exhibition of the engine room.
A Walk in the Tower through the Bridge. Wonderful panorama on the Thames. Transparent floor to see down.Try to be there when the Brige opens!

Wedding at Tower Bridge . Been here for friend's wedding. Very cosy , fits probably 60 people, but lovely venue.It has a bar inside so after the ceremony we could visit the tower whilst they were preparing the venue for canapé and drinks. You can walk from one tower to the other and watch cars underneath through the glass floor. It has a museum inside the towers and a lift that gets you to the top.
London Iconic landmark that can't be missed. What a beautiful view one of London Iconic Landmark along the beautiful river....one of the must do!!!
Thrilling experience!. Great views from the bridge! Look at the Thames beneath you through the glass floor! The Engine room is fun too!

The best spot to get a photo. ...is in a little park called Potters Field across from the bridge. You get to Potters Field from Waterloo station and it's an area that is just behind the mayors office. We use it for PR stunts all the time and your photo will be perfect from this angle!

Visit with 9 and 6 year old. In a word WOW!!!!! What an amazing experience. Having been a frequent traveller to London with work over many years, this was my first trip to the bridge with my family.The kids loved it. They obviously loved the glass floor and although the bridge didn't raise we had an amazing experience. Walking so high above the traffic below showed a very unique view of the city.The history behind the bridge is equally as amazing. Seeing how the bridge was constructed and built was riveting :) (pun intended).Sailing under the bridge is also a great experience, especially on the city cruises with open top boats.The only downside is that the engine rooms felt like a little bit of an after thought and we would have liked to have seen more information. My 6 year old was a little frustrated but he loved the two hands on experiments at the end. As an improver to this fantastic experience I would have more people in the engine rooms (we saw no one working there at all) and more hands on experiments.Amazing experience and very highly recommended for any visitor to London.

Use the lift.. Well worth a visit. We went to the top where the youngsters enjoyed the exhibits and glass floor. if you have trouble walking or get tired climbing stairs use the lift. great views from the top of the river

Outstanding bridge. We just past under this on our boat trip, but what an impressive bridge this was. Next trip we going to walk over it as I hear they have a (experience ) so that's for next time, but it's such an iconic bridge you have to atleast see it
Nothing much. Don't expect too much, it's just a bridge! You can search on the web for the time of the opening of the bridge.

Nicer from the outside . If you have an extra £20 and an extra hour you might enjoy this attraction. I felt it was over priced for the underwhelming attraction. It is quite beautiful from the outside and very nice to look at in the evening.

The bridge that never sleeps. The bridge was visible from my hotel room. It looks just as stunning and beautiful when lit up on a night as it does in all its splendour on a day time. I drove across the bridge during the day and was taken back by its splendour and walked accross it in the evening. It was still alive with tourists taking selfies and admiring its magnificence into the small hours.
Beautiful bridge. This is such a marvelous bridge! We walked across it easy as its not very long and took in the beautiful sites of London tower and the shard.

Beautiful London landmark . A must if you are visiting the city - walked across in the late evening and the bridge was beautifully lit up in multi colours. Strolled past the Tower of London also lit up and round St Katherine docks where the Queens barge resides. Plenty of bars and restaurants to sit and enjoy a wine or two
Worth it. It is worth visiting. I suggest walking across the bridge to see the views from both sides of the river.

Beautiful part of London . This is a beautiful place to stroll around and lot of options to go on a ferry ride. Bridge looks stunning at night, when lights are on. After your activities, there are lot of options to treat yourself in one of the best restaurants, which are everywhere around tower bridge.
Great views at the top!. We did the exhibition, very informative and it was great to walk across the top and look down. The children really enjoyed this. Not pricey.
Very Cool. This bridge that I have seen on TV forever was so much fun to walk across. Just standing there looking at it in person was awesome. You have to check it out while in London

Another item off my bucket list.. The Bridge was breathtaking and the tour was cool. We found out that the bridge was going to open while we were there. The top floor featured a glass floor over the opening. It did in fact open smooth and quick. I was a bit scared but well worth the tour

Classic London!. Tower Bridge is iconic London. Budget an hour and a bit to go through the site. Good explanation of bridge history and construction with videos that appeal to all. Glass floor along the top is great! Engineering room is a short walk along the bridge. Gift shop upon exiting. There's a lift up the tower for those with mobility issues.

well worth doing. We decided to do the experience of Tower bridge. Bit of a queue to wait for the lift to go up to the tower but we did not fancy climbing up 206 steps, once up the top we walked across the north tower to the south tower, this walk included the glass walk way which was brilliant, its only a small area to walk across compared to the whole walkway area, you can also walk around it and not look down if you are not a fan of heights. The views from the walkway of London are brilliant, was quite busy around the glass part of the walkway as everyone wants photos on the glass, but the crowd does die down and you can get your photos done, you can walk across the other side walkway (south to north) they also have a glass bit and views of the other side of London from the bridge. Once you have finished with this part you can walk along the bridge following the blue line to the engine room part of the bridge, make sure you keep your tickets handy as you need them to get into this part as well, definetely recommend this experience but just walking across the bridge itself is a great thing to do.

The glass floor gives a new dimension to this classic bridge. This icon of London is probably one of the most famous bridges in the world. It's because of the beautiful towers, that this bridge is so iconic. With the London Pass you can skip the waiting line, which saves you a lot of time. The tour through the bridge, gives you a good impression about how it was build and how the bridge functions. The new glass floor is very cool. It offers very nice new perspectives to take a picture. A nice innovation in a centuries old bridge.

a nice walk. me and my kids teenagers , decided to walk over the bridge and also go see how the tower works eetc ... one bad point is the people who were on bridge the same time of us were rude and ignorant ...... and did not care who they barge into to etc its like the people of london cant see others around then ........
Best bridge in London. This is the most beautiful bridge in London. It is quite busy - but well worth a stroll. I'd recommend seeing it during the day and at night.

Unique Iconic Place. Tower Bridge is a wonderful tourist attraction which has a fabulous view to Thames River. You will definitely enjoy visiting the bridge particularly if you are locky enough to see the bridge folding.
Delightful Sight. Been to London countless times and never get tired of seeing and walking the Tower Bridge. Great history landmark.

Wow! Love the glass floors!. This was a lot more than I anticipated with historical and mechanical information, timelines, great pictures through the years and just being there. We went through the entirety of open areas, but the cherry on the top was the glass floors crossing. Looking down the vehicles looked small. We must have a dozen pictures of ourselves and each other laying on the floor facing up, facing down, on our sides. If it is really busy (usually) having enough time with the floor can be a challenge, but hey, we probably won't be back so have fun!

Mond. What a place.me and my wife spend all day in this side.
We spend lovely time.together.and we visit queen castle river of thames.

one of the Best part of London tourist attraction. this is my dream place. once i landed in London my first visit place is tower bridge. and i really adore this place what i think about this, it is better than that.
worth walking over. Famous bridge over the Thames. Worth walking over. We didn't go for anything extra cost. Just the free walk over the bridge.

Very nice iconic place to visit . This is very good attractive to visit. It's near tower of London and it's very nice spot to visit and chill out. Actually lot of people took tower Bridge as tower of London but the bridge shown in the most of the London promos and pictures is tower Bridge and not London Bridge. You can see very good view of river Thames from tower Bridge. Apart from photography you can find very green garden on the east end of the tower Bridge to chill out and London tower on the west side of the tower Bridge. This attraction is very close to Tower Hill train station, so ads convenience to your visit. I suggest to visit this place early in the first half of the DAY so you can cover both London tower and tower Bridge.

Fascinating!. The tower bridge has a lot of history behind it but I'll leave the reader to read about all that online. We went up one tower and walked on the bridge linking the other tower. They've got glass bottoms and some find it squeamish to walk on the glass watching traffics go below you. We also visited the engine room that drives the tower bridges huge drawbridge and it was fascinating to know about that technology employing steam and hydraulic power. Fascinating visit indeed.
This is not true. It's a bridge - a very nice bridge. Thought I would see if my third review with a funny title was accepted ... I wonder how many more I can post !? ......
Impressive. Again, a must see in London but not much to do but admire it really. Famous, nice looking, iconic bridge.
breakthtaking. Have seen many bridges during my travels but this bridge remains my top favorite for the right reasons. Outstanding .

Classic Part of London. This is a classic part of London and well worth a visit. The views up and down the river are excellent. Worth thinking about getting a boat to full appreciate the splendour of the bridge and the buildings on the side of the river.

A sight not to be forgotten. Even at night--perhaps especially at night-- Tower Bridge is an impressive and attractive structure. It's not designed or presented as the useful bridge it is. The draw bridge aspect and attendant design work make for a unique visual experience
Just Beautiful. The Tower Bridge is so unique and beautiful. Its towers are so majestic. One will enjoy walking across the bridge to enjoy views down the river.
Enjoyable. The London tower bridge is amazing to be on, you see all across the river Thames and the speedboat tours that go on there. I would recommend walking across it with family

Very interesting and beautiful sight.. This is a nice place to go, the bridge is really outstanding, walking thru it and seeing the towers, the river, it is a great sight and totally worth a visit. Can get very crowded too.You can take really good photos around this area.

Crowded but who cares?!. Lovely, very crowded make sure you hold your childs hand!
Wow just wow, try and walk under here, if your lucky you might here Big Ben chiming!
Great!
Good background for photo~. A landmark of london in your photo. You can get up to the tower with small entrance fee. There are some exhibition.

A must do when visiting London. A highlight of my trip. The ticket that I purchased at the service desk allowed entry to the the top level of the tower, where there was an exhibition where you could learn a bit more about the history and the construction of the tower bridge. The ticket also allowed me to walk through the 2 passageways that link the two towers, what made that more exciting was the fact that they have recently installed a glass floor in the walkway so that you can look down at cars driving over the bridge just below your feet. It was an unforgettable experience.

Great fun.. We decided at the last minute to visit the glass walkway at Tower Bridge as we were passing on a walk around London. As a family group of 2 adults and 4 children (aged between 8 & 12) we found it excellent value at £22.50. We did the tour back to front and did the victorian engine rooms first. Great staff and all very interesting and well displayed.When we got to the tower entrance on the bridge it was very busy but the queue moved very quickly. We decided to walk up as the queue for the lift was very long and we are so pleased that we did because it was lovely to see the views from the windows as we went up and got a feel for the history.The staff were really friendly and helpful again as we got to the glass walkway. My son was a bit nervous while the rest of us were busy taking photos while we were on the glass and a staff member reassured him and encouraged him and before you know it we managed to get a photo of all 6 of us on there. The kids even jumped!Great staff, great value for our family and great fun!
So Fun!. So no, not the real London Bridge, but still beautiful! We had a great time walking across the bridge and taking lots of pictures!

Amazing Gorgeous Structure. Just completely in awe of the Tower Bridge. Great way to spend a few hours to a Day just walking around and looking at this. Always cool little festivals nearby. Just breathtaking and peaceful

Enjoy from Cruise. I enjoyed the Tower Bridge from the Thames, on a small Cruise. Is when I found it the most amazingm during sunset...although next time I will try to go all the way up, as some people say it is also amazing.
On top of the world!. A great visit, especially the glass floor walkway. The engine rooms were very interesting for the engineering types and wonderful views to see while you're up above the bridge.

Not just s pretty photograph. Why not see and experience it inside, the glass wall is exciting. It is kind of warm inside and get crowded. It's also worth to watch and listen to the history of the bridge!
Great photo ops. Make sure you come by often. Get different views based on time of day. Great night pictures. Take the cruises

Interesting and cheap. I was surprised at the price of entry to the Tower Bridge experience, considering its London it was very reasonably priced. The walk up the first tower was a bit knackering on a hot day in August but there is a lift if you don't fancy the climb. The glass walkways between the towers is fun and there are some great views from the top.

Well worth it!. The price to enter the Tower Bridge is very reasonable compared to other attractions, and offers a unique view down the Thames in both directions, and onto the road and river below through glass floors. There were many interesting displays throughout with new and lesser known interesting facts about structures in London and the World.

Iconic must see and experience . Well we visit tower Bridge every time we come to London. If we aren't on it, we are under it, near it or looking at it. This last visit we were on it looking for the BFG dream jars and were very lucky to see it opening and closing to let a boat through. This doesn't happen too often as the boat obviously needs prior special permission for the bridge to open. One thing you must try is the tower Bridge exhibition whist you are there. Not only can you learn a bit more about the history of Tower Bridge you can also walk along the inside of the top gangway of the bridge. The view from the top of there is amazing, especially on a clear day.

I Work right across tower bridge. Tower bridge is a picturesque bridge in central london which gives the flavour of old london. When the bridge opens for the ship to pass is one of the rare sights and should not be missed.

Very beautiful, especiialy at night. No visit to London is complete without visiting the Tower and Tower bridge. It's very beautful. Especially at night. And the surrounding streets have lots of places to sit and have a drink. I'd recommend walking along the Thames from Tower to London bridge
Glas floor is a bit scary. First time on top of it but it was worth it! Didnt cost that much (not normal for London) 9£! Like I said, the Glas floor is a bit scary but still very impressive!
A must to walk across and photograph. What can I say. A famous landmark I walked over and then photographed from either side. Fantastic views. A must stop when visiting London.

Excellent to see, don't do the tour. My recommendation is to walk the bridge and not do the tour. Some really impressive views from the bridge and to see it open up is really special. This is a must for any London visit.
Saw bridge being opened for a boat to pass under. Our hotel, Grange Tower Bridge Hotel, was conveniently located for this venue. It is a magnificent structure especially for when it was constructed.

Fave attraction in London so far. We visited Tower Bridge Exhibition in a beautiful sunny day and it did not dissapoint. The attraction was very reasonably priced and even better with 2for1 and both adults and children enjoyed it. We were expecting long queues but they werent - we entered the exhibition within ten minutes of arriving. The glass walk was amazing but not for faint hearted! To my surprise so many people avoided the glass floor i assume through fear if heights or maybe vertigo? Kids and i loved it - well worth the visit. Excellent views, informative attraction, not huge but thats reflected in the reasonable price. The area around the Tower Bridge is beautiful and lively..a must see on your visit to London!

Worth visiting. This was a rainny day and we walked to the Tower Bridge. Line was very short. You go all the way up to the tower and read about different bridges and history. You also get a beautiful view of the city. There is a part on the bridge where the floor is made of glass and you can look, sit or take a picture; you just have to wait there is no one to take it. When you go down you can wait for the bridge to open or go downstairs to the machine room.
Lovely Architecture. Lovely old bridge next to the tower of London. The architecture is beautiful and the bridge itself is very iconic and a great place to take photos from.

If you're in London, you can't miss this!. I took a river cruise tour to see the sights. I was very impressed with this structure. Many people seem to confuse this with London bridge because it's such a prominent site in the city so automatically one would think its London bridge. This is a site one should definitely visit.

My favorite attraction. I really enjoy the Tower Bridge, and I have been there on each trip to London. The glass walkway is fun... but watching other tourists freak out while walking on it might be even MORE fun. LOL There are some great views of London, and nice photo points. If you have time to watch the short movies you can learn a lot about the history of London and the bridge itself. It is a short walk from the Tower Bridge to the Tower of London, London Bridge, the HMS Belfast, St. Paul's Cathedral, and the Monument to the Great Fire of London.
London Bridge. I had no desire to sing that silly little children’s song ‘London Bridge is falling down’ when I walked across it TWICE. It was truly spectacular.

Viewed under and over!. We went under the Tower Bridge on a boat, and walked over by foot. Great iconic English landmark. Fantastic spot for taking photos. Would have gone in the visitor exhibition but I think it's more suited for adults than children, so will have to make a return trip without the little ones.

Unique, marvelous structure. A one of a kind bridge to cross - we also got to see the bridge 'lift' to accommodate a masted ship passing through - would give almost anything to travel up to one of the rooms at the top - magical at a disney/hogwarts level.

Iconic. The walk up was good thou there were quite a number of rubbish uncleared but generally it was still a beautiful sight with clear beautiful sky in the backdrop. Majestic of course. Saw the bridge part to let a ship through. sat in the chilly nice weather and people watch. it was a beautiful sight.

The glass floors are great. Probably the most iconic bridge in London. Had pictures and information about other world famous bridges across the world. There was a big queue, which went down fast but I would advise buying tickets online. You get good views looking down the river at both sides. There is also a few glass floors where you can see right down to the traffic / people walking below

Great fun for the kids. I took my kids (7 & 5) here the morning before we were due to get our train home. I wanted something we could fit in, that wouldn't cost a lot or really need a full or half day to make the most of. This was perfect.We arrived early, joining a queue before it actually opened. But this proved to be helpful. The kids took a wee bit of interest in the first video and exhibit, but were more interested in getting onto the glass floor. We went out and they had lots of fun, though it is not a huge area and lots of people, even first thing want photos. The kids moved on to the end of the corridor and I asked the assistant if we were able to go back along the other corridor - for some reason no-one else had entered that corridor so we were on our own for a while.
