This gave us more time to enjoy the glass floor. If you lay down, there is a mirror on the ceiling so you see yourself on top of the glass floor and the Thames underneath. Lots of fun.There are other parts to the exhibit as well which are interesting, and a video showing how it has changed over the years. Worth a visit. They also do family tickets in a range of sizes, though we used the National Rail 2for1 deal.

Amazing bridge. Great price of history. There's a view point up top, never been because in my view there are better spots. FYI it used to be popular for people to leave their estate to their favourite bridges and so today the maintenance is still paid for by these old donations
Amazing sights in London. Always a thrill to re-visit the sights in London. I got free or discounted entry to some places being over 60 which was an unexpected bonus.
Amazing views. If u are in London - see this. Views from on the bridge are amazing n cost nothing. It is amazing to view the Thames and the skyline from the bridge.

It's Iconic.. The bridge is iconic. We did the tour and walked over the top. What is cool is that they were at the leading forefront in the technology to raise and lower a bridge back when they built it. Now.. It is just another bridge that people hurry across and the hoards of people detract from the overall experience. Would I do the tour again? No, probably not. More than anything it is just a photo shoot for the tourists who get in the way of the people who just want to cross it.

Wow, Memorable Experience. There is no doubt this bridge is beautiful. We viewed it on the BigBus tour and by boat on the Thames, but the best experience without a doubt was actually walking over the bridge, starting on the Tower of London side. The photos I took of the bridge and the Thames were magnificent. Enjoy the views of ancient structures holding their ground at the river's edge as sky-scraping modern buildings peak up behind them. The park at the other side of the bridge is just the right spot to sit and place back on this beauty of a bridge.

The most beautiful bridge ever build . I love the structure and building of Tower Bridge. It's gorgeous to look at and can be seen from high up miles away. For many years in my youth after a night out I would just go and sit there for ages enjoying the bridge itself as it is. In the day it is possible to go to the top and visit. whenever I cycle past i will stop and just admire this beauty

Awesome Views!!!. The glass floors are phenomenal. We have enjoyed the Towers in Dubai & Shanghai which are much taller, but the glass floors over the water make this very worthwhile. Views are awesome & it's educational too!
Great site. Saw the bridge go up to allow a ship to pass an iconic London site. Near Tower of London and landing area for boat trip down Thames

An imposing feature of the river Thames. Cross the bridge and enjoy a key position on the river. A good place to watch the river traffic. Crossing either way and you are on s good walk giving dramatic aspects of the river
Tower bridge . bridge had just opened when we got off the underground. Wonderful experience to see it live ! I recommended...

The best part of London. In my eyes, this attraction was the best part of London. It is very majestic and provides a balance between the old and new. It is free and you can pay to go up if you want a good view of the city.
iconic. Iconic london landmark, we walked over the bridge and enjoyed the view but there was absolutely tons of litter around especially on the steps which did spoil things
So romantic!. Great romantic walk and view in evening. Stunning. Why have I been all over the world and missed gems like this at my door step? Great lights and mega historical building.

Don't miss the London bridge experience. Strolling around the London bridge is a delightful experience. Moreover, you can have a picnic nearby on the lawn and enjoy the view.
I recommend to you to enter the "London bridge experience" also and see how it looks like to be on the top the bridge. I choose my attractions carefully, and this one was totally a HIT.
Wow. A lovely bridge you have to visit. You can walk across the top on it now on the glass floor, we didn't but people were raving about it so worth looking into.
Spectacular. The bridge is beautiful and a real focus point on the Thames. However, drive over it at night and look up for an absolute delight.
Breath taking Tower Bridge. Best to walk over the bridge in the evening and perhaps along the bank of Thames. The view at night is breathtaking .

Had a great time!. Staff were friendly and helpful. Lots of information and things to look at so keeps the kids occupied! Glass floor on the platform was brilliant! Recommend this to anyone who's not afraid of heights!

A walk worth taking. Walked over London bridge the make the loop through the open air market and park on route for a walk over the Tower Bridge. A great walking path has been built through the area to make the way something enjoyable.
Great views from all sides, leave yourself time for the Tower of London.
Vacation. The bridge is a must you can go under it walk along the river to it look through it to the water and climb up in it this bridge does get busy so go early
What a Sight to Experience. We thoroughly enjoyed walking up to the Tower Bridge and walking along the bridge. Its beautiful and the glass floor is amazing-take a picture here.
Iconic . Iconic landmark, lovely to walk over. Catch a bus to covent garden on the other side of the bridge . The bus ride to covent garden pasea through the borough market area.
beautiful. Awesome view when a ship passes and the bridge opens up. Take a lake cruise to enjoy the complete beauty of the bridge and sorroundings.

Fun afternoon. We had the London Pass which included entrance to the tower bridge exhibit and the engine room exhibit. Didn't take a very long time to get in as we could fast pass the line. Once at the top, there are several glass floors that allow you to see down to the Thames. Had a great time!

Great Place to See the Brideg and London. Well organised DIY tour to see the bridge and its workings. Great glass floors on upper decks so you can see the cars driving below. Scares the adults but not the kids. Good display of bridge working gear for lifting the bridge.
A bridge for all to see. Wonderful views from the bridge. The bridge itself is breathtaking, and a pure amazing piece of architecture...
Wonderful. It was my dream to see that bridge and dont regret a bit i did. It was just huge and amazing building. I love that architecture. That's something you must see then you visit London!!! :)

Tower Bridge, always amazing. Tower Bridge is Tower Bridge. one of London's must see attractions. I have now been here probably 10 times and each time I am amazed by it over again. The only drawback is the amount of people in August so if you can visit at any other time you better choose that.
Visit it at night. Try to visit it at night, it's really safe and you can get great pictures with all the lights. It's a magnificent landmark and a must if you are in London.
Fun but expensive. It was expensive to walk across but fun to do it and the kids liked the glass bottom of the bridge and view.

Iconic site. As my husband and I walked across the bridge the favorite childhood song kept going thru my mind even though it's not the London Bridge. I wish we had the time to go up to the top but with so much to see we decided to move on. It was really interesting to see all the fine work that made this bridge so neat and to appreciate how special she really is. Don't miss this site for sure.

Tower Bridge is NOT the London Bridge !. This attraction was a wonderful experience and we thoroughly enjoyed visiting it. The history and modern elements combined make this attraction a must see. The Glass bottom top of the tower was a " Selfie Haven" and the kids loved it as much as the Adults. The gift shop is also, quite nice and the overall experience makes it a MUST SEE.

Stamp your pass with this visit. For any reason if you are around the area to London Eye or historic places in city of London or take river tour, sure you will see this great bridge. It will be good to enjoy it in daylight

It's ok. Yes it's ok really. The glass floor on the bridge is the interesting part and the rest of it is interesting if you really want to know about the history of the bridge. Very crowded in august and not that pleasant.

Do You Dare Walk On The Glass?. Tower Bridge is synonymous with London by visitors all over the world so of course you have to visit when you come to the city. This historic bridge now comes with an added attraction of having a glass walkway in a small section when you walk between the towers. The views up and down the River Thames is brilliant. The exhibition of bridges around the world isn't that good if I'm being honest and I don't think anybody really cares about it. Most people just come up here for the views. Even though that's only a minor gripe, it's still a must-see place to visit though.

Great views from up there! . When visiting tower bridge make sure to go up on it, and would recommend to wait for lift as i took stairs and regretted it half way up :) specatcular views and it got glass floor in the middle. Worth its price!
An architectural gem. It is no secret that London has many bridges with many stunning views but Tower Bridge as a stand alone piece is spectacular and by far, the best bridge in the city.
Icon of London. Situated next to the Tower you should pay a visit to it. Great to see the inside and walk on top of it.

A Worthy use of your Time. We visited in August on a Windy Wet day. This is a self guided tour which starts with a climb up the stairs of one of the towers to the walkway (there is a Lift for the least able).There are good views of London Westward from the left hand walkway Eastward from the other. There is plenty of information including video explaning how the bridge was built etc. You end exiting from the far tower. If you have paid then a visit to the Engine comes next. Well worth doing to complete your overall knowledge. Once finished if you look there is a nice walk along the River on this side. Book online to save a little. Not to expensive.

A Great Olde Bridge. There are not many olde bridges in the world that can do what Tower Bridge can do , and it does it so well .. I cannot recall how many times I have crossed The Thames using this bridge , it's grandeur is to behold .. I have also been on the tour of the bridge including the upper walkways , which includes a museum on the inner sides allowing great views up & down the river .. Also on the tour you get to see the mechanics of the bridge , or should I say the hydraulics of the bridge .. Well worth a couple or three hours of anyone's time ..

Olympic Fan zone. We visited here on one of the last Days of the olympics, the fan zone below tower bridge was excellent with deck chairs and bars set up. A really nice set up with the impressive tower bridge as the backdrop.

Enjoyable. When in London this is a must because of the history. The glass walk way is so so funny. I filmed a Chinese lady trying to step onto the glass, but she couldn't bring herself to do it. I have never laughed so much, but it took a lot for me too walk on the glass lol.
A must see!. Long time since we visited before... And a must see, we just had a slow walk over this pretty bridge, and a fish and chips on the other side (from the towern)

Tower bridge exhibition . Fantastic bridge so decided to go to the exhibition. It's fairly cheap to get in and we had 2 for 1 tickets. Once up there, there isn't really much to see. There are great views of the city and a glass floor that makes a good picture but think they struggled to fill it with information as there was lots about bridges across the world. I'm glad I went but wouldn't visit again.

Must do in London. Walking across is better than driving or riding just so you can say you did it! The river cruise is good to do also. you get to see alot of the city in little time. I recommend night viewing even more.
Stunning . Probably the most famous bridge in the world. Beautiful by day and stunning at night when all lit up. Take the tube to London Bridge and walk along the embankment for wonderful views.

Timeless Treasure. Tower bridge is a timeless treasure. One cannot visit London without taking a walk across the bridge. If you're feeling froggy you can venture to the top. Whatever you chose make sure the bridge is a part of your itinerary.

Worth the Climb!. We were on a bus tour and alight at a stop near Tower Bridge just to visit it. We did not book tickets in advance, there was a queue but it moved fast. After buying the tickets, you can go straight up the lift or stairs to the top. There were movie clips and a lot of information about the tower and London too. The glass floor of the bridge is quite short but amazing to experience. We went down and waited for the draw bridge to move. It was a great experience!
Great to walk along for a nice view. We enjoyed walking along the sides of the bridge, but did not bother to go to the top for the price of admission was a bit to steep. Nice views from the bridge.
Nice to see. You can walk on the tower bridge and take a tour of its history. You can take nice pictures . I liked the nearby river walkways very much
Great Place. This place has an outstanding ambiance that i can't express, the weather is awesome especially in July/August

Stunning bridge especially at night. Stunning bridge in the day or night but I recommend seeing it at night when it is lit up. It is amazing. The atmosphere around the bridge is also still lively at night.

Shakespears running mad with a Window Live. Rose was waiting by the left tower she said crossing was easy but i dont believe her , surprised by trafic , well i am a timelord and things do change , did u know can actualy climb up those towers a challenge with adrenalin and a feel good factor when get across , recommend the right side bridge in September on the Eleventh day then pegg it to the Globe Theatre 1999 and ask for the new window milleniun live play

bad customer service. Tried to go to the Tower Bridge Experience on the south side of the river. I arrived there at about 10:20 only to be told “oh this side is not open yet (the opening time is 10:00) you will have to go to the North side. If I had a pre booked ticket, I could have gone into the exhibition. I did not bother, as I had to stay on the South side of the river. If I could give it zero stars, I would have
Love it. It is such an iconic bridge and it just great to see, walk across, go inside, take a river boat tour under - haven't flown over it, but happy with lot so far. It's a great bridge.
Day out. Travelled across the bridge by open top bus tour and by foot. Amazing views and information about the bridge.
Another one of londons landmarks. Fantastic bridge and londons landmarks went on a river cruise the guy said look online tells you what time the bridge opens
Must See. You cant go to London and not see Tower Bridge. We didn't go in, but it was marvellous enough just looking at it.

Loved it. Ok, the glass walkway part of it is not for those with a big fear of heights - like me - it was dizzying, terrifying and amazing. The best bit was the engine rooms, they were amazing, filled with fully reconditioned engines including a working one.Ok, the kids weren't quite so enthused with the engines but there are interactive displays for the kids to play with.

Its OK. The bridge being open to the public is a good thing and you can enjoy this, but you have to be into bridges. For a school trip or to learn about the bridge it would be good, if you like heights and very different selfies this one is for you. Lay on the glass floor !!

lovely historical bridge. really nice and historical bridge over the themes.too crowed in summer, but worth to visit.Go inside and make the tour; even it is crowed, it was worth and really interesting.
Beautiful . Such a beautiful work of art we had to take my nephews over it. There are lots of places to sit and have a drink around there so it was nice to sit back relax and take it in scenery
Amazing bridge.. We walked past the bridge yesterday as we are staying right near it. It looks amazing , we saw it go up as well at one point. Lovely looking attraction.

Go early. I would say that this attraction is definitely worth visiting because of the view, the glass bridge, the authenticity and the general mood feeling of this place, but I would advice going early to avoid the greatest crowds. The ticket to Tower Bridge exhibition includes a visit to the engine rooms, which was also a unique experience. A short film presented and views on both sides of the bridge will guarantee you have a wonderful time here.

Was surprised that this is not london bridge!. I think we have grown up believing that this is London bridge and its not! Its a very charming piece of architecture and the MOST beautiful bridge in London. U must try to walk from one bank to the other. To get a good view or photo of it walk along the Thames from London bridge towards Tower bridge.

Grand!. Great opportunity to view this majestic bridge from the inside and out. The Exhibition tour takes you up the South Tower via elevator. You learn about the construction of the bridge and the history of the era. The highlight is the glass floor of the "catwalk" on both sides at the top. Truly spectacular views around the city and below your feet! Fun to watch everyone's reaction when they first take those steps onto the glass, if they dare. You also get to view the engine rooms and of course the gift shop.

Great picture. Again historic. Must picture taking. Again big groups and traffic. Good area to walk around both sides of river. You can tour the historic bridge. Again if you tour everything in the area it can bite into your budget

Better to take a picture of, not pay to go in. Tower Bridge, not to be mistaken as London Bridge, is a very iconic bridge, and a must see in London. Now, I say, must see, not must go in to. There's not really a lot to see inside of the bridge. They have a glass walkway at the top, but that's all it really has to offer. It's better to go on either of walkways along the Thames, to get a good view of the bridge.

Beautiful bridge with amazing view of London.. It's difficult to give this bridge a review which does not sound repetitive. The bridge itself is truly iconic. It's location is great with great view of the City of London and thriver Thames, of course. It is also situated between the London City Hall and the Tower of London which makes it extremely convenience.
The most beautiful bridge on earth! . I adore Tower Bridge and I think this is one of the most unique bridges in England! So if you are in London, go there! You won't regret it!!

A must visit on London's map. Besides the fact that you can visit it any time, you can even visit it and have a look from above on the glass bridge. Hope every tourist gets a chance to see the bridge lift.PS: You can visit Tower Birdge and the Monument at £11.00, tickets are available for 7 days from the moment you buy them.

Iconic. I was looking around the Tower of London when I first spotted it during my visit. It was lit up as the sun was setting and it gave the place a wonderful feel. I later saw it from the riverside where we ate dinner and after we had finished eating I persuaded my parents to get closer. Just one of those must see places to be honest. Everyone knows it.

Spectacular.. everything you dreamed it to be .. then more. The photo ops with this behind you is spectacular. When you go out of the Tower of London or take the river thames cruise.. you can get spectacular photos of this bridge. Seeing this bridge in person took my breath away.
Open the bridge . A very good place to see the Thames and to understand a little bit of London history. And the fabulous glass floor in the top of the tower.
Great to visit!. Nice tour of the history of the making of the bridge. The glassfloor is a nice addition. We were lucky to see the bridge open that day!

Great view. Stairs, stairs, stairs!! Totally worth the hamstring fatigue! The views from the top are gorgeous. There will always be a ton of people in here with you so don't expect to get private photos.

Expensive for just a short walk..... I found expensive the ticket comparing to what you get. You pay about 9 pounds for a short walk in the higher levels of the bridge that also includes a small part with the glass floor. Amazing views though and glass floor is a good experience. Also you have access to the engine rooms of the bridge.

What a View. The visit twalks you through the details of construction and I was surprised to see that the bridge had a counter weight design. Engineering a aside another highlight stays with the glass floor that you can walk through in between the towers.

Bustling area. Recommend to visit tower bridge in the late afternoon/evening. Lots of dinner choices beside tower bridge. If you're hungry while walking on tower bridge, there are warm sweet peanut snack sold in push carts :)

The most famous brigde. Walk by the riverbank from London eye, it's a bit far until you reach London Bridge but it's a nice walk. You can see many people and many attractions along the riverbank. Some street performers playing music and singing, acts like a robot or just makes giant bubbles. The bridge can be seen from a far, but as you walk closer it looks magnificent! Beautiful from any angles.

Amazing piece of British engineering. We loved walking over the bridge with our 2 young children - much better than driving over it. My husband said "Peter Pan wouldn't be the same without it" wonderful structure and part of our heritage.

Someone sort out the litter . The most littered part of London due to no waste disposal/security. So instead do nothing and let the garbage pile up? There needs to be some other way to collect litter or ban the hand outs and leaflets and ice cream containers. Much more signage and information needed - very little on that front. But a London must.
Beauitful, iconic bridge. Love that you can walk across this bridge and see so much of London. It is so beautiful not only from a distance, but up close as well.

Exceptional. It is one thing to see the bridge from a distance but your really can admire it only when you get on top; see the Tower Exhibition and the Engine Rooms to be able to appreciate the technology that was used several decades ago.

Touristy Visit to London. Great to walk along and take photos from.Makes a good excuse to walk along it and to keep fit.By the bridge you can walk along a path and see it from a distance in all its glory. But actually walking it I would think is more of a pleasure than from afar

Tourist sights. Went here after living in london for four years, they had recently installed a glass floor. The views from the top were very nice and also from the glass floor if you were brave enough to walk on it! It was quiet cheap also, look out for special coupons you can get from people on the bridge also.

Awesome. It was a great tour for me through the London City. Specially London Tower Bridge, one of most attractive and authentic viewing place . We looked around Tower bridge & climbed up to top to cross the glass walking path . Which is newly added to attract tourists.Really I enjoyed my tour.
Definitely worth a visit. It's really as spectacular as it looks in the pictures. Amazing views from the Tower of London on the Tower Bridge and vice versa. Definitely worth a visit.

Mi soul London festival party. What a fantastic atmosphere.
Locals and tourists alike were grooving to the sounds of the mi soul crew. A great gig and it's on every weekend until October. I will be there.
A must see!. We visited Tower Bridge when first arriving here. Well worth a visit. It's free. Great view. So visit it if you come here!
London Bridge . We weren't sure what to expect but when we saw this bridge it was impressive! We snapped a bunch of pictures and marveled that it had survived two world wars.

Visit to london. Excellent staff. Good price. I don't think it's for young children as they might find it boring. Glass walk way is good but not good for people with fear of heights. I am a wuss and didn't walk on the glass walk way as some people made me uneasy by jumping on it which I though was dos respectful
Nothing like Lights. Perfect for a romantic stroll. Lovely bridge and very beautiful at night. Probably the most exciting bridge in London.
One in kind bridge. The Tower Bridge is a must see when in London. It's a unique building and the view from the walkway is very nice.

Very beautiful!. You have to see it! It's huge and beautiful!It's a great view of Thames river and everything around it! There's a tour up there (it seemed to be very good) on a glass floor! It's close to the London tower!And after seeing it, you can take a boat trip! It's very nice!! And if you have the oyster card, you get a discount! Make sure you remember it!

A tour of The Lovely Tower Bridge. We bought an opened ended ticket online that lasted a year. It's just the one visited but worth buying it online.It's a bit cheaper plus you can jump the queue on the day you visit.So about the tour, well the team of staff they have are brilliant, very helpful and so friendly.You go up in the lift and when you get to the top there is a video of the history of the bridge which I found interesting, then you get to walk from one side to the other of which they have put a glass floor on part of the walkway. Great opportunity for photos, and when you look across through the windows some great views!Then you walk over to the other walkway with great views of London looking at the Tower of London, HMS Belfast, St Pauls Cathedral to mention a few, they also have another section of a glass floor, which also has a mirror above for more fun photos, and we got lucky because the bridge opened beneath us for a boat to go through.Then once you have finished its down the stairs or lift and walk to the other side of the bridge to see the old engine room with steam engines and the history that goes with it.It's all well worth the visit and at the price of less than £10.00 each it is a great valued trip with great views and learning about this wonderful bridge.
Cool. How cool this bridge is ? Simply lovely and easy to reach.We got the chance to see it opening for a boat to pass . Nice

Iconic. Turns out that what I thought was the infamous London Bridge is actually the Tower Bridge. Amazingly photographic, the walk across the bridge an experience in and of itself if your group includes restless, fidgety members.The bridge experience ticket is educational, informative and interesting for those fascinated by engineering and curious history buffs. The bridge needed to open for passing river boat while we were about to walk across.Toilets available but not easy to locate.Walk across is a definite suggestion.
Fascinating. Crossing the Tower Bridge makes me feel a part of history. It is one of the famous and most beautiful bridges in the world

must see icon. The bridge was amazing to see, so beautiful at night and during the day i suggest going to see it at both times for the nicest pictures.I also went up the tower to walk around on the glass floor this was fun but very bust at the top. Lots to see from the top it really is a great view.they have an elevator to the top but they also have stair i took the stair to see more of how it was made it was very nice and there is a lot to read on the way up.

Fascinating views through the glass floor. Tower Bridge is a great sight and picture motive from street level, but absolutely worth the visit "upstairs". Had booked tickets online which is a little less than buying on the day, also children discount is valid up to age 16. You can take the elevator or go up the stairs (which we did, already interesting part of the building and not crowded) to the walkways above the bridge. Obviously not of interest to people with height issues. Parts of the walkways feature glass floor which makes for a special experience and cool pictures. Featured alongside are info boards on other spectacular and/or famous bridges around the world and there's also TVs with information narrated by one of the current engineers, subtitles available in different languages. Great views across London, even though our visit was on a cloudy day. The engine rooms on the south side are fascinating as well - even if you're not tech-minded, be amazed by the sparkly cleanness of the machines ;)Really great visit and not as expensive as most other London attractions (our family ticket was £14.10 for one adult and two 15 year old).
Must see. My first trip to London and we had to se Tower Bridge. It's truly amazing, the size and the details.

Dream Came True..!!!. It was an amazing feelings, being there for the first time in 2007, then 3 more times..! It is one of the most renowned icons in the world..! Each time, I enjoy the river, the scenery around, this famous bridge everything..!

Tower Bridge . A beautiful architecture . We were twice there and is busy all the time. Great place to take photos and for a walk. We enjoyed so much our walk around the bridge. So beautiful at night time as well .
great views. great views and great photo opportunity very good if you are visiting london and is free to walk over would make sure you do this if in London

towering over london. This bridge is a very famous bridge many walks of life have tower over it under it and on it the bridge itself is quite unique and if you love it buy it as a 3d jigsaw we went under it on a boat trip it's lovely too see day and night

Iconic City road bridge.. Must be one of the most recognisable bridges in the world. In the centre of one of the worlds greatest cities to visit. With dock lands developed into lively areas seems more 'central ' .than it was . Competition. ? European -Budapest chain bridge has location but not the uniqueness. As has st Charles ,Prague.Ponte Vecchio Florence , Rialto and Sighs small Italian bridges and Mostar too small.  Paris , Amsterdam Berlin ,Vienna , Geneva, Copenhagen Stockholm ,Warsaw , Dublin many bridges but .... Not particularly memorable for me World wide Sydney harbour(Forth rail bridge on Steroids) must be main competition. Golden gates , Sanfrancisco - great bay but most overrated bridge I've seen .....on edge of city going somewhere else. Only beaten for overrated-ness was by 'London Bridge ' bought and shipped to the USA brick by brick in 1960s ,allegedly, thought to be Tower Bridge. Large suspension bridges , functional everywhere out side cities all over the world and its the view that is important rather than the bridge. IMOTower Bridge looked great in the sun yesterday , not really looked at it for 40 years, I don't think I appreciated it before.

The icon of London - go at the top and view from the glass. Its simply iconic to be at the Tower Bridge when in London,its costs you nothing to click some amazing pics but if you wanna explore more pay 9 pounds to get to the top of the tower bridge, walk across the alleys and view the traffic moving across the Thames through the glass floor.To top it all there is a special animated video which shows the construction of the Tower Bridge which makes you wonder the architecture and engineering behind the construction.Free wifi is available when you are on the Tower Bridge.After the tower you are gudied to the engine room which portarys the equipments and machines which are used to open and close the bridge.
SO COOL!. Love, love, loved it! So much history in this city and specifically in this area! The bridge has so many intricacies to be taken in. So much more than a connection of two land masses.

London Icon. Such a beautiful bridge and a true icon of London. We walked across it, but did not do the tour. We were able take great pictures from the Southbank side of the bridge with the Tower of London off to the side.

A must see. Stunning experience. The Tower Bridge is one iconic place in London, the walk on the glass floor over 40 meter above the Thames is breathtaking and the visit at the Engine Room quite interesting. A must see.
London attractions . Such a landmark to see. What a part of history. Always great to see it upfront. Worth a visit. Check the bridge lifting times.
A true masterpiece. Walked over Tower Bridge and read all about it. It is a beautiful piece of history. No trip to London would be complete without visiting the traditional sites.

Beautiful Bridge. The architecture is great and it's a terrific place to take photos. We didn't go in to the exhibit as it was really busy but we did see the bridge rise which made it worth missing the exhibit.
Step back intime. A visit here opens the doors back to an era of British history. The surrounds and stories as told by our Yeoman guard made an place of history alive and fascinating.

Pretty neat place to go.. Apparently everyone gets London Bridge and Tower Bridge mixed up, but you will definitely learn the difference. The glass floor while being so high up on the bridge is a very unique feature. We got the London Pass and this was one of the places we were able to get in without standing in line. If you take the stairs (and there are a lot of them) your experience will begin much faster than standing in the long lift lines.

Awesome . Totally amazing piece of construction and is so dominant over the Tower of London I thought.. Amazing to walk under and admire from a distance.. I didn't do a tour inside but will save that for next time.

iconic bridge. many confused with London bridge, but anyway this is veyr unique iconic buidling of London, would recommend take boat from pier rather than spending big monery for tour boat. i think most beautiful to see from Thames river.

Tower Bridge Tour. We booked a tour of Tower Bridge online and visited last week. Pretty inexpensive for such a good tour. The tour is self-guided so you can take as much or as little time as you want. First you will see the inner workers of the bridge mechanism including a short film about the construction and operation of it. After that you can go up on the upper walkway high above the street below. This part of the tour is worth the admission price alone. Some terrific photo opportunities from that vantage point including through the glass floor you walk along which I must say takes a little getting used to and a bit of faith. I have been to London many times but this was my first closeup encounter with this magnificent structure. A must do if you love London, By the way, the staff very friendly and helpful especially the staff in the very good gift shop which was very busy.

Does what is says on the tin, great views and friendly staff. Good visit to the bridge, only thing that might make things a little better is put a sign up at the end of the walkway to tell people that they have to go back had someone with vertigo crossing over the glass floor thinking achieved it only to have to go back!We returned to the bridge because friend had lost her necklace and the phones aren't manned over a weekend. The very kind lad on reception rang through nothing had been found but gave us a couple of tickets to go look ourselves. Even with a bit of a laugh about the glass walkway, great credit and very helpful.

always a great sight. Tower Bridge is lovely. The sight as you approach from land or water is always wonderful and can been seen from some way off. Make sure you see it during the day and again when it is lit at night which is great.
Magnificent tourist attraction. One of the best London spots. The best view is from the south side of the river, nest to the city hall

Lots of stairs.... Tower Bridge is a must see in London. You can walk across for free, but if you have the London Pass use it climb the bridge and walk through the engine rooms. Don't need to spend to much time here.Take the elevator, the stairs to the top are a killer!
Great views. Great views, a look at the engines that were used in this bridge with a bit of history and a glass floor. Decent for the price
Family Visit. We visited here on an open top bus, we didn't stop though. We loved travelling over this iconic bridge, and seeing the views and the detail.

Easy walk & amazing views. If you have ever walked across the Brooklyn Bridge this is nothing. And with young kids they can make this walk so easy! The views are amazing & of course you can't beat the tourist pictures that you will get from this. With the Tower of London & Tower Bridge you are set.

Nice view. If you pay to go up top, the view is nice but you can get a high view of the city in other place. This is great if you can time it with the bridge lifting. The exhibit isn't worth the money necessarily and one could be satisfied crossing the bridge at traffic level for free
London Tower Bridge. Beautiful and worth seeing in person. Took a boat tour to get a different perspective of the bridge.
Loved it! . It's a bridge, but still has so much more! You definitely want to visit this if you are in London. If you don't, I really don't know what you have doing there!

Glass floor experience icing on the cake!. Iconic building and to be able to get inside and get great views across the river is worth the money, (£9 Adult/ £6.30 Concession). There are short talks and films at either side of the towers, followed by the glass floors on each walkway. For children there is a sticker if you manage to hold your stomach and brave standing on the glass floor. I found the engine room was good to do at the beginning so you get a feel for the workings of the bridge before it went electric. Total visit time 1hr 15 minutes. Coffee shops and restaurants are a plenty as you complete the experience, either on the south side (Shad Thames) or North side at St Katherine's dock.

Tower of London. We took the river boat from Westminster on a £10 return. Easy pier to navigate from. The area is busy and the contrast between today and yesteryear was wonderful, modern yet historic! Watch out as seagulls fly low! We didn't go into the tower but walked around the area and loved it!

Iconic. We could see Tower Bridge from the Tower of London, and we also walked over to it. The bridge crosses the River Thames close to the Tower of London and it has become an iconic symbol of London. Tourists commonly call this London Bridge, but that is not the official name of this historic landmark.

Tower bridge . I went to tower bridge with my two young children and wife. We were greeted with reasonable prices, friendly and helpful staff, an all round good experience with excellent views and interesting history
Can't miss it. Be sure to take a stroll across the bridge. The bridge museum is on the west side. There is also a tour of the engine rooms on the southern side.
Nice walk. Pleasant walk with great views of the Thames. Good place to find a local pub. We did not stop at the exhibit.

A must see location of world renown. The Tower bridge (which a lot of non Europeans incorrectly think as LONDON BRIDGE) is a must visit location, even if you decide not to take the paid tour to go up the towers and the connecting bridges on the top.The place offers ample photographing opportunities and it is truly one of the iconic structures of London. The surrouding areas offer ample activities for families and couples.

Must see. Anyone and everyone that has heard or seen of London has certainly seen the most recognisable landmark. Not much to say other than don't forget to enjoy this monument during daylight AND nighttime ! The tower Bridge does have a an attraction that has opening hours. This is for going on the high walkways where glass floors look down on the road below.

Iconic bridge of London, shoud'nt miss. Close to the Tower of London, this great bridge is treat to tread over. Beautiful view of Thames and the buildings on its both sides. Walk along the sideways and enjoy the view. You may go up after purchasing the ticket to have an even better view. Really a gorgeous bridge. You must walk on it, rather than whooshing past by bus/cab.

Big Bridge. Walking across the Bridge is wonderful with amazing views. Lots of boat traffic to watch and a large gap in the middle of the bridge you can stand on each side :) I didn't see it worth pay for to up top though.
Tower Bridge!. Well, our timing was excellent, as the bridge started to open as we were walking across it! Also fun to see it light up at night!

better value than a lot of other tourist attractions. got a 2 for 1 on tickets as we went to London on the train. That made the entrance prices very reasonable! You can climb the stairs or do the lift.. your choice. A couple of black and white short old movies showing the bridge and London in the old days are on constant show at either end of the bridge. The glass floor is quite good as long as you have a head for heights but you can walk around it. Great views of London from both sides of the bridge. We were lucky as we had check the web and seen that the bridge would be raised on the day we were visiting so we timed it accordingly - great sight as the bridge opened and a tall ship sailed through heading for the sea. The engine room is very interesting and well worth seeing.

This is a bridge!. It is much bigger that you could imagine and it is easy to access by bus or on foot. You can visit the London Towers which are very close to the bridge. The details and beauty of the structure is impressive.
Loved the view. Lovely views of London and river. I was little afraid to walk on the transparent floor section and see the cars and boats below. But that was great experience!
Fun! . We walked across after visiting the Tower of London. spectacular views! Easy walk. Definitely do this if the weather is nice.
Breathtaking. Beautiful bridge and I had the opportunity to walk over it and take pictures and even my hotel room was facing it
Vantage point view of the monuments and the river.. This is a must do in a London visit. I liked the walk on the bridge and the wonderful view of hms Belfast and other interesting sites.

A spectacular bridge. The London Bridge, is one of the bridges that most impressed me, I think it is a mixture of grandeur and beauty, two difficult things to combine with its two huge towers and solemnity across the Thames river, you have the feeling of being something tiny his feet. A great architectural work no doubt.Besides gastronomic surprises nearby.
Specyacular. Took the tower bridge exhibition, very interesting, glass floor safe to walk on! Lots to see, plenty of steps. Must do whilst in London.

Nice bridge . Nice bridge to walk over or stand on look down the river at the sights or go into the mechanism room to see how the bridge opens up or walk across the high walk way at the very top of the bridge

Fun day outing. Visited the Tower Bridge exhibition on a clear day and enjoyed ourselves greatly especially seeing down from the glass floor. Plenty of tourists and locals on a weekday and queuing system moved fairly quickly. Taken up by lift or you can walk up the stairs to the 4th floor,not sure how many steps to tackle. Good displays of other interesting bridges around the world on the walls and plenty of descriptive information of how the bridge was constructed.Highly recommended tourist attraction in London.Don't forget the engine room which is included in the admission price
a London Must. We didn't go up onto the high walkway, just walked alongtheu bridge. It has to be a must if seeing London

London. First ever time I've been to London and it was amazing I didnt want to leave. The tower Bridge was brilliant, the fac you stand on it with the other tourists and everyone is amazed. The sites are brilliant.

Interesting self walk. My wife & I visited Tower Bridge on a joint ticket with the Monument (see separate review) - this was by far the best iof the two attractions although still leaves you wanting a little more.The main entrance is a bit of a walk from nearby public stations etc & after going through a bag-check then you're taken in a lift up one of the towers to the walkway. Both east & west walkways are bascially the same with information boards along the path & also a glass floor which can be scary for some people as you can see the pavement, road & Thames below - some visitors were laying on the glass taking selfies. The views are good from the sides & after doing both walkways you can view a 4 minute video on the history/building of the bridge before taking a lift back down to the ground to follow a blue line along the pavement outside to the engine rooms & the inevitable souvenir shop.It was interesting but not stimulating, but glad we visited
Lovely day out. Great family day out. Got to go over Tower Bridge and take the walk over the glass floor which looks down onto the Thames

Excellent value . This was something new for me this trip it was excellent value for a London attraction and the glass floor was fantastic. Lie down in the floor and have someone take your picture or photograph the mirrors above your head.

A Must See & Do...the Entire Embackment Area is British History to Soak In. Our friend Rob from London took us here on our stay and it was amazing! You hopefully will get here on a clear sunny day. Linger and check out everything near by. Pubs, food, history. Just do it!
A fun view of history. Learning about how the bridge was made, as well as seeing through the floor to the bottom, was really fun. It's an impressive structure, for sure.
Stunning . Viewed from the river then walked across. a real piece of British heritage. The information plaques helped explain the names of places such as dead man's hole.

Huge and AMAZING!. What a sight! This Tower Bridge is a combined bascule and suspension bridge in London and was built in 1886–1894.
The bridge crosses the River Thames close to the Tower of London.
Cool Photo Place. We enjoyed just walking across the bridge and taking pictures. It does get very crowded. The Tower of London sits right at the base of the bridge.

Magnificent bridge. Very well known bridge and beautiful to see especial lit up at night.
Worth paying a visit especially if your a photographer

Amazing Tower Bridge. We walked across the bridge and just as we approached the other side, we were quickly rushed off as it was to open to allow a Cruise Ship through. It was a great thrill to see the Bridge rise and as the Cruise Ship sailed thru with everyone on board and on the bridge waving and Playing Hail Britannia! Perfect timing!
Go inside. Interesting the inside tour. Plus the engine rooms. On top you get to see under your feet. Not expensive. At night looks better ;)
awesome !!!!. the Tower Bridge is awesome to do, it's the most popular attraction in London.don't miss it, just do it !!!!

Great weekend in the capital. Friday-SundayFantastic weekend of what's the greatest city in the world, not the cheapest but by far the bestTwo nights in the Hub by Premiere Inn London Tower Bridge, small but spotless with a great bed and shower, what more do you needUsed Uber 10 times to get around and they all turned up within a 10 minute time stated and great priceTower of London awesomeVisited 6 bars Friday night with Admiralty Trafalgar Square the "dogs" six of us spent our £300 kittyVisited 12 bars and the tower Saturday including Sky Garden and Covent Garden mind blowing if you want a laugh visit Half way to heaven proper freak show £450 kitty emptyHung Drawn & Quartered Sunday for Breakfast and dinner tremenfous Travelled with London Midland superb

Good experience. Steeped in history and a must if your in London. To say we have been inside and across the top of Tower Bridge is quite something. The glass floor is amazing and if your ok with stepping over random tourists your good. Quite expensive to get in for what was half an hour in total and it was really busy inside but well worth the experience.

My favourite bridge. I love to see this bridge at any time of the day or night- it's a beauty. For a special trip check the opening times of the bridge on line. Also, you get a great view of the bridge from the boats in the thames.

Miss Hatter. Had a amazing stay , staff on point and a massive thank you to Freddie Holmes for making it extra special , i am extremely happy and he went above and beyond to meet our expectations , only thing was I did not have the pleasure of thanking Freddie Holmes in person , but will be back very soon , perfect room , Longe couldn't ask for more you are truly amazing ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
True icon. Must see. Wish we had time for the glass floor but the Tower of London took longer than we expected.

Fantastic and Educational. Husband and I visited the Tower Bridge on a rainy day. It's the perfect attraction for such weather as you are inside. The displays are quite interesting and very educational. You learn how the bridge operated "back in the day". Even though I enjoyed the exhibits, my husband was really in awe. We both recommend a visit to the Tower Bridge for anyone of all ages. But FYI: there are a ton of stairs to climb and we do not recall if there was an elevator available or not. So this attraction may not be handi-cap accessible.Visited August 2009
Beautiful Bridge. Tower Bridge is an iconic place in London and not to be missed. You can view from the Thames, but must walk the bridge when in London!
Impressive . Was great to see and walk across... Great photo opportunity and lots of tourists and much visited... Worth a look....

I hope you like heights. The main attraction with a visit to Tower Bridge is walking across the glass floor linking the two towers. If you don't like heights you can walk to one side and not look down. If you are an engineer or have an engineer background you will enjoy reading about the construction of the bridge and understanding how the bascules work .
Nice landmark. Lovely place and London landmark. You must check in. You should stay until the evening. Don't forget this is Tower Bridge not London Bridge.
Take a boat!. Take a boat ride on the Thames to get a great view. Tower of London is right there. You can see both on the same day!

One of my favorite places in London!. This is a do not miss, steeped with history, you will can easily spend the day here! We loved it, but careful not to miss any parts and to visit the Crown Jewels.

Iconic. Although it's iconic, it's over in 10 mins. Great views and the tower of London isn't too far. You'll be better off adding Tower of London on the same day. And remember, kids are free on the tube/trains.
Greaaaat!. What to say... it's a stop that everyone should do! Lovely beautiful just great.. no matter the weather
Awesome looking bridge!. Although we didn't go inside we took the hop on hop off bus and drove through it. We also took a river cruise and past under it!! It is great to see on the water!!

Absolutely Stunning!!!!. We walked from our hotel to here and I can say, it's worth the walk.
The bridge is spectacular to see, it's huge, pretty and so many tourists. You can walk along the river bank and take some spectacular photos.
Also on the other side of the river is a lovely castle too💜

London Bridge and London Tower. Had a great time here, London Bridge is impressive, we crossed the bridge walking and took the self guided tour of the London Tower. The London Tower tour was fantastic, specially the Beefeaters are supper funny. Highly recommend seeing this piece of history.

Excellent visit.. Visited this last week with my wife and two kids aged 7 & 8. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed it and we're amazed to watch the bridge open up to allow the boats through. We used tesco clubcard vouchers to gain access to the glass walkway and the engine room which we all loved. Would recommend this to anyone visiting London.

So cool!. My partner and I went through the engine room ad through the tower itself.
It was so interesting, took about an hour for us to go through the whole exhibit, but was worth the £9 per person.
Good history and we got to the bridge rise from the glass walkway as well as from the bridge itself.

Beautiful with great views of old and new. A must do. We stumbled upon a street performance at festival in s park at the end of the bridge on a beautiful day. Don't miss the market - crowded but cool.

Great tour -- can be short or long depending upon your interest.. Loved the tour of the Tower Bridge - the only reason I didn't give it a "5" was the crazy mob at the entrance. There was no real rhyme nor reason in getting in and getting your pre-paid ticket. The tour itself was excellent (self-guided) and the view is awesome. I also loved the glass floor over the bridge below. We skipped the engine room so I can't talk about that, but we enjoyed all the info on the building of the bridge, etc.

Best angle for photo shoot. At the north east bank of the bridge just next to the Thames River, little eateries open at lunch hour to serve wood fired pizzas, ice cream and cold beers. If you can find a seat there to eat, sip beer and relax, enjoy the view of the Tower Bridge. I think this angle offers the nicest angle to capture the magnificence of the structure.

Very iconic!!. Just walking across the bridge you feel very nostalgic. You definitely have a great view of the Tower. The history of the bridge is very interesting stop and read all the info. Be sure to go down below to the water that is where they used to dump the bodies from the Tower. You can't go to London without walking across this bridge.

Architectural Beauty. This was one of my favorite stops in London. There is a very large park nearby that you enter to view and approach the bridge, and expect there to be a tremendous amount of foot traffic in this area. Think San Francisco Bay Bridge on a smaller scale, but just as busy with cars and pedestrians.

Bridge 5 Stars. Exhibition 3 Stars.. The Tower Bridge is a London Icon. See it and you will take a photo. You will take tons of photos. You can walk across it at road level for free. If you take a Thames River cruise, you can travel under it. So, what does the Tower Bridge Exhibition buy you for £9?Well...Mainly, it's the high-level walkways with the glass floors. You do get to see the old steam engines and an explanation on how the bridge works. But, mainly it's the glass floors in the walkways. They have mirrors on the ceilings of the walkways so you can lie down on glass floors and take photos. The views from the walkways are spectacular as well. But, is it worth £9? No.But, no one pays £9.If you visit the Tower of London using the London Pass, it's almost automatic to go to the Exhibition (which is included) and probably HMS Belfast and/or the tour of the Globe Theatre. National Rail 2FOR1 also has an offer for the Exhibition. Even the Exhibition's own website has advanced tickets for £8 with discounts for Families, Seniors and joint tickets for The Monument and can be purchased as eTickets via your smartphone. There are probably other offers out there as well. The point is don't pay £9.
Beautiful . Very nice beautiful Old Bridge. Often mistaken to be the London Bridge. Walked over it a couple of times while I was staying here by. Definitely an attraction to get your photo taken by.

Nice tour of famous landmark. The Tower Bridge Experience is too slick to be extremely educational, but is interesting nonetheless. The high walkways with the glass floors are the most enjoyable part of the tour, though the whole structure is impressive and a pleasure to see up close.
Unusual and pretty. We say this bridge from a number of views and on numerous days during our week in London. Once we even got to see the draw bridge up.

Splendidly iconic. There's no other bridge like Tower Bridge. For starters, how many blue bridges are there in the world? (There should be more of them). It's a splendid sight, day or night (and may trigger poetic urges!). Fabulous.
Tower Bridge Review . Very good place and the glass floor was very cool. Would definitely recommend. Lifts are available. Good view of London.
Beautiful Bridge to See While Taking a Boat Tour. I took a river boat tour down the River Thames and was able to go under and see this famous icon. It is a very interesting looking bridge to be sure.
Beautiful!. One of the most beautiful bridges I've ever laid eyes upon, awesome for pictures and a must walk under and past!

Fabulous view. Not being a fan of heights I didn't much like the glass part of the walkway but we were lucky to catch the bridge being opened while we were up there and got a fabulous view from directly above. Worth noting that the only loos are in the far tower right at the bottom of the stairs, on the way to the engine house exhibition and shop which are in a seperate building. It's worth a brief visit.
Walked across... but in the ened - a bridge. It is a cool bridge though, but not too much of a great experience in my opinion. including the inside. The tower of Londong is far better and enough
Regal. A beautiful bridge with much history! Being here provided a great photo opportunity of regal British architecture.
Must Visit place. Place to visit. If you are in London and You missed visiting this place then you have not seen London Your trip to London was not worth.

Beautiful. Tower bridge, fantastic day and night.
Even late at nights its still bustling with people, locals and tourists alike.
Would highly recommend checking bridge lift times whilst there and trying to see one.

Amazing Views from Tower Bridge. Great family trip - for two adults and three teenagers - amazing photo opportunities - look through the glass floors - lucky to be present when bridge fully opened to let very tall warship pass. Interesting bridge exhibition. Option of lift or stairs. Free wi-fi so kids can post their snapchat stories instantly. If you travel by train please ensure you pick up and use the two for price of one London attractions leaflet which will save you a fortune.
Grandchildren visit. Very good for all family. Not too expensive. Lift available to top of gallery. Views from top good. Glass floor an experience, good!

Nice walk over glass. In the tower you see an exhibit of special bridges over the world. There is also a glas floor so you can walk over and see the thames. After that you can see the engine rooms. I missed a kind of maquette to see the working of the bridge. This could be made with steam..... Also 9 pound is a reassonable price.

Need to go up and walk the "glass-floor walk"-ticket required. Again, book early and save yourself waiting in the queue. Even with tickets, if the crowd is huge, you will still need to queue up and wait as they control the total number of tourists inside the Tower Bridge. When walking the glass floor, don't forget to look out to the London skyline on both sides. There are a few "little" openings for you to take photos without shooting it through the glass windows. Apart from walking the glass floor, the pump room is probably worthy of a look if you are into engineering operating system. Another suggestion is to group Tower Bridge and Tower Of London together on a single day, and possibly squeeze in Borough Market. Highly recommend to visitors of London.

Better things to see. Think I might be difficult to please but a bridge is a bridge. If limited on time I would give this the swerve. You can get a view of most if the bridges from other parts of the city and to be honest unless your paying the extra money for tours etc I think they all look mire impressive from a distance
It's a bridge. Its a bridge over the Thames. We walked across it. There's a footpath. Was there anything else I should have noticed??

A London Must. The Tower Bridge is a London landmark that deserves a visit. I have been there twice on two separate trips within the past year. I went with my brother last year and we were lucky enough to see the bridge open up. This year I went with my boyfriend and we saw the bridge at night. It is so beautiful to see and worth the walk across and around it. I have not gone inside, but anyone I know that has, did enjoy the glass floor attraction.
Amazing. It is the tower bridge it is super amazing! It is so beautiful, for me it's the most beautiful bridge London has to offer you
Wonderful time!. I love this bridge! that's mix of history and modernity. Fun expirience with glass floor. Nice view. You can see the river and traffic. Recommend!

Directly from the English Language study book. Who of you do not remember the picture of Tower Bridge on the cover of your English language study book? So, yes, it looks the same - iconic and beautiful, and of course it's a big MUST to visit! Best to do it while you are visiting the Tower of London, as it's time efficient!

Iconic London Attraction. Do visit the tower bridge and take a walk across the river Thames to enjoy beautiful views, lots of tourists and many activities happening around you. The bridge also opens to let bigger boats pass, do not miss it.
Best part of London. The most iconic sight in london, it's brilliant to walk across but it is actually better to walk across another adjacent bridge to look onto Tower Bridge itself

What an experience. This is a popular attraction in London but is very efficiently organised, we joined a queue & were up the viewing Tower in 10-15 minutes.Some interesting facts & information are available, & whilst the views East & West from the top are incredible the highlight of the Tour is to walk on the section of glass floor, just made for the Selfie & Group photo !All ages will enjoy this attraction.
another great things to do with kids.. My kids loved to see how the bridge works. the deck were the glass is, totally amazing. Make sure to go to the engine rooms to get the full idea
Nice. Is a London markVery beautiful and huge structureLovely surroundings and huge contrast with the futuristic buildings all around it

The glass bridge is awesome. Make sure and pay the money to go to the top! You can stand over the glass and look down at the bridge open. It's great for kids. There was fun information to read at the top as well!

The glass bridge is awesome. Make sure and pay the money to go to the top! You can stand over the glass and look down at the bridge open. It's great for kids. There was fun information to read at the top as well!
Beautiful. Try to be there for a "lift". Traffic may be brought to a standstill, but it's a pedestrian's delight. Try to record the start up at the end of the lift. Le Mans on Tower Bridge.

tower bridge experience. This is a must , where you must walk up the inside of the bridge and not take the lift as it gives an insight into the build of the bridge and then when you cross the top of the structure you come across the glass floor revealing the road beneath, awesome views.

Tower bridge. A very enjoyable experience! Really interesting and impressive place. Nice informative plaques and monitors. Take the obligatory selfie of your feet on the glass door. 42 meters above the road and Thames.
Don't forget to visit the engine room as it is really outstanding.
Go early, it gets ridiculously busy and it's no fun with a big crowd
Iconic London. The Bridge is commanding! It's so iconic London you certainly should visit. we took several pictures here it is a very pretty background for a vacation photo.

Α must visit. I think the best place in London....So big and beutyful...Take a walk across the river.
Get on the tower bridge website, and find out when the bridge is going to be opening

Beautiful. Very nice to see!
also, when boats are coming, it's nice to see how it opens and closes again!
At night it's al covered with lights, which makes it stunning to look at!

Favourite London icon!. If you're in London for a few days then visiting Tower Bridge should definitley be on your to do list. Whether it's a rainy day or (rarely) sunny, the bridge always looks imposing and impressive. Lots of history associated with the bridge and can even do a glass floor walk across for just under £10. Added bonus is the Borough markets are only a 5 minute walk away...

Great to place to visit for the price.. Really enjoyed our visit to the top of Tower Bridge. We took the lift up and went across the top of the bridge on the glass walkways which you can then see down on the road below and the water. We then visited the engine rooms and saw how they bridge is raised. Really great place to visit and the kids really enjoyed it too. Butlers Wharf nearby is also great for lunch and a wander around after.
Great. The chance to see the inside of this iconic landmark and the new glass floor so you can see the bridge and river below you

You cannot visit London and not visit. We were lucky enough to see a bridge lift, which was fab. The tour is short enough and can be done in under an hour. A nice attraction if you looking to kill an hour or so. There is an indoor sky walk when crossing over the top of the bridge which is not for the faint hearted.
Iconic London Site. You have to visit Tower Bridge when in London, whether you walk up it, take a bus tour over it or a boat under it.

Definitely worth a visit!. If you don't want to pay to go into the tower, check out the times the bridge is going to open to allow larger boats to pass under and find a vantage spot on the embankment to watch the bridge open and close; it's quite impressive. A visit to the higher level is definitely worthwhile for the views of the Thames and the chance to stand on the glass floor. Ticket price includes entry to the engine rooms which are very interesting.

Glass floor is good fun. Went around 3.30 with pre booked tickets and got in within 15 mins. A nice attraction but the glass floor makes it. I got this attraction for a cheap price as I bought a combination ticket for other attractions. It was interesting and the children 8 and 10 enjoyed it.
Impressive. This bridge is really well maintained and picture is amazing. REally there are no words to describe how beautiful is this monument (if we can say is a monument)

It's just a bridge. I visited the bridge recently when in London and I guess from a tourist point of view, crossing the Tower Bridge is something everyone does when in London. Nothing else to say really, it's just a bridge, albeit a very famous one. When in London and out exploring, cross the bridge just to say you have done it.
A MUST. Take a walk across and take in the size of this spectacular bridge. You can go to a small outdoor pub just below the bridge and get some awesome pics of the WHOLE bridge.

Lots of fun. I saw an advert and as I had time to spare in London I decided tower bridge was a good idea! I wasn't wrong. Lots of interesting facts and pictures and being able to lie down on the glass floor was fun!
A must visit.. Do not miss this wonderful icon. It is steeped in history. I have visited countless times and am always impressed. Best to visit weekdays and away from holiday times if you can.

Fings ain't what they used to be, but good for selfies. We were looking forward to a return to the Tower Bridge Exhibition, but perhaps the crowds of visitors militated against a better experience. The videos were useful and in many languages, but it just wasn't as engaging as in the past. The Engine Room was interesting, but some of the limited 'hands on' items need repairing. The glass walkway was, however, literally the highlight of the whole experience.

Fun!. My young daughter is not normally into bridges. But if you can go to the top level of it and look down at the tiny little ships going under the bridge beneath you through a scary glass floor it changes everything. This is the one bridge that young ladies would enjoy visiting as much as adults. Bring your young children (male or female) there! It's a fun way to spend 30 minutes.
Over It & Under It!!. Be sure to experience the bridge from the river and by foot. It's a different perspective and always a thrill to come back again. Beautiful!
We could have spent longer here!. Totally interesting with great views! The engine rooms were very interesting, and had good information panels.
Beautifully designed. What a structure its beautifully deigned, so many people come from far & wide to walk across this bridge just to stand on this structure look across London breathe taking

A compulsory London icon. There really isnt much new to say about this amazing icon..........except, maybe, I can share what I do with overseas visitors who have not seen it yet.First, I get on the tower bridge website, and find out when the bridge is going to be opening.Then, approach on foot, round the back of St Katherines docs. They will have no idea what is coming next.... At the very last corner, you turn, and there is Tower Bridge right in in front of you.This will be breathtaking enough, but if you have timed your visit well, your visitors will see the lights flashing, horns blaring, traffic stopping, and the 2 awesome sections lifting majestically into the air.I live here, and have done this many times, and it still takes my breath away.Enjoy!(of course, there are specific attractions on and up the bridge, but someone else can review them!)

Enjoyable. We chose this tour as it had short queues and was a reasonable price compared to most in London. We had two for one tickets which you can get with a valid train ticket and a brochure from the station for the same day and the little one was free so only £9 for the family -excellent value for money. Lots of stairs but there is a lift if you fancy. An interesting and informative tour with nice views and a fun glass floor for the brave. Also interesting seeing the engine room for the bridge.

Tower Bridge Experience is FUN!. I had read other reviews, and they were less than stellar. I really loved learning about this iconic bridge and walking on that see-through walkway! The worker up there was nice to hold my hand as I was somewhat scared! It was so cute to see an elementary school class cautiously walk across it too. This is part of the London Pass, and I loved that it was a Fast Track! Great thing to do, and you cannot beat the view!
Another must see. Being able to view places you have learned about in history, helps to put things into perspective. Glad to have had this experince.

Brilliant!. Iconic feature of London, historical interest, fascinating explanations of the workings of the bridge itself, amazing and unique views of the river Thames from the upper level. Any visitor should include this in their itinerary, and London / UK residents should also go. The entertainment rooms upstairs can be hired for events too.
Take a boat ride for the best view.. Nice tie in with the Tower tour! Take the boat ride back down the river. A fun full day of London!!!

Another London landmark!. If visiting London, this another must see sight! Experience walking across the most famous lifting bridge. Excellent location for photos down the Thames of Tower of London and The Shard.

The famous London bridge.. Well London bridge is not falling down this time. It is historical and worth a visit. The tour takes you to the upper chamber and bridge where you can look down from the transparent glass. I would recommend getting a "London Pass" if you plan to visit lots of tourist sites. It guarantees you less waiting time and less price.

Worth a visit. £9 for an adult but worth every penny. Very interesting and lots to read, see and experience the glass walkways......but not if you don't like heights. Lift accessibility.. so OK for buggies and disabled. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
Great. I love Tower Bridge which is steeped in history and right next to the Tower of London. The glass platform looks scary so I would avoid if you hate heights.

How can you not!. How can you not visit tower bridge when in London.
It's surreal to be there.
Get the camera out and start snapping you won't be dissapointed...
Icon of London. Show anyone a picture of this icon, and they will recognize the city and the landmark, it doesn't dissapoint at all

A must to visit. This place is gorgeous, Highly recommended if your in london must visit, worth to visit. beautiful architecture design, over view the london towers, very relaxing while enjoying the view..Good for family bonding & friends!
one of the landmarks. during my last visit to London, i spent hours enjoying the beauty of the site. i crossed the place many times that day and enjoyed te view from over the bridge as well.

Amazing. We were staying in the Tower Hotel and it was just amazing to be lucky enough to witness the Tower Bridge opening and hear the boats honking etc....the bridge is such a beautiful picturesque structure and at night when all lit up it is really worth seeing...We added to the excitement by also going on a bus tour which took us over the bridge..i eould say its a must see in London.
Fun day. Great quality arcitecture and a fun experience to see the view and have as part of a day out. Every one is sure to enjoy
London weekend. My coworker and my hotel was at the Tower Hill exit so we had to walk by the bridge to get to our hotel. My friend said she had to touch it so we did. :)

Really cool. Just walk over it! It's worth seeing! It's free to go.. It was great :) don't miss it. Very touristy place but it only takes 10 minutes to walk it. It's also nice to see it from the London bridge which is right next to it.

Another Wonderful London Experience!. A trip to London would not be complete without a walk across Tower Bridge, looking at the Tower of London from a different angle, and enjoying the ships traveling the Thames. There is a nice museum on the end of Tower Bridge which we visited 4 years ago but did not revisit on this trip due to time constraints, but which is well worth seeing.

Bus 42 or 78 from Liverpool street will cross the bridge. To get here go to Tower Hill station and walk past the Tower of London..or..London BridgeOne of the most picturesque landmarkes in london the opulent bridge with drawbridge that opens more rarely than frequently is purely iconic..with the high price for acecss to the engine room
Great experience. Great experience! The views are stunning, the museum is very attractive: you got to go up on the glass floor, it's fabulous! 5* experience!

Good . It's good around this area as there plenty to do, nice walk across the bridge or something nice to eat.theres people always selling roasted nuts so if u want some always knock them down in price. Always works.

Classic London site. Check online before you go for bridge raising times as seeing that adds a lot to the visit. We were able to see the tall ships that had just finished an around the world race go through the drawbridge making for a unique experience. For those with no fear of heights the glass walkway may be quite a view, but I didn't do the tour.
Must see. A must see when in London. Just walk it and be in awe of surrounds. Free access easy walk despite a good few steps to the street level. Plenty of great photo opportunities

No wonder the Americans wanted to buy it. I take Tower Bridge for granted as a cut through to the station from the South Bank. Lively, worldwide landmark with stunning views. Floodlit at night time just to show off how handsome the architecture is. No wonder the Americans were do disappointed when London Bridge arrived & they thought they'd bought Tower Bridge.

Fantastic bridge in gorgeous surroundings. Would have never thought to come to this area but so glad we did.We had gone to london bridge and was just going to take a photo of tower bridge from the banks.So glad we walked over it and around the twee shops, apartments at tower hill. We could so live in this area.A not to be missed spot!!

Tower Bridge Tour better than it sounds!. We took this tour when our daughter came to visit us. We are in England temporarily. I thought it would be a yawner but it was great. You walk above bridge on the 2 cross pieces. There is thick glass in the floors so you can see the bridge and river right beneath your feet. The kids love it. Along the way there is both history of the bridge in large pictorials and explanations of its erection in English. Also, there are large pictorials all along the tour of famous bridges around the world. Then you descend to street level and into the engine room. For us engine people it's very cool. It also explains how the bridge raising works and the engines. There are activities to teach the kids this concept. All around a very interesting and fun tour.

Good but not amazing. The iconic tower bridge felt like a thing we "had" to do. We used our Tesco clubcard vouchers with no problems. The visit itself was mildly interesting but the star of the show is the glass floor. I really enjoyed this part- the view was great, plus the views from the little diamond Windows is great but as they are small it feels the view is somewhat restricted. It's fun to look down at the people and traffic and river (they can't see up at you very clearly though- I checked) There is some historical information and video screens but it just felt a little lacking. It was just not massively interesting. Perhaps we are overstimulated these days but I would not go back again. The staff were nice but the attraction itself was just not enough.

Great bit of history. Visited Tower Bridge with some US visitor something, and we all found it really interesting. Look at the website for planned tI message for the bridge to open for an extra impressive view. Views across London are OK, but better from the Sky Garden. The view down through the glass floor is awesome, as are the engine rooms. Well worth a visit.

Back again for a worthwhile visit. It is some time since we last visited this site and it has not lost its charm. A beautiful historic bridge across the River Thames, taking you to another iconic landmark in this ancient city, the Tower of London, with its bloody history.

Amazing experience. It's worth paying that extra buck to go to the top of tower bridge,not for the view ,but for the fu experience which u get while walking in the glass floor. I was honestly scared,,but amazing pics,,,, just loved it. Also the machine room is nice. We had it as a part of london pass and it's worth it.

London Icon. Built in late nineteenth century this iconic bridge connects both sides of London on River Thames near Tower of London. The unique feature of this bridge is the opening mid section that allowed taller vessels to pass under the bridge. There are two towers on both sides with walkways for pedestrians.

Interesting expirience. It was interesting expirience. There is glass floor, so you can watch the road and river. Great view of the Thames and London. It's functional bridge, located next to Tower of London
Visit to an iconic venue . Many years have past since our last visit to this venue. Obviously things don't really change but great to be back. Well worth a visit.

Very interesting!. This is a well organised and interesting tour. You go up in a lift in a group but once up the tower you walk around at your own pace. There are information boards along the walkways with concise interesting information. No overload. The views are stunning, so photo opportunities abound. There is a glass panel in each walkway for you to stand on and photograph the traffic and Thames below. One of them has a mirror on the ceiling which gives a most unusual shot of traffic, Thames and yourself.
