You then visit the engine room which shows the engines and pumps, A most reasonable tour lasting about an hour and half to two hours.
Great day. Had a great day loved walking across the glass platform, lots of fun. Not keen on the stairs though. Great view when you get to the top

Disappointing. Went to the tower bridge exhibition for the glass floor, which is pretty small and disappointing. Exit lift system needs sorting out, wasn't particularly busy and waited a long time with group visitors being let out in a crowd of people, maybe just a rope up to separate the crowds.

It's not the London bridge!. It's one of the famous bridges in London and is located across the River Thames. On top, one can see the spectacular and stunning London views, sadly it's not free as there is an entrancee fee.

Loved this visit. I've been over it and under it but this time it was up the tower and over the top. It's not like the Sydney harbour bridge where you harness up for the climb but it's still pretty cool. We were blessed by being up on the glass walkway right at the time when they were clearing the bridge for it to raise and let a paddle steamer go under. Looking down at the swiftness of the bridge pedestrian evacuation was impressive and watching the roadway being raised was great. The final part of the tour was down to the engine room to view the original boilers and engines that were used to raise the bridge before electricity came along. It wasn't only the views from the top that impressed us. The entire tour was extremely well done.

Must see. The iconic Bridge is in every portrayal of London. You must see it at least once. Interesting history of its construction. When you walk across the top, the glass floor will either give you vertigo or scare you. Watch the short film on the Bridge construction.
Worth the steps to the top. Great opportunity to see the sights and interesting to hear all about the engineering.Even though you know the glass floor is safe, its still scary!

Skip this one. I was disappointed in this attraction. The only thing worth seeing are the crown jewels which are interesting but only take a few minutes. Evidently, much of the structure was repeatedly altered over the years so it was hard to tell what might have truly been original. I guess my biggest turnoff was listening to the Yeoman Warder's presentation about Ann Bolyn's beheading. He was cracking jokes which felt very disrespectful. The site was a place of much cruelty and selfish manipulation by those seeking power and turning it into a Disney-like attraction doesn't seem appropriate.

Great views. Informative visit here, using the 2-4-1 vouchers, kids got a bit bored after a while but loved it when the bridge went up to let two boats through. A great piece of London history but more for older kids and adults
Interesting and Fun experience. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit. It did not take long but was interesting and the Glass floor experience was fun. Would recommend for families as it is reasonably priced.
London's great. Both locals and tourists alike always look at this bridge and go whow. It is a little part of London that will never age

Incredible views.... I done tower bridge along with the monument as they had an offer on.Tower bridge is very easy to get to and located right next to the tower of London.I spent a good few hours here looking around and taking in the views of the rest of London and the river thames.I would come here again as I had a great time.
visit. went there last week and booked a walk over the bridge, the view was amazing , and I was lucky enough to see the bridge opening, well recommended.
Great architecture, easily THE best bridge in London. Beautiful and iconic bridge. A bridge well worth traveling to walk across it. Great views of the Thames and London city.
Loved it do it again . Loved it so great loved the tour great sights and so much to info to take it. Great for all ages and easy because of the lift.!!!

What a View!. This is a great exhibit with interesting facts about the Bridge, and a wonderful view from up top. There's even a plexiglass floor in part of the walkway so you can watch the boats and traffic. It's even better if you happen to be up there when the bridge opens! A very good value for the money - much better than going up the Shard, a WAY more history!

Another iconic photo opportunity. We were too late for the tour, however being so late, and a dull evening, presented me with the chance to capture some very dark and eerie photos of the bridge. I would return for the tour having read the reviews here.
Very interesting view. I enjoyed to walk on the glass floor. Very interesting view to the road and river. Nice people work there.

Cheap and relatively enjoyable. The tickets are cheap. There is more to do than expected. The top of the tower has two glass floors weew if you time it right you will get to see the bridge lift. You get to go down to see the engine walk which means coming out of the bridge and a two minute walk.
after this try St. Kat's Dock for refreshments. plenty to see here, not on the busy tourist route, lots of souvenirs to be had and a stone throw to St. Kats Dock for restaurants and refreshments
Saw the opening. Was awet day but was happy to See the bridge open for a tall ship great to,think that it still can stop traffic literally

I also think a "must go". There is a great view to the city. I personally like such views over a city and on top of the bridge you will have it.The exhibition was for me not so interesting.The (new) glass is also an interesting way of getting aware of the height :-)On top there are small window where you can take good pictures (not through glass).The engine room is for me not as impressive as it is announced. Surely a great technical achievement, but unless you are really into this matter you can skip it - on the other hand its not more than 5 minutes to check out, so it does not harm either to go there.

STUNNING VIEWS OF LONDON (& Wait to see it open & close!). The views from Tower Bridge are absolutely stunning!! A must visit if you are in London!! And something that is completely FREE! As it is a public bridge.And if you have time, be sure to wait to see the bascules open and close (bascules are the parts of the bridge that lift on both sides). It takes about 2 & a half minutes to open and close and it's a majestic sight!You can find the opening and closing times of the bridge on the Towerbridge website. Enjoy!!

Interesting to see. It was quite interesting, though bit short, tour. You will get a chance to see a short film on how the bridge was built and how London looked a century or so ago. For the brave ones, there is a glass walkway on the top which is quite cool. The engine room is also interesting.

Iconic structure. What an amazing treat to walk ont he Tower Bridge. Even more special after going to the Borough market and heading to the Tower of London. Watch for the gypsies doing card tricks on the side of the road and the hustle bustle...
Add to your list of must do. Amazing to walk through this and be transported back in time. So much history and enjoyed by all age groups. Well worth the visit.

This is London . Hi I think the tower bridge is the most important attraction in London Do not miss it Visit it when it's going to open Go up stairs to see the view of London Go down stairs to see the engine of the bridge I really enjoyed London

Incredible views of the Thames. It's worth the trip up to the walkways to see the incredible views of the Thames. The weirdest thing is the clear walkway panels that make it feel like you stepped off the edge of the bridge. The exhibition of the workings of the Tower is very interesting and well presented. If you time it right, you can be on the glass walkway when the bridge is lifted.

The most renowned spot in London. It's undoubtedly it is the most important tourist spot in London. The shots in both the morning and evening are equally stunning. Don't mix it up with the London Bridge anymore folks! LOL

Glass Bottom Skywalk Experience . At $12 GBP, This is one of the lower cost tourist attractions in the city, and gives you a unique sense of floating high above the bridge traffic below. The tour begins with a lift to the top of the 1st tower where you can watch a video about the history of Tower Bridge. Then walk across the sky walkways and enjoy great views of the London skyline as well as the glass bottom sections. You'll also see pictures and info on other famous bridges found around the world. Can't get enough Tower Bridge knowledge? Then find a spot to sit (or most likely stand) in tower 2 and enjoy another video that describes in great detail how the bridge was constructed. Once your learning center is full, head down the stairs and outside tower 2 following the marked path to the Tower Bridge Engine Room. These things are both massive and impressive to see. Once you've got your pictures, exit through the gift shop. #Tabestravels TOP TIP: The WC in the engine room is nice and clean. Should nature call, this is as good a place as any to answer.
Bit of History. It's a nice place for picnic by Thames river. The bridge itself is not clean. Wish it is better maintained.

You must walk this. Lovely walk with constant picture opportunities. The view of the bridge while crossing, the views from the bridge, experiencing the beauty of the technology of this masterpiece, then getting the oppurtunity to snap a picture of the big red bus passing under one of the arches. Be a tourist on this one!! There is an option to do the "Bridge Experience" which gives you an insiders look at how the drawbridge works too (requires a ticket purchase)

Spectacular view, nice exhibition and a little bit scary glass floor. We went all the family: young kid and teenagers. The family ticket is 22.5 pounds for the family of 5. At the beginning we took the lift, but could do the stairs - less time, more fun, not a hard climb. The view from the top is stunning, you see the Shard, the City Hall, the Gherkin. There are special windows for taking photos. There is also a short movie about the bridge construction. In the middle of both passes, that is a glass floor, and you see the downwalk and the Thames river from 44 meters high. For me it was pretty scarring, but my children loved it a lot. There is also nice exhibition about bridges all over the world.

Great walk, great view. We walked across Tower Bridge during a sightseeing day in London. It was a lovely walk from one end to the other. It wasn't super busy due to the rain that day, but it was a great place to take pictures and the views from the bridge were spectacular. There is a tour offered for the top part of the bridge, where you can look down from the walkway. Regrettably we were unable to do this part, but it is on our bucket list!Great place to walk across and makes for great stories.

Fascinating - a real insight into late 19th century Britain and better value trip than most. Really good value as you get to see a lot for your money. Make sure to visit the engine rooms after the experience: they're very well explained and incredibly interesting.Another tip: look up when you are on the bridge not just down through the glass floor! It's especially useful if you like but can't take selfies ;)

Upper than my expectations!. At first I totally didn't want to visit the Tower Bridge thinking it was more like a touristic attraction and being part of a group I made it. It's actually not that bad, from up there you have a beautiful view and the exihibition are rather interesting. It's expensive but do you know anything cheap such as touristic place?!

Exploring London & beautiful views. This Tower Bridge lets you see wonderful views of London and see the Thames and the Tower from the water & 80 feet in theair! It is exciting to look down the glass floor and see the water. Worth walking up to see the view!
Not That Much. The Best thing that i see it is the Crown diamonds. the rest is great but i did not enjoy it. the items that used in their centuries is elegant.

Impressive. We did the inside tour because we had the London Pass and we're glad we did. Take the lift to the top and walk across both ways. Nice, different views and the glass floors are awesome. Make sure to snap some photos using the overhead mirrors at the glass walkways. The Engine Room was well preserved but not as much fun as the Bridge Towers. While we were there a large cruise ship came through so they had to open the spans, pretty cool. Definitely worth your time. Takes only about an hour. Not crowded when we visited

Great photo op of classic London. It's an iconic symbol of London and great photo op. The crowds are busy during the middle of the day and weekends but come early in the morning for great photos and less crowded streets. It's easy to get here on a bus or tube. We were lucky enough to see the drawbridge go up and if you want the best chance to see this (which is random luck) go around high tide when the large vessel go through.
Another must see. Always take our visitors to see with the other sights. Great photo opportunities. Good pics from the boat trips.
Well made bridge for transport /public.. It looks majestic. It is a must thing to do.Be it by foot.Or by boat.Or from a distance. Just enjoy.

Great Views. I was recommended by friends from London to make sure I got to the top of the bridge as the views were great and they weren't wrong it was great to get a view over the river and it felt like you were looking out more over old London with the London Eye being out of view as well the history of the bridge is very interesting and it's a great part of London's making and history! Glass floor makes for some fun photos and stories to tell people, worth a stop as you make your way around London.
Definitely too crowded. I pass by the bridge every single day of the week and I don't want to stop because of the people there, even if the view is nice, it's too much people for me.

A beautiful piece of history. Just walking over this bridge is awesome. I will do the tower bridge exhibition on one of my future london trips. It has such a sense of history and grandeur. Beautiful building.
Stand in line and wait, and wait........ Stood in line for at least 45mins and was in and out in 15mins. Once in it was ok. The best bit was the street food served near the Tower of London.
Exciting Event to behold the bridge opening. Amazing , as I was there when the tower Bridge opened . Hoards of tourist taking pics . I had some amazing pictures too . Well worth a visit .

Great views from the top. In addition to admiring this bridge from afar, you certainly want to see it up close. You get to go up to the top level and walk across. This includes a stop at the section of glass floor, which makes for interesting photos. Great views from atop the bridge. The entrance fee also lets you into the engine room which you should not skip.
Mr Wright. We used our london pass to enter..Not really that much to do but it was worth a walk round.Once u have seen u wouldnt do it again

Walk across for great views!. After visiting the Tower we walked across the bridge. Great photo opps and the views are amazing! The walk along the Thames on the other side was pleasant on a hot summer day.
Walked over and back. Got off the city cruise and walked over the bridge and back again.. beautiful day.. lots of people.. gorgeous views from the bridge.

Very iconic structure, glass floors. I did not know until arriving in London that you could climb the Tower Bridge (the bridge that is erroneously referred to as "London Bridge" as in nursery rhyme). It is right beside the Tower of London, so you can do it right after your tour to the Tower of London.You can go to the top of the bridge through an elevator. The entrance and ticket booths are located on the right sidewalk, if you move from Tower of London to the other side of the Thames. We will have nice views of the Thames and the glass floors, although I don't think they feel that scary looking down.Regardless, I think it is nice to cross the bridge on foot, even if you are not doing/paying to climb the upper bridge.

See Early Morning. Best to be on a bus that drives across the bridge and being on top deck allows for some spectacular picture. By lunch there are hundreds of people all over the bridge so navigating the crowds can be challenging. Worth the visit.

Worthwile. Been to London several times, first time visit to Tower bridge. We booked our tickets online . You have to pick your day, but can go at any time. You get great views on a clear day. You can walk up the steps[if you are fit], however there is a lift. There where no crowds when we went so we could take our time. The glass floor is a must and makes for some interesting photo ops. You have to go.

Lovely bridge. Lovely bridge to cross the Thames. There is paid tour to climb up and see the bridge from above as well. You can see the motor house which controls the drawbridge. Enjoyable piece of history. Much recommended to visit.

Great but don't bother buying tickets in advance!. As I was visiting with my 2 young children I bought our tickets in advance to avoid long queues. Sadly this didn't work as even if you have a ticket in advance you still have to stand in the same queue as people who don't have tickets so that you can exchange your ticket for another ticket! Possibly the most ridiculous and annoying system I've ever encountered! Even the member of staff who gave us our 'proper' ticket said he would be annoyed and he can't understand why they do it that way...That said the kids loved the experience and we were really lucky to see the bridge lift through the glass floor.Highly recommended, just wish they would sort the ticket system!
Loved this . What an amazing sight. Was great to do. Loved the glass walkway. Was at a leisurely pace. Got there at opening time. Hardly any waiting. Very friendly polite staff. Great day.

A Famous Sight From Many Angles. By far, it is best to walk across the bridge to see its details and appreciate its size. But it is also a great sight from many places in London, the Eye, the Tower do London, and the Thames. Make sure to look in its direction as you visit the city to appreciate this iconic bridge.

A remarkable construction!. This is not only a major London landmark but also an engineering feat designed and built at the time when the Thames river was a busy thoroughfare. Go inside to see the mechanisms which make it work!

Worth the ticket price for the view. When you enter the Tower Bridge Experience your shuttled into a lift and taken up to the top of the bridge. You're then free to explore the bridge and take pictures on the glass floor that overlooks the road below.Unless you like reading plagues, the attraction does loose your interest quite quickly. Perhaps more interactive exhibits could be installed to eradicate this issue?Overall, it's worth the ticket price if you book in advance as you get stunning views of the London skyline.

Superb views and fascinating trip.. Tower Bridge is one of the most famous bridges, and a trip to this historic landmark is well worth it.We had a 2 for 1 ticket from our local rail company which reduced the price.Queuing to get into the attraction is a tight squeeze, but once inside there is a choice of climbing the steps or going in the lift. We opted for the stairs (not too many of them), and saw plenty of exhibits along the way.You can walk along the platform where halfway across is a glass floor - the views onto the road and river are amazing. Well worth a visit!
Iconic . Selfie central as everyone tries to get the familiar shape of this beautiful London landmark into their photos

Amazing view. Another iconic landmark of London. It is not enough if you just walk from O end to the other. You have to see the bridge open in the evening to let the sail ship pass through. We were on the Thames Rivet cruise on our way back to Westminster station and we had this great opportunity to watch the bridge open and close from the top deck of the boat. I have no words to describe it.

nothing beats this especially whenthe Bridge is open. as a Londoner I am proud of the place and love the view strolling from one side of the river to the other.. All the better if it is timed with a boat passing through and the bridge opening.I recall many a year ago when the bridge opened at 12 midnight and I was in a Taxi . We enjoyed getting out and wishing the other well wishers good new year. The towers are spectacular and s were the Poppies.. a stroll around the gardens under the bridge by the tower entrance is always a way to escape the bustle
The glass walkway is awesome!. Its a great attraction for families. My son really enjoyed the glass walkway and the informational videos.

A beautiful walk, great views!. Tower Bridge is what everyone is expecting when they think of the 'London Bridge' children's rhyme. It is majestic and well-maintained, and easy to walk across. You're separated from traffic, so kids can walk across safely, and it's wide enough for wheelchairs. If you time it right, you can watch the sun set from the center of the span. Absolutely gorgeous and free!

Always worth a visit. Probably the most beautiful bridge in London.Not only amazing on the outside, but well worth a visit inside the towers. When you go upstairs you will find 2 runways connecting the two towers. These runways both contain transparent passages around the middle, so you get a nice view of the river and the bridge downstairs. The engine rooms are interesting as well. And make sure you visit in the summer, as it opens several times a day during the summer, but does not open in the winter. If you want to know the exact times it opens, you can ask at the Info desk of HMS Belfast, as they have this information and will tell you if you ask nicely. And the opening of the bridge is something that you definitely want to see. And maybe if you are really lucky you will see it open for a big cruise liner.

You know you're in London when you can see the Tower Bridge. Along with Big Ben, a classic London icon. Definitely worth a look as it’s in an interesting part of London, right near the Tower of London. Some good restaurants nearby along the waters edge that give a good view of the bridge.More interesting than Big Ben and Parliament House end of town.

Best Bridge ever built. You cannot visit London without walking across this icon and it's FREE!!The views are fabulous and we hit the jackpot a ship came through and they raised the bridge.By night catch a water taxi and go underneath.Don't miss it!

Nice view. I really enjoyed visiting Tower bridge. There is very nice view from upper part. Entrance fee is really worth it. Go there at nice day with clear air, if you have this possibility. Visit to old technology of the bridge is very exciting too.

Must see. Such a beautiful bridge on the Thames. Just can't miss seeing the lovely blue hues and passing bright red buses. Surrounding area is also pleasant for walking and sight-seeing. Highly recommend.

My Wife was not talking to me after this.. This exhibition was interesting and very factual. The walk from structure to structure was the highlight with the views of the city and the novel glass floor halfway over. But beware, if you are afraid of heights like my wife is, this may be not for you. It is perfectly safe and fully enclosed, but if you have that phobia, it means nothing. Unfortunately, we missed out on the engine room tour at the end, so I am unsure to comment on this. It was worth the visit if you have the London Pass, unsure if I would have paid for entry if it wasn't included.
Not London Bridge. You must walk across the bridge to get the full effect. Awesome sight when ships pass through. Much larger than expected.

Iconic landmark. This is one of many iconic landmarks in London, and is featured on many images of London. Next to the Tower of London on the north bank and City Hall on the south bank, the view is breathtaking. The road bridge opens when large vessels need to transit from the pool of London, Apart from using the bridge as a means of getting from one side of the river to the other, inside one of the towers is a museum where you can see the actual workings of the mechanisms that raise the road bridge. At one time you could go up the stairs of one tower and walk across the top bridge, then climb down the stairs on the other side....but I don't know if this is still possible, what with the crazy Health and Safety laws.

nice visit . We went here as part of a tour and it was a nice visit, a must see in london, it takes a while to walk around and see all the places around this area but it is a nice walk and you can find great spots for great photos, it is funand I reccomend the visit.

A great thing to do in London . This isn't one of the most exciting things to do in London but very interesting nonetheless. The best bit is probably watching the traffic down below as you peer through the glass floor. We were lucky enough to be there when the bridge opened. Apart from that, it's a museum and you can go round the old engines
Beautiful. Great and historical place to visit in a sunny day and have a bier near around. A must see in the English capital. Don't miss it! It's free

A really pleasant surprise!. This wasn't too expensive, relative to usual London attraction costs. No long queues when we went, and nicely laid out. Not too busy and friendly service. Just the right level of information - and something for all ages. Would be nice to have been able to visit the spaces under the bridge as part of the tour too - but I guess it's this country's sometimes overzealous health and safety laws that prevent this, rather than the attraction organisers. Well worth a visit and highly recommended!

A must see London attraction . A must see London attraction....typical tourist site, but very impressive and great to walk along and just take everything in your stride.....the area gets busy but no problems to navigate around the area can't go to London Town without stopping off here for a look....

Good thing to do while in London. There is a good climb up to the top of the tower to start and the first surprise is that you are in a metal structure not a brick one, but I guess I never gave it much thought. There is plenty to take in on the tour but the best bit is the view through the glass floor in the upper deck. There are one or two video pieces along the way which help bring you along. I think they will have to provide an audio guide to bring it to life. There is a visit to the engine room included but again they could make this much more interesting by having a video display explaining how it works. I think they are missing a few tricks but I'd still have to recommend it.

Interesting Feeling. The tower bridge experience is a great way to see the Thames River. We have walked over the bridge and sailed under it, but never walked so high above. It is a fun and not too lengthy excursion.

Beautiful bridge. This beautiful bridge is next to Tower of London. It is a great attraction. Sitting on the benches along the River Thames on a sunny afternoon and watching people and ships passing through is a memorable scene.
Very informative . We enjoyed reading all the invitation and most of all the views were fantastic. We will go again as it's not too full on.
Amazing. I think that Tower Bridge is amazing. If you walk in the middle of the night in this Bridge you can really appreciate the beautiful of the city.

Iconic place. One of the the most iconic places of UK, Its very refreshing to walk along the Thames river up to the tower bridge and on one side of the river, you can find a very flashy environment and place to relax. This is a great attraction for any tourist or anyone looking for a photo opportunity.The glass walkway is a sight worth seeing, if you're into history, there is a history of tower bridge section as well as a behind the scenes look at the engineering behind the tower.And also plenty of good photo ops throughout the tower.
The best part of London perhaps.... Iconic bridge. Always a thrill when it opens & a large vessel passes. Lunch at nearby Butlers Wharf Chop House gives the most amazing view.

An Iconic Landmark of London. Definitely do the tour of the Tower Bridge and hopefully its during one of the days the bridge lifts, unfortunately mine wasn't but it was still a really good tour.Walking across the glass floor was fantastic, seeing all the traffic under your feet and the interesting facts plotted throughout the tour.

superb view from glass floor. the day we went the weather was brilliant to catch the views from the bridge. we went as a family of four, my husband in a manual wheelchair, 10 year old autistic son also with adhd, and 9 year old son.whats brilliant is you get rewarded for pushing the wheelchair so I got in free as a carer, which seems to happen a lot in London. my husband was impressed with the staff when it came to helping my husband enjoy it while in a wheelchair. a particular entertaining member of staff who impressed us by being able to say blue line in several languages, he also had time to chat in a happy positive demeanour to my husband sorry forgot his name. it was all very interesting it captivated my autistic sons curiosity so he didn't play up which can be an embarrassing situation for us meaning we as a family could relax and enjoy our day. my boys loved lying on the glass floor you do feel a little nervous at first. only down side is when they raise the draw bridge members of the public would not let my husband see this happening, may be staff should make room for the disabled when this occurs may be more staff up their to marshal the crowds. when we bought the tickets the staff were very helpful even drawing on your visitors map to show us the way to the outdoor lift.
It was a great experience. We loved going up the Tower Bridge and walking on the glass floor and seeing the traffic below and the workings of the bridge.
Iconic experience. Well organized and informative experience with many photo opportunities along the way. Clever engineering that typified the glory days of the UK.
Better in real life. I had seen this iconic bridge many times on TV but the real thing is magnificent. Absolutely a must see

Thames River Trip. Took a Thames River Trip to see Tower Bridge and we weren't disappointed. Quite spectacular views and observed the bridge opening to allow a tall ship through. Great way to see this wonderful bridge.

One of the historical places to see. Tower Bridge is beautiful by night when the lights are lit and equally beautiful in the day time. Great photo opportunities and a great place to take a stroll going back in time with beautiful architecture all around
Beautiful attraction!. We loved sitting on the benches nearby and enjoying the views. It's right there by London Tower with great restaurants and food trucks!

how to get a good picture of the bridge. Firstly Tower bridge is not the London Bridge, This bridge is huge because a lot of cars pass thru daily. To get a good view and picture perfect iconic bridge is to go to the side of london tower near the thames river. In this area you can get a good view or picture of this bridge or a selfie. You can spend time walking along Thames river and enjoy the view. You have this option just stay in this area or visit the tower of london or go to greenwitch by riding thier water taxi.

Well worth the money. We took our nearly 8 yr old grandsons and they loved it, In fact I've lived in South east London all my life and have never been up to the top of the bridge so it was as much fun for me, the glass floor they loved, they wanted to walk up the stairs but agreed to only do the down journey it's over 200 steps.Also what made the day was that they saw the bridge go up twice in that day, something I've never once seen in my 70 yrs.and living so near..well worth the money

Scared of Heights. Not me, but my wife is and the glass bottom floor terrified her. This is what lightens up this tour from being just factual and a bit dull. My wife was cranky with me after leading her through this, so I never got to see the Engineroom at the end of the tour. Not for someone who is afraid of heights, but it is perfectly safe.
Glass floor fun. Enjoyed a 2 for 1 visit here with our train tickets. Enjoyed the interesting exhibition on bridges as well as the glass floor - surreal experience walking over the Thames!

Another must in London . I have never been on the tour through the inner workings of the bridge, yet. But have walked across several times. There is just something about it that I love to go across. Plus, there are nice areas around the base of either side.
Beautiful. This tower is beautiful, at night they have it lit up. and if you are a Harry Potter fan you imagine being part of the travel.

day out with friends. this was lovely to visitu can either take the lift ot walk up over 200 stairswe took the lift hahawhat a view u get i was a bit scared cos i don't do heights but i loved itthere is also a glass floor u can walk onit was amazing lots of information also explaining what things are

Interesting. If you are at the Tower then you may as well go to Tower Bridge but not really worth making a special effort to go there. Its so impressive from the outside less so (understandanbly!) from the inside, although the machinery room is fun.

One of the Historical venue of London. It is very close to london tower tube station, you can just walk and reach in five minutes from this station.It is a historical monument and has two suspended parts of the bridge, which can be lifted, when required.Out of so many places to visit in London, this can be avoided, if you have limited time.
Well worth a visit. Well worth a visit, the glass floor on the upper walkway, see the Thames from a different angle, the engine room is just a short walk from the bridge a must to see.

History made exciting. We climbed up the tower (there is also an elevator) and immediately got a good sense of the Victorian craftsmanship. Up on the deck we enjoyed the views of the river and the glass floor. There are two decks, we visited both. One of them at least had mirrors over the glass floor (maybe I didn't notice on the other deck) which makes for really fun pictures. The staff were very friendly throughout. Engine rooms worth a visit (included), very warm, more excellent craftsmanship on display.

A must see when in London. World famous bridge, spanning the River Thames. historic design and architecture is world class. Walk across this bridge & experience it first hand. Great photo opportunities of the bridge from the banks of The Thames.

Billy the Beefeater, you are the Man! Or should I say the "Yeoman"!. The Tower of London and all the history it had to offer was fascinating but it was our guide from the Yeomen Warders of Her Majesty's Royal Palace and Fortress the Tower of London, and Members of the Sovereign's Body Guard of the Yeoman Guard Extraordinary, popularly known as the Beefeaters that truly made the tour come to life in a very entertaining and humorous manner and make it captivating, engrossing, absorbing, enchanting, enthralling, spellbinding,riveting, engaging, compelling, compulsive, gripping and thrilling.Thank you Billy the Beefeater, you are the Man! Or should I say the "Yeoman"!

Beautiful. While waiting for my Thames Cruise it was fun to look at the bridge. We were treated with watching the draw bridge lift for some tug boats.If you want to see it open, you can go towww.towerbridge.org.uk for the daily schedule of lift times.
Fantastic Value. Extremely informative tour with fabulous views and not a pricey attraction. Well worth the money in our opinion.

Beautiful architecture. We were fortunate, we saw the bridge from two angles. Once we crossed over it on our tour bus, and then we passed under it on our river cruise back to Westminster from the Tower of London. It is a beautiful bridge, but it is still only a bridge. Do I think it is a must see, no; however, it is truly lovely. If you are in that area see it, but it isn't something you will get out and walk around.
easy to walk across and great photos. go up if you like.. a decent walk across and back and great photos. we didn't go up but there's now a glass sidewalk you can shoot downwards.
Rainy day. Even though it was raining , Tower bridge is a sight to see, it is grand and beautiful, go on the river cruise you'll have a great view from underneath the bridge and hear of its history
Great view. Walk across part of it for the experience or just view from the distance. We got to see the bridge open up and sail boat race go under it.

Great tour. I didn't know about the tour until I was there but decided to give it a go. Very reasonable price and great fun. You get to see the inner workings of the bridge and walk across the top. Well worth the visit, try and go at one of the designated bridge opening times which are displayed on the website. Takes about an hour
Beautiful Bridge . A beautiful, historic and memorable bridge, I can see why it is admired around the world, loved walking over it and admiring it's fine glory!
Beautiful. We were there when a huge sail boat went under the bridge. Really cool. We left the Tower of London and crossed the bridge. The other side has a lot of shops and a great outdoor bar.

Amazing unique monument .... Ok, you have to share the Tower Bridge with many others but this is what one needs to do that. The design, the colors used and the view/s are - as said - amazingly unique from far away as well as close(r)-by.

Must see landmark. Definitely worth visiting when sight seeing in London. Enjoyed a lovely walk on a sunny day down to Tower bridge & the river Thames. Lots of restaurants, bars & places to grab an ice cream too all over looking this monument.

Fantastic atmosphere. We visited London last week and got tube to tower bridge. only about 5/10min from tube station but fantastic atmosphere of live music and bars along thames unfortunately these are seasonal and where closed by 10pm! so beautiful

Tower Bridge. Well worth a visit if you are into bridges and an awesome view up and down the Thames. The floor-lite view down onto the road below is great for photo ops. Worthwhile with older children.

On the Bridge as it opened!!. Were lucky enough to be on the bridge when it opened and this was an amazing experience. Then visited the Tower Bridge Experience which was very informative. Access very good as lifts provided to save having to climb al the steps. History of the bridge very interesting and the glass floor sections very interesting. Entrance fee very reasonable for London.

So incredibly blue.... Although it may appear to be a classic tourist trap, there is no trap to it whatsoever. The bridge is just part of the everyday commute of so many, and only the architecture gives away it's age.It is in an incredible state, and the color is just so blue. Only few photos do it justice.
Iconic Bridge. This is an iconic bridge of London. You definitely have to go see this old, historic bridge. Plus, be sure to take some pictures.
Experienced the best views on a river cruise!. On our first night, we went on an evening cruise down the River Thames, and this bridge was just one of the MANY things we saw. It was breathtaking.

great views and very interesting tour and videos. My 3 young kids loved the views and the videos about building the bridge. They also enjoyed the engine room tour which I surprised me. The glass walkway was a big hit with them as well. Worth the time and money!

Stunningly Beautiful and fun to walk across. We walked several miles along the Thames and enjoyed the beautiful view of the Tower Bridge much of the way. It was closed for a short time while the police attended to a very distraught young person, but we walked across when it reopened. We would have liked to have gone up in the tower, but we were on the wrong side of the street when it reopened and by the time we got to the tower entry it was mobbed with people after having been closed for an hour or more. So we just enjoyed our walk to the other side of the bridge.

Another epic symbol of London. The Tower Bridge is another very known landmark from London and it looks amazing, specially at night. Even though it is relatively recent, the architecture used resembles an old tower.
Masterpiece. What can you say about this fantastic landmark ,you have to see it in action when ships require to pass under.Crowds gather all along the waterfront to see it in action.

Fun and Interesting.. The queues were only 5 minutes long and we used our Tesco vouchers to gain entrance to the bridge. After using the lift to get up to the walkway the guide told us how to see the various parts of the bridge and we were free to spend as much time as we wanted.We crossed the first side of the bridge and walked onto the glass floored section to gaze down on the traffic below which was fascinating. There was an illustrated history of the bridge along the walls and a short but very interesting film about how it was built.Passing through to the other side again we went onto the glass floor and this time lay down on it, taking a photo of ourselves in the mirror above out heads! We noted from the timetable posted at the end of the walkway that a boat was due in 10 minutes when the bridge would be opened (this happens about three times a day during summer). We asked a helpful member of staff where was the best place to watch and she directed us along the river side up to the 'onion', as the Greater London council building is referred to, so we managed to get some good photos of the great bridge opening!Afterwards we returned and went into the engine room, on the same side of the river and saw the great engines that had previously powered the bridge opening, resplendent in beautifully painted green, red and cream.It only took an hour of our time but was good fun and very interesting.

London Bridge. Tower bridge is just a wonderful piece of London history ,we were staying at the \Tower Hotel so to sit and have dinner and see the bridge all lit up was just magical ,and of course just a short walk from the tower of London .I would recommend the bridge and the tower both bye day and night .

Top walkway is a must see. This iconic place is hard to miss when you are at London. Interestingly no major lineups to get in. Walkway on top of the bridge is quite interesting specially for its glass floor portions.

Best Architecture in the city !. Obviously, its my opinion, but I love this bridge. Big Ben is one of the most photographed icons in the city, but I feel Tower Bridge offers more. It is especially cool when it opens.

Emblematic monument. One of the most emblematic monument of London. That medieval bridge at the Tames river, unites the tower of London side (Medieval London0 with the Town Hall on the other side (Modern London). A good walk through the bridge will give you a nice view of London.
.... Check it out from the Tower of London spot... you can have a nice perspective. It's just a few meters from Tower Hill underground. ;)
Stunning piece of history . We love the history behind the bridge. We also visited the museum within the bridge which is really interesting too. Apparently its haunted up there!

Nice and fun. Great spot. Interesting tour. The kids loved the passport stickers they had to collect.
The best part is walking at the top of the bridge and looking down through the glass panes!

A nice bridge to walk. A very nice bridge to walk and to see the tower. I didn't go inside because you have to pay and I didn't find so interesting to go inside. The view from the bridge is wonderful. You see from there the river, the London Bridge, the Parliament, Big Ben and London Eye.
Epic. We were fortunate enough to see the bridge open up to allow a ship to pass. I would recommend you do one of those bus tours preferably on a weekend when there's less traffic.

beautiful at night!. Discovered Tower Bridge while exploring the city at night. It was about a 15 minute walk from our hotel.. safe walk to and on the bridge. The bridge was lit up at night with many photo opportunities. Close to the London Tower as well.
Beautiful. Tower Bridge is a 5 minute walk from the premier inn and so beautiful day or night. Also you can go into the towers for better views.

A landmark not to me missed. If you take the Thames Path from London Bridge, good views ! Keep following the south bank, very good, the bridge had to be raised as we walked past, and this was the best vantage for a good pic !
Very good . Very neat thing to do to go up in the bridge. I have a 3 and 1 year old. They both loved the glass floor. Couldn't get enough of it really. Great time here.

Nerve wracking but exciting!. Tower bridge is an iconic landmark in London and was built over an 8 year period between 1886-1894 with the loss of 10 lives during the construction.From the entrance there's a lift that takes you up the North Tower to a room where you can watch footage of the construction. Access to the east walkway is on the left and although I have no fear of heights, taking the first step onto the glass floor is quite nerve wracking! 42m below the vehicles on the road look like toys and the people are like ants. The west walkway also has mirrors on the ceiling so you can take selfies lying on the glass floor. A lift in the South Tower takes you down to road level where you can follow the blue line on the ground which leads to the Engine Rooms below the bridge. Victorian ingenuity came up with a way to open the bridge in order to allow ships through, there are also interactive exhibits to explain how the machinery works.

Better seeing it from outside than entering. The Bridge is better to look at from outside. It's quite expensive to enter. The only cool part inside the bridge is the glass view under your foot but other than that, it's better to take it into a distance.
Beautiful bridge. We crossed it by foot, and it is lovely. And when we there almost to the middle they stopped traffic in order to raise the bridge to let a boat pass and the was fun

This is the glass floor place. Ok, the highlight of this tour is certainly the glass floor. Lots of people there, so wait patiently. On one side (closer to London Bridge), there is a mirror ceiling, so taking pictures by bouncing up off the ceiling is more interesting. But if you're a bridge lover, you will love this tour. Make sure to see the engine room, where you can see how the drawbridge operates.
Take it to the Bridge. Top attraction with photo oops galore. Walk across is a must do. Plan it with lunch or breakfast on the south bank side and then tour the tower

The glass view onto the bridge is fun. It was pretty neat to see the bridge and be able to check out the levels. We really enjoyed walking across the glass area on the bridge. I am not sure the price but it was included with the London Pass so it was great to visit as a part of the pass.
Worth seeing if you're at the Tower of London. It's interesting to see and provides excellent views of the Thames River; however I wouldn't make a special trip just to see the bridge.

Well worth the Trip. Such a lovely interesting tour, thoroughly enjoyed it, lots of nice footage on film too. Was rather crowded though due to all the school children now going too, so may be worth leaving your visit until after school holidays if you are able
Iconic landmark. Seen from far always I decided to walk to this iconic landmark. Very photogenic from far! Lots of nice places to eat very near. So a good place for tourists!
Worth a visit. I'm scared of heights, so I wasn't sure how I'd do on the tower bridge. The height didn't end up bothering me until the glass walkway showed up. It is a short visit, but very worth i!
nice tour. Very nice and lovely view from the glass floor. Very easy acess for disabled kids and people with buggy. There is 2 lifts. My kids loves glass floor and the engine rooms
Nice to see. Been there on a school trip on a boat. View from the boat was superb and i finally saw one of the most known british structures.

Crowded. Great site to see. However, on the top floor glass walk it was very disorganized. People hogging/blocking spots on the glass floor, one staff member trying to manage things. Do not do the glass floor walk, too expensive, not worth it.
Love the view. Went up the Tower Bridge with a friend. It was nice taking pictures and the idea of having a glass floor is also a lot of fun!

London bridges falling down. London bridges falling down falling down..beautiful place for a walk surrounded with stores and
restaurants,just fun to walk around take picture and check the place. There is a burger stand near people are talking about it all the time! should go and try that ..junkie walk day haha

Must visit. Nice location... with some restaurants near by... and a starbucks too.
No need for tour guide, you can just roam around on your own

Those views.. Not only is it an incredible privilege to be able to enjoy this historical bridge, but the new glass walkway between the towers is so much fun and the views up and down the Thames are wonderful

Touch of history. . We use to walk and cross this bridge almost daily and every day it seems to have a new look and flavour. The building of this bridge old times require a lot of work and dedication. An icon of London

Beautiful bridge during the day and at night!. We had a fantastic weather while visiting London this summer. One day we decided to spend a few hours strolling along Thames River and taking in the fantastic views of not only the Tower Bridge but the Tower of London, City Hall, Shard. The pictures we took of the main attractions were amazing. We were also lucky to witness the opening of the bridge. That was awesome!

Best part of my trip!. It's as marvelous as everyone else mentions in their reviews. I got to witness the drawbridge opening up. Not sure how often that happens. I think I read it used to open up five times a day many many years ago. I think most people call this the London bridge, which is obviously not correct.

Awesome Spot to Visit. We visited the Tower Bridge on July 6, 2016. It is a must stop and visit place. Our grandsons were in awe of the bridge and its age. We went over on a tour bus and the bridge is a must see when visiting London.

Interesting half an hour. Was at Tower Bridge to watch it open and decided to do the tour. Only took about half an hour including spending time standing on the glass floor., so not very long, but it was reasonable value.Interesting history along the way in old newsreels and the machine room was the highlight.Just watch the gift shop, not all items showing a price, and, in some cases the item advertised at one price and showing a pound extra at the tills.It wasn't until I intervened that my young Chilean visitor was going to be charged the extra for two items. The cashier was arguing the toss until I took him to the item on display and he then reluctantly let me have it at the price shown. A mistake, I would hope so, but he obviously was not used to having his prices checked.Other than that the gift shop items were reasonable priced and fair value selling some items not seen elsewhere.Disabled can visit the bridge tour as there are lifts to all floors, and to the machine room which is in a different part, away from the towers.

Magnificent Views. For views that are very hard to beat this is one attraction in London you really shouldn't miss, the price is very reasonable for a Central London Attraction too and when we visited, lunchtime in July the queue time was quite short. You start the attraction by entering a lift in which a tour guide gives a short talk about the bridge. You then enter the exhibition walkways which are filled with interesting information about the bridge and the views over the Thames are excellent. There is an added bonus of a glass floor walkway which is fun for kids and adults. The staff are helpful, informative and friendly, it was my daughter's birthday and the guide organised a chorus of Happy Birthday from our tour in the lift! The staff also gave her a 15% discount in the souvenir shop which were nice touches. My only grumble was that the ladies toilets near the top of the attraction were out of order, so I had a long walk downstairs to use the ones at the bottom and then one of these was out of order! Overall though a good attraction, reasonably priced (and this attraction accepts Tesco vouchers) with outstanding views.
Great Views. The views from the bridge are amazing. You can see many landmarks such as the Shard, the Gherkin and other tall skyscrapers.

The Tower Bridge is a true post card look. Many travelers crowd the sidewalks to get a picture of the bridge in the back. Go take a look. The walk to the bridge from the hotel was hassle-free, you will see many different cultures on the streets and there are many different places of business and restaurants along the way.

Fab, & the glass floor is great!. Brilliant little extra to your trip to London. Can take as little or as long as you like. Our six year old loved it. Little bit of a queue on the way in, no great shakes and great photo opportunities in the bridge. Be prepared for a stair climb, but very much worth it.
Unique. An impressive structure. Take the time to walk across the bridge, to better appreciate its position and its unique splendour.

London icon, must visit place for all. Tower Bridge is fantastic. Its must visit sight for residents as well as visitors. If you are lucky enough to spend an evening in the mid span banquet room, its a treat to see and the view is great

Part of history. Although chances you'll see this thing working its magic are cero to none, it is still one of the best photo spots in London. If you head your way through the stairs at the end of the bridge you'll find some interesting options to have some food while you continue your journey.

Great at sunset!. We were staying on the south side of the bridge near Southwark. We were able to walk to and across the bridge at sunset and it was awesome. We spent quite awhile just standing on the bridge enjoying the view to the east and west. It was one of our most enjoyable evenings in London.
See how it works!. It was interesting to find out the details about how the bridge was constructed and to see how it works. The views from the bridge are really good!

The bridge is cool, a must see...save time & $ and skip the glass floor and tour. The bridge sits right next to the spot where the Crown Jewels are located. Do them both in the same day to save time during your touring. Also...check out the view of the bridge from both sides of the Thames - it changes. 1 hour is plenty of time for pics & to soak in the bridge. Add 30 minutes if you do the tour.

Cool windy and much more Londonish. When I first saw Tower Bridge I confused it with the London Bridge. London Bridge is a normal typical bridge and for me Tower Bridge is the most iconic bridge in whole London

Never fails to be awesome!. I've seen this many times over the years, and this time, whilst on a river cruise (see separate review) saw the bridge open for a clipper. What an awesome reminder of engineering.
Such a beautiful bridge!. Tower Bridge is simply stunning. The exhibit within the bridge is fascinating and there is a glass walk that is fun for the whole family.

Very nice. The bridge is absolutely stunning to look at. You can do the exhibition which is very interesting and gives lots of history about the bridge and go right to the top and walk along the walkways which offer superb views of London, as well as having a glass floor so you can look straight down at the road and river below. If you're nervy about heights, don't worry as the glass floor is only a couple of panels, and also has proper flooring around it so you can walk around it if you don't want to walk on the glass. I didn't realise the bridge was used regularly for boats, I'd always thought it was only used for special occasions but to see the bridge open up was quite impressive. If you go on the Tower Bridge website, they have a list of all the times that the bridge opens.

Often Mistaken for London Bridge. This is way way way better than London Bridge. You'll be disappointed what London Bridge would really look like. Tower Bridge is a British icon and a very beautiful bridge. It's picture perfect.
GO!. It's free, it's right by the tower, it's a beautiful walk up, there was little coffee stands around if it's cold or early in the morning. Just go, it's iconic and worth it.
Charming walk. You should walk over this bridge at least twice, once by the street and once up through the towers and experience the glass view walk.
Wow !. If you are lucky enough you just might see the bridge opening making way to let the ship pass by. You can check the timings when the bridge opens up before going.

Loved the glass floor. One of those iconic London sites - worth a visit inside to the upper levels to see the Thames through the glass floor. Entry also includes a visit to the engine room. Make sure you stay to see the bridge open up for passing boats.

Kiwi OE. Besides walking across bridge also did the bridge walk. An experience not to be missed. Views over London and the Thames not seen by us before. Would also go to see machinery room !! Well worth seeing as this was how bridge was made to operate originally.
If you've never been there than you must. Interesting tour through out the ages about this particular bridge. very interesting, high level, with many historical facts and events

It's a bridge!. It is a bridge, a beautiful one at that, situated beside the beautiful Tower of London, free to use, and used by both pedestrians and road traffic. If you're lucky you might see the traffic halted so it can open up to let a boat pass through.

Iconic must see . So excited just to see this bridge. Walking across was very cool and watched it raise for boats passing through. We used our 2 for 1 pass to visit the top. That was very cool to look down from the glass floors to see the bridge below. You can also visit the engine room and there's a few short movies to watch if you'd like but you don't have to. It's a visit you should do. All the kids were laying down on the glass floor really enjoying themselves.
Iconic monument. I work next to the bridge and never get tired of looking at it. It now has a glass floor bridge which is great if you are okay with heights.
Mesmerizing bridge . This is not just a bridge, it's a very beautiful and elegantly stood bridge. You will fall in love with this beautiful bridge.

Never ever disappoints . Now I know everyone knows this but Tower bridge is by far one of the best most ionic symbol of London. I used to live just south of the river and my daily commute to and from work took me over the bridge twice a day it never got old to me seeing it light up in different colors, opening up for boats to pass and the best seeing it in the snow. If your a tourist in London your trip will not be complete without a stop to see this magnificent bridge!
Must see night and day!. Most beautiful bridge I've ever seen. You must see it lit up at night and the beautiful colours during the day. Lots of restaurants near by.
Amazing bridge!. This bridge is really lovely! We drove over it twice and the view was very nice. You should see it, it is just a bridge but a nice one!

Great View. Definitely take the time to go all the way to the upper walkway. The glass floor is really cool and while we were there they both needed the bridge to be lifted so we were able to view it from above
Beautiful. Stayed right next to the bridge on my birthday, was amazing to look at during the day but at night when it's all lit up it took my breath away. Wonderful.
Wonderful. I was in London for business, but I did not want to miss out on actually seeing London. I walked to my hotel through this bridge and it was beautiful
We traveled from far to see it, not dissapointed. We had seen the bridge many times on television so standing on it was a wonderful experience for us. It truly is a magnificent icon.
Nice example of technical developments. Showing high level of the engineering work in construction and machinery. For Young visitors is most interesting glass walk on the top part.

The Greatest and popular Landmark. Being in London and not seeing the Tower bridge cannot be forgiven. The most famous background for anyone to take a snap with the background of the bridge... it is also great to walk all the way up and under the bridge, Indeed a structural marvel

Magnificent Structure. Been to London on a business trip for 2 weeks. Thoroughly enjoyed the weather and the walk around the Tower Bridge. Was lucky enough to witness the bridge opening up to allow a vessel pass through. Truly amazed by the architecture of the bridge.

Iconic bridge. I wouldn't visit the Tower of London on cost grounds but you can see it from Tower Bridge. You can pay some money to go into the supports and walk across which is not bad value for money. Check out when it is due to lift for a super experience

Lots to see great view. Did not realize there was so much to see at Tower bridge. When I was younger I thought this was the London bridge. 😊. Lots to see, hear and read if you like some history. Worth taking the kids for the views and educational aspect.

Marvel of 18th Century Engineering. Amazing views of London & River Thames..!! A must visit to exhibition..!! Souvenir machine was defective at upper floor... which was compressing coin in souvenir...It was printing after galloping 2 or 3 coin GBP...... Please replace with the new one immediately...it feels like a cheating with tourists... Thanks again...
Walk across the top level!. Be sure to walk across the top level and photograph yourself on the glass floor. Intimidating if you are afraid of heights like me, but my kids loved it.

Most photographed thing . Arguably the most photographed thing in all of London, this bridge also has a short tour that can be taken. A lift takes you up to a level where you can walk across the top of the bridge over some glass floors. You can also watch a couple of short films about its construction. After you leave the bridge you can check out the engine room that raises and lowers the bridge and a pretty nice gift shop.
Details. There were so much detail. It was cool to go on top and cross the Thames and it was just as unique going underneath.

Loved the glass floor. Very good value for money. We had 2 for 1 tickets, so £9 for my 7 years old daughter and me was a great few hours to spend in very interesting building and see fantastic views of Tower of London.

Cruised across the bridge for fun. I came across the bridge while walking through London and it is gorgeous, definitely if you want to see the small finer details take your time and walk across it. Look at the structures of the bridge when doing so

Birthday Treat. We visited this attraction on my Birthday when visiting London for a few days. We were not disappointed the views were fantastic on such a nice sunny day. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and a great gift shop at good prices. The attraction is well worth the price.
Terrific Way to see London & the Thames. It costs nothing to walk across the beautiful bridge! You'll get great vistas of London and up and down the Thames.
Gorgeous. One of our favorite London sights. We walked across and also rode a night time bus tour across and saw it lit up at night. Beautiful!

Hard to miss. Its hard to miss the spectacular landmark of London. A superb walk around and over the bridge. Classic photo opportunity. The functioning and history is even more interesting. Keep this on you itinerary.
Neat experience. Very cool to walk on the glass bridges! Great activity with kids and not a lot of time needed to visit.

A classic when in London. Not going to the London bridge when in London is missing part of it's history. The bridge is simply a classic. It is situated close ti many museums and restaurants within walking distance. There is a Dungeon that is now operated and owned by Disney id you want a taste of what London was in the 1700's including torture chambers, the plague and what criminals and persecuted people wnt through in those days. As an ICON of the city, the London Bridge is an obligated one
A must see sight when visiting London. Well worth making sure you visit this landmark on your trip to London... such a beautiful sight and lovely surroundings too.
a great landmark of London. Mostly just saw this in the distance, but you seem to want to continue to take pictures at different angles, or to have it in the background to represent being in London.
Cool looking bridge. Such a unique looking bridge, between the structure and the colors, I love this bridge...enjoyable visit
Beautiful!. This is bridge worth walking across. The structure of it is beautiful and the view of the Tower of London from it is wonderful.

An enjoyable tour but not as good as it used to be. We visited on a Saturday afternoon and had a good time.Quite interesting facts and its fun to walk over the glass floors and see the people and traffic under your feet.Also visited the engine rooms.They used to have a lot more to this experience, seems to be very short now. Like everything in London - probably a bit too expensive for what you actually get but it is a must do really, its a beautiful and historic bridge.
It a fancy bridge. I may have miss some sort of tour, but its spectatular to see from any vantage point. I would probably rate it higher if I would have taken a tour vs. just looked at it.
Not as fun I was hopping for. advertising is better than to visit, not as fun it looks like, messy systems to get in, there is particularly nothing to see,

a London Trip. This is well worth visiting all very well organised with time to experience all the history, it is very high up over the road and river Thames, and standing on the glass walkway is quite something have your camera ready.

Glass walkway OMG. Excellent value for money for a London attraction. The glass floor is amazing if you like heights, I personally couldn't look down till I'd reached the middle of the glass floor but was brilliant when I did look. Views are spectacular from up there and the staff are very informative. There's lots of information around the trip to read about the bridge and it's workings. A definate recommendation for all ages
Tower bridge. It was a wonderful experience to see "the must see attraction in London" just walk from the famous square and this was the end of the walking toue we had.

A good summer afternoon. Was quite a pleasant experience to stroll through the walkways near the bridge.
Was good to see many ferries zipping thro and people enjoying a lazy weekend afternoon there.
My favourite place in London. Tower Bridge is my favourite place in London, both during the day and during the night. Its spectacular architecture and the walking aside the river makes it special.
Easy and fun. This place was a great place to go. It was hot, boring, and a lot of obstructed views, but there was no line. I am glad that I went because it is a fun tourist place to visit.

Great Experience. This is anIconic London landmark with some fascinating displays.Walk up the stairs and marvel at the Victorian engineers that created it. When you arrive at the top of the tower there is a video presentation running on a continuous loop which gives you time to catch your breath (if you need it!)From here you make tour way on to the walkway connecting the north and south bank towers. The original lattice work has been fully glazed giving great views up and downstream. Some of the windows have been covered with a fascinating display of iconic bridges around the world. The best part though are the glass panels in the floor and the mirrors above them. Great to watch people's reaction to them - some wont even acknowledge they are there whilst others are happy to lie on them looking at the view belowWasn't too busy even on a Friday afternoon
Great view. Very interesting building and fantastic views of Tower of London from the top, quite an experience walking across the glass floor looking directly down on the traffic and Thames below.
Interesting. Quite interesting to see how it used to work and the history behind it. I quite enjoyed the see through floor at the top.

Great value, and wonderful time!. Beautiful views and fantastic architecture. You can take an elevator or the stairs to the top. There is a nice video to watch when you get to the top that tells the story of the bridge. Interactive screens on the bridge allow you to chose different languages and research aspects of the bridge and surrounding area.
Wait until dark. We especially enjoyed this at 10:30 pm on a Saturday night. Lots of activity and a magnificent panoramic view of London.
Tower Bridge a must see. One of the must see sites while staying in London. Walking distance to several other attractions. Go visit both during the day and night.

What a waste of time. This was such a tremendous waste of time. And I knew it was going to be a waste of time. But I did it anyways because my son's wanted to see it. Essentially you go in you see a movie about how a bridge was built can you walk across the bridge both ways can you go down see the motor that makes a bridge work then you go to the gift shop. Whoop-dee-doo. The only cool thing is the fact that there's a glass floor about a hundred feet in the air over the river but you can walk on. However if I hadn't gotten it for free because of my London pass I would have been really annoyed I spent any money at all on this.
Impressive bridge. Great for photos externally but if you choose to enter inside its interesting experience. Looks great when lit at night.

Great bridge. This is not London Bridge (it is quite plain and boring). This is a cool bridge. Anyone can visit it, cross it, take pictures, admire the Thames. It's free and is like no bridge I have ever visited.

Worth a visit. My wife and I went to Tower Bridge and did so using Tesco vouchers. Even without these, the experience is not that expensive (£9 per adult).Having decided to use the stairs rather than the lift we realised just how tall the bridge was once we were half way up.The glass floor is a nice touch. It took my wife a while to pluck up the courage to step on it though !!The views up and down the Thames were excellent as it was a sunny clear day and the Bridge had lots of information about this and other bridges.Included in ticket was a trip to the engine room of the bridge. This is in a separate building a short walk from the Tower entrance, although easy to find.We were glad to have done it, although would not be likely to return as I feel it is a 'do it once' attraction.

Spectacular . The walk across the bridge is impressive because of the views it offers, however the architecture and beauty of the bridge itself is also fantastic. It's also worth taking a trip on one of the many ferry cruises to see the bridge in all its glory. The open top ferries travelling along the river turn side-on for great photo ops too. Most interesting and eye catching bridge in my opinion. It's also really easy to find and is located close to loads of other great attractions and tube stations.

The Postcard of London. Tower Bridge, which has mistakenly called London Bridge by millions of tourists, is the monument you imagine when London is mentioned. Tower Bridge is not only iconic, but also beautiful by itself. My favourite spot to take its picture is from the wall of Tower of London. But in case you are not interested in entering the Tower, Southbank is my other (and everybody else's) favourite.I am not interested to climb to the glass bridge (it does not look that interesting for me; look at it from below before you decide to climb), so I cannot review anything about it. However, another thing that may be of interest is the Opening of the Bridge to let big ship passing by. Check the schedule online if you are interested!
Bring Back Memories. This was my first visit to London. But everytime I go, I always make time to Tower Bridge. If you're a first timer, make sure to visit here, one of many London's landmarks.
Top tour to explore the bridge. It was one of the highlights of our London trip.To explore the bridge is fun and interresting.The sky walk is absolutely fun...A must visit place!!!
Great viewing platform. Very friendly staff, good viewing platform (glas !). Must see the engine rooms. They are worth it. Good in combination with Tower

Beautiful bridge. Visited this bridge in July 2016 with friends and family. We've not walked across it but have taken a boat trip underneath it. Very beautiful bridge, a definite must see if your visiting London. Probably my favourite tourist landmark in London as its just so pretty !

Very nice to visit the London bridge. Not very expensive to visit. The most fun offered the glass floor and mirror in the corridors between the two towers. Many people (including ourselves) do funny things to made funny photos. Take the stairs (at least down-wards) to see the interesting interior of the tower. Also the non-tech oriented can visit the engine rooms: very interesting and well explained. Also suitable for a rainy day!
I could spend hours looking at it!. It's just a bridge, but so beautiful and so full of history. It's cool to spend some time observing it and watching it open the bottom part when boats approach!

See it from the inside!. Buy a ticket. Take the elevator up. See the Tower Bridge from the inside! Lots of history. The video presentation is very informative. I enjoyed the views and it is fun to stand on the glass and look down at the traffic and the Thames. Engine room is great!
Beautiful bridge . We utilized our London Pass to skip the line to go up top and walk across the bridge. There is a glass section where you can look down at traffic and people below.
tower bridge .... i just walk through the bridge ... but the architecture is fabulous.cross the Thames by walking across this bridge it is sensational
Must cross the Tower Bridge. This is a magnificent stone bridge! Wonderful to cross while on an open air double decker tour bus - This was my highlight or London.

Nice piece of engineering. Probably one of the most well known London icons, this bridge is a beautiful work of engineering. The blue and white colours give it a nice touch. If you are lucky you can see it in operation.

Walked on the bridge between 2 towesrs and looked down through clear glass was fun !. Buy 9 British Pound per ticket to walk on the bridge between the 2 towers was worth it. Looking cars driving below on the bridge through clear glass was pretty neat ! I would recommend this !
Lots of bridge history. Personally, the glass floor was a bit of a gimmick, but the views were fantastic. The engine room tour is a must see. In all, this was well worth going.

Must see bridge! . I did take the tour inside. I marveled at this magnificent drawbridge as I walked across it on a gorgeous day. The craftsmanship of the builders is impressive. I'll have to take the tour on my next visit and see it at night all lit up.
A landmark on the Thames. I was fortunate to stay in an adjacent hotel and was fascinated by the workings of the bridge and its artitectutre amazing. A must see
Wow. What a lovely experience to be around. You can even see it from the river while you there. Great attraction in a good location in central London.
Very cool site. Take lots of photos of this site from the many various locations possible. It is quite a landmark for sure!
Beautiful colours across the Thames. In my opinion, this bridge is the most beautiful from all of the ones across the Thames in London. The colours strike on both day and nighttime. Highly recommend!

amazing. No visit to London is complete without visiting this iconic bridge. Tower bridge can be seen from afar. It is the perfect postcard image. But you should step on it, even more than that, you should go up on the walkways to really feel it. You can see along Thames river from up there, you can step on the glass to see the water under your feet. An amazing experience! The Tower of London is really close, so you can visit both. Buy entrance tickets in advance, so you do not have to wait in line.

Summer nights on Tower Bridge. If you do anything this summer, take a walk along St Katherine's Dock all the way along the River Thames and see Tower of London & Tower Bridge like never before. London transforms when the weather is warm... Some great photo opps and whenever I visit here I feel like a tourist all over again. Never gets tired or boring, reminds me how magical London is!

Great View. Recently visited Tower Bridge. The view of London is spectacular from the top, especially down onto the river through the Glass Floor.It is reasonable priced at £9 and there is plenty of information displayed about the history of the bridge as well as videos to watch. It can get busy especially around the Glass Floor area.

A magnificient piece of engineering. I thoroughly enjoyed visiting Tower Bridge, particulaly the walkways, the engine rooms are also extremely interesting, I was amazed at how such complex technology was built at the time of the towers construction.
Good view of the bridge. A must see for any visitor in London. Fantastic view of river thames. I really enjoyed it and will be back.
Breath taking. Not your ordinary bridge and enjoyed seeing it up close. A must see when in London and beautiful both during the day and at night.

Worth the Money. Definitely worth the money to go up into this famous bridge. You can learn about its construction as well as learn about other bridges. And if you don't care about learning anything, it is still an interesting attraction with a nice view.
Worthwhile experei. I loved my morning walk across the tower bridge. It was not too crowded and very clean. Excellent views up and down the Thames.

The onlyTower Bridge. It was an excellent trip to the Tower Bridge as it was very close to the Tower of London. We managed to walk through the bridge However, it was a rainy day which negatively influenced the journey. I would extremely suggest to visit this bridge in a sonny day .

Must for London. This exhibition was really amazing. First of all, you get to see the amazing view from the bridge. Second you can walk on glass floor and you watch people on the sidewalk beneath. Third, you can see a great movie about how they build the bridge and last, you can see the engine rooms which are used to open the bridge for big ships. Really recommended for young kids and teens.

This Is London. This bridge is amazing and such a historical part of London. I wish I had read the review better before we went. We drove over the bridge, but I didn't know that there was a glass floor I could have walked over. That would have been very cool.

Glass floor gives a different perspective. We hadn't planned to visit but as it was great value for money, we popped in. Very short queues, great explanation of engineering behind it (structural and mechanical). Then there is the best bit - they've put in a glass floor, so you can walk with the Thmes beneath you and an even better touch a mirror on roof allowing you to take superb selfies.

Good experience, . Family of four waited about 20-30 minutes, friendly and jovial staff.
