Short video introduction at the top then on to the bridge, lucky enough to be there during a raise, but so many people crowded around that view was severely hampered. The commentator during the raise was great, giving much more than just telling us the bridge was going up. I did fine it quite crowded, on both sides of the bridge.

Majestic Emotion. Majestic emotion. Sensational experience. Grandiose structure that is imposed on the Thames. See the bridge open and see its power in the mechanisms is fabulous. And indescribable the feeling of walking on the river through a transparent floor and maybe see the bridge that rises or ships to pass under your feet. Beautiful photo exhibition of extraordinary bridges in the world. Experience Live!
Worth visiting . An excellent tour about the tower bridge, the mechanisms behind the opening and closing of the bridge. Worth visiting once.

Breathtaking. Just by chance we were by Tower Bridge as a ship with a tall mast sailed along. It was dark and the bridge was illuminated. we watched as it opened and the ship sailed under. It was fantastic.

B-e-a-utiful. Best bridge in London and best at night since its all lit up different colours and the London night life views are great. At night the bridge isn't too busy but I'm sure it gets more popular with the tourists during the day.
Lovely view. Had a leisurely walk to enjoy the view which is different day and night. Interesting to see a group of skaters zooming past.

A unique opportunity to see something different. When I was young, you couldn't visit to the tower Bridge but many admired it from the outside. It has since opened to the public and is marketed as a place to visit like many places these days and has become popular. However, there was not a long queue to get in when we visited on a weekday fortunately. There were many tourists once inside all enjoying what there was to see. First of all you find an entrance area with photos of the old days and an artificial display of fish from Billingsgate Market as it used to be in baskets. You go up the first section in a lift (there are stairs if you want an option. The lift is modern and fast and everything is well decorated and in immaculate condition. Once upstairs, you can begin the walk across - high above the opening section. The walls are decorated with pictures of other famous bridges across the world and explanations. It is in this first walkway, that you find the glass walkway which is larger than the one in the Spinnaker Tower in Southampton. You don't have to walk over the glass section but you can get a paper badge if you do and many people had great fun, walking, sitting on it and simply taking photos. Continue to the other tower section and you will find a film but not enough seating as it is not a large area. You then walk down the other walkway, opposite the first and can get views from the windows there of the other side of the river - again with more pictures of bridges.There was a machine for cold drinks and it was very hot but it kept rejecting our money. The drinks were priced at £1.50p but we were charged £5 at a café / bar outside! There are toilets at various stages which are clean and of course free.Back down the second lift, we then had to go outside the building and along the road with the general public following signs to the engine room. It was amazing to see how these work but unless you are an engineer - difficult to understand. However, just to see the machines all brightly painted in red, green and brown was wonderful. All parts are caged for health and safety but you can take photos anywhere. We were disappointed that we did not see the guides in costume giving explanations as in the promotional video on the internet. However, overall it was an experience I am glad I had. The gift shop at the end of the engine room sold the usual tourist gifts - cards, key rings, books etc. We didn't see the bridge open up on this occasion but have done so at other times when not visiting the building - an amazing feat of engineering especially in its day.

Worth a visit. Loved the Glass Floor. We made an unplanned visit to the Tower Bridge. It was very reasonably priced (around 9 GBP). There were little windows where you can take a panoramic picture of the Thames and London skyline.

What an amazing structure !. Enjoy during your day tour of London but come back for the night time version! Well lit and well traveled! A beautiful and historic part of central London! and don't miss the Tower of London on the other side! Equally amazing during the day or night!
Iconic . Nice architecture. A lot of history. Has stood the test of time. Read up on the history to truly appreciate.
A must see. A must see place in London. I took the tour around the upper bridge and the view is really good and the glass floor is an awesome feature.

A Masterpiece of a Drawbridge!. This bridge is decked out with some wonderful architecture as well and stands near one edge of the Tower of London attraction spanning across the Thames River. It is lit up at night and is really something to see - watching the drawbridge move to make room for ships to traverse the river is amazing!

London Icon. Iconic feature in London. You can pay to walk across the glass bottom section across the top or walk across the street level for free. Take a photo of London Bridge while you are here. Tours are also available.

Loved the glass floor!. This one of the cheaper tourist attractions that I came across during my recent trip to London. Having just a few hours to spare until I had to traveling home, I decided to visit Tower Bridge. Despite it being busy, it didn't take too long for me to purchase my ticket and go to the first level of the bridge.The views of London were amazing, and the glass floor was a great experience. It was fascination looking through the glass floor viewing the boats traveling on The Thames underneath us! Would recommend this attraction who only had a spare hour or two in the capital.

way more than just a bridge!. took a 7 yr old, it was brilliant!
climb up tower and go across glass floor in the middle if you dare!
victorian engine rooms, bright green machines turn showing how it works.
fantastic views over london
loads to see, took well over an hour.
would go again
excellent for all ages.
So pretty! . Apparently people mistake this for big Ben. (Lolz) really great to see though, a must see if you're visiting London
take the river boat. not to be missed saw from both land and water. most people think it is london bridge but that bridge is very plain

An iconic Landmark. My hubby and I had the pleasure of walking across this bridge. It was crowded, but for the most part everyone was respectful. For an addtional fee you can walk on a glass platform on this bridge and look down. It is approximately 4 stories high.

Beautiful From Every Angle!. This is a magnificent bridge, beautiful to see from both sides of the river, from on a boat tour or while walking across it! We were lucky enough to see it open two different times for boats while we were downtown. Beautiful to see at night!!

Nice place. I love it because its an old part of london you can book a ticket to go inside the tour but we did not enter i foud the ticket expensive for just to go up better go on london eye or thr shard and you got restaurants just infront especially in the night all lights on the tour very nice place

There is a lot more to this bridge than you think.. The bridge allows you to go up one side of the bridge, cross over on the four story tall crooswalkto the other tower and back again. As you cross the floor on the crosswalk is made with glass panels. We had a great time there.
A "Can't Miss". If you anywhere in the area of the Thames River and the Tower of London this bridge is worht viewing. Of course it is NOT the London Bridge but it IS an icon of London.
Totally iconic! And NOT the London Bridge!. Beautifully lit at night. A wonderful walk from one side of the Thames to the other. There's a museum too for those wanting to experience a bit more.
A must see. The family and I took the tour around the upper bridge and the view is really good and the glass floor is an awesome feature.

A must see. You have to visit this iconic landmark. The tour is very good, offering you a view of the inside and workings of the bridge along magnificent views of London from the walkways.I recommend the personal guided tour but you need a group to make this cost effective as it is a set price of £56 (plus the entry fee per person) for up to 16 people.
It is another must to visit. We went into the inside of the Tower Bridge and saw how it worked. It was fascinating to see how it all worked. A must for people that like engineering works.

A nice tour of a very familiar site.. We had never done this tour before, so it was interesting to see the insides of something that we have always seen on the outside. The views from the bridge are great and seeing the mechanisms that raise and lower the bridge is interesting. There is a listing inside of scheduled times that the bridge will be raised during the day. After our visit to the bridge and tower, we were on hand to see the bridge raised for a tall boat. Very neat!
Photo time . Well worth doing with the Tower of London. It makes a beautiful setting for photos . It's one of the places to see while in London

Schedule your visit when the bridge opens!. We were on the river cruise when the bridge opened for boat traffic. Drove over it on our city tour as well, so saw Tower Bridge from top to bottom. Fascinating!

Must visit when in London. It was really amazing to see the Tower Bridge! it's such a beautiful bridge. It's really lovely to see if from the water if you take a river cruise and can go under it. Next time I visit, I'd love to walk across the bridge.

Imposing structure. We decided to view the bridge from the Thames by taking a circle tour that started at Bankside in front of the Tate Modern, then under Tower Bridge to a pier just east of the bridge. The view was spectacular.

Absolutely Iconic. But it's NOT London Bridge. It's just next to the Tower of London and it is the Tower Bridge. Hundreds of years of history in one bridge! It's amazing and nearly impossible to imagine the things the Bridge has seen. Not to mention been seen in. Many a movie has used this location but it is even more breathtaking in person. Stop off any of the many sightseeing buses, see the Tower of London and enjoy spectacular views of the Tower Bridge.

Mr Huseyin Dogan. If your visiting London this place is the first place you should visit before going anywhere else. Overall i loved this place as its staggered with history and lovely view of london. Dont forget to get a cup of coffee when visiting as it adds to the vibe. ;)
Great to see, especially via river cruise. I've seen tower bridge via foot and via river cruise, on the river cruise I was lucky enough to see tower bridge open and got some good photos
A Must See in London. Extremely crowded, so you will definitely be moving slowly. It is a good attraction to see on a clear day.

Do not confuse with London Bridge.....totally different. Tower Bridge is not the London Bridge. This bridge is a marvel. The tour (free with your LONDON PASS - recommended) includes a trip to the top and a walk between the towers. They have recently added glass flooring so you can look down upon the traffic (auto and pedestrian) and the river itself. Gets a little crowded as everyone wants to take pictures of themselves "floating on air" above the scene below. Be patient, people do move along. It also includes a trip to the engine room with an explanation as to how the bridge opens (from it's early times to modern times). A nice little self guided tour.

It's Tower Bridge, NOT London Bridge !. Walked the bridge after touring the Tower of London and found it to be interesting due to it's iconic stature. We didn't find it anything to get excited about but did find it interesting. The most amusing part was listening to almost everyone their calling it the London Bridge over and over.. It's the little things, LOL.

historic icon. You can walk, drive or cycle over the bridge (all 3?), and travel underneath on one of many ferry options. If you are really lucky - as we were - you will see it raised for a really large boat to pass through.

London Icon. Had a tour round here which took about 90 mins. Was good to see how it was built and the old photo's and films of London and the bridge from over 100 yrs ago. Nice and close to other sight seeing parts and easy to get to.
Worthwhile activity. Very interesting with views to rival the London Eye. We were macho and climbed to stairs ...good for bragging rights. If not so gun-ho you can take the lift.
amazing sight. A must see at night when its lit up from one of the many restaurants on Butlers Wharf - great to see it lift too to allow larger vessels to pass through.

Coolest. Bridge. Ever!. I have a strange bridge fetish (not in a sexual way..just thought I'd clarify that). I've seen some great bridges in my time (Charles Bridge, Chain Bridge to name a few) but this tops my list. I'm in awe of its beauty! The fact that is was built only 120 years ago doesn't detract from its beauty and uniqueness. A must see when visiting London!

Must do!. So vast and amazing to look at. Make sure to visit in the day and at night again. Walk along the river and enjoy its beauty. We went to the top on our visit - fun but not a must do. The London Eye has better views in my opinion.
Tower Bridge is a must!!. You should see tower beidge when you are visiting london because it is one of the most popular things in london!! All over it is great!!

Enjoyed visiting the top and engine rooms. We enjoyed the Tower of London. It is such a beautiful bridge it was great to see it from the inside and to learn more about the history. We enjoyed walking across the walkways at the top. As someone who is scared of heights I was a little freaked out by the glass floors in the middle, but you are able to walk along the edge instead. I also did get the courage to walk across the glass. I was a little disappointed by the views, as they are largely obstructed by the bridge structure. The engine rooms were also very interesting. It was cool to see the old steam engines that used to lift the bridge.
Great way to see the Bridge. . The glass floor experience was amazing. So cool to look down on the road unobstructed. Lots avoided the glass walkway so it was remarkably uncrowded down the middle.

Novel but unimpressive . An iconic London landmark with the addition of a glass floor. Very little inside the building itself and the ticketing staff are rather unhappy and unwelcoming. Cheap for London but worth a miss if you haven't got tickets online in advance.

One of the most famous places in the world a must for visitors and Londoners alike. Take the day off, walk over this iconic bridge, wait for it to open and wonder at the views, the scale and mechanics. if you are a visitor it's a must to take the tour even though there may be a queue. You cannot "do London" and not visit the bridge though walking across is free the tour of course costs..

Great design worth seeing up close. A great historical bridge that has a design matching the surrounding buildings. You can walk out over the roadway and look down at the traffic and river through the glass paneled walking area. Also the mechanical parts from days gone by are restored and very interesting to see on the lower level.
Must Visit. If you are in London, you can't miss to visit the tower bridge, this one of the must visit place. The ideal weather is in June, where you get plenty of sunshine and less of rains.

Fantastic Views, Great Experience. If you're not too tired after your Tower of London visit, worth doing or finding time on another day.Brilliant views from the walkway which is full of details on how the bridge was built. Also get to visit the engine rooms. Enjoyable and interesting.

Victorian Wonder. This attraction is worth pre-booking to avoid the queues. There are interesting displays charting the history and way in which this wonderful structure was built. There are a lot of steps!! The glass viewing platform was slightly disappointing. I suspect many people miss the best part which for me was the pumps and engine room - you need to leave the main exhibition, walk across the bridge and down some steps but this section was facinating to see how it all worked. Elegant victorian engineering!

Very glad we did this. My family did the Tower Bridge tour in London in July of 2016. Did we enjoy? Yes. Would we recommend it to friends? Yes. The tour was free with our London Pass. It was very interesting to see the bridge from the inside out. The glass floor was cool but it was difficult to get pictures because of all the people. Still I’m glad we did the tour.If you found my review helpful, please let me know that by clicking the Helpful Button. Thanks.

Stunning bridge. This is one lovely bridge and worth a walk over. Great photos and views from here. You can pay to do an extra tour inside but I didn't. It is very unusual and full of history. Doesn't cost anything to walk over it.

Great views. Very interesting, but the best bit is the views, looks like you will be waiting in line a bit but it moves quite quickly, lots of info and films but glass floor and views out are best bit

London icon - best seen from river cruise or promenade. You've not been a tourist in London if you haven't been to visit Tower Bridge. It's enough to see it close up from the the river bank and get your holiday snaps to prove you've been there. Unless you are particularly interested in engineering and machinery you don't have to pay to go inside the bridge towers. Try and view the Bridge from the river bank when the road bridge is due to open - usually 3 or 4 times a day - some days not at all.. The timetable can be found at the official web-site: http://www.towerbridge.org.uk/lift-times/.

A Must See While In London. We used our London Pass for the London Bridge and it was well worth the visit. It's such a beautiful bridge and there's lots of interesting information inside and it's fun to walk across. Our boys liked the glass floor so they could see all the way down to the boats.

Must visit, historical site. The Tower of London, Tower Bridge and London Bridge are all in one place. The London Eye is also nearby. Have to physically show my children that this is called the "Tower Bridge" and not "London Bridge" as depicted in many children's' books.

Walk along thames and visit this iconic bridge. It's a nice walk it's a historical walk, it's a leisure walk, it's architectural beauty and most of all a bridge being used by London erstwhile every day. I prefer to go at dawn when sun is setting (depends which month though). A must visit if in london
Kids loved it. Two girls age 9 and 10 went with us and enjoyed the tour. Fun to look up and down the Thames and watch the various ships, particularly when the bridge is drawn up.
Must have a photo. . Tower Bridge is an excellent attractions in London. If you are in London you will never go back home with out a photo of the tower bridge.

My kids loved the Glass floor!. This was well worth our time! We got the London Pass and went to many sights. This had to have been one of the favorites. It's a short self guided experience. Not too crowded and completely fun!

Its not called London Bridge.. I thought this bridge was called London Bridge because of Hollywood. Although London Bridge is nice don't get is confused with this bridge. It is beautiful and can be easily crossed to see more landmarks.

Great for Engineering Geeks. Tower Bridge is so iconic and close to the Tower of London that you should take the time to walk across and perhaps even catch an opening (they are schedule well in advance). If you are an engineering geek take the tour. You can go across the walkways connecting the towers and take pictures through the glass floors as well as visit the machine rooms which sadly are no longer required for opening and closing the bridge.

This bridge is fascinating!. This bridge is an icon for London. It was interesting to hear how it was built. You get to walk across the top and there is an area with glass so you can see the water below. I definitely recommend going on the tour.
Beautiful bridge. The bridge is beautiful, and photos from a river cruise are especially gorgeous. It is fun to walk across.

Day in London . Spend the day in London sight seeing it was very hot so very busy, we paid £9.00 each into Tower Bridge, very interesting short films playing in most areas of how the bridge was built and how London was back in the day, plenty of information about the bridge, there is a glass floor on the two walk ways great views and great fun for photos.
Tower Tour will take you Back in Time - The Stone Walls Make it Real. The Crown Jewels are Spectacular - it feels like we are time travelers. Such rich collection of another time. Loved the Ravens!
London Highlight. Again when in London, the capital of the world, do yourself a favour and check out the Tower Bridge, it is spectacular.
A must see. Definitely must see while in London. An amazing structure and so iconic of London. Saw the Tower Bridge from both the Tower of London and the river cruise

Walk the bridge. Take the time to walk the length of the bridge. It's beautifully constructed and very well maintained. Got caught in a rainstorm while crossing, know that there is not many places to duck for cover b

Family outing. Very crowded, no staff and security , rubbish everywhere under benches and child got lost ,should have one side going up and other side going down as parents trying to see and hard with buggies was upset to see it like this
Iconic!. Everyone recognises Tower Bridge, such an iconic bridge and amazing piece of architecture. One of many landmarks you should visit in London
Weekend visit. This is brilliant.Don't go if you don't like heights as their is a glass floor to look down at the road below.

Beware the glass floor!. What a neat little surprise part of our trip to London. We went to the bridge just to take photos and walk across and ended up purchasing the fairly reasonable tour option. Once inside and actually way up in the air walking across the bridge - we were stunned. Such an amazing visit.And beware the glass floors - talk about a dizzying view. ;)Wonderful and highly recommended.

Great place, museum but shocked about a sexist sign. The Tower Bridge is definitely worth a view if you're in London and the tour is not expensive. The staff is kind. However, I have been shocked about the Machine room sign. There were demonstrations of mechanisms of how the bridge works, including schemes and explanations. The sign read: 'Building Bridges: The Female Perspective'. To be honest, I have been really disappointed with the sexist sign. It's really a shame. I really thought London was open place for everyone.

One of London's most iconic sights. Worth the walk across whether you're visiting the Tower of London or not. It offers great picture opportunities, including of the bridge itself, which is a stunning piece of both engineering and architecture.

Beautiful Tower!. I regret not having time to do the Tower Bridge tour....but did walk across the bridge and view it from a river cruise. Spectacular architecture. Next time I will tour the Tower Bridge!

Great fun to visit, perfect for anyone.. Very interesting place to visit, especially if you are interested in the mechanics. For those that don't care so much about how it works, be sure to go up top to walk over the glass floor, it's quite disconcerting and fun at the same time!

Unusual experience - great idea. To be able to walk across this icon London Bridge at 42 metres above ground level is amazing. There are two sections with the floor removed and so you can look directly down at the Thames - I did and felt a little dizzy so just walked along the sides. There is also a mirror above so you can take selfies! You also get included a visit to the engine rooms. I also thought the gift shop had some very tasteful and reasonably priced items, not the usual London things you see everywhere.
Interesting. Good weather made this visit much better , views are fantastic, not sure about the view from the glass floor !!

Great Iconic View. This is a go to spot for tourists. The metro system in London is very easy to navigate to this location, and the best time to come is in the evening/night. The bridge lights up and gives a very beautiful look. This prime spot is also near city hall and there are several outdoor venues and street venues with good food in the area.

Takes over the horizon. Takes over the horizon... Such an iconic bridge… I'm always in aw when I see it ... You can walk across to her you can buy tickets into it .... Chose to walk across to a much better experience in my opinion
Walked by this on a Harry Potter walking tour.. It was so much fun seeing this after only seeing it in movies or in books. There was a lot of foot traffic.

London Bridge???. I took a sightseeing boat ride on River while in London. When I first spotted this beautiful bridge I was sure it was London Bridge. I was ever so wrong. Most people tend to think this is London Bridge. It has such beautiful architecture and is definitely an icon on the river. I would not pass up the chance to see this.

Another Piece of British History Not to be Missed. The Tower Bridge, which is great to see just from a distance, is even more impressive up close and taking the walkway between the two towers, including a glass floor (for those who don't get vertigo) with a great view of the Thames and the city.

Excellent Value. I went with a 5 year old and a 9 year old. We all loved the glass floor. I went as a child and it brought back fond memories. I think it's excellent value for money and has great views. I think if you are planning a visit it's worth looking up when the bridge is going up. The timings are on the website.

Good value for money. Brought tickets in the gift shop next to the Engine Room, gave us chance to fast track the Tower when we got to the Tower entrance. All staff extremely helpful, including the security guard having to do the bag checks.

Amazing place and surroundings. Amazing place and surroundings, the walk down the river is breathtaking with a lot of cafes, restaurants, shops, and kiosks. you can be lucky watching a ship passing under the bridge while it is open.
Must see. If you visit London, this is one of the landmarks you have to see. Good views from the bridge. Glass pathway is a nice touch.

Excellent. This was a most interesting and informative visit. I had done a little bit of research beforehand and the exhibition answered all my questions. A most enjoyable experience and not too crowded.

nerves of steel. I loved this and before the tour didn't realize that you actually got to walk across the top and through the bridge. Unfortunately the entry was a bit confusing and not very organised but once inside it was fantastic to go at your own pace. The walk across the top with the glass floor was amazing, I love heights but I am sure it would be very scary for some.Unfortunately we didn't get to see the bridge open and the times that it was opening were note easy to find out.
Iconic bridge. We walked across Tower Bridge to get to the Tower of London, very cool. There's an exhibit you can visit where you walk across a glass floor - not advisable for the faint-of-heart.

Fun photo opportunities. We didn't have to queue for very long to get in, and we visited on a Sunday in July. Prebooking tickets cuts your wait time quite substantially. We opted for the stairs, which, if you are physically able, is a real fun thing to do. You get to see all of the inside of the building, the metal work, etc.The exhibition at the top of the tower was good. Would have liked a bit more history. Same with the underground pump rooms, the signs were in odd places and it was very hard to read them without being in the way. There were a lot of interesting objects with no signs about what they were as well.It ends on a really dull note. The "Building Bridges: The Female Perspective" is the last thing before exiting through the gift shop, and it was really unclear about why it was there. Its such a shame as its a really interesting idea, but I had to go home and google it to know anything about it. Seems weird to call it the female perspective... Is the female perspective all soft and fluffy and about family/community? (with exception of Pauline Etim-Ubah). Would have preferred a exhibition ON historical women in industry.
Family Outing. Family day out, a very good thing to do , great views of London and the glass floor is a little scary .

Exciting history lesson for the kids !. My two boys - 12 & 9 loved walking across the bridge to the Tower of London and got a wonderful history lesson. We took the tube to the other end of the bridge and walked across. Good family friendly restaurants on both ends of the bridge.

Impressive View. We had driven over the bridge in the past, but this time we took the Expedition and walked the top deck with the glass floor and visited the Victorian Engine Rooms. There was a gorgeous view of the city but looking down the glass floor was a bit creepy. It did not seem to bother the youngsters who laid down to look! the Engine Rooms were interesting - this is an ideal visit for the whole family.
Day out . Day out with family went to see tower of London saw beefeater had photos taken lots of tourists walked over to see the brudge5 kids amazed good day out

Beautiful Architecture . Nice summer day visit with the perfect weather. Easy access via the subway, 2 minutes stroll from the subway station. It's a MUST visit when in London for the first time I guess.
weekend break. worth a visit tells you all the history of the bridge which is all very interesting.views are amazing was well worth going.

Quintessential London Attraction. If you go to London, you owe it to yourself to give this bridge a look. Like many North American kids, I was always under the impression this was THE "London Bridge". I had long since known the truth, even before visiting here, but I do find it amusing how even souvenir shops in London allow the mislabeling to continue. :) Anyways, there are numerous fantastic views available of the bridge, and it's open to the public. The architecture is impressive to say the least, and it's an fairly easy walk, only a few flights of stairs and there are lifts (elevators) available on either side of the bridge.
Magnificent Structure. We viewed this iconic structure from afar and snapped a few shots. The architecture and historical significance of this bridge made our trip to London all the more enjoyable.

Beautiful bridge. We did not take part in the Bridge tour, but admired the bridge from the shore and atop the wall of the Tower of London. We were lucky enough to see it open for a large boat to go through. It is a beautiful structure and a nice back drop for vacation pictures. Hope to take the tour whenever we return to London.
Nice view. I recommend you go to at sunset time. You can see the city buildings with the sun going down. The gray london sometimes comes red. Favourite place in London

Impressive.. Another one of those great British institutions and recognisable the world over as a quintessentially London landmark.
I walk across the bridge often and never cease to be impressed by not only the structure itself but the views also. Fun to see it opening as well.
Worth the walk. It is cool to walk over/on, even carrying a 5 year old the whole way. We didn't pay to go up as we had just done the Tower of London but do plan to the next time!

London's Icon. Just loved it!!!
Beautiful place, beautiful surroundings. A modern & antique mix that you will love.
A must see!
Amazing. A beautiful historic bridge, take time to enjoy the fabulous views of the Shard, City Hall, the hustle and bustle along the Thames. Spectacular when lit up at night.

Fun to walk across the glass floor at the Tower Bridge. We visited the Tower Bridge after spending time at the Tower of London. Was fun to learn about the construction and use of the bridge and we liked being able to walk across and take pictures on the glass floor.
Fab. Went to c the tower bridge it so brilliant and had some fab food by the side of it street food well worth a visit
Tower bridge - A must do!!. The tower bridge experience was lovely. The walk takes you through the tower bridge. Checkout the timings when the bridge would open.

Cool!!. Easy to use especially with The London Pass which also gets you into the engine rooms .
We were even lucky enough to see the bridge rise up😃

Great spot for a picnic. Lovely spot with the park on the south side, commonly I stop here and have a picnic whilst watching the city go by. Great to see when the bridge goes up. Lots of tourists is the only downside

excellent experience. you can't miss the complete tour inside the bridge: the video, the upper deck and then the small museum at the opposite end.
Really amazing, in fact this was my second time!!

Beautiful architecture!!!. Located near the well planned Borough market. It is a must watch. Make sure to see the timings when they raise the bridge. The London bridge tour is a little bland but one can go with it. You can walk across it and see the beautiful thames as well. Highly recommended to those visiting London.

Great exhibition glass floor.... Love the tower bridge it's a must see we have been to London many times but we actually paid £9 to go up an walk over the glass floor.. We think it's great value for money plenty of photo opportunities when you are on the glass floor.. Quite scary and exciting all at once! A must do if you are visiting London.. The bridge itself is just beautiful an worth just walking across it to appreciate its full beauty!

Grandeur indeed. I love the architecture found in England and the Tower Bridge is no exception, Its rich history which can be found on site makes it even more meaningful. Come at the right time of day and your pictures can be unbelievable.

yes that's right, it's not London Bridge. But it is the bridge in London that many people think of when they think of London Bridge (a few blocks away and somewhat non-descript.) Cool to see, great for photos, and they do occasionally raise the bridge. Seen in many times, always go back.

London calling. Anyone who hasn't been to London must add this historic bridge to their list of places to visit whilst in the capital. It's amazing, my grandmother used to play on this bridge as a small child in the early 1900's so it is a special place for me.
Must do when in London. Great to see and plenty of history built around it. Location is easy to get to and plenty of eating places close by

A Night at Tower Bridge. We came here twice: during day time and at night. We were lucky during the day visit to witness the lifting of the tower bridge to give way to a passing huge cruise ship. I would say, you should try to come back at nightfall when the view of the bridge is incredibly awesome due to the lights. Very romantic for couples to visit and sit by the bank.

Wait to see the bridge lift!. Have walked across the pedestrian path of the bridge several times. The most fascinating sight is when they lift the bridge for passing sea vessels. Timings can be found on official Tower Bridge website (Bridge Lift timings). The bridge is beautifully lit up in the night.PS: This is NOT London Bridge. That's a much more plain one!

Great experience. Tower Bridge is a London icon, it can be seen outside from the Thames banks, but I recommend buying the tickets for the Tower Brisge experience, a very interesting show inside the bridge, with several historical facts, interesting explanations of how different bridges in the world are constructed and various short movies.At the end of the tour it is possible to see the old engine room, showing wonderful powerful steam engines that were used to create hydraulic power for opening the bridge.Another nice tip : inside the bridge we learnt the timetable of the opening times for the week, so we could position ourselves close to the new city hall at the right time for the bridge opening.

Tower Bridge. We rushed in just before closing time. There isnt much to do there, but I was surprised to see pictures of various bridges from all around the world up there. The view on a clear day is fantastic. The best is the view of the road below, and the waters...from the glass walkway. Absolutely worth it.

Beautiful at night. A great place for photos. There is no need to hire a tour guide. I walked on the bridge on my own. Make sure to take photos from both sides of the bridge. As the sun is going down, take photos. Now be aware that it make be crowded with people.
A feast to the eyes. The Tower Bridge in London is definitely a must see.Details are mesmerising.A feat in engineering and architecture.

Bridge with Tower?. When you stand along the river and either look to ur left or right, it is definitely one of the most prominent bridge as it has two towers on each side. It looks romantic from far (but not too far coz it'll look tiny), and rather majestic (and rapunzel tower feel) as you stand on the bridge looking up the towers. An hour before the sun sets, take a slow walk from the bridge near St. Paul and towards Tower Bridge. It's lovely. But the borough market is nearby too so plan well.

This is an amazing beautiful bridge!!. This is the one you want to see. Don't bother with "The London Bridge". This is the one. It's breathtaking. Crazy that they built such beauty with such detail so long ago. This is a drawbridge also so stay around for it to open if you can. Just adds to the allure. MUST SEE!!!

Pretty. It's a bridge. It's got a good view and it's cool to walk across. Not sure what else to say. There is also an exhibit inside. Looked interesting but I didn't have time to go in. I hear they have a glass floor section of the bridge.
Always gret to see this icon. We sailed under it and drove over it o in a cab. The kids were excited because it is such an iconic image of London.

Grand bridge . Check out the bridge rising times and go toSee it . Very nice view from the docks. Walk across before they raise it another time . Definitely buy all the tours i.e. The glass floor, the engine room etc. great view of Tower of London from the bridge. Drive or walk across at night for different view point .

A London landmark . Love this bridge which connects North and South of London. It's always crowded there. Next to Tower of London. Soon some theaters from Central London will move to this area, will make it more happening place to visit.

Nice view. If this is your first time in London you should visit it, as it is pretty iconic.Anyway it offers what it is. Yes, it is a very nice and pretty unique bridge and it has some history behind, but beyond the view it is just a bridge. It has a gift shop nearby if you wanna buy something to remember.

Glass Floor at Bridge Opening Time!. For a family of 2 adults + 2 kids + 1 Free under age 5, it cost £20. Don't forget to pay attention to the bridge lift time www.towerbridge.org.uk/lift-times/ There are 2 glass floor. The 1st one is nice, but the better one is at the 2nd walk-bridge. You get passed the 1st glass-floor, walk to the end and turn around into the other walk-bridge. The 2nd glass-floor is amazing with Mirror on the Ceiling!! Be there when the bridge is lifted! It's about 1 hour tour, excluding the Engine Room which would take additional 30 minutes. There is only 1 toilet at each floor when you walked up. So don't get hang up and wait and que at the 1st toilet you come across. Move on to the next floor and you would definitely see another toilet!
Wonderful place with excellent view. Visited the place last month. Magnificent bridge with an awesome view. We stayed near the place and were fortunate enough to cross by the bridge each morning
Can't miss!. Beautiful! The Tower of London provides an excellent view. Dinner at Butlers Wharf is a superb spot to experience in the evening. And you can also "cruise" by.

Must do. went to the tower bridge experience ,so easy just walk in join small queue and within minutes you are in the lift up to the top where you can watch a quick film on the history of the bridge . Then out onto the bridge the views are amazing, dont forget to walk over the glass floor and watch the boats sailing by under your feet.

Tower bridge is the fastest way to go visit the tower of london. My daughters and I spent a day walking around the tower of london and the tower bridge. We just fot off a plane from Canada and were tired as we were getting pver jet lag.This is a great activtiy when you need to stay awake. Walking walking and more walking.

Really impressive!. Being from the states when always heard about the London Bridges and I had a picture in my mind that I thought was a true representation. But after seeing the Tower Bridge I realized I had never even seen a picture of the bridge. I definitely would have remembered the blue accents. This of course makes the bridge very distinctive. Aside from the color the bridge is truly magnificent because it is large and ornate and as appealing lines. It is so wonderful to to see examples of beautiful architecture and stonework. One just doesn't see things like this in the states. The bridge is lovely to admire from the river side or the tower or even just walking across it.

Just have to see. We waited until dark to do our visit, It is one of the Just Have To See places in London.It is also very close to several other attractions.Just do not miss the chance to take the tour.Leroy & Tonya PeughCedartown, GA USA

Tower Bridge Tour. The tour is a little bland. There is a viewing from the top to the bridge below, which is packed with tourists trying to funny photo. The best part was the incredibly charismatic guide on the elevator on the way out.

do i need elaborate. one of the must dos in london. and whohas not seen it or sang London bridge is falling down.....take a boat tour going under and make sure you visit it in the night.... the Thames flowing below... its a sight to behold

Interesting Experience. It was a pleasure visiting this bridge, apart from learning about the bridge, the experience of walking on the Glass looking down at the cars was great, i was a bit scared at first. Amazing idea here.

Very romantic! . A must do when in London. Such a romantic place to spend the end of your afternoon. There are many restaurants and pubs around where you can finish the night having a great fish & chips.

Iconic. Such an iconic bridge - not much more to do than have a walk across it and grab photos in front of it...but still enjoyable to see as the surrounding areas are lovely and obviously it's right on the Thames!

Great for a picture.. If visiting London I would highly recommend visiting Tower Bridge, especially for a picture at night when it is lite up.
They also do tours but I have never done this.
It is also interesting when they raise the bridge to let big boats through.
Perfect for a romantic walk, enjoy the sunset together.. Perfect for a romantic walk, enjoy the view over the river Thames and the view of the sunset together.
Walked over it.. Interesting, bit nothing really spectacular. Yet, when you want to visit the Tower, this is good walk way to get there.

so cool!. So iconic you have to go!We took a boat tour to the bridge which I would recommend! There were multiple brands of boat tours that left from the Big Ben area which stopped here and there and gave information about the city as you traveled towards the bridge.I would definitely recommend the tour of the bridge too! It is quick and very interesting and the see-through portion of the walkover is very cool if you like heights! We did both the boat tour and bridge tour in the AM before 11 and it was not too crowded...we also bought our tickets for the bridge tour there and had no issues with having to wait long.The staff my sister and I interacted with was all friendly and helpful!

fun landmark. This is a very well maintained interesting landmark. We bought tickets and used the walkway over the top of the bridge. There are facts, photos and short movies in different areas when you purchase the self tower tour, worth it we thought.

Best Bridge in Town. Loved the tower bridge! Often confused with London bridge. Go up and walk over the Thames on the glass floor. Check out the engine room. Grab a pic with the friendly bobbies. Great views. Close to everything we combined it with HMS Belfast, and the shard.
Iconic. Saw this many times as we spent our time in Central London. The view from the City Cruises River Red Rover boat is the best.
Interesting bridge. It amazes me how such a large bridge was made, we had a London pass and the view you get to see is amazing.
Majestic and captivating!. Took some photos while at the tower bridge! Amazing! Had an awesome feeling seeing it up close. Just like when I first saw the Eiffel tower!

Often Mistaken as the London Bridge!. The Tower Bridge, both an auto bridge and pedestrian walkway features fantastic view in all directions. We toured the Thames via boat and by bus and viewed the beauty of this magnificent piece of functional architecture. One note: the walkways allow views from below to see you walking above, ladies wear your knickers under your skirt.
Spectacular. Visiting this iconic bridge is a must. To walk the glass floor is an amazing experience. Well set out with traffic flow always moving.

Must see. Ok, you are in London and for sure you gonna see the Tower Bridge. Its really impressive and I would really recommend to cross it yourself to get an idea of the size and have a chance to catch the many architectural details.
Day out. Great place to visit. Very impressed with glass floor. Enjoyed the views over the river and watched the bridge opening to let a boat through.

A must-see. Definitely have to visit this historic sight while in London. Great for taking pictures of. You can do tours of the inside but I personally think it's more picturesque to be on the outside looking at the Tower Bridge than to be in the Tower Bridge looking out. There are many other areas to take pictures of the river. A nice walk alongside the river to visit the Bridge is a very relaxing walk also.

Impressive. Altough we had seen it on pictures and it seemed very nice, when we saw it with our own eyes, we were still amazed by how beautiful it is. Also, the glass walkway is highly recommended. The engine rooms and short clips they show are also very interesting.
a MUST. A wonderful experience! Our tour lasted one and a half hours and the guide was enthusiastic and knowledgeable. We learned a lot about the mechanics and history of the bridge
name of tower. i travel in river in boat lovely to very close this is one top attractions see cinema but can enjoy more when see closely
Don't miss!. Incredible place and should not miss if first trip to London! Plan on at least three hours to visit and try to get there early to avoid crowds.

You must when the bridge opens (splits). This bridge has the option of a glass walk on the top also, which is amazing with kids.Also, it's a sight to watch, when the bridge opens (splits), & the ferries pass by, from underneath it.
Nice. Loved the glass floor and the views from above are great but skip the engine rooms..not worth your time.

wimbledon trip. great experience to walk over, was raised on way back. believe it is built from wicklow granite but not sure great structure
walked around whole area so beautiful

Beautiful Solid Structure. Tower Bridge is defenetly worth visiting, if you are in London (although it's located quite far from the center). It's very beautiful from all views: from the inside and from the both coasts. Also you can find nice teahouse and warm honey nuts there, which make the whole walking much cozier.

HIGH IN THE SKY. We fast tracked entry because we had a London Pass. You go up in a large lift so do not have to climb the stairs. Its amazing since the bridge was built in 1894. At the top you can walk on the glass footpath and look down to the street below, in one area there is mirror so you can see yourself on the walkway. For those who do not want to walk on the glass floor there is room to walk along side.

Iconic bridge. This is the bridge you cross over to get to the Tower of London, if you are also on the other side of the river, this is the bridge that that an American thought he had bought, unfortunately the bridge he had bought was not this one. When the bridge he had bought was taken down, shipped to the USA, and then rebuilt in Arizona, he was upset to find it was not the one he thought he had boughtThe bridge opens to allow boats to pass through, years ago when the bridge was up, people would climb up the stairs and cross across the top, this area became known for prostitutesNow you can get a lift up to the top where the views are fantastic and there is an exhibition about the history of the bridge. Close by you can go down below ground to see how the drawer bridge works, there is a charge for this and the ride to the topThere is a charge to visit both exhibitionsAn interesting historical iconic bridge

Inside view of Tower Bridge. Happened across the tour info as we were heading to the Tower of London and decided to go in. Took the tour of the engine room - the Victorian era machinery was beautiful, some of the tools on display were bigger than my 7 year-old! After that tour, we walked across to tour the upper bridge. The line for the elevator was long, so we opted to climb the stairs. Cool off-the-beaten-path experience. Lots of info in videos and placards up top; several section of the floor are glass. A large tween tour group sat on the glass floor panels, we had to step over them to get past. Glad we took the time to tour
Nice View. We enjoyed our walk over it from the Tower of London side of the Thames to the London Eye side. The bridge is somewhat interesting, but the riverwalk on the other side is really the treat.

Come get your facebook picture. "Omg its the london tower bridge!" When you actually get there, its a cool bridge but its still just a bridge. Its one of those landmarks you just get a picture of to show that you were there. I recommend getting the picture from Tower of London which will get you a great picture due to the angle.
Great site. Loved visiting this historic site and engaging in the atmosphere of the grand stature. The afternoon was perfect.
Beautiful. Passing by this place, from a shot distance, at night, it's just mind blowing! It's one of the most beautiful views you'll ever see in your life!
very interesting. beautifull place . very interesting to see how they built such a bridge more than handred years ago !
Worth the visit. Well worth the money to go inside and over the tower bridge. Interesting exhibit and the walk over the bridge gives a different perspective with great views.
Good for kids. The workings of the bridge are especially interesting for boys. There is a great tour and it is included in the London Pass. Allow about 90 minutes
Beautiful sight at night. We walked to the bridge late in the day in order to see if at night. It is lite up at night and lots of people visiting late in the day. Be sure walk across the bridge.

A favorite spot. On a nice day it is lovely to sit on the grass in view of the bridge and people watch. You can see the tour boats on the river, occasionally see them lift the drawbridge to let a ship pass under. You can see kayakers paddle by while you board a sightseeing boat. Or you can visit the nearby London Tower. Nice spot to visit for sure.

The bridge. This has to be the most iconic bridge in London. Well worth a visit. Take a tour to the engine room, or up the towers and across the upper walkways or just take a stroll across it. You can't really visit London and not visit this bridge.

Great views from the glass walkway. Booked this on line and paid just £8 for each of us to go. Money well spent!We checked the bridge opening times on the website before planning our day. We watched one bridge opening from the riverside and then, an hour later, viewed a second from Tower Bridge glass walkway above street level.When you visit the bridge you start at street level and can either take a lift or walk the 200+ stairs to the top of the North Tower. The stairs are roomy and their are places to stop for a quick rest if you need to. There are also toilets at some levels as you walk up/down. When you get to the to, the views are stunning and it's great to watch the boats travelling back and forth.The glass walkway is brilliant. We were both pretty scared to walk on this initially but got braver as time went on. Once you're across the walkway, there is somewhere to sit and watch a video about the bridge before visiting the second walkway.When you exit the tower, you follow a route to the engine rooms. These are really clean and informative. Great attraction for little money - well worth it.Please click below if you found this review helpful.

Love London Bridge. Definitely one of the sights of London! I do thoroughly enjoy going for a walk across it. On Halloween weekend 2015, I actually did the London Bridge Experience with some friends. It's really nicely done, and it's great to walk up all those steps inside the Tower Bridge! The walk across the top is also fab, history of the bridge but also a brief history of bridges in general and how technology has advanced them! Worth doing, only takes an hour, good value for central London!

Highly recommended!. It's worth heading to both at daytime and night to see. Myself and my partner purchased tickets for the Tower Bridge Exhibition and it was worth every penny, plus it was reasonably priced too. The views you get of London on a clear day are incredible, plus the added bonus of seeing the traffic and pedestrians under your feet is great.An enjoyable couple of hours sent finding out more about this iconic bridge and all it's features.
An other must see in London. All people that go to London have to go see the Tower Bridge, you have to walk on it as well and admire the work that was put into the bridge

The Bridge. Our tour group came up close to the Tower Bridge and we get to take so many pictures as we could. The area where we park must be a local knowledge because it's by the court house and office building, not really a tourist accessible place.

Walked on the glass floor on the top level. We walked on the bridge and did take the tour to see the engine rooms (I am not an engineering person, so not very interested, but I liked going all the way to the top and walking/ sitting on the glass floor. They have some pictures of famous bridges from around the world which was interesting and other than that, there's not much to do.Then we walked off the bridge towards the Mayor's office building to view the opening and closing of the bridge which happened to be at the same time.Then we walked back across the bridge towards the Tower of London side and had these yummy red pepper chicken pizzas at one of the food tents outside the Guoman Hotel, the booths are part of the hotel. Even though it was raining, we were nice and dry under the tree next to the food tent.There are good photo ops, from the Tower of London side, as well as from the Mayor's office side.

Not worth the money. Just a check mark in my book. I wasn't fascinated by the glass floor or the engine room. Maybe it's because I have seen one too many similar structures... The ticket line was just a couple of people. I was in line on a Friday afternoon in July.

Engineering Marvel. This bridge was built over a century ago. To have an opening bridge based on steam engines just shows the engineering brilliance of humans. The glass floor experience is one of a kind. If your an engineer, the engine room is a sight to enjoy.

Great Views. Well worth the trip up for the glass floor walk across the top. Not very expensive at under £8 per person. An interesting insight to the history behind the bridge and some great views too.

Finally here. When planning to London, we wanted to visit London Bridge and when we are in London, someone explain to us that the old bridge was London Bridge while the new one was Town Bridge, so we walk along the 2 bridge & City Hall
Make sure you visit the Engine room. Free with the London Pass. Very interesting how the bridge operates. Also walked along the bridge with the glass floor to look down on the river.
Why did we cross the bridge?. Why cross the bridge? To get to the other side. Yes it's a good photo op but that's about it. Not worth a tour.

Right out of the Story Books. A must visit for anyone coming to London, this place is a combination of the old and the new, with historic sights and modern marvels all coexisting in harmony around it.
Leisurely stroll. This is a must do after visiting the Tower of London. It is a nice walk and after I would recommend continuing along with other side of the Thames to London Bridge.
Tower Bridge!. I always thought this would be the London Bridge but this isn't. Most tourists get confused. The tower bridge is wonderful to look at after the sun sets.

Cycle or Walk, just be prepared for crowds. This is an amazing bridge and when it is has raised the bridge to let a ship pass, it's amazing to see. However, being a tourist attraction, it is super busy and the walkways (especially around some of the corner structures) can be difficult to pass but worth a walk across for the views and the experience. I cycled this too which was a little more intimidating with all the traffic.
Nice walk. Train to tower bridge and I walked across the river . Then walked to London bridge . Nice walk on a nice warm afternoon

Beautiful Bridge Flying Across The River Thame. The construction style of the bridge makes it a congruent part of the London Tower. We didn't get on the two towers on the bridge, but admired it from the distance just came out of Tower of London. We crossed the bridge another time on the cruise coming back from Greenwich. Obviously viewing f on the boat is the best way to see the bridge, as there is no obstruction and no crowd bombing into your pictures.

Just Ok. Don't get me the wrong, you should definitely go see the Tower Bridge. It's makes for a great back drop to a keepsake photo from your time in London. That said, the exhibition is lackluster. The glass floors are actually quite small and people tend to crowd around them, so you don't get too much of a view unless you wait it out. And the outward views of the Thames are foggy because the glass windows are dirty and scratched. At least there is an elevator!

Free to look at!. Well it's a beautiful bridge, and it's free to look at, so take lots of pics and enjoy the scenery! I found one of the best picture ops was when we were inside the Tower of London with the bridge in the background.
Yay big ben. What can you say about Big Ben glistening in the beautiful golden evening sunshine with a blue sky and blowing clouds behind. FANTASTIC.

Impressive. Impressive sight to see from a distance and you don't fully realize how big it actually is until you're walking under it. Much better in person than in photos by far. Also an amazing place to view the sunset which sets on the west side. Chances are you'll see many tourists there, even locals, watching the sunset among the buildings. Truly amazing view. Easiest way to reach Tower Bridge is arriving through Tower Hill underground tube station which leaves you right in front of it essentially.You can't say you've been to London if you haven't been here, simple as. Every time I go to London I end up passing by.

Walk by, no need for the tour.. Its a beautiful iconic symbol of London. Definately walk over the bridge. There is also a great place under the city side of the bridge with 15 to 20 tents serving good street food if its a nice day. No need to pay for the tour, just sit and appreciate the view.

This is history. Wow. What a place. Just don't go to Starbucks They want you to pay for the bathroom first. Total losers. Highly recommend getting British or e en Italian coffee before they rake you over the Starbucks bathroom. 40 years of Starbucks buys and they give me garbage. Train your employees Starbucks. Do it now.
Beautiful bridge. Beautiful bridge over the River Thames near the Tower. Tower Bridge is another place that you must see in London. Definitely I recommend it.

Must see attraction!. As one of the symbols of England and London the Tower Bridge is a must! The coolest thing is, that you can even enter the bridge and use the elevator to go on the next floor. We learned a lot about the history of the bridge and got a cool floor over the river Thames!

WHAT A BEAUTY!!!. This bridge is just so iconic and quintessential London. It is a gorgeous structure and wonderful to be able to walk over it.
It is easy to get to by underground or by one of the river boats.
It is not to be missed!
Good for bike ride. It is realy nice to take a walk or bike ride, to just look around realy nice view. There are a lot of place to take a picture, if you capture sunset moment it would be marvelous
Lovely. Beautiful bridge, just how you see it in the travel brochures. Great to see the red buses and london cabs ..picture perfect

eautiful sight...must see. Went over the bridge at sunset. Its stunning, can stay here a few hours.
Next time, I would go up and in and the bridge
the most famous bridge. The tower bridge is a beautiful art of construction . Before visiting the bridge we visited the Tower. A nice combination.
Wow. It was everything we expected and more. The history part was informative and held our interest. The glass walking part was so awesome. And the views were spectacular.
Insight into great British innovation. Not a long trip, but to finish the day off was worth a trip to see how it all works even down to the engine room, great glass floor experience on the walkways.
Beautiful Bridge. I did not walk over the bridge but I definitely enjoyed admiring it and took many pictures as I took a stroll along the water.
Just as good as the photos. Just wonderful. Walked across several times just because it's such an interesting structure and got to see it raised to let a sailing boat through.

Great to walk across at night. You must walk across the bridge and also find spots to take a daytime picture and nighttime picture. I have both and it really is amazing the difference. It is a must do - if not walk - ride a bike. While you walk over don't forget to go down to St. Catherine's Docks, los of restaurants and very nice area to visit.
Stunning bridge. Stunning Bridge! A lot of art has gone into this bridge, lovely to look at. If visiting London it is definitely worth a visit!
You have to see it.... My second favorite spot to see in London after big ben... The bridge is really impressive and You have to see it if You are in London...

grand and beautiful. spectacular and fun bridge to walk across, lively and bustling with visitors from around the world, this bridge is not only visually beautiful and architecturally iconic to London but also an art piece with colorful bright lights complementing a magnificent walk. A staple of London.

A must-see for toruists. The tower bridge is iconic, but to really enjoy it you have to look inside. The floor is completely made of glass and you can see the busy road below. Do not go if you are scared of heights.

Lost for words. I am almost lost for words. This bridge is amazing. We did the walk around the structure, and spent a lot of time just staring at the amazing sight that is this bridge. There are lots of additional features that you can look at such as engine rooms, and the dining room (thats not a typo!), as well as just enjoying watching the boats float by. We didn't get to see the bridge open, so will be back to try see that again.

Great piece of history. The draw bridge still works but only a few times a month as compared to the 30 times each day that it was raised in the past. A great landmark best viewed from boat tour or bus tour.
Surreal . Absolutely beautiful and surreal to see in person. It's big, bold, and a world landmark. Make sure to cross it on your visit to London, it is well worth it and makes for fabulous pictures.
Awesome. Drove over the bridge and was very excited thinking about what history this bridge has seen. Beautiful.

Famous Drawbridge!. Recognized throughout the world and instantly associated with the city of London, this famous drawbridge is not nearly as old as it looks. Built in 1894 and still very much in use, it spans the Thames River carrying both people and vehicles. Free to cross and view. Explore the most famous bridge in the world and visit the Tower Bridge Exhibition. The walkways offer fantastic views of many of London's most well-known sights and the Victorian Engine Rooms house the original steam engines, awesome machines whose immense power once raised the bascules of the bridge. A "virtual bridge lift" shows how the bascules still rise today to let ships pass beneath the Walkways. It is often mistakenly thought to be London Bridge by tourists. Free ExteriorTube Stations: Tower Hill or London Bridge

Tower Bridge Frequently confused with London Bridge. The Tower Bridge London is the Iconic Bridge of London, not the London Bridge. Often confused.Needs to be corrected through such fora as Trip Advisor.This is open for vehicles and pedestrians.Close to the London Tower....some steps have to climbed up and down.A bascule bridge with two bridge towers built on piers. The central span was split into two equal bascules or leaves, which could be raised to allow river traffic to pass. This happens often but not daily...one needs to check out opening and closing (raising and lowering) online or on ground to get the correct times for viewing. It's spectacular by night or day....Memorable event

Always wanted to walk across . It's a must.. It may not be very old , it may be only mock-Gothic , but it's visually stunning from a distance and close up. The walk across is an unmissable experience ( obviously no one in their right mind would want to drive around London). It also provides different views of other landmarks and I was particularly pleased that it was in such close proximity to The Tower.Mere words can't describe the whole experience.

A bridge to see. Great piece of history. First of all, London bridge is NOT Tower Bridge. Both are different. The Tower bridge is just near to the Tower Hill of London. The best view of the tower bridge is from the sides of Tower hill and from the St.Katherine Pier. It was a pleasant view from either side of the banks of Thames. One can kill time here easily sitting on the banks near the Tower bridge.
not to be missed!!!. i always recomend to my friends and family.is one of the london attractions not to miss.great views from top and a very relaxed atmosphere.

Amazing views. We decided to visit tower bridge as it sounded interesting. I thought the price £9 for adults and £3.50 was very reasonable for London prices. You can get this cheaper if you pre-book online.We had to wait in a small queue as there was only one till operator working when we went. We decided to climb up the stairs of the tower instead of getting the lift which was interesting! When you get to the top there are a lot of interesting facts about the tower and how it was built etc. There are also glass floors so you can see the traffic on the bridge below. If you time it right you can see the bridge being raised.You also get the chance to see the engine room and see how the bridge is raised which is interesting
Astonishing. The detail and history of this bridge is amazing. We had views from the top and got to see the bridge open, as a yacht went through. A must see when in London.
Tower Bridge - fantastic. Did the Tower Bridge tour - well worth the money.Great insight into the history and mechanics of the bridgeThe glass walkway was excellent
Lovely bridge. This iconic old bridge is best photographed either from London Bridge or with the Tower of London in the background. Also good views from the river boat tours on a nice day.

Awesome from start to finish!. Definitely an exciting thing to do! You should not miss seeing the engine room either! The bridge itself is quite beautiful , the views are amazing and the overall experience says...Totally worth it!

Great site for pictures. Tower Bridge is like walking in a life movie, not sure how to express it but all around it there are restaurants, people walking and taking pictures. It is a must see structure. I recommend walking over and under the bridge via Queen's Way. This is a great point to take pictures of the river and boats, it is located at a sort of industrial yet modern side of London.

Iconic Building . Quite an interesting tour of the building, its history and the engine room, the glass walkway was also fun, a must to visit whilst in London the tour took around about an hour. Highly recommend.

Just a walk across the bridge is great. We didn't do the Tower Bridge Experience or the glass walkway, but just a walk across the bridge is great. We loved seeing it lit up a night and also enjoyed views of it during the day. One of London's true icons!
Huge bridge. We saw this when we went to the tower, we did not go on the bridge but you can. it looks like it is well maintained

An Iconic Symbol of London. This symbol is recognizable the world over. As part of the London Pass we were able to visit the viewing deck and the museum. It is well worth it if you have the London Pass and are able to visit the other attractions in the area. Takes about an hour to visit.
What a monument!. I have seen and walked the majestic Tower Bridge many a time, yet it always puts me at awe again when I come back.An engineering feat and a gem of the city of London!
History and architecture. went on the river boat and then road the Hop on Hop off bus across the bridge, a must see when you visit London

Must-see site in London. If you're visiting London, odds are that you'll see the iconic Tower Bridge. It's a beautiful piece of architecture/infrastructure. You should definitely take the time to walk across the bridge and take in the views of the city.

interesting to pass the time of day. interesting structure. very old bridge. fun to walk on, but to visit the inner workings of the bridge, if you have time to waste in england. yes visit, other a picture of the bridge is just as good

A great tourist thrill. Had a great time visiting the Tower Bridge, the price is £9 for an adult, not bad really for a London attraction.The lift was out so the walk up the tower steps was exhausting, about 500 approximately.But when your at the top, the views are stunning, beautiful views of the city from both sides of the walkways with a knee trembling glass walkway right in the middle, a completely insane feeling whilst walking it which does scare you until you get used to it.Brilliant for the information of how the bridge was built all those years ago.A great bit of fun.

Iconic symbol of London. This iconic symbol of London was built between 1886-1894 and is absolutely worth a visit and a must see when you're in London.The total length is 244 metres and its height is 65 metres.For GBP 9,00 you can go inside and have a look in the engine room and go on the glass floor to have a stunning view over the river and the city.On the north bank of the river Thames next to the bridge you'll find several places to eat and relax and of course there's a Starbucks. If you walk a little further, just behind the Tower Hotel, you'll find an interesting & beautiful small harbour called St. Katharine Docks, with many restaurants like The Dickens Inn and the Medieval Banquet, where you can eat medieval style. Here you can also find Gloriana, the Queen's rowbarge.Finally a absolutely must-do for those who like to walk: if you go over the Tower Bridge and go right for about 800 metres, you end up at a great promenade along the southbank of the Thames River that goes all the way to the London Eye (and further), with many restaurants, bars, coffeeshops and even beaches and boardwalks!

My favourite London icon. A grand old structure that is amazing up close. The design is wonderful but I also love the blue paint. You can walk across and there is a museum of sorts midway. Can get great shots while doing a river cruise.

the other side of London. We had no idea that it's that far from London eye so plan to go to it with somewhere else . We to took the bus to Aldgate and walked then .I don't think that the is best way to get there ,but I enjoyed seeing the other side of London there.

great experience . unfortunately when we went there the elevator was broken and we had to walk up the stairs to the glass walkway (over 200 steps ). The walkway is cool and gives a nice chance to take amazing photos especially when the bridge opens underneath. ..
Beautiful . Beautiful architecture as it was built to look like the tower of London however it was only built 120 years ago
Get that London experience. For one, the bridge is pretty to look at, so you can just lounge in front of it at the South Bank with a nice sandwich and youre good.
Short but sweet. Really enjoyed our trip here, especially the glass walkways with fantastic view across London and down to the road below. Would definitely recommend!

Incredible Bridge. This was a very interesting tour. I enjoyed it much more than I thought I would. I loved the glass where you could see the barges going through underneath. The engine rooms were also very interesting. We had the London Pass which took us to the front of the line, and which included the bridge tour.

Beautiful Bridge. This is a beautiful bridge! We pre purchased tickets online and it was 23GBP for our family of 5. We took pictures from every angle and took the walk across the "glass floor". It is more inserted glass panes in the center than a full glass floor. But still interesting. Great views! The engine room was also very interesting.
Interesting building. Not so expensive, paid 9 pounds, and you were allowed to go up in both towers, see the glass floor and see the old engine room.

awesome view. if you walk to the middle of the bridge, you'll get a beautiful view of the city and the river. if you have the london pass, you should definitely go to the tower bridge exhibition, because you can walk through the walkway above. However, I'm not sure if I would pay to see that exhibit.

Definitely not a must do. I was disappointed I did not do this on my first trip to London so went out of my way to do go there this time. It was most overrated. Unless you are getting it on a London pass don't bother. The engine rooms are underwelming, the top level walkway has poor views of the city because of the bridge structures and the glass floor is quite gimmicky.
Gorgeous. Grandiose and stunning, it is something you have to see when in London. Magnificent architecture and gorgeous views from above complete the experience.

Busy but good views. Gives a lovely view of the Thames, and although we didn't do it, the walk up the towers and across the top section of the bridge looked good. Of course, as it's a public road bridge, it is very busy and noisy as the traffic goes past, and all the people walking past makes it hard to have your photo taken. However, if you see it open for ships, it's a good sight to see and you can get some great photos.

Excellent Value for Money, Really Informative and Interactive. Visited Tower Bridge last Sunday and it was great to do something different on our day out to the Capital. It cost about £20 for a family of four and it was £20 well spent. A good tip for you if you are planning to go is to get your Ticket from the wrong side of the bridge near the engine rooms. The main visitor centre gets crowded but there is a small gift shop at the end of the tour where you can buy your tickets from. We started at the engine rooms and once finished made our way across the bridge and skipped the queues to the main attraction. There is a bag search as you go in and you can choose to go up the tower using the lift or the stairs. Unfortunately the lift wasn't working that day but honestly if you can do the stairs it is so much better. The structure inside is amazing to see and you would miss it all if you took the lift. There are plenty of benches on the way up for you to take a rest if needed. I don't consider myself a fit person but I handled them without any problems.There are exhibitions, facts and videos at the top of the stairs and along the walkway above the bridge itself. The views are stunning! The glass floor is brilliant and kept the kids entertained for a while.At the other side of the walkway it wasn't very clearly signposted, but you need to take the lift down, there doesn't appear to be any stairs down this tower. This can get quite busy but the lift is quite large and can fit a lot of people in one go.The whole trip only takes about an hour and a half and is easily accessible from London Bridge Tube Station. It's well worth a visit if you're looking for something different to do in London without breaking the bank.

Fascinating. I did a tour of the bridge, seeing the interior and engine room of this world famous icon was really interesting. Walking across the top and looking down at the road below had a lot of people clinging to the edges but was fun.

Awesome undiscovered gem (no, really!).. OK, I know you're thinking 'Tower Bridge, undiscovered?!'. But honestly, everyone comes to take photos of Tower Bridge. But most miss the fact you can walk over the blue-coloured skybridge in the photo, recently upgraded to feature a stunning walk-on glass floor. So you can walk over - and look down on - cars, taxis, busses, boats etc. Not to be missed. And surprisingly quiet. 10 out of 10.

Fantastic. Loved this trip, took family from France & they really enjoyed the spectacular views from the bridge!! Glass walkway is freaky but fantastic! An absolute essential to do when visiting London!

Better to view from water than go up . This was included w our London Pass. Had it not been, I definitely wouldn't find it worth it. the highlight is looking down at the water through the plexiglass up top, which is kind-of cool, but otherwise, not that great. Just photos of other significant bridges, a little history of this bridge. Generally underwhelming. Views much better looking at bridge from water or even below.
This is a great bridge, I've been across it loads.. It's a good bridge, but sometimes the road lifts up and you can't cross over which is a bit annoying. Otherwise it's nice.

The most fantastic sight. This is the most iconic sights in London. I had the pleasure of running the London marathon in April 2016 and Tower bridge is slap bang in the middle of the marathon route. It honestly takes your breath away. It is beautiful.

Night time bridge lift. An iconic London landmark, you will see this famous silhouette on many a tourist tea towel or souvenir mug. Tower Bridge is definitely worthy of a visit, whether you sail under it, walk or drive over it, or ascend to the glass floor walkway. If you want to see the bridge open to allow tall masted ships to sail through, check the bridge lift times on the Tower Bridge website.
