At night when floodlit, the bridge has a different atmosphere again. One of my favourite London memories is sitting at the outdoor tables of the Tower Hotel Brasserie with a drink, watching the floodlit bridge open late at night to allow a boat through. Very atmospheric.

Don't be embarrassed....take 500 pix...it's Tower Bridge. There's no getting around it, this is spectacular. I took 500 pictures, some in the daylight, some in the evening, and from every angle and it all looks amazing.
Amazing. If you are in the area, why not go over the tower bridge? Another slice of history you can walk over and experience
Awesome Tour. The Tower Bridge was included in our London Pass...so of course we toured it. We were in awe when we found out what we were able to do and see. I thought it was impressive.
Breathtaking. Quite a walk from the hub of London life but absolutely stunning up close! Didn't go for the tour as didn't feel the need to, just walking along it is sufficient to appreciate it
Loving walking on this historic beidge. Many prominent pictures of London feature the Tower bridge so we decided to walk on it on our trip to see the crown jewels! It is truly awe inspiring.

Another London Signature . Well this structure is perfect for every photographer and everyone to take creative picture. It is free to pass the bridge but you need to pay for the tour which will bring you to the top of the bridge. It is a dream come true for me to walk on the bridge from side to side. It is crowded but what can you expect from the famous landmark. The sidewalks help walkers to cross the bridge smoothly. Another signature that cannot be missed while in London. There is a lesson for me and everyone that taught this is the London Bridge. Well this is not the London Bridge. This is the Tower Bridge and keep that on mind. The London Bridge is just across from the Tower Bridge and there is no tower there but a simple sign board of London Bridge which surprised me because all the time I was imagine that the London Bridge is the one with the tower.
Beautiful bridge. It was very lovely to walk the bridge and get a nice view on River Thames. Good experience and doesn't take too long.
Tower Bridge experience . At £9 for adults this is considerably inexpensive! We were so lucky with the weather on our 4 day trip! We also were there for the opening and closing of the bridge!
nice view. fantastic view from the S bank of the river. I have to say it's one of the most beautiful icon in London. a must go
Amazing Architecture !!!. The best way to experience this bridge is by walking. The peaceful Thames river under it a beautiful sight. Lovely way to enjoy London !!
Must See. You can't visit London without seeing the Tower Bridge. It is truly amazing to see it in real life! We really enjoyed
More a Photo Backdrop Than a Place To Visit. It looks great in our photos, but it's not much to visit. We were lucky enough to be on a bus when the bridge was raised for a passing ship.
Must see. Tower Bridge is stunning and is a must see in London. We were fortunate enough to see the bridge open, which was a sight to behold.
beautiful. I have yet to go around but this is one of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen. I love it. loads of history

School trip.. School trip 2008 amazing really good history expirance.
Lovely staff .
Travel is available everywhere.

What a Site to Behold. Our first glimpse of the Tower Bridge was during a Thames River cruise. It was so awesome. The architecture and the history of the bridge were very interesting. It's a must see when in London.
Take This Tour! . The glass walkway made this attraction great along with the short films explaining the construction. Well worth the price of admission.

Must see in london. It's a must see in London but all in all
it is just a bridge with some nice stonework around the edges.
Good vantage point for the tower
on the north bank and make sure you take the tube as its a little out of the way compared to some places
Cool visit. First time to actually go into the exhibit and walk across the top. There is a spot were you can see clear down to the Thames that made me just a little nervous.
Glass walk. Once in a lifetime op to walk on amazing piece of engineering . Did the glass walk with wife and was amazing. Also watched the bridge rise at 3 pm which again was Amazing.

Nice Outing. Very touristy yet iconic. You must walk across the bridge if you are in London. There is a top bit that you can walk across made from glass so you are able to look down. Not for me as I am afraid of heights. =)
Tower Bridge. Another of the attractions by tourists. Easy access and views are great from the bridge. Just be careful of traffic and other people on foot.
Stunning!!. The Tower Bridge is a must-go for tourists. Don't drive unless you enjoy getting stuck on the bridge and enjoy the lake view!
Greaf. Been to London many times but never been to Tower bridge. The line was very efficient and I loved the exhibit at the top showing bridges from around the world - a fun tourist stop!

Engineering tour . Wow - this trip opens your mind - how this bridge was built and a trip into its very mechanics - see the huge levers and how they open the bridge - stand in the depths and wonder at the size of the hydrolics - really different type of tour - all of us ( kids 10 and 13 ) loved it

A must do. Didn't spend a lot of time here. Do take a picture from the glass floor looking at the road below. I am not too squeamish about heights but I did hesitate to walk on the glass floor.Did it because it was in our London Pass.
A new view. I really enjoyed the experience of looking at the people walking and buses and cars passing throught the Tower Bridge.

Beautiful. A must see when you're in London, it's something that everyone thinks of whenever London is mentioned. It's much more grand when you see it in person. It's also very nice to walk across at night. One day I hope to catch it when the draw bridge raises!

This should be called London Bridge LOVED IT!!!!. What an amazing piece of architectural/engineering!!! The glass walkway was awesome and the view was superb!!! Getting to see the history videos and walk around the mechanical rooms were so interesting!!! Not to mention as a photographer my cameras LOVED IT!!!

Tower Bridge. This bridge looks like from fairy tale, its architecture is very nice. It looks amazing in the day and also in the night. If you are lucky, you can see when the road on a bridge goes up to make space for ships:)

Worth a Gander. I took a quick walk across and it is a neat bridge. Built in the Victorian era but revival of the Norman style to match the Tower of London. It is neat to see it fold up for large ships and I hear they have a Tower Bridge experience exhibit but I did not go. Just the walk on an iconic landmark was good enough!

Excellent Surprise!. My wife and I did not plan to visit the tower bridge but the hop and off bus did not go as planned for us. We gave up and got out at the Tower of London stop which is near the Tower Bridge. We sat on a pier and had a couple drinks while looking at the amazing bridge. Great iconic London landmark. In the decades I have lived in London never get tired of looking at this landmark. It is beautiful and I always look forward with surprise and awe when a ship passes beneath. Look online for timings when the bridge opens!

Looking Lovely at Night. The iconic bridge is impressive from many vantage points in London during the day - but don't miss close-up it at night! Very well maintained and beautifully lit up - especially romantic on a couple's trip :)

Day out . Came here with my husband daughter and her partner There is a huge amount of stairs to climb to the top but there is also a lift for the less able Once out of breath and at the top I found the tower bridge great as a fantastic view from the top of the bridge On the walkway at the top there is glass floors for people to walk across etc don't worry those of you that hate highs there is proper flooring both sides of the glassThere are films to watch etc about the bridge to and as you exit the bridge they encourage you to visit the engine room and gift shop which is marked All in all good value for money

Great activity to pair with Tower of London. We (2 adults, 2 children 11/15), spent around an hour at the attraction, included in the London pass. Fantastic for all the family, with stunning views of London along the Thames. The glass walkway is fantastic, and the attraction is entirely accessible. The engine rooms were very interesting as well!

Quintessential London. No visit to London would be complete without a visit to Tower Bridge. It's bigger than you think, Cambridge-bluer than you can see in just photos, there's a lot to be seen from it, and... on a weekend... lots of people! It's the place to go if you are a visitor.The history, the engineering, the stone- and iron-work and the Thames, can only be truly appreciated by seeing the real thing. It took me 60 years, and it was worth it. You could pay to go to the top of one of the towers, and I'm sure it would have been a great view, especially of the adjacent Tower of London, but you'd have to be early to avoid the queues.The only thing that would have made our visit better is if we had actually seen the bridge open. But nothing plying the Thames was big enough that day to warrant such a moment.The Bridge is easy to get to on the Tube or walk to from downtown London.

Definitely worth a quick visit - plan 2 hours (included in London Pass). We had a 2 day London Pass so added this to our intinerary as it was right next to the Tower of London. In fact while touring the latter you can get a picture of your Beefeater tour guilde with the bridge in the background. If you're in a rush you can skip the first part of the tour which lets you check out the pistons and mechanism that raises the bridge. Make sure you check out the glass floor on both walkways. Fantastic photo op - perhaps not the best for those afraid of heights.
Worth the price and very cool. You walk rock across the top of the bridge and there's a glass floor so you look down on the Thames and the traffic. The kids 10 and 12 loved it

A landmark to see.... The museum on the towers, with a fascinating attraction. Accessible with the underground train, bus, but not so sure abt parking when using your own car, as we took the train the time went...
Neat!. This was really neat to see, but we did not tour it. It is a breath-taking structure, though, esp. when seen from the Thanes.

Great experience . Walking on the glass floor above the river Thames is a great experience. You also get some good views of London. The ticket can be brought in combination with a ticket to go up the Monument which has some great views of the city. A good attraction that won't break the bank.

School trip. Went with the school a few years back and we got a private tour. From the below areas that used to control the raising of the bridge to the pathways towering over the bridge. Was a good day out well worth a visit

Something you just have to see.... This is something you just have to see when in London.. It's a very beautiful, iconic bridge well worth your time to see via boat, vehicle, bus or walking. TONS of people walking... Take lots of pictures...

Iconic. Lovely bridge, and even better at night. We didn't do the tour, but simply enjoyed the view and walking over it. And to watch the bridge raise/lower is a incredible....much faster than I would have thought.

Glass floor makes this attraction . Had 2-4-1 with rail ticket . Short queue to get up on lift. Good views from the walk ways and the glass floor makes the attraction. Definitely plays with your mind. We were on glass walk way when bridge was raised to allow boat through which was great to see. Times of bridge raising can be found on the tower bride website.

Interesting as one of the many sites ....... Not a big deal in terms of visiting. but, as you will see when you look around in this area, this bridge is interesting. That is if the throngs/multitudes of toursits permit you to be able to see it:)
Great attraction. Loved this took my grandchildren across the top great views of river Thames good history also very interesting boiler room.
Glass floor!. This beautiful bridge is a natursl next step for a Tower visitor. Do not forget to visit engine rooms!

A must visit in London. One of the main landmarks in London, this takes you from the Tower of London over to the Southbank with views of all London's iconic buildings. A must visit when you're in London.

Brilliant. Went to see the glass-floor walkway which you can see the Thames and the roads under your feet. I would highly recommend if you love heights ..and if you don't, then it'll be terrifying so it's best to go with a friend where you can walk on the side of the glass which has wooden flooring without a hassle! .. Love it overall :)
Beautiful . My favorite bridge in London. It is vividly colored unlike some of the other bridges, including the London Bridge. At night the Tower Bridge is lit with colors, and looks quite nice.
view. beautiful amazing for pics and next to there is a great spot to have a something to eat on a sunny day

one of the landmarks in London. Nice experience to see this place from "the tower of london " side or the other end. Good idea is to vist the website to find the bridge opening time and then settle for a nice place and enjoy the view.
Beautiful architecture. Great architecture on a working bridge. Lots of restaurants and eateries around for snacks and food. The bridge lit up at night is breath taking and a definite site to see.

My favourite bridge by far,. This makes London Bridge look like an ugly relative. The detail and the majesty of this bridge are undeniable. The bridge going up and down is one of those things you should be lucky enough to see but the immediate area is also good for walking and taking pictures. Good food nearby and it is easy to relax the day away in the vicinity of the bridge. Must see if you're a tourist and if you're not still a must see.
History!. Took a stroll on the bridge, and some nice photos. Amazing bit of history here. Did not visit the upper portion or walkway.

Must visit place. this is an iconic structure in London over Thames river & is a must visit place to view its grandeur . the walk on the glass above the bridge is a wonderful experience 7 the exhibition gives an inside view of the bridge operation.
Impressive . This bridge is a true architectural marvel. Even if you just drive through while on board a tour bus, take the time to walk your way back and forth! It is just beautiful.

Great outing. We had gone for lunch to Hutong and then decided to walk to the Tower bridge and I am so glad we did. It was a short walk and a very enjoyable one. The whole area around the bridge has some great eateries and there was a huge screen to watch wimbledon. Got some great family pictures with the bridge as a back drop. Worth taking time out to go see the bridge. Amazing.

Good short visit. Fun to visit and walk over the bridge -- though the new glass floor can be a bit terrifying for those fearful of heights -- kids LOVED it -- laying down on the glass for photos. Pics along the wall of other famous bridges very interesting. Budget no more than an hour -- and its right next to the Tower of London
A Dark Tour of Our Past!. Don't miss the Tower of London - it's a fascinating journey that transplants you many years in the (often frightening) past.
Monumental. A great site in London I remember as a kid (many years ago) Standing on the joint in the middle. when it rises it is so majestic especially as a ship sails through.

A towering achievement. While London Bridge is a bona-fide London icon, it is probably fair to say it is not the most exciting of that city's attractions. Still, it has lots of offer and most visitors won't be disappointed with the experience.You get to visit both the North and South Towers, the Engine Rooms plus cross the walkways between the Towers. Both walkways have glass floors for at least part of their lengths and, not unsurprisingly, these tend to have a magnetic effect on a large number of visitors, especially those armed with selfie-sticks. I have to admit, the view through the floor to the bridge traffic below and then the Thames below that - more than 40 metres down - is pretty good. You also get good panoramic views up and down the Thames. While these views are splendid, I wouldn't rate them as highly as those from the London Eye. And the view down to the river from the walkways when they raise the bridge (to let river traffic pass) must be stunning - assuming you can be up there when a Bridge Lift takes place. Arranging your visit to coincide with such a lift - and there is a schedule of at least four or five each day - would be smart move. You also get to see the Engine Rooms as well as very accessible exhibitions on the construction of the bridge during the late nineteenth century and on other major bridges of the world. The giant steam engines, boilers and other massive contraptions in the Engine Room have long ago been decommissioned and are now an impressive array of gleaming polished and painted metal. For the mechanically minded (and unfortunately that's not me) it must a wondrous sight.
Interesting with a fun factor. Learning everything about the building of this famous bridge is a great experience. And walking high above the street level on a glass floor is funny for all.
Interesting attraction. Interesting attraction, static displays but nice to see a different view of London on a sunny day. Watch out for groups of loud school kids!

Iconic Symbol of London. This bridge is crossing Thames River and located near the Tower of London. As implied by its name the bridge consists of two bridge towers. They are tied together at the upper level by two horizontal walkways. It has very beautiful view with amazing and unique architecture. It is very easy to reach and was very nice to walk and to take picture.This bridge is free access for vehicles and pedestrians but there is an admission if you want to visit the bridge towers, upper walkways and the engine room.

Love the Glass Floors. The Tower Bridge is so iconically London! It is beautiful. A great spot for pictures. I would definitely recommend getting tickets to the top. We ordered and printed out our tickets at home before we left - made things much easier at the bridge. There are glass floors on the walkways that connect the two towers. It is really cool, not to mention a bit unnerving, to stand over the road and the water looking down. There are mirrors on the ceiling too that make for great selfie and photo ops!! Great for kids too! Engine room was OK. Tower Bridge visit is not too long, can be done in about an hour. We visited the bridge the same day we went to the Tower of London, very close walking distance.

Amazingly scenic and iconic. Offers so many beautifully archtiture buildings, amazing views of the river thames and city hall.. You can walk across the bridge itself or along the thames, which offers a range of restaurants, bars and during some months outdoor festivals, musicians, shows and big screen tv at the scoop, offering the tennis and football...

Educational and Enjoyable . Arrived here on a bit of a grey day, but this didn't stop the fun. You catch a short ride in the elevator up to the walkways. Once you depart the lift there is a short video you can view before you enter. Once you start walking across the bridge you see there are information boards about other famous bridges across the world (I was surprised how many I had been on) and facts about Tower Bridge and its construction. About half way, you come across the glass floor panels which you will be able to stop, walk across (yes, apparently the glass can bare the weight of 6 elephants!) and even sit or lay down should you wish (for those all important selfies of course!) There is another video at the end which talks through the construction of the bridge. You then catch the elevator back down to the ground, and follow the blue arrow painted on the floor (I'd never noticed this before) across the bridge to the engine rooms. Once in here you can see how the engines operate, watch another video and at the end of the journey you can even record a short video to email to your friends and family! Of course, there's the gift shop too! I chose to buy the combined ticket which allowed me to visit both the Tower of London and Monument for £11. This makes a good saving as for adults it would be £13.50 should both be purchased separately. Also, incase you're visiting for more than one day, you don't have to visit both places on the same day as the ticket is valid for 7 days! To summarise a great day, great views, educational and suitable for any age so long as you're not afraid of heights of course!
Beauty!. Go there during the day, the dusk and the night. The bridge looks marvellous all these times, my favourite was during the dusk.

Love to view and walk on. This is a favorite in London, great views, free of charge, easy to walk over. Close to the underground as well. You can stop and take pictures, at night it is lighted well with great color

Great Views -Ok tour. We had the London Pass, and since the Tower Bridge Experience is on it, and in close proximity to the Tower of London, we decided to stop in and take the tour. It wasn't crowded so we were able to get right on. It journeys to the top where you can watch a short silent film regarding the ever-changing landscape of London throughout time. Then you walk across the bridge which has a lot of information about this bridge, as well as bridges around the globe. There are areas with a glass bottom for a thrill. You walk through to another film and then down the street to an engine room. Overall, it was interesting, but if we'd had to pay, we would've been disappointed. But, if you have the Pass, take the tour. It's half an hour and a decent learning experience.
Pictures don't do it justice . First day in London and this was the top of my list to go see. Walked around and across it and couldn't believe how stunning it is.
Did not disappoint. Growing up and reading about all things London, I was excited to see the Tower Bridge. Even with all of the traffic, it's still a site to see. Amazing views of the city.
Neat place to go through. Line was not long and used our London Pass to get in. Very neat to tour through ..just to say you did !

Walking across is NOT the same as the tour!. This tour gives some really interesting insights into the amazing engineering feats that made the bridge possible. Getting down inside the bridge is a unique experience and shows a side of it that you'll never understand otherwise.
Stunning!. I loved Tower Bridge. It's magnificent! The tour is educational, nothing over the top. If you have time you should do it.

London Bridge is falling down. Tower Bridge or so-called "London Bridge", one of the most iconic and recognised building of the United Kingdom is as impressive as ever. This is especially so when at night the various lighting show another perspective of the iconic building.
Lovely views and nice walk. Great place to go walking if you don't mind how busy it can get. Good views of the river plus for the brave the glass bridge!
Iconic landmark. Love this bridge, such an iconic landmark in London. Easy to get to via tube. Highly recommend also catching a bus across in the evening.

Good, but not brilliant . For the price, the tower tour isn't that bad. But the 45 minutes or so I spent in there was anything to write home about. You get to walk across the glass floor at the top and visit the steam engines. I think there was something lacking.

Interesting. A first time visit for me to see a great view along the River Thames. I didn't have to queue for very long, I think I was lucky! The exhibition was very informative and interesting. Maybe a little tired in places but it told the story well. I have seen the bascule chambers on television but you can't visit them as part of the visit.

Great view. They have replaced part of the floor across the top with glass so you have a view straight down which is brilliant to see the Thames. The view is amazing and you can see how the pumps work. Amazing place we loved going here.
Beautiful Bridge. Very nice to look at, but all you can do is walk it. It is even better at night when it is lit up. One of the most stunning architectural bridges in the world.

An Icon! Be sure to walk along "The Queens Way". The bridge itself was lovely. We opted to not take the tour and just walk across. The tour seemed a little pricey and the experience was close to the same. The Queens Way is the one opposite the Tower of London and it has beautiful spots to take in the sights and great restaurants and shops.
Tower Bridge. Historical, and in close proximity to the Tower of London, Tower Bridge was nice to visit, and had amazing views of the city.

Excellent view of London. Brace yourself for climbing stairs, but it is worth it.Excellent view of London and the Thames, and cheaper than the wheel.Be sure to visit the engine rooms. Also interesting and good labels describing how it works.
My favourite bridge in the world. I work right next to it, I have seen it all my life, it never fails to take my breath away. Also visit at night.

Nice visit with a nice view. The tower bridge exhibit was very informative, but the placards look like they are a little bit outdated. The glass floor was fun to see, but it was also crowded so I would try to go early. We spent about an hour here enjoying the view and reading about the bridge's construction. The engine room was also informative if you're interested in the physics behind it. Overall a fun visit.

Neat looking in real life. THIS is what most people think about when they hear "London Bridge." It's quite impressive up close and makes for a great photo opportunity while on a river cruise or while in London Tower.
History at a glance!. Enjoyed the architectural and historical aspects of the bridge, they say it's a close replica of the style of the London Bridge, but it isn't falling down :)

The opening & closing. Going up the Tower Bridge & walking on the glass walkway had to be a must-do! The queue was mindboggling, extended down the street, even for London Pass holders. There is a staircase to take you upstairs too, if you are willing to climb so many stairs.For others, there is an elevator, & hence the queue. Once on top, you first get to see a short documentary on the construction of the Bridge. Post this; you walk down the glass walkway, which makes a few people jittery.So be careful if you are scared of heights. The view of the city is good, while under you, you can see the brown water of the Thames flowing. A display also lists the times for the bridge opening & closing.We were fortunate enough to witness this a little later when the Tower Bridge opened to let a passenger vessel pass. After coming down the Tower, I also visited the Engine Room where the machinery operating the bridge is on display.Overall, a good experience
The classic photo opportunity. We did not go up on the bridge but just were on the outside. The lines can be long and the best vantage point may be down by the river near the Tower of London

See it from Land and Water. The Tower Bridge is another iconic London landmark. We first saw it from the tour bus. When the bus drove across the bridge you could see the real majesty of the construction. The next day we had a Thames boat tour and got to see the bridge from the water as the tour ended by the Tower of London. If you are lucky you will see the drawbridge open to let boats pass.

Timeless classic. You gotta love Tower Bridge. With its light blue painted steel, the fantastic view on the river, the sigils at its end with the royal motto (Dieu et mon droit), and the Tower of London right there.I did not go upstairs to walk on the glass runway - but it sincerely does not look too impressive.A can't miss in London
Great British Icon!. A must see! fabulous history and great views..See how the bridge works and history of the old steam engines..glass viewing platform too! Go early to avoid the queues..

Must see in London. Impressive to see, even more impressive up close. Try to be there when the bridge goes up. New also did the bridge tour and got to walk across the tip of the bridge. Was a great experience

Brilliant. The guides are very informative and helpfull, even taking photos for us, the glass floor is a little scary but you can walk down the side of the glass, the mirrored ceiling in one of the walkways is excelent for selfies ...... the views both up river and down river are fantastic...... continue on to the engine room as this is facinating.... takes about an hour to an hour and a half, fantastic value, especialy if you use Tesco/family day out vouchers.
Grand. Enjoyed our visit to tower bridgeEnjoyed the views and the glass floor panelsThe engine rooms amazingSo cleanQuite crowded but not uncomfortableWorth a visit
Gorgeous. So many beautiful things to see in London. Love the gothic look of so many structures. It is free to look.
very nice. Interesting history,well done.Couldn't walk over the glass,where you can see the traffic go underneath,too scary for me,but nice to watch on the edge.

Worth a visit!!. The tower bridge is beautiful and thrilling as well. There is a glass floor on the upper level that gives you an incredible view of the bridge below! Take the Thames River Cruise to get a stunning photo of this amazing landmark.
Walk across. Nice photo op's from the river. Some cafes and shops below. Walked across on our way to the Tower of London. A little crowded but an experience if you're in London.

Tower bridge. Tower bridge is well worth the effort to visit when in London. So much history and incredible archetecture. Walked over the bridge and later went under it during a river cruise. Beautiful and a must see. Very popular so expect crowds andbe sure to wear your walking shoes

Great place to visit - but you need a head for heights. I'd not been aware that you could visit Tower Bridge and only found out when looking a the Two for One offers from our train company. This made the experience great value for two of us paying a total of £9 for two adults instead of £18. The 'highlight' for most people are probably the glass walkways which are on both sides of the bridge links - personally I couldn't even look down on the road below let alone step onto the glass - and there were lots of people enjoying the experience. There are great photo opportunities for both sides of the bridge up and down the Thames and if you get your timings right you might even get to see the bridge open to let ships pass through. Highlight for us were the steam engines that are in place - one of which was 'working' - I'm not a mechancially minded person but even I could appreciate the beauty and elegance of these beautiful huge wheels. On a Two for One offer this visit was excellent value although at full price would obviously complete with other attractions.
Tower Bridge. An icon from London that is quote impressive. I did not get to take the tour but it is quite an impressive feat of engineering!

An Iconic Landmark in London. I don't know if people actually go specifically just to see Tower Bridge, but if you are at the Tower of London or South Bank, etc., you really can't miss it. Nor should you. It is a lovely structure, built to blend in with the Tower of London, but built during Victorian times. Take the opportunity to walk across it and get pictures of the bridge, the Thames, and the city on both sides of the river. Highly recommended.
Amazing Architecture,,,. A masterpiece of traditional English architecture. After having a nice walk, you can use the bridge to cross the river.
Tower bridge. Take the time to walk across the top of the bridge, there are great views to be had from the top! Interesting history journey as you pass between the two towers
Iconic Tower Bridge. Beautiful piece of English history. I travelled on my own and it was lovely walking along the pier and taking pictures.

Tower Bridge and surrounding area. We are so fortunate to live in London and to be able to visit such wonderful places. Tower Bridge and the surrounding area is a wonder to be hold. You can walk along and see the Tower of London and imagine what it must have been like to live in those times. Tower Bridge itself is magnificent and it never fails to take my breath away.
Nice view. The bridge is looking amazing and the architecture is impressive. It is a must see attraction in London.

nice views but a little thin on the exhibits. You pay for this so you can go up in the walkways and look down on the Thames through the glass-bottomed parts of those walkways -- particularly cool if you are up there for a bridge opening and you can watch a boat coming through. The Victorian engine room part of the exhibit was neat, since it guided you through the actual mechanics of using steam power to raise and lower the bridge, but the main exhibition in the bridge itself was little more than some photos of other bridges around the world. Worth visiting, especially with kids who will love the view through the glass floor; would be a better value with more hands-on stuff about bridge-building.

Amazing!. The gates opened during the time we got there. We also went up to see the exhibition and the glass floor which is amazing. I would definitely recommend going there! There's a spot on the promenade where you can take great pictures.
Another must visit at London. I went early morning to take a nice picture without crowd. But if you are to go inside, you'll have to go after 9.

Worth the visit. Tower Bridge has always been my favourite bridge in the world, but I had never had the urge to actually do the tours of the bridge and the machinery ever. When we had our family visiting us last year we decided to give it a try, particularly since they had opened the crystal passage in the two beams of the bridge.The exposition is small but condenses what's important of the history of the bridge and other bridges in the world. The part of the machinery is quite interesting, and it is well worth the £8 we paid for the ticket.The best part is possibly the crystal passages in the two beams of the bridge. It is quite scary to step on them, but once you do, pictures taken from that height are nothing like anything else in London. Well done for that!It can be very funny to go with small children. Seeing their reactions when they step on that passage is quite fun. Just don't let them jump on it. It's not that it is not safe (it is) -it's just too scary! But that may be me :)

Loved it!. Take a picnic lunch and grab a spot on either side of the bridge. Put your feet up and relax or grab a pair of walking shoes, there is so much to see around here. Shopping, eating, entertainment, whatever your heart desires

Can't Believe Standing at Tower Bridge, LONDON. Been dreaming to visit Famous or Iconic Landmark in Europe. Tower Bridge is one of them. I am blessed beyond believe I am standing and taking pictures of Popular place in London. I am so excited and happy that I experience to visit the Tower , it was pretty when you go down at the river and taking pictures. You can capture the entire view, plus with beautiful lights.

Unique view of the Thames. Amazing feat of engineering of the Victorian times. Modern walkway well worth admission price. Engine room tour is good can also start that end if you are already over there.

A Nice Bridge and a national Landmark. My mother adores this bridge and it's not hard to share her enthusiasm. Aside from being one of Britain's most famous landmarks it is an irrevocable piece of London's history and a testament to the vision, bravery and irrepresable energy of the British people.

Now has glass panels in walkway. This bridge and walkway is always a hit, but in the last two years they have installed glass panels in a small portion of the walkway and you can see down to the river. Great! Always interesting to see the workings of the bridge and how it used to run. We also were there when the bridge opened. All painted up and gorgeous! Short video explains the building of the bridge and exhibition of famous London buildings. Always worth the stop!

Iconic and stunning. Tower Bridge is one of London's most well-known and celebrated landmarks and it deserves its fame. It is worth waiting to see the bridge lift up to allow ships and large boats to pass through. At sunset especially, it is quite stunning.

Great iconic place of London. One must visit the "Tower Bridge" when in London. The architecture and the size and the of the bridge is worth the time to visit. We walked from one end of the bridge (London Tower side) to the other side (City Hall) side. Visitors will have a great view and good look of London by the Thames. The walk is easy because pedestrian designated walk is designed for this purpose. To walk across the bridge, check the time of the drawbridge open for boat traffic because you might get stuck for a while.. It was neat to witness the working of the drawbridge (the mid span of the bridge to let boat through). The bridge is practically in the same area of the London Tower and it. took about 10 minutes to walk from the London Tower visitor center to the edge of the bridge on the Tower side. A small fee is required to go up to the walking bridge (second level). After the London Tower and the Tower Bridge, I recommend lunch/dinner on the other side (City Hall side) of the river.

Not that interesting. We brought our 7 year old twin girls here and had an ok time. They loved the glass walkways but didn't pay attention to anything else, nor did we as it wasn't that interesting to us. I'm sure the engine room is exciting to some people but we found it pretty boring!! We wanted to go to show our girls this famous landmark but I don't think we'll be going back as there is not much to see. We were lucky to see the bridge open but we did it from the park nearby as it gave us a great view!!

Beautiful - can see best from the Tower of London. This is a spectacularly beautiful bridge! I saw it both from the Tower of London and from a boat at night. You can see it best from the Tower and take great pictures of it and selfies of you. you get an equally great view of it at night, but you cannot see all the detail that you can in the daytime.

Tower Bridge. Great walk over the bridge after touring Tower of London. The center has a glass floor and you can see the cars and people going by. An elevator makes it easy for the trip up but you walk down. I think I saw an elevator at the top but probably for those who struggle with steps.

Great Glass Walkway . Wonderful attraction of you are okay with heights. Well run and organized. 2 bridge walkways to go on, each with a portion of glass to walk over and see the river. Very fun and a little unsettling!

A landmark!!. Fun to be on the Tower Bridge and especially to see it go up. The tour was OK, a little pricey but I considered a donation. The see-thru glass floor is loved by kids but some of us with vertigo found it a bit uncomfortable.The engine room tour is interesting if you are mechanically inclined and love old power systems. Others may find it a bit boring.

Great views over London. We were in London a couple of days ago and went on the Tower Bridge tour. You visit the engine rooms and walk across the high gantry. Great views of the London skyline and you get wobbly legs for free.
Breathtaking in person. Since I had just visited the Tower of London, it was logical to walk across the Tower Bridge. Plenty of spots for a good picture!

Iconic bridge, great photo op spot!. Tower Bridge is iconic and a great place to take a few photos. Walked over and back, easy to walk even when busy. There is lots of room for everyone (there was a tour group when I visited and didn't have any trouble getting photos)
The grass is really soft. Bridge is very well made, love the cheese topping. I remember back in 99' when the left pillar released its new single "too the left". Lovely sky blue colour also.

Just OK..... With so many great things to see in London, this would have been further down on my list to be honest. We actually enjoyed walking across and watching the bridge lift and lower which is free. It is very evident the bridge has been well-maintained over the many years and the British take great pride in that. If you have an interest in bridges it may be worth doing.
Queued for hours!. Amazing to visit don't get me wrong but too many people and too long to wait. Will try come on a quieter time
Amasing. Went on a boat trip along the Thames, to see and go under Tower Bridge. A fabulous site to be had either by river or by land.
Beautiful Landmark. Its well worth the visit,but i found the entrance fee is way too high for regular tourist (25 GBP). Good pictures can be taken from Tower of London entrance area.

I had a wonderful experience of the London Tower Bridge. This is one of the most popular land mark in London, the architectural structure is fascinating, the bridge is buzzing with tourist with vendours selling all sorts of London regalia and souvenir items.

Don't be put off by people milling round the entrance. Excellent lesser known place to visit. BOGOF with a train ticket got us in for 9 quid, and there was no actual queue. Views of the bridge through the glass floors and mirrored chilling were cool, if nerve wracking for me! Great views of the whole city with sliding windows so you can get unobstructed photos. Museum elements were interesting (if only for giving us a bucket list of cool bridges to see in the world) - but worth the time watching the videos and particularly seeing the well maintained engine room. I certainly understand hydraulics a lot better now thanks to the diagrams explaining! Would be great for kids with keen minds.

Beautiful Piece of History. This the magnificent bridge along the Thames. The London bridge is actually a very boring looking bridge a few blocks down the river. There is an opportunity to go into the towers and look down through glass bottoms.
Superb landmark . Really to go to London and not see the tower bridge would be like to go in Paris without popping by the Eiffel tower! A must to figure in your tour of London. Stunning!
Incredible landmark. A visitor must visit the tower bridge, it's not only a landmark but shows the history of fantastic engineering of the time that was built. Tower bridge is the London beauty!!
Great. Loved visiting the tower bridge! Would deffinitly recommend to anyone visiting the city. Deffinitly going again

Loved it. We did the Tower Bridge exhibition and it was worth it. We were able to see the engine room that controls the bridge. Glass flooring allows you to see the bridge from above. If you do have the chance to visit make sure u stop of the picture booth. Prints custom postcards.

Try to watch the Bridge "working".. The tour is cool, you can step over a glass walk and visit the "machines room". Observe at the desk entrance the times of bridge openings and try to see it from outside.

Top of Tower Bridge. Visited the glass walkway at the top of the Tower Bridge. Elevator access to the top. Great views of London including straight down at the road. Mirror above allows for selfies. Somewhat like the CN Tower glass floor in Toronto.

Busiest. Bridge. Ever.. Being and iconic landmark of my country I had to see it for myself. I was hoping for a good view of the Houses of Parliament but sadly all you get is a view of people's selfie sticks while they all try and get the best Instagram picture.Don't waste your time! It may be quieter in the evening but in the day it was shoulder to shoulder stuff and the bridge took 15 minutes to get across due to the sheer volume of people!

Be brave and go high. This is not just about walking across Tower Bridge - you need to enter the exhibition and go up to walk over the upper level where you will find a glass bottom and - just to increase the sense of hanging over the Thames - a mirrored ceiling too. Terrifying and exciting. The exhibition itself is a really fascinating history of the building and operating of the bridge.

Iconic place to visit. However nothing special inside, except for glass floor
But worth a visit
The price is way cheaper than London eye or shard
The most iconic attraction in London . Tower bridge is the most beautiful bridge along the Thames in my opinion. It's a must to walk on, go up and take fabulous pictures of.
The Symbol of London. This is the symbol of London and you are not allowed to miss it if you are in London. The presentation of how it was made is very interesting

A must see. Tower Bridge is a must-see part of London, yes its just a bridge but its iconic and beautiful too. Its also a FREE thing to do on your visit to london. There is an exhibit you can pay to see in the higher part, thats ok, not spectacular.A walk across the bridge and a pic taken on there is in my opinion a must do if visiting London.

a bit disapointed. I walked the bridge and enjoyed eating the glazed peanuts in the sunshine as I watched the people and the boats on the river. I was really looking forward to seeing the view from the glass floor high abve the bridge, but I must admit it was not as exciting or as good as I thought it would be.
Wow. Beautiful tower. Great to stand there and watch all the boats driving under the bridge. Great to see it druing a sunny day
Good views. Enjoyed a trip up to the top of the bridge for great views over the city and the traffic below with the glass floor! Good value at £9 for is both with our daysoutguide 2 for 1 vouchers

Stunning at night!. We have always stayed on the other side of the River Thames and opted to stay on the opposite side at the Hilton London Tower Bridge this trip. We were a 2-3 minute walk from this stunning piece of engineering work. We had the opportunity to view it up close, walk up and down the river view sidewalks at all times of the day. That being said, night time is definitely the best time to see it in all its glory! Great pubs and restaurants are in the area as well.
London's identity (must see place). Well maintained, very beautiful and must see bridge in central London. Easy access from railway stations and bus access too.

Beautiful Bridge! . A lot of people mistake the bridge for "London bridge" which is completely different.An amazing piece of architecture and looks fantastic when it opens up for high ships/ boats going through. Also looks amazing at night when it is lit up. You can see more of it by a Thames river boat experience.

A Step Back in History with a Great View Thrown In. This attraction is very good value for money and the queues outside should not put you off as they move relatively quickly.Once inside you travel up to the walkway across the top of the bridge where there are presentations, videos and exhibitions explaining the construction of the structure and how it works. Along the walkway there are more informative boards describing other bridges and structures around the world explaining the different types of construction and how they all compare. The view up and down the Thames with the London skyline is stunning and for the discerning photographers there are small windows that can be opened to allow shots unhindered by glass.Midway along the walkway there is a glass floor to look vertically down through above the main bascule section which if you time your visit correctly you will be able to watch the road section lift to allow vessels to pass beneath. Do not worry if you cannot walk on the glass floor, there are solid side sections to walk on for those unsure.The entry ticket also allows you access to the engine rooms which power the bascules, this is a short walk to the south side of the bridge and underneath, it is well worth making the short trip to see the engines and counterweights that lift the road structure.Allow yourselves a good one to two hours to take everything in and some advice for the elderly and small children, wait for the lift to access the walkway as there are more steps than you would think if you decide to walk!

busy and expensive. We went to the east end for the first half and we left early thanks to the not worth it expensive prizes for the exhibit and the noiseness caused by traffic and a demonstration with loads of people.

Rory s 5th birthday. In london sightseeing sat on tower bridge for about 15 mins traffic was horrendous roads closed for gay pride weekend. Didn t spoil anything though as RORY was mesmerised with the whole experience.
Beautiful. Walked over the Tower Bridge and it's smaller in person but still very beautiful. Tower of London is right across but we didn't go, just wanted to experience walking on the bridge.
Iconic Landmark. The Iconic and world famous Tower Bridge. Free to the public, and just an all around cool structure to view and experience.

Iconic. Instantly recognizable the Tower Bridge is worth a quick visit while in London. The hop on and off buses all go on or near the Tower Bridge. The bridge draws your eye even with all the new skyscrapers popping up around the area.
Didn't go in but a gorgeous sight . This was a shock when I first arrived in London. I'd never seen anything so beautiful. I loved strolling across and at the right time they let you up the towers.
Tower bridge. good explanation of the construction of this and other bridges . view is very nice and the location is easily accessible via the tube

Amazing feat of engineering. We walked across, visited the engines room (the old ones), and then we took the lift to visit way up. Do not miss it: wonderful views, interesting and still a functioning bridge.
Charming . I advise anyone who visits London to visit tower Bridge, its very charming and looks amazing you can walk around cross it, there are many restaurants and bars around
World famous. Spectacular views from the bridge, can be combined with a visit to the tower of London. Highly recommended to have a glimpse of the city

Try the walkway. This is one of the iconic London landmarks. Its good for a short visit and to have a look at major landmarks around London Thames embankment. Do visit the tower bridge exhibition priced at £9. It shows the history of the bridge, information about other iconic bridges of the world. The special feature is the glass walkway that allows you great views of the bridge and people moving on it. The times for the bridge openings are displayed and do wait to see it in action.

Fascinating to see the inner workings of an icon. Worth walking through the bowels of a historic landmark and see Victorian engineering at its best. Fascinating to see the old engine room apart from getting beautiful views of the Thames and London!

London Landmark worth touring. We toured Tower Bridge while on our honeymoon in London, and it was well worth it. The glass bottom walkway was really neat. They also raised the bridge while we were there, which was super cool.
Very nice.. Wonderful monument to see. Nice walk around the area. We also, got to see tower Bridge lift as there was a tall ship that was passing.
Charming. Tower Bridge is a must see in London. It's a beautiful bridge and you can take some awesome pictures. Recommend it!

Another glorious Landmark. This is one other landmark hat you cannot miss when in London. Even if you do not access it, it is still beautiful to look at from the outside. You may be lucky enough to see it in operation.

Good for a short visit. This is a great place to visit if you only have an hour or so - you could spend more time than that, but an hour is sufficient. This is also something that can be done on a rainy day as it is all indoors. There is a glass floor between the two towers where you can watch people and vehicles below. You can check the website to see when the bridge is opening to let boats through and I recommend going up during that time as its really something to see.

Nice history and a great view. This is a quick site to see but there is a roughly 10 minute informative video about the funding and building of the bridge. The main thing to do is walk the two sides which include plenty of lookout space and a glass floor (which you can view the bridge when it raises up and down). Worth doing if you are in the area for the views.

Amazing sightseeing. Tower Bridge in the one of my most favourite sightseeing I have ever visited. I like and am interested in old buildings, bridges, structures because I am a technician. I had London pass, therefore entrance for me was free. Tower Bridge is verz popular for most tourists. One can see long queues waiting for the lift. There is an amazing view from top of the bridge with a glass window on the floor. We can stand on it and below us we can observe traffic and Thames. Sightseeing continues in the engine room, so the lifting mechanism of the bridge could be seen.I was here during terroristic attacks in Paris. In the evening bridge turned into color of French flag - emotions were really strong.
Very impressiv bridge. We wenty here on a very sunny day. |I is truly a very nice bridge. From here you can have a nice walk along the river .

Beautiful and interesting, well worth the visit!. Arrived at a time when the bridge was being lifted, so saw that from the outside first. Then went in and took the tour. Nice exhibition with a lot of information about the history of the bridge, and also the history of London. Excellent photo exhibition of extraordinary bridges around the world. The glass floor was the highlight of the visit, and probably the highlight of the whole week for a 12-year old.

It is a classic. It is a landmark and always worth a visit. One day we had clouds and on the next day passing through by boat it was sunny and the bridge went up. Next to the tower bridge is a street food market - you should try it.

Regret not to go inside the Tower Bridge. Planned to go to the Tower Bridge tour after Tower of London but turned out schedule got messed up with something else.Yet its still stunning enough to see this historical landmark on London on such a beautiful day!

Bridge opening. We were waiting on dock at side of bridge waiting for a river cruise when the bridge began to open. Next we saw the ship St Helena coming through for its final journey as a mail ship. This was a treat as only few people would see this live.

Excellent view of eve bridge from the Tower of London side. Great view from the Tower of London side. Make sure you visit this in the evening because it looks even more beautiful when lighted. The Thames cruise takes you under the bridge.

Iconic Site. It wasn't too crowded and we walked right in with our London Passes. The Tower Bridge Experience was fascinating, clearly describing the bridge's history and how it operated, also showing photos of other major bridges around the world, a short video, the steam equipment, and of course the sections of glass floor. Fully enclosed, it was nice to have small windows that could be opened for photos and to feel the wind. Elevators take you to the top and we exited down a set of steps.

Do it for the view. The Tower Bridge Experience is definitely worth your time. We traveled with a teen ager and he really enjoyed walking over the glass pavement and looking down at the bridge, people, Thames and boats. It's a bit strange to walk on the glass, but you'll get over your initial hesitation and get some great pictures. There is lots of information on the history of the bridge on display as well. Your kids will enjoy this after doing the museum like walk and tour after the Tower of London. Suggested itinerary would be to visit the Tower of London when it first opens, then walk to the Tower Bridge Experience, and then have lunch at one of the many restaurants on either side of the Tower Bridge along the Thames. Also, the Tower Bridge Experience is including in the London Pass.

Fun after a walk along the Thames. Fairly cheap admission. It was actually much better than I anticipated and was of interest. Would be good for the science or engineering minded visitor. Engine room is an added bonus. Loads of great restaurants and charming cafes on the south side of the river.

BEAUTIFUL VIEWS & PROMENADES ALONG THE THAMES. Enjoyed the stroll across the bridge to see the rehabilitated sites along the Thames. Well done promenades with shops and restaurants led me to the Tate Modern and back across the Millennium Bridge towards St Paul's Cathedral.
I walked the bridge!. I walked the Tower Bridge! It was amazing and it's a stop every tourist should take! There are people jogging and vendors only at the bottom, and you'll see a Starbucks.

Quaint River Crossing :-) :-). the history of the place and the building in itself is quite interesting ... something you can google but being inside adds to the relevance :-)the tour needs a ticket and you can then watch a video of how the tower was built, the engineering room, walk across the 2 towers and the glass flooring and the traffic underneath / rive underneath .... Let me see if you folks can take a photo covering the entire glass flooring and yourself sitting on it :-) .. it is tricky :-) but i managed it tickets are pricey but can understand the cost of maintenance .. would have loved it if i could have seen the actual parting of the over bridge :-) .. it would have been money's worth but sadly could'nt
See Through Floor Great Fun. Very fun for kids and adults too! Also great for history buffs. A quick tour will work with less than 2 hours needed.

Beautiful design . I was fortunate enough to be staying in a hotel that was about a 5 minute walk from the tower bridge. The bridge is (obviously) gorgeous and its history is truly unique. If travelling through London, do yourself a favour and visit tower bridge.
Wow. Do go up and see the glass pavement they have put up and get pictures clicked . for the adventurous soul there are steps leading up .

Grand Bridge. The Tower Bridge is a grand bridge that opened in 1894.This is the bridge that the Americans thought they were buying when the bought London Bridge.The Bridge is by the Tower of London. Many tourists and Londoners visit the bridge every day. It symbolises London.The Bridge opens up to let tall ships pass through at certain times of the day.There is a high level walkway with a glass floor. However, I gave that a miss when I visited the bridge because I do not like heights. But for those who do not suffer from vertigo, this is worth going on.The opening hours in summer (April to October) for the tour of the bridge is between 10am and 5.30pm (last admission). Admission prices are GBP 9.00 for adults and children up to the age of 15 years GBP 3.90. (June 2016). There are deals for a family of 2 adults and 2 children (GBP20.30) and also for groups of ten or more for which the prices per person work out cheaper.You should consider visiting the bridge together with a visit to the Tower of London as it represents better value for money.

Well Organised Fun. My wife & I visited this after Tower of London, and we found this exhibit to be extremely well organised.There were clear signs and marked paths to the entrance and with our London Pass, we went straight to the elevators and reach the top. My wife had the most fun and thrills walking on the glass bottom floors, looking down to the traffic and crowds below. I personally enjoyed the views at the top of the surrounding area more, especially since there are small windows all along the bridge that you can open and peek out for photos, so you don't have the glass reflections on your photos.There is also a Tower Bridge app you can download where you can see augmented bridge lifts if you weren't able to see it in real life, which is a bonus.As you exit out of the main exhibition, there are clear lines marked to lead you to the Engine Room, the 2nd part of the exhibit, where you can see the engines/machines that control the bridge lifts.Highly recommend visiting both, but definitely don't miss the 1st part. The view at the top is worth the admission price alone.

Just do it because it's famous. We visited the bridge as part of the London Pass and since it's a famous landmark. But aside from that, there wasn't much to enjoy other than the glass-bottom floor looking down on the street. Not sure that it's a must-see site. If you are into machinery, the engine room may be worthwhile.
Iconic. Regrettably, it was raining at the time of our visit to the Tower Bridge, but even in the rain and from the top deck of a bus it was worth it. I wish I had the opportunity travel beneath it.
Interesting and fun!. This is an interesting and fun place to learn about London, the river Thames and some fantastic engineering. Great views too.
An iconic FREE attraction!!. You must walk over the Tower Bridge when visiting London. It is FREE, has magnificent views and is iconic!!

A great, quick trip!. Really nice time here today - helpful Sarah told us where to go when we ended up on the wrong side of the bridge, even told us to buy our tickets from the gift shop to avoid the queue the main entrance (not that there really was one). View from the top really was exquisite, especially the parts with glass - make sure you look up to take fun pictures with the mirrors. I also liked that watching the videos and visiting the engine room was optional - as we were in a rush this meant that we could do the main event and not lose time on the less important parts. Price very reasonable (£18 for 4 adults with 2 2-4-1 tickets!)

Iconic design. Built to match the adjacent towers of the Tower of London complex. This beautiful bridge is a drawbridge that opens every day at 5pm, except for the day off the London Marathon. The bridge may open up to 15 times per week for tall masted sailing ships.

Iconic!. You cannot fail to be impressed by this bridge, it's so iconic and beautiful. You can walk up the tower but we didn't do that. However, even just walking across the bridge is great as the views either side are amazing. Seeing it open up is a good sight too :)

People get this confused with the London Bridge.. This is the Tower bridge. It is beautiful. The London Bridge is not as pretty, so don't get them confused like America did when we bought the London bridge thinking it was this bridge.

The tour was just ok. Don't get me wrong, Tower bridge is an awesome attraction, its great to walk across, see the bridge open and photograph from the banks of the Thames. We opted to the do the tour, booking in advance and getting £1 discount on each ticket. It is not a specific timed ticket like a lot of attractions in London, which is helpful.We swapped our print out for a ticket and went in the lift to the first stop at the top of one tower. You walk across one of the walkways, to the other tower, across the other walkway and then back. It was a bit underwhelming in all honesty. The videos in the towers were old fashioned and dull and not at all interactive. There is information on other bridges across the world on display on the walkways and although this was mildly interesting, I doubt this would keep children entertained at all. There were some small windows through which you could take a photograph without the usual glare when taking it through glass, but these were placed very high and even on my very tip toes at 5 ft 3 I struggled to be able to take advantage of them. Probably the feature that the attraction would boast about the most is the glass floor on both walkways which allows you to look down on the road below. This seemed to be a in a stark contrast to the rest of the attractions which was quite dated. A bit gimmicy really and nothing particularly to look at. At the end of the tour of the towers, the ticket also entitled visitors to visit the engine room which was a walk towards the south bank. Not really worth the additional walk, this was again very dry and lacked the interactive exhibits that tend to be in these kinds of places. We would not have paid more than £8 each and would not recommend this for younger children who need more to entertain them than the view.

Great views and worth a visit. The views are great and you get to see from both walkways that span the top of the bridge. The Victoria mechanical room is included but probably more interesting if you are mechanically inclined and want to know exactly how the system to raise the bridge works.
Amazing. Didn't manage to do the tour but we walked across it. Views from the bridge itself wear fab, was a clear day though. €9 for the tour.
Discovering London. Amazing view. Food places all over to fall over for. selfie is a must. Walk along its beautiful, captivating and very refreshing
Tower bridge exhibition tour. The tour takes about an hour with a short info video , a walk across the elevated platform. Also the pump room is worth a quick visit.
Amazing. A "must" for everyone visiting/passing by London! Nice walk over it with Amazing view on the city!! Definitely suggested

Tower bridge is not London bridge.. The iconic bridge that comes to our mind while we think bout London is actually tower bridge and not London bridge. We wanted to see the bridge open and we checked for the time and went to see it. Bridge is beautiful and huge. At the scheduled time the traffic was stopped and bridge started to open. We were highly disappointed by the boat that actually came through it but overall whole sight was beautiful. We even visited the bridge once at night and it looked beautiful. Magnificent structure has its own charm during day as well as night. Must visit in sun and in dark..
Loved the walkway!. Have been here once years ago and just visited again. Good value and loved the walkway to look down on the river below.

Fun, interesting, worth the time.. A 'required' stop for anyone visiting London. If you're going to the Tower Bridge you might as well take the tour. The staff are so helpful, present and knowledgable. There are booklets with activities in them for the kids, which mine LOVED, and lots of interesting things to see. Go on a clear day for the best views from the upper deck and during the week to avoid a larger crowd.

Day trip to London. Had my first trip to London for many ears and decided to visit the tower bridge as we have been inside it but all I can say is wow we had fantastic value and views from the tower plus walking over the glass walk way and looking at the mirrors on the ceiling and then the engine room so if you are in London this is a must

Glass floor and mirrors - great views from a London landmark. I visited Tower Bridge with my 12 and 14 year old children and my mother, and all three generations really enjoyed it. To be inside the iconic bridge was very exciting. The views from the top are spectacular and I really like the thought that had gone into having small opening windows at eye height, so that you could take photos without the reflection of the glass. The highlight for me was the transparent floor - no matter how much they tell you 'it can take the weight of an elephant', there is something psychologically challenging about walking out on it and being able to see the river below. Seeing my hesitation, Iain, the charming member of staff, took my hand and 'escorted' me out onto the glass - thank you ! When he gave me an 'I did it !' sticker, I felt as thrilled as child ! I was put to shame by my mother and daughter, who also walked out on the glass, without Iain's help. On the Eastern part of the bridge, the glass floor has a mirror above it, so you can take an amazing picture of yourself on the glass, with the river below. Awesome.There was an interesting display about other great bridges around the world, and about the building of Tower Bridge. You can also visit the engine rooms - to me they were not that interesting, but still impressive for sheer size, and I am sure that for someone with more knowledge of engineering than me, this would be a good finish to the visit.
Great site. This was part of a Tour we took. A couple of majestic bridges in London and I like this bridge especially

We walked over it and sailed under it, and viewed from London Eye! Must see and do in London!. It was really amazing to walk over the Tower Bridge - it's something I'd seen in movies, but was so much more amazing in real life. We also went to the Tower Bridge exhibition - that was very interesting too!When we caught a rivercat up the River Thames and sailed under the Tower Bridge - that was a really interesting view as well - to see the Tower Bridge from a different perspective. And again, from the London Eye - such a different perspective as well.

Well planned and interesting exhibit. I had expected long queues visiting during half term, but the entry system was efficient and free flowing. There was the correct balance of lifts and stairs so you didn't get worn out, but you still felt you were exploring. The glass floors from the top level were quite exciting, and a very different vies of the Thames

Tower Bridge tour.. We were in London near Tower Bridge and on an impulse did the tour. There is so much to see. The engine rooms are a fascinating viewview. As is the upper gallery walk throughthrough. If you love history and how things work. This is a great way to pass a couple of hours.
Sisters Trip. Again the London Pass provides free entrance to the Tower Bridge. Go to the top and try walking across the glass portion of the bridge. Not sure how people sit on it for pictures.

Amazing, Iconic Tower Bridge - London Must See!. Does't take long, however quite incredible to see all the inner workings of a lift bridge completed in 1894 & still functioning today. Also kinda fun to stand (or lie down on) the glass floor above the actual bridge surface (looking up...looking down).

It's the bridge you've seen a thousand times. Look, we all know what this bridge looks like and we've seen it tons of times in movies or on TV. If you are trying to see all of the famous British Landmarks, then sure. But if you are far away and this isn't high on your list, then I'd say, skip it.

Just beautiful!. Iconic London monument, shouldn't be missed. You can walk across if you want but the view is just as beautiful from the side of the river. We went right after leaving the Tower of London, very close walk.
Iconic. Beautiful and historic bridge - Famous London attraction which is in top5 or at least in top10 so you must visit it while exploring London. (Of course, it's not possible to miss it:))

Interesting tour. The visit to the tower bridge was interesting, the glass floor is not for those without a head for heights. The entrance fee was reasonable for the length of time we spent at the attraction.

Hello Tower Bridge. The famous tower bridge really caught my eye. Simple yet elegant. It has become an iconic symbol through the history. One of the most visited tourist attractions in London.
I thank GOD for giving me opportunity to visit this place. GOD is really Great! Live,Love,Laugh and Travel to London!

Well worth a visit to the exhibition. We purchased tickets as part of a pre-booked package and were pleasantly surprised at how interesting the exhibition was. The glass floors wasn't my thing (but lots of others clearly loved it!) but the short films, the pictures and the engine rooms were. Would definitely recommend a visit to anyone visiting London.

Beautiful views. This is worth a visit, and included on the London Pass, stand on the glass floor, get some excellent pictures from up high, and see the history of the bridge building. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit
fantastic views. great structure and great view from the top. a great way to see the bridge, is by using their subway system (water type)

A must see!. The bridge is absolutely gorgeous and it's really neat to see when it goes up to let ships through. It's also perfect for getting beautiful views of the Thames, the Tower of London and the Shard.

Well organised staff. We have been here before but glass panels have since been installed offering a new experience. The glass panels are very popular and can cause a bottleneck. However the experience overall remains excellent.

Icon . Tower Bridge is an icon in London whether you walk over drive over sail under the bridge is magnificent. Great place to stop and look up and down the Thames river taking in all the sites on both sides, day or night excellent place to take photos.
The the iconic London sight. What a fantastic experience it is to walk a long this bridge. You can go up on it if you wish we did not do that and walked on it for free.

Worth to visit. Very romantic sight during evening visit. The lights made the bridge brighter and more enjoyable for your sight. The surrounding, you may find restaurant and/or cafe to relax. A nice atmosphere.
Great site to see. To experience the walk and travel across the London bridge was one that was worth to take the time to do.
The most famous bridge in the world. I love Tower Bridge, especially now with the glass floor. I tell all those I know who are visiting London to experience the view from the top.

A Beautiful Bridge. The architectural masterpiece was an interesting part of my London adventure. The glass walkway is very nice, especially when the bridge is raised. The Victorian engine room is worth seeing too, as the means to raise the bridge was fascinating.

Loved every minute of it!!. Visited and did the Tower Bridge tour!! I was supporting a gentleman with learning disabilities there and was surprised to find it was free for both of us!! But even if we did have to pay I would happily pay.The Tour guide was very knowledgeable and loved the glass floor! The views from to top were amazing!!!Already planning my visit with the family next time
Really impressive. really big bridge a bit far from the middle of the city.Really nice experience, one of the most emotional that I had in London.
Reminds me of Harry Potter. We didn't actually get to stop on the bridge, but we drove on it and it totally reminded me of the Harry Potter movies, in a good way. Was pretty impressive.
Nice view. I love towers. I climb towers all over Europe. this was brilliant, gave me a lovely view of the city, well, parts of it at least.
Historical sight. We went on river cruise and passed under the bridge. Lovely sight at night with it all lit up. Beautiful and recommend to tourists
Iconic London Landmark. Tower Bridge is an iconic part of London and fascinating to watch as the bridge draws up and down to allow boats to pass. Perfect photo opportunity

Love this spot the most in London. It's a very cool bridge. I stayed around this area for few days. I took pictures of London Tower Bridge almost everyday. It's so great to see and its shape was so unique!!

Fascinating . Going inside this iconic structure is quite an experience. The machinery that seems to work like clockwork, and is obviously in such a great condition must require constant maintenance but nothing is evident.
A fascinating experience for all ages.

Took the tour over the top. Highly recommend taking the walk over the top of the bridge. There is a lift up and stairs down and various interesting talks along the way. The highlight of course was the glass walkway with views down to the road/river below. Each side has a walkway but the Western (?) side also has a mirror above so you can take some fun photos. You also get a tour of the engine room included. Well worth doing.
The most beautiful bridge. Worth a close look - either walking or by boat on the Thames.Especially if you are fortunate to see it on a day when thebridge is raised for tall ships to pass.

A must see.. Walk across it. Take a boat ride under it. Tower Bridge is a magnificent sight as well as being an engineering icon from The British.Steeped with history, it is now part of a thriving concourse of restaurants, cafes, walking and sight seeing tours. Young or old, you must see it-especially where it leads to.

Crown jewels worth the wait.. The guided tour with the beefeaters is great. Informative and entertaining! But I thought the crown jewels were the best. Read up on them ahead of time. There was a long line when we got there, but despite waiting almost 30 minutes before seeing my first item, I was really amazed at the splendour and beauty.
Stately and Majestiv. The tower bridge is imposing and beautiful. It reminds one of the grandeur of Britain. A must see for every traveller

Reliving the Poetry is such a fab experience. Totally Loved the experience, especially when the Bridge opened we were awestruck. We sang "London Bridge is falling down" together as a family and had a great time walking on the Bridge.

Cool. The glass floor was pretty exhilarating to walk across. Not the tallest structure I've ever walked across, but it was intense. The engine room was even really cool. Probably my second favorite part!

Great experience!!. If you're scared of heights I would NOT recommend. There is a glass walkway over part of the bridge walkway, which is so fun to see the bridge and people below you. It gives a bit of the history of the bridge, and there is some fun things to see along the way. Not truly a museum, but interesting just the same. If you've got the London Pass, don't miss out!
Iconic. Tower bridge, an icon of london. This landmark is one of the most interesting places to visit in london. Would definetely reccomend checking it out
Landmark!. Make sure to walk, run or bike across this bridge - the view is spectacular - also, there are many things to see and do in the neighbourhood!

Really enjoyable . We have crossed the bridge many, many times and decided to visit whilst staying in London for a few days. I would recommend to all ages. My daughter celebrated her 21st whilst we stayed in London and she thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Walking on the glass floor was a highlight, but she enjoyed learning about the history. Please make sure you visit the engine room as it is fascinating and part of the visit. Enjoy :))

A beautiful bridge. I didn't visit the inside of the bridge, only walked across it. It is a truly beautiful bridge to look at. Do cross it though so you can really see it up close and get a good view of the thames and London.

Excelent tour!! . Some of the best views of London !! The glass floor on the top floor allows for really spectacular views of the bridge!! The guides on the elevator are super polite and clear when explaining what will be seen.

Great in good weather. Visited here yesterday.Weather was hot and there were open bars with deckchairs to sit on and jazz music playing for the Summer Festival.It was very busy here but lovely to stand and watch all the boats go underneath.There were plenty of ice cream vans and cafes too. You could also watch all the planes taking off from Heathrow airportTower bridge is a great piece of architecture.The Tower of London can be visited on one side and the Tate Modern on the other side. Near to underground stations,

Worth a wander. Why not walk across one of the iconic bridges of the world and take in the sights? In walking from our hotel to the Tube station, I was able to see boats cheering for and against Brexit, huge working vessels cruising under the towers (get up close to watch the bridge decks lift), and locals and tourists alike taking it all in.
