My son did the Tower Bridge exhibit where you can get to the top and recommends that too. But you need not spend those pounds to have a memorable experience.

Interesting and historical. I stumbled upon this attraction whilst waiting for others to open. I spent around an hour looking round. The highlight was the glass walkway, which allows you to walk over London and the Thames. The rest of the attraction was not particularly interesting to me, that being about how the Bridge operates mechanically.

Wonderful focal point of London. Even more beautiful when lit up at night. We were surprised and amazed to be on a river cruise boat, just mooring alongside the pier outside Geoman Hotel when the bridge opened for the National Georgraphic cruise liner and Balmoral ships to go through. Amazing and never seen in all my visits to London.
Good day out. It was a nice experience to go inside tower bridge, I think i expected a little more from it but it gives you something to do

Cool experience and not terribly expensive. As London prices go, this one isn't too bad. It's mostly self-guided with some interesting videos playing that cover the conception and design to the engineering and technical requirements. There are glass floors on the walkways that connect the towers, so that's always fun! Once you've had enough of the bridge itself, the admission also covers access to the mechanical room that used to power the mechanisms to raise and lower the bridge. If you're into any sort of mechanical stuff, this was really cool! You can see how the steam boilers powered the pistons that charged the hydraulic systems that operated the bridge.
To do. Nothing to say! Wonderful and a must see when you are in London :) London is always beautiful i Think

Great views of a great city. Not to expensive to get in and you can do 2 for 1 deals and kids under 5 are free. Really interesting the workings of bridge and how it all came about. The really good views ,I went before they put the glass floor in so would love to go back and experience that

One of the best attractions of London. Tower Bridge is one of the best attractions of London. The architecture is simply great. Again this place is always buzzing and good walk on the bridge is required
My favourite place in London. Make sure you do the tour of the Bridge tower, it isn't overly expensive but it is so interesting, I love this spot

Not really a museum but still beautiful. The museum is not really a museum. Most of the museum consists of posters of all the beautiful bridges around the world. It is very informative and interesting, but the history part that focuses on the tower bridge is very small. The engine room is probably fun for kids but I got bored.The second floor where you walk on glass floor is cool.

Inside Tower Bridge. A wonderful and fun experience to walk across my favourite landmark in London.
Interesting, and, historical. Not for the faint hearted to walk over the glass floors or even lay down! Be brave.
Such a beautiful construction, thoroughly recommended.

Short but interesting walk. After mistakingly calling it London Bridge, and following signs to said bridge (not nearly as stunning) we finally found our way to Tower Bridge (quite easy, just followed the Thames). It's one of the most recognised bridges in the world and easy to see why. The detail is amazing and is just an experience to walk across it. I hoped it would open on our way across, but wasn't that lucky, there are some great views and is strangely romantic... Definitely a landmark to visit!

Step inside history!. This iconic landmark is well worth a visit. we took advantage of the British rail 2 for 1 offer so at £9 for two of us bargain of the day. inside it's full of interest and the glass floors in the upper gantry's give some great photo shots. also the photo machine that superimposes your photo into an impressive postcard for just £3. A very enjoyable visit, makes us smile now every time we see it on TV knowing we have been inside one of the most famous bridges in the world.

Great Father's Day trip. This trip was suitable for all ages. The family party ranged from 8-70. Everyone loved the glass floor, and amazing views! The visit to engine rooms, under the bridge was surprisingly interesting!

Glass floor!!. This is a brilliant opportunity to go to the top of tower bridge. Interesting and amazing facts about the history and the operation. The glass walkway is amazing and the views offer a brilliant view of the city.
great views of london. didn't know you could walk across, so thought why not. Glad we did as was good and also I learnt a little of how it was built. The glass floor was cool..

Great!!. i really loved the visiting this place and i really liked when the bridge broke wen the big boat came me my brother and my friends really enjoyed especially my new friend who just came from usa she loved it she was expecting the tower bridge to be boring but i proved here wrong .... thank u guys it was an amazing experience

wonderful view. We were lucky with the weather and that was very important to enjoy the view. The queue was very long.. we spent more than one hour to get in, so make sure you buy a ticket in advance and be there in a good time.The view is fantastic when it is sunny! you get to see the most of the city view and the history of the bridge. For me it was just like a once in a life time experience. No visit to London is complete without visiting Tower Bridge.

Better before the glass bridge. Really .... i hope and wish was different when I went many years ago was definitely mych better now with the glass floor people does not give a dam about the monument....they just seat, stand anywhere just to get the selfie pics on the glass floor
Unique in the world. Always impressing to see this huge old drawbridge, working until now. It is another typical point of interest of London.
You have to see it at least once in your lifetime!. This is just must see at least once in your lifetime, its wonderful to walk down the bridge and see the town from it
Different . Excellent views of the city and thames river. Good photo opportunities. Different than the actual London Bridge

Recognisable everywhere!. I have driven over the bridge, I have driven passed the bridge both side of the river, but never until the other day had I just walked up to the bridge to just look at it.I was on the North side of the river walking back from Dinner and it just a wonderful monument to admire. I was working in London all week but kept thinking I was on holiday. This is what is great about London, you have historic next to modern and it just seems to work. It is what London is all about, moving forward and modernising without forgetting its past.

Inside the bridge. If you ever get the chance to go inside the towers, just do it. We went to a meeting & it was inside the tower, amazing, a bit like the tardis, you go in at street level & take the lift up, up & up then there are rooms & little offices inside. You would never know they were there.

My favourite place in London. One of the most iconic views of London! A perfect photo opportunity with wonderful cafes close by, the tower of london, the tube and the river. Go eat peanuts at night! A beautiful place.

Don't miss this!. Walking across Tower Bridge provides a unique opportunity to get a great view of the city from the Thames as well as to look thru the glass floor inserts down to the river. Plus there is a mirror on the ceiling so you can see yourself standing on the glass! At first I was hesitant to do the "walk" but it was fine and fun. Helps to have a London Pass for easy entry if there are crowds. Be bold!!!!!
Wow. Pictures don't do this beautiful bridge any favours, a must see in London. Great to travel over this bridge on a bus tour to take in full detail.

Iconic London Sight. If I was a bridge fanatic, this would be my favourite. I don't want to sound sad, but it really is a beautiful bridge! It's so iconic and the views of the bridge from the new county hall and gardens is just amazing.Worth walking over to get to Tower of London and getting fantastic views of the city as you do it.

Get to the top!. Tower Bridge Exhibition an newly added attraction helps you indulge into the days of construction of the bridge. Enjoy the breath taking views from the glass floors a top the tower. A special visit to the engine rooms to view the engineering behind the huge architecture.
Must see. This is an absolute must see sightseeing place in London. If you go there at night / the late evening, it is even nicer because of the illumination.
Not to miss. after booking a show in London we started with a lovely walk over Tower Bridge on the way to The Tower of London, its a fantastic bridge and in your in London its not to be missed

A trip to London is not complete without a visit to The Tower Bridge. This is not only a top tourist attraction but is an actual working opening bridge. The bridge walk is covered with interesting historical facts and images and it also has several panels of glass flooring that are quite freaky when you first step out over the void. It's a fantastic piece of history and your entry fee also gets you into the engine room where you can see the mechanics behind this fascinating bridge. You can check out the bridge lift times online so you can see this grand old lady in action.

The Tower Bridge Experience is not to missed .. Wonderful experience that far exceeded our expectations .We arrived at lunchtime on a Saturday and no queues , very helpful staff , disabled and wheelchair access to all areas. The exibition consists of various areas with seating to watch films and animations, photo displays and the two glass walkways ( one with ceiling mirrors for great photo opportunities ) also the engine rooms and small gift shop .Fantastic views of the london skyline and overlooking the Tower of London . Even if you dont have time to visit any other attraction Tower Bridge Experience is a must , something for all ages (we ranged from 60 years down to 7 years , 3 generations and various health limitations ) and we all enjoyed it . Excellent value for money and very reasonably priced . Toilets clean and small gift shop reasonably price and you can exit the exhibition without going through the shop .

Ruler of the Thames. The Tower Bridge is "the" bridge of London. It presides over the flowing Thames and is a British icon. Combine it with a visit to the Tower of London, then a walk around the Katherine docks with a stop for a bite to eat in one of the charming cafes that line the little marina. Feel the power of the monarchy as you walk across the river to the promenade on the south shore. Fun to do in rain or shine.

very beautiful to travel across as well as see from away from the bridge.. I brought my aunt in a wheelchair and it was miserable for her because it is mostly coble stone. But it is amazing and well worth while, but not in a wheel chair.

Beautiful ! . I really loved to walk around the bridge and in the bridge! I found it quite cute and lovely, around you can walk and find many more Interesting places also dining places and is accesible by subway !❤️

Walk or drive through. You will see Tower Bridge from the Tower of London. However, I would recommend walking through and crusing the river Thames to get the best views from and of the bridge.Although its not the biggest or most historical sites in London, there is great history and beautiful views to and from this great landmark. This is worth a visit when you go by the nearby Tower of London.

Time your visits carefully . You go up in a lift and they show you a short video before you walk between the towers. There is a small section of the flooring between the towers that is glass right above where the two ends of the bridge meet in the middle. We were fortunate enough to have a large boat come through so we were able to view the bridge opening. We later found out that it happens about four times a day, and the operators know beforehand at approximately what time so it's probably worth checking out what time the next one is scheduled for and then going up. After we came back down, we visited the old engine room (included with the ticket), so for those keen on a quick lesson on engines, keep your eyes open for this!

Thrilled to watch opening of bridge.... Very big,charming adorable bridge!! We took the exhibition tickets which includes ti watch from upper level of bridge and a glimpse of engine room.ticket was of 9 pound.fortunately,we were able to watch the opening of bridge. Must watch attraction of London...

Tour Tower Bridge. Stand on the bridge and look up and down the busy Thames River. Then take a tour to see the inner workings of how the bridge is raised and lowered for ships passing.Great pictures of the river.
Child Hood Fascination come true... Right from the days when I used to Sing the Nursery rhyme of London Bridge is falling down ....always wanted to visit the Tower Bridge. Beautiful Location.
Great Old Bridge. It was a lovely experience, many great photos. Daughter was only upset that they didn't open the bridge when she was there! :)
Magnetic monument. Being from England, I always loved the rush of the city of London! Somehow the Tower bridge gives me the serenity I need to keep up! Love it
Honeymoon. Beautiful bridge, worth the walk to see it. Just minutes from many great restaurants and attractions. A very nice gentleman came up to us and took our picture in front of the bridge.
Excellent landmark. So lovely view. Specially in the evening . No word can actually express the beauty of this bridge. London Bridge should never fall down.
Loved It. I couldn't really what it was I loved about the Tower Bridge just that I did it has a great of the Tower of London and Westminster abbey as well as the tames

A quick visit to Tower Bridge. It was a very good time to spend during my last visit to London. It took me couple of hours to explore the area. I reached there by metro via the green line. I didn't have a chance to visit the castle but I did shopping there and took my lunch (Fish and Chips) then walked for 15 minutes toward London bridge.
It's Tower Bridge. It's Tower Bridge. Nuff said.Even if you don't pay to go to the museum and glass bridge, you have to go if you visit London. Looks beautiful next to the Tower of London.
TAKE A WALK ON IT! GREAT VIEWS. What a magnificent relic of the Victorian era. An icon that is a must see. Do walk across it! Great photos of the Tower of London from it.

Glass Floor WOW. Visited with my 10 year old son and 15 year old nephew. They both loved the history of how the bridge was built and the comparisons to other large bridges worldwide.The glass floor to look down onto the road bridge and the water was amazing - I skimmed down the side - but the boys were quite happy to walk straight across and lie on the floor to look up at their reflections floating above the world (whilst my stomach did a flip or 20!)A very informative and interesting place to visit and enjoy.

Great views. Tower bridge is a wonderful historic site. For around £10 you can climb the stairs to the top of one of towers and walk across the walkway. There is a small glass floor section in the middle to get great views of the bridge below. Also a small museum below is open for a view of the equipment that lifts the bridge. Recommended attraction in London.
Great Photo Op. Overall very impressive and huge bridge! Very crowded and lots of places to view from including the Tower of London. A must see!
Stunning view. It is near the Windsor Castle. It is the best attraction for any tourist or anyone looking for a photo opportunity. A lot of unique monument u can captured there.

The beauty of London that can be experienced from every Angle!. I first saw the Tower bridge from Millennium Bridge, next from the sky gardens and a third time when we went on one of the cruise tours, and two out of 3 times I was lucky enough to see the tower bridge open. I recommend going on one on the cruise tours to see the Tower Bridge up close and personal at the same time experience it from afar because it looks equally stunning. Enjoy the view of Tower Bridge and The Shard at the same time, it is a moment to capture in your mind forever!
Impressing as always. Everytime I visit London I don't miss the opportunity to visit this iconic bridge and its surroundings. Day or night it stands glorious.

Beautiful architecture. I did not pay to walk across the glass walkway ('m not a huge an of heights), but it was still great to walk across the bridge at street level and see the towers up close. Such a beautiful bridge. Some of the best views of the bridge though are from the wall walkway at the Tower of London.

Great views of the Thames. The bridge is a beautiful structure, but it is really cool to see the inside. Also at just 9 pounds for admission a great bargain. The que for the elevator to platforms was slow so we opted to climb the steps and were glad we did. It really isn't a bad climb and really get to see the inside of the structure you wouldn't see on the elevator. Once up top we were pleasantly surprised by the glass floor that allowed us to look straight down to the bridge below and the water. As an added bonus we got to experience the bridge opening for a boat from above. Take the time to go in and up, it's well worth it.

Great attraction. This is well worth a visit, very interesting and great value for money. The glass walkway is superb , the views over the city and the River Are spectacular . Don't forget to visit the engine room too.
A must see. Extremely impressive , especially from boats on the Thames. I think there is a museum, but I did not go .

Nice ride through . We were on a hop on hop off bus, heading to the Shard. We passed the London Tower Bridge and also had wonderful views of it from the Shard. Nicely maintained, part of London's heritage.
Fantastic. I had a good time on Tower Bridge, the see-through walkway is great fun!And the photos taken there are so cool!It is free with the London pass and it won't take long .

Best Bridge in the World. I know I'm a Londoner but no other bridge in the world compares to Tower Bridge.Just to stand an admire the architecture of this Iconic structure is awesome.I would recommend you to pay the entrance fee to find out the history of the bridge and how this bridge actually works, it is well worth the cost. The views of the Thames from the walkway between the two towers are amazing. Try walking across the glass walk-way if you're brave enough.

Beautiful stroll across the Thames. The Tower Bridge is located very close to the Tower of London, and after a lovely day exploring we were able to cross the Thames over the Tower Bridge and see some magnificent views of the Thames and London. Admission for the exhibition is about 9 pounds per adult, so is a little pricey, and if you weren't willing to pay that much then the views as you cross the bridge are well worth it- and free. The exhibition was interesting and the panoramic views of London are definitely worth it. I would definitely consider visiting if in London.
Doesnt worth the money.. You can see the bridge from outside, it doesnt worth to spend extra 13 pounds to take a picture of the transparent floor..

A must see now with glass floor. Last time we've been in London we visited the bridge but only crossed it as pedestrians. This time we also paid the entrance fee to go on the upper level. The self guided "tour" is not very long, beside the possibility to cross the bridge on the upper floor level and see the inside of the towers (where is actually not much to see) you also get to the engine room.Anyway, its quite interesting cause the view from the top of the bridge is very nice. Now they even have replaced parts of the upper floor with a glass floor so you can look straight down at the cars and ships crossing 38 m below you. Quite a great fun and since the Tower Bridge is a well known symbol for London its just a must see.There are even foto machine on the top level where you could take a shot of yourself and then have you printed on a selection of tower bridge post cards you could then send home or take with you.I would also recommend to paid the entrance to be on the upper level just for the view and the feeling of it. Visiting the "exhibition" in the towers and the engine room is not that exiting and nothing I would pay for again. But the view definitly is.

Beautiful. Was intrigued by the engineering and construction. Is different from any bridge we had seen before. Well maintained and over a hundred years old. Had lunch at a restaurant in the shadow of the bridge. Was a great view
So special. Tower Bridge is so impressively beautiful day and night. Whether you walk over it , boat under it or stare in wonder at it from a distance it is an amazing sight surrounded by History .

Go when the bridge is open! Amazing...and oddly uncrowded.. Our first visit (me and my nine year old son) ended in disappointment when the bridge did not open as planned. However, the next morning no less than three big fishing vessels went under the open Tower Bridge as we watched through the glass walkway under our feet! A very cool experience that landed me two different high fives from my son. I highly recommend looking on the schedule the day before you plan to go so you can coordinate the time. The schedule is subject to change at the last minute. My advice surprise your spouse and kids when you are there and able to verify. You too can feel like a hero! Enjoy.

Great for All Ages. The bridge is absolutely amazing and being able to walk between the towers on a glass floor is a must activity. This is an activity for the whole family, couples or singles. Be sure to check out the engine room after you walk the top.
Great View and tour. We enjoyed the exhibits and the glass floor where you could see the traffic and Thames River below. Viewed the mechanics of the drawbridge.

Iconic bridge. I have walked across the bridge a number of times. Not tried the tour, but the bridge is just fabulous to look at.
I found the bridge open at 8am on the Sunday morning, first time I have ever seen it, I think it may have only been open For safety checks, well worth a visit.

Quite a sight. The bridge is easy to walk. There are stairs to get up to it & also down from it. There is a tour you can take of the inner workings of the bridge. It is fun to stop & watch the water traffic go back & forth. There are great viewing areas with benches along the Thames if you don't want to walk the bridge.

Built in 1894 and still a beautiful structure!. Originally the only crossover for the Thames. There is a new glass walkway or stroll down the traditional upper deck. Beautiful structure and wonderful experience.

If you could, take a walk from Tower to Westminster Abbey thru Cannon st. and Fleet st.. I was surprised how interesting the walk was, specially near the St. PAUL cathedral, every block, there are either interesting buildings or sculptures. We also found an excellent restaurant next to 50 Fleet st., called Chamber restaurant and bar, located at the floor of Apex hotel.

Wow views. My so and I have walked a long the Bridge many times but on this occasion decided to go up the Tower Bridge and walk the glass floor. Amazing experience for only £9.00. very good value. No rush to walk quickly. Had plenty time to read all the information. We were so lucky as when we were over one if the glass walkway's ....the bridge opened.. Fabulous to see this and a memorable moment...Well worth doing... As visit to the engine rooms was possible but we never did it as the sun was shinning and we wanted to roam around the Tower Bridge area
Amazing, beautiful bridge. Jaw dropping. Took my breadth away. So much to see from here across the water. Some iconic buildings.

Great views of the Thames. The tour was very interesting. Great views of the Thames. The bridge goes up an average of three times a day, every day of the year.

Information on other famous bridges on display along the way. The whole tour lasts about one hour, and the price is not expensive (£9 adult). I recommend it.
looks good in the day and awesome in the evening. This lokks amazing during night. there are sitting areas, pubs, restaurants at nearby thames river banks where you can sit relax and enjoy the view.

Truthfully, the Tower of London nextdoor gave us all we could hope for and more! Make sure to walk UNDER the bridge for the place the bodies would wash up after being thrown off the tower. SPOOKAY

One of the most iconic bridges in the world. This bridge is especially beautiful to see from the riverside. On the north side, there is Xi Bar in the Tower Hotel. Also make sure you check the bridge lift times to catch it when it opens up to let boats through. You can search on the internet for 'Tower bridge lift times' to find these

Beutiful piece of Architecture. It's a great feel to watch the Tower Bridge during day as well as night time. The beauty is mesmerizing and walking over this brings a great joy.

Stunning bridge with amazing views. I visited the Tower Bridge for the second time, and it was just as fun as it was on my first visit. We took the elevator up to the observation level, and watched the short movie about the history of the bridge. The highlight of the bridge tour is the observation areas, which feature amazing views of London. There are glass walkways that allow you to look down on the road and the river below. This year, they added mirrors above the walkway, which allows you to get some unique pictures. Don't miss walking through the engine room down the block to learn about the mechanics of the bridge.

Spending the Kids inheritance . This is such a cheap attraction. You get to the top of Tower Bridge and can walk over it and observe the river traffic as well car and pedestrians below through the glass walkway. After you are able to go into the engine room below the bridge.

Wonderful experience. The Tower Bridge is located on the Thames River between the City of London and Southwark nearby the Tower of London, London Bridge, Monument and City Hall. You could reach Tower Bridge via the London Underground stations of Tower Hill, Monument and London Bridge. There are several things to do when visiting Tower Bridge. First and foremost, it’s a beautiful bridge that is just begging for your camera to capture it day and night. It’s instantly obvious why it’s a great seller for postcards. Second, it is a bridge and you can use it to get across the Thames. Lastly, it’s a destination itself. The Tower Bridge Experience offers the visitor wonderful views of London 42m (130 feet) above the river. It was indeed a wonderful experience!

Must see. One of the items on my bucket list and it did not disappoint. I am told the Tower bridge of often confused with London bridge. It is easy to walk across without any problems. I view from the bridge is impressive. I highly recommend visiting this iconic London Symbol.

Fantastic tour. I think it was just a bridge where to shot some pictures, but finally it is an experience to walk and learn how was build when and how the mechanism was able to open and close the bridge. Yes, you can see how steam engine was builded to serve mechanism of the bridge, also an upstairs walkabout seeing cars and buses driving on the bridge is an experience that you haven't to miss.

Best Ways to See Tower Bridge. The best places to view Tower Bridge (aside from taking the Tower Bridge tour) are from four locations: (1) from London Bridge, (2) from the South bank (close to Borough Market), (3) from the front side of the Tower of London, and (4) walking across the bridge itself. Tower Bridge is spectacular at night time and I most enjoyed seeing it at night as I walked across the bridge under the lighted tower sections. (Check out uploaded night time photos.)

The bridge in London known to all.. It's amusing when I hear people who believe it is contemporaneous with the Tower of London. It isn't. When a bridge was mooted for here in the late 19th Century it was decided that it should complement the appearance of the Tower, hence its iconic appearance.Because, in those days, the 'Pool of London' downstream of London Bridge was busy with much high-masted river traffic this bridge was provided with the famous bascules which would be raised and lowered numerous times daily. Nowadays the frequency is much lower as the Port of London moved downstream long ago. But it's a great sight when it happens.I still haven't ever paid to visit the interior but it's always a thrilling experience to view the exterior of the bridge from the river and to sail under it, as I did twice recently.Looking up, the glass floors on the high-level walkways could clearly be seen and I hope to be able to report on that experience at a later date.
nice to visit once. wouldn't go here more than once nothing special but good view and romantic at night if you wanna go with spouse!
Lovely bridge to walk across. My eight year old son and I were really impressed with this bridge. It looks so impressive. Shame bridges like this aren't made any more

Make sure to walk across and visit at night. I am lucky enough that this bridge is right near my main campus for university so I get to see it every day. If you are visiting, make sure to walk across it and take an evening stroll to see it all lit up at night. Better yet take a boat trip from Westminster to Greenwich and you will be able to go underneath it!
Iconic and gorgeous. I really enjoyed the view from up high and the history learned. This only takes about 1 hour or less and we had no wait at all. You get to go on the upper level which is fun.

Lovely visit . Visited during half term, wasn't too busy. Reasonable price for family ticket and lots of interesting information inside about bridges. Being scared of heights I did manage to walk on the clear floors and I survived. Children enjoyed it and it's a nice visit for the family. Would recommend.
Tower Bridge. The tower is nice and is a landmark, but there is nothing astonishing about it. It has a good architecture and good view from there, but there's nothing special about it.
Bit Boring.. Great views of the Thames, the tour itself was a bit boring though, its much more interesting from the outside.

Lived in London 29 years finally been. I live 40 min walk from this iconic landmark and have never been and am really pleased to say that I'm glad I did.Firstly the surrounding areas are lovely shad Thames city hall st Katherine dock all deserve posts themselves but the bridge was today's agenda firstly was really please with the ticket price it cost about £21 for two adults one small child and an activity book for my daughter which by comparison to other London landmarks was great.Now let's face facts it's not the tallest landmark so don't go expecting great views across London but it is still a good viewing platform the glass bottom floor was pretty cool however you are mostly staring down at the beaten up road and a bit of the Crystal clear waters of the thames. I was more intrested in the construction side of the bridge and how and why it was built. I found a nice touch was the list of all the other famous bridges around the world that I really enjoyed. After the main bridge you can come out the bridge and walk south side of the river and see all the old pumps that were used at the time which was pretty cool too nice finishing touch for my family was we could take a boat on the thames back to where we live and you get to go under tower bridge and see it from a different perspective.

Love crossing the bridge!!. Tower Bridge is lovely, usually windy but breathtaking when it is sunny! The view at night with the city on one side and the Shard to the other is beautiful both during the day and night. I saw it opening several times and I love it each time!

Simply awesome! . Tower Bridge is simply stunning. Seeing it up close and personal is another thing altogether. We did a river cruise and bus tour so we're fortunate to see it from an open top bus and on the river. We were also fortunate to see it rise for a boat to leave London. A great site. This is a must on anyone's agenda visiting London.
greate. This place was one of my importants reasons to be in London and now when i arrived i feelt so hapy thx !

Must see in London. I visited the Tower Bridge the second time I went to London. I consider this a must see and was disappointed I didn't get to it during my prior trip. Viewing the bridge from multiple angles from the ground, from a river boat, and from inside is great. Admission is included in the London Pass. There is a short film inside about its history, and you have the opportunity to walk on and take pictures on the walkway at the top of the bridge that in sections is glass bottom to look down at the cars driving across. You can also walk by the London Tower or snap pictures of other area landmarks like city hall or the Shard tower. Pick up roasted peanuts from the vendors near the bridge.

Private work party on glass walkway. My company had an event where they hired the walkway for a few hours last summer and the view was incredible, it is a great place for corporate events with around 100 guests, though any more would be a squeeze!Staff were discreet and incredibly efficient with keeping glasses topped up, though the canape offerings were so so and extremely small, meaning I got rather more inebriated than I would have liked seeing as it was really a marketing event rather than a classic piss up whihc is mre what I am used to! I lined my stomach that day with bacon sarnie and cake but the champagne still got to my head! Not the fault of the venue as I do have a fear of heights, despite this the glass floor and panoramic surroundings whihc gave us all full view of the sunset were stunningDefinitely recommend for corporate events, despite my own sligh awkwardness in these very formal surroundings I thoroughly enjoyed it as did all the others, some eof whihc were CEOs of top companies and government departmentsAll in all it impressed in this context, but I wish they had supplied a sly chip butty or 2 to soak up the booze!

Tower Bridge. We visited Tower Bridge after spending several hours at The Tower of London so were pretty tired but it is very close by. We then climbed the 200 plus stairs as the elevator was broke down at the end we had arrived at. Wonderful view of the river and sights from the top. My husband especially found the Engine Room at the bottom very interesting. Unfortunately the gift shop that day had their Debit or Credit Card tills not operating.

Crazy glass walkways. We went to this as it was near our hotel. Of course it is a beautiful Victorian masterpiece, and quite charming. The views up and down the Thames are wonderful particularly of The Shard, City Hall, The Gherkin and the Walkie-Talkie. There are many displays inside and a couple of great old films of London in past times. The engine room is a short walk away from the towers. The photo display of other notable bridges worldwide was fascinating to older viewers such as myself, though my son was less enamoured with many boards to read. The two glass walkways were mad - quite a weird experience trying to walk above moving traffic and the river!
The Main London Landmark. Outstanding bridge, great view by boat, unforgettable experience, every single detail made with care.

Fun. This bridge is so cool and it is fun to go to the top and walk across. There are glass inserts so you can look below at the cars, boats and people. The history of the bridge is interesting as well.

London Landmark must see. This is a must see while in London. Took tube to London bridge and you could walk to Tower Bridge. There are plenty of area to take picture of the Tower Bridge from More London Estates. Walked thru the Tower Brigde will bring you to the Tower of London. Good to stroll around.

Unexpectedly fun!. We weren't even planning this as part of our jam-packed trip, but having finished the Tower of London, we were right there so we decided to go as there were no lines. The history video was very interesting. While up on the bridge, the floors are transparent and so much fun to stand on while looking down. The views of London are wonderful. There's a lot of additional bridge information and history on display. The tour of the mechanical workings of the drawbridge down underneath was fascinating. All the employees were exceptionally friendly. We are so glad we went to this amazing landmark!

Beautiful. We walked from the Tower of London to the Southbank. It is a short easy walk while admiring the beautiful tower architecture on the bridge. I suggest going to the bridge right after seeing the tower, since they are next to each other. The walk across the bridge takes you to the Southbank where you can get sit, get refreshments and take a wonderful look back across to the Tower.
I recommend!. It's an impressive place! The view is incredible and is very imponent. It worth every minute you pass there. I recommend.

Spectacular Structure. Great view of this spectacular bridge and engineering marvel can be had from the walls of the Tower of London. Had only 6 hours to tour London highlights, so only took opportunity for viewing and photo op. Maybe tour it next time in London.

A London Card attraction near the Tower. We thought we would visit the Bridge as it was near the Tower of London and also on our London card (9 pounds) Unfortunately, the lift wasn't working on the first tower and having climbed 7 flights I could go no further -there were still 7 more to go! Check with the staff that the second tower lifts are working.

Not bad. Its ok, nothing spectcular but worth a look if you have time. There is lots of information on bridges and the history of bridges. The views are nothing fantastic as you are enclosed and they are a bit blocked. Not the same as being out in an open air platform etc.
Bridge rise!. Famous London attraction Tower bridge still functioning! Near Tower of London you can see beautifull old Tower bridge.

Iconic. Tower Bridge is one of the iconic must see sights of London. Combine it with a trip to Tower of London and a short walk to the Millennium Bridge and it is a great afternoon. Pop to the Borough Market for lunch?

best view is from outside the Tower of London.. Recommend going to The Tower of London and from there, you can stroll along the Thames and get a wonderful view of the bridge, Tower, and Thames all in one. It is a fairy tale looking bridge. Very beautiful to see up close. It is quiet there, no car traffic

Beautifal. We stayed at the The Tower hotel right beside and walked across the bridge multiple times. Such a unique bridge. Lots of traffic across but there are paths on both sides for pedestrians with great views of the city!

Worth the visit. Definitely worth a visit.If you want a good walking tour start at big ben, cross the thames and walk along its shore past the ferris wheel and keep going. There are lots of spots to grab a drink or coffee or bite including starbucks. Eventually you will pass the tate, the millenium bridge, and shakespear theatre and finally get to the bridge. Cross it and come back on the other side.Be sure to catch it in action.
Amazing. Great to see how it all works, staff where very nice and helpful. It's highly recommend to do the bridge walk. A good half day on this will see everything.
Great night-time photo!. Worth photographing in day, and going back at night. The lights after sunset are very charming and make the bridge look beautiful, with a good camera!

Great value, interesting and exciting!. Excellent value attraction, ticket price was very reasonable. Visited with two daughters aged 13 and 14 and we all enjoyed the experience. There were interesting videos of construction of the bridge and displays and information on different bridges around the world. The glass floor across the walkways makes the experience all the better and of course great views down the river from that perspective.

Looking through the glass floor to cars and boats!. Really great value experience compared to the other attractions around the capital. Less than a tenner. Interesting video to begin and then you can spend as long as you like walking between the Towers on the glass floor!

OK.. I think the best time to visit here is at night. Because you would see mostly lights and you wouldnt see the place must. I visited once at night and it was lovely. I visited during the day another time and I was disappointed. It wasn't exceptional or it didnt look very nice to me. It is a bridge and the water wasn't also pure or clean. Unless you really love London for the sake of being London, it didnt have special thing to me.
Get the half price tickets and its good value. Excellent tour over the top of the bridge which has glass floors. Lots of steps up so take the lift if you a bit feeble!
Incredible. Tower bridge really effected me. Walking on it was an unforgettable memory. Both far and near sceneries of Thé Tower were excellent.strongly recommended

Leaving party . We hired the upper level of the bridge for a retirement party
Wonderful venue, friendly staff and good food
But a jobsworth attitude to the arrival time and the space was very long and thin - not the greatest for networking
Pleased I went - not sure that I would go again
Nice. Really nice bridge to walk over after visiting the Tower of London we walked on this Bridge to South London then to the borough Market and got food.

Loved the see through floor . A great visit to the tower bridge, obviously lots of stairs also a lift if needed, I walked the stairs and was shattered by the time I got to the top, awesome views once there and the see through floor was amazing to look down on, not good if your scared of heights though ha ha.

Very impressive and worth it. Great vantage point of the city from the most impressive bridge the city has to offer. Easily accessible via train and worth it even if you don't wish to see the tower or crown jewels.
Breath taking . Beautiful site from far and up close, the architecture is insane, the view from far and as your on it is stunning. A must do while in London.
Weekend fun. We went on a Sunday morning and it was not too busy . The glass walkway is exhilarating and just odd at the same time. Well worth the admission price.

Unique place, must visit in London. The bridge is opening up for ships to travel underneath at certain times. If possible chk the schedule before go their so you can see it opening and closing. We missed that during our travel

Add another bridge climb to your bucket list. It may not be the biggest or the greatest bridge ever built, but certainly one if the most iconic. Adding the upper so an to walk across adds another dimension, particularly with a glass floor

Great views and displays. The walk across the spans and the glass floor adds to the experience with many interesting displays and comparisons to other bridges around the world
Enjoyed seeing the machinery that lifts the bridge at the end of the displays and then to see the bridge raised as we waited by the Thames later in the day was great

If only all bridges were this pretty!. Although crowded, it is such a beautiful structure. I can only imagine how much prettier the river would be if London Bridge (the original)was just down river! It is a nice walk and great views.

Don't pay for the tour just cross on foot and linger!. Not sure I see the point of the tour/museum when you can cross on foot for free and spend as much time as you like soaking up the atmosphere! Wide pavements over the Bridge make this a very pleasant spot.

Quite a bridge and we saw an opening. There's a museum on the upper level of the bridge with a glass floor to see the main part of the bridge - we didn't visit the museum but did walk across the bridge minutes before a scheduled opening to allow a tall boat through.The woman staffing 'our' pedestrian walkway was most informative about the opening process and happy to share the info with us, despite her probably repeating the same story hundreds of times before - it would be easy to become blasé and jaded but she was informative, engaged and lovely when talking with us.When it opens it doesn't waste time - one minute closed and within another one or two it's fully open.Not much else that one can say about the bridge - it works: when it's down vehicles and people cross over it; when it's up boats travel under it. But who can't not like such a lovely structure with great history?

Wonderful experience, breathtaking views.. Whilst visiting London in May my son and I decided to visit this iconic structure and we timed it just right! Never having seen the bridge open before we were treated to this occurrence twice within an hour....amazing especially when you are actually on the upper walkway looking through the glass section and seeing it all happening beneath your feet. A very unique and informative experience.

London's most famous landmark!. The Tower Bridge is perhaps the greatest bridge in the world. This is perhaps London's greatest attraction and is a must see! Come see this bridge light up at night it is beyond amazing.

worth a look. iconic and truly brilliant piece of architecture. extremely busy with a lovely view from the bridge of the city. We were lucky enough to be on it when it opened as well which was really cool.

Can't describe . This bridge reflect how much London is a great city with endless of history I will recommend this place to people who would like to see how Thames river was connected in both sides more than 150 years
Fascinating tour. The Tower Bridge is well worth a visit. It is an engineering masterpiece and offers a great view of London. The animation do its construction is a highlight of the tour.
My Dream London Bridge. My Dream to see London Bridge Fulfilled when i saw London Bridge, Its View is ultimate and Good and there u have lot of things to see , When u xplore this Area.....
Visited last September. Poppy field of remembrance an amazing sight. Was swamped with people and finding somewhere to eat and get away from, Underground Station closed was difficult.
Nice . Nice iconic structure.. opens up to let the bigger ships in... looks nice with the lights on... worth a visit any time of the year..

A London icon. The bridge runs across the Thames close to the Tower of London. It looks great, particularly at night or when opening to let boats pass. The website gives opening times a few weeks in advance but be aware that the maintenance openings don't result in a full opening of the bridge.The bridge is open to traffic but the pedestrian pavements are wide and there are barriers to seperate you from the traffic. It is great fun for kids to stand halfway across the bridge and have a foot on either side of the opening as it wobbles a little as bigger vehicles go past.The exhibition is pretty good although the high spot is really the glass floors in the upper walkway. From there you are looking down at the bridge underneath. During uk school holidays they usually have free craft activities for children.It has recently been announced that the bridge will be closed for around 3 months for repairs/maintenance but I don't believe that the dates have been announced yet.
Tick another icon off the list. Unfortunately only got to view this magnificent bridge from the Tower wall and when we drove over it in our bus. But still amazing seeing it up close.

Beautiful architectire. This is a great site to see on a bus or river tour. Our viewpoint was from the Tower of London. It is a beautiful bridge! Take the time to see it from another site, tour or walking the banks of the Thames!
Photo-op! . This bridge is good for being in the background in vacation pictures. Also, I am not afraid to admit that until a week ago I thought this was London Bridge. Oops!

One of my favorite London attractions.. The history, design and lore of this bridge are supurb. It has a certain understated quality. The tour is very good, and so are the views. For me, it is a never miss when time allows a visit.
An unforgettable encounter which will last forever.. Without doubt an iconic symbol of romance in London. The Tower of London is simply a wonderful place which will stay forever in our hearts.

An underrated attraction.. The entrance fee alone is worth it for the views from the walkway which has nice little windows that open to allow you to take photographs. For the brave there is also the glass floor. The staff are grumpy, the guy on the instructional video is even more grumpy and the engineering exhibition unintelligible. Despite all that it is still worth it.
European old historical bridge. I guess one can say I saw it....lots of history and many people walked along this bridge...picture worthy

Interesting engineering feat. Enjoyed a short visit to the Tower Bridge Experience. The history of the bridge was interesting and I particularly enjoyed the exhibition on bridges around the world. The glass floor added a bit of extra excitement and gave some interesting photos of the river and road below. I also enjoyed a visit to the well maintained engine room with its row of massive spanners! An interesting visit. Also great to be able to walk across the bridge itself.

AMAZING/100%/BRILLIANT. I lived in London for many years and cannot understand why i never visited this attraction. Value for money. Glass floor (not for the faint hearted) but you can walk around it. Super staff and facilities . Brilliant visit

Lovely Tower Bridge. It is a great experience to wander over this beauty. One of the free activities to enjoy. There are great photos opportunities from both sides of the bridge. Put this on your to do list in London.
walking on the river. the tour of the tower is very well organized and the visit worth the ticket. spectacular the walk on the glass floor which makes you feel suspended

Not for those who are scared of heights!!. Easy enough to find as we had just visited the Tower of London. We got taken up in the lift to the top and watched a brief video before we were able to walk across on the glass walkways. Brilliant, you can see all the boats and traffic moving from below. And when you get to the end you can walk back up the other side of the glass walkway, but, you must exit from the other side to be taken down and it is optional whether you want to follow the blue line to see the engine room and gift shop. And then if you want to be on the north bank (like we did) you have to walk back across again! So must have walked that bridge at least 4 times now!

A must to see. You can't be in London and not see it!!!Don't miss the visit inside the tower, with a nice walkaway on a glass floor from which you can see the bridge from the top.Take a look also at the timetable to see when the Brigde will lift up (several times a day)

Nice walking area . Nice walking paths around the bridges, recommend starting at London bridge and walking towards tower bridge to see the area and enjoy a nice stroll. I wouldn't bother paying to do the tower tour, plenty to see from the public walk ways.

Walk, drive or take the double decker across. During our 1st trip to London my husband and I got acclimated by taking the On/Off bus around the city ( a cheap and fun way to get around with the freedom to get on/off when you want) and it took us across this enormous landmark bridge. Traffic was thick, so we were able to take in the details while snapping pics and chatting up our fellow bus riders. Last fall we returned to London, and walked the surrounding area, while enjoying the imposing Tower Bridge from afar. This May - another visit, so we walked to the bridge from our hotel and crossed on foot, which gave us the very best vantage point from which to appreciate the enormity and beauty of this bridge. GO! Walk, ride, drive - just go. It's amazing!
The REAL Deal. We walked across the Tower Bridge and saw it from our River Cruise. Loved the opportunity and the view. Buildings in the surrounding skyline were incredible.

A walk through time. This gorgeously appointed bridge is a magnificent marvel and a true sight to behold. The colors come alive as you look at the bridge and walking across inspires one and provides a glimpse through time as you reflect on who may have crossed along the very same path upon which you are now trodding.

Interesting museum and a great venue for business meetings. The first time we visited was for a series of conferences in preparation for the 2012 Olympics. We hired the venue to present to customers for a week. Every single customer was amazed, the staff were delightful and the complementary tour really rounded off the experience. I was then inspired to take the family on the tour a few year's later and they really enjoyed themselves.
up the tower bridge. The tower bridge experience is a good way to spend hour or two. No stairs to go up as the tower has lifts. At our time at the bridge we saw the bridge opening which was a bonus.

One of the nicest building in London. One of most iconic building in London. I definitely recommend to visit first floor of the bridge, very nice view on Thames, Tower and Docklands and also of course bridge from bird perspective.

The Tower. This is a great attraction. Everyone knows Tower Bridge and to walk across it is a must. To stand in the glass walk way and look out at the Thames is the icing on the cake. While we were visiting there was also a display of 1960s iconography. They also have a glass floor in one of the walkways now so will have to pay it another visit.
Beautiful walk. Thoroughly enjoyed walking over this beautiful old bridge. We were fortunate enough to see it open to let a boat through. Great views of London.

Amazing. Booked tickets in advanced and saved a little on the walk up price (also meant we avoided the long queues). Very good value when considered against the price of some London attractions. Glass floors on the walkways are impressive if a little disconcerting to walk across. Amazing views of London and the river from the top of the bridge.

Tower Bridge expedition . This is one beautiful bridge. Being inside of it & being able to walk over the see through glass floor was simply amazing. The engine rooms were interesting. We used the London Pass to gain entrance but even if we didn't have the pass, we would've paid the entry fee because it was a very reasonable price. This is just a few mins walk from Tower of London.
Tower Bridge. We walked along to this lovely bridge and proceeded to walk across it...didn't have time to reach the top but the view was great nonetheless!
Do the experience, it's worth it!. I loved the tower bridge, you go up on an elevator and get to walk across the top, and it has a glass floor, don't worry you don't have to walk on it...

Tower bridge. Went to tower bridge had a really good time very interesting and the views from there were amazing have been a few times and enjoyed it very much .not to expensive well worth a trip. Dee lanzon.
Really interesting to watch in action. We loved the Tower Bridge. It is a working drawbridge and easily accessed from The Tower of London. It looks much older than it is!

Beautiful Bridge. We did the Tower Bridge Experience which brings you to the upper level on the bridge. The cost was about $14 USD and I felt it was worth paying. The views are amazing and they have a glass floor you can see below you while you are up there. This was also included in the London Pass.

Iconic landmark for London. Probably the best known bridge in London and it's not the one that William Hearst thought he was buying for his estate in Arizonia!The views from either the south side or north side are good but looking towards the City you see the Shard, Razor and Radio.You can go inside, walk across a glass bridge looking down onto the traffic and take a tour of the history of the bridge.It's a definite in London.

MANY STEPS but worth the view. This was part of our London Pass (enables free admission to many attractions). AND it was 2 blocks from our rented flat! Did the tour but refused to walk over CLEAR walkway above street. Views from here are great when weather cooperates. Prepare to walk and climb a lot. Many areas to rest for those who need it. There IS a lift for those who need it.

Historical memories. We visited here whilst visiting the Tower of London, the history of the whole place is fascinating, to think of all the monarch that have been involved in the place is mind boggling, the bridge itself was fab, and we were lucky enough to see the bridge go up for a boat to pass through. The visit in tower bridge was also as good, looking through the windows down the Thames river was great, you can really feel the history of the place, quite spooky really. I would recommend a visit to this place to anyone to miss an opportunity to feel the history.

visit to towe bridge. i have walked over this many times over the years i have been going to london but never been inside on the tour. very reasonable on price 5 areas to view and a glass floor to walk over not for the faint hearted. very interesting but a tip use the lift not the stairs unless you are fit as i found out.
Great day out. Did the whole Tower Bridge experience - loved the glass floor. And then cycled across the bridge on a Boris Bike the watched it open.A perfect day
A landmark over the River Thames. Just a stone's throw from Tower of London. It is a busy bridge with London traffic, commuters and even boats passing below. Just be there and enjoy the view
Gorgeous . Gorgeous view of the city. It's a fun walk during the day for people watching, and amazing by night too. We did not go inside.

Truly a sight to behold . Tower Bridge is arguably one of the most famous bridges in the world and it's also one of the most beautiful. You can walk across the bridge and for a small fee, you could enter one of the towers. If you're looking for nice pictures to show off to your friends, Tower Bridge is a pretty good place to start.

Beautiful . All I can say really, is how beautiful this bridge is and the area surrounding. Always a buzz about with tourist bustling around taking selfies and waiting for the bridge to lift to allow larger boats pass under. There is plenty of tasty places to eat and drink in the vicinity so make the most of it . Well worth seeing at night when it's lights are on
Its a bridge. Not much difference between a photo and it in person with the exception that in photos you are not being fleeced out of your money by those guys with the ball and three cups.

Half term fun. Went here to fill in some time over half term holidays. One of London's cheaper places to visit, just over £14 for one adult, two children. We didn't wait long for the lift, the glass walkway does go against the brain's senses but it's great and makes for some great pics. They have some animation to show how the bridge was designed and built. The engine room is interesting. We didn't think we'd been there that long but we were there for about two hours. It's really well put together, it's fun, it doesn't overwhelm and the price is a winner. On a warm day you could take the kids to the water jets on the south bank by the Mayor of London office, and let them splash (bring extra clothes) a fun cheap day out in London
Tower Bridge skywalk. Definitely worth paying to do the "skywalk" walking over glass panels high above the road and river, good to see the Bridge from a different perspective!!
Iconic London. When one thinks of London they think of Tower Bridge. Was fun to walk across and see all the architecture.

Excellent Views!. As it was included in the London Pass, my son and I went up the Tower Bridge! In 4 previous visits to London, I had never done this. I am so glad that we did! It was really interesting to see the mechanical parts of the bridge at the end of the tour. We also enjoyed the view of the traffic and river below from the glass bottom part of the bridge. He enjoyed it more than I did. They had to give me a sticker at the end that sais "I did it"....it is a little intimidating to look down from that height! This visit made me extra glad that I had the London Pass with me. Without it, I might have skipped this visit and I am glad that I went!
Great views from the walkway.. Well worth a visit for the unique view of the city and the river. Try and time your visit for when the bridge opens.
Great place. A must whilst in London for those who love British History. The sheer size of it is breathtaking. Be prepared for large groups taking photos.
Nice trip. Nice trip up to the top and a look down the glass at the road below. £14 for adult and two kids. Not bad but the videos and other information weren't up to much.
Eat I view of the greatest bridge in the world. Lovely view from any one of the restaurants in Shad Thames. Night or day sit and drink in the atmosphere with an iconic view.
Beautiful!. One of the best sites in London - a must visit. Great to take a boat trip or view from afar. The most beautiful bridge

Nice view from above. In my opinion a good visit if you have enough time. Not that much to see or learn, but worth a visit. Impressive is the glas floor over Tower Bridge. We were lucky as we could see opening the bridge from above.
Great place. Great place with amazing architecture. If your are in London, you have to visit it at least once. Great view on Thames

True London landmark. It is a spectacular sight, one of London icons that makes London such a popular city. The bridge has a entry ticket that can be used with the bank tower for a couple quid more. Bank tower is on the north side of London Bridge, a great historic landmark also. If you're in London make this a priority visit, make sure to check the bridge opening times on the website.
Worth the walk and the visit !. An iconic sight of London ! Quite interesting to walk day or night and not expensive to visit ! Great for pictures !

worth to see. this bridge is so beutiful. a must see when you visit London. it`s Next to Tower of London, after a visit at Tower we went for a walk over the bridge, the most beautiful bridge i have ever seen. the children also loved it
Scary fun time. So fun. Especially if you are a bit scared of heights . Conquer your fears. Loved the mirror to lay down and take a picture of your body lying above the river and London traffic.

Over 120 years old and still one of the most beautiful bridges to see!. The most "Beautiful Bridge!" Worth your time to see it! It is as much part of London, as is Tower of London. It is not an expensive place to visit and it is quite fun for tourist. Very unique all the way around! Plus its great for pictures!
Stunning . Stunning night view. The bridge is a picture and the lighting is fantastic. Tower of London can also be seen from the bridge.

Beautiful photo op's on a sunny day. . This is a beautiful piece of history. A credit to those who maintain it. Very informative signage and tour guides and presenters a very knowledgeable. We had a London card so skipped the cue and enjoyed every minute.

London's best bridge!. This London's most impressive bridge- it's impossible not to notice its stunning and iconic design and I would recommend walking down the Thames and crossing it before exploring the other side of the river. I also would highly recommend the tour of the bridge- it's not expensive, you get a great view of the city, and you learn a lot about bridges and the construction of the Tower Bridge. Also, there;s a cool glass walkway you can walk on and look at the river and people walking on the bridge below. Definitely check this bridge out when you're visiting!

"Vere's da boll?". This was a fun part of our trip but not a favorite. It was great to see and the view was lovely but the walkway is largely blocked by lattice windows so there are better sights in London where you can see from above. My kids did enjoy watching the street performers on the street level trick everyone into following the ball beneath one of three cups. "Vere's da boll, vere's da boll, see da boll."
Gigantic structure ...Must see. Though London city doesn't have a good landscape on the bank of Thames, this bridge is beautiful to watch. Memory to cherish !!!

Glass floor is amazing and terrifying. The Tower Bridge exhibition was definitely worth doing period we love walk across the glass floor. There is a lot of info about bridge construction and other bridges. Great views.

Tower bridge visit. Great value for money, the history is brilliant, I timed my visit with a bridge lift, history in action, a glass walkway adds to the experience at the top. Cheap as chips as far as London visits are concerned, if your in London you gotta visit.

One of the things to do in London. As soon as you Enter the insides of Tower Bridge you can see the wonderful Victorian iron work that provides the frame work for the iconic towers. Upstairs in the walkways you get wonderful views of London and if your feeling brave you can walk on the glass floor. As part of your fee to visit the bridge you also get to see the old steam engine room that used to lift the bridge.Overall I would definitely recommend visiting this attraction!

Tower Bridge Experience, amazing. Fantastic trip to Tower Bridge, in it, up it, through it. Excellent value for money. Tickets online or at the kiosk on the bridge. Fantastic glass walkways to experience wonderful views. Some parts accessible to wheelchairs, but check first. Lift to top floor then steps or lift down.

Most famous place!. A place where n no. Of people come on daily basis to have a look of Tower bridge. One should wait there and have a look in night and when the bridge open to allow the ship to pass.

Beautiful place. Picture perfect place. One can complete the visit to tower hill and later see this magnificent bridge. Good place to hang around, with very good views.Lots of places to eat around. More crowded in the evenings.

Picture perfect . We never get tired of the view of this iconic bridge. It is a great place to take pictures. Walking distance to London Towers. This is another part of the city which is a must see while in London.
Wonderfuk. One of the wonderful sights of London. Beautiful piece of architecture. The view is wonderful. A must see when visiting London especially for art and architecture lovers.

A pleasant surprise. My friend and I did this on a whim and it ended up being one of our favorite attractions. The architecture is beautiful and the glass floors and mirrored ceiling made the experience really fun. It was also relatively cheap.

Architectural and engineering marvel. Tower Bridge opened in 1894. It is impressive from an architectural point of view, as well as from an engineering point of view, due to it's hydraulic system). The bridge has become an iconic tourist attraction, and it's hard to imagine the London skyline without it. It's beautiful. If you've never been to London, of course you have to see it - combine with a visit to the Tower of London for amazing day.
Different bridge. It is one of London´s postal card so it is a must see. Can be reach by metro or you can walk from london eye if you have some spare time left.

Great experience!. The Tower Bridge tour takes you high above the Thames and above the bridge roadway. There are two walkways, both with sections of glass floor so you can see the river below. Great for photos. We were lucky to be there when the bridge was raised for a passing boat, which we observed through the glass floor.The tour exits on the opposite side of the river with a tour of the engine room and gift shop. Allow time to explore the other side of Thames, where there is an esplanade with shops and great views of the city.

Great . Great tour through the tower bridge ,I loved it . The glass flour is so excite. I recommend you to use the stairs. Many but you'll enjoy the walk. At the end don't forget to visit the engine room.

Bridge from the river . Had a lunch cruise from the pier in front of the bridge and we were so lucky to see the raising of the bridge to let a paddle steamer through love the bridge but my advice see it from the river very special and you see more attractions.
Because you have to walk it.. This is one of those attractions that you just have to access and walk right over it. The bridge is quaint, steeped in history and just magical.
Lots of history. Walked across to other side. Very colourful in blue and while its not as spectacular in structure as the Sydney Harbour bridge the history is great

Great views. We visited Tower Bridge exhibition and tour on recommendation. We were not disappointed by our experience as we found it very interesting and original. Loved walking over the glass walkway and could spend as much time as needed to take in the views and take photos too. Engine room also interesting, as it is hard to imagine how this bridge operates with out the explanations. Overall great value for money and even got to see the bridge open after our visit!
Unique Experience!. Walking on glass at the top was really exciting and my son enjoyed the most. We also picked up some nice souvenirs from the shop there.

Tower Bridge. We have London pass so we don't have to wait inline and just go right in. You can walk the stair up or take the elevator. the view was great & walking over the glass & looking down to the water/bridge was great.

Fantastic. Really a definite visit. Pretty cheap and a good hour worth of stuff to look at. The glass floor is a nice addition but the history that the bridge shares with you is incredible. You can learn a lot in one hour!

Incredible Beefeater Tour!. We purchased a ticket into the Tower in advance from a travel group, and I highly recommend this, as you don't have to stand in a long line. We had a 9:00 am. tour with a Beefeater! Clive was our fellow, and boy, did we learn a lot about the Tower of London. I highly recommend these Beefeater tours. Get to the tower early, right when it opens. You won't regret it. We went immediately to view the Crown Jewels, and there were about 5 other people in there with us, so we could view them leisurely, and really enjoy this part of the Tower. Don't miss seeing where they house the ravens. Hard to find, but it's worth seeing them, and reading about their care. They are flying and cawing all around the grounds, too, as they have clipped wings. The Tower is a MUST SEE. So much history here.

Must experience. This adventure was quite inexpensive despite the dollar exchange. The bridge doesn't open very often overall though we were very privileged to be there when it did. You can simply walk across the bridge though you must take the opportunity to do the tour. There is a a partial glass walkway. Regrettably the gentleman's name escapes me though he was exceptional in me getting over my fear. Worth every cent (or penny!).
Beautiful. Nice views from there. Lovely area to be with family or your lover.Good to see the bridge open and boats passing by
amazingly constructed bridge..!!. It is just mesmerising to see the mechanism of opening and closing of the bridge.. such an ancient masterpiece..!!

Always worth seeing.. Try and see the bridge in action, when it is opened and letting a ship through, it is an amazing sight. I've taken my nephew and he was amazed. The views from the bridge are amazing, especially at night.
Great views. Such a great view from the Tower Bridge. I lucked out because it was sunny that day which made the experience 100x better.
Gorgeous bridge. We walked across this after a visit to the Tower - just didn't have time to go up. It was a lovely walk - with incredible views of London and the Tower - highly recommend.

Magnificent . No matter what anyone says, this is one of the most beautiful bridges in all of Europe. And Europe has lots of nice bridges. Looks very nice from afar. And a walk on it gives you a different view of the area

Excelkebt. I last visited before the glass floor was put in so must have been 2013 and it's somewhere I wanted to revisit.
Excellent trip, especially when the bridge raises at 12:45.
Think it's good value for money.
Friendly, knowledgeable staff.
Lot of stairs, there are lifts but they get very crowded.

Wonderful. We had a walk across the bridge, decided not to pay qnd wqlk above the road, they have a glass floor to look down on the road and river. We were luck to have the bridge open for a boat, good to see.

Amazing history. We love this bridge, every time we travel to London we go by Thames clipper which goes straight under the bridge.
Beautiful bridge
Beautiful Bridge. This is a very coo; bridge. we walked across, drove across and even sailed under, and it was fun from all aspects.

Iconic landmark. There's really nothing like Tower Bridge. In a city of distinctive structures, there is perhaps none which is more "London" than Tower Bridge. It is, of course, easily visible to all, but a visit to the exhibition is well worth the price. The lift takes you to the upper walkways where you can admire the views, peer down through the glass walkway to the road below and browse through the various information panels about the bridge. There is also an exhibition of panels giving pictures and information of other notable bridges in the world. After you come down, be sure to follow the blue line to the engine rooms which give a detailed insight into the workings of the bridge.There are higher views of London but not from the middle of the river. The elevated structure of the upper walkways therefore gives a unique view of the river and the buildings on either side.A feature of the bridge is of course the raising of the roadway.You can witness this from the glass walkway above, and whilst I am sure that would be an interesting perspective (if you can see through the crowds) the overall effect of the image can best be seen at a bit of a distance so you see all the bridge. Check the times the bridge is due to open and watch from one of the river banks with the sun behind you. That really is a truly iconic image.

This is London!. We did not have time to do a thorough visit of the entire bridge and shops, but did enjoy gazing upon this iconic structure. Take a picture of this bridge from inside the Tower of London! Remember that you can walk this bridge and visit the shops for free. Pay the entry fee to see more of the history. Not terrific for a rainy day, but you can do as they do in London when it rains--just do it!

I love this bridge. Nowdays Im driving through this bridge quite often and still until today I feel like a tourist there.Beautiful bridge. i remember the first time I've seen it. It was very windy - that's 19 years ago.Iconic! Its a must!

So beautiful. We walked across the bridge twice. The views are absolutely breathtaking. The bridge itself is so beautiful to see in person. It was definitely on our list of must sees and so glad it was. Don't miss this huge piece of London history.

Interesting to walk across.. There were a lot of people walking across this bridge, and it was interesting to be up close enough to see the architecture of the bridge. It was so much bigger than I thought it would be.

My favourite . I don't know how many times have I been, each time it just takes my breath away. Stunning bridge, i love walking up and down and just stare at it from different corners. It's beauty cannot be put onto words.
Fantastic! . My dad and I went for the tower Bridge exhibition and it was fantastic! Educational and the walkway with the glass floor was awesome :) would recommend, suits all ages.
Stunning!. Very well kept and looked after. Information given top notch. Is exciting to see the drawbridge actually rise, well worth a visit
Neat views. . We went because it was included with the London Pass. Would not have paid extra for it though. The glass floor at the CN Tower in Toronto is much more impressive.
Passing through. Biked around London on the Santander bikes. I walked over the tower bridge...definitely a cool experience and worth doing when coming to London.
Great Views!. This is always a favourite stop when in London though I prefer to admire from the outside. Can be very crowded in the high season so visit early.

Amazing architecture. Undoubtedly the most amazing bridge in the world. Really class engineering.
Its most amazing if you get to see it open, do check timings before buying tickets.
Very beautiful!. This is a very beautiful bridge and there are nice places to walk along the river. I would definitely recommend checking this out when you are in London.

One of the icons of London. Do walk across the stately, picturesque and most beautiful of all bridges in London and climb the stairs to get a great view over the Thames river landscape and learn about the inner workings of the bridge. To see the bridge from all angles, make sure to take a ride on the Thames Clipper which will pass right under it and give you different vistas. You can get a great, unobstructed very scenic view of the bridge from the riverbank at the southern end of the bridge, just opposite the City Hall and the HMS Belfast, particularly when the late afternoon sun bathes it in direct sunlight.

Walk over the top. This bridge is one of THE landmarks that defines London. Iconic, it stand resolutely as the first city bridge over the Thames. (The Queen Elizabeth bridge is closer to the sea but well outside the city).The trip up to the top walkway is informative. The view from the top (complete with glass floors) is a great experience.I thoroughly recommend visiting.

Tower Bridge visit, not to be missed.. Even though we were only in London for a short stay this was one of the major attractions I really wanted to see. I was not disappointed, it has a unique place in British history and it's easy to see why it holds so much charm. Just to walk across it was an experience and look out over the Thames both sides and take in London's historic presence in the world and it's key role in the world today with its stunning skyline of amazing buildings and architecture. Given more time I would love to examine it further but that's on my to do list for the future.

Lots of fun!. Given this is only 9 GBP, versus other attractions that are 20GBP+, this one is great value and lots of fun. It's fun to play on the glass floors, and the exhibit provides a good history of London. I highly recommend it!

Love this bridge. It is a pretty bridge. I got to see it raise up to allow a boat to go through. Access by foot is easy. Traffic across it is pretty heavy. It is a very photogenic bridge from all directions.
Great view of London. Well worth a visit. Very informative and the glass walkway is different if you are brave! Value for money

Walk the Glass Walkway and see the engine room!. Definitely a very cool place to visit!
Not only can you walk across both sides of the bridge, but you can also walk back outside and go down to the old engine room.

A Beautiful Bridge Steeped In History. It is a land mark in London and straddles the Thames at the back of the Tower of London. Take a walk over the ridge and look at the architecture and sights up and down the river,as well as learning something of the history of the place.

Great view of London. Great architecture and a great view of London - history saturates your senses when overlooking the city from here.
It is also quite beautiful (though not a Chain-Bridge)
An obvious bucket-list location.

Massive structure .
