Great icon of London...you may enter the top are of the bridge, which may be fun to some after visiting the Tower of London.Great picture spots: from London Bridge as you walk across London Bridge, grab a shot with the Tower Bridge behind you.Another fun shot is from the upper deck area of the hop on/off bus, make sure you're in the back of the open second floor of the bus.Right outside the exit of the Tower of London provides a more detailed photograph, such as the color of the graphics carved into the top of the bridge.
Good to see.. Lots of details and easy to get too. Was wheel chair accessible which was not the case for many of the attractions.
Not the real London Bridge. This bridge has been made famous through so many movies. Even though its not the real London Bridge, its a fantastic site. Great to walk across and people watch.

Holy Smokes! That was a lot of stairs!. We did this with our London Pass. It was nice having express entry. But be aware the climb to the top is a long one. I'm in my early 50's in pretty decent shape and I was winded by the time I got to the top. If you have doubts about being able to make the climb they do have an elevator.The views from the top are breathtaking. The view through the glass floor is daunting.The engine room was very interesting too. Don't miss it.

So much fun! . I pre bought these tickets on line and really didn't have to, this was one of the least crowded attractions we found. We loved it though! The view from the top walkways was amazing and although I am a little afraid of heights and found the glass floor a little daunting, I soon got over that for a unique experience where you could little see the river below you, cars crossing the bridge and an exceptional view of London! Well worth it as it was also on of the cheaper things to do while in London.

fanstastic architecture, amazing bridge! must see in London!. If you are visiting London, you HAVE TO visit Tower Bridge! It makes fab impression from the distance. But walking this bridge is what you have to do. It is awesome! Lovely, unique - top marks! Every time I'm around have to stop and enjoy it!
Iconic Landmark. Well worth a visit, go inside and see the workings of the bridge. Excellent photo opportunities, take spare batteries and chargers!
Lovely!. I just looked at the Bridge in amazement! The design is fascinating and to be seen to be appreciated. I like the design and the fortitude of the Bridge.

Interesting - Good Views. One of the things we did on our visit to London.We found it very interesting learning all about the Bridges History and how it was built (Various videos shown) as part of the ticket you also get to go to the engine room - again very interesting.Some good views as you can imagine up at the top.

Excellent view. We decided to go to the tower bridge by accident we had purchased tickets for tower of London thinking its the london bridge since they were in the same vicinity nearly side by side we decided to go and have a look and yes we were not disapointed.The people selling the tickets were very helpful and I think each ticket was 6 GBP since we were 2 adults 1 child they gave us a package cost which was real cheap.The lift takes you up some 100 ft and you are on the bridge there is a see though glass on the base where you can look down and see all the traffic there is also the history of how the bridge was built.There is an audio video room which runs a short documentary about the bridge on the other walkway they have glass down and a mirror on the top where one can take a selfie.This is a must see place trust me.They also have a LCD displaying the timing when the bridge below will open up to allow a boat ship etc to pas by I saw this and it was the biggest thrill of my visit no doubt waited 2 hours for it well worth the wait

Really good. We wanted to go inside Tower Bridge for years and finally got round to it. Such a lot of history with the bridge. We chose to use the stairs rather than the lift as you see much more and get a better idea of the size of the place. The glass walk ways are amazing so much fun as it's such as talking point went with total strangers. I'm very good with heights etc but this even had me feeling dizzy. It just not usual to be so high and be unsupported yet have a fantastic view. Your mind plays tricks with you. It's a brilliant experience not to be missed. It's good value and even better if you have the two for one train vouchers like we did. For years I've taken lots of photos of the bridge but now I can say I've been inside. It is worth a visit you can taken as long as you like in there which is good.

Great to walk over. We didn't get a chance to go in or do the top walk but we did walk over this magnificent old bridge. Stunning views up and down the Thames whilst being immersed in history in all directions.

Incredible Experience, a must do!. This was such a fun attraction. Going up to the top of the most iconic bridge in London was amazing! A portion of the walkway has a glass floor and all text visitors took turns taking fun pictures with the traffic and Thames River hundreds of feet below. We decided to take the stairs up as the elevator had a huge line up but I recommend waiting for the elevator unless you are up to a good workout. If you have the London pass then admission is free for this attraction. Highly recommend!

AWESOME ATTRACTION!!!! A MUST SEE.. Althought there's a typically long queue to get into the lobby and you have to navigate a crowded rotating door before cramming into a lift with several strangers.Once up inside the bridge you can go at your own pace, theres plenty to see and do. not to mention incredible views on the walkway. The glass walkway is a little daunting, but a great view of the world and the river below!You have spectacular views of all the London landmarks including the Shard, City Hall, HMS Belfast, just to name a few.We loved it, visiting the engine room after the tour of the tower is well worth it, you get to see how the bridge used to be powered and of course visit the gift shop!
Magic!!!. This was my first place that I visited in London and we had an incredible time. A lot to learn, one of the best experience was sitting on the glass walkaway.

Not free but walk free. If you want enter the engine room which is where the letting of the bridge takes place the mate you must pay but walk on and you can see the Tower of London and enjoy good view. Read the stories of the tower to make it enjoyable

Tower Bridge. London bridge is must to visit while you are in London. If you take a River Thames cruises, You can take good picture with the River Thames. It was near to the Tower of London. I enjoying the tea cruise with such a beautiful scenery.

Great sight . Not much to do but it's defiantly a sight to see. We were on our way to the Borough Market and decided to walk over the bridge. Beautiful details. If you can you should get a glimpse. It's by the market and the Tower of London so you could always walk past it.

Tower bridge trip April 2016. We arrived at London Bridge station about midday during the week. We walked about 10-15 minutes along tooley street and then along the Thames. It was very quick and easy to get in and the best priced attraction in London. Around £7 for adults. It was brilliant once we arrived at the top with great views of the capital and good to see the magnificent architecture and engineering that went into building the bridge. The glass floor is a fairly new addition to tower bridge and is good fun if you dare to walk over it. Great attraction for all the family.

Great peice of history. Most people will have seen this iconic structure many times on TV. But you really don't appreciate until you see it for real. It can get very busy in around this place. But my personal favourite view to see this icon is from below from a boat. We were very lucky to see the raising of the bridge.

Cool experience . Did this attraction right after visiting the Tower of London. It's a landmark that should be experienced up close. The glass walkway was fun. Thought it was the whole length of the bridge but it is not. Still, was fun watching people take pics on it.

Beautiful!. I love the tower bridge. For me, this is in my mind what I thought was the London bridge. It is such a beautiful bridge. I didn't have the heart to go up and step on the glass but looking at it from afar is suffice.

Magnificently kept bridge. This bridge has been kept in magnificent condition. I am so glad that quite a few times a day they will raise and lower the bridge so the many visitors can see it in action. Check the website so you can make sure you are there during one of those times.The only disappointing thing is that the map/plaque laid a few years ago is already quite out of date.

Exhibition and Tour Definitely Worth It!!!. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our time here, despite the incredible 42-meter climb to the top. The exhibition isn't much, mostly info about bridges of the world, but the glass-bottomed walk you see between the towers is fantastic! People of all ages get creative getting their pix taken there ... it's so fun to see ... and there was a great guide when we were there. Howard clearly loved his job and relished sharing his knowledge and jokes. Seeing the workings of the bridge and learning what went into its making was interesting, too. All this combined to make this our favorite monument of the trip.

Not worth the money!. What promised to be an exhibition was greatly lacking.In reality it's just a walk up 206 stairs within one of the towers, some good views of the Thames River as you walk across the bridge and then back down the other tower.I'd hoped to discover the history and architecture behind the bridge, delve into the Victorian era and learn about the time period. In reality what I got was a lot of walking for very little pay off. Save your money!
A must do!!. A inexpensive but interesting view on the life and workings of this wonderful old icon of London.Absolutely wonderful view of the river Thames from a very different angle alrogether
Scary at the top!. Do this when you are rested or young. Once you climb to the top, it is a rush to stand on the plexiglass and look down!

Brilliant . Went on the tour of tower bridge with my girlfriend and it was excellent value for money at£9 each and you're ticket lasted till 6pm so you could come and go if you liked,& I recommend walking over the glass walkways and look down to the Thames and traffic and people like the size of ants! Wow
Splendid !. It is for me one of the most beautiful bridges in the world, as simple as that ! Beautiful during the day and splendid at night !

Great View!. Visit the exhibition when you are there and dare yourself to walk on the glass and look down below. Caution: Not for the feint-hearted. Even I didn't dare to walk on it. Go through the exhibits - interesting knowledge. And lastly, take a photo at the booth for rememberance sake.
Visit. Did the Tower Bridge exhibition on top portion of the bridge.An excellent insight into role of Thames river as well as long history of this famous bridge.

A bridge is a bridge . I can see why everyone finds this bridge so amazing and it is such a beautiful bridge and has been created Perfectly and will always be at the centre of our history but at the end of the day a bridge is a bridge so I don't see why there is so much fuss around it really.

Great experience for the tech savy. The tower bridge experience is quite interesting.mthere is a good view from the walk ways and it was very interesting to see the old engine room which used to power the bridge opening. You don't get alot though for the admission fee. It takes less than an hour to get through the entire exhibition.

Tower Bridge is AWESOME!. One of the most recognizable structures in London. It doesn't cost a penny to walk over and have a look. You'll get some nice views of the Thames as you cross over. It's a grand bridge and we'll worth having a look at when in London.
Nice bridge, nice view. It is definitely one of London's icons, and pleasant enough to cross around the tower of London. Not really that many activities to do in conjunction with this bridge though.

Great for your obligatory picture. Cool to see the Tower Bridge as it is definitely iconic but I guess I didn't appreciate much else about it. You can grab a picture of it but there are lots of people so would just plan on moving on with your day.
Another must. If you visit the Tower you can't miss it. It is also one of the main landmarks of the city. I think there is no film where you cannot see these famous bridge.
fanastic. my husband always wanted to walk across tower bridge and when he got there the camera never stopped clicking.
Lovely views across the river and of London. We enjoyed the views although it was not great weather. It was extremely busy, being spring and on a weekend probably made it worse...
Fantástico. Tower Bridge is a place that evevybody needs to visit at London. A good tip is wait to see the bridge opening.
Awsome. This place made the hole trip to London for me. The glass walk way at the top is different but after getting the nerve to step out on the glass it was awsome. Remarkable enginering.

Impressive icon . One of the most recognisable structures in London. It doesn't cost a cent to walk over and have a look. You'll get some nice views of the Thames as you cross over. It's a grand bridge and we'll worth having a look at when in London.

Nice Bridge and a symbol of London. Beautifully built and looks amazing when the bridge lifts up for the ships to go through. Can get a little busy due to lots of tourists but the traffic is kept flowing with strict speeding rules (not exceeding 20mph)

Beautiful Bridge. An impressive ornate bridge. The bridge is light up at night and is worth a trip to see it. It is very close to St Katherine's Dock which is a nice place to go for a drink and/or something to eat.
Pro active planning . What an awesome construction. For a bridge that was built many many moons ago, it has been so very well thought through. Love it!
Magnificent. A beautiful bridge. The architecture is stunning. The view from the top of the bridge is amazing. Easy access, walkable.
Iconic. you have to pay to enter but it's free to walk across and I highly recommend it. It's the icon of England and a must do!

Great views!. This was one of our favorite "touristy" stops. My husband and I had the 2-for-1 voucher and were able to easily get our tickets upon arrival and walk right up. We enjoyed the gorgeous views from the top of the bridge and had a blast playing on the glass walkway and taking photos. You MUST lay down on the glass and take a selfie ;) Great time!
Tower Bridge. Is one of the most beautiful bridges at London, but inside of the attraction the way is really short!!
Tower bridge, not London!. Don't confuse the two- this iconic site is the Tower bridge. You can pay if you like, but we just rode over it on bikes and enjoyed the site from a walking tour.
Very Interesting. A very interesting visit to one of the symbols of London. The visit is short but very informative and very fair considering the entry fee one pays
Amazing . The Tower bridge in London is simply amazing with a fantastic view.. A great place to take pictures with a good scenery
Amazing!. Amazing view and beautiful venture. Nice place to visit with family and friends. I intend to revisit inshallah

Nice inside&outside . Visiting Tower Bridge is a must do in London! During the day and night you can takegreat pictures and for 9£ it's possible to get inside, walk through the upper passage with see-through floor and to the engine rooms.
Most famous bridge in the world. seen it on TV but this was mesmerising and it felt good to actually go on top of it and see how unique it actually was
Briain at its best. Just looking at this fine structure confirms what an iconic structure it is. Situated right beside the Tower of London it is a must see for all London tourists.
Its a bridge.. I mean what else is there to say, yes its historical, yes its pretty to look at but its a bridge. People walk over it. Boats go under it. It opens occasionally for bigger boats. Meh.

Beautiful bridge. We crossed the Tower Bridge yesterday on our travels. There are many restaurants and coffee options in the area. There are many shops as well. The Tower Bridge is quite a large structure and beautiful decorated. We crossed to the other side of the River Thames and spent the afternoon before returning to our room in Southwark. Great place to take some pictures.

Great Views!. We bought tickets online to avoid waiting in the ticket lines.You ride an elevator up to the top of the tower. There is an option to take the stairs. Then you walk across to the other tower. The floor has glass panels so you can see down to the bridge deck and river below. You can also look out the windows to get a nice view of London.

Iconic. So it's one of those things you have to do once, a bit l like the Eiffel tower. Sure there isn't much excitement in the museum displays but there is as much information as you could ever want to know about a bridge the glass walkways however are great, worth the admission fee alone, even if just for the entertainment value of seeing people panic as you jump up and down on them.... And the one member of staff I spoke to was very polite and knowledgeable
London Weekend. Really enjoyed our visit to Tower Bridge, great value for money, well worth a visit, the glass floor above the road is amazing and the engine room is very interesting

Do the Bridge experience!. The beauty and charm of the bridge itself is amazing, but getting to walk across the top of it and view the river and road below through a see through floor was pretty cool.

Fantastic!. I will share my bias up front - the last time I was in London I wanted to get here, but could not make the time. This time, I went, and I am so glad I did.First of all, take the time to enjoy the bridge itself. This place is an absolute marvel of Victorian engineering. Walk over the bridge (which is very pedestrian friendly) before exploring the exhibit.In the exhibit itself, first just let your eyes wander across the massive iron work that supports the whole bridge. The lovely vintage film loop of Edwardian London is also really worth a look as you move through.Honestly, I was not as impressed with the tower walks up top as others, because I had seen the London skyline before, but I did have some photo fun with the glass floor parts.The real star, though, is the old Victorian engine room. Pity the engine running is running on electrical power instead of steam, but it still gives a good sense of the scale of works involved here. Poke around a bit, too, there. The old reservoirs are still there to find.Absolutely go, enjoy one of the great marvels of the Victorian age, and take in a great view.

You have to see it up close. I had no idea of the beautiful colors and details, even in cloudy days this Bridge is beautiful. We drove through it. Pictures don't do it justice and just a picture far away is not enough. Make the time to see it on your way to the Tower of London.
Worthwhile . Great to see this attraction at the same time as the Tower of London. Lovely views of the Thames and London skyline. Can do it when raining.

Beautiful Setting. It's Tower Bridge, a sight recognisable the world over. I wouldn't necessarily go to the visitors centre (although I did get married here!) but if you're there, it's got to be worth a few photos

the iconic bridge of London. same a everyone else I knew this as the london bridge.... except this is actually the tower bridge. A beautiful example of art, architecture and engineering marvel and a must see attraction.

Head for heights. Great attraction and a good price. As you can imagine fantastic views up and down the Thames. The glass floors were deffinalty the best bit for me, most people take a selffie not me I played down on the glass and had my picture taken. The guide were very helpful and informative. The lifts got a bit crowed on the way up and down. The engine room is deffinalty worth a look Victorian engineering at it best.

Stunning . Tower Bridge is lovely and around the area too, especially with the Tower of London and The Shard on either sides of it.Whenever I am in London, I always walk down to Tower Bridge, depending on where I'm staying. At night is a beautiful time to go, just as the sun is setting. Seeing it all lit up is gorgeous.It's free, it's near top attractions and it's beautiful.

Must Visit Landmark in London. Great landmark to walk, visit and see.Take a guided tour, with best value if combined with Tower of London.Walking around from Tower of London to other side (London Bridge street) to enjoy great restaurants, wine bars and cafe's.Use the London Underground / Tube stations Monument or of course London Bridge to visit this beautiful landmark.Stand in the middel of the bridge and admire the view on the river Theems.Must vist !

Tower bridge experience. My Partner and I where Returning by boat from Greenwich and got off at st Katherines Dock , thought weepy led have a look at Tower Bridge , what a Excellent Decision £9 each tiger I but well worth the Entrance price , loads of info and video about the bridge History and Mechanics , excellent views of London from the two walk ways and s Glass floor on each , staff are Excellent , got everyone organised round the glass as we happened to strike it Lucky with Bridge Opening , WOW , we then went under the bridge and looked at Engine Rooms , Again great info , Excellent attraction , great value for Money
Not falling down!. Visited Lindon bridge whilst doing a tourist tour around London. It is a real piece of art and a great piece of British architectural history
Worth the visit but.... Worth the visit. The museum is so-so. The machine room is fake. We don't actually see the real machinery. Still it is informative.
A fun experience!. I highly recommend the Tower Bridge walk. It's a bit touristy and cliché, but doesn't take much time out of your day, and it's a fun experience. The glass floors are neat!

A must see!!!. Usually mistaken for the London bridge, there is a special feeling you get just walking across. There is a museum attached. This is a must see if you in London. It is a short walk from the Tower of London.

Iconic London. Tower Bridge is one of those iconic must see places in London. The middle part of the bridge rises a few times a day to let tall ships pass through. If you have the time, it is fun to walk across the bridge but for most people a view from afar will suffice.

Beautiful bridge. Went again last week with my sister and her family.
We cycled there and had a long walk by the docks seeing the bridge from different angles under a beautiful sun.
Definitively worth it
Amazing vie. A fantastic attraction. The walkways offer brilliant views. The glass floors are amazing. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable

WOW. Never knew you could go up the top of the towers and walk across the bridge at the top.
It's amazing to do and not really that bad on the price either.
It's something to do which is worth while.
Do it !!!!

Interesting, well organised and fantastic views. We had a dual ticket for both Tower Bridge and the Monument. However the Monument was closed for Health and Safety reasons. This was dealt with very well by the staff at Tower Bridge who went out their way to reassure us of a refund and apologise for this. All the staff here were very polite, friendly and professional. Well laid out exhibit and of course fantastic views from the top. The first walkway with the glass bottom is very grounded to take photos, yet don't worry as hardly the same crowds at the second bridge on the other side. Enjoyed the experience.

Iconic landmark, massive and in a convenient location. My girlfriend and I headed to the London bridge as soon as we arrived in the city, as it is located in a beautiful place with lots of other attractions, a lively food market (borough market) and several coffee shops and restaurants close by. The bridge is massive with passage ways on both sides, and i read there is also the chance to take a tour in the structure. It is also quite exciting to imagine how the neighborhood may have looked like in the past, especially during the middle age.

One must see landmark in London . Best way to see the Tower is to take a river cruise along the river Themes. Perfect place to take photos from. Head over the south bank to take a nice chilled walk or to grab some food and drinks from many restaurants and bars.

Huge when you actually see it. The first thing that struck me when I saw the bridge was the sheer size of the structure. Pictures you see or images you see on TV does not do justice. The bridge is gigantic.The views are awesome, be it from the bridge, besides the bridge on the east side - at St. Katharine's Pier or on the west side in front of the Tower of London. It is so enjoyable just walking in this area. You can also sit by the river on one of the many benches provided by the water front, especially on a sunny summer day. It is truly relaxing.
Great day out. Can do tower of london, tower bridge and shard all on one dayRestaurant tip - Pont De La Tour - just along the embankment from Tower Bridge

Great experience. Amazing experience visiting the Twoer Bridge. This place is full of history and at the same time modern. We took the stairs as we felt adventurous and I have to say it wasn't that bad walking all the way up. Very beautiful sightseeing from up-top, very interesting facts about the towers and the city. The staff is very careful, knowledgable and happy to help with anything. It worth every penny :)
Great Landscape. Great Landscape, great for photographers! If you pass by, you must see the bridge being lifted, what a huge monument! built in great details, i just would easily live there! :D

Impressive. Imposing architecture, well worth seeing it up close. Check out the website for the bridge lifting times and find a spot along either bank of the Thames to watch the mechanism and the boats coming through.

Perfect walk on a sunny day. Came to London with my friends and had to do all the standard tourist stuff. This bridge does get busy but it's a lovely walk when the sun is shining. Get a nice view of the Thames too

I must see London icon. This is a must see London icon, and easy to combine with a trip to the Tower of London. Take the time to walk across the bridge and get some photographs of the Thames River and tower. We did not take the tour, but it sounded interesting.

London walk essential viewing. There is a great walk along the river bank that takes you along the river bank,past Tower Bridge and up to St Catherines Wharf. There are some amazing photo opportunities but the best part of the walk is crossing the historic bridge.
all time visit place. good for summers..especially when bridge opening time...cool place...good with friends and family..

Tourist day out. Interesting place with a good tour and look at the history of the bridge and area. Great view from up top with a glass floor that makes the walk across entertaining watching people's reactions.

Amazing and spectacular Tower Bridge. Grade and amazing Bridge. Engine room is a must see. The class floor on the tower above the bridge makes your hearts skip a few beats. Hope one is not fear of the height.

Worth the small price tag. Lovely views once you can manage the stairs :) Although I think they might have a lift if they can see you not able for stairs. And the engine rooms which are included in the price are well worth going into as well.
LIke. Enjoyed walking in this area and the view from the bridge. Full of history and you feel like you are back to 1910

huge. who as not seen this on tv but in the (flesh) its huge and beautiful. people using both sides to walk across in there 100s and the traffic, I could not count the number of the amazing London Black/blue/red/white cabs. for us London beats Paris

Great view of "old Father Thames". Done a few corporate gigs here. Its pretty interesting the first time. The second time, well "Bin der, dun dat" but its a interesting venue. If I'd had to pay I'd probably gone down a mark.

Wonderful architecture. the Tower Bridge made a wonderful backdrop for photo taking My Canadian relatives could not take enough of it the architecture and sunny day made for fabulous pictures to take home
Great bridge . We seen this bridge fro London bridge and by bus. This is great picture taking bridge. Overall best to view from London bridge.
Exciting. Went across the Tower Bridge and even took the Tower Bridge Experience. Walked across the bridge on the top and was able to look through the glass to the bottom. Very exciting .

Tower above the Thames. Best view in the world, looking down through the glass floor to the bridge and river below. Not for the faint hearted. saw a lot of very nervous adults and plenty of excited children. Another must see attraction in this great city.
Beautiful bridge!. This must-see London attraction. It's amazing landmark. The view from this bridge is very beautiful for a photography.

Iconic Bridge. Tower Bridge is truly an iconic bridge and a symbol of London. I love the way there iron supports are done in blue, providing a beautiful contrast.It connects the north to the south bank of Thanes apart from several other bridges. You can go one level up to the deck and have a view of the traffic below through the glass floor . Costs about 9 pounds . Its a great sight to watch the bascules being opened for river traffic .The bascules are raised around 1000 times a year and the date and time are published on the website. You can plan your visit accordingly.We were lucky that while we were walking from the Tower of London towards the Bridge, the bascules opened.Combine this trip with the Tower of London as it is a nice 10 minutes walk along the river from the Tower.Closest tube is Tower Hill
One of Londons main attractions!. A beautiful bridge with a very interesting history. One of London's main attractions for obvious reasons. Definitely a must on any trip to London.

Don't bother. Unless you want to look at the glass floor it was nothing I couldn't read online for the price of it really - was okay but if you've got other things to do then don't feel guilty about missing this one out!
Meh its ok. If you have done everything else on your list finish it off with this. Not too much to be said, it is a well designed bridge that London is famous for.
Always impressive to walk over. I've visited here a few times and a walk across Tower Bridge is always a pleasant activity. It's very impressive and well worth getting into a visit somehow.

Very nice. My opinion its the most beautiful bridge in London, defenatly worth a visit.
must attraction in London

Amazing glass floors. Tower Bridge experience was very good, lots of things to see and read and walking along the top the glass floors are amazing. Views from the top were stunning on a beautiful warm sunny day. good photo shots

Beautiful! This is the Bridge to Walk Over or Bike Over, or Just Take Pictues!. We bicycled over this amazing bridge and also drove over on our bus tour. It's such an iconic landmark, you will want to see it. We also walked across. It's a short walk.They have some fun, inexpensive night tours that unfortunately just ran out of time to do. We wanted to do the 'Jack the Ripper' night tour. That is rated as a great attraction. Think it's £9 per person and if you have The London Pass, it is free. So, would try with older kids/teenagers to try to do a walking tour. Still, just to see the Bridge and take pictures is striking. So, hope you feet hold up better then mine b/c these attractions are so terrific to see you want to take in all that you can.
What a view. The best bridge in London - the prettiest to look at and the most photogenic. The view from this bridge is also quite fab.

Had a lovely time. First time in london and had to stop at this one. Had a nice time up there and can now say i had a wee on the tower bridge . Lovely staff and exhausted legs after all those stairs! Would tecommend it to everyone!
An amazing Landmark. Very busy location but offers opportunities for photographers. short walk from the Tower Hill tube station

Glass walk way and engine rooms v. good. Quite a few steps to climb up to the top walkway, you can walk over the long glass section and look down at the traffic. The exhibition is spread over floors in the towers. Engine rooms are worth a visit. Check times when the bridge is to be raised and watch from the walkway or on the bank.

Historical bridge in the centre of a modern metropolis. I think this is the one of the most famous building in London. Walking across the bridge was epic. It is much bigger than I thought before this visit.

Pretty. I used to come there with my friends after classes. We would wander and come from one bridge to another while expecting a nice view of sunset. The last time I came there, I was alone but the place is just that memorable to have a stroll. Both the day and night views of Tower Bridge are stunning.
You should visit for sure at night!. Amazing place, you should go off in the closest metro and walk next to the river. The best time is in the night the scenery is really good.

Gotta do it!. We used our London Pass to get a Fast Pass to the Tower Bridge Tour. It was very informative and interesting. We didn't realize we got to meander the walkways connecting the two towers and was even more amazed and apprehensive when we were able to venture onto the glass walkway and gaze down at the traffic and people below crossing the bridge. TIP: look up when you are on the glass walkway. There is a perfectly positioned mirror on the ceiling that easily lets you - or a group of people - take a selfie of them standing on the glass tiles with the traffic below. Even our height-issue friend was able to do this. She just couldn't look up or down while we stood on the glass. She just focused straight ahead while we snapped the photos and she was perfectly fine! You have a great view of the city of London and recognizable icons, and you can use the "photo ports" dotted along both sides of the walkways to get unobstructed views of the city.
Hands off. tied this up with a visit to Tower of London, the place is swarming with tourists and the walking is painfully slow however the views are spectacular
Definite must see. Take the trek to the top. You will have great views and pictures to share. The history of all you can see is shared by the staff. Quite fantastic experience

Take the tour!. My friends and I recently visited London, and of course the Tower Bridge was a must-see! We opted to go up and take the self-guided tour. It was really neat to see and had some fantastic photo ops. The tour is inexpensive and you can even print off a 2 for 1 voucher if you take the train to make it even cheaper. The views are lovely. I highly recommend.
Oh my the glass floor. This is a must do in London the engine room very interesting but the glass floor unbelievable. Not for those afraid of heig9

This is not London Bridge. You've seen pictures all your life, but you need to experience this space for yourself. This is not London Bridge, as you may have been led to believe most of your life. If you get lucky, the deck may lift to allow a boat to pass under.

Must see when in London.. This is must to see attraction while you visit London. There are nice paths around the rivers banks to let you enjoy the views. Bridge is spectacular in the night. There ar e some nice food places around. Busy with tourist specially in the the warm days.

A New Perspective on a Familiar Site. Everyone who thinks of London pictures the Tower Bridge, but the Tower Bridge Experience allows to you see how the structure was built and how it works. The pedestrian crossing at the top of the spires has added a section of glass floors so that you can see right down to the roadway and the Thames River below. It is a great learning experience and offers some excellent views up and down the river. Don't miss the steam powered pistons in the lower level used to operate the bridge early on.

The beautiful Tower Bridge the Americans could never buy!. Visit Tower bridge in London. It is located outside of Tower bridge underground station and is the water gateway to londons East End. I also recommend you walk across the the (inside!) top of the bridge for fantastic views on the Thmes and London.Afterwards, walk up 10-15 min. to Brick Lane (or take the tube one stop as its it outside of Aldgate East underground station) for a delicious curry (the area is known for its Bangladeshi community and curries) at a reasonable (for London!) price. Enjoy!

Love this! Glass floors are a little scary.. There are bridges and then there are bridges. This is the mother of all bridges. It is a fantastic bridge and an attraction you should not miss. When you are walking across the top, there are sections of the floor that are glass so you can see all the way down to the roadway and the water. That was a little freaky to me, but my husband and so many of the other visitors were loving it. It was a fantastic selfie opportunity. The views from the bridge were amazing. When we left the bridge, we headed back towards the tower of London side and there was an amazing street food fair right off to the side. Great selection of international foods and really affordable for a lunch.

One of the most iconic places in London. This is my favourite spot in London. Since I was a child I have the image of this bridge in my mind. I crossed it several times. I was lucky enough to do it walking, on a double decker bus, car and by boat.It really represents what Queen Victoria wanted for her Kingdom from my point of view.It is a unique and a very special bridge.
Wy. Everyone missed took Tower bridge is London Bridge, a grant bridge. Great view from under the bridge as show on pic. Can walk across the bridge as well. Great outdoor activities.

Pls Pls make this the top most reason of your trip to London.......... Must see at all cost if possible in the AM and PM hours if possible see it by walk via a vehicle over the bridge and on a boat under the bridge and if you are lucky try to time your trip at the times when the bridge opens and closes - published and pasted near the bridge and i think also available online on their website
one of the best to see in london. The technology of the london bridge explained and the view from the top through the glasses is superb. it was a nice to visit place even on a rainy day
clear floor pictures a must!. worth the price for a unique view of the river and the workings of the bridge. clear floors make for some fun photo ops

Great Views. We visited the bridge via the 2 for 1 deal when you have travelled in via train which cut the cost down. The views are great and you get some great photos on the glass walkway.There is plenty to read about the history of the bridge and other bridges in the world. My foreign visitors loved it.

VERY INTERESTING. While staying overnight at the Tower Hotel we did the Tower Bridge Experience.It is very interesting with great views over London from the upper walkways which you access by lift and which have glass walkways in parts.Lots of information and you round it off with a visit to the old engine rooms and gasp at the fantastic Victorian engineering skills.A very good way to spend and hour or so if in London. Cost was £6.30 each which was a senior rate I think about a tenner normally.
glass floor. See London and the River thru the glass floor. See the engine room. Great viewing point. worth the walk up !

Walk over the Thames. Its free to walk over on the main level. We wanted to do the upper level glass floor but long line (que) for tickets and closes at 1730. If you take the tunnel at Greenwich and then the bridge you have walked over and under the Thames.
towering. Great place to spend an hour crossing on the walkway kids loved it (aged 6+) interesting. Check for disabled access.

Very nice bridge. You can visit in day and on night with illuminated. The view from jubilee park or from the otherside Tower of London both are good.You can also take a tour inside tower bridge and see the down bridge.Also take a note of bridge opening, even though we took a note and tried to reach there but it was late and unfortunately missed it.

Beautiful Bridge. I stop by here every year on my visit to London. This year I had my brother with me and took him up on a half rainy day because I wanted him to see the suspension bridge open up . It is amazing to see the bridge and if you can see the bridge lift even better. I had checked the Tower Bridge website and some when the bridge was opening that day. It had quite a few openings that particular day but the days this happens does vary. Still fun to see.

Must See. the Tower bridge is full of history and historical anecdotes. don't just walk across on street level but go upstairs and read all about the construction and functioning of the mechanical parts and the history about construction in old days and modern times.

One of the many symbols of London. We've enjoyed this place from both the outside and the inside. One of my favorite things about the inside tour was the glass path on which you could walk and see all the people under you. At first it was a bit scary but after a while we got used to the sensation.

how much history in this institution!!. beautiful structure to visit, also the internal museum that explians the story of the bridge starting from its conception to its realization, that makes it clear how the British people were and are a great modern and progressive nation

Gorgeous bridge. I fulfil me dream not only to see the bridge but go also inside. Upstairs there is also glass surface to watch bridge under you. Very exciting experience. The bridge is what i heard open 3 times during the day. I was loocky and saw it from up through this glass surface at 16.35 o'clock. With your ticket you can also visit basement where is small museum of engine this tower. Realy great bridge! :-)
Boat trip on the Thames was a great way to see the area.. The bridge I enjoyed seeing the most was the one built by women during WWII. It came in under budget, ahead of schedule and is self-cleaning!

Another London classic. Aside from the Big Ben, the Tower Bridge should also be on your London list. It's a beautiful bridge that's an icon of London. Easy to get to and should be part of a walk along the banks of the Thames.
A must see in London. First, the view from the river it's great! The price to go up the tower was around 30 punds. If you are in london it's a place that you have to see.
interesting history . We were delighted with the nice layout of the bridge system. Informative and interesting . Elevators available , but still some walking

One of the most beautiful bridges I've seen in my life. Walking from one side to the other of the Tower Bridge is an experience you will never forget. This bridge is a monument of beauty and splendor in all its lenght. Besides, there are many sides of London awaiting to be uncovered on both ends, so enjoy your exploration, traveller! :-)

Excellent views of the river. I would recommend coming to visit Tower Bridge either in the summer or whenever it is sunny as the views are a lot better up and down the river. Also, if you can afford it go on the upper viewing gallery - really impressive!

Boring . Unless you're really into bridges I wouldn't bother. All's at the top is (basically) billboards on other bridges. You then take a 5min walk to a old engine house for it, looked intresting but like the bridge, bit boring. Not for kids, they'd be bored out of their minds

The famous bridge of London.. The most iconic bridge of London. The London Tower Bridge. Once you gain access to the exhibition which allows you to get access to the top of the bridge. Its a great view from the top. There even a glass floor which allows you to look down. *For those with heights issue, its not recommended*. I also visited with the London Pass.

A trick of the mind. It is funny how one's mind get tricked while walking on the glass path high above ground level. Don't miss a visit to see the engines on the other side of the bridge. It is a part of the ticket.

Beautiful Place That Stands As A Symbol Of London. Most rhymes show the Tower Bridge as the London Bridge and my little kids were overjoyed to see it in front of their eyes. A spectacular place to click memorable pictures. When you visit the Tower of London, do take a short walk to the bridge as well. The tour is amazing!

Fam Holiday. Well organized and signed to explain functioning of the bascules.Not too busy on a Tuesday at noon in May.Love the engine room and that it so well looked after. The mirrored ceiling over the glass floor is a big hit with all the tourists!Great exhibit of major bridges of the world, including my favourite...the Roman stone slab bridge in Dartmoor!

It was a great experience. It was amazing to see the most famous bridge in the world. There was a short movie about how it was made. The walk thru the glass floor is amazing. The engine room is also great, to see how the bridge opens and closes is amazing. Overall, I would give 5 out of 5

Not as good as I remember it. This was ok and was free with Tesco vouchers so can't moan. However I remember it being better when I went as a kid (you could go right down under the counterweights). Now this is a little light and could be done in about 30mins tops.

A View of History. We travelled to the Tower via a commuter craft on the Thames, a great way to meet people and view the buildings along side the river. Our destination was the Tower of London so we got to see this imposing structure from the river and on land on the tour.
Lovely at night. Very pretty at night in particular. Impressive architecture and close to lots of other interesting sights!

Must see icon. This is one of those super duper touristy attractions that you have to go to at least once when visiting London. I'd recommend doing it the same day you do Tower of London because they not only complement each other nicely, but are literally right next to one another. I'd recommend going super early in the morning or around twilight to avoid the masses of people.

Yes, the one that opens. Having lived in London for the last 40 odd years, this was the first time I took a boat trip down the Thames with my nephew and his family on holiday from India. Thoroughly recommend this way. Sure the hop on hop off buses are good but this is differentYou get to cruise from the London Eye towards the docklands area and back, taking in all the bridges and the ever changing London skyline.
Love it. Brilliant attraction in London to see!! Just a shame that the bridge doesn't open else I would rate it a 5!!

Good Fun and Cheap. Really enjoyed this experience. For only £9 it is absolutely worth it. Views along the river are great and standing on the glass floor whilst cars drive underneath is weird but a good experience. Along the top they have lots of pictures of other interesting bridges around the world and just the right amount of information on Tower Bridge for you to feel informed but not too much.

Often Mistaken To Be London Bridge. Walked across the the Queen's Way from Londomn Bridge to Tower Bridge on a sunny day - it was just lovely. A must do with kids and dont forget to take them across the Tower Bridge too
Enjoyed the walk. lovely view and lovely tower. enjoyed the walk, bridge was clean and it was comfortable to walk around.

Impressive. I was pleasantly surprised at this bridge. I had watched a documentary about it prior to coming and it didn't disappoint. Great view from the bridge of the Tower of London and beautiful in itself. A bit crowded of course though.

Excellent if you're into technical stuff. You will love this if you're an engineer. They go very in depth into technical explanations (especially towards the end). My friend wanted to go up mainly for the glass floor. There's a series of exhibition, but I would skip going up if I had only 2 days in London.
Looking for London Bridge?. The tower bridge is visited by many tourists. We took a hop on hop off tour bus and enjoyed all the history lessons provided by the audio tour.
Spectacular. The Tower Bridge always amazes me. It is beautiful and stately. It is worth it to walk across the bridge and back just to admire the architecture.

great. great piece of English history and architecture .
a nice walk around the bridges, with some nice eateries along the way.
The best bridge in the world. The history and architecture of this bridge is spectacular. I waited over 40 years to see this bridge...so worth it!

Wonderful Views. We visited the museum which is housed in the enclosed upper walkways. Check the website or look at the board inside to see if the bridge will be opening. Its pretty cool to watch that from above (there is a glass section of floor to look through)
Beautiful At Night. Waited until nightfall to head over to the Tower Bridge - gorgeous and glowing at night! Great view of the sunset on the Thames.
👍🏻. A beautiful bridge to walk over with great views from either side! Gets busy in areas due to it being a tourist attraction but an enjoyable experience.

Exciting!. Tower Bridge is another signature of London. One of the best view is from Tower of London. Besides, there is another feature about Tower Bridge, can you guess what is it?Upon your arrival at the Tower Bridge, why not take the challenge of walking on the transparent section? You can see everything straight under your feet including the River Thames. How exciting!

More "British" than this it doesn't get.. Perfectly placed with the Tower of London just next to it, what could be more "British" than this. I visited the insides with 2 teenagers last year and they were enthralled by the brilliant Victorian engineering. This year our 3 year old grandson was absolutely fascinated watching the bridge open and close to let a tall masted sailing boat through. Unfortunately the quick questions here do not allow one to give a fair overview - so here are some more details - the inside visit is probably not for smaller children and not for wheelchairs and it has a fee. Watching the bridge from outside however is free and great for all-

Good for history buffs!. We visited the Tower Bridge Experience recently. As well as seeing the outside of the bridge you can walk along inside the high walkways and look down through a glass floor below and see the boats passing underneath. You can see the engine room and you can see some information on the history of he bridge. If you time it right you could also be there when they raise the bridge too. There are many photos of other bridges all over the world which we found quite interesting inside too. Good educational trip to see a landmark of London. Near Tower Hill station so easy to reach. Gets busy - so visit early!

Attending yet another meeting with a view of Tower Bridge from the window....... .......led me finally to get round to reviewing it.For some it is simply the simplest way across the river, for others a working museum. However over-used the word 'iconic' might be, Tower Bridge is an icon saying 'London' to people across the world.In the great sweep of London's history the bridge is something of a Johnny-come-lately, but in the 122 years that it has been open it has achieved its current status.When illuminated on special occasions, or when for example Olympic rings were suspended from the bridge, it assumes even greater importance.
Recommended . I think it's a must if you're going to London. Children and adults liked it, specially the glass floor and the views from the top.
Historia y trofeo de inglaterra. Very nice overall look . Except when one because of the colors of their chains learns . Still worth is a complete exposure.

A landmark and an amazing piece of engineering . Great. Love it. From all the different views, just beautiful. It is a landmark. You should not miss it. With sunlight the light blue painting looks gorgeous.
Beautiful Bridge. We walked over the bridge and also went under it on a river cruise. This is such a beautiful bridge. Right next to the Tower of London.
Majestic. Take the river boat up the Thames and you a greeted by the majestic sight if Tower Bridge, a true feet of British engineering at its very best

Walk along the glass floor. It was a very enjoyable excursion! I do not like heights let alone walking across a glass floor, but I very much enjoyed this experience! The views are fantastic and we were lucky it was a clear day, we could see for miles around. And £9 and adult very cheap!

Walking in an icon. I went up the Tower Bridge to please some friends, visiting London for a few days.Well, what a pleasant surprise! It is a marvel of Victorian engineering, which you can best admire by walking the stairs up and down. Forget the lift, if you can. Once up, you will have a great view of the city for a fraction of the price that you have to pay at - the London Eye -. The glass floor can be a bit upsetting for those who do not have an eye for highness. However it is really something to see the traffic, the pedestrian and the water flowing below you.
It's a pretty bridge. I didn't get to do the tower visit in the bridge as we were too late but it is really pretty. I really like driving over it when I'm passing that direction

Gorgeous and iconic!. I love walking across this bridge. You get a fab view of the Thames and the cityscape.
If no one was looking, I'd give one of the towers a hug and say, "Thank you, Mr. Bridge, I feel like I'm walking across history." And you will too!
Be a Tourist. Take a boat ride on the Thames river to see this beautiful bridge from the vantage point that royalty viewed it on coronation day. As well as the other historic sights of London.

I called this...' London bridge is falling down'. My childhood's fav rhyme was ' London bridge is falling down... My fair lady'. And it was since then that I dreamt of being in London standing on the bridge which was etched in my childhood memories.But infact, this beautiful bridge is called the Tower Bridge and of course, there's another bridge called London bridge. As u walk on this bridge or even travel by bus, especially the rooftop, you will feel the awesomeness of this marvellous structure. It's so so beautiful. Walking by, touching the stone walls, feels wow! As you must know, this bridge is on River Thames near the Tower hill station. It opens when a ship sails beneath it.No doubt, it's one of London's Most Iconic Landmarks.

Beautiful bridge with excellent views. I absolutely love Tower Bridge! I am fascinated by bridges, and I remember that Tower Bridge impressed me on my first visit to London with my parents a long time ago. On that visit we toured the Tower then but were unaware Tower Bridge could be walked across (and I don’t know whether they had tours then). So when I discovered the Tower Bridge tour in a guidebook before a recent business trip to London, we decided to go on the afternoon we arrived before we started work. We were not disappointed. I recommend walking north to south, as we did, on the east side of the roadway. The entrance to the Tower Bridge Exhibition is in the north tower on the east (left as you walk from the north) side. After paying your reasonably priced admission and having any bags checked, you ride a lift to the upper walkways (we had no wait but there can be queues for the lifts). The tour guides were very good. You walk south on the east walkway, then north on the west walkway, then back south on the west walkway. From the walkways you get spectacular views, especially from the west walkway, even on an overcast day. You also get amazing views looking down through the glass floors of the walkways (and don’t forget to look up and see yourself and the river in the mirror above). You then descend in a lift (or sometimes they let you walk all the way down on the stairs, as we were able to do) and continue south across Tower Bridge (road level) to see the engine room. Note: it is free to just walk across Tower Bridge on the sidewalk that parallels the road.Tower Bridge is a working drawbridge that does open periodically (schedule can be found online). I did not see a lift (opening), but expect the tour is rather crowded at that time. It would have been fun to see a lift from the shore.

Worth taking a river cruise to get a great view . You can get a good view of the Tower Bridge while visiting the Tower of London. It's also great to take a river tour which allows you to pass under it.

Not a must see, but fun!. After spending the day at the Tower of London, the Tower Bridge was a good way to end the day. It was easy to get tickets and no wait to take the lift up to the top. Beautiful views and informative displays.
Better by foot. We saw this from a tour bus and by foot. Walking is much better as you can stop and explore up close. Great spots for photo opportunities.
Nice walk over the Thames. Very nice to walk across this beautiful historic bridge.It worths considering to visite the Tower Bridge Exhibition.

Memorable sights. The visit to the Tower Bridge was a memorable experience for me. Definitely worth the entry fee. The views from the top over the city is great and the glass floor directly above the traffic and river below are quite an experience.Worth visiting!

Mind blowing. We went at the beginning of the year, wondering if it was worthing and were totally delighted. The glass walkway is truly impressive and slightly scary, the mechanism of the bridge fascinating and the construction video worth watching twice.

The city possesses so many iconic venues its very difficult to decide which must be seen and in what order. The Tower Bridge is definitely one of the "must sees", even if it is while riding across it on the top of a double decker tour bus. Awesome architecture and a fantastic symbol of this old city.
powerful. One of the most impressive bridges in the world along with the Charles bridge in Prague. Amazing new to Themes Tower of London and City of London.
So interested. Visit included in LondonPass and visit is clearly explained. All is interestedVisite incluse dans le LondonPass et très intéressante

AMAZING NIGHT!!. I've always been interested in visiting London and all its beautiful attractions... and finally one day my dream came true. *-*I absolutely suggest to visit the Tower bridge which is the attraction I preferred most becouse at night it turns itself in something really evocative and suggestive and everyone should see how magic is !

Underrated and unique.. I've wanted to do this for a while but waited for decent weather for a good view down the Thames and across the city.It's one of the cheaper attractions on London and doesn't let you down when it comes to value for money. It can take a while to get in as there's limited space in the lift to the top of the first tower but once your up you can take your time, enjoy the views of London, look through the glass floor at the traffic and Thames below or just read the many information boards spread along the walk way.Cross over the 'road' from above and walk down the opposite side and then head down and out to see the original and amazingly maintained 'engine' room.All in all a good attraction worth seeing and worth the money, combine it with a trip to see The Monument and save even more.
Wonderful experience and educational. Really fun experience the new glass floor is amazing. Staff are friendly and helpful. The tour is really educational although there are a lot of steps.

Iconic bridge - the one to cisit. The Tower Bridge is an amazing structure and can be seen from a fair distance. Good to view from all different angles on a nice day. Pros: A must see when you're in London. Makes me want to buy the Lego set. You can walk across this bridge and take plenty of good photos from all angles. Cons: none, just go and see it.

Lucky to see the bridge opening sideways. Uniquely impressive bridge and an icon of London. We got the chance to sèe the bridge opening at the middle and moving sideways from both ends to allow a vessel cross from below - truly incredible.

Finest bridge in the world.. We have been to sanfransico and other great bridges but this is the best, have a picnic by the mayor building or just sit by the Tower of London nd watch this go up. It's the best and most beautiful bridge in the world. X
Wow, quite a structure. This was a highlight, don't miss it, we walked over the bridge and were able to look back at the tower of London, perfect

Take 20 minutes for Tower Bridge. Working in London can be a bit stressful when commuting, queuing at lunch and rushing around, but if you're lucky enough to be close to Tower Bridge or you're visiting the area, take 20minutes to appreciate Londons most historic bridge!There is an entry fee if you wish to walk over the viewing glass or go into the engine room but just walking across the bridge seeing the H.M.S Belfast, Tower of London and city skyline is a nice experience on its own.If you leave the bridge on the south side using the steps walk a few paces down Shad Themes and turn left into the Old Brewer House. There is a little walk through with a few steps that lead into the Themes itself! If you're there when the tide is out you can walk down into the themes so you're almost under the bridge ;)If you leave the bridge on central side using the steps next to Dead Mans Gate (where they used to pull bodies out of the river) there is always an ice cream van and a hippy camper van which both sell hot/cold refreshments. Or if you're watching the pennies there is also a Tesco extra... Grab a drink and take in the scenery St.Catherine's Dock is also 2 minutes round the corner! There's always beautiful boats in there include one of the Queens.. It's free to walk around and has bars/restaurants around it.ENJOY!!

Iconic Bridge. Iconic Bridge of London, was on a walking trail of the area, picture perfect place, was very rainy the day I was visiting so a little dampener. Overall something one cannot miss visiting London.

Glass Floor!. Tower bridge is really cool so go and see, but the best part is the glass floor exhibit! If you go up to the top, they have a glass floor that you can walk on and it feels weird and awesome at the same time! It was really great to look down at the water while walking high above it. It is a must do when in London!

Fantastic!. Just what i hoped it would be. I would highly recommend going on a weekday to avoid the crowds. A spectacular example of centuries of English history and architecture. Definitely not to be missed.

Worth a look but don't expect to stay all day. A unique insite into how this amazing bridge came to be and how it works, if you are scared of heights, think,twice. This exhibition will not take long to,complete maybe an hour max, but a good break between other site seeing.

Each time leaves me breathless with wonder. With the help of a Black Cab driver, we were able to capture the perfect photos. Tower Bridge is truly awesome.

Must-do in London. I had a very hurried experience in London, and this was one of the few things I actually got to experience fully. The bridge in beautiful and if you go to the top it offers a beautiful view. This is especially wonderful for anyone who loves engineering or architecture. Well worth doing the round the Tower Bridge trip!. We did the tour and were fascinated by the history of the building. Really helpful informative star. Crossing the walkway with the glass floor is a must. Great selfies lying down!

Excellent visit. We visited this Tower Bridge late afternoon and were lucky enough to see the bridge being raised just before we went up. We bought our tickets in advance and therefore didn't have to queue. I'd recommend this as I'd imagine the queues can get quite long. There's a large lift to bring people up to the platforms that crosses the bridge. One of our kids hates lifts and got very upset with it on the way up and the staff couldn't do enough to help us. They were unbelievably helpful and did all that they could to help calm her. You can then walk across the bridge and look down at the river and traffic below through a glass floor. At the opposite end of the platform, there's a video showing how the bridge was constructed. On both sides you can see details on various other famous bridges the world over and the views are amazing. Bring your camera for both selfies through the glass floor and the view out of the bridge itself. Separate to the bridge but part of the tour is the original steam engine room that pulled the bridge up. This was fascinating and very well done. You could see one of the steam engines working , the hydraulic pumps and the counter weights. Fascinating if you're into engineering and how things work. Overall a great couple of hours and not at all expensive compared to some of the other attractions in London.

This NOT London Bridge. Many people think that Tower Bridge is London Bridge. It is not. Tower Bridge, however, is great to look at. It's a lot more fun than an average sort of bridge. The bridge was built in the later 19th century. It;s since become a symbol of London, recognised around rhe world..
Simply... Wow. Don't miss the tower bridge if you are in London, you can go up and see down through a glass under your feet! A wonderful experience.

Iconic landmark of London. A trip to London MUST include a trip to Tower Bridge. Amazingly well kept with the pedestrian and vehicular traffic. Since it is so close to the Tower, they are easily done together.

Icon of London. On the 1st day of my arrival to London, I went to this attraction right away since it is the most typical icon of London, that is, everyone can realise you're at London with a picture with Tower Bridge. There's a small art gallery inside and exhibition of the bridge operation, which is worth seeing. Totally recommended!!!
Must do... really!. Walk the bridge, and then stop for fish and chips on either side. Part of a perfect day!Be prepared for chilly weather.

The History Walkway Exhibit. Your admission also includes the engine room that has an imitation engine, which shows how the drawbridge works, so you can see that aside from being a beautiful icon, Tower Bridge is also an engineering fest. This is my favorite daytime attraction in London! As iconic as the British Parliament and the London Eye, the Tower Bridge is yet another recognizable symbol for the British capital. If you didn't witness it, you probably didn't know that it's also a movable bridge. The walkway exhibit shows the history of the Tower Bridge with its facts and data and the roster of impressive bridges around the world.

View of the River Thames. London is a terrific city to walk around, but it's important to note that if you decide to fit in all of the touristy landmarks, it's a pretty significant walk from Big Ben to the bridge. I would recommend taking a bus tour, which will take you as far as Tower Bridge to the east and Westminster to the west, as well as the arts district to the north. I was able to get some good pics on a fittingly overcast day. The Tower Bridge has a lot of history around it. And, it's absolutely beautiful. Why don't they make structures like this anymore? Such detail and craftsmanship. It is situated in the middle section of London and offers terrific westerly views of the River Thames as well as the Tower of London.
