Beautiful . One of the great landmarks of the world and a must see if you ever visit London!! Oozes history and offers great views in both directions up and down the Thames

Great views from the top!. Nice tour without being overwhelming. We just finished the Tower of London so a short tour was good. Lots of info about bridge building and history of this bridge. Fabulous views of the city from both sides of the upper levels!
Great views. On a nice day you get some breathe taking views of the Thames and the surrounding areas. Not great for those scared of heights. Very enjoyable
Fabulous!. Such an interesting and historical place to visit. The glass floor over the traffic is so cool...great for photos.
Beautiful during the night.. One of the many London Bridges. This one is really beautiful during the night. Must seen if you came to visit London.

Excited Place Tower Bridge Amazing. It is a vast & amazing structure. Standing along the river looking upon it, I imagined medieval times & all who've crossed it. Then I imagined Bay Bridge, Golden Gate, Coronado, George Washington bridges & did a mental comparison. While each is quite compelling, Tower Bridge, thus far, is my fave. The detail & design utterly amazing yet simple. I was in awe. Still am. Took a wrong turn at Tower of London & exited onto the wharf and WOW! Was not expecting to see Tower Bridge and there it was, right in front of me.

Impressive!. A lift takes you up to the walk way level by very pleasant lift operators who let you know a little about the bridge.The best bit of course is walking on the glass walk ways, if you dare. But apparently the glass is stronger than the wooden floor which is a hundred and fifty years old.You walk around at your own pass and it only took us half an hour but a great experience

Saw it in a Unique Way. We came in Sat.on a small Ponant Line cruise ship,BACKWARDS!! This gave us a unique view of bridge that will stay eith us. The bridge was crowded with waving folk,enjoying their rare sight. The bridge is gorgeous,from any angle.

Brilliant site. Walked across the bridge and took photos from across the river. Amazing seeing the Bridge from the Eye too. Great to think about the history of the bridge and the thousand of people who run across it during the London Marathon.
London essential!. You can't say you've been to london if you haven't crossed this bridge and taken the obligatory photos. Crazy busy at times, can be quite nice early (6am) on a Sunday though.

Must see London from the top of the tower. If you visit Tower bridge you must not miss the opportunity of going up the tower and getting a great view of London from above or seeing the old steam engine rooms (which used to lift the bridge in the past)

London Bridge from Nursery rhymes. My kid wanted to visit, the ' London bridge' and we decided to go there.Reached a bridge exactly opposite the one in the nursery rhymes. Then figured that this is called the Tower Bridge.Old structure which looks good.Don't miss the opening and closing of the bridge to let a ship pass, its a good sight.

Loved it. Has been London loads of times and never been here before but so glad we went. It's great. Went on a Sunday morning and no long queues Loved all the history and the views of London were great.The glass viewing platform is great.

Lovely. This is just beautiful. There is virtually no trash on it even though there are thousands of visitors a day - they take amazing care of it. It is still a breathtaking site to see - pictures do not do its history and stature justice. A must go if you are in London.
Boring Tour. This bridge is so beautiful but the tour of it is so boring! Skip the tour and go hang out by the river in front of the Tower of London to get amazing views of this gorgeous bridge!

Iconic landmark and love the glass floor overlooking the Thames. This landmark has an awkward tight admission tickets area, but be patient and enjoy the outstanding view from the top. Loved the glass floors, the special exhibits on bridges in the world and the overall history of the complex.

Highlight of London. A group of seven of us went to visit this on a beautiful Saturday evening. Two kids and five adults. We all agreed that this was on the best things to do in London. The views of the city are amazing. We arrived outside just as the bridge was being raised for a cruise ship. The only way this visit could have been improved was if we had gone about a 1/2 hour earlier & been inside the bridge in time to see the bridge be raised from inside as the ship passed under.

Amazing!. You should absolutely visit the Tower Bridge Experience. It gives you beautiful views, a little history and the glass floor is absolutely stunning! Take about 1-1.5 hours to visit this monument!

Walk across and absorb the history. No trip to Central London would be complete without a walk across tower bridge. The great thing about London is most of the main monuments are within walking distance of each other. For a resident of London like myself I don't spend a long time at each monument as it is something Iv visited many times before but each visit still makes me grateful that I live in such an amazing multicultural city. If you are a tourist spend a little time longer and soak up the history !

Worth the visit.. What a great view of London. We done this attraction as part of the london pass. It only took approximately an hour. It did have a great view. The best experience was the glass floor across the span looking straight down onto the traffic below.

Iconic Bridge. The tours last about 1.5 hours, for the price it great value. You take a lift to the top and get to walk across 2 gangways on both sides. If you go on a really busy day walk through to the 2nd gangway as the first one fills up as you enter. Mainly because of the glass walk way which is amazing but it is also on the other side as well.You get to learn a bit about the history and when you exit you get to see the engine rooms which is interesting. To know this is an active working bridge with all its history makes for a good visit.

I don't do touristy things; I am glad I did this.. On the day of the Marathon, my son and I enjoyed walking in places with no traffic, as the runners were finished. We came to the Tower Bridge and decided to pay the 15 pounds for both of to go up on the walkways, which now have glass bottoms. It was a blast. Not only is the view spectacular, but the view downward was crazy. It literally makes your stomach turn the first time you walk over the glass, and you find yourself trying to avoid walking over it. One side has the mirrors over the glass, you you can get some interesting shots. Was worth the visit.
Great views of the city. Walked across on a glorious Spring day and lovely views in both directions and such an amazing piece of architecture
Fantastic views. Was crowded as expected. Amazing view of the tower bridge standing tall against the blue skyline helped by lovely weather. Cannot be missed.

Great to look at in the dark. Well worth a visit at night with nice places to eat just down the road Hms Belfast is not to far away. We stayed at the hotel Guoman which is nice. Reasonably priced and the bar overlooks the bridge so you could just pop in for a beer and get great views

Beautiful landmark. I have always seen this bridge, but only in movies or print.. I always thought it was beUtiful to look at. Last June 2015, I finally got to see it in person. It exceeded my expectations!

Nice place for a walk. Check internet for the times the bridge is opening.. The first time I visited it I didn't know that the bridge open so often. So I checked Internet next time and took the perfect photo with me and the bridge opened.

Walking over the river is so beautiful . Ive been over this bridge many times but being a river lover it doesnt get boring at all! Especially when the sun is out, and you want to just watch the river flow. Its peaceful - unless you get caught in rush hour! But its wonderful on a hot summers day. You see normal boats and river cruises go by under you and people wave. Its a nice atmosphere. Sometimes you get artists drawing pictures of the views they see, you can buy some of their work, also live entertainment, free of charge.
Only from the outside . It's beautiful from the outside but going up isn't worth the money. The view isn't that great and you can read the history of the bridge on the internet, nothing special

Icon in middle of London. I went to Visit tower Bridge in February. The winds around the tower bridge were so chilly that one would froze himself. This is awesome place to visit .This place will give you the glimse british architecture. I liked the peanuts sold at tower bridge.Awesome place to visit
OK . Signage wasn't very clear for the exhibit - maybe because lots of people were crossing the bridge? Great views across London.

Well.. i don't know what to say . Im really not impressed with this one. Just really nothing special. I saw many nicer bridges. Some parts are colored in blue an that totally destroys the atmosphere of it.  Its just next to Tower and the underground station so easy to see
Well Worth a Visit. Can highly recommend the Tower Bridge Experience, a great opportunity to see inside the building and understand a little of its fascinating history.

It was a ok visit. . This is something I always wanted to Do but never had a chance. We paid £6 per adult on a discount ticket paired with London dungeons. The lift wasn't working at the bridge so we had to climb the 200 steps up and was not asked if we had a problem with that. After climbing those steps and catching our breathe, the view was pretty amazing and the walk over the see through floor was pretty good. There's not much else to do up the tower. Then you can go see the engine rooms. This was interesting, kids were a bit bored. Wouldn't go again, but glad we did it once.

Loved it. . This bridge is just great. It probably screams "London" nearly as loud as Big Ben does. It's really cool architecture over a famous river in a famous city. I enjoyed it from on shore and from on the bridge itself.

Quick trip. Decided to go into tower bridge experience as the weather wasn't too good and we didn't really know what to expect. It is a good price to get in and we were impressed. It's very informative and interesting. The views from the walkways are great and the glass floor although a bit odd to start with was really good
A lovely view after visiting the Tower. Admired the bridge after completing our tour of the Tower. It's the bridge that everyone thinks of when they think of London.

Simply Beautiful. We passed by the Tower Bridge several times on our all day tour and eventually had a chance to stop and gaze at it. Just can't describe the awesomeness of this bridge. It is a definate must see when in London.
Walking over Tower Bridge. I love the views! They were absolutely breathtaking!! This was my second time visiting London I would definitely return again!

nice and amazing view. it is a MUST to visit Tower Bridge especially if you love history. Because inside there, lots of story to tell from your tour guide and u can take pics from different angles - amazing view

Worth visiting!. Great experience, nice view from glass floor.Try walking up using the stairs instead of taking elevator, it's a great experience. Tiring but fun! If you are lucky you get see the bridge lift too!Just FYI, it's quite a walking distance from Tower Hill Underground Station but there's so much to see (i.e. Tower of London) and eat (Fish & Chips, Soft Ice Creams, etc.) so take your time and enjoy.p/s: Buy your ticket online to skip the long queue.

Beautiful sight!. This is an icon of London, so you have to at least catch a glimpse of it! Walking across it is good. You can visit Tower of London all day, then take a walk across the bridge, eat at a pub nearby and get a view of Big Ben all in the same area. London Eye is also there. And, of course, take note that you are viewing the Thames. A lot of cool stuff in one spot!

Amazing glass floor top of the bridge!. Nice and interesting place. Under the bridge you can see, how it was work in early years and when you climbing up, you realize how tought work was build this monumental bridge!

Guardian of the Thames. Standing proud beside the Tower of London this iconic bridge guards the river approach to central London. It is a fitting companion to the Tower yet so much younger having been built around 1890. Despite its youth it exudes a great sense of history and witness of bygone years. An architectural masterpiece which demands the closer examination that will reveal so much more than a mere photograph.

Fun View of the Thames. So fun to walk on the glass floor. It is a hike up to the bridge via stairs, but super cool to see the city from the middle of the river. Stop to watch the movie - the history of the bridge build is great.

Iconic bridge. The bridge tour was great. I really enjoyed the mechanics of the bridge. There are several areas of the walkway that are made of glass. The only downfall was its busy so it's difficult to get a look thru the glass when the bridge was opening.
Brilliant photo op. What a cheap but great day out - the glass walkway provides such brilliant photo opportunities. Wear flats though!
Visit exhibition!. Loved the exhibition (including really interesting video) and the view. Don't just take pictures of the bridge - go inside! Follow the blue footsteps to the engine room as well!

Not great for buggies. An interesting tour of the Bridge learning about it's history etc. However we found it not very buggy friendly. Although directed from the main entrance to a side lift, the lift isn't very well sign posted. Once up though the views down through the glass floor are excellent.

A different experience. Our friends were married Tower Bridge. Intimate and beautiful spaces for intimate feast was an experience. After the wedding ceremony we were able to explore the bridge showrooms and admire the stunning views around the surrounding areas! I recommend at least showrooms and at the same time you get to see London in a slightly different point of view.

Amazing. We were doubting whether or not to visit the bridge. So glad that we decided to take the short trip to get here. The bridge is very beautiful and the contrast of it being surrounded by very impressive modern buildings makes the experience complete. We didn't go inside but I can only imagine that this would be a treat as well.

Sightseeing in London. I only had two hours here but could have spent at least half of a day. The queen's jewels exhibit was absolutely amazing and I went through it twice. I also went through the white palace. Get there early in the morning as soon as it opens to avoid the crowds of school children.
Really Cool!. Make sure you see it from the River AND walk across it! The Tower Bridge is really amazing and unlike any other bridge.

A Must Indeed. We cane here on the day of the London Marathon and as expected walking amongst the crowds was more cumbersome yet, manageable. The bridge is the halfway point for the marathon. Actually the marathon spirit added to joy, the crowds were cheering the runners and sang along with the music "wo oh we're almost there, oh ho we're living on a prayer" now that is something else. The tour is approx 9 BP for adult and 4PB child. The tour is fun and takes about an hour. The glass floor is amazing and videos explain the story of the bridge and constraction .The views are superb. Still a classic, highly recommended. Tip, there is s photo machine 3PB per photo, does not give change. Bring exact change, also bring 1PB and a 1 penny if you want to do those flatten penny coins. Great souvenir shop at the end. Enjoy.
tower bridge was breathtaking. tower bridge is the most breathtaking bridge ive been on to date. the views are amazing and the details on the bridge make it that much beautiful. its gorgeous

I love it here.. Ever since I was a kid I've had a thing for this bridge. I recall seeing it and passing underneath on a school trip in the early 1950s and wanting to cross over by the road. These days I come once a year to watch the Marathon go over.Part of my childhood and part of my present.
Good views from the top. . Entry is included with the London pass. Otherwise 9€ to go up and into the engine room. On top theres a nice view on the river on both side of the bridge.
Scenic views.. Nice attraction to visit, scenic views of the River Thames as well. Can get a bit crowded just because it's a place of interest.

Interesting exhibition and good view from the Tower Bridge. The exhibitions and videos are interesting. My husband and 5 year old son have no problem with the glass part of the tower but I chose to walk along the solid side. They gave children a "passport" with stickers to be collected at various stage to complete the passport. Good way to engage the kids.Tower bridge and Tower of London nearby are eligible for the "Day out" 2 for 1 promotion if you have two rail tickets and fill the form online or from the brochure at rail stations.

Awesome. Brought the family here. Wanted to come for ages. The Tower Bridge itself is steep in history. We loved the view and most of all we all remark how awesome the bridge is and how long it's been there. Another tick of the list ✔️

A must visit sight. If you visit London, you have to come and see Tower Bridge and if you are really lucky, see it in action... Awesome! Of course you also have the Thames there with a fantastic view of The Tower of London etc.

Don't bother inside - the outside is the impressive part. I had seen Tower Bridge from the outside many time, so I eventually waiting in the queue to check out the inside. Very touristy and not that exciting. Don't waste your time and money going inside - just view it from the outside, especially in the evening when it lights up.

It's Cute Isn't It?. This is just the cutest little bridge! I've wanted to see this bridge since I watched the Great Muppet Caper. You know? The one where the Muppets go to London.Anyway it was everything I hoped it would be!
Beautiful!. Very beautiful, great place to take photos. Must walk across and do tour if not busy. Loved this place! Walk over to Tower of London, fantastic sightseeing.

It's better if you come back at night. The bridge itself is really gorgeous. It's iconic, they hung the Olympic rings from here in 2012, and wish I could have seen that.The bridge looks 100 times better though at night, with the lights adding the magical glow. Tough to justify a trip just to look at the bridge, but you shouldn't miss it if taking in the Tower. Try to come back at night though, if you really like the bridge!
It's a great site to visit. went there seen it got the t-shirt lol Great piece of history and engineering and must see for anyone who travels to the uk

GLASS FLOOR!!!. One of the better places ... my wife loves roller coasters but had trouble with the glass floor over the river ... great view ..only complaint ...they should show how thick the glass is BEFORE you walk over it.
Educational. As great trip, history and a lot of sight seeing and things to do. There was a glass bridge exhibition which I recommend but not for the faint hearted!

I love the views. There is something about Tower Bridge that makes me feel lost in time (if you close your eyes & imagine the sky risers have disappeared) So much history and a great place to also see Modern London.
Tower Bridge experience . Excellent day out - walking across the top of the old Bridge - walking on the glass floor and seeing all the traffic and water below. Very interesting and good for photos.
Unique view over the Thames.. Great view, unique experience. LOTS of steps. Was a cold rainy day but got to check it off the bucket list.

Fantastic Views. Wow what a bridge. The views are stunning and what a magnificent landmark to London. A must see if you are in London. We stop just down near Tower of London and had a coffee while looking at Tower Bridge. Gorgeous day and stunning view. Worth a visit if you are in the area :-)

Tower Bridge Glass Walkway. The new glass walkway on the Tower Bridge is a nice addition for visitors. If you are hesitant to walk on the glass, there is area on each side where you can still walk across the bridge and enjoy the views. The glass does provide unique views of cars driving under the bridge and The River Thames.

Tower Bridge. We only walked across the Tower Bridge on our way to see The Tower of London. This bridge was very historical and very beautiful to photograph. It looks even better from the river Thames
not what you expect in a bridge. A vast metal structure covered in stone giving the bridge an older look than it really is, A tribute to the original builders and those who keep it working today.
Tower Bridge. Recommended by a friend and ticked lots of boxes. A great way to spend a couple of hours. History and views all for a good price.

Our favorite bridge!. This was the first visit that we actually walked across Tower Bridge. We came by boat from Westminster Pier and got off at the bridge. This has always been are favorite from afar but we had never been physically able to walk it until know. Up close it only is more beautiful!
Sight seeing at tower bridge . Iv never been in this part of the city before and the walk across the bridge gave a fantastic insight to the sites of London

Fabulous Thames River views. Took friends visiting us in London to the Tower Bridge after a visit to the Tower of London. Bought tickets in advance and skipped the line. Kids got a sticker book to fill in at various points of the self-guided tour. The highlight were the glass floors looking down at the bridge and Thames River. You just can't be scared of heights as it is a long way down looking through the floor! Interesting exhibits on steam engines and other bridges around the world. Thought it was well done and keep the kid's interest.
Truly a classic London site. This was my first visit to London and would recommend viewing the bridge from one of the Themes river cruises.

Cool bridge! See the exhibit on history and mechanism !. A london icon, well worth visiting. The bridge is cool and has great views, the information is fun for everyone and the mechanics are interesting for gearheads. The Walkway has a glass bottom and if you are lucky you will even see the bridge open up. Note it can be busy.

Amazing experience . Oh my. If your thinking of doing this experience, Dont delay. Was amazing. Breath taking and educational.I am not a fan of bridges but this doesnt feel like your on a bridge. I even sat on the glass floor watching beneath. Seeibg the engine room was a true experience for my husband he was in awe. A must do.
Combine with Tower of Londoo. An interesting sight and a pretty bridge. The tour itself does not stand on its own to warrant by itself but combined with the tower of London, it was fun.
Fantastic place to see. Fantastic place to see, you can go up on the towers and walk in between and also experience the glass floor. Amazing one

Stunning structure!. Have visited this bridge many times and always impressed by its design.
Latest visit was just after the London Marathon while it was still closed to traffic so was able to walk on the main carriageway (not recommended when bridge is open to traffic)
Well worth a visit!
Marathon landmark. Was glad to get over it but if you go on the bus tour it was good to hear yhe gistory of it. One of londons beat landmarks... especially when you are running the marthon
Beautiful from the outside. If you are in London why not wander to the Tower of London over Tower Bridge and take the opportunity to take photos from the banks.
Worth a visit. This is worth a visit. However if you were pressed for time in London, I would do for example, the Tower of London as a priority.
Very impressive. very informative with old film footage from 1800's. walking on see through platform may be awesome, exciting, or a bit frightful

Wonderful day out!. Didn't really know what to expect but an amazing day out.
Took about 1 1/2 hours, get to see the engine room and how the bridge was built.
The wow factor is definitely the glass floor, makes you feel a bit dizzy!
Definitely worth it and very reasonable at £9 per adult and about £20 for a family ticket.
Watched the race here. What a magnificent structure this is unfortunately didn't go to the mechanism part due to watching the marathon but can imagine would be very interesting would recommend
A must do. What more can be said about tower bridge that hasan't been said before, i've missed London if you havan't been there, and the Temse is a nice walk too
Awesome place to visit. Great views and small nuggets of information along the way. Worth it. Just don't use the vending machine outside the lift to the engine room and exits. Lost 2£ :(

Beatifull bridge with history. If you are in London you must visit LB. Crowded but it worths. You must visit inside,walk on the glass and see the information about the construction. It is very close to London Castle. It is better to spend half day both bridge and Castle and have launch or dinner near the river or on the marina with beatifull bridge view.

Good views but unhelpful staff. I attended a reception in the walkways at the top of the bridge. Good views in both directions along the river, though the Shard and other newer landmarks have better. The waiting staff were unhelpful: I asked one a question and she walked straight past me, saying "Ask him" (nothing more) and indicating a colleague. Then getting the lift to come to the fourth floor to take me down took ten minutes and asking staff three times. Disappointing.
Architecture at its best. During the London Marathon you run over this beautiful bridge - makes you feel very special indeed. Could we achieve this type of building now - I wonder?

general visit. what an excellent place to visit! We were totally unaware what is inside this london gem! It is huge inside. Well worth the visit for the price. The glass floored section at the top is a little weird to stand on but a great viewing point of the cars below! Deffinately a must see!!

Walking over Thames.. A todo item if you are in London.A historic bridge over river Thames just next to the Tower of London.They have a small museum at the bridge that explains the history of this bridge.Also nearby an old British warship, HMS Belfast is parked, if interested you can visit that as well.At night it is illuminated with lights and its a photographers dream to click one.
See the lifts!!!!. Wonderful history!!! I loved the tour - good for families!! It will fascinate your kids!! Don't forget to take a picture on the glass walkway!!!

Tower Bridge from Inside out.. This is without any doubt one of must see London attractions.This is one of the most famous bridges in the World and that's why you can't miss an opportunity to see it from inside. The most exciting exhibit for me was Victorian engine rooms.You can combine your visit with Tower of London, especially if you buy the London pass, like we did. You'll have an opportunity to use it for both attractions. After visiting them both we took the Thames river cruise, the stop was right there, and again we used our London pass.
A must see, Must walk accross.. Beautiful during the day and night. Must walk accross and gets some fresh roasted nuts and take in all the beautiful views of the Thames ( the river).
Take the tour of the Tower Bridge. Taking the tour of the Tower Bridge doesn't sound to interesting, but it is. You see how it was built and how the bridge works.

Bring your camera. You get the tube to tower bridge station and within a short walk you arrive at a very grand architectural structureBring you camera because if your realy lucky you will have the fortune of seeing the bridge go up to let a tall boat through a totaly amazing sight

Impresssive. Stunning British architecture, take your time walking across and if you are lucky you will see the bridge open.
I would suggest you walk along the water way to enjoy a different perspective.

Wow!! Just Wow!. When you see the pictures of the Tower bridge you're like "I wish I could visit this one day" now that you actually see it. It's like Holy S**** that thing is amazing!! It's just a beautiful piece of art and it's just amazing to see.
Walk Across One of the World'd Most Unique Bridges. Rarely will most people walk across a Bridge, buttery this one from south to north. Look at the Tower of London from it and then go see the Tower.

Interesting exhibition and views from the glass floor. Enjoyed the exhibition about the building of the bridge, and other bridges around the world - will never just cross them again without thinking how they were created !

Exciting glass floor. Not for those who are afraid of heights. Possibility to take the elevator, but far better experience to climb the stairs. Beautiful views, and great glass floor where you can take great selfies.
Not a Must. I guess it's cool to say I visited the Tower Bridge, but it's really not that exciting. Facts and a great view are about all I can say about it.
You just can't miss it. I loved to roam on the Tower Bridge. It is simply fabulous and a perfect time pass if you have nothing important to attend to.
Bridge with History. After seeing the Tower of London, we cross the river over the Tower Bridge. The bridge has version symbols with British history. Worth a picture.
Great moments. The historical meaning of this bridge can be felt bye toorists even if they don't know the place so I recommend it really !!!!!
Beautiful bridge. I love all the bridges of London, but the Tower bridge is a real beauty. Great views and amazing architecture.

High walk above the River Thames and the Tower of London. Great dive into history during the Tower Bridge experience. You get down into the engine room and up to the top of the towers behind the scenes. Great views over the River Thames
Jake Longworth. Tower bridge looks stunning from far away and up close. I certainly reccommend it to anyone. I love lots of places in London
Lovely attraction. Lovely place to visit though you need to have sunshine to make the most of it. Lovely photograph and a great historic monument.
Brilliant!. Husband and I took our three daughters to Buckingham palace so they could see where the queen lives. They absolutely loved it and even saw changing of the guards.

"The" Bridge of Bridges.. I was able to view this from the under side from a River Thames tour boat and ride on the Big Red Bus to go across. The inner workings of the bridge have to be done by walking to the bridge.
Amazing structure. I ran over this as part of the London marathon. Really moving and an iconic landmark of London from both the road and the water

Amazing views from above. A lift was available for disabled sister and amazing views when you walked over to other tower and great glass floor sections. Would do it again for the experienced with other member's of the family.
Awesome View. Great to get up close and view site from Tower of London. Architecture interesting as well as history of bridge.

Not what I expected. I was looking forward to walking across the glass walkway which from the website looked like it went all the way across but it didn't. It was lovely looking up and down the Thames and the pipe room was interesting.

my favourite. It's my favorite attraction in London. It has the peace of the river, the charm of history and the magic of the book you have been reading when you were a kid.
Definitively nicer during the night, and from the other side of the river.
Historic. Was on the bus tour, so I was not able to get off and take photographs. Very historic, looks amazing at distance and close up for photographs
Night view was better!. come here before the sunset but due to normal weather in UK we got no sunset. stay here for awhile until dark and the bridge looks more beautiful from the city hall.

Was Lucky to see the bridge open. Was very lucky to see the bridge open As I've never seen it open before.
The tower bridge is a very delicately built bridge and deserves all the credit.
I'll have to buy a ticket to go up to the top next time.
A Beautiful Bridge!. You may have seen it on photos, but standing on the bank of the Thames and gazing upon the Tower Bridge in all its wonderful, stunning beauty, is an unforgettable experience.

A must for British History enthusiasts and photographers. If you are interested or follow old British history and you love architecture then seeing Tower Bridge is a must. This bridge is absolutely gorgeous and just being able to set foot on it is a miracle in itself. Being able to walk over a bridge that British Royals have been over is just amazing to me. Also the view of the Tower of London from the bridge is amazing. A must if you are traveling to see London. Take a walk over this bridge and you won't be disappointed.

Well worth a visit. Very good exhibition. There is a lift up but we took stairs. Plenty of boards etc to read. View from bridge across is excellent - as is glass floor looking down on traffic. There is a visit to the old pump machinery rooms too. For about £9 per adult this is good value considering it's London

Must visit Tower Bridge walkway !. It's one of the must visit place when you are in London, there is an activity with 9 GBP one should experience when you visit the Tower Bridge, it's a walkway with a transparent floor gives you the mesmerizing view of the Bridge and river beneath your feet.

Interesting visit. My wife does not like heights. Last year we were in Tenerife and on her birthday we drove to the north of the Island up windy mountainous roads. This year we visited Tower Bridge.We had pre-booked the tickets online and found the entry process very easy and well managed by the staff. A lift to the upper level with a brief introduction set the scene and then finding out more about the construction was interesting with some amazing facts.Then we went across the first walkway - fortunately there is just enough space to the side of the glass floor for those of a nervous disposition to avoid stepping on the glass, which I suppose is a good idea as she may still have been up there otherwise refusing to go across! I enjoyed watching the goings on beneath my feet.The displays are interesting and the short walk to the Engine rooms are certainly worth it.Now I just have to decide what high place I can take her next year.
A Bit of History. We crossed Tower Bridge on a Hop-On Hop-Off bus. It's architecture & beauty was amazing. I would like to have had more history on the bridge to appreciate it more.
Virgin Money Marathon. This place was great. Lots of people and lots of fun. Def will be back here. Perfect for families or solos with a selfie stick
Gorgeous!. You must Pass it throught you will get great pictures, it is a must in London!! If you take The big bus it will be a nice way to get to know The bridge and All its neightborhood

Great experince especially on the glass pavilion. Visited with my parents and the tour was very informative. Gives you an insight on the origination of the idea for the bridge along with the people behind the work. It's great to see how the bridge operates with the tour of the engine rooms. The view through the glass pavilion is very exciting.

After Jokowi visit. Very crowded with tourist but nice place to hang out while the sun is shining. Its still windy in April and prepare umbrella

This is the first time I walk on Glass this is a great experience look down cars and buses and trucks they look like toys , you so get good look at the history of the bridge via film , the kids love it but they take over the glass takeing pictures , down in the engine rooms you see some of the stuff that makes it work. the landmark of england. a good place to walk and visit to have a towering bird view of london. Bought a cheap ticket 2 for 1.
the landmark of england. a good place to walk and visit to have a towering bird view of london. Bought a cheap ticket 2 for 1.
Not to be confused with the London Bridge. An impressive bridge in the city of London that offers short documentaries at various locations within the tour that explains how to the bridge was built.

Stunning. Tower bridge is a great part of the London skyline. It is incredibly impressive. One of my favourite parts of the route on the Clipper.
Famous Bridge. London is famous for it's history and London bridge. We have seen many videos of London Bridge. Worth visit..
Love this bridge. Of all the bridges in London- this one is my favorite!The architecture is so beautiful and incomparable in the other bridges.
iconic. seen this bridge so many times in pictures & film but you have to experience it in person to realise how fantastic it really is .

A nice view. One must climb up there at least once when going to London. This wil be a long-lasting memory. Besides the view is very typical and free. From there you can see several monuments on the banks of the Thames.
It is what it is. When your there, why wouldn't you? Its fun, historic and. . . . . a bridge. The history is quite interesting but you can get that on a city tour on the Big Red Bus.

Extremely scary walking over the glass platform. Do not assume that those with vertigo will be the only ones affected by the concept of walking across the glass platform. This is well worth a visit - great fun with the family

Climb exhibition of this tower !!!. Many people just watch this lovely tower from a distance. But, you can climb (by elevator) and enter the exhibition at the upper floor over 30 miters from the bottom of the tower (You should pay). Put your courage to the test at the floor !
Stunning . We didnt go inside but we did walk across loads of times, we went underneath by boat aswell. I want to go inside next time. Its just amazing
British Bridge. Its the most beautiful bridge in London, but not the most beautiful in the world! But is also a must in London.
Great visit. Worth visiting - iconic site. Visit this site after going to the Tower of London. After visiting walk along the Thames especially if a nice day.

Unique experience can get a bit Crowded. Walking over the glass and looking down is very exhilarating and a unique experience that not everyone gets to do. a pride of britain. What a magnificent building, a true work of art and an architectial wonder that must be seen a true part of London.
Worth every penny. This has to be one of the best value attractions in London. The history of the bridge and the views from the top are great.

Walking across the top is a great experience. This is a four star review, but it's probably a 3.5* attraction, it's a piece of the fabric of London and in it's time a marvel of modern engineering. It is still a bridge at the end of the day so don't expect the time of your life. Great views of the Tower of London (as you'd expect).

Take in the history of a true London icon and the wonderful views from the upper walkway. Take the time to see all of the bridge from bottom to the top and the aerial walkway.The museum artefacts are fascinating, the mechanics of the operation interesting, the information is clear, concise and well presented.The views from the walkway up and down river and across the City are superb (weather dependent of course) and looking through the glass floor might not be to everyone's taste but is fun.Enjoy the experiance

Impressive structure. There were lots of other people strolling across this iconic bridge. It is certainly pretty impressive. I had hoped that it would be possible to climb one of the towers but was disappointed.

Oh love thee. The bridge in itself is nice and one should cross it at least once but the best part is to walk from London Bridge to Tower Bridge, on either side of the rive it is a really nice walk, alone or with people.
Tower Bridge. This is an awesome tour. If you have a spare hour or two after touring the Tower of London this is well worth the time.

really amazing. We visited this on a two for one on train tickets, the walk across the top of the bridge is absolutely amazing, the how it works and how it was built is really well put together and is very interesting, see the old workings it is worth the walk down into them.

Historical attraction. If you have only one day in London you must take the boat along the river to visit Tower Bridge where you can then get off and walk around and if time go to the Tower of London. Its wonderful to see this iconic bridge close up.

Fascinating monument of historic engineering. The Tower Bridge is arguably one of London's moist iconic landmarks - and rightly so.The bridge, built in the late 1800's, is being kept in impeccable condition and still uses much of its original mechanics. Its a fantastic place to visit and marvel at the engineering skills and ingenuity of its designers over 100 years ago.The bridge deck is freely accessible to anyone (pedestrians and vehicles) but the towers and the engine rooms from the victorian era are part of a museum tour which charges admission.But even if you are not interested in engineering and it's functional features, it's still a marvelous historic monument and a must-do item on your London sightseeing list...

Draw Bridge & Iconic London. Built in the late-1800's, the Tower Bridge is a working draw bridge and wonderful tourist site. Situated on the River Thames near the Tower of London reaches over 200 feet tall and offers the viewing platform high between the two towers. You can walk or drive the lower deck for free, or pay £9 (adult; discounts for age and families) for the Tower Bridge Exhibition daily from 10am to 5:30pm. The tour lasts 1.5 hours and you visit the upper platforms, inside the towers and the mechanical working parts that opens the draw.

Tower Bridge makes the most of what it has to offer. This was a quick attraction to visit. It has great history but where it excels is making the most of what is, essentially, a visit to a bridge.You ride a lift to the top and then walk across two glass-bottomed floors that give views of the road and Thames below. There are great views of the Tower of London and the Thames.The walls are filled with history of the bridge though my favorite exhibit was the photos and facts of all the other remarkable bridges in the world. A video follows (not all that compelling) of the making of the bridge, and then you head back to the street, follow a blue line and visit an exhibit of the old hydraulic system once used to power the drawbridge. You can also plan to visit during times the drawbridge opens and closes; times are posted online.

Interesting. Husband really wanted to visit, not keen on heights but somehow found myself queuing for the lift up to the upper floors.Interesting exhibition and not too overcrowded.Some difficulty getting past the glass floors when other visitors blocked very narrow walk way that wasn't glass!Unclear where/how you got out.

Fantastic tour, great value. The tour has a glass floor, you get to see the original steam engine and machinery that opened and closed the bridge. The entry also includes and entry to the fire monument. We spent almost 2hrs in this bridge looking at the stuff. Anyone with an interest in engineering or bridge building or just interested in the history of london will love this place
Day & Night . I love tower bridge in the day & night. It's worth a walk over but you need to come away from it a bit to appreciate all its glory. Night time takes it into a new dimension beautiful

Really cool to look down from!. The coolest part of the experience is the glass-floored walkway. You can look straight down to the roadway below. Lots of fun. I didn't value the museum portion of the attraction. Certainly worthwhile all in all - a little pricey.

Not expensive, great views, impressive construction.. A wealth of information about Tower bridge as well many other bridges around the world. Great views from the walkways and exciting, or sickening, glass floor walk with views onto the bridge > 30 metres below. Don't worry the glass is almost 10cm thick. The tour includes video presentations and the Victorian boilers and engine rooms. Interesting enough to go again.

long weekend. tower bridge is great value of money it give you the history . if you are up of it you can climb the stairs but there is a lift you can use when you get to the top there is glass floor you can look down at the people walking buy

Cool to see. Yes it's iconic and very distinctive, but that's about it here. It's an old bridge with lots of history. Lots of foot traffic walking across, but the real star here, is that it leads to the Tower Of London and the Crown Jewels.

So beautiful!. Best photo location from beside the Tower of London. Go at sunset for amazing shots! It does get a little crowded but at the end of the day it begins to thin out. Also, go back after dark. Very romantic..... men think proposal location! (Just saying!)

Landmarl. I would say this is my favourite London landmark. Beautiful bridge and the views from it are amazing... Along with the history which goes with it, it's a great place to visit and learn about the history
towering. see how they lift the bridge or walk across the suspended walk way or see how the bridge was made the bridge lifts 3 times a day
Beautiful. Beautiful Historic building. This is a must if you are ever in London. Visiting this place at sunset or at sunrise is definitely breathtaking.

Stunning sight- for locals and tourists. I love tower bridge- I've driven over it countless times yet I never get bored of it. Cross the iconic bridge. It was very interesting to walk across Tower Bridge and there is plenty to see. Well worth the time.

Seeing the huge metal plates riveted together, spanning the Thames River, was amazing - then to realize that this is actually a bridge which may be opened, was surprising!

Such a cool bridge!. We walked over this bridge, rode over it on the Hop on-Hop off bus, drove over it with the car we rented and under it on the river tour! Not to miss!. Most people think this is London Bridge it is not went on a river cruise on a nice day and it ended here you should not miss seeing it first off its free to see it and its a part of London period! It is also right there at the Tower of London
A Must See. Classic, must see while visiting London. The architecture and history are definitely reinforced when you visit.

Seeing the bridge open was an event. The bridge opened to let through a fleet of sailing teams from around the world. Everyone stopped and cheered on the teams as they paraded by. It was such a fun unexpected site to see.

Interesting non traditional bridge.. It was great to walk over this bridge.Historical place and interesting building.Great view to the modern London.

Well worth a visit. This trip is well worth a visit....got there about 11.30 and it was not overcrowded. Better seen at night. The bridge looks much better at night when it is illuminated, definitely worth a visit on the way back from a day exploring London. You do not need more than 20 minutes for to see the bridge and appreciate it.
Good sightseeing point. One of the must visits if you are in London as leisure travel or with friends. Close to the river, with restaurants around, etc.
Tower Bridge. I highly suggest getting the London Pass to avoid waiting in line. You can either use the stairs or the elevator going up the tower. Take lots of picture when up there!

Remarkable. This is London Town.. Must see the The Tower of London. Walk across this iconic piece of English History.
Take some bottled water and your iPhone to get some good shots of the Bridge and the torrid Thames River.
When you cross the bridge pinch yourself and say. "Yes I'm in London".
Loved it !!!

A Must Do. A great visit. Spent a couple of hours walking around inside learning about this and other bridges. The glass floors are scary to begin with but you soon get used to it. It fascinating watching the world go by underneath you. A very enjoyable and good value visit.

Fantastic. Visited Tower Bridge on a Saturday morning. We had not pre-booked and after paying and having our bags checked we went straight up in the lift without queuing at all. Our favourite bit without doubt was the glass floor. I was determined to walk across it and after a few false starts managed to do it! People were sitting on it and lying on it and it was great fun. There is a 'postcard' photo facility which isn't too expensive and produced a very good quality picture which was a great memento to take home. If you want to visit the engine rooms and well stocked gift shop you do so after exiting Tower Bridge and following the signs to both. It doesn't take long to experience Tower Bridge but it is well worth a visit .

London Icon. You can't not come to London without visiting this world renowned icon. Unfortunately we missed the opportunity to see the bridge raised but it didn't matter as the view from the bridge is brilliant looking down the Thames
nice. amazing experience!!! what a landmark !!! love the crowd !!! Must see in summer. perfect place for a selfie !!! lol
Stunning. Had a lovely stroll across the bridge and to the shops below. Some really stunning views from the bridge.Lots of nice little shops below too

Stunning Structure. An iconic landmark which we visited recently whilst on holiday in the capital . We loved every aspect of our visit and marvelled at this stunning example of historic architecture and the panoramic views afforded whilst standing in the middle of the bridge . HMS Belfast was berthed just down the Thames and one could see the Tower of London diametrically opposite . A must see whilst in London .

Rather displeased with my latest trip to the exhibition . Last year I went on a solo trip to the Tower Bridge Exhibition and I loved it, so when my sister visited from the States I wanted her to experience it too. We had a very packed schedule since she was here for only a few days and one afternoon we had a little extra free time and decided to go. The website said that last admittance was at 5:30, so we assumed that that meant there would be 1-2 hours given to explore the exhibition and proceed to the engine rooms; similar to how Westminister Abby gives 1 hour after last entrance. We were very wrong!After purchasing tickets (£15) at about 5:20 we went to the lift and were taken to the exhibition, we got there between 5:30 and 5:40. We started by leisurely walking through the exhibition reading each plaque and watching the videos. About 10 minutes before 6pm we saw staff going to other groups and speaking to them (no one ever came to us); apparently the engine rooms closed at 6pm and anyone wishing to see them had to head over there immediately. We had not even completed half of the exhibition, but my sister wanted to see the engine rooms, and they were included in the price of the ticket. We skipped the rest of the exhibition (even though she wanted to see that as well) and hurried to get to the engine rooms before 6. We got to the engine room at 5:59 and we're admitted. It was at that point where we saw a sign that said the gift shop closed at 6:15. We made it through the engine rooms while doing very little reading and watch the video near the end. We left at approximately 6:25. We were very busy for the rest of her visit so we were unable to attempt a second trip to the exhibition. What displeased me the most is that we were not informed online, at the ticket desk, or in the lift (in fact we were told there would be enough time to explore what we wanted) that the engine room was closing at 6pm and they we would have to walk through the exhibition without stopping to enjoy anything if we wanted to see it all in time. I am also displeased that she and I were not told while in the exhibition, we had to overhear then inform another group. So we ended up wasting £15.From past experience I know the exhibition is very enjoyable, but my suggestion to anyone who wants to see it, is that you go no later than 4pm.
Cool bridge to visit. Take a walk on top and read about all the top rated bridges in the world. Worth going up and taking in the views!
Great Experience . Well worth a visit and good value for money. The view from the top of the towers is amazing but even better is the glass floor in the viewing walkways! Don't miss it!
Stunning to look at. Another Iconic landmark in London-Beautiful to look at especially when lit up at night time-however traffic is very heavy across it.
Amazing architecture . Drove over this bridge today and what a stunning price of historic architecture it is. Really need to park up next time and have a wonder and take some photos
dont look down!!. loved the glass floors on the bridge. looking down took some courage-for me anyway! the engine room was amazing. i think all men would find it interesting. very much worth a look.
Landmark. Famous landmark near to other attractions such a tower of london. Easy access from underground station and free to walk over!

A must see in London. Being one of the most famous landmarks in London, it is a must see for any visitors. Not only is it a great photo opportunity itself, it is also a great place to take photos of the surrounding city.
interesting architecture. in india most of us know Tower Bridge as London bridge. It looks great in both day and night, it is a must visit.
Beautiful historical bridge. This bridge is one of the many bridges in London. It is nice to take a small cruise around the waterways and see the city from this vantage point.
tower bridge experience. spent a couple of hours on the walkways and around the bridge, nice views and glass walkways to look down onto the bridge from the centre of the walkways

More than we expected, well worth a visit!. We had been out for the day doing touristy things and this visit was more or less a 'filler' at the end of the day. It turned out to be one of the highlights, we thoroughly enjoyed our trip and the walk across the elevated bridge gave spectacular views of the the City. The engine rooms and towers were interesting and the facts and figures presented in a way that made them very readable without being boring. If you have a couple of hours to spend in this part of London you would enjoy this.
not to bad. great view on a good day is the best thing and the bridge and then the glass floor you can walk across but theres no audio witch i dont like.

Iconic Tower Bridge doesn't disappoint. We toured all over the Bridge. The upper span with it's glass floor was very well done and we got some great pictures of the London skyline from it. We enjoyed the curated parts of the tour, including the workings of the bridge itself and the history of the bridge too. We travelled under it to Greenwich and returned to see the bridge rise for the Riverboat Queen to pass underneath. NB In the Bridge itself, you can find out when the next scheduled bridge risings will occur. If you are lucky enough to be in London at that time, don't miss this iconic event.

Tower Bridge. You can't go to London with our seeing Tower Bridge in the distance down the Thames River. But taking the tour which was included in our London Pass was great. It was less than an hour which was nice. You get great views from the top floor observation deck, but also some great history.

Totally A Must See, Skip the Interior Tour. It's impossible to miss, and there's no reason not to pause on the bridge. The interior "experience" is pretty cool, but not as impressive as the bridge itself. Do it if you have the time, skip it if you don't

BEA-utiful bridge. Oldest engineering at its best, its astonish that they keep it in working condition since 1800. Top floor of the bridge is awesome a glass floor to see the road below and if you went a a prefect timing the bridge will elevate for ship to pass thru

New addition: glass floors!. I have done the tours before, but now the bridge offers the glass floors that look down onto the Thames! Everyone was lying on the glass and taking selfies! A great addition but I couldn't lie down on the glass! Just walking on it was a surreal experience!
Sister's Adventure. Amazing. Watching the changing of the guards to doing all the tours. Buckingham Palace, St. Paul's Cathedral to Big Ben. Even the buss and lobe was Great.

Amazing Experience!. One must see to believe the experience you are going to have from Tower Bridge of London. Fantastic!

The Great Walk. . As you come to the bridge from the Tube. It is amazing to walk up to a national property and look at the crests imbedded in the fixtures. Walk over the bridge and it was good to do and look back at the main part of London.
Very pretty. Didn't actually go in it just went under and round it but very cool! If you are taking a boat tour you will pass under it for some good pics get to the back of the boat.

The London landmark. The place has recently opened a glass floor on its top. Looks wow from up there to down the thames. The walk up the stairs is tiring though. I saw the bridge open and close and couldn't ask for more. Check for the timings of this before you go.

MAGNIFIC!!. A splendid and a beautiful Victorian structure .this place should be on your Must see list of places.

The addition of the glass walkways adds a much-needed adrenaline boost to the whole experience and the information available is presented in a fun and interactive way.The walkway exhibit shows the history of the Tower Bridge with its facts and data and the roster of impressive bridges around the world!

A good view of London and the river as well as a Historic Building.. This Museum is well laid out and you get a great view of the River from the Walkways. The Steam Engine Museum is also very interesting to look at.

Great History. As it is close to Tower of London you can do both
Get there early and go to view above.
Make sure you walk across bridge as well for photo's
View. Excellent spot to take a tour and enjoy the view. Walk the old stairs if you can and take pictures of the glass floor

A Must!. No, it hasn't been around as long as the Tower of London.Yes, it is frequently thought of as THE London Bridge.No, the bridge isn't raised very often.Yes, it does have a tourist-y feel to it.Having said all that...It is still very, very cool!Save some time in your day after - or before - visiting the Tower of London to swing over to check out the Tower Bridge. You will not be disappointed.

SUPRISINGLY FANTASTIC.. The London Bridge exhibition is just FANTASTIC, it's history is very interesting and the old films and photos make it even more so. The glass floor is spectacular, with a great view of the road and river beneath it. It has some thing for everyone. Well done London on Tower Bridge, loved it.

Glass Floor Photo Op. This is the place for that iconic selfie of your shoes hovering over a London red bus and the River Thames flowing away beneath you. The ticket was a reasonable price, and along with the glass floor there is a timeline of the construction of the bridge itself and many other interesting facts along the way. Included is a tour of the engine rooms. The view from the towers is very nice, although if you're like me you'll be transfixed by the view under your feet!

Interesting and informative.. The glass floor does not span the whole length of the walkway but is nevertheless fun and a little frightening. Seeing the interior of the towers is fascinating along with the beautiful victorian machinary and doesn't really need anything to supplement it although there is lots of information and photography. Well worth a trip.
very importat monument. after eye or wheel of london we visit this lovely bridge that we went to tower of london. this also is not the first time either. you should visit it as well.

The experience was quite good. The view from this iconic bridge is great with glass floor sections and photo windows on the sides. Has plenty of information on other bridges as well. Atleast do it once.

Spectacular bridge. I did both ways to go there.I took a boat at Tames River and walked until there.This bridge is spectacular.You have a chance to see different scenary from there.It's nice if you do this in a sunny day.
Fantastic Architecture . Easily viewed and a wonderful, beautiful bridge with a huge amount of history! Plenty of places to take great photos. Definitely a must see if you're in London

Thoroughly enjoyed by all. We loved it up the Tower Bridge and timed it so we were on the glass floor as the bridge opened (check wesite for times) Great staff on hand who are very knowledgeable and informative). The second glass floor has a mirror above so you can take some cool selfies! We would highly recommend this as it's such good value for money.

Very pretty :) . I'm biased because I look at it ever day. But an amazing piece of historical architecture. Very nice to stop off for lunch on the river with the view of the bridge and watch the city walk by!If you're doing a tour of London it's more than worth a look!

interestig but over-rated. There is a tour of the Tower Bridge going from the old machine at the basement to the top of the tower through the glass corridor. It's a nice tour if you have 30-40 minutes to kill but nothing extraordinary. Considering the price of the ticket i'd suggest to skip.

Good views of the city. Really interesting to find out a little bit more about Tower Bridge. The information about how the bridge was made and how it works was really good. It took about 1hour and half in total.The only negative was it didn't tell you what buildings you can see. I knew most of them but for some one who is visiting London for the first time I think that would be useful.Worth the money though.

Nice!. firstly you need to climb up 200 steps? before you can enjoy the tower. *huff & puff*theres lift for the less mobile visitorswalking over the glass panels is a great photo opportunity and scary :Sluckily theres a lift to bring us down
Impressive. The workings of this bridge are phenomenal for the time period. Super impressed with it's history. Looking down through the glass is a little unnerving....

More interesting than expected. We paid for tickets online and got a family ticket which was very good value. Went into the engine room and walked across the bridge and it's glass floor. We even saw an exhibition there.Fab shop too ...kids of 15 and 11, enjoyed by all.
birthday treat. Very impressive tower bridge never knew yiu could get marriec on the bridge very busey lots of people on bridge must see this when in london

One of the Great Bridges in the World. If you make it to the Tower of London, Tower Bridge is a must make point of your trip. While we could not include the Tower Bridge experience, the walk across the bridge was great!
an intresting view. worth taking the time to see tower bridge, London looked good from such a different view and the glass walk way was very cool

Awesome. One of my favourites. If your not afraid of heights go up to the top and walk along the glass floored walkway. Quite an experience. Close to shops and restaurants so you can enjoy your day and have a drink or coffee admiring the bridge!

Excellent value. Went to Tower Bridge exhibition during a short visit to London. Excellent experience - friendly staff, informative exhibition and impressive glass floor looking down on the busy bridge traffic below. With its amazing architecture and impressive engine room Tower Bridge is a 'must see' piece of London's history.
Great exhibit.. A lot of people don´t know that people can go in the tower bridge. It has a great exhibit which offers great views of London. It also offers a visit to the bridges engine rooms.
A must see for London tourist. Although I have visited London many times, I have never been to Tower Bridge. It is just amazing in real life as it is on photos!

B.e.a.u.t.i.f.u.l. I think that all the round place is beautiful because it is new and really modern and you can see one of the most important monument that represents London in every part of the world
Another icon of London. Not to be confused with London Bridge. Great views of it from the river bank. Worth going up to the top to see inside.

MY ALL TIME FAVOURITE THING. Tower Bridge is by far one of my all time favourite things to do in London!!! The glass floor is a little scary mind!! It is just so wonderful looking out at London from such an iconic structure! I would do this again & again & again
Great historical sight. Fantastic! A must see attraction in London, nice to walk over and see the view along the Thames river.
South bank and north bank outing . Wonderful to visit rather than use it as a way of crossing the river..... Kids enjoyed the grandeur of it and appreciated how immense it is.

The Most Amazing Bridge. This Bridge is so amazing and beautiful. It is not possible to just look at it and walk off. It is worth staying and watching it open and close when big boats need to go through it.I have yet to visit the insides which is on my list for next year.
Beverley

Awesome, but hope the lift is working!. My son wanted to go up into the bridge, and our London Passes covered the attraction. The only draw back to the tour was the fact that the lift from the road deck to the top was not working. So, we had to climb up at least 7 flights of the prettiest Victorian stairs just to get to the exhibition at the top. It took a minute to get up, but it was worth it. They have a glass floor so that you can take pictures of the road below. Fun times!

Tower Bridge Exhibition. Visited the Exhibition after my sister-in-law recommended it. The staff were helpful and informative. The highlight were the glass floor walkways. very surreal experience. Great views over London from the Tower.We had a 2 for 1 offer, so paid just £9 for 2 adults.

Amazing. This was a family visit and it was amazing, the staff couldn't have been more friendly, the views where amazing and the informative bits really did make it outstanding.A wonderful place that I would love to do of an evening to see sunset. I hope in the future that they do like the Museums that you can sleep over one evening

Beside the Tower of London and amazing architecture. We viewed this bridge by day and night and at all times it is amazing, no wonder the Americans thought they were buying it when they purchased London bridge by mistake they must have been miffed.

Tour was wonderful. There is like a wee tour you can take of the Bridge that takes you to the top walk ways where there is a wonderful view of both sides of the bridge. The section of glass walkway was great as well, fun and perfect for those cheesy tourist photos.The tour then takes you into the basements of the bridge where you can see how the road way originally lifted and how that's changed over time. This was the first thing we did when arriving in London and I would happily do it again.
visit to London during Europe tour. Land mark of London for its beautiful architecture and magnificent look. its the only first of its kind to have gates that could be opened for small ships.
A MUST when visiting London. One on the most beautiful pieces of architecture in London. A night time walk around St Catherine's dock and Tower Bridge not to be missed.

Excellent London attraction at very reasonable price!. Went to Tower Bridge exhibition as part of friends birthday outing. Excellent experience, combining history, learning and excitement with the glass floor in the walkways above the busy bridge traffic below. Excellent, informative and friendly staff. Make sue you go to engine room too, amazing engineering!

Gorgeous at night. This bridge is synonymous with great photographs. At night you can get a great photo from the shore looking at the bridge. It's a must visit if you are in town and like to do photography.

Great to see in London and well worth a trip,. Staying right near the bridge, great landmark there is a lift at the end to help wheelchair users but the tour has steps so we couldn't access this. Free attraction.
Like No Other Bridge. Rich in history and fascinating in engineering. You need to first see the bridge from a distance then get up close and learn about this great structure.
good weather with nice place. nice weather this time. so that i take walk to Tower Bridge. night view is better that day time. i love this place.

A romantic stroll by the riverside!. Sometimes you forget how beautiful the London city is when you are busy working stuck in a routine. A quick romantic stroll in the evening by the riverside with your loved one, watching Tower Bridge and the amazing views this lovely city has to offer will always leave you spell bounded. Although popular among the tourists it's also a must visit place for us locals every once in a while just to remind ourselves of the amazing views we are blessed with.

Really Great. Really, really amazing! We went on the tour that takes you up inside the bridge and it was absolutely fantastic! Very enriching to learn about the history and gorgeous views on a sunny day. They have a part of the floor that's clear glass so you can take a photo looking down over the road and river which is really cool. Somewhat expensive but totally worth it as will probably never do it again. Located in a good area as it is surrounded by other attractions which you can visit. Also good to take a walk along the Thames in good weather. An amazing day out, would definitely recommend it!

Hour or so visit. Visited Tower Bridge and went inside. Good exhibition that explains how the budge was built and how it used to work. You can walk between the towers, part of which is on a glass floor. Took and hour to so to look round.
Beautiful and historic!. We loved walking across the Tower Bridge, and we loved photographing it from both sides of the River Thames. This is a must see attraction after touring the Tower of London.

Well worth a visit...... Had a great visit to this experience........we had a two-for-one voucher so only cost £13 for a family of 4!!!!! The history is great, the architecture is stunning and they have things to do for the kids as well.......The glass floors are a must do......especially the one with the mirrored ceiling!!!!! We were fortunate to visit on a day that the bridge was raised, so the pump rooms were given a little more reality as well...All in all a definite must do.......

Epitomises everything London beautiful architecture. The historical view is wonderful but the real gem is the surrounding area. Lots of great walks restaurants cafés a very vibrant smart location feel to the surroundings. Amazing apartments if moving to London!

Glass floor in the Tower Bridge. Walking on the glass floor in the Tower bridge is fantastic. Not that expensive and the views are just as good as the eye, with less long lines of people. Just be aware that you have to climb a number of stairs to get to the top. Makes for some great photos!!
An amazing structure. Well worth a trip to Tower Bridge, a truly beautiful work of art, majestic and such a part of the Thames scene
Beautiful. One of the First things we got off the Bus to see. we were Amazed by this Bridge. Looks Beautiful and you Get great pictures from any side your on.
Awsome . A must do when in London .. dripping in history It was fascinating to hear ...beautiful to look at night ..well kept .. just loved it

Stunning Piece of Engineering Architecture. Not much I can say to add to the plethora of reviews already here, but Tower Bridge really is a fantastic piece of beautiful engineering.Love it!Wished we could go underneath it and find the secret James Bond area. Obviously we couldn't because James Bond isn't real. We know that. Also kind of wanted to jump a Routemaster bus over the gap as the bridge raises. Didn't because this was infeasible, illegal and a lot of effort that I wouldn't get to see.In short, great bridge.

Worthwhile to pay to go up inside. We paid to go up inside the bridge. And as luck would have it, we were inside when the bridge opened up. There is a glass bottom floor that is right over top of the raised bridge. Another great photo op!
Exquisite . Tower Bridge is everything you think London bridge should be and more. The bridge is absolutely gorgeous, and the stonework is purely magical.
Glass walkway . Cost for a family OK plenty of information for both adults and children. Good place to go and be out of the rain. The glass walkways are fantastic especially the one with the mirror.

Tower Bridge is Fantastic. As we arrived in London on the Friday afternoon, we did some late afternoon, early evening sightseeing. The Bridge is amazing and even more so lit up at night, for all to see. Especially reflected in The Thames below. It's a marvellous construction. It's just across the road from The Tower of London, St Katharine's Dock with restaurants and pubs close by. People of all nationalities are there in the area with cameras at the ready. there is a real feel of London about it!

Photographic!!. It is one of the most popular landmarks of London and there is huge confusion amongst people between this landmark and the London bridge which are different. The main feature of this bridge is that it can split open for ships to cross.
More than you'd expect. An absolutely lovely sight. The tower bridge is incredible. Specially during a rainy day, this monument is of an incomparable beauty.

Another place to tick off your list while you are visiting London. I've been with my parents and my partner this March and we bought tickets to go through the walk-able tour.very crowded and very busy. i would suggest having cash on you, because after we stayed in the queue for 40 min and got closer to the counter we saw a big sign that said they didn't accept any credit card payments.luckily, we had cash on us so we didn't wait for nothing so much time.The tour itself is OK, the views are nice, you cannot take very very good pictures because the bars are blocking a very big part of the view. therefore you have to wait a while until you find a proper good place to take a photothe glass on the floor was a bit disappointing , because we were expecting to be larger/bigger. therefore , again, you have to wait until you can have a nice cool picture. and rarely you find the space to have one with anyone else in your frame :)i believe the bridge itself is better, you have amazing views from the bridge and if you are lucky you can see the bridge opening for the big ships to cross-over.
Amazing view, lots of nice places around there!. Love the bridge, great views. Nice places around there. There is not much to do other than see the bridge but still a great place to see

Sue. Walked across loads of times in one day. Love the views. Went to the Tower Bridge exhibition. Takes you high up into the arms connecting the towers, where there is not 1 but 2 glass walkways above the bridge. One having a mirrored ceiling. It's amazing and the views are great. There are information boards and interactive screens. Then on to the engine room, very interesting and informative.
Walking trough the tower bridge. Walking into the tower bridge was a great experience to me and to my mom. We have the chance to see the tower get opened so a boat can cross. It was incredible.

Iconic Visit. Really enjoyed the structure and the city sights from the top. However, if you aren't a stairs person you will be hard pressed to see much should the elevators not be operational. We were fine - just saying. For those who are mechanically inclined, make sure you see the hydraulics that operate(d) the bridge.

Lots of stairs. Toured the tower bridge which is walkable from the Tower of London. We took the stairs up which is quite exhausting. If you are unable to do the stairs there is a lift on the opposite side of the bridge. Once you get to the top you walk across the bridge which allows great views of the River area. There is a portion of glass floor that looks down on the road and river. We took the lift down and did not do the engine room tour which is included with admission.
Wonderful . This is a site that comes to your minds eye when you plan to visit London. The reality lives up to the imagination. The views of the bridge and from the bridge are fantastic.
My teenage son enjoyed it. Nice views from the top, scary glass floor! My teenage son loved it though and could handle the hundreds of steps without a rest!

Glass floor!. Went to visit on a rainy London day this week and for the price of things in London this was really reasonable and I feel well worth it. No queuing times and the views from the platforms were still good!

Glass platform. There are two parallel glass viewing walkways across tower bridge. We checked on-line and found that the bridge would be opening to allow a paddle steamer through, so we were on the platform as the bascules opened. It gets very crowded when this happens, so to ensure you get a good view, sit down at the edge of the glass when you see the vessel approaching.

Had to walk across it!. This has just been one of the things that I wanted to do. Walk across the bridge. There are always lots of people and traffic on the bridge but plenty of walking area. You an pay to go up to the top of the tower walk between the towers on a walkway. I was fine just walking across the main bridge. This is a very touristy and busy area.
Just walked across. Not sure I would pay for this attraction. It was a nice view of the city though. The other side of the bridge offers great restaurants, access to HMS Belfast and a Tune station.

Glass Walk Way!. Great place to take pictures. We were able to see a view at night and take a tour during the day. The tour is self guided and our ticket included a tour of the engine rooms. Very interesting to see how the bridge worked when it was first built. If you are brave enough, step onto the glass walkway! If not, hold on to the railings and tip toe on the side. I was completely terrified but if you take out your cell phone and look at it you hardly notice your over 100 feet above water.

Very interesting. Having lived in London for 20 years, driven over it ,sailed under it, decided to go up and have a look, this is my favorite bridge, the glass walkway was awesome, and great views. THen on to the engine room, the history of this bridge is well worth £1 Guide book. Great for kids and people of any age.

Nice little thing to do. I gave it a try as seen it but never thought to check it out. Went on a Saturday which didn't have any real queue which was cool. It is not the longest thing to do but I enjoyed it. The glass floor is cool watching the cars underneath go past.
Super pretty!. One of the must see touristic attractions in London! Go for it, see for yourself and take some beautiful pictures!

Spectacular Bridge. It's a beautiful bridge. We've been there many times and everytime we find it extremely beautiful and mesmerising. It should be seen both in the day light as well as at night.Must watch.
I only got a quick view of it . My friends and I only got a quick view from our hop on hop off bus tour but it was nice, if you have time, I would recommend walking it, on a nice day.
Awesome...Visit in Evening. Awesome. Visited in late afternoon and stayed till late evening when the Lights where up on Tower Bridge. Nice feel to have a evening walk on the Tower Bridge.

A london icon . One of Londons' iconic landmarks, and worth a visit, if only for a couple of hours. There are lots of steps to get to the top, so be warned.
