There is elevator access if you ask the staff, other than that it's quite a long way up.Views are great, the glass floor is brilliant, very well done! Lots of people crowd around them for photos so be prepared for a little wait. Each walkway is lined with info boards, and there is a movie that plays in one of the towers. On the day we visited it wasn't to busy and we had been and gone in about an hour. After you leave the tower you can visit the engine rooms just down the street, as must for any fans!

Fun Tower Bridge Tour. Enjoyed this! Good information and the glass floor was a plus, although at first I was scared to walk on it!. The bridge itself is a marvel - no wonder it took 8 years to build.
Not For Sale. Great looking bridge! You'll hear the story of the guy that bought the wrong bridge!! Lots of history here and a great sight to see. Don't miss this one.

An unusual experience. The tower bridge is an icon in London, make time to visit and easily accessed from the Tower of London. The climb is over 200 steps but there is a lift if the legs can't take it. The views through the glass floor are unusual it is best to walk across videoing it if possible as it looks strange when just looking down.Allow an hour.

Vacation. Symbol of Great Britain..... On top is the UNION JACK FLAG. An exciting view to behold at all times. The opening and closing of the special BRIDGE. What a great architectural piece. I love this sight and wish U all go see it when ever in LONDON.

Worthwhile to see at night too!. I had wanted to see the Tower Bridge the entire week we were in London but never made it there. We decided to take a cab to see it late on our last night in town. I'm so glad we did! It was really beautiful with all of the lights! I would like to go back during daylight hours, but seeing it in the dark was also very worth it!
4 days in London. The tower bridge was interesting. Again, there is a lot of history there and if you are a history buff, then London really is a good place for all of that.
Classic. If you're lucky enough you'll get to see it open up. Better than movies, Tower Bridge is so magnificent. Amazing experience to see it up close.
It's a bridge . Its nice and full of history, but it is just a bridge. If going to the tower of London it's nice to pass over the bridge and watch the castle rise in the distance.

Fantastic views of London. This is an exciting experience and the views from the top walkways breathtaking. The addition of the glass floor is well worth the trip. Make sure you visit the small museum when you exit to view all the history and watch the bridge mechanism.

Magnificent in real life. How very strange that most people refer to Tower Bridge as THE London Bridge of England. It is not. The real London bridge is ordinary and boring. But, Tower Bridge makes a mark even from afar, with its beautiful old shape and architecture. I walked from the train station, saw it as I reached the pier from the right side and felt a lump in my throat. The bridge I sang of in school 35 years ago was there in front of me in real life. I walked towards it and the closer i got, the more awesome it became. This is a not-to-be-missed icon if you ever visit London. Around the corner from it is the Tower of London and the real London Bridge. You can also walk to the Millennium Bridge and Blackfriars Bridge, which are all nicer looking than London Bridge.

Impressive architecture . The bridge is a beautiful punctuation mark to the end of your 1/2 day at The Tower of London. As you exit the Tower, you are provided a picturesque view of the bridge spanning the Thames River in epic fashion. It's worthy of taking 15-20 minutes to observe, appreciate, and take some photos.
Fun. We did this as part of our London pass. Enjoyed the history and being able to walk in upper level with the glass panels. Fun to have lunch on warm on other side too
Another "must do" in London. I could look at this attraction all day, but going up to the top and staring up and down the river is amazing. A visit to the machinery is worth doing too

Nice . Enjoyed the history to see that bridge
If you visit London you must vist tower bridge is good for afternoon to visit and sunny weather

Very interesting . Worth buying advance tickets to skip the line. The tour is very interesting - particularly info about the other bridges around the world. The glass floor was cool and the views down the river are great. The engine rooms are beautifully restored, although it would have been good to find out how they do it all now.
Nice view but.... I expected something more from the visit, while there is not much more than the view to see. I don't know if the visit is worth the price.

Iconic and great value!. To me Tower Bridge is THE iconic sight in London. A remarkable looking bridge I continue to love looking at. For those who are not too worried about actually going inside, obviously you can just walk along the river and see it. A good view can be seen from the Great Fire of London Monument.However I really do recommend you go inside as I think £9 is really good value for London, plus is available on the 2 for 1 offer if you travel by train so even better.This was the second time we visited but was well worth paying a second time. Great views as you walk along the top (take the stairs - don't be lazy and use the lift) and some interesting facts about other famous bridges. A new addition since our last visit is the glass floor which is quite cool as you can see the road and river below you and use a mirrored ceiling to take a picture of yourself on the glass.After exiting the bridge, the cost of your ticket also allows you to visit the 'engine room' and see some of the mechanics that would have previously been used when raising the bridge.There is also an app you can download to experience what it is like while the bridge is being raised. This was OK. I doubt it really reflects what its like, but it is a free download so worth checking it out.A must visit attraction when in London.
The Famous Bridge. It's a little cozy bridge! With detailed architecture. I would recommend it to be seen at the dusk when the sky turns to orange and voilet and the the lights goes on! Must a visit

You haven't been in London until you set your eyes on Tower Bridge. Whilst I would not recommend the Tower Bridge visit in itself, one can't possibly visit London and not see it. You should time the trip so that you get there by sunset, and only leave after night has fallen, so that you can see it moving from different shades of light.
Marvelous. This tower bridge is so beautiful and interesting to look at. We love the glass floor also the view from there is amazing.

Be fit.. Really enjoyable exhibition. Hope you enjoy the climb, there are chairs for resting if required. Glass floor a must!
Like the engine rooms especially.
Selfie backdrop. Can be selfie backdrop, you can walk through and pass the other side for discoveries. I wish we could see you open for large vehicles!
Great. We walked over tower bridge it is a great thing to look at and makes a great picture it's very busy round here so have to keep firm hold of children or u could soon get split up

it was nice been at the tower bridge. the most interesting side of it all was the water front view. the walk around.. the weather was not too friendly for me but it was a better experience after some hours been around the environment.
Buzzing yet nice. Just stand here for a while and see the peace it gets you, its nice to be there in the evenings, the eateries around and the pubs as well make a good place to close the evening.

Nice an unexpensive visit and it doesn't take too long. For a family of four we paid GBP 20.5 without booking, right on the spot and it was nice to go around the bridge and read and watch the videos. Maybe it will be better if there were more staff to ask questions which answers are not easy to find around the posts. Specifically how is it working today compared to the early days.
We saw the bridge lift. The bridge itself is a marvel. We got to see the middle open up and that was pretty cool. We did a night tour and the bridge was very pretty to look at

Great time spent around Tower Bridge!. Its a must as its the most beautiful bridge and has so much historical significance! Its also nice to spend time around it and have a coffee! Docklands look good as well!
school trip. big big and so cool you can do some nice pictures there maybe little bit crowed but have to see it in London for sure

Nothing special if you arent interested in mecanics and history.. Went there for the view. It really wa not that good. Most of the windows were bloked with info banners. Couple small windows were open so you could take photos of London without refections. The glass floor was nice

Iconic. Definitely something to see while in London. The view of from the bridge is stunning. On one side, you see a medieval castle, and the other side of the river hosts tons of modern glass buildings!

Expensive for what you get. Expensive attraction to visit. Most people go to get a photograph taken with Tower Bridge in the background. For a good deal of money you get lift to the top, get to walk across the walkways at the top with the bog standard glass floor which seems to be the must have attraction for people with little imagination. Once you do that, you can walk along and gain access to the engine rooms where you will see some nicely painted old steam engines and another video screen displaying a five minute history of the tower.Save some money and get your photo for free outside.

great on a sunny day. well its great to see get some pictures, and if you lucky you will see it go up, this is a great add, if you are doing a nice sunny walk around all the key London attractions as its FREE
Well worth the guided tour. Really interesting and scary in bits which I liked. Great view from the top. Price wasn't bad for what we got but it didn't take long. Maybe allow a couple of hours tops!!

We enjoyed it. The adults in our party enjoyed this, despite the 207 steps up (there is a lift available), views were good and the information was interesting, took us just over 1.5 hours to do, reasonably priced for an attraction in London. However the 13 year old with us thought it was boring, apart from the glass walk way over the bridge.

Impressive. Certainly makes my London "TOP 3 tourist sites". Saw it multiple times (night, sun, cloudy, night) and from multiple places (boat from the river, bus tour, from the Shard). Just looks great - either day or night when lighted. A London must see. Definitely. If you are in London as a tourist- just must see it. Next time I am visiting-going to go for the walking deck. A British icon, interesting also from an engineers view.
Looks nice . Great place took my partner to London for her first time and the first place she wanted to go was here so that's where we went and she lived it recommend it as a tourist spot to anyone

Glass Floor A Winner. Fascinating walk through and the glass floor was a huge hit for photos and a fun touch. Use your London Pass for admittance and skipping the queues - well worth having one for this site.

Great view of Thames and London. This was a very interesting place although very crowded (it was Easter week). You take the lift (optional walk up some 168 stairs if you don't want to wait!) and walk across. There is a glass floor that you can walk on if you dare and a nice display of many of the great bridges around the world (temporary I believe). Great view of the Thames and London! There is a short film at the beginning that takes you through how the bridge was built. When you get down again you walk across to the engine rooms where you learn how the bridge was opened with the steam engines.

Excellent experience . The Tower Bridge visitors centre is well worth a visit next time you're in our wonderful capital. Have always loved this area of London but this was my first time actually inside the best bridge in the world.

London. Special time for every single person who been there!!! A lot of new new information and emotion I had that moment. And very important info: if you your nation Ukraine and you are fly from Ukraine to Canaba(make sure you have Canadian visa) with connection in London and you have a time you official can go to officer and ask about FREE TRANSIT VISA FOR 24 hours. Go outside from the airport and walk in London!!! Good luck
Beautifull!!!. Great bridge and super area, really save your afternoon for it, there is just soo many things to see there

the landmark bridge of London. it's the best known bridge over the River Thames all over the world ; it is naturally a must see and a must pass when visiting London;in fact it is a very special sight and feeling when seeing it for real and not in pictures ; it's something jewel like and history loaded kind of masterpiece !
Worth visiting !. An iconic place! Amazing views and great piece of history... I will highly recommend anyone paying a visit here if travelling to London.

Iconic London location. Millions of people have seen London's most famous bridge but now you can go inside and over the upper walkways to get a fabulous view of the city. The twin walkways have a glass floored section too which won't be to everyone's taste but if you can pick your way through the crowds taking the oddest selfies then it adds to the experience.You can buy a twin ticket to visit the Monument commemorating the Great Fire of London and of course there's the Tower of London right next door to help make it a great day out.
An iconic spot. You can get a great view with the south bank of the Thames where you can also do a really good walk. Of course it's a lot nice when the weather is good.
Iconic. Beautifully built and such an interesting history, as are most of the buildings in London. Young and old, they all have a story of their own

Family Favorite. We were able to walk across the bridge, take pictures from every angle. This was one of the high points of our trip. Seeing that this is one of London's most visible land marks its very exciting to be up close and climb and walk the bridge. A must see for every visitor to London.

Lovely Bridge. The Tower Bridge is absolutely worth a visit. Its structure, colors and two towers are impressiv. Take a nice walk over the bridge after or before visiging the Tower of London or just cross it while stroling around the Thames.
Nice experience!. Nice experience! Especially the part where the floor is made of glass and you can see the bridge below.

Short and good. A really quick tour apart from the queues. Great to walk across the glass on the bridge which made me a little nervous when a family of 50 million foreigners decided to lie down on for 10 minutes not letting anyone past. However they finally moved and I enjoyed the walk!

Iconic London Bridge!. What a beautiful and historic structure. We simply took photos of it from Tower of London (another great family visit!). Never gets old seeing this historic bridge. We did not take a tour as we simply did not have the time with so many other activities but I think it would be worthwhile.

Famous Bridge. When in London, of course we had to visit this bridge. We were at the bridge on a sunny day and the bridge looked absolutely beautiful. We also went in for the exhibition. Great when we actually walked over from one pilar to the other. Wonderful views and there are two glass bottems so you can see the traffic going by underneath you. We also visited the engine rooms at the end of the tour.

Great!. I didn't actually realise you could go in tower bridge!! Made my visit to London even better!! Climbing the vast stair case to the top and what an amazing time when you get to the top glass floor looking down at the bridge the views up and down the river was awesome! Would recommend!
Romantic at night . Never have enough of it. Every Time I amIn London I make an effort to see it. Beautifully lit at night. Can be very romantic :)
Impressiv. A beautiful bridge with so many details - and a classical thing to see. I haven't been up to the glass floor, but it look fun as well!

A Must See. While visiting London this was a must see at the top of my list. We luckily had great weather when we visited and got some great pictures! The bridge itself has a lot of history behind it and has a fairly good expo of sings that discuss its historical relevance.

Tower Bridge - London Icon. You saw it on TV when the Queen went underneath it, nothing can prepare you for it, absolute stunning architecture, thousands upon thousands of tourists but you know this is one place you have to be, well worth the 5 mile walk to there

Interesting experience . Take the stairs to the top instead of the lift - really makes you appreciate it more. It doesn't really take longer than an hour at most even with reading all of the info there. Definitely take a look at the engine rooms!

Amazing structure. This is an incredible structure. Every time you walk over it, you really feel connected with a vital piece of history that dominates this area of the London sky line.At night the bridge is beautifully illuminated and it looks amazing from all directions. If you visit London,you really need to pay Tower Bridge a visit.

TOWER WITH A VIEW. If you're not terrified of heights then make sure you DON'T miss out on the opportunity to walk across a glass floor which looks down onto the road bridge/river below. Not for the faint hearted as your brain tells you "don't do it"!!!!!!

Beautiful doesn't describe the tower bridge. Just simply beautiful, at night it's even better. Tower bridge is a landmark and history. Highly recommend to visit. Even better, have a little walk across the bridge

Bridge went up!. What a fabulous sight to behold - the Bridge lifting to allow a tall ship through. A very impressive site. Walked over the Bridge many times during our stay in London and have lots of lovely photos of it from different angles. Well worth taking the open bus tours as well.

Just to take pictures. There is nothing to visite there. Only the view and somme pics. Verry poor. Cost is sheep 9 pounds. Down the tour starbucks you may have coffee there. But london has many place to spend time in than this place. Pics are not good enough because of the glasses. Maybe at night is better:(

it can be seen from the Tower of London and vice versa. In my view, it is a breathtaking spot of London, underestimated (I did not seek anything about it, for instance), but its structure and beauty adds it on my bucket list for my next London trip: I am completely sure that its inside can be visited and it really deserves to be seen.
Visit to Tower Bridge experience.. Great experience and not too crowded which always helps. Loved the glass walkway and the illusion from the mirrors above.

Not London Bridge. Often confused by some tourists as being London Bridge. Located close bye near the Tower of London on the north bank and City Hall on the south bank of the Thames. Is a working bridge which can be raised to allow tall masted ships to pass through when necessary. Excellent for photographs on a nice sunny day. Free to walk over but a recent innovation is a glass floored walkway across the top intersection of the two towers. This is not free and there was a large queue for this attraction.

A Must visit while in London. Walking along the bridge, I remember the song 'London Bridge is falling down... falling down...' You can enter the tower and go to the top or just walk along the bridge, enjoying the view of thames river.
Something different to do.... The glass floor on the top platform did it for me. Staff are friendly and the whole experience was a great taste of real London.
City Icon.. The well known bridge is the icon of the city and the country itself. The view is great from both sides of the river Thames.

Great attraction. Another iconic London attraction that needs to be visited. Obviously you can simply view it from a distance or by crossing it. We also took the experience and found out all about its history. The glass floor is hairy especially for those with a fear of heights.
Go Inside!. Walked across the top part of the bridge, and it was completely glass below my feet. It's a short experience, but it has great views of the city!
Good place . A nice place to take the photos and memorabilia as well as to walk and stand to watch the river below a beautiful and romantic place

The beautiful blue. What a way to cross the Thames! A powder blue is woven in designated areas and because of it's beauty,many people think it's London Bridge, which is actually in Arizona. Also, you get great views of the Tower of London & Guoman's Tower Hotel,
.
Well worth it. Great experience walking on glass floors but weird at the same time! Definitely worth it also for the view,

Just as you've always imagined.. The Tower Bridge is beautiful. It's just as you always imagined it would be, because you've seen it a million times in countless movies and travel photos. It's definitely worth seeing, but you might feel as if you've already seen it before.
A must in London!. If you are at the Tower of London you can get some great photos of the Tower Bridge. But nothing compares to going up to the top. It is also lit up nicely after dark.
Awesome. We went by bus. Stopped at Tower hill and the bridge was just 2mins away. It was really nice to cross. This bridge is a symbol of London and it's really easy to get to it.
Lovley place to Visit. Every time I go to visit tower bridge I just love it. Historic place and full of tourists all the time even in the winter. nice river view, art of Architecture just Love it

typical london. just great
a must for tourists
great photo opportunity
walk further town the thames & see the none toursitic parts . blackfriars
Not London Bridge. Part of tour and spent too long talking abt it's predecessor, London Bridge(which now resides in Lake Havasu City Az.)

Picturesque Way to Cross the Thames. We visited the Tower of London and then walked across the Tower Bridge to the Shard, which is the site of the Borough Market. The bridge's architecture is iconic, and a candied peanut vendor sold us a snack on the way across.

Imposing . Walking over London Bridge and looking along the Thames at Tower Bridge is a sight to behold, imposing and magnificent are two words that come to mind. Yes walking over it is great but also just looking at it is amazing.
Brilliant, well worth a look. I only saw it from another bridge nearby but it was very pretty and very cool. It reminded me of every single movie ever set in London lol.

Beautiful. It's hard to miss, if you're going to the Tower of London. I loved the way it was designed to look like the Tower. we got a nice commentary from the hop on hop off bus tour as well as the Thames cruise back to Westminster.

A symbol of London. Tower Bridge is a London landmark and a well deserved one. Its cantilevered roadway is a sight to behold when raised to allow ships to pass through. A must for every tourist.I always get a kick out of the story - which maybe true - that an American bought London bridge, thinking he was buying Tower bridge. After demolition, the bricks were sent to Nevada and reassembled and now span a lake - I must go and see it one day!!

Interesting visit.. It is a little pricy to go in but then again tell me something in London that isn't. Good views overlooking the river and a little bit of history thrown in to boot. You go up in a lift with a guide who was obviously completely bored of saying the same thing every ten minutes and then down some steps at the end. Not sure if it's possible to accommodate wheelchair users.

Amazing engineering. What can I say? I walked down the bridge after visiting the London tower. the bridge is beautiful to look at. You feel all the movies and Disney fantasies flashing through your mind. You wont be able to believe its over a 100 years old and still functional with all its power. I couldn't see the bridge opening up though. I was thinking of the beautiful new year fireworks too as i walked through .. It was just as I saw in the movies.. Once i thought was reel is actually a real and i am happy I could get this experience.

Walk across tower bridge. A lovely walking bridge with beautiful details that need to be seen close up to be appreciated. The railings and supports are brightly painted which you can't see from photos. The views are great and both sides of the river are full of activity.

A fun Walk in the City. A walk across the Tower Bridge is a must while in London..and it's free! It is always crowded and busy with lots of traffic, but that is part of the fun. There are great views and picture spots along the Tower of London side of the river where you can capture a picture of this beautiful bridge.
It's a bridge, we walked over it.... It is pleasing to look at and has a lot of history attached to it, we didnt take the tour, maybe next time.

Fantastic experience. What a fantastic trip we had, 4 adults and 2 five year olds, great to go during science week with extra attractions for children. The glass floor is great with amazing views. Seeing and smelling the fantastic English machinery in the pump room was a bonus to the trip, good shop too with gifts for children. Brilliant and reasonably priced.

Flipping Cool!. Yes it's a bit overdone, but this is one of the few sites that is the hallmark of any London aerial shot in any movie! Walking over is fantastic, viewing it at night is superb-just enjoy the views of it and from it!

Fun experience. We have toyed with visiting tower bridge experience often, but on this recent visit went ahead. We were not disappointed. The history of this iconic bridge is well presented and we enjoyed the behind the scenes look, but the best was the views from the top and worth the entrance fee.
Turist viewing. It was amazing tour in Tower Bridge, the glass on the floor it was very great, nice and recommended!
Like the movies. This bridge makes you feel lime you are in a movie. It is surrounded by ultra modern London landmark architecture, as well as the Tower of London. Explore the South Bank from there

Walking in the air. Great views, the coolest thing was walking in the air. It would have been amazing to see the bridge lifting. Interesting facts about dfferent bridges. The engine room was cool, even though hard to understand the process of lifting the bridge

Exciting but not amazing. I came here with my boyfriend this weekend and was really excited, the views were amazing around the surrounding of the bridge and of course the bridge itself but going up it wasn't all the great, the bridge is gorgeous and it's exciting that you can see through the glass floor but there wasn't really much to see and it's so busy you barely get two minutes on there! And it's difficult to see through the windows, we didn't really spend any longer than 30 minutes up there and that included the wait for the lift which took about 10 minutes! It's good but nothing amazing and I probably wouldn't do it again. Although the staff were all friendly and helpful which was a bonus, just not something for me really (21 year old)
Glass floor was amazing. We walked along the walkway above the bridge. The glass floor was great, you could see down into the water. Worth a look if you don't have vertigo

Iconic. The Tower Bridge is obviously a very iconic landmark of London and well worth a look. You can walk over the bridge and there is actually an exhibition inside the bridge which I didn't go to but have heard good things. You can get great views of the bridge from outside the Tower of London and also immediately on the other side. It's pretty spectacular and the history of it is quite incredible.

Walk across, it's worth it!. This is what all pictures of London show you, the awe inspiring Tower Bridge. My family and I were visiting the Tower of London when we decided to walk across Tower Bridge to the South Bank to catch a train back to our hotel after our visit. I've been to London several times and have never set foot on the bridge so I was all for it. I have to say that I am absolutely delighted that we did. Other than the 10,000 pictures I ended taking (okay, just an exaggeration), the view from the bridge is magnificent all around. If you want, go ahead and take the tour (I think it's called the Tower Bridge Experience), I wish we did but it was getting late in the day so we didn't get around to it but if you don't want to spend the money, just walk across it from the Tower of London to the South Bank, the bridge itself just takes your breath away. It's about a 10 minute stroll across, what with all the stops to take pictures) and we enjoyed it very much. In the past, we've done the boat ride that goes under the bridge and being on the bridge allowed us a new perspective of the Thames and all its surroundings. Definitely recommended if you're in London. The Tower on one side and the South Bank on the other, what's not to like?
Icon of London - worth seeing. Having seen Tower Bridge on TV many times, it is definitely worth seeing in person. Would be a very lovely bridge to photograph if you could get rid of the traffic!
Well worth a visit. A must see in London, free to walk/drive across. Was too busy at half term to do the experience, so would try again at a less busy time.

Makes you feel proud to be British. This like many parts of London, makes you stand back, take it in and realise you are looking at a true iconic master piece. Makes you proud to be British or at least utterly wowed by it!
A famous landmark. try to take a boat ride, and take a picture the way you like it for the bridge.. you can't miss it. you will pass by it many time during your stay if you are a tourist.

Good to see. I always enjoy seeing places I've always seen on TV. It was great to see it in person even if it was cold and raining. We went on Easter Sunday so it was really busy with tourists that were over for the Easter holidays, that just added to the atmosphere.
Fun!. It's interesting to see how this fantastic bridge was constructed and the view is just amazing. The lookthrough windows give you a creepy feeling and the stuff is really friendly.
Sunset time. I arrived to the Tower Bridge at 5pm as the sun was starting to set. I recommend to go at this time so you can see the bridge during the day and then lit up at night.
Had to see it.... Nice to see one of the greatest landmarks of London. With the tower of London en the shard a bit behind great place so sightsee

excellent place. tower bridge is a most amazing spot to see if you ever come to london.great location for all pubilc transport,down side was we went in the rain so would be better if planned when sunny.

Fantastic architecture.... Visited the bridge in March on a trip to London..our hotel was on tower bridge road so only a 10 min walk away...it's a fantastic looking bridge, we were also lucky enough to see the bridge raised twice in one day..this apparently is quite a rare event these days as not many large ships now pass through..we'll worth a visit.
Nothing exciting. We stayed in a hotel near the bridge hoping it is lighted up at night but it was very dark. I guess the council is trying to save energy.
Must see in London. One of monuments in London you must see. View on the river, close to all the major city sights. But hard to take a picture without tourists on it...

You and the background in the picture. This historical London Bridge is a must visit place.
Within the modern buildings, London still keep the ancient building.
London Bridge is a must visit monument.
Be creative with your photo, you and the backgrouns
Tower. Not somewhere necessarily to visit, but passing by you. An see over a lot of London. If you go on the megabus it goes along here twice to get out of london

Tower Bridge Glass Walkway. Wonderful view from the top of Tower Bridge!
We loved the Glass Walkway,it's quite exciting of course if you are not scared of heights!
Highly recommended tour!

Excellent. My wife and I checked the inside of the tower bridge, all this steel and rivets. Amazed of how this was possible all those years ago. The glass floor and mirrors above the street...very cool.
Tower Bridge. It's not very expensive and you don't feel hurried when you look around. The views are great and don't miss the 'Engine Room'.

Worth the experience. Brought daughter and her boyfriend for a birthday surprise. Queueing was a bit of a pain, but once inside the wait was well worth it. After claiming up one of the north towers, the view from the top is fabulous. You start of with a view to the east of London, walk over to the south side via the glass ceiling and then back over the other side with a lovely view of the west of London. Recommend visiting the pump rooms - the engineering is amazing. Couldn't find Wing Commander Raymond's accommodation though!
Reminds you of School!!. Just a bridge but brings back memories of all that you learnt in School. Great to see all the ships in the background and the magnifici=ent River Thames

Beautiful sight, some interesting facts but rather plain.. The Tower Bridge itself is magnificent architecture and a must see as a part of the London experience. However, if you decide to go up there's not much to it- they have some facts and pictures, worth a look if you have the London pass but I'd skip it otherwise. Just take in the view from the bottom where it's free.

As beautiful as in the postcards. Breathtaking bride by the Tower of London. Love the architecture and the color blue on the bridge. Went walking over but the rain and wind was annoyingly-not the bridge's fault. A definite must see/walk on a trip here.
Great.. We did the tower bridge experience, walking across the bridge over the glass floor was amazing.My children loved it, my little boy was lying down on the glass.Great.Staff were brilliant.

Spectacular view. Even if it's clearly a tourist spot it still deserve a visit. The glass floor and the view from above give you a different perspective of London. It's a good opportunity to learn some of london's history. Tip:Buy an advanced ticket to avoid queues

Up Close Above The Thames. A spectacular photo opportunity even before gaining admission, the Tower Bridge presents post-card perfect profiles to the eye and the camera. Upon admission one ascends into the tower at the end to be able to walk over the pedestrian joining spans between the towers. The floor in several places is glass and so vertigo grasps anyone so affected since you are above 100 feet above the road traffic and a few feet more above the Thames River. All along the walk inside are graphic illustrations of the bridge construction and its predecessors and its importance to local commerce and river traffic. There is no rush to traverse the length inside and you can actually return via the walk opposite the one you took over. This is a fun activity and affords loads of information for all and vistas that will be especially appealing to children
Night walk. I was there only at the evening, when it was already dark outside, but it just worth it :) We could not enter, but we had a wonderful walk around :)

What a spectacle especially at night. Went to London with family and ear a a restaurant overlooking the London Bridge. This location is a piece of 'must see' history for all visitors to London. Thoroughly recommend.
Magnificent bridge. We decided to have a stroll across tower bridge, this bridge is magnificent steeped in history with great architecture and engineering. Fabulous a definite must see.

A quick run to the bridge at night . Visit at night and it gives you a different aura with the lights in the river reflected and the lesser crowd! Run there from Westminster Bridge and back gives you 9km.
Amazing. This is a great bit of architecture. The views from it are amazing. There is also a chance to go up to view from towers. This is a great photo opportunity.
Beautiful. Worth a look! Anything historic (which is almost every building) is awesome as far as I am concerned.
Great day!. Visited London and popped to tower bridge on our travels, wonderful views, it's what London is all about! Definitely worth a visit :)
WOW. Loved it. Took great pictures. Walked the glass floor on top. Awesome experience I highly recommend,

Beautiful Bridge!. We took the big bus tour and had the pleasure to first see and drive on this bridge while riding on the top deck. We had the pleasure of seeing this up close after touring the London Tower. Great place to take pictures!

One of the icon in City of London. The visit to London never complete unless you visit Tower Bridge. The best time will be afternoon to visit as the bridge looks lovely at sunset. Again all depend what you look at what time of the day. Don't forget to walk over the bridge and see all details, specially the separation line in the middle. There is a glass walk, what's new but I did not have time to try that. Nice food outlets, coffee shops and restaurants around.
Nice. So much to see and visit in London, often we see this land mark on tv or cinema, is a nice place to visit. If ypu have the time to do the river by boat also a must
Impressive. We didn't do the tour, just walked across the bridge, which makes for an iconic London photo, particularly at night.
Stunning bridge . An easy walk over this bridge and around the surrounding areas makes for a great day. Borough Markets is a must visit as well
British Icon. Another visit to Tower Bridge and it is never boring! The history and technology is fab and it is just an amazing piece of history that you can still visit, touch and walk over

Interesting attraction. We visited Tower bridge on a short trip to London and weren't disappointed. They were upgrading some of the exhibits in the first tower when we went so it was straight up to the top (lots of stairs!). The views are great and the glass walkway is fun! There's also lots of information about the bridge, how it was built, and about other bridges around the world. An added bonus was the exhibition in the engine room. This is worth a visit if you have time or are in the area!
beautiful construction. Exciting and stunning views. Although I am disabled I still managed to climb the steps. The glass floor looks really interesting

Lovely on a fine day.. I have never paid to go into the exhibition but came yesterday and had a wonderful view from the Tower of London. The bridge opened for a tall vessel. If you want to come here check on the internet for the opening times as it is a lovely sight to see the bridge operating.

Must See!. The tower bridge is a must see and is close by to the tower of London and Borough Markets.
Don't be mistaken this is the Tower bridge NOT the London Bridge, the london bridge is a crapy bridge near by that you shouldn't waste any of your time seeing. It's really just a normal bridge.
Amazing architechture. What a fantastic piece of engineering, The history of the place and how its all put together to form this piece of history is fantastic

Great experience!. I honestly did not think I would enjoy going in the Tower Bridge as much as I did. Once there, however, I was really impressed! The views of London were great, learning about the history of the bridge was very interesting and ,of course, walking on the glass floor and taking pictures was a lot of fun! There were staff around to ask questions of and to encourage people to walk on the glass if they were a bit squeamish. Overall, a lovely experience and not too pricey either.
Would you dare walk on the glass floor ?. Our grandchildren loved it & I did it as well. Seeing the traffic 100 feet or lower down was different. A thoroughly exiting & informative attraction
Great View on Bridge. This is the Bridge you want to walk on top of. The view below is incredible. We were up there when the bridge opened below. I highly recommend.

Good views and unique feel!. Let's be honest: this is a must-see attraction in London. We took the Thames River Cruise here, which was a bit slow and regrettable, but the actual tower is breathtaking. Of particular interest is the "bridges of the world" exhibition and history of the bridge. If you're brave, you can walk across the glass floor and see the Thames far below. Its also one of the cheaper attractions in London - only£ 9 per person!

Don't expect much. I have been here a few times over the years with mates and relatives alike. Usually the first thing people want to see to on the river, but there are far better things to do. Having lived in London for well over 30 years I pass over this bridge on a regular basis so to me there is no novelty value other than it's a pain for the locals when there is "A Lift" (an opening of the bascules). Please bare in mind there is only so much you can do with a bridge to exciting and fun but as for value for money goes this is not the best one! You pay a small fortune to be herded into a small lift and took up to a room with a video projection presentation that looked outdated as soon as it was installed. After a short but somewhat unhelpful presentation you are frog marched up to another level and you can walk across the over gantries between the two towers. This is the only bit of excitement on the whole trip. You can peer down through the glass on the river or the road depending if the bridge is raised or not. It's ok, but why? The view up and down the river is no different as you are only a few feet up in the air, add to this as you are already in "the view" you miss out on the river view of the bridge if you get my logic! As soon as you are over to the other end you are off down a long set of stairs and you then have to follow the line to the engine house. Now, when I first started going here as a kid you could walk all the way around the engines, poke about, touch them, ask questions and even turn a few knobs and dials. Now it's all fell foul to H&S which has ruined it. Also in the early days of the museum you could go down into the bowls of the bridge into the bascule chamber and if you were lucky you could stand at the door and watch a massive weight go by, but even this is out of bounds. To top it all you are forced through a hum drum shop selling all the usual tat. At the end of it you feel let down and realize there are better things to spend your money on like HMS Belfast next door or walking around the docks next door that are free. In all very poor value for money and not a great deal to look at.

Interesting Exhibition. We had the London Pass and we got into this exhibition for free. It was an amazing feat of Victorian engineering. You can walk across a glass portion of the walkway and look directly down into the Thames. NOT for those that are afraid of heights!

Fascinating technology. This attraction walks you though the upper level of "The Tower Bridge". There is a see through section on both sides and a great deal of history presented at the various presentations. There are also photos of other famous bridges. Down below you get a walk through of the technology behind how this still in use bridge works.

Nice day out. Not to be missed. Atleast should be visited once. The history , is fascinating. I liked the jewel house the best. Enjoyed oggling at the diamonds. Pricey day out. So it restricts numbers. Not suitable fof very young children.

Surprisingly good. Didn't even realise there was an exhibition on the bridge and that you could walk over the upper parts. Came here using our London Passes.Very informative exibition, especially as you go over the walkways. The interactive apps and videos were great. I, personally, wasn't so keen on the glass panels but managed to walk along the edge, holding the rail!My husband especially loved the well preserved engine room.Great value for money, especially for a London attraction.

Surprisingly interesting tour. Was in London with 17 year old son and friend. For want of doing something different to traipsing up and down Oxford Street we did the Tower Bridge tour. Walked up numerous steps to the walkway at the top of the bridge, and then went down into the engine room. So interesting my 17 year old wanted to watch various videos and see exhibition pictures, instead of the usual galloping through in 2 seconds. Would visit again.

take the train to the 'tower hill station'. stunning masterpiece, perfect engineering, beautiful picturesque check out the fish and chips for 7.40 (gbp), take a walk round the tower of london and you can reach the tower bridgeyou have this glass floor tower exbit, were you can get on the elevator... reach the top of the towers on the bridge and get the city view as well

Majesty and Utility. The Tower bridge straddling the Thames river is a landmark one cannot miss. Majestically standing there for over a hundred years now, the construction of the Bridge is a story in itself and can be seen in the various pics and drawing which adorn the building.There is a small entry fee to this monument and the exhibits change from time to time. On my last visit, the Tower Bridge opened a few of its rooms to exhibit the place where Royalty had been imprisoned. The new attraction, something which was not available on my last visit, were the walkways between the two towers and a visit to the engine room.But beware. There is steep climb up to the top so the fainthearted should not waste their money.The walkways give you a bids eye look straight down on the traffic which flows over the bridge and the ships which pass under the bridge. It s a great sight. Worth the price.There are two video exhibits which give you an insight into the construction of the bridge and both are very interesting.Once you finish with the top, you can go down to the basement and see the massive engines which are still used to operate the bridge and bring up the bridge when large ships need to pass. The Tower Bridge is an amazing engineering feat.

Night time. I took the opportunity to visit and night and was so glad I did as it's stunning lit up. Although there were plenty of other people there, it was a great place to sit and take in the view.

Both for tourists and Londoners alike. I had some colleagues come to town from Paris for an event. It was their first visit to the capital. I met them at Kings Cross St Pancras and brought them to Tower Hill Underground. We took a slow stroll over the bridge pausing for photos as I guided them to a restaurant on the south-side of the Thames. Magnificent views and well worth the effort (even I, as a Londoner, was impressed).

Finally got to experience it in person. Very interesting tour of this famous landmark. The high-level walkways connecting the two towers on either end are a great way to see the river, the Tower of London and the surrounding buildings. A small section of the walkways are made of glass so you can look down onto the bridge itself. After the bridge itself we looked at the Victorian engine rooms to see how the two spans are raised and lowered.

A London Classic !. The Tower Bridge, not to be confused with the London Bridge, is a must see ! Well worth the admission. Plan on spending at least an hour there. Shoot down the spiral staircases for a great image
Inforamtive.. We had the London Pass which allowed us access into the top of Tower Bridge. It was good as we seen the history of the bridge and through the engines

Worth visiting. They have a glass at the top and it's really worth the visit.
Kids will love it...
It's also very informative.

One of the most famous bridges in the world!. One of the most famous bridges in the world!The view from the bridge is fabulous. The view of the bridge is fabulous!As a tourist the Tower Bridge Exhibition and engine rooms are pretty good value, especially now they have the glass floor on the high level. The view is pretty spectacular from up there and the history of the bridge is fascinating.
An unique experience!. This is a must-see attraction invites and probably one of the top 5 famous bridges in the world. it has high level walkways through a glass floor which is very unique.

Cross it on a sunny day. Plan a walk from the tower of London to some spot you'd like to visit on the other side of the Thames and then use the Tower Bridge to cross the river, preferably, on a sunny day.
Majestic. She really is a lovely structure. I love that I got to visit her on a splendid Autumn day. If you are in London, go visit, it is so worth it.

Impressive architecture... No wonder the Americans wanted it. So in case you didn't know, this is the bridge the Americans thought they bought some years ago, when in fact this is Tower Bridge and not London Bridge. It definitely pays to know the difference.There's not really much upselling to do on this; it's the most iconic bridge in London. Have a walk down on the south side of the river from London Bridge station and you'll get the view you're after. Word of warning; it gets busy down there and on the bridge.

Amazing views of a glorious river. I've been to the attraction twice, once in the evening for a Valentines treat, which was amazing, the lights of the sights of London are stunning. Plus you get a tour of the bridge, and on our Valentines evening we got quite a few glasses of bubbly! What could be better?!For our day visit, it was still an invigorating experience, and if I recall very cheap!
nice walk. Nice clean, quit surroundings for a walk up over the bridge. Good view of the Thames River and surrounding buildings

Stunning Landmark. The Tower Bridge is an amazing building that's always worth a visit and you clearly need to bring a camera to capture awesome moments. My wife and me visited it a couple of times during our holidays in London. We even saw it opening and closing for a sailing boat, which is very nice to see but it's a very slow process. Unfortunately the weather wasn't very good.

Great fun. Really interesting historically, plus our kids loved the glass walkway looking down onto the river below.
Should be on your list of must dos
Iconic. Riding across the Tower Bridge is a must for every visitor to London. Most confuse this with the London Bridge. Sit on top of the open air buses and take pictures.

Another 'must see'.... As a Londoner I avoid a lot of the tourist trail. But this is a magnificent building to be able to get inside.When I was a kid it was not open to the public and the high walkway was the stuff of legend.When it was opened to the public I went as soon as I could and was not disappointed. Like I said on my review of the Tower Of London it is a good one to do on the same day as the Tower... both being very close to each other.Only drawback, as with the Tower, is it can get very busy and is quite expensive.Don't rush it. Once you get inside, take your time... sit down... soak it up... look in all the nooks and crannies and corners... there is so much to see if you let yourself take the time to really get into it. I have spend hours up on the walkways watching the river and imagining London of the past etc.And don't forget to visit the old engine rooms too.

Had fun exploring the Tower Bridge!. I had seen the Bridge from the Tower of London years ago, but this time we actually toured it... ran out of time to go underneath and see how it works, but we walked the platforms and enjoyed seeing London from a different perspective!

An Easy Tour Near the London Tower - Included in your London Pass. It's worth a walk over the bridge and a quick tour. The views are stunning and the bridge is beautiful. I wouldn't have done the tour if it had been crowded but it was interesting and free with our London Pass. We especially liked the clear panels in the floor that made you feel like you were walking on air above the cars below.
Fabulous History . This is a great value trip. You get s lift to the top, am exhibition and a glass floor corridor with pictures of the best bridges in the world.A cracking visit

Very pretty. Visited tower Bridge whilst training at International House. The Bridge was busy night and day with tourists but it was always kept clean and tidy. Very nice place to visit and get some lovely photos. Would recommend a visit.
Worth doing & helpful staff. Staff very friendly and helpful which is always a good start. Interesting to walk over the top walk way and see the view below, worth doing.

Great value. For less than £6 ( senior concession ) this is really good value . The tour consists of films and walking all over the bridge including the new glass floor on the upper levels. Also see the engine room .

Iconic - if you have to visit one bridge.... Tower Bridge rings history, was London built around it, was it there before the Romans, adjacent to the Tower of London that must be true. However, for LOndon its relatively modern but what a classic. To me its more beautiful from an angle, perhaps from Catherine Dock, which is another local gem or a walk from the tower along the river path.A must for all tourists and the catch the 11 back into the centre of LOndon, that will take you pass all of London great sites, for just £1.50 and if you are lucky you can get the heritage bus.

Amazing. I have only visited it from outside (I walk across it every day to and from work) and it never gets boring, this is probably the most well known bridge in the world, it's great to stand in the middle and see the London City on one side and Canary Wharf at the other end, great area overall - planning to visit exhibition this summer, it must be a great view from up there too...if possible take a boat trip and you should be able to get some great pictures of the bridge from the middle of the river....

Magnificent. This tower is a wonder to behold. It's presence is big and inspiring for some reason. The design & it's location by the river is just wonderful.Walk by its length, go to the museum, or walk by the riverbank where Tower of London is (by far, the best location to be at) - and in any way, it is a pleasure.

Great experience. We used an offer so it only cost £9 for the two of us. There are a lot of steps to climb if you don't use the lift but the views are worth every step.The staff are really informative and also helpful.
An impressive monument of London. I love crossing the tames in this bridge, especially by bike. It also worth it to go on the south of the river to admire the view.

Very Beautiful Bridge. I do recommend to walk alongside the Thames to go to Tower Bridge, it is a very pleasant and beautiful walk, lots of visitors from all over the world, however in March there is still enough space available to walk with easiness, do not know how it is in the summer time. Nice to sit down on the benches alongside the Thames, just very relaxing and joyful experience. Took photos and had lots of fun just observing people pass by.

A must. The Tower Bridge is a great landmark and a fun walk. The Londons on either side are very different. The architecture is of course classic. Read about it before you go to understand the history. Great vistas are available from multiple spots on the bridge

Great experience!! . Loved this. Especialy the walk over the glass panel... Plenty of history and facts on the bridge and could spent some time reading into the bridges from around the country... would recommend.

Featured in many films, this icon is a must see/do. The current crossing, which opened to traffic in 1974, is a box girder bridge built from concrete and steel. This replaced a 19th-century stone-arched bridge, which in turn superseded a 600-year-old medieval structure.One can tour the structure during times open to the public as well as private tours / parties after it has publicly closed.There is a glass walkway in which one gets a bird’s eye view of the bridge and the surrounding area.One can also visit the engine room which tells the story of how the bridge functions.

London Bridge, Charming and bold...... I was taken aback, on how small the doors where, the original doors that where built, to go up to the tower. There is a tour, with a high cost in my opinion to go to the top. (which I didn't do) I mean the view from the road was good enough you saw all of London and the river. I walked to the end and then took the double decker bus back to Tower Station, to catch the tube back into the city.
Tower Bridge - London. Iconic Bridge of London. A must see attraction in London. It opens to pass ships. you can have a beautiful view of Thames from the Bridge.
Great views. Entry is reasonable and this includes going up to the bridge and underneath to learn about the history of the bridge. Worth the money.
good place for a photo. You won't get the real feeling when you actually be there! It is a great building with lots of historical mark. Take a picture of the bridge on the river bank! Love it.

Not bad for £9 - Glass floor was good.. We went here one Saturday in March. The queues were short, maybe 5 minutes maximum.The cost per adult is £9. You get to walk across the top section of the bridge which has a glass floor, I was actually quite scared. There is information about the bridge along the way. You get good views from here.Next you can go in the engine room to see how the engines work and the bridge moves. I found this quite interesting.I'm glad that we went.
Take the tour - its so inteesting. I thought a tour of the bride would be only very nice. I was wrong. Its interesting and fun with great views both above and below ground

Its not just a bridge. Absolutely gorgeous at night and especially good in pictures. Even if its just to take photos , this is always a must see. Although i probably drive past it 3 to 4 times a week, you cant help but marvel at the engineering and its sheer size. Tower Bridge is a combined bascule and suspension bridge in London. The bridge crosses the River Thames close to the Tower of London and has become an iconic symbol of London. Looks absolutely glorious in the evening. If you are walking, try go down and walk along the river side where there are about 3 to 4 large hotels. You will see loads of people walking by the river, or having a drink or coffee. I once stayed at the Guoman Hotel Tower Bridge for a party and asked for the tower bridge view. Wow, it was so close it felt like you could touch or taste it. We stayed up most of the night just looking at the beautiful bridge, and thats someone who has lived in London over 30 years.
London must see. We visited but did not go up in the tower bridge. Great to visit for cool views of London and the Tower of London. Go underneath the bridge along the river for even cooler views.
It's a bridge. Well, it's a bridge....it's nice, it's iconic, cool too see and experience but at the end of the day everyone.....it is a bridge.
Amazing. This is incredible, worth a visit. You can't get much more London than this. It's truly the best bridge in the world. You must walk across it.

Don't miss it!!. Tower Bridge is in my top 3 places in London! It's amazing how you time travel while looking at it! And if you are lucky (like I was) you will see the gates opening and closing which is great for pictures :) (I have no idea how often that happens but it's an amazing view). You should also cross the bridge! 5*
Historical Bridge. The Tower bridge is one of the most notable bridges on the river Thames.A great photo opportunity from so many angles
One of the top things to do in London . I really loved the bridge! The view is just amazing and the glass floor is thrilling! I would definitely recommend!

Romantic at night with the boat tour. I visired this bridge in daytime and nightime. I prefered in night time when the lights are on, better photos, greater view. Boat tour at night,evening is highly reccommended.

More enjoyable than expected!. Our family expected the usual walk up to the top of a bridge. Kids were not all that excited. But once there, they loved the glass floor and we happened to catch the bridge lifting beneath us. Fantastic views and interesting info along the way of other fascinating bridges around the world.

Iconic part of London!. Great place to go for a picture or two and to take in the view of the City from the Thames side - definitely still a notable landmark (recommended if you are visiting London for the first time for sure)
One of the most beautiful bridge. This is one of the most beautiful bridge I ever seen. People confused it with London Bridge so did I but its name is Tour Bridge. Best way to see it to walk on it.
Beautiful. Beautiful to see/walk across. Great panoramic pictures of the bridge/city from the Tower of London too.
Very Impressive. This was actually on my bucket list. It's very impressive standing on the City Hall side of the Bridge you can see the Tower of London!

Well worth a visit. We brought our 9 year old here and he loved it, all the history and talks that were taking place to explain what every area is and how its been used in history, you need a good 1 - 2 hours to get round the whole place

Glass Bottom Bridge. The newest renovation at the Tower Bridge has a clear glass floor for part of the tour that is breath-taking (not for the feint of heart!). Make sure to visit the Engine Rooms at the end of the climb across the bridge. Great exhibit for engineers of all ages.
History comes by. although I visited London before , but this was my first time to the Tower bridge .Don't miss it or you will miss a real land mark
VIEW!!!. It is worth walking the stairs. There is a good halfway landing for catching the breath. The views are marvelous.

Stopped off to take pics. Amazing bridge to see great place to take 30 -40 minutes to take pics, amazing to see the bridge come to a halt for a boat to pass through even better to grab a drink and watch life going by
It is an icon. You really do get the feeling you are in London when you visit this bridge. You kind of feel like you are part of history. Iconic design. Part f the musts in London
Great Views from the top. We went to the top and the views were great! Had a good time walking around! Very easy to do before or after the Tower of London.
Beautiful. The view is fantastic, full of history, although it is located between high modern buildings. The Bridge is absolutely delightful

Beautiful Icon. Tower Bridge is one of the nicest area on the Thames river. The Mayor's building opposite is a great place to sit on the grass and have lunch. Better than the Tower of London north side which is madly busy.

Interesting exposition and lovely Panorama . The exposition in the tower bridge is interesting About the construction and the functioning of the bridge on the top level you got a beautyfull Panorama on the river Thames and London, through a glass bottom you can even see the Thames right beneath you.

Easy on a Sunday morning. Loverly piece of history
So pleased the USA purchased the wrong bridge.
Easy to get too across from the Tower of London.
Great walk along the river Thames

Ships can pass. This unique bridge on River Thames was opened on 30th June, 1894. It is unique by its contraption that allows large ships to pass under it by lifting the two halves of the pathway on top.
Everyone should at least drive by!. This is such a frequent picture in London, just nice to say we went by it! There is so much to see and do in London!

Must see it twice, by day and at night!. Maybe the most beautiful bridge I have ever seen. It tops the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco and the Fred Hartman in Houston because it is so ornate and historic, yet fully functional. True representation of England... Modern and historic.
disapointed. I had been told that the visit was very interesting, maybe I was expecting more, I am glad I had a 2x1 tickets, if I had paid the full price I would have felt even more dissapointed

Must see! . A glimpse of the past!
Absolutely one of the best sightseeing in London!
Day and night is like a fairytale!
There is no reason to pay 15 pounds to see the view from above.

Experience the Stairs if you Go on Experience. There are a ton of reviews. I just want to make sure that if you go on the Tower Bridge Experience and the lift is broken.....plan on 10 flights of stairs. Walkway window at top, over bridge road was cool. But really not worth the $ unless you paid for it as part of London Pass

Gorgeous. This is a must see. When you are up on yop,there is a section of the floor that is glass. It is funny to see how many people are afraid to walk across the glass floor and chose to stay on the sidelines. Along the walls are pictures of other famous bridges around the world. The final part of the tour is the engine room. Amazing when you think that this was the first bridge that was able to raise like that.
Iconic. A great icon to view as you walk along the Thames. Take the time to walk over the bridge, if the weather permits.
Towers of London!. It's a wonderful experience if we are in the heart of London & pass by Tower Bridge, Lambath Bridge, London Bridge, Westminster Bridge, To see all Bridges in Parallel view!!
Weekend in London. My wife and friends were fascinated to see how much London had changed since we last visited. The city has a vibrant cheerfulness about it.

Interesting and challanging. You can actually go inside and climb the hundreds of steps to the top of tower. When you get there the view is fantastic. On either side of the walkways are glass floors which you can walk over. This is when I freaked out, however after some gentle persuasion I did it. The glass can actually take the weight of 2 Mini cars or 1 elephant but even knowing this there is still something in the back of you mind saying it's not wright.

Fascinating example of a bygone era in mechanical engineering. This is more an experience than an exhibition. Walking along the top corridors of the bridge, seeing the views, daring yourself to walk on the glass floors and learning about the engines are all included in the price of £9 per adult. This is excellent value. The exhibition is complemented by videos telling how the bridge was constructed and more. It also includes examples of other famous bridges around the world, tempting the traveller in you. While there is room for modernisation, you do get a feel for the era in which the bridge was built.

Can't recommend it at all.. The draw here is to walk across the bridge via the top walkway which has a very short stretch of glass flooring allowing you to look down at the cars and people. This view would probably be slightly enhanced by the bridge opening but it was not to be for me. Overall, I wasn’t that impressed with the walkway and felt it wasn't worth the price, and my opinion wasn’t helped by people lying on the glass floor taking selfies for whatever reason, blocking the passage almost completely. I also took in a visit to the engine room (which is included), but Victorian Engineering baffles me, so I trundled through it at a fair old clip.
Beautiful bridge. It's the bridge we all think is London bridge but a very beautiful monument. The view of the bridge when the roads go up for a ship to pass is really good

A London Icon. The tour of the bridge is quite interesting - esp. the behind the scenes look at the actual workings of the structure. The restored equipment to actually make the bridge open was very nicely presented. And they do a good job explaining the overall history and importance of the bridge to the city itself. It is both educational and entertaining and a nice way to spend a bit of time on (and above) the river.

Great View!. They have a tour, I didn't bother. I did however try the peanuts from the street vendor. DO THIS! They were warm and tasty, best peanuts I've ever had. The view of London is great. Make sure you have plenty of memory, you'll go nuts taking pictures.
Worth the visit. Lots to see and going up in the towers was a good experience. A must do if you visit London. No this is not the "London Bridge" :)Visited October 2012

Good value attraction. We did the Tower Bridge Experience last week and we enjoyed it very much. Learning about how the bridge was constructed and powered was very interesting, and there are some stunning views. Good value for money considering its world-wide appeal.
Great. We all really enjoyed this, it was both informative and exciting. The glass floor was so much fun, if not a bit scary!

The glass walkway is a must. In addition to just seeing this historic and majestic bridge, it's great fun to pay to go up to the top levels where there are glass walkways. All the kids were loving it although quite a few adults looked somewhat nervous. Great views up and down the Thames and overlooking the Tower of London.Also worth a quick visit to the engine room.I did the combined ticket to also go up Monument. Great views again but not for the unfit or poor head for heights.
Beautiful. Steeped on history any visit to London should involve a trip over the bridge. Very windy so make sure you wrap up well!

Amazing architecture.. A visit to Tower Bridge is a must do! The bridge was designed and built for Queen Victoria and completed in 1894. It stands 140 feet above the city, the views are spectacular and if you manage to climb up all the stairs to the upper level and have a head for heights, you can walk along the glass floor and watch the traffic going underneath the bridge. However, there are lifts for people who are unable to climb up all the stairs. The upper level also has little windows so you can take photographs of the views of the surrounding areas.If you are lucky, you may be able to watch the bridge open to allow ships to pass underneath it.Your ticket also includes a visit to the Victorian engine rooms, just a few minutes’ walk from the South Tower, where you can see the original machinery that powered the bridge’s lifts when it was first built. We saw huge, well maintained steam engines, furnaces and accumulators that were once used to power the raising of Tower Bridge’s bascules (the moveable roadways at the bridge’s centre). We found this interesting and informative. Good value for money and not as expensive as some of the other London attractions.
Awesome view!. Do not miss this place if you are in London! The tower bridge has a unique experience and I had been with my family, my kids loved this place!
Beautiful bridge . Beautiful bridge decorating this city. You can have a pleasant or a drink in a cafe just besides it on the southern bank.

Amazing gound floor with great views. The view it was amazing and glass floor it made me feel that I've step inside of the most famous bridge in the world. This is a beautiful place where you must stop if you will visit London and you can take beautiful pictures too.

Unique view of London. This is not a place I would have thought of visiting, had I not arranged to meet a friend here, but I found found it well worth the trip. The unique view of London it provides would almost have been enough on it's own, but the information boards, diagrams and setting, not to mention the level of engineering required to build and run this bridge, made this a very interesting visit. If you have an interest in architecture and engineering, or just want to take a closer look at an iconic London landmark, I would recommend the Tower Bridge Experience.
Grand Architecture on Thames!. Magnificently built, the Tower Bridge is the most spectacular bridge in London. Enjoyed walking on the bridge. Had a beautiful time.

A walk across the glass floor....do you dare look down?. An interesting look at the city, both across and down through the glass floor. I couldn't bring myself to step on it, but plenty of room for cowards to edge round it.

Indescribable. A must for every London traveler to walk or drive across Tower Bridge. We drove across it several times on the Big Bus tour, which was breath taking, and a wonderful way to see the Bridge up close. However, I would recommend walking across Tower Bridge, as the moment is enjoyed and cherished longer. Such a beautiful sight.
You can't go to the Tower of London and not walk across the bridge. Always wanted by the Americans this is one of Britain's iconic buildings and recognised all over the world

Very reasonably priced for a London attraction.... A very good way to spend an hour we found this to be a reasonably priced tourist attraction for London.We arrived very early (just after it opened) therefore, it was not very busy and we had to share the attraction with just a few visitors. However, and one word of warning would be, is that it is a long trek upward with over 200 stairs albeit they are quite gentle and not too steep and rightly enough, they do warn you of such before you pay. It did appear that there was a lift installation in progress to ease the passage.The walkways were good and there were some good information points/facts dotted about which provided further interest and we found all of the staff we came into contact with, very friendly and cheery.There are some great views from the top and included in the price is a visit to the engine rooms (at the end and below of the bridge itself) which was very interesting.We found it to be well worth a visit, great value for money and would highly recommend.
Something for all ages. I went with two grandsons. We enjoyed the high level views and they revelled in the games provided. The Engine Room was a bonus surprise.

Awesome. It was raining at about 6 pm when I ventured towards the Tower Bridge. With the sun setting, it was a beautiful sight indeed. Later on, the lights came on and it looked even prettier. There is also a nice write up about the Tower Bridge worth reading. It is scenic with boat rides below (which you may need to pre-book and is separate). On both sides you get a good view of the London city.
Amazing views. A little cols and windy but that's to be expected. An easier stroll than one would think. Walked across and back then down to the river walk. Nice afternoon

One of the most beautifully constructed bridges in the world. Iconic bridge.This tower bridge is close to tower of london where many Indians visit to see the famous Kohinoor diamond which was taken away from India during the British period.No charges.Its free..YOU can take a walk on the bridge.This bridge is accessible from tube stations and bus stations.Its incredible.You can see the london bridge from here.Enjoy the beauty of thames.Looks beautiful at night.

Must see. We have visited some years before the bridge, but now there is an addition that is really fun (or scary depending) : There are two parts of the floor that have been replaced with glass so it feels like you are walking on air while watching the river and the cars passing underneath. It also makes for a great photo opportunity. Note that you have to ask for use of the elevator when climbing up if you need one. Also the attraction is included on the London pass but also 2 for 1 days out in London offer.

A must part of your trip. The architecture is amazing but towers and bridges are just that! Definitely should be a must to visit when you go to London but plan it with multiple other things as it is not a whole day experience.It is beautiful and amazing to wander across. A fantastic view.A perfect walk from many other traditional attractions.Learn the history as it will make your experience more amazing.Truly it is really a must on your to do list.Wear comfortable walking shoes are London and have bandaids handy!Blister really are so painful when this city is often a walking experience.

Beautiful!!. Taking a walk on the Tower Bridge is a must for every tourist in London! We (Me and the husband) did it in February and boy was it cold this year! It was freezing and we were wondering which one of us would take our hands out of our gloves to click pictures!!You get to see the Thames up close and if you go in the evening, the London view is great!

A must see. This is an iconic landmark for London, and is an amazing piece of architecture, especially when you consider what era it was built in. Combine it with a visit to the Tower of London and you won't be disappointed.
Mr. Sublime area to check out. Lovely steak hse called c.a.u. loved it. Argentinian steak hse lived up to its calling. Although I tried two dishes my tastebuds wern't confused.
Just good. It's a nice place, expensive to enter! At night is beatiful! I don't know anything about the history of this tower, so I can't talk to about it!
tower bridge. Great expierance, used our 2 for 1 tickets as we travelled down on the train , walking on the glass floor was great once my legs stopped shaking :)

Lovely bridge with some curiosities and history. One iconic place in London, many visitors call it the London Bridge but actually that is another bridge, Tower Bridge is next to the Tower of London, and both are a must visit
Loved it. Very cool!!! Loved the glass floor that looked on the bridge. Everyone was super nice and helpful. The bridge was incredible.
Great without paying for tour.. Don't bother with the tour. Line of site is blocked by structure and it's very quick for the money. Just walk by for free, or get a great view from the boat tour.

Definitely do the Tower Bridge Experience. We loved looking at the Tower Bridge and spent quite a lot of time there taking photos. On our London Pass we had free entry to the Tower Bridge Experience which we thoroughly enjoyed. It had videos and loads of information about the history and construction of the bridge and even had some glass walkways. It's a must do especially if you have the London Pass. Note, there are over 200 stairs to climb but there is a lift available as well. Just ask the lovely staff.
Stunning. Very beautiful site and must for your "London" shot. It was a nice walk along the Thames and great structure to see in person at the foot of the bridge. I would highly recommend this place.

Interesting but not fantastic. Having lived in London for a year already I was a bit underwhelmed with the Tower Bridge climb. It was fairly cheap and on a Sunday morning it wasn't too busy, but it's a view that you could see lots of other places in London. Having seen some pictures that other people had taken, I was under the impression that most of the walkway would be glass, but only a small section of it was glass.I think Tower Bridge is beautiful and walking across the bridge (along the road) gives you a nice view of the Thames and the bridge itself.
Great view. The Bridge gives you a great view of the Thames and of London. It also allows you to see what went into building it.

Great exhibition on top of iconic landmark. Tower Bridge is a must see iconic landmark on any visit to London. However, you can make the trip really worthwhile by spending the 9 pounds or so that it costs to get access to the walkway over the top of the bridge plus the exhibition of the engine room that powers the bridge. The view from the top of the bridge is great both ways and there is a very cool glass floored section that lets you see the river and bridge below you.Not too much to do for less than a tenner in London. Great way to spend an hour or so.

Stunning!. Surely the most stunning bridge in London, if not anywhere.Very interesting learning about the history and how it was built.The glass walk way gives you a very different perspective (if a little scary) on the view.Enjoyed by the whole family from 6 yr old to me (39).Brilliant couple of hours.

Walk the Thames and learn.. This is a great place to take the family when visiting London.
