Its educational, thrilling to walk the glassed routeway above the Thames, fantastic views and you can marvel at the stunning engines in the steam room. Its 2 for1 when showing a national rail ticket. Great value. I also recommend finishing off the visit with a cuppa or a viewing on HMS Belfast. A great photo vantage poit of Tower Bridge.

WOW - Experience for everyone. Perfect walk from Big Ben, on this right side of Thames. You can see a lot modern and historical monuments while walking to Tower Bridge and Tower Bridge is interesting and fascinating! WOW

A must visit icon. If you book on line, and print your tickets, you can get them cheaper and you walk past the queues. You will have ALL your bags searched and have the contents emptied on to a table. This is a really slow process. The Towers look big from the outside but are huge inside. The steel structure is immense and open to see the workings. Wide stairs take you up to the viewing walkways, these have glass floors half way along. There is a lot of information but often where people pass so it is difficult to read. The graphics are very good but again is spoilt by people walking in front of the screens. You can also see the old steam engines in the basement of the south side tower. This is an interesting visit for anyone but at the end we still did not know how the original steam engines worked the cantilever roadways. To some extent the information was over complicated and became tedious and slightly boring.

An evening treat. Staying just near here at the Tower Hotel. Very romantic to stroll across in the evening when it is all lit up! I did not pay the fee to see the exhibit on the upper level (just didn't seem worth it)

Incredibly Beautiful . I loved looking at this bridge as I walked across it. The intricate designs of the towers are truly gorgeous and yet majestic. A very beautiful scenery as you cross the bridge especially in the direction toward the London Tower.

Worth a visit. The bridge is nice from outside but is better from inside. If you pay to go to the top you can see river Thames and London from a spectacular view. But the most attractive thing for me was the museum inside where you can see the history and how the mechanisms of bridge were working. It is very interesting and I recommend it for every people but especially for persons who like technology.

Iconic Bridge. It's definitely worth visiting the area around the bridge on any trip to London. If you're lucky, you'll even see it raise! I also enjoyed paying for the experience going up the bridge, which had a bit of a queue to take the lift up but went relatively quickly. Up top is a short film on the history of the bridge and a cool path with a glass floor allowing you to look down. After descending on the south side, the ticket also allows for a tour of the old steam rooms.
beautiful landmark. Visited this landmark and it was beautiful, walked over the bridge and looked over the river Thames. Looks beautiful at night as its all lit up.
Out of this world. Fantastic my advice would be to try and get there for when the bridge opens once in a life time experience
The Towering Majestic Bridge. we crossed the bridge and admired its quite unique architecture - its an amazing site and well worth a visit - you can see all the way up the Thames from it

Must visit. Visited London and wanted to make this a place to see. Looks more impressive on a night when all lit up by the river and having a cocktail overlooking it. Didn't go to the exhibition but well worth a trip to see from the outside. Great architecture and a must see.

Loved the glass floor. I did this experience with my son. He found the mechanics of the bridge fascinating. He wasn't too keen on the glass floor but I did eventually get him to stand on it and look down. All the photos of the different bridges from around the world were interesting.Standing on the glass floor and watching the traffic pass beneath you on the bridge was a very strange feeling.
well worth seeing. every visit to London England should include a visit to the tower bridge, its a great site and well worth seeing

The New Walkway is great. We recently went up the top where there is a new glass bottom walkway. It's much better than ground level which is a big smokey from the cars and crowded. My kids ((9,7,5,1) loved the glass bottom- bit worrying having a toddler bouncing up and down on the glass but the whole environment is safe feeling and wasn't too busy when I went (bet it gets busier though at peak times). Basically lots of people sprawl over the glass taking selfies.Some people walk around the edge rather than stand on the glass- you can do that. Lots of info up there and places to sit and chill.I liked it up there too. It is surprisingly high up (really!) and offers really good views both ways. I have been up the Shard to the top (really good on a clear day but super pricey) and still thought the view up here was pretty enjoyable. It is also very reasonably priced compared to other high experiences in London (I'd recommend over the London Eye for example which is over priced and over rated and huge Qs). Little in the way of stuff to do up the top of the Tower other than enjoy the views of the river and surrounding. What is interesting is to see the engine rooms (same ticket) which are at the foot of the bridge south side...if you're an engineer then you'll love it. These are the old original engines. You can't see today's engines. It's probably an hour in total - it's enclosed and warm- and maybe best mixed with a trip in the Tower or a walk along the South Bank.
Tower Bridge. Its a short nice walk from Tower of London to Tower Bridge along the river. lots of nice small shops along the way. Relaxing.
Excellent. Yes excellent, cos I saw it open and close my first time there. Have everything on tape and it was an amazing sight.To think this bridge is more than 100 years old.(121 years old now).

A bridge that folds up. For what it is (a bridge) it's quite extraordinary. It is beautifully designed with intricate detail. It was quite a revolutionary design for it's time as it can fold up to make way for ships passing underneath it.Go and have a look and view London from the middle of the river. If you are lucky a ship will come through when the bridge is drawn.Some nice views of the Tower of London.Definitely worth a visit.

Great outing . This place was my first project at university to understand the engineering behind this bridge. It's only fair that I took my son and nephews to this place, always awesome and fascinating, try the walkway, the engine rooms etc....museum! Overall you won't be disappointed at all though it may be pricey if are a big family or large group but then again London is always expensive! Enjoy the experience of a birds eye view of London.

Glad I did!. One of my good mates said, "Go do the Tower Bridge-it's awesome!"It was worth it, if nothing else, for the view from the top, and the look at how the bridge actually was designed to work. Some of the displays were a bit of a throw back in time, but you certainly gained a good understanding of the history of the bridge, and what it was about.I didn't get to see anyone with the Keys of the City exercise their rite to run sheep across it, but given the richness of historic attractions (and the new City Hall nearby) it was certainly worth the money and time.

Worth doing once. We visited with some Australian friends and they children a few weeks ago and throughly enjoyed the whole experience. The kids loved the glass floor. Please note that you can only enter and exit and the southern side of the bridge. Try and time your visit with a bridge lift.

One of the World's Iconic Bridges. Okay, so my girlfriend and I enjoy walking across famous bridges. It's one of our things when we go traveling. We've traversed the Golden Gate, Brooklyn, Capilano Suspension Bridge, Bridge of Sighs, Rialto, pretty much every bridge between Paris' Left and Right Bank between the Eiffel Tower and the Marais, a few in Kyoto and Osaka, Chain and Liberty Bridges (Budapest), Charles Bridge (Prague), London Bridge, Millennium Bridge, etc, etc, etc. We just go looking for cool bridges to walk across when we visit a place. So, how can you go to London and not cross the Tower Bridge? I mean it seems that every single movie you see where London is the location, you get the gratuitous shot of Tower Bridge. Anyway, if you like walking and want to check out Southwark and the London that's on the other side of the Thames from where most tourists seem to go, cross over the Tower Bridge, head out over the bridge, walk along the embankment, have lunch at Borough Market, cross over Millennium Bridge. Just make a day of it if you can, particularly on a weekend day when the City seems to be less crowded. It's great to see and be part of history.
Worth a quick walk across. We didn't pay to walk up to the top but we didn't really see the reason for it since the walk across was just fine on the bridge with some great views.

Tower to visit in London. I went to a meeting and just found myself at one side of the river where I had a large view of the Tower Bridge. I was really happy to find how its architecture is a 'wonderful art'.
Ok, but not terribly exciting. I think it is better to look at than actually go in. The exhibition was a bit geeky but ok for a rainy day. Not sure kids would really enjoy it that much.
Great!. I went by night and it looked really nice with all the lights and with the river, its also a must. i didn't go by day but i imagined that also look really nice

Different views. Love this bridge. The architecture, location and history make it special. We saw this bridge from a boat tour, from the Tower of London and we walked across it. I love the Golden Gate Bridge. This is special in a different ,personal yet historic way.

The Tower Bridge is awesome. I had one of the best times here. But make sure you can climb the stairs and you have the London Pass. You shoot past all the lines if you do. The history is great and the climb up was fun but a whole lot of climbing. I stopped once to rest. Once at the top the views are amazing and the glass floors down to the cars crossing the bridge were great. This is a must do.

Iconic structure. Very often mistaken from the London bridge, but this is the Tower bridge. It is within walking distance from the Tower of London, and included in the London Pass, so why not. There is glass floor on bridge for you to see down to the river and take pictures, of course. You can take the elevator up and walk the stairs down.

Incredible Architectural Feat. The Tower Bridge is just an incredible and imposing structure. It took over eight years to build and has stood for over 120 years, bearing the brunt of tens of millions of vehicles and pedestrians each year. You cannot really appreciate just how large and how awe-inspiring it is until you walk across it. Give yourself plenty of time to do so, though.

Glass Walkway!. I'm afraid of heights so the glass floor gave me the "willies"!!! One of my great grandfathers helped construct Tower Bridge so the place has a personal significance for me. Thoroughly enjoyed my visit but be ready for stairs... lots of them.
great vist. Did the railway 2 for 1 so this was good value for money does not take long and it is interesting.Loved the glass walkway.Worth a vist.
London landmark. This is a landmark and stands out in London so I will not give it any less than a five. You can stand and watch the tourists and boat life.
Beautiful. Definetively a must when visiting London! As seen in tons of movies, a mythical place already! Just walk it and get to the tower of London :)
very impressive. One of the reasons you come to london. We walked across it several times and even took the tour boat underneath it.
Must Goo for all visitors !!. This place is so damn amazing & lively as always. I always visit this place when i visit london and stroll around the thames river. n tower bridge..Feels refreshed!!!
Fun visit. Tower Bridge visit was fun and informative. My girlfriend and I loved the views from above, pics were great!! The London Pass got us fast access which made the experience even better.
Amazing structure. We went under and over this bridge today, much better view from the water! also you are not pestered by the con artists on the bridge!
An interesting walk across the River Thames. Odd that this bridge really is not historical, but has been built to blend with the Tower of London.
Beautifull sunrise above iconic tower brigde. Went to the Thames with sunrise to make a picture from the iconic Tower Bridge. Tip for photo lovers: make a picture on the London Bridge.

A little bit of history. Everyone should do the Tower Bridge experience with the glass floor down to see the cars and then down to the engine rooms to see how this magnificent piece of architecture works. (Visit) April 2014)
What can I say about this?. It's a must see. Simply thè most recognisable bridge in the world. What idiot could say it's not exciting to see?
Beautiful to see from close. Nice view not just of the city but the towers themselves. The bridge looks really nice from up close. Can skip if short of time though.
Must walk over. Stunning bridge with beautiful views. Must walk over on a sunny day. The detail is amazing. Make sure you have your camera. There is nothing else like it in the world.
Historic . Great place to visit as there plenty things around to choose from. Lovely views and steeped in history.
Unique bridge. The Tower Bridge is a fascinating site to see and I'd recommend that anyone in the area swing. I visited in Nov 2015.

Worlds most beautiful bridge. The world has many beautiful bridges but this is by far my most favorite. It looks beautiful during the day and night. There is also so much to do around it. Find St. Katharine Docks a secret marina just a short walk from Tower Bridge. You will find excellent bars , cafes and restaurants there.
worth a visti. step over the bridge and wait for it to open... a bit of past in a 2 hours visit ... Good! especially the engine room

Awe inspiring . My Wife and I crossed the bridge many times on our two trips to London and it never fails to Amaze me. So much history, so much beauty. It really is a Wonderful Piece of Historical Architecture.

Glass Floor. Best part was the glass floor. It is unnerving standing on it though. Well I thought so. Other than that not a lot going on. Some history on the building of it etc and the walk up the steps to the top was knackering but wasn't overly expensive so worth a visit.

Take the tour to the top!. Prepare to climb a LOT of stairs but it is worth it when you get to the top. You will have gorgeous views of the Thames, and the chance to walk on the glass floor if you dare! There is a lot of information about the history of the tower and attendants who will answer any questions you have.
A Must See. One of the iconic landmark of London. If you do not visit on this landmark, London is half done. Many other landmarks like Tower of London are nearby attractions.

Exterior is beautiful. You can skip the experience inside.. It's not as pricey to do the Tower Bridge Experience where you head up inside the tower and view the lower bridge thru glass. There's nothing else to do up there though. We skipped the engine tour was well though it was included in the entrance fee.TIP:Skip the Tower Bridge Experience and opt instead to appreciate the Tower Bridge from the banks.

A towering London icon. I first began to appreciate the technical marvels of this Victorian structure over forty years ago as an aspiring student of Civil Engineering. Now that I have finally seen it for myself it is all I imagined and more. A trip to the old engine room, just past the South Tower, is not to be missed. It is here that you can view the beautifully maintained steam engines, furnaces and accumulators that were once used in raising the moveable roadways at the bridge’s centre. (These days the task is all done by electric motors). On the bridge itself visitor's can ascend the towers, via stairs or lifts, to high level walkways spanning the river and roadway below. There are great vista's from up here, including a view downwards through a glass floor. Some helpful audio visuals are also strategically placed to help with an understanding of the bridges history and construction.

The monument of London. Tower bridge is the most popular and most visited bridge in the town of London. You can take the photis you can go on the top of the bridge or go accros thos bridge and see the romavtic part of the river Themes. Tower bridge is on of the attraction in London you have to visit. Is part of history and nowdays of this town.
Iconic. This bridge is an iconic part of the London skyline. Depending on when you visit, the bridge can be seen raising to allow a boat through the bridge. The place is great!
Stunning. As this is one of the most famous bridges in the world, it definitely lives up to the hype! See Tower Bridge at night and it will be something you never forget!

Beautiful . On a brilliant day this offers on the best views of London. A few down to Canary Wharf and then across back to the city and south bank. At weekends it can become crowded with tourists!Night time it illuminates the sky!

A great view of the city!. We enjoyed the Tower Bridge Experience.There are A LOT of steps to climb so you would need to be prepared for this when visiting.The views are lovely and the walkthroughs have lots of history about the creation of the bridge.The glass floor is at the centre of the walkway. There is a foot of non-glass floor around the edge if you are like me and not brave enough to walk over it! But you can still get some great photos and experience it by just looking over and through the glass. The views are lovely of the thames and along the river. Stretching up towards the city and down towards Greenwich. A great way to view london.Don't forget the engine rooms too. These hold the 2 main pumps that were used as well as the steam room where the power was held. Very informative and educational.

YOU MUST NOT VISIT LONDON AND NOT VISIT, MEMORABLE.. We spent time looking at various times of the day, stunning at sunrise looking downriver. Just magnificent impressive fantastic words do not really describe the aura surrounding Tower Bridge. What a landmark.

Romantic London. Walking along the Thames and crossing the bride, in my opinion, is one of the most romantic things to do in London. The architecture is amazing. By day or night - your not gonna regret spending time here.
Is falling down. Not. If ever you are in London you must make your way by tube to see this building / bridge. It's iconic from a distance but close up its even better.

Mesmerizing!. Many of the tourists don't know that this isn't the London Bridge. Even I wasn't in the the know how about the difference in London Bridge and the Tower Bridge till I visited it myself.
A must visit place in London! Best way to enjoy its beauty is travelling through the Thames River cruise.
Recommended highly if visiting London.

Towering over most exhibitions. To go into and over one of the most iconic bridges in the world is a fantastic experience ,Lots of great information and a very helpful and friendly staff , it is very easy to find infact it would be very hard to miss . the glass floor at the top of the bridge that you can walk over is very thrilling of course you don't have to walk on the glass floor if your a little afraid of heights there is a path either side ,for me and many other tourists it was a must for the photos , there is also great views from up there and cheap at the price

Not for the faint hearted!. Well worth a visit are the high level walkways on Tower Bridge, fantastic views and the exhibition is extremely enlightening regarding the building of this famous bridge. The glass floor gives an amazing sight below, it is not compulsory to walk on it!! Breathtaking....

Pretty, especially at night. Enjoyed walking along the River Thames and crossing Tower Bridge. Although it is always very crowded with tourists, it still is worth the visit for the architecture. I recommend walking along it at night, when its less busy and lit up.

Lots of steps but love walking on glass!. Fascinating insight, but hate it when you are channeled through a shop; the child sticker passport is great, but do you really have to have the final sticker pack in the shop? Walking on glass was great fun, and loads of people taking pictures, but lots of good humour and strangers helping each other :-). Great views each way and down!

The song " London bridge is falling down " which give very impression for this fabulous one.. (London is one of my favorite city ,went there twice already ,I rent a bike at night,in order to see night views of the bridge ,ha but it's unfortunately raining during the way so just went back at another day of day time.)最愛的城市之一,去了兩次2012.2015 騎著租的腳踏車(建議還是不要在市區騎腳踏車,哇危險^0^) 晚上快9點一個人,騎在附近,看著這座美麗的橋,可惜當天晚上突然下起小雨來,哈哈,好詩情畫意啊^0^ 為了這座世界著名的倫敦橋,只好隔天白天再去一趟
Beautiful. Sad it was rainy when i go never have chance to glass walkway. But the evening light up of the bridge make it look awesome on photo taking.

Very interesting. A great landmark, loads of information & lots to see, from the top walkway (Glass walkway is a real experience) to the basement engine room, take time to read the information that is very well explained, take in the views from both sides, it's great ( one of the best views of HMS BELFAST) also, check on website for times an dates of bridge opening, it's a real spectacular, so try to time your visit to witness this. Please be aware one lift in one side of tower bridge not working and it's over 200 steps to walk up !! You could of course cross road to other side of bridge & use lift there. End your visit with a cruise down the Thames to Greenwich or Thames Barrier, another very reasonabley priced excursion
a sight for sore eyes.. beautiful architecture. you can visit inside to see the engineering side of the bridge but for me I loved to see it lit up at night
Gorgeous. Many people think that Tower Bridge is called London Bridge - it isn't. London Bridge is a boring one nearby. Tower Bridge is really stunning to look at.
Iconic London bridge. Tower bridge is a beautiful brige, you get a great view of the thames and also some of the iconic new buildings in London like the shard and the Gherkin.

The glass walkway makes this special. An interesting visit. It could be a bit dull, apart from the great views of the Thames, but the addition of the glass walkway is inspired and provides a new perspective. The information about other famous bridges means there is plenty to see. A visit for all the family.

Take the bridge exhibition for amazing views and walk into history. Purchased the joint ticket which covers both the Tower Bridge Exhibition and Monument.Tower Bridge was by far the highlight, a real London icon. The exhibition covers the history and construction of the bridge and gives a real sense of the inventiveness of Victorian engineers. It then covers some of the history of London over the time of the bridge and you can even visit the engine room.All of this is added to the wonderful and unique views you get from the top walkway.
Thames River views. Truly a remarkable bridge with amazing architecture. Views of the Thames River from all directions. Highly recommended.

A piece of art.. Take your time to visit it inside and walk by outside. This isn´t just a bridge over the Thames, but a piece of engineering and architecture art. Tickets are sold on a shop in a gallery down the south side; there is a painted line in the bridge´s sidewalk, follow it to get your tickets.
beautiful sight. Such an amazing piece of architecture. A must see if you are in London. Great place to take lots of pictures.

Don't mix it up with 'London Bridge'. This Old bridge is a must visit place when you are London if you are not planning to avoid visiting one of the famous 'ICONs' of London. It is just beside the 'Tower of London' and you can walk along the bank of 'Thames' river with your loved one with a nice view. It is stunning during both day and night. They have a Chamber in the bridge with glass floor in which you can observe people and vehicles under you going through the bridge. But you have to pay GBP 7. Otherwise just passing through the bridge and taking some photos are absolutely free.
wonderful. Beautiful landmark. Good to see in all weathers and times of day. Breathtaking. Looks really good in pictures .

Excellent museum of Victorian engineering. Igçf you really enjoy the understanding of how things works, this is teh place to visit. If you understand technology as a late twentieth century thing, you wil not enjoy this.
Fun for a walk. Really neat architecture.. Worth the walk across it for the views. Walked from south bank to the Tower of London and all around that area.

Walking over top of Tower Bridge. We booked on the Tower Bridge Exhibition using the 2 for 1 prices as we'd travelled by train. We went on a Tuesday, and did not have to queue to get in. There are 200 steps up the inside of the Tower which are a bit of a challenge! (There IS apparently a lift available but from a different place to the main entrance). Once we had climbed the steps there was a historical exhibition, on the top level. Then we walked across the top from one tower to the other. Half way along the corridor there were glass floor panels which were great but, a little un-nerving, when we stood in the middle of them. At that point you realise how high up you are! Then we went down the other tower and into the engine rooms and a large exhibition (a little bit further along the footpath). The "exhibition/working museum" was very interesting, and we learnt about the engineering needed when the bridge was built. They had a gift shop, selling quite nice souvenirs. A good experience and place to visit when in London, and very reasonably priced if you get the 2 for 1 prices deal. Also ideal for rainy days.
Nice view. It was a very good experience watching the Tower Bridge.The view was very good. We went there at night and it was good place to go to.

Interesting tour and views. I had to take this tour, I love buildings and technology. This is a fun tour with some great views looking straight down on the road deck (with glass floors so you can see and also take selfies). There are great views of the surrounding area (such as the HMS Belfast). You get to see the structure inside the towers, which is quite interesting, as well as the old steam system that was used to raise and lower the bridge. I found this to be a very fun tour.

Remarkable Walk across a historical bridge. Already, seeing this bridge from afar is impressive, but walking across it, one is awestruck with the intricacies of it's design. Often mistaken for London Bridge (nearby), this is a must see when visiting London
It's worth a walk across!. Great views looking in each direction. Also, there is an historic visit to the towers during hours of opening.
A must do activity. I enjoyed my time visiting the Tower Bridge and learning about the history associated with it including how it was built. This is a good 2-3 hour activity.
Birthday visit. Had a fab time here, the glass floor walk was great - weird watching the snow blow underneath you !!! Very interesting about the construction and the Engine Rooms too!!

Tower Bridge. I see Tower Bridge everyday but it always inspires me. An amazing piece of architecture. It can be seen from the north side by the Tower of London and by the hotel as well as from the south side next to the Mayor's building. There is also another view from Shad Thames but lots of tourists miss this view. I once had a private dining experience in the building which was amazing. Great place to visit and to walk across.

Its just a bridge that opens to be seen by tourists. If you have a London Pass, I think you should visit this, but if not you probably will want to save your money in other places... The best part is being at the top and look down by the glass windows...
a must see. brilliant, avoid if heights is not your thing though !! centrally located with tube stations very close and gives a brilliant view across the thames

Fascinating. A London icon not to be missed.It is set against the most amazing backdrop, of new London, with the outstanding modern buildings and old London, The Tower of London and of course the River Thames. History is standing there in front of you. The views all around are excellent. It is quite something that so many people from all over the world are here ,now ,all to see this iconic building.
Fabulous architecture. What a beautiful bridge we visited during the day and also in the evening when it was lit up. Beautiful structure.
Wow. Well. Having spent the £9 to get in... I then spent the next half hour trying to get enough courage to walk on the glass floor... Glad I did....
Any visitor needs to stroll across this bridge at least once. Any visitor to London needs to stroll across this bridge as it is a British Icon with loads of character.

Great views. The tour takes you into the bridge and across both walkways, you can stand above the Thames on a glass walkway which will be a test if you don't have a head for heights. Worth a visit, take the stairs up very slowly....getting to the top can feel like a trip to an exercise bootcamp!
Really good attraction. This is a really good attraction. Its really worth paying to go up and they have this glass floors so you can see beneath you and take some cool pictures.

Great views. I wasn't aware that tourists could go inside Tower Bridge until recently, so my partner and I visited last week. We looked at photographs and videos showing the history of how the bridge was built, really interesting. We walked across the glass walkways which provide amazing views of the road and people below - I'm ok with heights but even I was a little hesitant at first! It was an amazing experience. Then we went to the engine rooms to see how it was all powered years ago. I purchased my experience together with a London Eye flight online, great value for money.
Beautiful tower. I walked and saw many times this beautiful tower unique in the worldIf you saw it you know youre in London

Nice to be at that place . Everyone has seen the bridge in many movies or documentaries. So it is nice to really see this bridge which has a special architecture and looks way more massive when you drive trough.

A London Must. This London symbol is architectually gorgeous and an overall beautiful landmark. For a fee the Tower Bridge exhibition allows you to have panoramic views from high level walkways. It's only a short walk from the underground, right beside the Tower of London and has a small gift shop attached. Being here, on this bridge as double-decker buses drove by me was the moment when I truly fell in love with London. This is a must if you're in the city. You don't need to spent a significant amount of time here but you can't miss it.If you can, you should also experience it at night when it's lit up. I had the wonderful opportunity of seeing it when it was pink in celebration of Princess Charlotte's birth.
Wow. This was awesome tourist site. Loved the pictures we were able to take. It was very larger than life to see.

Brilliant views. The glass floor is amazing, such a brilliant experience. Daughter loved it and also enjoyed learning about how and when the fantastic bridge was built. £9 for an adult is very good for London as well.
Iconic!. Such an iconic bridge - definitely try to cross it next time you're in London as it offers spectacular views of the city!

Highlight of weekend . Never visited as daughter in a wheelchair so assumed not accessible. However will take daughter next time as there is a lift. Great walking over glass floor to bridge below. Well priced souvenir photo at £3. Recommend.

Must see!. Tower bridge is one of the icons of London and doesn't fail to impress. At night it is lit up and makes amazing photos. We didn't do the tour, just went over and took some photos. One thing to watch out for is the scammers that show u a cup trick ;0(
History alive . Was viewing it from cruise but a nice experience. ..live comments on cruise about Tower Bridge, Westminster Bridge and London Bridge was so informative
Interesting. I was really surprised that you can actually walk along the top of the bridge! Very interesting and worth checking out!

Too expensive. This symbol of London is in a walking distance from my hotel so I visited its right from the first day in London. The glass sky way is thrilling, very memorable place. But the price is super expensive, 20 pounds if I remember right.
Nice to see, not much to do. Went to a business trip to london. The bridge, of course, is beautiful, but there is nothing much to fo, so 4 stars from me :)

Fabulous. Bought a combined ticket for this and the Monument to the fire of London which I thought was really good value.Lovely views from the top of the towers & the walkways.Shame about the signage as it was a bit confusing at times (not clear that the 2nd walkway was not a thoroughfare & also having to switch from stairs to the lift on the way back down).

A London Must. Everyone goes here if they can. Close to other attractions. Suggest you go in the afternoon to get the best light. On the South side of the bridge is Potters Field Park a great place for taking pictures and also a place to rest with a coffee or tea.
Wonderful time. Spent time walking on the bridge.We also able to see the opening of the bridge and ship passing through the bridge. Nice experience and look location for any tourist not be missed.
a must in london. Very nice place. it worth it a quick visit. A must see, very popular. It will take you just a few minutes to see it, take some pictures and cross it :)
An apology . I walk across this bridge twice a day on the way to work and on the way back. I must have been in hundreds of tourist photos, sorry!
Beautiful tower . Really cute and beautiful, you can cross from one side to the other and enjoy the views of the river and the city.
Tremenfous. Awesome world class landmark. Lit up at night which is spectacular. Great views of the city from the bridge and one of the most famous London sights

Awsome. This has to be the most iconic piece of construction in London. Well worth the two-hundred steps to the walkway. Fantastic view over the Thames in all directions. loved the glass walkway with views of the River and road underneath. The team that work there are very knowledgeable and will answer any questions you throw at them. There are stations that tell you how the bridge was built how long it took and how many workers worked on it. Well worth the visit.

Ok. We have visited before so maybe knowing what to expect took the shine away. They have changed the exhibition show to a poor quality video.. Managed to get 2 for 1 tickets so only 10.00 for two.. The glass walkways are good.
A Must See. You know you're in London when you stand and gaze at the bridge. Then it's off to the Tower of London and the experience is complete

Iconic. Magnificent piece of construction. This one is the iconic bridge over Thames, though the river has many bridges connecting the banks. your visit to London is incomplete if you have not visited the Tower Bridge. Special view is to watch the bridge opening up while a ship moves though the central portion. Walking on the bridge is a great experience. They have an exhibition there, but i did not find it interesting.

Fun but expensive . I would say that the only that really caught my attention was the glass floor. There wasn't so much to see for the money I payed ( even with discount). There were just some basic facts like for example who made the bridge, when was it built and etc.

The glass walkway was the best bit.... As the title says, the glass walkway was the best bit... The rest wasn't that interesting if I'm honest but I'd say its still worth doing considering its only £9
