Good for the price. After spending £111 for the 4 of us to go up the shard, this fealt like a bargain. £20 approx. The glass floor is a good experience, well worth the visit. And you can around the engine rooms too.

Phenomenal bridge. Didn't do the attraction itself but just walking across this iconic bridge was a pleasurable.
Lots of tourists (taking selfies) but a great vibe around the bridge and area.
A must see. you can't visit London England without viewing the London bridge - worthwhile to walk across to get a good view of the river Thames

unique and interesting. very interesting. we climbed to the bridge. the exhibision there is interesting and the view was beautiful despite a rainy hour and grey colors. i did not find the engine room so exciting except some art works at the end of the trail. from there we went to hms belfast - an absolute must.

Walking on the tower bridge . On a nice sunny day it's a beautiful walk ...The views are stunning. Especially at sunset ... On the one side of the bridge is Shard Thames and on the other Tower of London. There are some nice areas on the shard Thames side - Bermondsey High Street .... Nice bars and pubs.. Good food. Beyond the Tower of London is the city of london. Again lots of action in the afternoon ...
Awesome Attraction. I might be slightly biased as I'm from London originally but when you see the grandeur of this bridge and the way it was built is stunning!
Take a walk for breathtaking views!. The bridge itself is beautiful, and the walk across it is easy. You can see so many famous landmarks from it and the photo opportunities are wonderful.

Good to combine with other nearby sights. Worth combining this sight with the London Eye or Tower of London. Check the schedule to see the bridge raised (twice a day). The upper portion has a plexiglass floor that you can walk across. Fascinating for anyone who enjoys how things are built.

Tower Bridge Tour. A great wee tour for the money....love the glass walkway over The Thames & my husband enjoyed seeing the engine rooms....good for families, singles or couples & not too expensive for London

Iconic must see location.. You hear about all of these locations but until you actually see them in person you don't really understand the stature of the place. As much as it's just a 'bridge' it is certainly an iconic must see visit.

Fascinating insight. Never realised you could tour around this, but a family member told us to visit this attraction, fantastic, especially the glass plate walkway, yikes, fab views and very insightful
Fun.. Good value for money in London. A fun way to see London below through the glass floor. Lots of steps, but lifts available if needed.

Do not miss the Victorian Engine Room. When you first are in this part of London, do not miss Tower Bridge. The spectacular glass floor makes it tickle in the stomach. When you first are at Tower bridge you must see the Victorian Engine Room located a few minutes walk from the South Tower.
postcard view. its my dream to be on London bridge. i would rather recommend you to walk around and find a good restaurant around the area for a lunch.

Impressive!. We went over the bridge on the way to The Tower. Considering it's historical value it is an impressive building. Be sure to tak some pictures from the embankement to make it just. Possiblities to get up in the highest part of it aswell, recommended.

Must Cross!. We crossed the bridge coming from the Tower of London to enjoy the various shop across the river but the bridge itself is simply amazing. Unfortunately we did not see it open while we were there but it still was impressive.

EXCITING!. It's free and it's fun! It was a treat visiting the bridge, although it looks smaller than depicted, but all the same it was really interesting! You can go up into one of the tower's which is excellent for family's. But just watching the bridges road lift up is a real treat for young and old alike!

Awesome View. Always wanted to see this bridge. We did it as part of the London Pass that we purchased. Went early and avoided crowds. Good tour guides. I would definitely make sure you visit this site as one of the top 10 in London.

Great attraction for children. Took my children to walk across the top of Tower Bridge and was surprised at how good it was. Children loved it and I thought it was excellent value for money.
Children loved the information to read and answering questions on the interactive displays.
Worth a visit if

A wonderful landmark a must see . Just a fabulous British landmark - the bridge itself is beautiful the views of London the shard the tower the river all fantastic. Definitely worth a visit lots to see and do in close proximity
Beautiful . We visited in February 2016 And it was beautiful. It isn't the famous "London Bridge" as many think but it is the tower bridge and beautiful.
Great family trip. Great place to take kids or adults Price reasonable and great displays of famous bridges from around the world A bit scarey at first standing on the glass bridges but well worth it
This is compulsory place to visit in London and you be overwhelm with the structure.. This is nice place to visit and worth the view.Do take the river cruise along the river. Fantastic site seeing.

Weekend trip. Great value for money as most tourist attractions are expensive. We were advised that we would probably be there for 45 minutes. We stayed for nearly 2 hours! The staff were very knowledgeable and the engine rooms were absolutely fascinating. Great for children too.
lovely tower Bridge. amazing and lovely bridge , we had a romantic time in this attraction , we loved being there , so beautiful

Brilliant Visit!. Being British during our recent trip to London, Tower Bridge was a must see for us. The tour was brilliant and very informative telling us how the bridge was built from the amount of materials to the structure. The glass bottom walkway was brilliant and definitely a draw for most of the younger visitors. It is worth saying that if you are visiting London get a London Pass and Oyster card we found them great value for money and the oyster card was a god send!

Good views minus the stairs up to the top. The best views of the London Tower and Bridge come from the walk along the boardwalk leading to the actual famous attraction. Along the way, you can also clearly view the HMS Belfast and the Shard, and if you can make it up the multiple levels of stairs to the glass floored bottoms of the London Tower Bridge tour, then it's worth the visit. Good time indeed and we probably spent about 30 minutes total at the attraction/landmark.

Simply Awesome!. This is Engineering in 1890's!! Unbelievable work, not many countries have done such amazing work. Mostly mistaken as London Bridge though. Was lucky to see the bridge opening twice. Kids loved the views from the glass floor above & I enjoyed visiting the Engine rooms.

Fascinating piece of Architecture. Tower Bride which is just north of London Bridge is probably as famous as anything English. And oddly, I can see why. It is gothic, romantic, imperious, frivolous, and sentimental, all at once. It will keep you spellbound for a minute or five. Take the time and let your childhood imagination take over and travel to those places of your youthful mind. The Tower Bridge will let you.

Bigger then it looks!. Tower bridge is actually bigger then it looks! Best thing to do is to hire Borris bikes (Santander bikes) and ride across. Don't worry it's perfectly safe as the traffic is often slow. Once you reach the other side there is a bike rack so you can return the bike and walk back across for a different experience. To get some good photos it's best to go onto London Bridge which is only a 10 min walk away and you can swing by the shard on your way
Good bridge. Nice lively bridge. Walked a couple of times. Enjoyed strolling and would surely a walk again given a chance
Tower Bridge. Amazing. Absolutely breathtaking and just what you expect to see! The architecture is stunning...I think I spent at least an hour on the bridge just admiring it :)
Mr & Mrs Peacock. Tower Bridge Exhibition & Glass Floor walk.Fairly priced at £9 ppInformativeInterestingTerrifying ha ha.
One of Londons best bridges. Always have to stop by tower bridge on my way through London. A must for most tourists and seasoned travellers alike.
Great for tourists. I really DO love Tower Bridge. I think that every tourist shoudl visit it. It's really amazing bridge. I'm proud.
Good day out. Its one of the places you have to see if visiting London. Even on a day off it it makes good sense to visit the place as it becomes a place we ignore otherwise.

Interesting to see how this iconic building came to be built. We used tesco vouchers to gain entry which made this a good value visit. Gained entrance via the the north tower and a lot of stairs to get to the walkway. We thought the video clips were good as were the posters. The glass walkway is a quirky experience. The engine room near the base of the south tower is worth a visit to see the huge boilers and pumps required to lift the bridge.

View from the top. Did the Tower Bridge experience as part of a sightseeing London weekend. This must feature as part of your tour as it only takes about an hour-hour and half to visit so won't take all your day up, less than a tenner admission, great views from top and glass walkway, very informative and interesting, well worth a visit!

Must See. Simply astounding architecture. The surrounding area is filled with shops and restaurants. The Tower of London area and City Hall on the other side have great views and offer a peaceful and relazing place to just soak up the scenery.

Tower Bridge Exhibition. Reasonable price to go up the towers and see more about the bridge. Also to walk on the glass walkway looking at the traffic below. If lucky you could be there when the bridge goes up for a boat.

The best bridge in the world. I have travelled to many countries but you cannot beat the sight of Tower Bridge. Every time I see it, from whatever angle it is just so magnificent, no better sight in the world.

How lucky can one be to live so close to such an iconic landmark?. And in the world's most exciting city! I wouldn't exchange it for any other city in the world having lived in quite a few. Every time I walked pass it I feel awed by its splendor...

Iconic London Must Do Attraction . Visited Tower Bridge today with my family having last set foot inside probably close to 20 or so years ago. The attraction itself is reasonably priced for entry and the excitement from the kids as we approached was brilliant!The attraction itself when you think about it isn't actually that impressive ... It's literally entry, walk across the walkways and then visit the engine rooms of a bridge. That said, this is probably one of Londons most iconic landmarks and globally recognised so definitely worth a visit.The views are simply second to none and they have positioned Windows around for you to put cameras out of to ensure no reflection interference on the shot ... Nice touch!The interactive bits are a little lame and could do with some work although the glass floor is AMAZING!My kids loved those although even I have to confess at first it was a little weird and queezy stepping into them for the first time.Great fun though and an absolute must, especially if visiting London as a trip.
Fantastic. Absolutely amazing. Wonderful staff very knowledgeable. Customer service brilliant. Highly recommended.

Great Views at the Top. Went here on 23/2/16 with my twin. Thoroughly enjoyed it. The views at the top were stunning. There are 206 steps to get to the top or there is a lift for people who can't walk very far or are in a wheelchair. Well worth the walk. Once up there there is a lot of information not just about Tower Bridge but also bridges in general and other famous types of bridge. Ie Clifton Suspension Bridge. Staff very helpful and pleasant. There is also interactive quizzes and an interactive film showing you how the bridge was made which lasts for 4 minutes and was very enjoyable. Can't wait to go again

Glass Bottom Bridge. Visiting a few times already the very famous Tower Bridge - but never seen the glass path which is - pretty amazing, Pricing is okay, better as Westminster anyway.Next to Big Ben and a few other places, one of the "must see" when visiting London.Btw; the tour is pretty good and informative.

Gorgeous Bridge. It's a good place to see at any time, but I definitely recommend to go at night fall to see the beautiful lights and the Thames view. There are a lot of places to sear for a while and enjoy the view.
Iconic. The iconic Tower bridge of London right in the heart of the city- was fortunate enough to see it open up to allow a ship to pass through.
The two towers standing in the mid of river. Beautiful connection across the river, worth visiting. Take a view from the Cruise or boat from the centre of bridge

Must see while in London. You must make sure you do the bus tour while in London and see all the iconic landmarks. This is a wonderful site to see. If you do a boat tour you can go underneath this well known bridge.

Friends with The Bridge. I have a very interesting relationship with this Bridge so I gotta share it. First time I saw it during my last visit I didn't like it .. I thought - God, and that is what all these pictures are about? Hmm I don't think so. I spent 30 minutes there and then successfully went to the other part of the city. But this time .. it was absolutely different .. I was talking a walk in Shoreditch .. and then the City... and then .. following all signs .. I just walked to the Bridge .. The weather was fabulous, it was sunny and warm .. and Tower Bridge looked so wonderful .. so bright and simple at the same time! my cup of coffee and I enjoyed being there for at least one hour looking at the Bridge and thinking - Jesus, I AM at one of the most famous London attractions now! .. I guess it's all about the right moment. We're friends with that bridge now. Try it too for sure ;)

Interesting but a bit pricey for what you get. The Tower Bridge was neat and had a nice view of London. They added a lot of history to it. I guess I'm not sure what I was expecting, but it was a bit expensive I thought, for what you get. It was 9 euros a person and other than getting some good pictures, it wasn't that exciting. I would say you need no more than an hour or so to see the whole thing, including the engine rooms.

Walk "over" the tower bridg. You get to see a bit about the construction and operation of the bridge on a self guided walking tour. It is quick and takes you up one tower, through the walkway (part of it is glass - you can take pictures and walk around the glass portion if you like), and down the other side.Definitely worth the time. It is free if you have a London Pass.

Brilliant experience, great value for money. We paid online for a family ticket and 2 adults so for 6 of us it was £36.20 which was great value for money for the experience. Our children are 9 and 11. The climb to the top of the stairs (the lift was out or order going up) was not for the feint hearted but it was well worth it. The day was a grey one but the exhibition was interesting and being able to lay on the glass floors was a real experience - the view was great and it was lots of fun. You get to walk on both walkways above the bridge. Fantastic experience - we all enjoyed it.

Great. We were on Tower Bridge tour thanks to London pass. It's good tour with view from the top glass path, connecting both towers. In the evening, Tower Bridge is melt to lights, which is great memory

Excellent exhibition with transparent floor !. While the bridge looks stunning from outside - we also went for the exhibition wherein you can actually walk on the level above the bridge.For lovely views of London - this is a great place ! It was cool to walk on the transparent floor section and see the cars and boats below. Can get a lil crowded - so plan accordingly. There is a fast track option if you have the London pass.
Loved it!. It proved to be a completely awesome experience, absolutely loved the glass floor! Such a beautiful piece of history and a signature of London.

I am a beautiful person. . Thanks for the first time in the UK. A place to must see someone who visit London . I'm not sure if this is a bit of a new window. the only way to get the best way to get the best way to get the best way
Walk across Tower Bridge. No matter the time of day walking across this historic bridge is great for tourists seeking view of the Thames, the Tower and the beautiful bridge itself.
Great view. Fantastic views,well worth seeing. Did not know what to expect but well worth a visit. Abit of a climb so not easy for some people but worth it.
Great view!. A lovely view of expansive London, most of the famous buildings can be seen from here. Beautiful at night also. If you can go here after a night out to watch the sunrise, do.
Requested trip . Requested to visit by my children. Reasonable attraction not too expensive . Daughter particularly enjoyed the glass walk way . Great shop too

Feel the force...... ...of the easterly wind.According to me... Walking across Tower Bridge is more important than swimming with dolphins. And touching a pyramid. How many pyramids have a Pret within 5 minute walk!.The norm side is the historical base of the foundation of the England, aka The Tower of London. It's where almost all tourists aim for. For obvious reasons. The south side is where you really should go. Quirky streets, great old London pubs, gorgeous little cafes, and the Design Museum. You can't get to any of this unless you cross Tower Bridge, on foot. I insist. And get ready to brace the wind. It's worth it.

great must-see experience. a static symbol of London,not only great from the outside but also a great experience from the inside.there is alot of information on how it's build and on the walkbridge there is a glass floor looking down on the street below.the ticket give you passage trough the towers and the engine room. a combination ticket gives you admission to the fire of London monument, about 10 minute walk from the Tower Bridge (recommended)

Stunning bridge. Such an iconic image of London, can't believe I've never visited it before. We sailed under it on the Thames cruise, drive over it on the open top bus and walked over it too. Amazing piece of engineering.

Family trip to see glass floor.. Took our granddaughter to see Tower Bridge with its glass floor. Be aware there are a lot of steps to the bridge part. Once on the bridge, there is a delicious nervousness walking across the glass floor part where you can see people, moving cars and a moving Thames below you! We'll worth the experience though. You then walk a short distance on the outside where the views are great photography opportunities, before going back in on the other side which also has a glass floor part, before going down the other side. Glass is unnoticeably tilted to prevent people below looking up skirts etc! Plenty of historical information around the walks.

One of the best. We greatly enjoyed our visit to the Tower Bridge. The glass floor walkway over the River is breathtaking. Go also to the engine room to understand how bridge was operating in old times.

Though it is not the London Bridge but whenever there, the poem London Bridge is falling down comes to mind. An amazing place, the only of its kind in the world, an openable bridge when ships pass through it and have seen the opening of its 2 parts apart, it is always a fun to be here and would go there everytime I am in London

A landmark that looks best from far. It's a great bridge and considering the time it was built, it is an architectural marvel. However, you can enjoy it's glory from the shores of Towers of London, especially when it's lit up. Again, something not to miss in London.

Superb . I've always loved this bridge since I was a child.
It's majestic, grand and historic
I've been lucky enough to watch it being raised for a passing ship and its a delight to watch
great photograph opportunities here. It's iconic London and well worth the visit

Tower Bridge . This was a great experience! Be ready to climb LOTS of stairs but once you get to the top it's great views. Get a London Pass it allow you to get into lots of places in London including this!
Proposed to my fiance here, amazing spot!. A fine bridge, I wanted somewhere that would be on TV a lot, and, believe me, Tower Bridge is evvvverywhere... Excellent value landmark - cheers London!

Tower Bridge. The most iconic representation of London crosses the Thames right next to the Tower of London and takes you from there to the lesser known 'South London' !! It's twin ramps occasionally open to allow a larger sea going vessel to pass and the times can sometimes be found with careful research on the internet. There is a famous bus driver who once daringly drove his number 78 across the gap in the road as Tower Bridge was opening back in 1952! Recently there have been thick glass panels inserted into the upper walkways and its worth paying a few pounds to look down at the road / river through these from 137 feet above - not for the sqeamish though.There is an alternative! Catch a river clipper from, say, Greenwich and as you dock at the Tower the large, powerful boat slowly passes UNDER the road and you can look UP and see the scared people through the glass panels from below!!Never come to London and miss this most famous of landmarks. Wonderful
Impressive. If you go to London,you should definitely cross this iconic bridge,take its photos from literally everywhere,feel the history and enjoy the beautiful view of it.

London`s famous attraction.. The Tower Bridge and the Tower of London worth a visit by tube, or having booked the London Tour bus pop off for a good time visit to walk around admire it from different angles. Another 100% London attraction.
Awesome. This is a beautiful bridge. I must say while in London. Definitely take a boat cruise down the river Thames for the best photos.

Tower Bridge Tour. This was a very interesting experience - walking over the glass walkway was a strange experience and good photo opportunity. The Engine Room was very interesting especially to my husband who is an engineer himself so was enthralled with the machines etc.

A cool bridge. Knowing nothing of the history I travelled over this on a red hop on hop off bus and it felt really amazing doing so. I can't quite describe the feeling bit it was amazing. One thing to do before you die
OK for the view. This is not the most exciting spot in London. You go up to see the view and that's about it. I would go if you have some extra time but I would not make a special trip.
Beautiful place. It was a beautiful place. I visited first time there and feel like heaven. Definitely i will go again there with my family.
A must. When you go to London you have to visit the tower Bridge. It's probably the most iconic of the bridges in London.

History, technical, beauty. Our kids wanted to visit the tower because it was close to our hotel. Absolutely not disappointed, well maintained, interested by the construction and the glass floor are an awesome experience.
It's a bridge.. Pretty cool bridge. Wouldn't go out my way km visit it but it's worth popping on by if you're in the area.
Gorgeous. Tower bridge is lovely for photos and the history is fascinating. Well worth your time when visiting London.

London Landmark. We drove across the bridge, viewed it from a boat tour, saw it from the Tower of London, and walked across the lower level. Each and every time we enjoyed the sight. It's a stately London Landmark, not to be missed

Lovely Exhibit. Superb informative visit. Beware if you are not using the lift up to the top there are A LOT of steps !!!The glass floor is brilliant but extremley busy so pictures are at a minimum. Top tip from myself would be to visit late afternoon as crowds will be less. The information on different bridges around the world is a nice touch and something different.The engine rooms and gift shop are located at the end of the bridge and can be accessed by following a thin blue line on the bridge itself.The engine room albeit small were not my cup of tea as all information was tecgnical in terms of their operation whoch didn't really appeal to me.Shop was good as were all staff, all in all at £9 a thoroughly enjoyable attraction.

LOvely. It is lovely to see and is cool on any photo. Selfies tourists are near, beware :)
The views from there are beautiful. Maybe some of the best in London
glass floor. It's trilling see the river thru the glass floor, the bridge is piece of engendering, the view is pretty and the kids love it

Interesting. Thank you very much.
This was realy interesting for me and my family. We got a lot of new information about the bridge.

The most famous landmark, perhaps in London. Perhaps the most common landmark amongst the many bridges across the Thames. You'll love the grandness of the structure and make sure you take a walk along the bank. It's awesome.

Unerving walkway. This attraction really falls into two parts, The climb up and walk across the walkway with its slightly unnerving glass section, this bit is what I would describe as an ok tourist thing bearing in mind it is probably the most famous bridge in the world, the views are not much through the ironwork,I should also mention it is quite a climb up the stairs. however the second part, a visit to the Engine rooms is fascinating, not only are the engines in beautifully restored condition the story is well told

What a sight!. When in London Tower Bridge is defiantly a must .It is so much bigger and busier than in TV and pictures. Also the view of the Thames is breath taking and you can capture some fantastic pictures from any point.There is also a good few places to eat and drink whilst in the area.Steve C
It's impressive.... You can see it from a distance and it looks better close up but if you go to the Tower of London it's there right on your doorstep.

a lovely exhibit and view. We almost missed this and I am glad we took the extra time! It was a memorable visit, with interesting informational displays and wonderful views. One can go at one's own pace so an hour is sufficient, though more time could be spent.

Tower didn't appear to be falling!. We had the chance to see the iconic London Bridge, otherwise known as the Tower Bridge, on our last trip to London. It's a beautiful structure with excellent views of the city. Vi was there on a Saturday and it was quite crowded, but able to accommodate the crowds. Beautiful!

Beautiful, historic scenic walk. After many trips to London, we finally walked across Tower Bridge near our hotel. Wonderful walking under such historic arches, and best of all seeing the best views of both sides of the Thames. Lovely boardwalk passing in front of The Tower of London leads up to the Bridge. God, safe pedestrian walks on both sides.
Walk to The Shard. We left the Tower of London to walk to the shard. Obviously chose tower Bridge. Stunning piece of architecture and a fantastic sight to see.

Tower Bridge visit. I would highly recommend the visit to Tower Bridge. The views are spectacular and you can walk along the glass floor at the top of the bridge and watch the traffic going over the bridge. Make sure you also go to the engine rooms definitely worth a visit.
Iconic and free. Not quite one of the seven wonders of the world but a world famous bridge. Fantastic piece of British engineering and beautiful.

Great views. Luckily we had tesco vouchers for this attraction as I felt it was a little expensive......lots of stairs and only one tine lift. Can't imagine what it's like in the summer as it was very busy in February. The highlight for most people is the glass floor through which you can see the bridge and river below. Not good if you have height or water phobias. You can walk around the edge of the glass .An interesting thing to do to kill an hour or so

Impresseive building with a lot of history. We took the tour of the bridge and learned about the history of bridges across River Thames, and Tower Bridge in particular. The tour takes you up to the top of the walk across the river and down to the original machinery in the cellars under the pavement. It was especially fascinating to see the huge hydraulic systems and quite charming the way the machines were painted in bright colours as to celebrate the technology. Our children were intrigued!
Amazing Place!. Really great to see one of the landmarks seen on TV or in movies with your own eyes. Spent a lot of time just looking at the sights. So happy to see!!

Its Tower Bridge, not London Bridge ;). Finally, the place which is so talked of and he place to visit once when u are in the city - Tower Bridge.Its an amazing place and located so perfectly that u wish to just stand there and watch the bridge. It's perfect for photography as well and will get to see loads of tourist around. Not sure about the timings of the bridge to open and close, but definitely a place to visit. I would assume it to much more happening at the time of it opening/closing.You can ho for a tour as well to see how it works and they also have a shop to buy some souvenirs for you to gift your love ones back home. Lots of places around to eat and amazing place yo walk as well.Enjoyy !!
Why can't we make things like this anymore?. I wish I lived in one of the rooms in the tower bridge. Reminds me of a fairy tale. Very well preserved. Readers this is not the London bridge

Interesting and informative. Did a combined ticket offer for the Monument and Tower Bridge. Overall good value for money. Worked out at £32.10 for a family of four + a student to visit both attractions. Tickets valid for 1 week.We visited on a Sunday and was fairly quiet.Glasses walkways mean you can see down to the street/ river below.... excellent for photos!Well organised. Informative and friendly staff. Guide book only £1 which was informative as well as being extremely good value for money.Toilets clean.Small opening windows on the high level walkways meant photos could be taken of the views.Glad we went although once visited, not really any wish to go again. Would recommend.

Walk across it is awesome and on one side is the Tower of London. l love this area of London as the Tower of London is on one side of the River Thames... and you can take a boat trip from here to Westminster see the London Eye
Really fascinating! . Definitely one of the most interesting and fascinating tours that I've done in London, you do need a head for heights if you're planning on standing on the glass floor!
Lovely. We walked across it and got some good photos. It's nice to look at down the river from other bridges

Great Fun!. We visited the Tower Bridge last year and had fun walking over the glass walkway at the top of the bridge.It was a bit unnerving at the beginning, but soon we got used to it.It offers a great vantage point to look at the city and River Thames, plus there is the thrill of being on top of one of the most iconic bridges of the world.There was an exhibition of other bridges of the world.You can choose to climb up the stairs or take the lift.You might have to contend with long queues though.Kids will really enjoy visiting and the ticket prices are comparatively reasonable for London.

The heart of London.. This is not the oldest bridge bet the best looking in my eyes, i have lived in Bermondsey for over 30 years and work on the river so get to see this bridge quite a bit. It always looks different so dont forget to put this down on things to do while in London best views will be on a boat trip #enjoy

Must see when in London!. Just like when you visit New York, you can't return without seeing the Statue of Liberty, similarly when visiting London you have to visit the Tower Bridge! Whilst visiting, I even got the chance to go on a boat across the river Thames, which allowed me and my family to enjoy great views of the tower bridge but all other landmarks in London!! When visiting here, I would recommend visit in a sunny day so you're able to enjoy great views and can take pictures you would be happy with!!!
Really nice walk. Nice walk but very busy with cars and people. I would recommend going if you are in the local area but not if you are far away.
Great view through the glass floor. The que wasn't too long and recommand combination ticket. Eeven a baby crowled over the glass floor.

World famous. Beautiful bridge which is well known all around the globe. It's a beautiful way to take a walk through Thames river - so historical and royal. This bridge is one of the main symbols of London.

Victorian mechanical know-how. The inner workings of the lifting arms is quite interesting. The huge weights involved and the precision engineering required are impressive, even more so when you realize it was done without the aid of calculator or computer. Very close to the Tower of London so many people take in both sights at the same time.
A must see. Amazing piece of engineering with all the beauty and history that comes with it, a must see with great views of the capital.

What a lovely sight!. This bridge is truly an iconic symbol of London. Whether you come for sight seeing or dining, the view is spectacular. The structure of the bridge, its color and the surrounding areas like River thames-- what more could you ask for? It is totally breathtaking.

Excellent place to visit. Visited as a family. Loved the glass floor in the walkway! The engine room was very interesting and the videos informative. Good to see comparisons with other well known bridges.

An iconic landmark and I love it . I don't know if you have a favourite Bridge, but this is definitely mine. Stunning architecture and one of the most photographed things in London. And quite rightly so. If you get a chance to go up to the walkways it's worth it. Even better to see this bridge at night.

Eye treat. Having been in London before I prefer to take a walk from St.Pauls to London Bridge each time and avoid spending on tube(without views) or bus to see the Tower bridge. It only takes about 30 minutes for the whole walk. I prefer the night view over the morning view of Tower bridge. Closest stations: Tower bridge station, London Bridge stationIt is usually safe to roam around.
A Historic Icon. A Must see, and compared to other sites to visit offers great value, doesn't take too long and offer some great views from the top.
Interesting Visit. A very interesting place to visit. I thought the entry price of £9 for adults was very reasonable given the amount of content inside to see, and the superb views from the top.

Magnificent View of the canal . This is one of the must see place in London to visit even for a short bit. Magnificent tower especially at night, and some good walking area nearby, somewhere to enjoy the view of the canal and the boats crossing. Getting there at night is a bit tricky as the route has quite a limited options. We had to walk back quite a long way since we couldn't find a bus and the subway was closed (not sure why, probably because it wAs after 10 PM)

Date day out with hubby. I have always wanted to tour london, and today i have finally been able to be a tourist with my hubby. I would highly recommend this exhibition its a lovely day out, and its very interesting to know the history behind the london tower bridge. I often drive through the tower bridge and have seen the bridge go up and have always wanted to know what happens behind the scenes. Be prepared to walk up lots of flights of stairs when going into the exhibition, but the views were absolutely amazing. Theres lots of history behind it and it was so interesting they have videos to watch of how it was built too. Theres also an area where the floor is glass and u can take some preety cool pictures when you look down you see the traffic going through i loved it. Its a lovely day out for any couples family, i really had a lovely day out they even have a nice little souvenir shop after. Also when you come out you can walk down and theres a few restaurants and a few more shops to browse around in. If you are a tourist theres also a shop that sells souvenir items too. But if you are a londoner then i would also defo recommend to see this sight as it really is interesting to know about the history of your own city. They also have toilets in the tower bridge even when your climbing up those stairs.
Beautiful by night. The tower is impressive during the day but at night with the lights is breathtaking. It's really world a visit and enjoy using it to cross the Thames.
spectacular. Beautiful bridge to walk across,it is breathtaking to see in the flesh,anyone visiting i would reccomend walking over it and not seeing it on a tour bus

Iconic visit. The bridge is very nice and a fun experience. You're passed by so many people making it an enjoyable venture with people selling selfie sticks to those going for a jog. It also is free and gives a good workout.
Go check it out. Nice place, looks great in the evening as it's lit up, and you are 10 away from awesome bars on southbank.

Iconic. We decided to have a walk over Tower Bridge. We did not go into the exhibition, we just walked over it and then back again. There was a guy selling freshly caramelised nuts out of a cart. It was nice to have walk over the bridge and look at the scenery. I wanted to see the bridge lift up but unfortunately that didn’t happen. I can’t imagine it does lift up much these days. This bridge is probably one of the first things you think about when you think of London. It is such an iconic structure.

Could have benefited from more detail on how it all works!. We visited on Friday afternoon. The bridge is beautiful and the views from the top - particularly toward Canary Wharf are stunning. The glass floors on the walk ways were also an interesting diversion! We didn't buy the guide book (we have a shelf load at home gathering dust) on the assumption that there was adequate explanation for how the bridge works around the exhibit. We were, alas, left confused and disappointed - particularly in how the original boilers, steam engines, pumps and 'accumulators' raised and lowered the bridge. The explanation in the engine rooms was very poor. As we were walking around, I thought "not to worry, I'll buy a book in the shop". Double alas, the shop was full of London souvenir toot and very little to grab the attention of a middle aged curious traveller! My advice....buy the guide book and hope it explains more than the exhibit itself.
Day filler. Nice piece of engineering, comprehensive collection of anecdotes, photos and facts and a well preserved engine and pump room. Good venue to pump lots of visitors through.
1st visit. Been to london many times but 1st time inside tower bridge. Well wrth the visit, so much information

Do the tour (£9 each) and walk on glass above the bridge!. Visited yesterday and climbed the many stairs to the upper level and walked on glass above the traffic below, very surreal! (Lifts available for people with mobility concerns). This was a fun experience and the many families around us enjoyed the story telling session (the lady telling the stories was so animated and full of energy she really captivated her audience) and children's activities. The upper level provides great opportunities for taking photos over the Thames as they have little windows that open for your camera.

an icon of london well worth a visit. Very interesting especially finding out how the bridge was built. The glass walkways are fascinating, although if you stand or sit on them for a while, you tend to feel a bit weird when you get off, great experience though and wonderful photographic views.

IMPRESSIVE SIGHT. Tower Bridge is a very impressive combined bascule and suspension bridge and such an iconic symbol of London. The bridge crosses the River Thames.The nearest London Underground tube stations are Tower Hill on the Circle and District lines, London Bridge on the Jubilee and Northern lines and Bermondsey on the Jubilee line. The towers of the bridge houses an exhibition about the history of the bridge and there is also a walkway which provides a panoramic views of the city, this also includes a glass floor section for those that are brave. They offer free open wifi for visitors.
Worth a visit. Was quite a fun tour. We got to walk on the gangways above the bridge. The glass floors were fun. The bridge didn't open while we were there though :-(
Beautiful bridge!. Need I say more? It's a beautiful bridge and makes for good pictures.. but that's all it' really great for. But besides that.. don't miss it when you're in London.

Do the tour, don't just look at it!. An awesome experience, definetly worth taking the tour through it. The bridge itself is lined with bridges and facts from around the world. parts of the bridge are glass viewing panels so you can stand on it and look down at the tiny people and little boats on the river, give yourself a small thrill or make you a bit nauseous. My 11 year old son LOVED the video on the bridge in the second tower, and we both learned quite a lot in the power house at the end.
Love!. We walked across and around this bridge throughout our trip. It is absolutely stunning to see in daylight and especially at night
Lots to see. Perfect place to see London and find out more about the bridge. The glass walk way was busy but still a highlight! Good that there's a few rest points on the way up the stairs.

lovely. The architecture is lovely. It is tiring to get here but it is totally worth it. We took nice photos from afar and then got closer to get another photos. This is one of the places you need to see when you are in London.

What more can you say? It's the Tower Bridge.... Step one, head to the bridge. Step two, look around and see the city. Step three, take some pictures. Step four, head off to the Tower of London or a pub. On and off in 30 minutes. Make sure to get a good view from the walking bridge a little while down the road.

Amazing views. Would recommend.. Lovely views from the walkway and it was lovely to look through the glass floor. You are under cover and the walkways were heated and so it was warm up there. To get to the top we used the steps and there are a lot so make sure you are ok walking up these before you start ( didn't count but sure over 100) ...there is a lift available if needed. We booked online for this attraction and think we saved a couple of pounds, we also did not have to wait in the ticket queue which was big. Worth buying in advance. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend a visit.
beautiful place with amazing buidings. i was on holiday to the UK and i love the scene and atmosphere there, will surely visit there again and surely this time round it will be me and the family

Historic and a glass bottom view . I love tower bridge. My favourite tourist attraction in London. It's beautiful and has an interesting history. Do make the effort to do the glass bottom walk. It's pretty freaky but the view is cool.

Took a Seven Year Old. Took my son to this about a year ago. Easy to get into and good value an excellent way to spend an hour or two and so much more. We learnt about counter weights and lifting and it became obvious that this was exactly right for him. Not too daunting but understandable. You go up in one lift get a shortish presentation then walk across the top part taking in the views as you go; great!
TOWER BRIDGE LONDON. This is quite famous bridge in London. The architecture of bridge very good. we watched it from quite far and the surroundings too are good
iconic. Feels like you are in a movie or back in time. Amazing structure. Fits very well with the London Tower.

Iconic and regal. Either driving through it or sailing beneath it, few shapes evoke "London" like the Tower Bridge. Traffic on it can be crazy during the summer, so if you are driving you may enjoy it for a long time. Fortunately, it is also visible from many other London sites.
Good value, fun trip. The kids really enjoyed the glass walkways over the River, the hubby loved the engine room & old steam engines. Overall this has something for everyone.

Great views, great value.. Tower Bridge is one of those iconic London landmarks that I had not visited before, but should have. Our family (2 adults, 2 children) had spent several days in London and had a few hours to fill before returning home, so we decided to visit Tower Bridge.It cost £20 for a 2+2 family ticket, and the whole experience took a couple of hours. There are quite a few steps to climb initially to reach the top of the North tower, and then you walk across the walkway to the other tower. Part of the walkway is a glass floor, which the children loved (but not the wife so much), and we spent ages on the walkway taking photos of the road/river through the glass floor and of the views along the river of the Shard, Gherkin, St Paul's, etc.You then descend the other tower, exit and walk to the engine rooms (ensure you retain ticket). The engine rooms contain machinery in pristine condition because the bridge roadway is rarely lifted these days (12 Mar, 05 Aug, 17 Sep in 2016).In summary, Tower Bridge is definitely worth a visit because it is an iconic landmark, has great history, great views and is great value.

Love the glass floor!. Well worth a visit, the Tower Bridge Exhibition is not very extensive, but the glass floor over the Thames proved very popular for selfies and people lying on the floor! The Engine Room is fascinating and overall worth doing.

Good for wearing the kids out. Hundreds of stairs to climb and an interesting bridge lesson at the top. The best bit is the new(ish) glass floor - make sure you check out both sides. One has a mirror for that all important selfie with London bus a hundred feet below!

Sunny Sunday Morning . We visited over Valentines weekend and whilst walking around London sight seeing, we walked over Tower Bridge not realising you can go up it! It's a lot cheaper than most of the London attractions and has great views - definitely worth the price! The views are mainly of Canary Wharf, The Shard, The Gherkin and The Tower of London. There is an informative 5minute talk from the staff on the way up in the lift and when you enter the first section of the bridge. The top of the bride is actually enclosed so even if it is raining it would be a good attraction. The glass walk way is the main feature - look down on the passing traffic - IF YOU DARE!When you've climbed down all the stairs you can walk to the end of the bride along the pathway then your ticket includes entry to the engine room when preserved old engines are stored on display. It is very informative and a great attraction for all ages!A hidden gem, as few people seem to know you can go up the tower to cross the bridge.

Amazing view. A must when in London, Tower Bridge has an amazing view over the central part of the city. The floor is see-through so you can watch the cars driving on the bridge. We went there for a private party and it was great, one of the best experiences you can have.

An amazing Victorian structure. This is a behind the scenes tour of London's most iconic bridge, built in 1894. You'll go to the very top and cross those connecting arms. If you're not daunted by the idea you can walk over a glass floor above the Thames and the traffic below. Then you'll go into the very bowels of the foundations and see how this bridge was initially raised and lowered by steam power. A great hour and half.

Always a magical gateway. Everyone knows the Bridge, right? No matter what you want, a stroll from Tower Hill underground, around the Tower of London, then across the Bridge to the Thames-side walkway, take in Shad Thames then along via the Golden Hind, Shakespeare's globe and the Tate Modern, before cruising the Millennium Bridge to St Paul's is perfect for anyone interested in the story of London.If you are lucky enough to be crossing when it raises up, then head for the barriers to get the vertigious experience of a road becoming vertical. The river looks amazing east or west, the views south and north.Head for the Tower Bridge Experience if you want to get inside the guts of it, climb across the uprights and walkways, peer down through the glass floors at pedestrians below, marvel at the engineering and scale. It's exciting, always.I've lived within five minutes of the Bridge for over 20 years and I feel excited every time I see it and walk over it.Classic, iconic: day or night, summer and winter
Nice place. Cracking sights in & around this area. Would highly recommend it to anyone. I visited this place for a dirty weekend with other half and we both throughly enjoyed

One of the trade marks of London. Visited with my family and went to Tower bridge tour also. It's but expensive if you buy ticket at the counter. Better check Online deals or Tesco Clubcard vouchers. About the Tower bridge, here are glass panels inside the first floor of Tower Bridge. Children were really happy to see cars and ships going under their feet. Really a good experience. worth a visit.

Nice to take youngsters. I have toured the bridge 2 times and enjoyed both visits, a place you can take children who will enjoy it.Its a place which you can spend several hours and see great views of the river Thames and the war ship moored close by and watch passing boat going by from the walk way above the bridge. I would recommend it. Can't remember the cost to get in but I thought it was worth it.
amazing views...!!!. Really interesting experience..tiring climbing the stairs though ...upper walkway is superb with glass walkways !
You gotta go once. I know they have the tower bridge experience but we did not do it. It was just fun to walk around the bridge and look at its majestic rise.

Fascinating. A visit to one of London's iconic structures is well worth a visit. To be able to walk along the elevated walways and get an enhanced view of London is good. The highlight is a walk across the transparent section of the walkway; well worth doing.

Great area for sights..!!. Strolled down from our hotel in Liverpool Street about a 15 minute walk and we had a walk around Tower of London and then along up to Tower Bridge great sights and it's a lovely area also easy spend a few hours in this area...!!

Beautiful iconic landmark and stunning view of london!. Love how amazing and picturesque it is but even more that you feel as though you are a part of history whilst walking across it. The view from the bridge itself is pretty amazing. Whilst in the area the family had to walk across it and have a customary photo on the bridge. We had the good fortune of great weather and an equally amazing display from the Royal Air Force who had aircraft in the area. Touristy but worth it!

A fun outing for all the family. We recently took our nephews here, a unique opportunity to view the Thames from the glass floor walkway, the tour takes in the incredible building that took place in 1894 a story told through interactive displays and video. We looked up the opening times of the bridge and timed our visit so the boys could watch the opening to allow a tall ship through. Great fun.

Surprisingly good. My teenage daughter loved this attraction....museum area..machinery for opening bridge but mainly the spectacular view looking down through the glass floor...frightening but apparently cool!!!
Very interesting view. When we went it was very rainy, but still the view was very interesting, there are sometimes food stands setup by the enterance/exits of the bridge.

Not the best view. The tower bridge is more beautiful from the ground level than going up to the observation decks. The glass floor on the upper decks offers a unique and thrilling perspective. However, the bridge structure itself blocks much of the view.

Tower Bridge . One of the most famous landmarks of London. Tower Bridge was once one of the main crossings across the Thames. It was full of life when we visited. Tourists galore, was fortunate enough to see the bridge raise the road surface to let a ship through. A must visit location.

Just a great place to go. So simple to get to and such great views. The place is bustling with tourists but you get great views on either side of the bridge to see he winding thames river . There are also steps that take you down to the embankment were there are other viewing areas or places to sit with the family and rest if nice and warm . People use this area to relax and have food . Great history points to be taken in and also very close to he tower of london and the tube. St Katherine's dock is also next to the bridge where you can get great food and drinks. Well worth the stop off. Watch out for the cars using the bridge and keep a hand on tour kids as the roads becomes full of tourists as well and cars are still using it !
top viewing. its best to go early morning so you can see all the local buildings with there lightson gets busy early with runners/joggers
Nice pic. Its what you expect. It is a nice walk over it towards the castle.Nice in the morning or at sunset to make picture from the riverside.
London . Always so nice to step onto this bridge so famous my daughter starting singing London bridge is falling down falling down Bless so cute age 4 ...

Quite a fancy bridge. Quite a fancy bridge, lights up nicely in evening. been lucky to witness the bridge opening while driving through it.speed limit of 20MPH enforced by average speed cameras so be careful. glad there are barriers to stop tourists from stepping onto the road.

Keep on Running!. My most memorable experiences of Tower Bridge are running across it and past it during 5 London Marathons. A wonderful London icon situated next to the Tower and a plethora of places to dine on the South Bank. Well worth a stroll across, or simply to see it lit up spanning the Thames.

Interesting. We visited the Tower as part of our sightseeing trip. Long queues, but we bypassed this with our London Pass. Lots and lots of steps to climb and unfortunately no one advises you of this, before you set off! But, nonetheless amazing views of London, plenty of information and interesting facts.

Amazing architecture. Due to a tight budget I did not partake in the Tower Bridge experience, in which you can walk on the walkway with the glass floors, but just walking across the bridge looking at the architecture and details was amazing!

Views Over the Thames. One of the most iconic views of London has got to be Tower Bridge.The Americans thought that they were buying it some years ago & ended up with London Bridge instead & in just about every tourist picture collection you can bet your bottom dollar that there is a picture of Tower Bridge!I have worked in the catering doing many functions on Tower Bridge in both of it's walkways & I must say that if the weather is good you can see for miles up & down the river, the views are spectacular & if you are lucky you might be offered the chance to view the mechanism that lifts the bridges roadway to enable ship & tall boats to sail underneath it!There is a lift to get you to the two gantries & toilet facility's are available, the main area's are wheelchair friendly & weather you are young or old this is a place that is worth taking time out to see!!!

delightful. I guess its a must for your check list. The area surrounding this attraction is a must! The reassurance and all the hidden back streets are so fascinating. I recommend getting lost here to find hidden treasure paths. Please use discression and always travel in a pack.

up the bridge. this bridge is the most beautiful in London, i have lived near to it all my life and i still get excited when i am standing on it, please if you get a chance to visit it please go, you will not be disappointed, take a river trip up the river at night and you will see it in all it's glory, simply gorgeous.

Nice walk across the Bridge. It is a very nice London Landmark, during the day or during the night you can appreciate the magnificent view of the bridge, at night the purple lights looks beautiful. I really recommend visit this place.
Great place to visit night or day. Worth going back a few times. Spectacular views during a clear summer day or at night from the top. Glass walkway interesting and not for the faint hearted!

A must do whilst in London. This is a real insight into how the bridge was made and how the engine rooms operate the bridge. There is a glass floor on both sides of the bridge, which can be unnerving, but perfectly safe for you to walk on. Lots of people laying down on the glass taking selfies. There are quite a few steps to climb, but there are places you can rest if you need to. You can get a 2 for 1 offer if you travel up by train. The entrance fee is £9 per adult. You can get some lovely shots of London from the bridge.
Interesting how they constructed it!. Really interesting history of this iconic landmark. A bit of something for everyone - history, transport, engineering and social history.

So Much More than Just a Bridge!. We visited Tower Bridge as part of our Three Day London Pass Tour of London which was really impressive! This is so much more than 'just a bridge' - it's a Living Mechanical, Engineering and Architectural Masterpiece! The tour of the Towers and of the Engine Rooms is a definite must! There is so much to learn, see and experience (more than meets the eye) - this structure is so rich in history. You will need at least two hours for a thorough tour of the two sites.
Very pretty. One of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen and you get to see a very old castle next to it. Great place to take amazing pictures overlooking the Thames river.
If you love history and/or architecture this is worth a visit.. Loved the glass floor, particularly good selfies can be made upon or within the bridge ;) it was nice to fill an hour or so.
We went under it !!. Did a rib experience tour up and down the Thames - we went under this bridge !! good to see from different perspective

See from Afar. When you get up close you can see more detail but the best view of the bridge is actually to stand away from it. There's not much here and of course it is crowded, but it is an iconic part of London - good for a walk by and photo but spend your time at the Tower itself instead of the bridge.
Great bridge great view. Very nice bridge it's a great landmark of London.Great view from bridge.Superb place.One of the most visiting place in London We had a good time

An Icon of London. As a kid, I remember that one of my fondest treasures was a keychain from London, which had Big Ben and tower bridge in miniature hanging on it. But I never managed to see the bridge up close for my self as an adult, until the January.A windy wintersday is not the best day to walk across the bridge - especially not if you want to stop along the way to take pictures!But the bridge is worth the cold walk across, both to look at the impressive architecture, but also to enjoy the view of Tower of London from the Bridge and to look up and down the river the is so central for London.Very close to everything else you want to see, even closer with the underground. Get off at Tower hill, and maybe take a tour of Tower of London before you walk across the bridge. On the other brink is Borough Market, which is also worth a visit.

where else in the world would you find a bridge with this history. Engine room tour worth visiting and also the walkways it now has glass sections to see below. Why not check the opening times before you visit, always good to see it open

Check when it's open - ie, closed!. Tower Bridge opens more often than you might think. You can walk across it any time, It's an experience not unlike crossing the Brooklyn Bridge, in that traffic thunders by. And you have good views up and down the river. But every so often it opens up to let tall-masted ships through, and it's worth seeing. It's so close by the Tower that you can combine both - just do a bit of googling first to make sure you get the full effect.
Walk on glass. The exhibition is informative and good, but the best experience was to walk on the glass floor and look down on the traffic on the bridge.
Surprisingly interesting. I never expected to see and leans so much about the bridge… and the view is Fantastic.The visit takes approx. 1 hour, and it is very enjoyable.
Nice. The place to walk troughout. If the day is clear and sunny you will definetelly willmake great pictures. Just lovely background. Nice area to walk around and nice cafes.
Iconic photo opportunity. Having visited the Tower London, excellent opportunity to take an iconic photo to celebrate your visit to London

Scary glass walkway. Excellent value, use 2 for 1 days out entry if can. Very informative visit to Tower Bridge with incredibly views from both sides all over London. There are two glass walk ways, with does take a bit of courage to initially walk on, seeing the Thames and road way under neath. Both Towers either at end have lifts and exhibitions and there are also toilets. Informative staff to assist you too. At the end of the Tower visit you can walk across the Bridge and go to the engine rooms. If get lucky I should image amazing to be across the walk way when the Bridge raises. The times are published.

Half term visit. Prebooked our tickets for family of 4 (ages 8 and 11) - £20.30! Went straight in which was great as there was a small queue forming outside. Very friendly staff. Children get sticker books and stickers. Walked up to the walkways as lift not working...great exercise but lots of steps! Walkways were wider than we thought. Great views and lots to read. Glass floors were both scary and exciting and you can walk round them if you chicken out!! Upon leaving you follow a blue line over the bridge and down some stairs to the engine rooms. Interesting place with things for children to do. Great shop with lots to buy. Some pricey items but also cheaper items for the kiddies to get. Would recommend & visit again.

Interesting and worth a visit. Like most attractions in London this can get pretty busy we missed the crowds by heading down about 10 am. Helpful and friendly staff. Fascinating and interesting facts and information. Glass floor amazing ( if you don't mind heights). Whole family enjoyed this attraction but maybe not as much if it was really busy.
Night View Tower Bridge. Another must see attraction of London. Don't believe that this architecture masterpiece still work and looks so good.
Architectureeee. Say what you will about inanimate objects...but it's a VERY photogenic bridge.Very close to heaps of other attractions. I saw it a lot and the novelty didn't really wear off.

Tower bridge. Tower Bridge is one of the tourist attractions in London, famous Victorian bridge by sir horace jones.It bridge will open sometimes im not sure exactly when.At the side of the bridge there is a carousel, food and drinks and statues.Sitting and strolling here is just awesome with the view of the river thames & the bridge.You can also go to the top of the bridge with an entrance fee and discounted for students (bring your ID), senior citizens & young children. They have photo booth upstairs, if you want your picture taken with the bridge as a souvenir. Great view day and/or night!

Its iconic. Walking over the bridge is fine - transit nerds and engineering fans may want to take the tour of the inner workings, but if you are on a limited schedule, walk across and up and down the bank past London City Hall instead.
Maxing looking bridge at night . A must see attraction in London, especially as the sun was going down in winter. Next time I'll climb the tower. Great history and scenery.

best view. Must see.
Not too many world,just need to be there to understand.When I am in London the place that I have to visit is Bank and Tower bridge.

An educatonal visit. When visiting the Thames, Tower Bridge is well worth a visit. You are given an insight to the mechanics involved in lifting the bridge. You are also told of the history of the bridge. Take a walk along the walk way, I urge you to allow yourself time, it's not an activity to be rushed.

Fun visit with great views. First time visit with my young daughter. We had a blast climbing to the top of the towers. Great views of the city and a fun filled activity for young children collecting stickers in a little passport. Highly recommended.

Beauty. My husband and I just loved the Tower Bridge! We appreciated all the blood, sweat, and tears that it took to make such just breath taking monument. The Tower Bridge is located near London Bridge. So you can see a few sites when you get off the Tower hill subway exit.
Great. Great for a wander across and you can go up to the top and walk across, I didn't do this, but have been told it can get very windy up there so take a coat!
Great architecture. VERY crowded, we decided not to go to the upper platform due to the line of other tourists waiting to go.
Lovely piece of history. Exactly like you see in postcards and merchandise. it's the most beautiful bridge in the world by far!

Worth a walk along the Thames . We walked along the Thames on a bitter cold day to take in the view and was pleasantly surprised with Tower Bridge.
This is an impressive sight and it was well worth the walk to see.
Stunning experience. I was very supprised by the whole experience.There is so much to see and a very good cost for a family.Very interesting and very informative.I had a great time.

You have not been in London, if you have not crossed this bridge. This is fantastic bridge - but I do have something for bridges. Take the time to visit this one. You gets such a great view of London and the history of the town.

Architecture at its best! . Beautiful bridge. A must see when in London. Also beautiful view from HMS Belfast, Shard etc! No matter how many times you visit London it always is a beautiful bridge to see!

No! its not London Bridge. I know this bridge since childhood as "London Bridge" but its not. Another bridge parallel to this beautiful Tower bridge is actually "London bridge" which is one of the oldest in London. but no worry this in very beautiful especially at night, also the glass floor WOW!
Tower bridge well worth a visit.. Excellent views from the bridge the walkways over the top have glass in the floor so you can see the traffic below and the river Thames.

A piece of history. I had taken hundreds of photos of his place from different places, from London bridge, millenium bridge, directly under the towers.
It's just a bridge, but I love it.

For an Awesome evening... A must visit place in London for an awesome experience (anytime of the day)..evenings are pretty much lovely as you can view the beautifully lit banks of Thames. Take a walk around the control gates & tower exhibition if you have more time. Just a walk on this historical bridge leaves you in nostalgia. Nearby station is Towerhill..good connectivity with bus transport also. Morning visit to Tower of London followed by the Tower Bridge will give you a full package of good memories to carry home !
Beautiful piece of Engineering . Got to say this is such a beautiful bridge and had an awesome view from our hotel... a must have for tourists to see!!

Beautiful at night as well as day time! . This place as for tourist as well as people of London will absolutely love it as the scenery is beautiful and the vibe is outstanding! Whether it be on your own or with family or a loved one, be sure you'd love what you see!
A marvellous site at night. If you have not been here is worth going to see. Along the river plenty to do near and the site is spectacular especially when all light up of a night time.
Amazing!. We did a walking loop recommended by Rick Steves and then ended at the Tower of London. Lots of history. Plan to spend a day if you are a history buff.
A must see. The Tower was very pretty and right there by Tower of London. Price was reasonable consider we were in London. I believe it was around 9 Pounds for adult and around 6 for children.

Good for mechanically minded. Liked glass walkway and info on history of bridges, working of the engines didn't interest me but that's just personal interests. Don't think it was worth £9 and lots of steps

How could you not see this?. A visit to London isn't complete without seeing the Tower of London and the accompanying bridge. To see it in person is quite impressive, especially when you think of how long ago it was built.
Great view. Pay the small amount for the internal Bridge tour it is worth doing the glass floor is amazing. The engine room tour is informative and the staff helpful & knowledgeable

Thames Clipper. My boyfriend and I recently visited London for a mini-break and Tower Bridge is one of the sites we visited! We bought a Thames Clipper Day ticket, there are 14 stops up and down the Thames where you can hop on/off, Tower Bridge being one of them! There is lots to do round Tower Bridge - The Tower of London, cafes, restaurants etc. and its a nice area to just sit outside and take in the sites! We got on the Clipper boat here and got off at Embankment so got to see a lot of the sites that way - I highly recommend paying Tower Bridge a visit even if you don't go in the Tower of London and I recommend getting a Clipper Ticket! There was also signs up for free Jack The Ripper tours round this area which looked good but we had missed the last one - will definitely do one of these tours when we go back later in the year.
Got to see the bridge go up. Watched an old ship go through the bridge.. even though I thought it was *London bridge* hahaha nope wrong bridge!! Great views of the river Thames.
So beautiful. We love the Bridge Tower and all that part of London too, so much to see, but not enough time to visit all
A must see. Great architecture and a famous landmarkWell maintained and cleanCan get a little busy with selfie sticks but worth a look , especially the glass floor

One of London's Iconic Sights . I work close to Tower Bridge but don't often take the time to walk over, admire & enjoy it. I recently visited the Shard and took the time to walk over from south side to the city & it was so nice to properly appreciate such a London Icon! It's right next to Tower Bridge and is free to cross so a must see for anyone visiting London.
Must see. This is such an iconic point of London you cant miss it. Walk one way and then the next to get the benefit of the views!

History and Dreams. For someone who heard stories about relatives from England and read everything ever written about London, seeing the Tower Bridge in person was a treat . It is impressive to see in real life. It is amazing actually.
A must in London. It's amazing to see the Tower Bridge from a ship on the river Thames or to walk over it. it's just beautiful.

Great place. I enjoyed this visit to the tower bridge. The history is amazing and I love the glass bottom floor. Do not forget to visit the engine room at the end of the tour...you paid for it and it is interesting.
Iconic highlight of the City. Nice for a visit,especially when you go inside. Interesting to see the technique behind an iconic bridge. Nice overview of the river and the skylune of the City.
Must-have. When you are in London you must have a snapshot with Tower Bridge for you Instagram. Regardless the weather, start to explore the city from this point!
my sweet bridge. this bridge is my love , i had a great vitist through this bridge , so amazing and realxing place , love it

Drinks and canapés enjoyed on the east side and 12 tables of 6 were prepared on the west side. This is such a great venue, much enjoyed by overseas visitors as well as natives - wonderful experience

the best bridge in london. as this is my best bridge london would not be same with out i like the glass floor and also the way the history of bridge is toldgreat views the history told of bridge is excellent a place when in london you must visitthe staff so helpful and friendly well done keep up good work tony mbe

Enjoyable tour of an iconic bridge. At £9 per person, this is a worthwhile way of spending a free hour in London. You mount the walkway above the bridge in a lift in the north tower, and then walk across the river. The big attraction is the glass floor, and it is indeed fun to look down and see miniature people crossing the bridge far below. Don't worry if you have vertigo - you can cross on a 'real' floor either side of the glass panels. The view is especially impressive to the east, towards Canary Wharf. To the west, most of the famous sites around Westminster are concealed round a bend in the river. After descending the south tower, hang onto your ticket and visit the engine rooms that powered the raising of the bridge; they are kept in immaculate condition. Throughout the tour there are information panels providing a comprehensive history of the bridge.

Event in the Walkways - shocking!. Planned a very special event in the Walkways... unfortunately the sole provider of catering and function services, Seasoned Events, really provided a shocking service and really proved that they are not a first class provider. 1. The Tower Bridge public address system playing in the background during the ceremony2. Messing up the table seating and separating partners and couples.3. Failing to manage DJ and wedding song upon entrance/exit and signing of register (no song at all on exit!)4. Not serving wines until AFTER the speeches and toasts!4. Bridal table dinner served after the first six tables and no wine/champagne for toasts.

Tower Bridge- amazing bit of British history. Quickly getting past that many still think of this bridge as London Bridge, Tower Bridge is a must see. I recommend taking the tube to the London Bridge station and walking past the Shard and down the river to see it properly. Along the way you can take in the views of London Tower and Saint Pauls from the opposite bank. Stop and have a drink to take it all in. When you arrive at the bridge - climb to the top and walk across. Worth doing and not too difficult. From the top, you have great views looking back up river towards Parliament.

A London landmark you must not miss. The Tower Bridge has derived its name from its famous neighbour - the Tower of London. This iconic bridge can be easily accessed by Tube or Bus - its a few minutes' walk from the Tower Hill station on the District line. One can leisurely walk along the bridge- which is free- marvelling at the fascinating architecture of the bridge.To reach the walkways which are located some 40 metres high, you have to purchase a ticket for 8.00 GBP. The access to the walkways are through some elegant stairways. Halfway up there, you will come across a recreation of the Bridge design office which helps you to conjure up visions of an office environment more than a century back!. As you walk along the walkway, you will be taken aback as you hit the glass floor and catch sight of the vehicles and people passing by some 40 metres below! This is where most people spend their time and clamour to get photographs. As you cross over to the South side of the Bridge there is a small theatre of sorts where they show a short video film of about 5 minutes on the Tower Bridge construction which undoubtedly will impress almost everyone. Once you climb down, the Engine Rooms- which demonstrates the technology and the machinery that powered the Opening and Closing of the Bridge which definitely would have been an engineering marvel in 19th century!

Spectacular - Must visit. Must visit if you are in London. Walk towards Tower bridge from London bridge and spectacular views and the bridge itself tells a story. Visit the Tower Bridge exhibition as well. A visit in the evening with the lightings give a different view which is stunning.
Good place to be with family. We got the 2 Day London Pass, the entrance fee was free, a must go and see stop in London.. especially with kids.

Tower Bridge - History, Architecture, Different. Living in London it is hard to appreciate the beauty of the city as one hardly gets a full day out from work to explore it. I decided to set a date and travel as many tourist attractions as I could in the space of one day. My favourite spot of all was tower bridge and it's residing area. You can say it’s just a bridge, but if you are looking to travel somewhere different, visit history and view intriguing architecture, the bridge speaks for itself. There is a lot going on from both sides of the bridge (check the spray painting blow up teapots picture), so the area compliments the iconic monument, fusing the old with the new. At these specific coordinates ( type in google maps) you can capture an amazing picture of the bridge, night and day: 51°30'21.8”N 0°04'21.3”W
