It's a bridge. Yeah...it's one of those must see things in London. Impressive size and architecture and the amount of people with selfie sticks :)
amazing. I travel over this bridge to go to the south keep ti 20mph or you will get a ticket! its part of our heritage and always lovely

London must do. One of London's iconic sights that looks better in the flesh than photos. If you're looking for something to do for a couple of hours, the tour is really interesting, showcasing the history and timelines of this London landmark.You get to walk over a glass panel looking down on the bridge's road and Thames river below.There are a good couple of other options at on either side of the river for a pint or a bite.

Very impressive.. I've been here a few times (including riding over the bridge) and the new glass walkway is a nice (if terrifying) addition and you can easily go around it if you wish.The steam engines were impressive but i do miss the ability to visit the chamber where the end of the bridge swings down when it opens.

Engineers dream. We spent an hour and a half at the tower bridge exhibition. We bought 2 for 1 tickets through the national rail deal, so it cost us £9 (adult ticket) for 2, which I think is a great deal.When we arrived there was a queue (due to having to go up via lift) and we went on a weekday, but it went down quickly. The lift took us up one of the towers to the walkways, where we were greeted by friendly staff explaining the history. Everyone ran off to view the see through walkway, but it's worth to stop to speak to the staff, which gave us more insight about the designs put forward for the bridge. We then wondered across the two walkways and I would recommend taking your time to read the history and watching the TV clips. Of course the see through sections were great to look through and make great photos! We left just as the sun was setting at 4:30, so it's ideal to visit at about 3:30pm on a clear day to catch it. We ended up in the other tower walking down the flight of stairs to go to the engine room, which is actually under the bridge. It's worth going to visit, as it's part of the ticket. The engine room is really fascinating and goes into detail about how they used water to create steam and hydraulic power to power the bridge.
Must visit place in London. For every tourist in London, this iconic place is a must attraction. Sheer architectural beauty is what is great about this amazing place.
Beautiful. A beautiful bridge with so many gorgeous photo ops. Conveniently situated near the Tower of London and sits above my new favorite London restaurant - Perkin Reveller

Tower Bridge . Amazing visit . Museum to see with lots of information on the mechanism of the bridge .gift shop but quite expensive. Can have long gues but fast track avaliable. Fantastic walk across .glass floors amazing. Views are really good
Great views. Always enjoy walking over this bridge especially a night with views to die for. Lots of great photo opportunities and plenty of bars and restaurants close by.
nice to walk along and see the river thames. went on a saturday night to enjoy the view, was very busy with people but nice view to watch sunset at the river thames!
Is a must. Our hotel was close by. I think, is a MUST to see,when in London...just incredible history behind it and beautiful to look at
"Affascinante". Beautiful, awesome, majestic ...far from other attractions Londoners, really deserves cross it.Fantastic!!!
An interesting visit. Our family visited this iconic location and attraction. The walk is interesting and is recommended as it provides a great view of London and the Thames.

Iconic and must see. If you are in London and have not seen Tower of London them I must say your tour to London is not completed and you need to come back .. Marvelous engineering and iconic work .. Situated on Themes which give memorable and breathtaking view

knowsley4. worth going to the tower bridge exhibition very interesting and informative.Good views of the thames and HMS Belfast from the walkway of the tower. Good maps showing the different stages of the structure of tower bridge.
Beautiful old Bridge. A very beautiful old bridge. Was there early morning in the sunset - very beautiful scenary watshing the sun rice.

Great bit of British history. Excellent views of the bridge from both sides of the Thames.
Wetherspoons pubs on both sides too so great value food and drink available close by.
Breathtaking view. London is definitely my favourite city in the whole world. From the bridge you get to see the most amazing views of the Thames. A must-see landmark in London!

Great view and a nice place to visit if time is limited!. I decided to take the tour inside the bridge when I was walking back to my hotel. You can do the tour inside the bridge in about an hour, so it is a nice tourist attraction to visit, if you do not have much time.The view is great and the glass floor on top of the bridge is a nice photo opportunity. I was most impressed with the old engine rooms and had overall a good time, even though the entrance fee is not really a bargain.
Huge nice popular bridge. whenever I visit the south of london I come across Tower bridge whether via the bus tour or when I have dinner at slug and lettuce
Beautiful bridge. Another great place in London that needs to be on your must see list. Very hard to take a picture of the bridge without the tourists but great experience.
Good city view. That is a place for good pics but you do not need to spend long time or coming back.If you like architecture, it is a nice place.

London Bridge is NOT falling down!. As a child we played this game practically every day so naturally I was especially curious to see this famous bridge. Here,as in so many places in London studied in history books,the past walks beside you and is VERY good company.
wow. its the beatufilust place i ever see!!! many turist walking for photos!!! london is great!!i hope to come back next year

One of my favorite walks in London. In my stays in London I always try to have a walk along the south side of the river, it is very nice and relaxing to look at the old warehouse buildings and the boats in the river. The Tower Bridge is one of my favorite attractions along this path.
Great to see, a tad pricy. The bridge is great to see and a must do! The information is good however the price is a little pricey for the fact you don't really have a 'tour guide ' as such.

Rainy day, great view. Quick walk from the tower of London to the south bank.
Plenty of walking space.
Can be a bit windy so umbrellas may not be the best idea!
Photo Op!!!. You've seen it on TV. In pictures. On the internet. So why not take a photo of yourself in front of it? Nothing says you've visited London more than this does.

Great way to see London. Start from the Tower of London side, walk to the entrance at the first tower.Keep the ticket you get as you will need later to enter the engine room.Take the lift to the walkway level (note the far tower is stairs only so if you need the lift you have to go back the way you came).Enjoy views of London and try walking on the glass floor admiring the cars below.Once you have walked both sides head to the tower and way down but before you decend look up Once outside follow the blue line to the old engineer room.A good trip not too expensive
Beautiful.. The Tower Bridge is beautiful! The gorgeous colours and amazing architecture make it a must see when visiting London.A walk across is compulsory!
must do. very worth its something architually beautiful, a must one of the most famous things to do in london
A must see attraction in London! Head to Bodman's for lunch!. A must see attraction in London! Head to Bodman's for lunch afterwards! mmm!Can also be enjoyed from Shad Thames.
Iconic. I have never been inside Tower Bridge. It is fun to walk over the bridge and watch boats sailing underneath
Beautiful . One of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen! Giving you amazing view and it's a experience to be on the bridge while they open up the gate for the boats ☺️

Enjoyable morning. We visited for a couple of hours and had a really good time. The staff were helpful and friendly. We went on the glass floor for a good photo opportunity and took plenty of pictures from the Bridge. Information was extensive and delivered through written boards, animation and filmed clips. Worthwhile and enjoyable visit.
Interesting. I was watching the bridge construction history also in the glass walkways and there above the engine rooms, highly recommended
Very interesting. Excelent experience, very informative. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Definitely and experience to try again.

Better than expected. Visited this attraction as I think Tower Bridge looks great and we wanted somewhere we could visit that was indoors due to the weather. Booked online with a combined ticket to the Monument as well – really good value for money. We thoroughly enjoyed our time in both.The staff at the Tower Bridge Experience were very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the Bridges from around the world exhibition as well as the great views and looking down at the pedestrians crossing the bridge.If you can try and be there when the bridge opens – the dates and times are published on the website – wrong timing for us.Great views from the Monument as well – as long as you like heights !!!
Great monument of London. Tower bridge is a suspension bridge across river Thames. It is an iconic symbol of London. The bridge deck is freely accessible to both vehicles and pedestrians.

Tower Bridge Experience - a must do in London. The Tower Bridge Experience is definitely something that you should visit when in London.The history of how this icon was built, seeing the metal structure inside the building and being able to get a totally different view of the city is fascinating.Walking across the glass floors (one on each side of the bridge) is terrifying for anyone scared of heights (me!) but worth doing.On one side there is a mirror located above the glass floor and a staff member encourages you to lie on the floor to take photos of yourself in the mirror above you!After walking across the bridge in both directions you can continue to the original engine rooms to see the massive steam engines that once powered the bridge and to find out how the bridge is raised. I wish that I had known about the engineering tour so that I could have seen the bascule chamber but even the basic visit is worth doing.
Excellent. Worth the effort. The glass floor is intriguing, and learning the history is good. We were there towards the end of the day, so got some stunning sun set pics.
Beautiful. Out of all the many bridges in London, this one in particular stands out for its towers and colors no one should miss

Beautiful bridge!. This bridge is beautiful and leads to the Tower of London which is also a must see! We took a tour of the bridge and went inside, the views were amazing. Please put this on your list of things to see and do while in London you won't regret it.
Clever English . Clever English putting all the main tourist attractions within a block of each other! Definitely worth a visit to see Big Ben and walk across to soho. The bridge itself is good.

A great day out. Well worth a day out, very interesting and plenty of points of interest for all ages across the different towers and Crown Jewels. We booked the tickets online which saved time at the ticket office

" Symbol of London ". The tower-bridge is in London like the "Tour Eiffel" is in Paris. - (Victorian style )Nice views from the footbridge to the River Thames;In the big building the "docks of St. Catherine", in the middle of XIX century they stocked tonnes of exotic cargo, like ivory, feathers of ostrich, etc.- The bridge to tilt (seesaw) tip up every time when a big ship passing through.

Engineering Tour review. We did the engineering tour on 16th January 2016. You see the same things as the ordinary tour, but to go behind the scenes to extra places. Well worth the money, this was fantastic. The best part was the Bascule chamber where the counterweight drops as the leaves of the road rise. Our guide was very friendly, answered all the questions people put to her. Was nice we were in a small group. Also enjoyed the glass floor in the walkways (!) not for the faint hearted. Highly recommended.
Just got to do before it's gone!. Can't really ignore one of the most famous sights in London, can you? It's a great climb up the steps and with the London Pass it all makes sense. Really worthwhile.

Tower Bridge experience . Good value for money when combined with Monument tour. Walk of faith across glass panels in floor. Interesting to find out how bridge works and gift shop surprisingly good value.

London Trip. Tower Bridge is a must see attraction when visiting London. We didn't do the tour or visit the glass viewing platform (I'm scared of heights) but was still amazing to see up-close... make sure you walk across the bridge and get the view of the London skyline from the middle of the bridge.

A glorious site. My wife & I travelled here a few times over the years. Walking around London is so easy & FREE! You can take boats,helicopters & buses around the capital,but if you walk along the south bank of the Thames you see more. Hidden museums,pub,cafe's restaurants,shops & street entertainment. Pick up a street map,& explore,we use Oxford street as a reference,& go from there. Crossing tower bridge to the Tower of London another great historic site. We love London in winter & summer.
High fun. Joint ticket with a river cruise. Reasonably priced. Courteous staff. Exhibits were good but the fun was the glass floor across the walkway.

The most famous bridge in the world?. How can anyone visit London and not visit this bridge!? Think of the films and shots that you have seen over the years and then experience it for yourself knowing you can say "Yeah I've been there"
Well worth it!. A great visit! Nice and informative, and a fun gimmick with the glass floor on the top walkway. We went on a Saturday morning around 11, before the big tourist rush. Recommended!

Beautiful. Beautiful British architecture and pompousness at its best. Great tourist attraction which if your lucky enough to catch at the right time the bridge will open for a tall ship/boat to pass. Great for tourist snaps X
Fun place to visit. Must do if in London. The Tower Bridge has some interesting history and the tour includes walking across the glass walkway and visiting the engine room.
Had to see. Very busy but a very iconic thing to see. Also there's a small shopping centre near by. Restaurants and pubs can be a bit expensive near by though.

Bridge with golden gates. This is first place I visited after coming to London. As everyone told this is must try place you should visit when you are on tour of London.Thing to remember while you visit this place :  1. Visit this place in the time of evening. It looks amazing. 2. Check time of opening of gates. You should not miss this.Fees : No fees unless you are taking cruise to visit.Directions : just get down at London bridge tube station and from there it is just on 100 steps.To eat : There is little option available to eat at this place but you can try different food items at London Bridge Food Station.

Best viewed at night. Whilst the Tower is impressive during the day it is lit up at night and becomes even more of a spectacle. There are loads of people taking selfies getting in your way but just enjoy the experience just the walk is free.

Theatre break. Really enjoyed our visit and would go back.You need a good few hours to see everything and be prepared for long queues.The staff are very helpful and keep you informed of how long you will have to wait.Glad we went it was well worth the wait

One of the most recognisable sights. The Tower Bridge, I reckon, would be one of the most recognisable sights on the planet (although most people would know it as London Bridge instead). lol We first saw it from London Bridge which is quite a distance away and as we walked closer, it was more and more majestic. In total, we would have taken at least 50 photos of the Tower Bridge. hahaA must see when in London...

Wonderful experience. Well guided tour with amazing highlights of the history of the bridge from facts from the guide to actual old mechanisms of the bridge to videos. Lots of fun. Scary see-through bridge but fun.
Spectacular !. Such a grand old bridge ! Lots of history in the area. A bit hard to miss the bridge. But a must to see !!
Very nice!. One of my faves attraction. Check out the glass bridge. The whole place is really a part of genius engineering.

Better than expected . I was surprised that the bridge wasn't more crowded. There was plenty of time to walk around at leisure and lots of interesting information. Tower Bridge that YOU MUST SEE !!. Tower Bridge that YOU MUST SEE !! Besides the transparent floor and the incredible views from the top of the bridge, the experience that show how they build the bridge, how many times this bridge open every day and the most photographic bridge in all James Bond films !
The worlds idea of london. The image of tower bridge is what people all over the world will recognise and it's an incredible thing to see. Definitely among the mist visit attractions in London.

just awesome.. beautiful, old, lots of history, many stories to tell. pictures were well worth the experience. we went on a cruise up the river and got entertained by staff as well as viewing the beauty of the sights.

Just gorgeous!. I didn't have a lot of time to see the sights in London, but the Tower Bridge (which is right next to London Tower) is really cool. If you like architecture and bridges you should definitely check it out!

A place from other age. I personally think Tower Bridge is one of the most beautiful place to visit in London..
It give always serenity.. relax.. and a mix of important sentiment.. i love visit Tower Bridge during sunny days... because it became with stunning color and amazing lights..

A walk in history, old and new.. Yes, we had to walk across the bridge. It is required in London if you are a first timer.People, walk, in London. They just do it. Worth Visiting Again. It is even better value than it was before with good views of the famous landmarks of Central London. Definately worth the money.

Nice trip. We went to Tower Bridge on nice sunny day. The views from there were absolutely amazing. It is just nice to see different things from there.

Must see. If you are doing the tourist thing in London, the Tower Bridge is a must see attraction. The Hop On Hop Off buses take the route across the bridge providing a good view of the approaches, the bridge itself, and views of the Tower of London.
Iconic. Easy to walk over, best to have a guide or a guidebook to understand the history of what you are looking at. Photos from, and on, the bridge are part of every photo album.

Great Experience. A last minute decision, well worth the price! Spectacular views, fascinating history. We serendipitously arrived just before sunset and were treated to a gorgeous display of lighting and clouds over London.

It's a bridge next to the Tower of London . Often referred (lncorrectly) to by visitors as London Bridge. Witnessing the raising of the road to allow ships to pass is a treat. Another must visit attraction in London.

Really informative. A great visit, very enjoyable. The glass floors were a really big source of entertainment (mainly watching people who are scared of heights doing it). A lot of history on show and the engine room was also good.

Incredible seeing the traffic stopped and the people in amazement. Worth seeing early in the morning, on foggy days, sunrises and sunsets. You get a good view of the bridge when you go on the Thames Clipper (boat)

Trip Highlight. The Tower Bridge was well worth the trip! We paid to cross the top to see the see-through floor. Our teenage kids loved it. There's lots of stairs to climb and the tour of how the drawbridge works was very informative.

Walked it. . Great views. Was cold and windy so would have preferred to weather to be nicer so I could have stopped to take photos without freezing my fingers off. There are machine rooms to visit too so have a look at those if it interests you.

The skywalk was a lot of fun for the kids. Kids enjoyed the Tower Bridge Experience. Kids walked backwards and forwards on the glass floor. The video showing the building of the bridge was interesting.

Iconic . Its iconic and a structure that whole world knows about and its tower Bridge but still many think it as London bridge.. on my new year I was on this structure to celebrate so it was my moment of joy

A must visit if you are in London. This is of course one of the landmarks of London so a trip there is an absolute must. In all the times I have been in London, I have never seen the bridge up.

Very fairy tale like!. I couldn't take my eyes of the Tower Bridge. It felt I was staring at a bridge from a fairy tale. I took so many photos of it from different angles.

Loved the glass floor. We used our London Pass to enter the London Bridge Experience. We went when it first opened so we were on the first elevator of the day. You will find out the history of the bridge and the making of it. You will also learn about other bridges around the world. Of course we stopped to take pictures of us on the glass above the cars. We did not visit the boiler room, but we did enjoy the visit.

Gorgeous bridge. We walked across it after visiting the tower. They have a museum of how the bridge was lifted in the "olden days" but was closed by the time we went but you can kind of see the mechanisms through a window. It is just beautiful at night too. Well worth the walk across!

You will never forget. That is probably the most wanted view of London. And never disappoint. It's completly amazing during the day or night. When I came to London I went to visit everyday for a week.

Just an amazing part of London.. We walked by the Tower of London and across the Tower Bridge on New Years Eve. It was spectacular all lit up and the atmosphere was filled with such a buzz. It is a must to do when visiting London.

Iconic!. How can one not love this bridge?! Whether walking on it, viewing it from a cruise on the Thames or walking beside it, I simply love this bridge. For a long time, I thought it was THE LONDON Bridge until I was corrected. It is truly a beautiful bridge which brings to mind romantic fantasies:-0
Always beautiful!. A great place for a stroll and some pictures. We went at night and the walk past the Tower of London and then along the bridge was stunning!

Iconic bridge in London. This is very popular with tourists . When you walk on this bridge, you are amazed with the liveliness of this ambience. No visit to London is complete without a walk on this bridge .

Unexcpected pleasant surpirse!. The tower brridge experience tour is really very interesting! The first part is a guided tour ,very interested , while the rest part of the tour is self made. A Must See London Attraction. The Tower Bridge Exhibition. Walk across the two covered walkways including a fantastic view through the glass floor of the historic Tower Bridge London. A very interesting and informative attraction with spectacular views down The River Thames. A reasonable entrance fee. Also included in the ticket price is a visit to the boiler room next to The Thames. Certainly a must see attraction when visiting London.

Loved this and the wlak across the Thames.... Great experience, we went early so we could miss the crowds but it was still busy and hectic. History inside with a short film, photos and wander across then back.
Fantastic wiew!. Very nice view from the bridge. God fore pictures. Nice experience, and not so expensive. Not so informativ staff when i tryed to ask about things.
the mistaken london bridge... we visited at night and it was fantastic. we walked thru it and i was so emotional being there. ilove the view. it was lovely..

Glass Floor. If you are not afraid of heights I recommend you do the Glass Walkway and learn more about how the Tower Bridge was built and about other bridges from around the world. Great sights of around London especially The HMS Belfast which is moored close by. My fiend and I purchased the combo ticket for The Tower Bridge and he Monument which isn't far from the bridge.
Amazing . Amazing visiting it is a must..... History of the past present a day future.. London is wonderful place

This is the most beautiful bridge what I ve ever seen in my life.. We went there in the afternoon, with my boyfriend it was very romantic. We could walk a lot and we could see the boats and the river. And in the evening the lights are so wonderfull.

Great time. We spent a couple of days in London at the beginning of this year and the London Bridge was something we wanted to see. It was really lovely, sounds stupid but it was just like in the movies. If you there go and see it
A beautiful part of history!. I adore going to see Tower Bridge. It is certainly a stand out attraction in London. I have never been inside but the outside says enough!
Iconic Sight. This is one of those sights you've seen all your life on TV so it was neat to see it up close. It's lit up at night - quite attractive. We also did the Keys Ceremony at night.
Fascinating. An architectural and engineering masterpiece.Panorama, the engine room is impressive. A tourist attraction that is a must!
historic must see landmark. fabulous photo opportunities on the right days. great view of london and the Thames, and a nice way to cross the river on foot

the bridge that opens. we walked along the water toward the bridge it stood out magnificently against the skyline.when we arrive near it you become rapidly aware of the size of it,it is huge.i thought that the views would be fantastic so up we went, views were dissapointing there were bars over each window which limited the views tremendousy.we came again at night to see what it looked like lit up.the answer was simple, fantastic..well worth a visit.
Worth visiting. Good views, lots of information and enthusiastic staff make Tower Bridge worth visiting and the glass floors are a nice touch.

An iconic sight. One of London's, if not the world's, most iconic sights. Not to be missed if in London. The battleship "Belfast" is moored close by, and is recommended for a visit, especially for the real men in the world.

Overrated. I suppose it is a nice photo and it is great to be able to say that you have walked across such an iconic bridge but really I wasn't too fussed about it. Maybe just take a photo of it but don't wall across? I mean, after all, it is just another bridge.
Near tower of London . We walked by it and was worth it, wish we would have had more time to walk across the bridge. Weather was bad!

View limited by steel beams.. Less busy than the other nearby attractions. We were expecting a panoramic view but found that the bridge walkway windows were limited by the structural beams and informational posters. Worth a quick visit? Maybe.
Worth seeing at night.. This bridge is worth seeing during the day and at night when it is lit up. Go on a boat trip and go underneath then walk over it to get the full experience.

A must go place!. Though this is my 2nd time to visit London but the Tower Bridge is the place where I go to re-visit again. As during Winter time the sunset starts at around 4pm thus the night view gives me another impression! You should not miss it!
Lovely. The bridge is iconic. Always a must see while in London and a nice walk to see the evolving skyline. A great way to get over to The Tower as well.
what a bridge. what a bridge we have in London, something unforgettable. i wish to pass there every day of the rest of my life

Glass floor. Try and fit your visit to a time when the bridge is going up and stand on the glass floor above it, very weird experience, but great photos. Then go to South side of bridge to the engine rooms, can't say I would have wanted to work down there in days gone by but the machinery is very interesting.

An Architectural Splendor . A trip to the Tower Bridge is a delightful experience for anyone who appreciates architectural aesthetics, engineering genius and historical significance. All 3 of these are spectacularly displayed through tactile & visual experiences. While climbing to the glass floored expanse of the bridge you are exposed to photos and written information regarding the history and significance of this edifice. There is a guide who will add additional information about its history and what to look for as you stroll over its expanse. Looking east & west over the Thames, you'll realize how important waterway it is. You'll also delight I the views of both sides of the river. You see the Globe Theater, Tate Modern Museum and St. Paul's Cathedral. But the real thrill is walking over the "glass" floor. You're looking down not only the river but the highway traffic crossing below. You have sense of "floating" as you navigate the glass under your feet. Another marvel is the engine room, a definite must see.
A must see. Well worth a visit, especially if you're not from London. I managed to see the bridge lift twice during my stay in the area. I've got to say it is a site watching the ships sail under.

Glass walkway tower bridge exhibition. Tower bridge well worth a visit very interesting glass walkway is quite a surprise Good value for money Engine rooms and how it all works is also very interesting

Tower Bridge experience is just that.. £9.00 well spent. Visited the Tower Bridge experience about 10.30 on a Saturday morning in January and walked straight in. No waiting at all. Took the lift to the top and spent half an hour or so taking in the views and learning about the bridges construction. When you walk on the glass floor of the upper walk ways you get a real idea of how high this thing is looking down on the river and the bridge traffic from above. Then go onto the engine rooms that were built to power the opening mechanism. Well worth the money to see behind the scenes of probably the worlds most famous bridge.

Quintessential London Attraction. One of those must see places in London. Not much to the see other than the outside of the bridge itself. A good place to take pictures is on the Thames River cruise. Well lit at night for photos.

What a Marvelous sight. I was so amused to finally visit this place I have been listening about in the famous nursery rhyme! We couldnt get to the top of the tower bridge but the entire feel to be at this place is awesome..Month of visit - May 2011
Impressive. Nice bridge to walk over. View from top is amazing! Haven't seen it open yet but should be nice to see that once in your life.

Good History & Viewpoint. We had never been into the Tower Bridge experience before but were impressed. It had history on many bridges around the world (some of which we had visited recently). We went down into the engine rooms to see the mechanics of how the bridge lifts which was interesting.

Great views of London! . We visited the bridge because it was included in our London pass, and were pleasantly surprised at what a great attraction it is. We ended up spending about two hours here. Lines can be long - if you don't have the London Pass, you can also buy online. For thrill seekers, there is a section of walkway that has been replaced by glass, so you can step out high over the river. For non-thrill seekers, you can easily walk around. The displays are well done and interesting. There is a great one about famous and intriguing bridges around the world. A cool feature - there are these small windows that open so that you take unobstructed photos of the beautiful views. We visited this after spending most of the day at the London Tower. Easy to do because of the proximity. There are no restrooms at the entrance, but there are once you get inside.

Great time. Had a great time walking the glass floor and for dad's the engines are well worth seeing.
Go early to avoid the crowds and allow about 1.5 hrs

Tower Bridge Exhibition. We decided to go to the tower bridge exhibition after spending a few days in London. You go right behind the scenes and you can see the engine room from when it was first built up to the present day. The staff are very knowledgeable and said about the bridge itself has a steel skeleton, and the brick effect we see is infact stone cladding. The highlight of the tour was the glass floors, which we both walked across a little nervously ,you could see right down to the main roads .We were both very impressed with the tour and was reasonably priced at just £9.00 each.
The symbol. Maybe, the bridge is the symbol of London. I think it is indeed. I liked to walk around and the view.

Amazing Experience. The Tower Bridge was an amazing experience for me, just finding out how it all worked, and the view from above was fantastic, being able to see the London Tower, and the HMS Belfast sitting there in the river. It's a great place to go for some great photos. Not to mention the glass flooring too! Not so good if you don't like heights! Haha

loved it. We went up and had a field day taking photos while standing on the see-through floor. A bit scary but so worth it. There are lots of facts and video detailing how and when and why it was constructed.

Take photo. This is a histortical site and main attractions in London along river Thames. The structure is very well designed and unique. During my trip using City Cruise, we were lucky to see the bridge open for ship passing. We took video and photos as we approached the Tower Bridge.It is a very memorable trip and we would visit London again in near future.How lucky.

A great way to see the city and learn some history. We did the Tower Bridge Experience while we were over in London and it was a great activity. We were able to go up to the bridge part up top and there was a great sky walk and historical exhibition. You can see the whole city from up there and are there are great places to take photos. The glass floor in the sky walk was excellent, though some might find the first step onto it a bit of a challenge. There were information displays all along the walls that described the bridge's construction as well as interesting facts about other large bridges all over the world. We were also able to have a look at the old hydraulic wheels and things like that. It was great.

Should have done this trip years ago. A must see highlight for everyone. Exceptional value and very interesting. Walking along the glass floor section of the tour quite worrying for some, kids seem to enjoy it though.

Touristy - but not all bad!. Lots and lots of people... But the view is really great - especially through the glass floor!!! There is an elevator if you need it, but you don't have to wait in line if you take the stairs - but be prepared to be huffing and puffing by the top, even if you're 23 :)
Great venue for London. Good value and great views of London. Don't miss the engine rooms. These are extremely well presented and although no longer in use provide a wonderful glimpse into the past.

Awesome. Its a well planned guided tour where in you are allowed to go on top of bridge and u can walk over the glass floor.
We loved the experience. Those who are scared of height may have issues walking on glass bit its much safe then it looks like.
One time experience so give it a try and have fun

kind of magical. I've learned about the tower bridge when I was younger. The beauty of trade for ships to come into the port. Seeing it beautified into a little museum is nice. The bridge has a glass floor where, if you stand on it and look down, all you'll see is the water, or the cars underneath you. Worth the trip

Worth the money to walk across the top. We took the tour and got some great pictures across the glass walkway. We also took the time to go to the Engine Room and we walked down the Staircases instead of taking the elevators down.
Tower Bridge Exhibition. Was a very interesting exhibition I took my group of Scouts Cubs and Beavers and they had lots to see and do as well as having the walk across the top of the bridge.

My favorite. This place is where my heart belongs to. It´s magical, amazing. I could spend one day just sitting there, looking to the bridge, just waiting for the night and, after, waiting for the day. I can´t put on words what is the feeling. U have to be there and try this experience.

Loved the Skywalk!. Received tickets for this attraction as a Christmas present. Would recommend booking online as we were fast tracked to the head of the queue. Took the lift up, the fitter among you could take the stairs. Incredible walk across the glass skywalk. Very nervous at first but quickly gained confidence, even lay down for a photo at one point!! The video talks are also very interesting at either end of the walkway. Well worth a visit.
You got to be there while in London. Very big and very impressive. One of the must see places in London. Nice walk by the river and many photo ops along the way

I saw it when it s open!. I feel so lucky to see when the bridge open! I was in The Tower of London and i was on the walk way from building to another building. I took a clip when she s open. I am so grateful!

Simply beautiful . This is by far the most beautiful bridge I have ever seen. It is definitely a must see for anyone traveling to London. There are other attractions near by so you can squeeze a lot into the trip.

The World's most iconic bridge. Forget the Golden Gate bridge and the Forth bridge, they have no character. But Tower Bridge has stacks of character. I have seen it hundreds of times. I showed it to my friend recently and he was well impressed, couldn't take enough photos of it. You can see and walk across it for free. It does have a tour of the engine room (for raising the bridge), and access to the top walkway between the towers (once used by pedestrians when the bridge was raised - lovely views), but these cost money and take time so we skipped them.
Great feat of engineering. Don't miss this one. History of bridges along the upper span, glass floor and don't miss the engine rooms that used to power the bridge.

Need a beer. Come in out of the cold to a warm cosy drink in The Vault under Tower Bridge.
Lovely and quirky and good beer.

One of the best ways to see Tower Bridge.. As a walk I've done many times, I can highly recommend to visitors or locals with some time on their hands to take an underground tube on the Jubilee line to Bermondsey, and head to the Thames Path to walk along the Thames River toward London Bridge.The best times would be - during sunrise (the sun rises behind you, splashing the Tower Bridge with orange light), and; - during sunset, as the sun dips below the city skyline as you approach Butler's Wharf where you can have a nice dinner or go for a pint at one of the many pubs before heading home for the evening.
Not to be missed..... Great trip and see through floor is amazing and if you go to London you must not miss this adventure.

A londoners must do!. I know thousands of visitors come here,I lived just a walk away for my early life,walked over the bridge many times,when I got to my late 50's we came on a visit,I thouroughly enjoyed the views and the history!!! Fabulous day out
Good Day Trip. Best view of the Tower is at night when all the lights are lit but also walk down the stairs and side paths for best pictures, also less crowded.

Magnificent Bridge. This is a stunning London landmark, situated next to the famous Tower of London. Definitely worth a guided tour as so much history is connected to these famous buildings. You are able to see the sights from the top of the bridge by visiting a transparent floor. Great if you are good with heights! A spectacular view of the Thames from here and a good view of the City of London. There are lots of snack bars and restaurants nearby and the Tower Hill tube station is minutes away, also a short walk from Fenchurch Street Station (main line trains).

Well worth the ticket. One can obviously walk on the lower level bridge for free, but we really wanted to visit the upper level walkways, so we had to buy tickets to the Tower Bridge Exhibition. It was well worth the money, because walking on the upper level is really stunning: there are glass floors on the walkways and one has a great feeling when looking down to the river. The exhibition was also really interesting, about the story of the bridge and also with details about the most famous bridges in the world.

Impressive Architecture. The architecture of this bridge is really impressive. Especially when the bridge draws up to let some of the boat to pass. One of the attractions that should not be missed when in London.

Romantic Valentines with a difference!. Since mum saw Tower Bridge from a train and mistook it for a place of worship, it has had a very special place in our hearts (and created a recurring theme for mum).So when I saw it was hosting a Valentines tour, we had to go! We enjoyed spectacular views of London from a different perspective while learning some of the bridge's history. I was even persuaded to stand on the glass floor and watch the boats sail beneath my feet (I am not good with heights).Champagne and chocolate covered marshmallows added to what was a wonderful, romantic evening with a true London icon we will never forget.
It's a bridge!. It's a bridge! It might be iconic, but get your selfie and get out of there! On a cold day, there's better places to be!

The landmark of London. This is the main landmark of London. I've been seeing this bridge every day for 2 years and every time it is impressive, especially during extreme weather conditions - fog, sun shine, sun rise, etc.

Must see outside, but not inside. nice to see but expensive for the little extra you get to see inside and on the top walking bridge.
If you are not very interested in the London bridge, I would say a photo session ouside is more than enough

I love the sound of breaking glass. Came upon this attraction by chance a really pleased we did. Having seen the bridge from the banks of the Thames for many years it was very interesting to see the inner workings and internal structure of the bridge. £9 per adult gives you entry into the engine room and also up into the cross beams of the bridge. The recent introduction of glass floor areas in these sections gives a different but slightly nervous viewpoint looking down onto the road and river below. A helpful tip if you are brave enough to lay down on the glass and take a picture of yourself and others using the mirror mounted above is remove any loose change you have in your pocket. It is surprising how change falling out of your pocket onto the glass sounds just like glass cracking. Very amusing for others to watch three people move as quick as they did. Hidden gem, well worth a visit.
Iconic ,a must visit. If you visit london and don't see/cross bridge you will regret. Tower of London next to it and loads of photo shots of famous landmarks.
London in one view. London in one visit, you can be in the south looking across to east London and the Tower of London or in the east looking across to city hall and the wonderful ship hms Belfast
Worth it!. The glass floor is definitely worth it. It's a must see for those who visit London the first time. It's an interesting place..

lovely place. A very lovely place to visit in London. The upstairs steps were a bit of a climbing but the view at the exhibition was absolutely lovely. The history was also instructive and interesting. The engine room was a plus. Admission is also affordable with discounts to students.

Great bridge and view. If you are in London, and sight seeing, Tower Bridge must be on your list of sights to see. A nice walk on the bridge can be something a doctor will prescribe to a patient, hehe. The bridge is lovely, the environment around at has a lot of landmarks to add to your list, and the grass area, pretty good in summer.

Tower bridge exhibition. Brilliant day really recommend this one. There is a glass walkway through the middle of the exhibition. Well worth a visit, if you are nervous about the walk, there is plenty of room at the side of it yo carry on your walk. Well worth a visit

Great for all the family. We visited here on new years day.
As we have three children ages 13,10& 5 we are always searching for something to do were all the family are happy,well the tower of London Bridge tour was fantast, educational, fun and a little scary ( for me) he he. A must if visiting London.

Amazing!. Really loved it all - the history, the view, the thrilling glass floor! Definitely one of my favourites. Staff was amazing and helpful. Nice, clean bathrooms. The engine room exhibition was definitely a nice add to the experience. Definitely a must see for history lovers and anyone who appreciates great views. We visited just as the sun was starting to set which really was the perfect time in my opinion, especially since the sky was not completely obstructed by clouds.

We loved this part of our London trip. I was stationed in the UK years ago, but it was delightful to bring my new wife to see Tower Bridge... as well as revel in the crazy background of "London Bridge" and the people in Arizona. I am never quite sure which side of the Atlantic I am bonded to... Tower Bridge is iconic. Tower Bridge is photographic. Tower Bridge is near the London Tube and many good restaurants are nearby... always a plus!

Best looking bridge in London. It was great to visit, classic landmark, it was better than the pictures. Moreover, there is a transparent floor you can visit from the tower of the bridge which might be interesting to check out it you want the "full experience"
must visit. one of the iconic sites of london. but its kinda hard to find a perfect place for taking a photograph. you have to go down to an area (i forgot the name) to take a perfect photo.

One of London's top landmarks. Unique bridge, designed to complement the Tower of London.We were extremely lucky to arrive just as the bridge opened up to allow tall boats to pass through. The upper walkways are a must-see, affording wonderful views of the river & the bridge road below. The museum tour - which includes the upper walkways - is the way to go
A Must See. One of the famous landmarks of London and you should not miss it.Walk along the riverside and enjoy the best view of London!

Busy but worth it. When we booked our trip to England one thing we wanted to do was to walk across the Tower Bridge. We got off the bus tour and did walk across the bridge and it was beautiful. It was very busy but worth it.

Very interesting. A must visit when in London, especially if you are interested in a bit of engineering. We saw the bridge open and close on a couple of occasions to let yachts through. Fantastic sight to see. Do the tour, and enjoy the glass floor walk at across the span.

check out the glass floor!. We visited the Tower Bridge again as it had a newly placed glass floor where you can see the cars crossing the bridge and the water. I learned that this freaked me out a bit but I definitely thought it was worth the trip to see it in person! I also enjoy that they have updated their photo booth so that you can take your own photos and make post cards. I didn't like it when they take an awful photo of you and then you want to purchase the memory but feel bad about the quality of photo. This is a great upgrade and would be fantastic for all the attractions to use.

Glass floor well worth it. We did the glass floor and it was fantastic. The exhibits about bridges around the world was a nice surprise. Tower Bridge is a great thing to do along with the Tower of London.

An excellent attraction but it's not cheap. If you have an interest in bridges then you will enjoy this attraction. We used the London Pass but if you pay on the gate it isn't cheapYou can learn how the bridge was built and get access to the engines and the gangway across the top, between both towersThe glass floor allows you to look down on traffic below if you have a head for hights An enjoyable and interesting attraction that will take 1-2 hours to walk around

Pretty bridge. Usually mistaken for London bridge...but definitely the more interesting looking of the 2 bridges. We took pictures by river Thames close to houses of parliament with it in the background.
A true Icon. We only walked over the bridge a few times but the structure is outstanding. If we had more time we would have liked to see the bridge exhibition to understand how the bridge opens etc.

Fantastic. I lived in London most of my life. This is probably the second time I have ever been to Tower Bridge! Totally amazing. Loved every second of the the glass floor walk and exhibition. I booked for 15 people from work. Booking was simple. Just an email. Collecting tickets was a breeze. The whole thing was fab. I would recommend it and I will be doing it again soon with my husband.

Surprisingly interesting. Inexpensive iconic tourist attraction. This is great value for money. There's a good view from the raised platforms and it's fun to stand on the glass floor and see the road below. You can see down the river and the flow below your feet. It's almost as much fun to watch the other tourists who don't like the glass floor.Then follow the blue line to see the Victorian pumps etc that originally worked the raising of the bridge. It takes a little working out but it is well explained so the kids could follow the process. Overall, we all thought this was a good attraction, great for a rainy day and surprisingly good value for London.
BEAUTIFUL! . One of the best structures in London and I still can't believe I was on the glass walkway. Worth a try!!

Not much to add.. I think everything that could have been said about this unique bridge has been said. All I can add is it's well worthwhile to see the bridge open to allow shipping to pass through, visit the Engine Rooms, and take a walk along the newly restored top gantry so long as you've a good head for heights. Highly recommended. Have fun!

Incredibly beautiful. The bridge is truly spectacular and one of the more amazing bridges I have been to. It is a great spot to walk across the river and see different parts of London. It has quite a bit of history relating to the bridge and is a good photo opportunity. Definitely worth a visit.

Great Area. When visiting London you must visit Tower Bridge. The area on tbe South Bank is superb for restaurants. The choice of dinning is second to none. Maybe a bit expensive but if you avoid the French ones you can get great value for money.

Great Area. When visiting London you must visit Tower Bridge. The area on tbe South Bank is superb for restaurants. The choice of dinning is second to none. Maybe a bit expensive but if you avoid the French ones you can get great value for money.

A very nice experience. It was awesome going into one of the famous landmarks of London. A very good experience and you can see very nice views from the bridge and the top part where you walk over has a glass bottom so you can look down on the cars. This is an attraction on the London pass, google it if you don't know what it is.
Interesting. This was another iconic landmark we wanted to visit. We viewed it from a perpendicular walkway, and we read about it's history off my phone.

You cannot leave London without crossing this bridge!. One cannot leave London without visiting and crossing from one side to the other. If you like taking photographs, it is also a one in a million place.

Tower Bridge a great place to experience rough weather! . I visited Tower Bridge in the rain and winds of mid January London. Inside it was warm and inviting, with easily identifiable workers sharing information about the bridge's construction and how to navigate the displays.We spent a lot of time on the suspended walkways, looking at the view, enjoying wslking the new glass floors and getting blasted by wind when we opened the 'photo' windows.The films and animations detailed the history and construction of the bridge in an interesting way, the engine rooms, though interesting to see, were somewhat less engaging.

Gorgeous bridge and interesting exhibit. You do not need the exhibition to enjoy this gorgeous bridge, as it is open for pedestrians. However, seeing the inside is a big plus. The whole journey takes about 1 hour and you get to see the engine rooms as well. The glass floor is very nice.
a must visit. a must visit when in London stunning as the sun sets over London, many people rave about big ben and all but i believe London bridge is one of the most beautiful sights of London

Tower Bridge Experience. we were in London with a few hours to kill so we thought we would do the tourist bit and as a Londoner I had never visited the Tower Bridge experience so thought Id give it a go. to start with the tour costs £9@ which I tought was not bad for London prices and this includes a trip over the bridge on the high level walkway and also a trip to the engine room. There is a lift that takes you to the high level walkway and the nice young man operating the lift gave us a quick brief to the bridge and what to expect and he told us that the lift in the opposite tower that takes you down was out of order so you could either walk down or go back down in the same lift (with my dodgy knees thats what I did). the views from the top of the bridge are spectacular and the amount of famous sights from there was amazing including the Shard, the Monument, City Hall, The Tower, etc..the engine room was facinating with the steam engines working (although not by steam anymore) and there were videos to watch that gave you the history of the bridge. All In all a facinating and historic look at a Famous London Landmark, would go again if family come to visit.

See this when you visit the "Crown Jewels" in the Tower!. Tower Bridge is many times mistaken for "London Bridge". However, they are two different bridges. (The current London Bridge is a rather ordinary bridge.) However, "Tower Bridge" is a London "icon....and you should not miss it. (If you are going to the Tower of London, when you exit from the Tower, you will see Tower Bridge.) It is worth walking across as the sights on the Thames will surprise you!
Its a dream come true. It has been my dream to visit tower bridge. It is so amazing. I visit it in summer and its quit crowded over there.

Magnificient. I had visited the Tower Bridge as a part of The original Sightseeing tour trip.The bridge is too picturesque and a delight to watch.A must see in your trip list if you are visiting LOndon.

Another attraction in London to put on your bucket list. Another great attraction which you should n ot miss if in London. Once again the crowds can be quite large if travelling in peak season although we were there in later afternoon and it wasn't too bad
All the steps!. My daughter had to go it alone when I saw the steps. She reported it was fascinating to see the workings and stand o9n the glass floor.l

One of the best views in London . If you think the tower looks great from the outside, I recommend being inside of it. There is plenty to see and learn about once inside, but more importantly the sight from the tower is spectacular. I went on a rainy evening and still got incredible pictures of the surrounding area! Also, be sure to check out the engine rooms.

Wow. Went out with my partner. Very well made structure.I wish I visited the place my last visit in summer.I could have enjoyed more But nevertheless this is Something every British should be proud of.
Must see in London!. The architecture of the Tower Bridge is so perfect and just amazing... We have spent more than our making photos and enjoying the view.
Gory history hidden.... ...beheadings, executions, imprisonment...the tower has it all. Yet it stands so grandly over the river. It just feels a bit spooky to be up close. So awesome.

One of, or maybe the best London landmarks. We are very lucky to have such a beautifully historic place in London as we do in Tower Bridge. It is so gracious by daytime and elegant through the night hours. I was fortunate to have a view of both the Tower and the Bridge from an office in the area for many years, and I never grew bored of the view. I would highly recommend visiting this fantastic area and would advise you to dine/take a coffee break in the area with a view of this beautiful landmark. I guarantee you will be in awe of the stunning architecture and graceful presence of this wonderful bridge over the river Thames in the Tower Hill area.

Beautiful by day.....Amazing by night. Not much to say other than the most impressive bridge ever.......Brooklyn, Golden Gate be ashamed.....this little bridge knocks your socks off. Great view from the London bridge rather than the Millenium bridge. But even better veiw just outside the Tower of London. Do yourself a favor though if you like the bridge during the day.......you will love the bridge at night. Even if you think `big deal it's a bridge` go take a look at night you'll understand!

Good. Hi cost £9 every one runs to glass bridge not interested in history of the bridge very sad. Staff friendly and helpful nice views and interesting info and great view of this bridge. Bought at entrance of bridge

A must see London icon. Tower Bridge has long been an one of London's most iconic landmarks, and for good reason. The bridge itself is beautiful as well as technically excellent. If you're interested in architecture and/or engineering it's a very interesting structure, especially if you have opportunity to see it when it opens to allow tall river traffic to pass.

Best of all bridges. The best of all bridges in London or elsewhere! Make sure you don't just rush to just the bridge. There is so much to see and experience around the bridge. Start from the Borough market by London Bridge station and walk towards the Tower bridge through the most awesome alley-ways of London and then by the river side. Walk across the bridge and get some of the best views of the city. Make sure to look for the mid-point where the bridge opens up. You can then also start your Tower of London experience. Instagram @navigrator

London visit isn't complete without its bridge. We had a close view during our River Thames Cruise which is FREE on our London Big Bus tour.The iconic London Bridge and it's definitely not falling down ;)Such unique architecture. Lovely to finally see it.

Great fun but get a duo ticket with the Monument. Definitely worth a visit to the tower bridge exhibition for an hour or so with enough to look at and read, we didn't go with kids but I wouldn't have thought it was too fun for kids after 20mins or so. My top tip would be to buy a duo ticket for the tower and monument combined as its abut £2 more than just the tower and if you buy it at Monument then you bypass the whole queue at the tower.

Something different to see. We did the tower bridge tour which was interesting and informative. You are able to walk from one tower to the other and there is glass floor so you can look down at the river and road below.
Amazing!. This is seriously one of the most beautiful bridges I've ever seen. There is possibility of really nice exhibition and sightseeing - make sure to not miss it. It's worthy!

You know you have to go.. The Tower Bridge is truly one of London's iconic structures and a must see on everyone's list of London's sights. We had the fortune of staying nearby and so we were able to walk the bridge in both daylight and at nighttime. We opted to take a Thames River cruise so that we could pass underneath it as well. Unfortunately, we did not get to see the bridge open, but if you take a City Cruise of the Thames, they will tell you the next scheduled opening so you can plan ahead.

Long awaited visit did not disappoint!. Not to worry if your visit is on a winter evening, there remains great chances for night photography of the City from the high pedestrian crossings. This is an amazing structure! The exhibits and films are well done.

Just another bridge. I thought that the Tower Bridge would be something absolutely incredible and different but, sadly, no. It is just a bridge that is praised.There is nothing special about this bridge.
landmark worth the experience. Not as old as it looks and a marvel of period engineering, plenty of history in the area so well worth a trip to this part of town.

Vacation London. The most beautiful bridge I have seen due to ita unique architecture..Another Must Do while in London. Went to Christmas Market close by and enjoyed a full day there. Excellent area to see also the modern architecture within London as well.
Good view . It was good to visit the tower bridge and a must see. The bridge at the top is a little disappointing and very busy but the engine rooms were very factual and interesting

Interesting Architecture. I loved walking by the Thames and seeing this after I went from the Tower of London.It's one of those pictures you have to take. Unfortunately, was not able to go inside the exhibition due to lack of time. It was summer when I went here and there were mobile restaurants near the bridge. One of them served the best mojito I have ever had.Lovely area.

ICONIC TOWER OF LONDON. By its sheer size and majestic presence, one is over awed by the elegance and grandeur. Photographer's delight to freeze memories of the visit.I was amazed at engineering marvel and the level of detailing.

Now THIS did not disappoint!. I found the Elizabeth Tower/Big Ben rather underwhelming, but the Tower Bridge was extraordinary. It was way larger than I could have imagined, and absolutely beautiful. A great view can be had from the Tower of London.

It's a Bridge. The Tower Bridge is located right near the London Tower, you can't miss it! We visited in December and opted to cross the bridge to get to a nearby Christmas Market (if you travel in here in December, I'd highly recommend stopping at the Christmas Market). You get a great view of the water from the bridge, and I believe there was an exhibit not the Tower Bridge.

Beautiful at sunset. At certain times of the year there are kiosks and events ongoing near by it.This place becomes particularly beautiful at sunset.Make sure you bring your camera to take few pictures as the sky starts turning red.

Really interesting . It's a bit unnerving walking over the glass walkway & looking down but you get used to it. And can walk around this part if you don't want to do it. Good explanations. Also photos & info of famous bridges around the world. Walk up the stairs, don't use the lift to get a true perspective off all the great engineering feats. Engine room good too. Excellent value for money. Attendants very helpful.

London, the most beautiful city in the world. My favourite part of London for many many years. It's beautiful in the day and even more impressive by night. Rich in history and feels like being taken back in time. I love just standing on the bridge looking over the Thames. There's nowhere like London :)
Great day out. Very good day for entire family - interesting, entertaining , many places to stop and eat as well as shop
Master of its time. Such a nice piece of engineering if you are into bridges then this is the best or just even enthusiasts of crafted work this is a must see

Great attraction.... This was a very nice place to visit! I was glad they had penny crusher at the top. They have a very neat children's activity you can do as well for free! The staff was ok, some seemed annoyed of Americans.

This is a must to see Tower Bridge.. Amazing! The tower bridge is one of my favorite attractions been there many times, but you never get tired of seeing it. The bridge is very distinct, Its towers are a good match for the Tower of London which is nearby. From the bridge, you can look up and down the Thames and see just what there have in London. Beautiful walking tour Amazingly amazing and still and interesting.

Spectacular!. Pouring rain and gales didn't prevent the Tower Bridge experience being spectacular. The views were not spoiled by the weather although the Shard was considerably less impressive and seemed smaller to look at than we had imagined. The display of other bridges around the world was interesting but the highlight was the glass floor over the road far below. With the film showing the step-by-step building progress sped up meant the whole thing was thoroughly educational with our children, great and enthusiastic, friendly staff and a unique way of seeing one of the city's main iconic structures!
trip with son. another great trip.. it was beautiful and lots to learn. this trip is good for kids and grown ups lucky had good weather so made it even better

Towering Icon of London . A must-see in London. Several of our tours took us over and around the bridge. Wonderful views from either side of the river. Great to see during the day but better to see illuminated at night.

Historic place. Great place to visit during your trip to london,great history and too much to admire as an engineer master piece, considering it is an okdbridge that still operates perfectly all year round

Great view of the city. Wandered passed on the way home from the Tower of London and saw we were able to walk up the tower and across the bridge. The line was quicker if you walked up the stairs. Up the top there were multiple sections with glass flooring that you could look down and see onto the bridge, cars and people below. If you follow the line once you're out of the towers then you get to go into the engine room and see what powered the bridge to open and close.

A Victorian Engineering Icon. What a famous site, that is Tower Bridge. It is easy to forget its real function is a bridge, and a very busy one at that. I was really surprised at the end of December that it was not only full of traffic, well central London what do you expect? It was also full of tourists. If you want to get a photo on the bridge point you camera upwards to avoid all the tourists on it. I am not complaining just saying.
The best icon of London!!. There is no possible way to go to London without seeing the Tower Bridge, it is absolutely breath taking!!!
Great experience. It was a great experience to walk on top of the bridge and very interesting stories. Liked the comparisons with other bridges around the world.

JAW DROPPING !. Although it was cold out - we had to tour the bridge ! amazing ! a Must see. The best view for pics in about 50 yards in front of it...lots of restaurants and pubs in the area...for a quick exit in the cold! VIVA LONDON!

Majestic Wonder -- Beautiful Tower Bridge Glows at Night!. This iconic bridge is famous throughout the world. The unique footbridge at the top is a lovely addition to the bridge and enhances the artistic symmetry. Love the gold tops and blue suspension cables and walkway features. It is especially beautiful at night with the lights lighting up the bridge.
Beautiful architecture.. This is a beautiful tourist attraction especially for pictures. I just wish they had not closed with glass, it would be much nicer.

Fleeting Visit, But Very Memorable. Visited Tower Bridge for half an hour one evening with my partner. The lights, design, make-up, shape and architecture are all impressive - a real beacon in the night over the Thames. Next time, however, I will pay to go visit the glass platform as it'll accentuate my whole experience of this attraction. 5/5:)

Lovely day out. Had been before several years ago and can only remember a little bit about it. Love the fact that the lifts make it so accessible to every one. Loved looking at all the information and pictures of bridges around the world and that I'd even seen some of them. Stunning views and of course the skyline has changed a lot from last time. The glass floors were a challenge but eventually managed to walk on one (with my eyes firmly shut). Lovely day out.

Just a nice drive by and a quick stop. it was our last day in London and we only had a few hours to do something so we made a deal with our cab driver on the price and he took us across the city drove us around and stopped to let me take photos and drove us across the bridge, it very pretty and cool but honestly you don't need to spend forever there like the 15-20 for us was good enough there are other things around to do so you could make a day out of it

Spectacular Bridge!. Another impressive piece of history that has been impeccably maintained! Such a special iconic part of visiting London! Sit on the top of a double decker open bus when crossing the Bridge!

Great view from the top. Tower Bridge is beautiful itself. Tours are well organized and interesting with a lot to see. Stickers for kids are awesome. =) The view from the top is beautiful, and looking glass is really cool. Great experience!
Great walk. The Tower of London is worth a visit as one of London's trademarks. It is a fine walk over Themsen and a beautiful monument.

amazing. To have this bridge in a modern city is magical. A must see if your visiting London. We also had the view underneath by travelling the Thames Clipper. Fabulous and it's worth every moment watching it.
Lovely at all times!. Love tower bridge, so beautiful and all the time! Lovely to jog up to from east london, especially in the evening, with tower of london and monument also a short jog away.
Not much to do. It is lovely bridge however all you can really do is walk across it or watch it open to let barges through which takes a long time.
Beautiful Bridge. Absolutely beautiful. Would've loved to go to the glass platform but didn't want to pay to stand in a glass box over a river.

A must do. I have walked over Tower Bridge many times, but had never completed the tour. Fantastic views and the glass floor is worth the entry fee alone, if only to watch people avoiding treading on it. Such a fantastic history and the tour gives you a complete insight into the design, construction and operation of one of the most iconic bridges in the world.

Lots of interest and great views.. We visited over the xmas holiday and it was a pleasant surprise that we did not have to queue for too long. Walk up the stairs to feel the history rather than using the lift. The glass floor is brilliant although not everyone wants to walk on it. Amazing history behind the building of this London landmark. It's worth taking your time and reading all the exhibits to capture the full story.

Beautiful to walk across at night. One of my favourite bridges in London. The colours and detail are beautiful and are even better when seen at night time with all the lights on. Theres a nice little grass picnic area on the south side of the bridge that is lovely to sit on in the summer and ive been able to see the bridge clearly from there (if you're lucky, you can see the bridge being raised as well). They have also shown the Wimbledon finals on temporary screens down on the grass too which makes for a lovely spot to watch it with the bridge behind you.

Unexpectedly nice. During the last day of our visit and while it was raining cats and dogs, we decided to visit it, just to stay dry to tell you the truth. Even though we didn't think much of it, it was unexpectedly interesting! The glass floor was thrilling, but quite frightening at the same time. There's also an application where you can see the bridge actually rising! The only disappointing fact is that from the array of bridges from around the world that are depicted on the walls of the upper floor the Greek Rio-Antirrio bridge is missing. It is undoubtedly a very impressive bridge and the world's longest multi-span cable-stayed one. So it deserves to be part of this collection, doesn't it?
Bit disapointing. It's all a bit analogue if you like.Could be a lot better, walking along the high gallery is cool, the engine room is ok , ok for a rainy day

Great Experience. Very interesting visit and great views up and down the river Thames when you walk over the top passageways. We used the 2 for 1 railway deal and you can also get a deal by buying a combined ticket for the Tower Experience and the Monument. With the Monument there are a lot of stairs and narrow, but the views are brilliant.

Tower Bridge Moment. What a thrill to stand beneath the Tower Bridge in London, England. A surreal moment in time... almost as a time traveler might feel if they could travela nd go anywhere they wish to be. That is how I felt. A must journey to location. The people are kind and the atmosphere is pure British.

Defines the London. I am sure you are not going to miss anyway if you are visiting London. But check at their website the time of opening the bridge and visit at that time, your experience will enhance manifolds.
Also visit Katherine dock (5 mins soothing walk along thames from the bridge).

Lift of bridge. This was my first time to see the Tower. It went so smoothly. I highly recommend watching it before you go. Got a chance to see the lifting of bridge to go a ship. it was a amazing show. Crowed and camera flashes...wow
A must do.. Take a stroll across Tower bridge to admire its panoramic views and Its iconic structure. Beautiful from the top of the bridge to the footpath beside, it's well worth it's rating.

Simply a must see in London. We walked from the houses of Parliament to Tower Bridge along the South bank. It's quite a walk but so worth it! To see the bridge rise to allow boat traffic and then walk across to the Tower of London is just magical.

This must be seen!. Amazing! The tower bridge is one of my favorite attractions. It connects the ancient with the modern. You can walk on the bridge and cross to the other side . In December as we were there we had the Christmas market on the other side. Everything was amazing. You should see it no matter the weather!

Beautiful!. Coming to Tower Bridge was the first thing in my head when first time I came to London. It is easy to reach, as it is near the Tower Hill tube station. The view is very beautiful, there is large park where you can enjoy the view of Tower of London and Tower Bridge while having lunch. Plus you can see how busy the water transportation in River Thames in London!

Beautiful Bridge. After seeing the bridge from afar, we decided to go to it and walk across. There are walkways along the Thames River to the bridge from London Bridge. The walkway on the north side of the river is the nicest.The bridge is very distinct. Its towers are a good match for the Tower of London which is nearby. From the bridge, you can look up and down the Thames. And you can look up to see the nicest bridge in the area!
This one surprised me. I had no idea we would like it as much as we did.. Well run. Our whole family enjoyed this. Loved the glass floor and got some great pictures. The Engine Room is worth it too.
Fabulous!. Tower Bridge is as evocative in the flesh as in all the photos and films you see. Go there and enjoy it for yourself!

Nice View, Amazing when it opens up. Brilliant to watch when it opens to let a ship through! One of the most memorable sights in London. When crossing the views are very nice too, should definitely get some photos when in the area and if you can AT NIGHT!!

Take A Walk On The Wild Side. I would suggest walking over this bridge after going to the Tower of London . The views are beautiful , one of the most famous bridges in London and on the other side a 20 minute walk to one of the best outdoor markets in town and the Underground .

Loved, Loved, Loved!. What isn't there to love about this bridge. It is beautiful during the day, even more so at night and just incredible the details that are on this bridge not to mention the color blue. I love it. I loved walking over it and enjoying the Thames below. Would be amazing on a great night with less xmas crowds.

The one photo I had to have!. In my opinion the most beautiful bridge in the whole wide world. The colours are astounding, and the architecture and engineering breathtaking—to think a bus once "flew" from one bascule to another because the bridge was rising! Must visit!

Cool. Had a great day out at tower bridge both our teens loved it and the addition of the glass floor is brilliant my wife on the other hand could not be persuaded to walk across it even for a kiss under the misletoe
Would recommend to anyone visiting London

What An Engineering Marvel ! The Magic of the Bridge Lifting Beneath your Feet !. This could be the most famous Bridge in the world !Its iconic structure ,the high level walking for the panoramic view, the Glass Floor to view London life , and if you are at the right time of a cruise passing under ,.the Bridge lift under your feet ! We were not that lucky. But we could witness that astonishing sight next day from far during our River cruise..The Victorian Engine Room was another marvel to visit. Elevator was available to reach the top. the weather was fine and we enjoyed our evening. As we were walking to catch our Red Bus ,a small drizzle forced us to wind up our plans for the day. I would like to add here that finding parking place for your vehicles would be an impossible task in London . So we had booked on a sightseeing bus. Public transport buses were available but their system of using cards were not suitable for visitors. Plan for extra time for transport and be prepared for long walk to reach each attraction. We could cover only 3-4 main attractions in a day.

Love it. Always love going here around also London bridge easy to get to on the tube and tube stations are on both sides. It's always best to go at night time. ( we went towards the New Year and Christmas lights were still on which made it well worth seeing.
A MUST FOR SURE !!!!!!!!!. Definately a must on your todo list. Even to go on the site tours if you have the time. A must in allowing the time for this.
Must see, great views. This is another must see while in London. It's the classic Tower Bridge-walk across it, take pictures, etc. It's just a fun time. Seeing it at night is fun too, it lights up.

Lovely. The bridge is best viewed from London Bridge at first and then make your way down the riverfront to get a better view. It is beautiful from all angles. From my point of view it is actually more iconic and nicer to look at than london bridge. It is also close to many other attractions.

Group Family visit. We were a large family of ten and took a private tour with our guide Peter. Worth every penny as we had a great inside perspective of 'The Tower'. A superb way to spend a few hours and a great experience to walk across the glass floor walk way at the top of the bridge. You can also take in the engine room and see the working pump room. I would thoroughly recommend a visit to Tower Bridge.
Wonderful . Beautiful walking tour Amazingly beautiful still and interesting The tower bridge was pretty close to the hotel we stayed and even from afar we saw it

Terrific Experience - well worth it. Worth paying the $$ to go to the top of the Towert Bridge, to walk along the length of the bridge from a great height and then to walk over the perspex for that truely scary experience (more unnerving) By this I mean when you are walking along the bridge (above) there is a large section of glass that you can walk over and look straight don onto the cars and buses below.
