FUN. Then you get to go down and have a look at the opening mechanism and marvel and the engineering of yesteryear!

Interesting. While not overly exciting, they do have an interesting display of other iconic bridges around the world. Also, there are a couple of places you can walk on plexi-glass and look down. If you are going to the Monument also, you can buy a discounted ticket to both. . The views from the Monument are better.

Tower Bridge at Night. Just wanted to share our pictures of how we see the wonderful Tower Bridge. With perfect up lighting on the Bridge makes it look even more glorious. Once in the middle the surrounding London city looks picture-perfect every time.
One of those icon bucket list things to see. If you come to London, then you have to see the Tower Bridge. It is the essence of sightseeing. It makes a great background for your selfie.

Great thing to do in London. Cheap and cheerful. Fab bit of history and you get to climb the stairs to the top and see the bridge from a glass floor. You can also view the rest of London through viewing portals at the top of the bridge. A treat for all ages
Great views. Great views up and down the river, and of the Tower of London. Plenty of photo opportunities and steeped in history.
Great view. Great experience learning about a London icon. Seeing below through the glass floor was cool. An education in bridge building, and considering it was built in the 1800's , an amazing feat
Tower bridge. Beautiful view. Definitely worth going. First time I have seen it. Taken plenty of photos. Will share my experience with family and friends
Amazing . We walked from our hotel near St Pauls over the millennium bridge along the Thames and bac over London bridge. We crossed it at night and it looked amazing lit up.
Look History?. Take the time to visit. The history and the architecture are wonderful. The staff was helpful. Be ready to walk and get good walking shoes.

Beautiful on the outside, does not worth the entrance. This amazing bridge features lots of history and a great view from the outside, however once I paid and went up the elevator I felt great disappointment. You can't see a lot because the bridge construction itself limits the view and I did not find it worth the money.
Let's cross the Thames. A royal symbol of a royal city. A mammoth suspension bridge with its two towers is a landmark of London.

Excellent! . Very friendly staff and stunning views.
Interesting to learn more about this London icon.
Would recommend buying a joint ticket for this and the monument just down the road to save money.
Truly awesome structure. The Tower bridge is truly and iconic symbol or London. You can walk across the bridge and has some great views of central London.
Beautiful! Postcard perfect. I visited tower Bridge with my London pass. The walk along the top was well worth it! The views were lovely and the exhibits were informative. Great part of London

Very cool tour and this unique bridge. Definitely worth checking out the Tower Bridge and inside tour. Get a chance for some great views and see the inner workings. Highlight is the glass bottom of the bridge in the middle and to look down on boats as the go under.
Memorable experience. Great experience, well organised, joint Monument ticket worth getting. A bargain if you pay with Tesco Day Out vouchers.

Quite interesting. Not sure if this makes it into my top 10 London things to do.We did a private guided tour but I got the feeling our host was struggling a bit to fill 90 mins. It was generally interesting with the walk over the upper walkway fun.Ok if you are looking for something to do on a rainy day but not a 'must see' in my opinion.

Neat archtecture. We combined a trip across the bridge with a visit to Tower of London. We basically walked across and walked back. We didn't go into the gift shop or pay to stand on the glass floor so it was a free visit. Very neat architecture but also very crowded.

Immense. The bridge is perfectly visible from the Tower of London.
There is a museum inside that you can visit. We didn't since we were short on time and preferred to visit the British Museum.
Tickets are 9 GBP for an adult. Good view of the city from the upper floors.
just towering. a true historic landmark..nice walk from the wrong bridge...all interesting angles..walked on the left side..will try the right way next time

NYE daytime visit. WONDERFUL! Great experience to go up into the bridge and walk across the glass walkway. Staff very friendly, professional and polite. My son is in the armed forces so was home on leave and we were both given discounted entry. He was treated fantastically - given loads of thanks and praise. Yes it's busy but this is a London tourist attraction - stay calm and happy the wait soon flys by.

take a walk along the bridge. This is such an iconic attraction in London it hardly needs an introduction. We walked across the bridge from HMS Belfast and enjoyed looking down the Thames from a different perspective.

Such a pretty bridge!!!. This bridge is just beautiful. I recommend driving along it in the top deck of an open double decker bus. Also take a cruise along the river. Boths ways are a great way to view this bridge.
Amazing Bridge. Was a must see in London. We just walked over it to take some pictures so there is probably more you can do to learn more but just seeing it was great.
Bice. Very nice place. Lovely architecture. Defiantly be visiting again soon. This is a very famous landmark of London. One of my all time favourite.

Nice walk with historical vista. Very interesting structure where you can see through glass looking down through the walkway below. You can see alot of the historical landmarks from here including london tower

London Landmark. There's no excuse when visiting the Tower of London not to at least take a walk across this iconic bridge. Stay on the right side of the bridge to get the best view looking back at the city and Fortress. I probably would have taken the tour this time since the entrance was in the right lane tower and crossing off from the left is impossible. Regardless, a great way to continue a walking tour of London across the river and down the banks of the Thames.

Historical Gateway. Very interesting from every angle , whether from it's upper vantage points giving a varied view , including HMS Belfast , who fired the opening salvo on D-day to herald the liberation of Europe. This old Bridge is also a monument to civil engineers of the day who designed and built this workhorse. Although a limited attraction . It is well worth a visit . Surrounded by other attractions , and very easy to get to.

Excellent Engineering Tour. We were given the engineering tour (book in advance) which had a guided tour of the bridge and the the engine rooms, with the added bonus of visiting the bascule chamber with one of the bridge engineering team. Fascinating and well worth it, though expensive.

Day out tower bridge. Great day,combined it with walk up the great fire of London monument,both within walking distance of each other,not expensive at all and really worth the visit,not too busy and was well run,as we had pre booked,no queuing either.Very interesting and a nice way to get over the river,the glass floors are amazing and the kids loved standing on them looking down below,wouldn'tl eave. Also nice area of London and near to the Shard as well. Do it,go visit.

Fantastic !. This wasn't top of our list of things to do but I was so glad we did. It was good value and the kids thoroughly enjoyed it. The bridges history was well told and the glass floor was mind blowing. We were up there for hours, had to drag the kids away. It was fantastic watching the traffic and boats go by underneath our feet.

Good historical sight with relevance today. 1st visit and tour of the inside workings - tour self guided and worthwhile when using 2 for 1 tickets or similar. Need approx 45 minutes to see all on offer. Highlight is the glass floor strips approx. 10 meters long on both walks allowing you to look down at the traffic below. Once visited, not a sight that needs to be visited again.

Do the experience! . Beautiful bridge. Would highly recommend the bridge experience. You go up in the first of the pretty towers - either walking up stairs or using the lift. We walked! Then you get to walk across the upper section between the two towers. Interesting information about the bridge and other types of bridge around the world. It was a clear sunny day and we got good views of Canary Wharf and the shard. Midway across there is a glass floor so you can see traffic and the river below. Plenty of history about the bridge and how the opening works. Make sure you walk across both walkways they both have glass floors the second one wasn't as busy when we were there. Then you head down and move into the engine rooms which explains how the bridge is powered - again interesting. Really enjoyed our visit and good value for money.
one of the icons in the city of London. This is again an icon of London. The bridge opens itself up when a ship passes which is worth a watch

View of the river.. We paid to go on the Tower tour - the kids loved the glass panes you could stand on. We ran out of time to go down to the engine rooms. It was a bit overpriced when we worked out the exchange rate - but I'm glad we didn't miss it at the same time. Lovely views of the River and the City skyline.
Nice place to visit. We walked down besides the river side and went up the bridge. The scenic view is very nice including the Castle besides it.
Beautiful Bridge. This was part of our walking tour of London. We mapped out what we wanted to do and it was easy to get to using the bus and walking.

A great view. From the top of the bridge you get a great view of London and through the glass floor a great view of passing traffic beneath you. It has great information videos and lots of pictures and it's a great place to take your own pictures of London. It's great and I would do this again. It's super easy to get in quick if you have a London pass on you! Skip cues and all :)

Interesting but short. The Tower Bridge Experience was interesting but a little disappointing. Even though we discovered how, when and why the bridge was built, the majority of the exhibition was dedicated to other bridges from around the world. (My husband found this fascinating!) Walking across the glass floor and seeing the bridge from above is quite spectacular though. It's worth a visit if you have the London Pass since it's included in that, but I would have been disappointed if I had paid separate admission. Take the time to stop by the engine room, it's well worth the visit.
Lovely. Loved seeing it was just iconic and fascinating with the structure. Definitely worth the walk down the river from Westminster.

One of the icons of london. Almost every visitor comes by to see the tower bridge. There was a christmas market at the banks facing the bridge during the festive season. The night view here is exceptional.

Historical. the bridge is located right next to the Tower of London and looks incredibly old and gothic. An impressive structure the best way to enjoy is by talking a walk across the bridge and marvel at its architecture and incredible engineering. An icon and a symbol of London, the Tower Bridge is a must see.

Staring down at the Thames. By all means taker this tour. you get to walk out on the top of tower bridge and stare down at the people and vehicles below, plus a great view of the city and a good lesson in the history of the bridge.
Majestic Tower Bridge!. Beautiful bridge,totally worth the visit,with beautiful views from the river and the Tower of London and the London skyline.great for pictures!

Fabulous. Great to walk over fantastic view of the Thames, we googled the opening times......so once we found a good time we walked along the side of the Thames and found a good vantage point and took some lovely photos

First visit.... This was my first visit to this wonderful bridge and for someone who has lived in lindon all my life i never knew you could see the workings of the bridge or get up to the walk way.. What a wonderful few hours with the kids and we all learnt something new! And when it dark the bridge and london looked beautiful

Must visit in London. Its a lovely structure and also one you must walk on.I missed die to the rains but caught some good views from all sides especially during the Thames river boat rideThe icon and hallmark of London is a must visit and a real sight for sore eyes

great space to access. This was a great space to access but the visit lacked any substance for me and I would have liked there to be more going on but it's certainly worth a visit to say you've walked across the top part of the bridge

Stunning bridge. I always loved, loved, old buildings, old architecture, old gothic style, and you can find it here, England. Stunning view when you reach at the top of the bridge. Interesting history of royal scandaoism, the dark side as well... must must go!

Iconic!. No trip to London is complete without a trip to Tower Bridge! There is no bad view for a picture, but my favorites are for the South Bank side or from London Bridge, which is a short walk away! Conviently bookended by the Tower of London and City Hall, it's surrounded by history, but offers stunning views of the modern London skyline. There is a great spot on the bridge for pictures, which provides a panoramic view of the Thames. There is also a sign explaining all of the buildings that are visible! It's very easy to walk a cross, with pedestrian sidewalks that are protected from traffic. It's fantastic during the day, but definitely worth seeing lit up at night! and be sure to look up the schedule for when the drawbridge opens! It opens at least once a day, but occasionally more depending on the boats needing to access the river.

London = Tower Bridge and not the London Bridge. London = Tower Bridge and not the London BridgeIf anyone disagrees, I am happy to have a long discussion over beer trying to convince him why and how Tower bridge captures the essence of LondonAnywhere across the world, if you say London, the image that emerges in the mind is of the iconic tower bridge and I must say i wasn't disappointed.It is simply the best of what London has to offer... have seen it at all times and all weather over the past month and loved it always

Fun bridge experience. We visited here recently and took advantage of the 2 for 1 voucher from national rail. The bridge is very interesting with lots of information on the bridge itself and even a visit to the Victorian engine rooms but the highlight has to be the glass floors where you can stand and look below at the cars, boats and people underneath.

London's Iconic & Amazing architecture adding beauty to its history. Should see!. One of the Iconic Architectures in London. Yes this is the same bridge from the song 'london bridge is falling down'. This can't be missed in your London trip. Its architecture is amazing and it's part of London's glorious history. it's in many songs and nursary rhymes. We caughr the views & pics from Tower of London. Unfortunately it was a rainy day & we visited from Big Bus London, the Thames River Cruise. Werent lucky to get beautiful views from the top of the bridge. Heard its great, so dont miss it.

Worth it for teh glass floor. I would recommend visiting just for the glass floor where if you are brave enough you can walk over the London traffic. As for the rest - the views are great , the history very light touch and the machine room OK. Don't expect a visit to take long no more than perhaps 30 minutes. But probably worth it as sid
Driving over was enough for me. I just passed over this bridge. It was enough for me and I got great pictures. It was raining, of course.
Beautiful. Seeing Tower Bridge, and walking across, are different experience. Beautiful bridge with lots of photo ops. Walk the bridge!!
The View from Above. A couple of our kids went up to the exhibition and really enjoyed the glass view of the river and the bridge
A must visit in London. Totally recommended. Visit during the day and the night as the night lighting is wonderful. You can walk along the bridge and take photos of the two parts of the City
must visit for London trip. Visited this during night and must say this is a must visit for London trip. Next time, will plan for a day visit when the bridge opens as well.
A must see landmark!. The tower bridge is one of the most iconic landmarks in London. It is a must visit location and is especially amazing at night.

Good bit of history. Doesn't really more iconic than Tower Bridge for London.
It's viewed best from a small distance rather than on it. Night time views can be quite pleasant.
Inside a glimpse of engineering at its best. And great views out to the Thames.
Quick visit is best.

Unique experience.. the line for the elevator was long so we opted for the stairs, it was a long hike up. The kids loved the glass pannels and the view of the city were nice. If I was traveling without children I would skip this attraction.

Iconic and British. Always a must see when visiting London especially for the first time.Great view from the Thames side walkway especially when lighted at night time.The views from the top are spectacular.

Worth a stop!. We had the London Pass (highly recommended) so we stopped here after Tower of London closed and could skip the line. Plenty of time for us. The new see through, glass walkway is amazing. Great exhibit on bridges of the world. Take the 206 or so stairs to the top, if you dare!

The Premier Attraction of London - Must See. It is possible to see this attraction in different ways. The first is on foot from a distance from the side of the Thames River below the bridge on the same side as the Tower of London. This is the best for photography esp. at night. The second way is from a car driven very slowly across the bridge and take a photo every few meters. Then study the details before returning to the bridge on foot. The third is on a cruise boat on the River Thames and one gets to see the bridge on both sides, twice. We have done all three, and continues to find different things on the Bridge we haven't seen. I would like to try again, next time by double decker bus, and take photos of the River Thames from the Bridge riding the bus. I still remain excited.

Lots of history here. Places of interest is a must to visit here. Sometime may wonder how the Tower Bridge were engineered way before till this decade. Anyway back to sightseeing, is crowded of tourist of cause, but the view is awesome, we took many picture for memory.

The most pictured city landmark. The most popular London's bridge. Build centuries ago and still very well preserved, personally I never crossed it up, but I always had the chance to see it from distance. Here are kept the Crown jewels and some other historical artifacts. Stylistically very beautiful, guess every single tourist have at least a souvenir picture with this bridge on the background.

Just beautiful!. Truly iconic! Walk across and then to the right to the next bridge for a nice stroll. If you go a bit farther there's a nice food market with great street food for lunch.
I was lucky enough to have full view of the Tower Bridge for several days from my hotel room.
Tower Bridge. Tower Bridge is one of teh most popular and impresive sigthseeng in london, unated kingdom. It is good to see it, to cross it, to go under it on the river Themsa with the boat.

Must see. We bought our tickets prior to our Christmas visit to London. Queues seem to go down super fast and the staff work extremely efficiently to oversee visitors arrival and guidance. It was a very beautiful and interesting experience - one which we would highly recommend. The visit into the engine room is extraordinary... Do make time for this - well worth the small fee they take to allow you the pleasure.
Magnificent. I was born and raised just south of London but I've never seen this before. Full moon rising up between Tower Bridge check out the photo and give it a thumbs up!! Fabulous!

Fantastic construction. The Tower Bridge has lovely views of London on both sides of the Thames. Obviously it's free to walk across at any time, but it's worth paying for the museum and walk across the top of the bridge where you can look through the glass windows straight down to the road below.

Great view. You can easily take the elevator to go upstairs to have a beautifull view over the city of London. You can walk over a glass floor. If you are afreight of heights be carefull. It is a nice experience to see the cars directly below of you.

Awesome sight. I literally gasped when I saw Tower Bridge for the first time. It's a marvelous sight especially at night when the lights highlight its beautiful architecture. Viewing the sunset on the bridge is also a mesmerizing experience. For a different perspective of the bridge, try to see it by the fountain with the sculpture of a boy and a dolphin. Awesome.
Great Architecture. Had a really nice experience there. But it is only good for photography. They do have small shops there which serves good food for a good value.

Always Impressive, unforgettable. Even on a cold, windy, rainy day the Tower Bridge is a majestic site. Access is by sidewalk and is short walk across. Hard to say much more than go see it both in day and night.

My Favorite Bridge. For me, the Tower Bridge is in a class by itself. It is gorgeous in day or night, and in any light. It is simple majestic in every sense of the word. I have taken many strolls over this bridge and back many times. It never gets old. You can walk over it, drive over it, walk above it, and ride on a ferry under it. Each way gives a different glorious viewpoint. Truly, truly one of the most picturesque and beautiful places in London. Do not miss seeing it in person!
Grand!. I would suggest visiting Tower Bridge at night! I think that the lighting makes this amazing piece of architecture stand out so beautifully! London-what an amazing city!!!
Amazing site. Experienced Tower Bridge up close while on a work night out on the river. Boat trip right down the River Thames and through Tower Bridge.
meh. It is a neat bridge but I wouldn't rave about it. It wasn't the highlight of my trip thats for sure.

Beautiful at Night!. It's always fun to see the Tower Bridge, but it is even more lovely at night when it, the Tower of London and the city are all lit up for Christmas! Made it even more stunning to walk over and around. It can be crowded, but the crowds are all having fun. Worth the visit to say you saw it.

Unusual Views of London. Taking the tour of the Tower Bridge is not a must see in London, but it does provide another perspective of the city. It also has glass walkways where you can take unusual photos of the bridge surface below. You can also watch strangers become exceedingly uncomfortable while trying to avoid standing on the glass walkway.
Fun Time! . What can I say? Just the name speaks for itself. This bridge "towers" over the water below, providing a romantic drive that speaks of history and a beautiful view of the city.

It's a bridge.. It's just a bridge. Granted, it's a very lovely bridge and always good for a tourist photo. It's functional too, allowing not only vehicles and pedestrians to cross a body of water, but also can lift like a drawbridge to allow larger boats under it.Amazing! If you love bridges, this is definitely up there in the Top 5.Why only 3 out of 5? Because it's a bridge. A bridge, people. It is what you make of it, it costs nothing to visit, but ultimately it's a bit of fancy road crossing a brown and murky river.Take a selfie with it, tell people you came here, and please please please remember it's call Tower Bridge. London bridge is far less impressive and definitely not the same thing. A bridge in London may be a London Bridge technically, but it's not THE London Bridge.

Stunning. I got lucky with the hotel and the room I selected this Christmas. Unlike other tourists, I could admire the beauty of this bridge from my room. It's stunning come rain or sunshine. And I did walk on the bridge several times, up, down, left, and right. Great views from the bridge itself.
Love the glass panel floor on the bridge. Overall a good educational tour for all ages. I simply love the glass panel installed on the floor of the bridge, it adds thrill to the tour.

A must see in London!. We walked across the bridge with the intent of going to the top. The price was exorbitant so we settled for the walk back! A beautiful landmark. Plenty of great photo opportunities from along the rivers edge.
Run run, it's opening. Hah, we finally had a chance to see it go up this year and I was very excited. It's the only time in London when the time stopped :D

glass floor is impressive. this bridge looks more impressive from a distance rather than on it... with that said, it's cool to walk across it and look up at the "towers" - also impressive, if you wish to purchase the attraction tickets, is the glass floor walkways (you climb the stairs up on tower, walk across and down the other tower) - also the mechanics of how the hydraulics of raising the bridge is cool to see...
An icon of London. All tourists must take a photo with the bridge. A genuine symbol of London. We found many people around this area but it is easy to walk across and take photos as you go.
Jewel. Enjoyed this attraction. Make sure you have your walking shoes. The jewel castle was magnificent. Crown Jewels on display. The bridge was awesome.
Tower Bridge. Lovely place. Very impressive conatruction the view and the Christmas Market made our day! Many options of drinks and food, live music. Magic (and cold)

Iconic landmark. We visited the Tower Bridge after going to the Tower of London as it was on the way to the HMS Belfast. The visit to the Tower Bridge exhibition including the Victorian engine room took about an hour and is worth while especially if you are in the vicinity. The glass floor walkways were a bit scary a first but we quickly got over the fear and enjoyed it.

Rich in History and a Good View. This is a must see on your trip. The Tower Bridge with its rich history and unique architecture make this a true London landmark. The tour gains you access inside the towers and ability to walk across the bridge from above, the glass floor definitely adds a special touch to the experience. The elevation provides for an excellent view of the Tower of London, the HMS Belfast, and other sites up and down the Thames River. This is still a working draw bridge, I would recommend checking the opening schedule and time your tour so you can watch the opening and the vessels passing through the glass floor from above (most openings are on Saturday).There is a combo ticket purchase that will save you a few pounds by buying a ticket to the Tower Bridge and the Monument, which is a short walk from the bridge. Your ticket also gains you access to the engine room to see how the bridge operates. Definitely plan a couple of hours to fully appreciate the experience.There is a nice exhibit in the tower dedicated to unique bridges from around the world.

Wonderful view of London. While visiting Tower of London I thought I'd pass again to see the iconic bridge of London. Excluding the busy traffic, this bridge has always fascinated me with it's amazing architecture.
Very impressive. Strawl along the banks of the Thames for good views. We did not visit the Tower nor the museum. It is in great shape.

If the weather is good, definitely go up!. We decided to climb the stairs to the top. We were hoping for a better view of the Tower of London. It was still very cool and interesting. The glass floor was fun. The engine rooms were not exciting and kind of a waste.The gift shop was great! We found that many of the items weren't sold at regular stores, so if you see something, buy it.

A unique experience. When visiting London we took the opportunity of visiting this iconic building. There are lifts up to the walkway, both of which have part glazed flooring (not great if scared of heights but there is enough room around them to avoid if you feel unsure!)which means you can look down on the bridge/Thames. There are some informative pictures and written commentary about this and other bridges around the world. The engine rooms (which are a minute's walk away from the Bridge itself) were interesting and well worth a visit.

A must do!. Been there with girlfriend and sister. Paid 19 pounds. Was really nice to know the history of it, ro see all those photos..But i was so scared to go in the glass walk. You wont regret to visit that.
Kids get stickers!. Iconic Tower Bridge with a combination of views, history, architecture and science. Kids get a fun sticker activity as you walk through.

Entrance to best country on planet Earth.... Hopefully I am contributor 10,000. I have crossed this bridge many, many times during my 57 years. It is beautiful, charismatic and reflects all that is British. What is that I hear you say? Pride in our country. Pride in our real history and pride in our ability to laugh. There is nothing the rest of the world can beat us at when it comes to a sense of humour. Only when you have laughed until you have cried will you understand what being British is all about.... and may god bless her and all who sail in her...xxx

Step Back In Time. Synonymous with the London skyline you can walk across this magnificent piece of history and actually look through the gap in the road where the two sides meet at the water below.This attraction is absolutely free to walk across and guess what.................. once across , mind out for the the traffic to get to the other side and walk back again for absolutely nothing so you can go back to where you have just been.Do it all day and you have a cheap day out.

Great Tower Bridge. One of the main attraction in London, a must visit and enjoy the view of the city. Feel really proud!! Really recommending for all the London visitors, don't miss this great tower bridge!!
Beautiful. I think this is one of my favorite bridges in the world :). Did not go in but it's just great to see it from all angles or to cross it!
Great attraction. Wonderful views and breathtaking glass walkways make this a must do while in London! Well laid out, informative and very interesting!

London's best bridge. Tower Bridge is worth a visit if the weather is fine and you are on your way to see the Tower. It isnt much fun in the rain or as a stand alone attraction. Excellent views from the river is you catch a boat.

Stunning - Must see. Great spot for photos and to enjoy the spectacular views of London. Love the hub of shops and restaurants around here too - and there is an amazing boat cruise option to enjoy the River Thames.
Just one of those must sees when you visit London. Just one of those must sees when you visit London. you can combine this with a walk along the shores of the Thames.

The glass floor was the max ;-).. We liked to see the tower bridge for once inside. Our kids loved it, especially the glass floor. It was very informative and for kids they had a passport. They were able to collect free stickers along the exhibition to complete the passport.
A must do . Loved our visit to Tower Bridge. It is a nice way to learn about the build and also to see London from a different perspective.

Very cheap way to see a great view of London. For only 9 pounds you get to go up into the Tower - there is a bridge mueseum and information about how the bridge was made. =)
The see through floors are amazing and the view is great!!

Worth the walk. Take a stroll down the South Bank toward Tower Bridge so that you can get a number of photo opportunities as you get closer to the bridge and then cross over the bridge to get a closer look at the architecture and design.

Beautiful structure. You can see the Tower Bridge after visiting Borough Market and walk over the Tower Bridge to get to Tower of London. This is a great route to catch all the sights including River Thames. It is a nice way to walk off the meal you would partake at Borough Market and see the bridge from afar and near as you make your way to Tower of London.
Iconic Symbol of London. I first fell in love with this bridge running across it during the London Marathon, a must see in London

go to the top of the bridge. don't stop just taking a photo of the tower bridge, go inside you won't regret it. you can see london from above and walk on the glass floor almost like you are walking on air.
Very nice!. heard from so many places as one of the places you should visit and indeed it is! very nice to walk pass through the bridge and take several photographs as a memories

So nice to finally be there. You have probably seen and heard many times about Tower bridge, but whe you finally get there is awsome. you can cross and go to many other places and you can also climb the towers. You have to walk quite a bit to get there.

A interesting visit!. Visited with the mother who had told me about the walkway. It was a real interesting visit, finding out about how the bridge was built and works all very interactive which made it fun. Would be great for all the family. Staff very friendly specially the security guard at the front checking bags!

Stunning landmark well worth finding.. We stayed nearby and wandered over for a good look. The views of this bridge and those from it are stunning. The Tower of London was on the other bank as well as the Financial District with those famous building. There are some good pubs on the South side just downstream which are worth finding. Overall a good area to sight see and find hidden gems.

Ok for the view through the glass floor and if you are interested in bridges . Thought I booked Tower of London tour but was only the bridge going through the top so was disappointed I had paid for this via a bus website.!Good for history of the bridge if you like that but the Tower of London tour by a Yeoman of the Guard was exceptional, but that is a separate tour of the Tower and get tickets at the Tower Ticket windows.
Great day. Lots of amazing facts, and information about how the bridge was made, the people who made it.Amazing view down through glass onto the road below.
Ideal for a boat trip on the River Thames. This Structure has such character & leaves you with a sense of pride for being English I love visiting this place especially via a River Trip on the Thames

Amazing bridge!. The bridge is amazing. We went up into the towers because we had a London Pass. The glass floor made my daughter feel queasy. It was a strange feeling to have the cars so far below you. We enjoyed the bridge but without the London Pass would not have paid the extra money to to up in the towers

Exhibition was fantastic, view was superb!. We went in free to the exhibition as we bought the London Pass. Wanted to skip it but it was one of the few attractions that closed slightly later (5.30pm), so we went for it after visiting Tower of London nearby. The staff there were very welcoming, gave us necessary information like what time the bridge would open that day. We went all the way up and walked the bridge, and it does give you temporary jitters when you look down to the busy traffic through the glass floor. The exhibition was very educational, and despite our dismal knowledge of energy conversion, we marvelled at the engineering and the people behind the operation of the bridge. A typical walk around takes about an hour and a half, and we stopped by the Christmas markets nearby to fuel up. Pity we didn't have a chance to see the bridge in the day though, we are sure it will be magnificent as well

Iconic London!. The Tower Bridge is a London icon. It is great to see and if you are lucky enough you will see them raise the drawbridge! My timing was perfect as the drawbridge was raised while I was there, which made it even more enjoyable. The weather was nice so it was perfect!
Iconic. Instantly known all over the world an iconic monument a credit to British engineering seeing it lit up at night is breathtaking
Fantastic Views!. The view of the tower bridge walking alongside the river is amazing, the view on the tower Bridge looking at London I'd even better. Definitely worth a visit if visiting London.
Unique. Very impressive. Great view over the Thames. Great just walking over this beautiful bridge with all the history in mind. A musthaveseen and musthavedone.
A must see :). A walk on the Tower bridge is a must see. When you have good weather you have excellent view. Afterwards a nice meal in one of the many restaurants...

London from a different angle. What a great experience we had visiting Tower Bridge. Its definitely worth paying the extra money to go to the top of the bridge and walk over. The views of London from this different angle are superb, enabling you to look up and down the river Thames from mid river ! An added bonus was the glass floor where you could watch the traffic passing you below. Make sure you go to the engine house as well. As an engineer I found it fascinating how the bridge lifts to let traffic through ... Engineering genius. An easy 5 stars *****
Big bridge. Big bridge on the river Thames, interesting to see when it opens but not the best thing I have ever seen

My favourite bridge in London . Since I was a little girl I was seeing this bridge in magazines' photos and adverts. It is beautiful. You should try to watch it from distance and walk on it. Years ago there used to be a little show (about how it was made) also inside one of its towers and it was very interesting. I hope it still exists.

Meh. Not really worth the 20 some dollars for entry. Friendly/knowledgeable staff that are easily identifiable. There's a glass floor you can walk on and see below. Other than that I would suggest just walking across the lower part or checking it out from a boat. Not nearly as old as it looks. The interior is metal. The exterior is all for show. Engine room was pretty slick though.

Spectacular Landmark!!!. One of the most impressive English Victorian engineering and a must see sight during the day or night!!! The bridge exhibition is a must, especially with the newest walk-in glass flooring installed on the top of the towers!!! No doubt a spectacular landmark in London!!!
Amazing views . Great place to visit with amazing views. Nice walk ways on bridges. Very safe anytime of day. Would highly recommend going there.

Amazing engineering!. I was most impressed with the engine rooms underneath the bridge which really did it for me, but the tour was great and interesting to see how the bridge is really just a steel bridge inside!
Great stroll through history.. We walked along the Thames, across the bridge to the Tower of London. The bridge is magnificent, especially at night. Lots to see and do.
Majestic Bridge. Great to walk across the bridge. A great place to take the panoramic picture is from the City Hall. I would strongly recommend it.

Memorable. It is the history associated with this bridge that attracted me to it and the fact it is right beside eth tower of London.It is worth the walk across it but I would have loved to see it opening but that was not to be on this trip which was a typical winter day in London that is light rain.
A memorable feature. Just passing by is memorable. The beauty of the structure is impressive. Worth waiting to see it open... impressive!

Beautiful bridge!. The bridge was build in late 1800's. It is a beautiful piece of architecture. You can walk over the bridge to Tower of London over the River Thames. There is a fee if you want to go the towers on the bridge.

Picturesque place, Glass Floor is amazing. If you go to see Tower Bridge, then watching the exhibition also makes sense. It wouldn't cost much, and will give you nice view from the top of the bridge with transparent glass floors.

You have to see it, but really- it is just a bridge.. You have to stop by and take the selfie... But really, it is just a bridge. Give it a good and walk across. Enjoy the experience while you are on the way somewhere else.

Beautiful and Magical, I never saw the Nice Building Art...... I feel more LIBERTY when I walk along the Tower Bridge with in your Hearth : God Save the Queen .....I'm British , I'm Free and I like to travel a lot around the world.

Childhood memory revisited. Last time I stood at the gap between the road ways was 70 years ago with my late father, unlike today it was not possible then to visit the inside workings of the bridge, it has to be one of the bargain visits in London. From the walk ways between the towers to the engine room I was like a kid on Christmas morning, I will take my grandchildren when they visit from Canada I am sure they will be in awe.
WAS LUCKY. It was one of that moments that i was lucky , the bridge was opening for river traffic , it was huge and slow :)

Nice view. Glad that I was up on the bridge and saw the view through the glass floor. Felt very exciting. There was some information about state-of-art bridges around the world. Good info for my future travel. Don't miss the engine room at basement. Some history and giant machines there.
A dream. My wife and i visited the Tower bridge which was a dream for us , we were happy to be there . It's one of the best places to visit in the world .
Real Life Fairy Tale - Tower Bridge. It was amazing to see this beautiful bridge - up-close and personal. Amazing architecture in the two towers. Lot of vehicle and pedestrian traffic.
Lovely, and in blue, the way the Queen commands !. One of the must-do sightseeings. If you can get a tour which includes some history, you will hear incredible stories about the bridge

A good attraction to view London from a different angle. . This was a good one to see if you don't have a lot of time if there's no queue. There is a lot of info if you want it but you can go through quite quickly in need.

Not The London Bridge. The Westminster area holds the London eye, London bridge, tower bridge and big Ben. There is alot to see and do in this area. While you're walking towards the London Eye don't get trapped by the first people trying to sell you tickets to the boat tours. Walk past the London eye and on your left towards the river you will see a ticket booth for boat rides. They have many more options from what the other people have to sell to you. Oh and stay away from the London eye/coke-a-cola cruise. Horrible.
Spectacular!. The bridge is absolutely spectacular structure, whether you see it at night or day, definitely must see and enjoy the view!

Beautiful landmark. Buy your tickets online to save!This exhibit won't take you long to see. You ride the elevator up to the observation deck and are able to walk the length of the bridge (complete with glass floor!) from up above. Your admission also includes a self-guided tour of the engine room. To view this, you must ride back down to the street level, walk outside, cross the bridge, and down the stairs to get there. Many people didn't even go because it's easy to forget that there's more that's included with your admission (since it isn't inside the bridge itself).It's worth seeing the bridge both during the day and also at night. And if you're lucky you'll get to see the bridge opening. The staff made a big deal of announcing to anyone passing by that the bridge would be opening that day at 3:30pm because it doesn't happen very often.To get great pics of this bridge (including other landmarks in the background), stand on Westminster Bridge or London Bridge.

Stunning & Magnificent piece of history!. Stunning & Magnificent, especially when viewed at night. I could stare at this all day long. Make sure to take a stroll past and pop into one of the cozy pubs nearby for a pint or two!
Tower bridge tour. we went to a really interesting tour of the bridge and its workings, a great tour, but lots of stairs.

Amazing at all times of the day!!!!!. It is an amazing bridge, still cannot decide if I liked it more during day light or night time. Don't miss it if you ever be in London. Just walk next to Thames and have this as a backround of your pics before you cross it. Just amazing!!
Very beautiful. The bridge is particularly beautiful at night with its blue lights, but impresses during the day as well. It is a bit smaller than I have expected.
In Oz we have some pretty incredible bridges........... However this one even opens!!! Beautiful scenery, taking great photos of this monumental bridge is easy, a must see.

Its a must in London!!. Your trip will not complete if you'r not visit Tower Bridge.Its a symbol or icon of London.Its a most visited and famous bridge in the world.This bridge is located near Tower of London and a short walk from Borough Market.Its look awesome at night with lights on.Its easy to get in there with undergrounds tubes.Its worth a visit!!!!

The most famous bridge in Europe!. It is a must see thing in London.Beautiful architecture and a great spot for pictures!Avoid rush hours and weekends cause it is packed with tourists trying to get the same backround for their photo, so it can be a little uncomfortable, but the same thing applies for all the famous touristic attractions.If you are lucky you may see the bridge opening when a high boat passes through!

A must do for central London. Surely you've seen pictures but it's every bit as cool in person. Arrive early and remember your camera. The walk up to the crystal bridge is nice, some great sights and story behind it. The walk across is fantastic with some amazing views. All in all its worth it. Also worth a view if you have time is the lower level inner works. It's very impressive to see the equipment needed to operate this massive structure.

You know Your in London when you see the Bridge. It was a rainy day but it was also our first full day in London and walking along the Thames and seeing this bridge was a great way to start our visit.

Good value attraction. Purposely visited to walk the glass floor and not disappointed. As someone who is not good with heights , it was a bit of a heart stopper but worth it - twice! Bit confused as you exit as to where the coffee shop was in relation to the 'engine room' , but found a friendly coffee shop close by. Tip , book in advance for a small price saving and ticket is 'usable' all day.

Amazing bridge and a bit scary walk on the glass walkway. Enjoyed the walk towards the bridge, its view but the most amazing (and scary) was a walk on the glass walkway. Rather interesting and enjoyable :)

GREAT FAMILY DAY OUT. Steeped in lots of history. Well worth a visit but give it time to get the most out of your experience. Not a place to run around and see briefly. Will definitely take about three hours to view it properly.

Excellent architecture..do visit the top level. The iconic Tower Bridge is centrally located in London and is fabulous monument..It is few metres away from Tower of London..very windy on and around the bridge, so ladies and gentleman, do carry your provisions for warming..I was lucky enough to see the bridge open 4 times..try to be at the very first row when the bridge opens..amazing feeling

An iconic monument, that doesn't disappoint.. The bridge itself has so much history. If you have kids, look up the "treasure hunt" you can do on the bridge, it keeps them engaged and looking around. At night, it is beautifully lit, and offers nice views. There are large pedestrian section on each side to stroll along and snap pictures.
Night view is mindblowing!!. I would recommend to visit in the evening and enjoy the view for few hours so you can capture the best pics with lights on!!

Much better than expected!. We used a 2for1 to get 1 adult ticket free and managed to pick up a minicar which gave 10% off for our kids' tickets. I expected it to be just a walk way but there were alot of information on the bridge and other interesting bridges all around the world. My daughter got really excited over the 'glass' walkway which allowed her to see to the street level below.Do take your time to watch the videos along the walkway as they will explain to you how the bridge works and there is also a screen to inform you when the bride will open during the next couple of days. We went around sunset and managed to catch spectacular views of Tower of London as the skys changed from light to dark. There are also small windows that allow you to stick your camera out to take better pictures of River Thames.
Touristy site. Get across the river for better pictures. Went to tower bridge twice. If you want to get a good view and a nice picture. get across the river ( the borough market side).

Great. Great view from the top. Great scenery surrounding it. Marvellous foodies surrounding the area. Romantic place even if you have children with you. Not to be missed when you are in London. Easy to get by also.
a must see. tower bridge is one of the symbols of London. there's is nothing to do here but admire the bridge and take a photo of it but you'll want to visit London tower anyway so get there.
Good place to visit. If you have time, one must visit this.. walking on the glass is an amazing experience but not even closer to walking on the SKYWALK at GRAND CANYON. Don't skip the engine room.

Just can't take my eyes off it ! too beautiful!. The day i visited the Tower Bridge is a sunny day! Its just next to the Tower of London. It's too beautiful that i couldn't stop taking photo of it! It is a landmark of London and i think nobody should miss it!

Great fun . We had buy 1 get 1 free tickets thanks to the days out booklet on network rail. We really enjoyed the tour, the glass floor was great fun & the tour very informative. You also get amazing views of the city & the River Thames.
love it. just love to hang around the tower bridgeand at night it has a very cool lightningmust-see in london

Victorian Engineering Marvel. Had a family ticket for under £30. The lift ride up is a tight squeeze. The tour was well signposted. The tour design made the most of the utilitarian building built for work only. There was a bridge exhibition. The glass walk ways above the bridge looking onto the street below was scary but showed off the wonder of the scale of the design. We couldn't quite understand how the steam engine lifted the bridge bollards but there in lies the mystery of the engineering feat. Must do for young teens doing an engineering degree.

Good, But Could Easily Be Better. I've always wanted to see Tower Bridge. It wasn't until I visited that I discovered you can actually enter the bridge. Exciting!The views were the best part. All around the Thames from high above the bridge. Not to mention 2 different places where the floor has been cut out and replaced with glass, so you can walk above the road and water below.The way the history of the bridge was presented was disappointing. It was summarized information presented multiple times in different areas. Always the same, never even worded differently. I say, if you don't have much to say about the bridge, then just say what you can and play on what you've got. The views, the raising of the bridge, play it up and make it seem like the best bridge in the world! That's what I thought when I entered the bridge...As a university student, the engine rooms didn't do anything for me. Sure not everyone knows what steam and hydroelectric power are, some schools probably find it very useful, but I learned all of that years ago. The coolest part there was the scale of the machines.Tower Bridge is relatively cheap and give a neat perspective on the city. They need to improve their information centers and play with what they've got, but not bad at all.I'd say definitely worth a look if you're in the area.
historic bridge. must see for visitor to london When it was built, it was was the largest and most sophisticated balance bridge ever completed
Great place to visit . One of my favorite place att all the time been there so many times with my friends and family love it a place for taking Picture ;) especially selfie

The glass-floored walkway is awesome!. Wonderful tour. Self guided tour with lost of historical markers to read. Amazing views of the city and the river Thames. A section of the elevated walkway is glass-bottomed for a simple thrill. Definitely take the extra time to visit the engine room to see the draw bridge controls in operation.
Highly recommended. Lot of fun and very interesting. Walking over the glass walkway was enjoyed by all the family. If you are at Tower of London then definitely worth doing this as well.

beautiful. Didn't do a tour or anything, just walked across. Its a really beautiful place, a must see while in London. We got to see the drawbridge go up for a boat to go under, which was really cool!

Interesting visit. Had a interesting visit up to the walkways of tower bridge. There are lots of information boards to read about the history of the bridge. There are a few videos to watch but which are quite short. The engine room tour is short too and just includes the two old steam engines the walk way with the glass see through is the most fascinating part and is quite fascinating
My favourite part of London. This is beautiful day and better at night. You can walk all the way to the London eye from here passing shops and markets

The stand out monuments in London. These tower bridge is the most stand out monument in london, I went up the bridge where they have recently put up a glass flooring , the glass flooring is so nice, one can see the bridge open from the glass. I just made it on time to see that. The entire tower Bridge experience is excellent.

Loved it. . Did this yesterday and loved it. The place closes by 4:30pm. So plan your trip accordingly. Very well laid out, breathtaking views especially through the glass bridge, cute gift store, and stickers for the littles. We really enjoyed our trip

Free with London Pass. This is a quick stop that is free with your London Pass, and it is appealing to three kinds of people - 1) History Buffs who want to learn more about one of the most recognized bridges in the world 2) Photography Buffs who want some fantastic pictures of and from the bridge and 3) Insane people who want to walk across a clear plexiglass floor so they can see the river below them. NOT for the acrophobic! (There's not a way to walk across the bridge and avoid the see-through part) The attendants are very nice and one was quite willing to tell me stories to try to distract me from the weakness in my knees and my stomach threatening to rebel. Attraction includes a short video that tells the history of the bridge and pictures and information on other famous bridges around the world.
An iconic part of British history!. Every visitor must visit here!Best viewed from a boat on the Thames but also fairly good from nearby streets.
Sightseeing. Enjoyed the London bridge experience, not to sure of glass floor(lol) didn't have to wait too long either well worth the visit.
Great a night. I like going here at night as it is light up and looks great and good photo moment and worth the trip

More to see and do than one would think!. Visiting the Tower Bridge is more than just walking across or taking a photo of a bridge. They have a visitor centre, gift shoppe, and exhibits. It's informational and educational as well. The views of the area, River Thames, and Tower of London are really good from the bridge. Don't miss the old steam room exhibits while you're there. Very cool stuff. This is near the Tower of London, so makes a great combo day trip.

Great views - Don't miss a visit to the Engine room. This is a surprisingly rewarding attraction to visit as it is such a unique building. The views are spectacular, the glass floor is a talking point and has everyone smiling.The engine room is an excellent example of historian engineering prowess. Great trip and views at a much fairer price for adults and families than the Shard.

Tower Bridge Experience. This was one brilliant experience but not necessarily for the faint hearted with no head for heights! Always loved this bridge but never before have l been over the public walkway which is now open to the public. Beware though as there is a glass floor to walk over. Brilliant but scary. Information is good, staff knowledgeable and display's interesting. Great views and looking down onto the road amazing. There is a Fair amount of walking to be done but lifts available to get you up and down from the walkways, which l would add are covered. Tower Hill your nearest station. Look out for 2for1 vouchers. Do try it and also make yourself a postcard with your own image on it. Will go again.
Great views especially when the bridge opens.. Go for the experience of walking across the glass floor between the two side Towers. The machinery room was interesting, great displays

good value for money. The visit to the glass floor . Like walking in thin air but great once you get over the psychological fear It was most interesting learning about how the bridge was built. Also to see the inner workings of the boiler room and the sheer size of the original method of opening the bridge. Well worth the £9 you can get a postcard with your self on it and various back images for £3 .great views of the river too.
Best viewed at night. Loved visiting the tower of London. Really pretty at night. There is also a little excellent bar underneath it with excellent view of the thames. really romantic setting.

Worth the price. Worth the money to go upstairs. The bridge itself is really cool on the outside but when you go upstairs it gets even better. Great views of the city, a fun display of other unique bridges around the world and oh did I mention the GLASS FLOOR?! It's cool, trust me pay the 7 pounds and go up, you won't regret it.

Nice to look at. It's a nice piece of history and nice to look at and walk over and take a photo in front of but that's about as far as I got with it.Its right opposite the Tower of London so it was easy to get to afterwards.Not sure if I would go out of my way to just see the tower bridge though.

Nice double act to tie up with a trip to HMS Belfast or Borough Market. The visit here is about an hour, 90 mins max so not the longest but it is worth it especially if you do it either side of lunch and combine with Borough Market or HMS Belfast nearby. Do contact them in advance to get the bridge opening schedule as being up the top when the bridge opens and boats go under is worth the entrance fee!The kids loved the glass bottomed floor, lying down watching everything go underneath you is brilliant.Going up top is definitely the best way to see Tower Bridge. Don't forget afterwards to go down into the engine rooms where the old steam lifting gear is held!

Beautiful Tower Bridge by the night. One of the famous bridge in the world, if you have time visit it by the night, and don't forget to make a pictures there! Its awesome! If you're lucky, you'll see cruise ship passing by it and the bridge will open it

Went over the Tower Bridge on a tour. Amazing structure. We went on the Hop and off Tour bus, and we over the Tower Bridge several times. This is a fantastic bridge, with so much history. Being on a tour, means you get to listen to the information about the bridge, when built, etc.

Great view of the city and glass pavement eyedrop. This is a quick tour, something that can be done in under an hour. The main attraction is the view of the city and the glass floor your can witness from the top walkways. The original engine room is also quite fascinating.Note: stroller friendly (the Tower of London is not).

Great views from the top. This is an prominent London landmark, which you can climb up through to experience views over the Tower of London and along the Thames. Although it is an all weather attraction, picking a clear day will help with the views. You can also visit the engine room where the bridge was originally controlled from - although electric motors operate the bridge when required now.

Amazing views of London. This is a great experience. The views from the upper walkways are fantastic, with a view across the East of London then a view across the city. Too walk over the glass floor and see the River Thames, traffic and boats way beneath your feet is awesome. We also visited the machine rooms and admired the workmanship of the steam pistons.Plenty of information is close at hand to let you know what you are looking at and a brief history of the items. Also such good value.
First trip up tower bridge. Great experience to see the whole of London from the top of the bridge. Interesting facts that we never knew before. Didn't quite expect what we saw! Great trip!

Towering over the Thames. An amazing feat of engineering from Victorian Britain. Well worth the walk over the glass floor platform if you dare!

a most lovely sight, and a nice walk over the bridge. while visiting the tower you must enjoy the lovely view of the tower bridge. try walking across, whtching the views on the Thames river...
Amazing view. Looks amazing during the day, but stunning at night...I would recommend taking some sort of boat cruise to get a better view, and if you are lucky, you will see the bridge open

scary . We went into the tower Bridge experience. £20.30 for a family of four was a bargain,you can't find much to do in London for a family of four for that price. The children were given passports and had to collect stickers at various points throughout the tour. The glass floor was scary but brilliant and the children were given 'I did it' stickers when they walked over. There is wooden floor either side of the glass for the faint hearted. The history talks are only short which is ideal if you have children with you. Fantastic trip.
Always beautiful. One of my favourite places in london but like it better at night. When it's not very crowded. Been here million times but will not miss a time to go again..
GOOD VIEW. Really loved Tower Bridge, our bus tour drove over it with perfect views of the River. I always love to go here on every trip to London, its a must.

Very well done, interesting and a little thrilling. I also liked the exhibition on other famous or interesting bridges - it's typically English to be modest and share the glory. The glass floor is a bit of a thrill and I'm sure kids would love it. The engine rooms are fascinating. The whole thing is very, very well done.

Iconic landmark. Walk across this iconic landmark after visiting the Tower of London or the Globe Theatre. We didn't go up the towers but the bridge offers great photo ops and is a must see attraction!

foto a zeffunne, a beverune, a migliara!! (A lot of photographs). Sarebbe perfetto se non fosse per la "zozzimma" che pervade il Tamigi. It would be perfect if there were not all of that filth all over the Tamigi.

Fun Experience and Great Views. When we discovered that glass walkways had been installed on the upper level of Tower Bridge, we immediately added this experience to our Bucket List. I will say that it was also really amazing to actually walk on the iconic Tower Bridge. On a clear day, the views are amazing. If you choose to do this, I encourage you to download the free Raise Tower Bridge app. Once up on the walkway, you point your phone at the Raise Tower Bridge poster (on floor) and watch a simulation of the bridge being raised as if you are watching it through the glass floor. It was pretty cool! You can also check the schedule of when there will be an actual bridge lift so you can watch it live though I do not know if you can see it from the walkway during the lift. We visited in early November in the late afternoon and had no wait. We bought our tickets at the bridge although you can purchase them online in advance. There was a steady handful of tourists on the walkway. Due to our limited time, we were only interested in experiencing the Glass Walkway so we did not complete the actual Tower Bridge Exhibition Tour. You must walk down one side of the bridge and then back the other in order to exit via the elevator. You will miss the Gift Shop if you skip the Engine Room part of the tour. For security reasons, fast track entry may not be available. Once we got up to the Glass Walkway, it was fun watching different peoples reaction to standing on the glass. Some would not step on it at all while others had no fear. We were able to get a Bridge employee to take our picture as we squatted low on the glass so he could get both us and traffic below in the photo. In addition to taking photos, I took some videos to give my friends a better idea of what it was actually like watching the traffic move below while seeing people's feet as they walk across the glass. I will tell you that we enjoyed this experience very much and highly recommend it. We walked over from the Tower Hill Underground Station after a nice man pointed us in the right direction to exit the station. Once we got to the Bridge, we just followed the signs.

Worths a visit. Tower Bridge together with london's eye, big ben and the central streets (regent, oxford) with the classic taxes, double deck red buses and red postmails are the most picturesque places to see..

Stunning. A definetely must visit in London. It is worth going in the day and in the night. Great views from the river and from the bottom.

The best bridge in London!. I see it from boat and from bus and Tower Bridge is marvellous. Unique. The best view is from Thames. You must get out on Tower station and walk through the bridge and then go to the boat near Tower station.

The iconic London bridge. Just like Big Ben, the London Eye and so many other attractions in London, the Tower Bridge is another of London's finest and most memorable attractions. Quick but must-see London stop!. This is my favorite daytime attraction in London! As iconic as the British Parliament and the London Eye, the Tower Bridge is yet another recognizable symbol for the British capital. If you didn't witness it, you probably didn't know that it's also a movable bridge!Constructed in the late 1800s, the Tower Bridge was built as both a bascule (movable bridge) and a suspension bridge which the cables are linked to the namesake towers. The walkways between the towers were meant for pedestrians when the bridge was up, but because of the hassle that involved moving up and then down, people rather wait for the bridge to go down again. Hence, the walkway was virtually abandoned...until it became a tourist attraction!The walkway exhibit shows the history of the Tower Bridge with its facts and data and the roster of impressive bridges around the world. Aside from the great view of the Thames east and west of the bridge, a small part of the walkway floor is also glass! Your admission also includes the engine room that has an imitation engine, which shows how the drawbridge works, so you can see that aside from being a beautiful icon, Tower Bridge is also an engineering fest!This is a quick stop that can be finished in an hour or less for only £9, but it is nonetheless a site that I would highly recommend visiting as a London tourist especially before or after your Tower of London trip!---tl;dr version:1) Walkway exhibit of Tower Bridge history and other bridges in the world2) Great view of the Thames and even a glass walkway portion3) Highly recommended short stop especially with Tower of London

Glass floor view. This was another treat in London. Again and again we are awed by the landmarks in London. The glass floor took a minute to have the nerve to walk on it but when we did it was amazing

Amazing. Well worth a visit. The glass floor is such an adrenaline rush and the history of the bridge is something to be proud of.

Awesome experience!. Went here to go up the tower Bridge and experience the glass floor. It was well worth it. Definitely do this when you are in London. The way the bridge was made etc was really interesting. Walking on the glass floor was an awesome experience. Do this!

Fascinating . . . views . . . evacuation!. We had spent an enjoyable morning at the Tower of London. Next on our agenda was a tour of the Tower of London. We simply showed our London Passes at the ticket office and we were issued with our tickets. The hardest part of the tour involved us being crammed into a lift with many other visitors to be taken to the upper gantry of the bridge to begin the self-guided tour. There are no audio guides provided, instead you simply wander around reading the information boards and taking the views as you go. One of the highlights of the tour was walking across the glass-bottomed walkway on the upper gantry. You look straight down on the bridge’s roadway directly below you, with the river flowing under it.The final part of the tour took us down to the road level and then down into the engine room in one of the towers, below the road level. Here, we were able to view the steam engines which originally operated the mechanism used to lift the roadway sections of the bridge, to allow ships to pass.At this point our tour was cut slightly short, when an announcement came over the public address system that all visitors to the bridge needed to evacuate the bridge immediately. Apparently there was some kind of security threat! We therefore had no alternative at that stage but to leave the bridge. We were fortunate that we had virtually completed our tour. Others were not so lucky, as they had only just begun their tours.The Tower Bridge tour is a good experience which provides the visitor with some unique views and experience. Good stuff!

Great engineering. Enjoyed the workmanship of this bridge, the glass floors in the walkways are a great feature, need signs below saying look up! Engine room tour was made interesting by in period cast members acting out the run up to the opening ceremony, nope they keep this feature as it was informative and entertaining for all ages, need to have a video of the bridge working, 1 to show it opening and 1 to show the mechanics that make it happen, kids will probably enjoy this attraction.

Beautiful Colors. This is one of the most Iconic views in London and I love the way it makes me feel while standing on one of the walls of the Tower of London and staring out at the Tower Bridge much mistaken for the London Bridge

Tower Bridge Visit at Half-Term. I visited Tower Bridge in October half-term with my 9 & 15 year old daughters. There was a queue, but we got to the payment counter quickly where I bought a discounted family ticket for one adult and two children. We took the lift to the top floor where there were pictures of different types of bridges around the world and info about them. Here is where the scary transparency glass floor looking down onto the bridge and the Thames is located. If you were too scared to walk on the glass, there was the option of using the rabbit runways at the side of the glass walkway. I managed to sum up courage to walk through the entire glass walkway and to encourage my 9 year old to do the same. The 15 year old refused, but did stand in one spot on the glass for a few seconds before skipping back to the rabbit runways. Lots of tourists were on the glass taking photos.There was the option of getting back down to visit the museum by lift or taking the stairs. On the stairs there were plaques giving further information about the history of the bridge. At the top of the ceiling on the next floor down, there were models of workmen depicting what it would have been like to work on the construction of the bridge. There was an animated film showing a speed-up version of the construction of the bridge from start to finish.The museum downstairs had the original engine rooms, cisterns, wheels, etc. explaining what went into lifting the bridge for tall ships. There was a small cinema showing a film on the history of maintaining the bridge, and some activities for the kids to draw and pull/turn knobs, as well as a digital quiz. This section lead to the usual gifts/mementos shop.

The glass walkway. Went here because of the new glass walkway, when you look up from the bridge, the glass walkway looks small but when you get up there, the glass area is quite big.Quite a lot of steps before you reach the glass walkway but it was worth it.
