Beautiful. This is such a beautiful bridge. Definitely worth a visit and make sure you go at night also, they light it up with beautiful blue lights. If you have time, take the short tour as it is not too expensive and is interesting.
Bicycled across bridge. Were on a bicycle tour of London and crossed the tower bridge at Rush Hour! Thrilling! It was at dusk and the lighting of the bridge was impressive!

An Experience. This is one of London's best visits. Not only can you go up to the top of the Bridge and walk along the upper parts but you can look down through the glass floor. It also has engine rooms, an exhibition and if you don't mind stairs, a really Victorian climb to the top!
amazing design. Another london icon that you have to see just once. There isn't much else to say- I didn't pay the fee to go uptop at the viewers deck - I did not think it was worthwild.

Such an interesting landmark. What a great surprise our visit was! We have only recently discovered that you can go into the bridge and see the workings, also walk across on partial glass floors. At £9 per adult we felt it was good value for money and there is interesting information posted all around the attraction as well as guides.

Not what you think it is. Tower Bridge iss often called London Bridge. This is incorrect. The last London Bridge is surprisingly in Arizona (USA). The current Lodon Bridge was bulit in the 1970s. Tower Bridge dates from the Victorian era (1800s). So far it's done the job for over 100 years and it's still going sgtrong.
It's OK but!. At least you can say you have to the top of Tower Bridge otherwise not such a spectacular event. Would I bother? Just to say you have done it.

Favourite Bridge In London. I love this bridge, it always stands out to me whenever we are in London, it looks so different and there's something special about it, I always seem to take a few pictures whenever we go past it. The tour inside the bridge is very cheap especially if you match it with the Monument so it is a good deal!It was very quiet when we visited and need to go again to experience the glass floor, this attraction is quite unknown in my opinion, many were shocked that you could go inside the bridge, it is a must do!!

Awesome. I was lucky enough to be visiting the bridge and whilst there, there was a 62 gun salute for Prince Charles birthday. I was amazed how beautiful this place is and plenty to see and lovely views.
A bridge. Fun to walk across but just another one of the cool sites to see in this city. It's worth taking the time to walk it.

When you want to take a walk... Walk on this beauty :). I took a walk solo on this magnificent bridge. I always love those walks. Get off the Tower Hill tube and walk all the way to the London Bridge tube station. On the way, don't forget to take a selfie on this beautiful landmark. :)

A London Icon!. Tower Bridge truly is a London icon, you will have seen it in so many films and TV shows.
It is fantastic to drive or walk along, offering great views of the Thames. (been a couple of years since my last visit)

Stunning. The most stunning bridge across the Thames. I viewed and photographed the bridge via a ferry trip to and from Grenwich, it really is a sight to see. Next visit to London I will make certain to find the time to walk across it.
tourist visit. there is a great activity that consist of walking over a glass floor at the top of the tower bridge you have to pay a small fee but it is so worth it!

Iconic landmark on the Thames. Tower Bridge is one of most attractive place all over London. You need to walk over it and enjoy magnificent views of Thames River & Tower of London nearby. Plus you can enjoy the Tower Bridge exhibition (historical information about the bridge) which allows you access to the upper part of the bridge (ticket required). But the exciting part of the bridge having a glass floor, which recently opened to public. Just go for it and you would love to enjoy.

massive structure. after visted the tower of londoni ha a slow walk toward the tower bridge , it was 1 of the massive icon bridge that i had seen out of asian countrieswithin this icon bridge , there are alot of interestin landmark and tourist places for u to visitn of course it a nice place to take some selfie out of it

Marvellous. Tower bridge is the most iconic structures of London besides Big ben and London Eye. Was quite surprising to know that it is made of steel although it appears to be made of stone. Must visit the exhibition at tower bridge. They can provide details about the passing of a ship through the bridge

Cool engineering! . We did not expect there was this much to see in the tower bridge. Really nice walkway, 42m high, with glass floors! In most parts they kept the construction visible, so when you're interested in engineering it's a to browse around. The steam engines and well kept and there's good explanation of how they keep the bridge running.
Totally typically British. Tower Bridge is just the best bridge you will ever see over a river, beautiful to look at, grand and imposing you simply have to pay it a visit and go up to walk over

The most iconic place all over London!. Tower Bridge (and Big Ben) is definitely the most iconic place all over London. Walk over it and enjoy stunning views of Thames & London. If you are lucky, you may even catch the time that opens and see it fully opened ! There is also the Tower Bridge exhibition allowing you access to the upper part of the bridge (with tickets of course). The exhibition itself is not something special (quite small with some historical info about the bridge), but the fun here is a small part of the bridge, which recently opened to public, having a glass floor. It isn't so scary as you'd expect! Go for it and enjoy the cars passing just below your feet!

Fantastic.. I have walked over Tower Bridge countless times and it still impresses me. Such an iconic structure. The only downside is the sheer number of tourists there too.Great views over the Thames and Tower Bridge, HMS Belfast and the surrounding area.It is a must do thing when you are in London.

Iconic !. One of the truly most recognizable structures in the whole world. A definite buzz around the structure and a great viewing place to see many other landmarks especially the Tower of London which is next door. Even more impressive lit up at night so make the effort to go then.

Its quick but interesting. The new exhibit that opened at the bridge is very interesting and only takes about 15-20 minutes to go through. Make sure you get the pass that allows you to the front of the line though or you will be spending that much or more time in line waiting to get in.
A bit of history. Tower bridge, tower of london, big ben are must see attractions. Stroll across history.What you see is what you get a feat of engineerimg
Looks beautiful with tricolor lights tonight. Looks beautiful this evening, I enjoyed walking over it today even on the rain. It always looks fab at night. I have a brilliant view from my hotel room
The most famous bridge in the UK. Beautiful bridge. And iconic so it is a must visit if you're in London. While in there you can have the a scary experience: The London Bridge Experience & Tombs.
Love the glass floor. Whilst this wasn't the most engaging of attractions for kids, for the price of a family ticket well worth it just to go on the glass floor
Great views.. We didn't go into the museum here but just walked over this iconic bridge. Great views looking down the river and spotting all the landmarks. Floodlit at night which was nice to see.

Old bridge... Bridging one side of London with another. Fascinating old piece of architecture which is very interesting to look at and fine for crossing. A treat if you see the bridge allow a big boat through!

Walk between the Towers of the Thames. I used a London Pass which included this experience. I probably would not have gone without the inclusion, however having gone I would recommend going even without the London Pass. Interesting views of the city from the river.

Dream Tower Bridge !. Always used to watch Tower Bridge on BBC from my home country Bangladesh. A lot of bollywood movie scene have been shot there to create a beautiful feel to the movie. One of the most beautiful piece of Architecture thesedays. When I saw Tower bridge from the taxi was travelling in I was simply amazed ! It should be one of thr 7 wonders in the world. Many more decades of holiday attraction for many more millions of people around the world !
Must visit it!. We visited it at night and it was amazing - the areas around it have been renovated and are full of life and entertainment!
Self guided tour. Great history here, as to how and why the bridge was build also an added tour of the motor rooms that power the bridge. Great folks working here very helpful and full of knowledge.

Wonderful landmark on the Thames. Walking along the banks of the Thames, this is a landmark which you cannot miss. You can view this from either side of the bridge, or by taking a river trip. What is spectacular is being close by whilst the bridge is opened certain times of the day to allow boats to go through. There is a glass walkway which has been added as an attraction but is not for the faint hearted. Do not miss seeing this attraction, All along the Southbank there is so much to see, history after history. Add this great location to your itinerary
So colorful! Loved it. The bridge was bright blue and a visual beauty. I just loved to look at it from every view I could. So unique

Walk across the Bridge. The London Pass includes a tour of Tower Bridge. If you are going to the Tower it is an easy addition to your visit. The original machinery of the bridge are like works of Victorian art. The view from the top walk also is worth it especially on a clear day.
wonderfull. this one of London's great sites either fro the river by boat going under or by car going over to think when it was built is to honour are builders of thr past

Deserving of its fame. The Tower bridge is one of the most famous bridges in the world, and one of the top attractions of London, and it is well deserved. A must-see when you visit the city. Great for taking pictures, best on a sunny day.

If you are in london you must see this bridge. When you got out of the Metro station with a very short walk you reach there.It is built years ago but kept very well.If you want to have more idea abot tower bridge you must read some information before your visit there.Especially a rainy day is not a good idea to visit this nice place.

ICONIC. People tend to think there isn't much to do around the bridge but there's loads if you're into history. Obviously there's the Tower of London right next door but there's also a lot of Jack the Ripper walking tours right here. Do both or maybe even all three. All I'll say is that I used to live nearby and when walking over the bridge after a long day at work it was so frustrating when the bridge went up so boats could pass underneath... but small problem I suppose. Takes around 10 minutes to go up and down again.

London Post Card. This is a must in London.This is the prettiest bridge in London. You can take the paid tour and visit the works inside the bridge that will make lift so the bigger boats can get by. You can also visit the glass floor walk at the top where you can stand at 120 ft from the water and appreciate the Thames and views around it. Like I always say..........Gotta see it.........
Tower bridge. A must to experience, the staff are very friendly and knowledgeable which always helps and the glass bridge is great for the kids
A great place to go visit. If you are going to The Tower of London you must do the tour at Tower Bridge! Very reasonable priced and steeped in history.
A London must. You always see this iconic bridge in films etc. I thought it was cool, like what Brooklyn bridge is to NYC. Amazing architecture.
A great view. The attraction is quickly finished but worth doing. On top of the brighe you'll haveA great view of the Thames and city.
Place to remember. Beautiful place specialy with a sunny day nice back ground for taking memorable photos in heart of London
Great Spot for Pictures. Sadly, we didn't get close enough to walk across or take the best pictures, but wow! This bridge is stunning and iconic! At least stop by for a pic or two.

Breathtaking monument for architectural connoiseurs. This is one of the most famous attractions of London which every visitor should see. A great monument, fantastic piece of architecture coupled with engineering brilliance. Walk along this bridge gives a nice 360 degree view of the heart of London

Quite a site!. We took the tour of the bridge, including riding up in the elevator to the walkways across, where there are GLASS FLOORS on part of it - quite scary to step out onto those while looking down at traffic and the river below, but well worth it. Views of this part of London are good from here too.

Engeneering master piece, long live London bridge. Must visit place and nice places to hangout around the bridge and you can walk and feel the vintage by reading the history. Nearest underground- towerhillThere are many places to eat near the bridge and just go near side of Thames near the bridge where you can spend bery nice and beautiful time. You can sit down relax and varities of food available and take some photos and selfies. From dere you can see the tallest building of Europe.

Good to see the inside of this landmark. The Experience explains the history of the bridge and has posters about other 'iconic' bridges in the world and these are quite interesting but for me it was about the view, the glass floor and the old lifting mechanisms.The staff at the bridge were great; with nice lift guys and videos by the bridge engineer. These people made the visit something special!The whole thing took about 2 hours so for me, especially with the online discount, this was excellent value.
Looks beautiful at any time of the day. It really looks beautiful at any time - morning, noon and even at night with all the lighting. Had a nice walk at night last week.

View from the top. We had a very interesting visit up to the top of Tower Bridge. There are clear, well written, illustrated information boards which tell some of the history of bridges across the Thames. The views are really good, looking both ways along the river. The glass walkway is not for everyone but you can bypass it if you need to. There were some imaginative photos being taken as people went across. The tour ends with a visit to the Victorian engine rooms which again have clear informative panels explaining the working of the engines.
Fabulous. Much larger than in pictures. Beautifully lightEd in blue. Next to Tower of London. Great views to both sides of Thames river.

To paraphase Richard Nixon, this is indeed a bridge.... but it's a gorgeous bridge affording you a great view of the Thames and Central London to the West. There is an attraction allowing visitors to walk across a glass bottomed walkway from the upper deck for a fee, but for exactly zero quid you can walk out and enjoy it almost just as well.

TOWER BRIDGE trip at NIGHT.... AMAZING VIEW!. We stayed at an apartment near the TOWER BRIDGE. Hence, we used this opportunity to have a walkabout at night time along the River Thames nearby the TOWER BRIDGE. What a view!! The night was glittered with amazing lighting. Must visit at this time of the day!
Go at night!. I'd definitely suggest visiting this attraction during the day and at night because it is a sight to behold!

Time your visit to see the bridge being raised!. Visiting London this is an iconic symbol which is immediately recognisable. The bridge is a marvel of Victorian engineering and stands as testimony to our innovative forebears. If you get a chance take a Tower Bridge Tour and go up onto the walkways above to see an amazing panoramic view of the area. If you are lucky, the bridge may be raised when you are there which is impressive.One disappointment is the traffic streaming across the bridge, but I guess that is London.....
Amazing amazing. A beautiful sight to behold. Next to Big Ben one of the best things to see here in London. A wonderful experience for me & my wife.

Another Iconic Point.. The bridge over the Thames is over 100 years old and a fine easily recognisable structure amongst others. It is a delight to look at from a distance and also enjoy as one walks across from vehicle level but also from the high walkways. The Exhibition is well worth a visit to capture the full atmosphere and the inner workings.

My Show Case!. I love to show off this bridge to friends and family and take every opportunity to do so by going up the river on the Thames Clipper from Greenwich to the Embankment or vice versa! Either way you approach one of the most famous bridges in the world and furthermore you pass under it! Some people call it "London Bridge", mistakingly, but it is London's 'show case' and an easy mistake to make! I have driven across this bridge several times, but the best way to enjoy the experience is to go by river, the latest being a few weeks ago when I travelled down the river from the Embankment with two friends from Canada who were doing a whirlwind 24 hour of London! Tower Bridge never fails to impress! I love it!

Great view. The tower bridge really is something to see if you like architectural masterpieces. There is a lot of space to walk on it beside the road. Also it provides a great panorama of centre London, it being right on top of the Thames. Great sight, for anyone!

One of the icons. Nice views of this magnificent bridge can be had from both sides. I like the view from the Tower, and then down stairs along the river in the hotel plaza. It's so much larger than it looks, and lots of fun to walk across. We used the London Pass here, got us into the exhibit and fast track.

One of the world's great sites !!!. This is a truly marvellous site and compliments and joins up history across the ages. It is a marvellous sight to behold during the day and becomes even more magical and marvellously illuminated at night time alongside all the other jewel boxes that line the Thames. We even saw the road bridge being raised to let a tall ship go through. It really is a special bridge !!!

World class attraction. However many times I see tower bridge , I am amazed . Daytime, nighttime , from the car , boat or from the Tower of London itself , this bridge is a privilege to live near to. Love it

Lovely. We have been to the bridge quite a few times and to be fair we stay quite close to it when we go to London.The bridge is lovely and even better by night, if your lucky like we where this year the bridge went up while we stood and watched.You can also go up and walk across the glass floored walkways and look down on the bridge, 1 adult and 2 kids was only £15Definitely worth a visit
University tour. Went with university as part of a London tour. Great views and very easy walk. A definite must see. You realise what an incredible city we live in.

MAGNIFICENT. Built since 1886, the walk by the Tower Bridge provides you experience of sorts. No matter the traffic or season, the suspended glass walkway connecting the Tower exhibits to the engine rooms are an exciting journey above the motor road which bascules open up for river vessels to pass by. Not only the Shard or the Gherkin is a great view from the bridge, the bridge's side aisles consisting of pubs, cafes and offices is a nostalgic walk of the old and new together. Either sides, the Tower Hill or London Bridge tube stations are situated and are well connected to most other tube/train lines. The epic 1000year old historical Tower of London is also just across the Thames for another venture of the past to be explored.

Historic site . It's amazing to see this work of art and the fact that it's a part of the British heritage and is still in use. Non other role this on London. So get off the tube and. Travel on land so you can see the sights and sounds of London.
Pleasant. Always a great pleasure to walk thriw this wonderfull bridge we can see a great part of London.All visitors have to stay here and watch......just watch
Love this bridge. What can I say, this is such a lovely bridge. Looks stunning at night when lit up. This is a must when in London. Can be a little busy when walking across, but well worth it.
Another London Staple. This is such a cool bridge to see. We didn't go inside of it (not sure if it is even open to the public) but we had a nice view from the river's edge by the Tower of London.

Tower Bridge......................The face of London. If you haven't had the time to visit this iconic bridge, so well known throughout the world, do it.Although only built in the late 1800's it really is a must to see.A great angle to view it from, is the promenade on the Thames just outside of the Tower of London.That way you get the best of two magnificent views, plus there are some seriously good restaurants along that route!
Dizzy heights of London. This is a great exhibition! Great for families. What a brilliant perspective if the Thames! Even better if the bridge is being raised to let a passing boat through!
Looks amazing at night. The best bridge in the world, never get fed up with the view, always looks stunning especially at night time.
best views of Thames. best views of Thames, really crowded sometimes, also nice passing over the bridge by bicycle :) If you wait enough you could see the bridge opening
Great Day Out. Can get very busy here but worth it try not buy from the venders its all cheap rubbish get a Thames boat ride great to get some great photo's & videoHave funRegardsSteve

Annual Business Party. What a grand place, and with magnificent views, we had our annual party here, and the venue were great! Memorable as well as an experience. The glass floor is a bit scary but again an experience. The staff were serving us a buffet, just a shame we had to listen to what I assume was an on duty manager moaning and stressing to the waiting staff, they appeared more refined and professional than he did!
Beautiful Bridge. What else can you say about one of the world's most iconic bridges? If you are visiting London this bridge is a must see!

Meh . I came here as part of my London pass, and wanted to tick it off my list. It wasn't anything too awe inspiring for me. I feel it would be just as good to walk across the bridge and not pay the money to explore inside.

Fascinating . For my 4 years daughter and us the most attractive in London was the Tower Bridge. It's amazing his mécanisme and the beauty. We walk up and down the bridge at least 4 times but always was lime a fist experience. We suggest to visit also the museum.

Holy Week April 2014. Fun and exhausting to bike across. Fat Tire tours was fantastic. However, they bike everyday... And my husband and I, uhhhh, well... don't. Haha! So much fun and auch a great way to really get where a big bus tour could never get to. Really special little gems of info you have to book a river bikeride pckg drom FAT TIRE to learn. I'll never give those morsels away. Honestly, it was the perfect thing to do on our last full day, before taking that super long flight back home. Dress in layers and wear a windbreaker. That river pedaling was super breezy.

Views are amazing!. We took the opportunity to walk across Tower Bridge, and then climb to the top where you can see all of London. I am not particularly fond of heights but knew this was a "must see".

Love to see it raised. Tower bridge has been an iconic part of London's scenery since 1894. We paid GBP9.00 (approxAUD$21.00) to enter the exhibition which includes the new glass floor on the upper walkway and the engine room below water level. Interesting to learn the history and how the bridge was originally raised. great views of the city, but how I would love to be there when it is raised. there is a schedule of impending raisings, but unfortunately none suited us. Well worth an hour or two
Excellent!. Recommending if you wish to know a little bit more about the world known bridge!one of the walking sides has glass floor!not of people who are scared of hights!
MUST SEE. An iconic landmark which I found best to be viewed from outside of the Tower Of London or on one of the many river tours
Worth doing once . Interesting, quick and easy and value for money, enjoyed going into the pump engine room and seeing the engineering side of the bridge

Scary glass floor. Interesting exhibition. You go up to the top and walk over the bridge. About half way along is a glass floor. Mind over matter is required to walk on it. There are lots of boards explaining the history of the bridge and also a short film. The ticket also includes entry to the engine rooms. Overall a worthwhile place to visit.

Impressive. Impressive structure. Huge monumental towers overlooking to Thames river.
You may say it is the gate of the river.
Very nice to walk underneath and around it.

Worth seeing. We enjoyed the bridge tour and it's worth going up there to look at the glass floor over the Thames and the traffic on the bridge. Neat to see the engine room and get a greater appreciation of how the bridge is raised when a boat comes through.
Picturesque!!. Amazing architecture, history. Beautiful place and a must visit to all the London tourist-ors. Easy access to the place via underground, train or bus.
Interesting visit. Really enjoyed the tower bridge experience. Well worth visiting. The glass floors are an added bonus.
Nice location . Nice place to take pictures. Gets really crowded though. Gets busy with traffic and the bridge opens up also so making more traffic

The most wonderful bridge experience ever. Tower Bridge was another great things to see. From 2015 they have a new viewing platform through which you are able to see the street, water and bridge under it. The platform is very strong and is able to sustain 5000 kg pressure power. So I think it is very safe. They are now also testing this platform in case something like a phone, tablet or laptop hits it, as this might slowly crack it. In this bridge I managed to see many other pictures with other famous bridges around the world including the Golden Gate bridge. Also you can understand how the bridge was created and hear some speeches between queen Victoria and the bridge architect. Tower Bridge is the most known bridge in the world. He has an impressive and difficult opening procedure to make every time a tall boat crosses under it, and he needs to open. The views from the bridge are extraordinary. Actually that is the best part. I should have spent more time looking at the views. You can see Gerkin, the financial centre, Shard, etc. Underneeth is very scary to watch, but I had to do it. Then I got used to the view. People underneath would never realise that we are looking at them. Its soo cool when the bridge opens. It feels like you are going to fall and die. But actually staying on the plexiglass is safer than on the wooden part. You even realise about the existence of the Butlers Wharf. 432 men were employed to build the Bridge. I even heard about the Moses Bridge, which crosses the water, in a strange way.

What a great historical place to visit. Whether you walk across the bridge at street level, across at sky level or in the bowels of the engine room, this is a great place to visit. I can recommend the tour of the old engine rooms and the glass top walk, although not for the faint hearted.

Worth a visit. We decided to visit tower bridge after leaving the Tower of London because of its locality not knowing what to expect. After doing a lap of the bridge at road level we went to the ticketing office to see if it was still open and were pretty much the last to enter, although it was closing we weren't rushed at all and in fact were encouraged to take as much time as we wanted, which was a good start. The tickets were also reasonably priced for London. The tour is basically up one tower, across the walkway and down the other tower finishing with a trip around the original engine room. Throughout the tour there are videos and information points about how and why the bridge was built, including information about other bridges in the world throughout. In the centre of the walkway there are glass panels you can stand on to look down at the water and road below. It was foggy when we went up so a limited view, although the bridge did open so we got to see it in action, which was good. Worth a visit to see one of the iconic London landmarks at a reasonable price.

An iconic piece of architecture in London. Who hasn't heard of Tower Bridge? Possibly one of the country's most well known landmark. The visit allows you to go up to the walkways between the two 'towers' where there is some information about the history of the bridge, the technology behind it and offers some amazing views of London - even on a rainy day! The glass sections in the floor offer a bit of an adrenaline buzz - even though you know you are perfectly safe! The interpretation was a little dated and could do with sprucing up a bit, but it was simple and to the point. Great value price if you have travelled by train via the Days Out website (2 for 1 on tickets to many attractions).
my best experience ever. London Bridge who don't want to see this place, is a fantastic place lovely to watch it restaurants around and ice cream to enjoy the view

Pretty bridge.. We didn't get the opportunity to walk across this very pretty bridge but took some excellent pix from the Tower of London. It is longer than I expected so we didn't have time to walk it.

Brilliant to see the inside and learn how it works. Tower bridge has always been one of my favourite London landmarks and I'm so glad we made the entirely unplanned decision to go inside. My wife and daughter took the lift while I chose the exercise option. The interior architecture is fascinating and I was also impressed at how they'd been able to fit some modern and very clean toilets in each of the stairwells! Once at the top you can walk across each of the gantries which are completely enclosed but with the addition of some little sliding windows for taking photographs. We took our time admiring the views and messing around on the glass floor before walking down the other tower and on to the museum of the old engine works. Overall a very enjoyable and interesting experience.
very pretty. most often confused as London bridge - beautiful bridge. Worth the photo opportunity and free to see
Walking. Just walked across it and it was really cool. Worth a sight and was kinda larger than I thought. Also this is the tower bridge pictured off of the London bridge crossing

The Tower Bridge. Thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the Tower Bridge, we went through a tour, but before we got to the tour, we had to stop as a boat was coming through, so we were able to witness the bridge going up, traffic stopped and the boat sailed through. Highlights were going down to the engine room, walking on the glass partitions set into the floor so you see the travel driving under you and taking a photo using the machine. Well worth theExperience
Tour. Went on river cruise under the bridge was very interesting enjoyed the views from the rice. Your guide very good City Ctuises

Super beautiful. This is a very unique and beautiful bridge. I can completely understand why it's so well known. When it's lit up at night, it looks like a Disney Princess castle, it's majestic. Walk across the bridge if you have time! It's awesome!

A must see.. The Tower Bridge (commonly misconceived as the London Bridge) is a definite attraction to visit. You can take the stairs (at least I recommend them) up to the top and walk across the glass segments at the top. Inside are some really cool photos and information panels of other famous and amazing bridges around the world. There is a series of short films depicting the bridge's design and completion at either end of the walkway. The ticket line can be a pain so if you are in a group, send one member to get all of your tickets, please. For solo travelers, good luck. Overall a must see.

Awesome by night . Great view by night when the lights come on serene walk by the river , it's quite chilly being November but amazing view from the bridge and walking towards it as you would see in the pics i have-attached.Is a lovely walk leading to tooley street and to the supermarkets ok the other side of the bridge if you walk from The tower hill station sideA further walk towards Moore avenue will lead you to the Jaime Oliver restaurant .Lovely walk so instead of doing the bus ride it's best to visit by foot across the fort and by the riverside

Worth every penny. We were fortunate... Rain stopped and afforded amazing views. I loved it!!!The glass floor delivered a thrill and great view below. We loved the photos display of other fantastic bridges around the world.

Magnificent structure. This bridge is absolutely fantastic. Go on the tour and admire the views including Canary Wharf, Tower of London and HMS Belfast. Look down on the streets below from the glass bottomed walkway (it's scary).

Interesting . One of London's favourite tourist locations, it's very close to blackfriars - London eye, Westminster. You could see the Shard from the tower, you get a presentation which tells you more about the tower Bridge. Quite cool glass floor in one of the towers.

Nice views and cool glass floor. You take an elevator up to the top. There is a new glass floor section so you can look straight down to the bridge and water below. You can walk on the glass. Interesting exhibitions on bridges around the wall and you can visit the engine room afterwards. Unfortunately we were not there when they raised the bridge. May be worth checking out when this happens

A beautiful landmark. This is a must-see in London. You may not get to see the bridge go up, but this is a beautiful piece of engineering that must be seen. I would really recommend walking here late at night, when there are a lot less people and the lights are switched on, the bridge is illuminated and is truly breathtaking.
Saturday night . A must see for all. You can't come to London and not visit this. Even more spectacular by night and highly recommended.

Waouh!!. Do it just for the fun, but a good surprise, not expensive for the tour. You can understand the story of the beginning of the bridge, the evolution and the influence. At the end of the visit there is some kid's experience open to all the visitors.

Photo Opportunity!. " the signature London Tower bridge is a must visit attraction in London.Its always busy with happy tourists and since london is a walkers paradise ..there are several attractions in the vicinity to just walk around.just watching people come and go by is an experience in itself because of the vivid cosmopolitan feel london has"
A must do.. We enjoyed this tour. An engineering marvel. Looking down at th traffic below from the glass walkway was cool.

The best bridge in the world...... What a beautiful bridge. Looks even better in person. The place was so busy when you visited. Would recommend going early in the morning. I got some amazing pictures.

So Cool !!!!. Such a beautiful Landmark. We walked the bridge at night and also viewed it by boat; both of which I recommend. The architecture was just beautiful and it is so well lit at night. It was cool to walk across it and see it up close. Next time I visit I will want to take the tour as I am sure it it worth the price of admission. This is a must see, especially at night while in London.

Good . Excellent seen all steam engine area Good views from your Staff friendly and helpful Good value for money

in awe... a must visit site.. a spacious footpath to enjoy and feel the air of london on its one of the oldest bridge!!
Phenomenal. This is an icon not to be missed. Loved going with a friend who knew the underground system well, and we walked this part of town on a lovely warm Summer's evening. Very beautiful!

A Visit to Tower Bridge. You need to be able to physically walk some distance and upstairs to fully appreciate this attraction. Found the history behind this bridge very interesting! Highly recommend.

Bit disappointing. There are always crowds; the only real presentation from a guide was given by someone for whom French may be her native language. Difficult to follow her. Very nice young woman but not the best choice for this job. I am almost always positive about what I see in London but this was really not much. And despite what I saw on someone's comment, there is indeed a charge...even with an English Heritage pass,(can't recall if this was an E. Heritage item or not anymore...)it was more than it seemed worth. As far as watching water rush below , that you can find on most bridges over the Thames if the tide is up. Save your time for the Tower of London...and all that offers.

Little disappointed.!!. I had very big expectation before visiting the tower bridge. But to me it was not so interesting. Roamed at both the sides of the river and visted the monument. I was little bored.

Bird's Eye View. Who would have thought that you can actually climb up into the top of this iconic London tourist attraction, the finest bridge in all the World? It is worth checking before you visit so you can witness the Bridge opening to allow a tall boat to go through as this only happens as and when there is a boat wishing to pass. It is thrilling when you do see it and it can be viewed rather well from the Tower of London. Photographers have a ball on this Bridge, there are so many wonderful angles to capture of the Bridge itself and it surroundings - a very special place. Tour tip: Visit the tower of London, then walk over Tower Bridge and visit HMS Belfast which is moored on the South side of the River Thames, a 3 in 1!

Another must-see site in London. After visiting the Tower of London, my wife and I did the Tower Bridge Exhibition (bought at a discounted combined ticket rate), which was only a short walk away. It was late afternoon, so no real queue to get in and we waited to access the lift (this takes about 25 people) to the first walkway level although if you don't want to wait there's stairs. This section has an introductory briefing on the bridge and its construction, then it's off to the walkways, which include large "glass" panes providing a vertical view of the bridge traffic and the Thames. Along the inner side, there's descriptions of other iconic bridges from around the world, with the other side open to provide views out to the river. Walking around to the other walkway, it's basically the same, with another glass panel, more additional bridge descriptions and an opposite side view up/down?? the river. After descending, there's a short walk outside to enter and view the engine room which provides an historic overview of the original steam driven machinery operating the bridge opening mechanisms. As it was by now about 5 o'clock, we walked along the embankment and watched the Tower light up as the sun set and dusk/evening set in - marvellous views.

Go above it, over it, or under it !. Most people don't realize that you can go up to the top of tower bridge and walk across the enclosed catwalk. As well as tour the inner workings that raise and lower the bridge. Great view up the Tames from the top. And just feet away to the east is St. Katherines Dock. Small shops, sailing barges and the Dickens Pub for lunch or dinner. Sitting next to the Tower of London, easy to get to and on many bus routes.

Must see!. Loved the tour of the Tower Bridge - they now have see through panels as in the CN Tower so you can look down and see the river rushing below. It has to be one of the most beautiful bridges ever and I could not get enough of it.
Majestic structure. Lots of great views of this iconic landmark. We viewed it from the Tower of London quay and also from the ramparts in the Tower of London. A must see.
Tower Bridge. Great Structure. Walking across is the best way to take this in. Its not the London Bridge so don't get confused.
Amazing to see in person at night!. It's so glorious to see it lit up at night. Its also impressive during the day! So cool! We didn't do the walk from the top but its definitely on our agenda.
Beautiful. This is one of London's landmark. Very beautiful structure, and a must see for tourists. I went there with my husband and we were very amazed!

London Bridge is Falling Down, Falling Down, Falling Down.... Quite the Opposite at the Tower Bridge!. Stroll or skate or walk or jog this bridge. This is an engineering feat.It reminded me of the bridge that I onced walked between Niagara Falls in Canada and Buffalo, New York. The Peace Bridge was impressive because of the roaring and rushing falls. The Tower Bridge conveniently adjacent to the Tower of London stimulated a similar experience and sensation.This is not any old bridge. It is formidable civil engineering from afar and in close proximity. When a bridge is built, it is to connect two banks across a river. It is a way to cross a body of water. It is functional. It serves a pragmatic purpose. Not so at the Tower Bridge. It is magnificent. It is splendiferous. It is dazzling. It is art. The bridge lured me even when I was miles away. I was mistaken when I initially thought that it was the London Bridge of the famous nursery rhyme, "London Bridge is Falling Down." I was permitted to cross the Tower Bridge! I was over the moon when I discovered that I was allowed without charge or other restrictions. I am glad that I took time to slowly walk across and back again. To get a sense and feel of the place, I investigated every piece of steel, rod, cable, and rock that suspended the bridge. I did not want to forget.Even if crowds and traffic had to be contended, it was a worthwhile adventure. Since I was out in the cool open fresh air with wind blowing in my hair, the excited people and whizzing cars were not intimidating or punitive or annoying. This was insignificant compared to the senses that the bridge evoked.All I saw was the awesome engineering, views of the Thames River, and parts of London. Many "Kodak" opportunities. Hundreds of tourists from every corner of the world were doing the same thing posing and taking selfies. I joined them in their pleasure. Carpe diem!

Cannot miss this when in London. Walk towards the bridge and then beyond, all the while soaking in the impressive structure and the scenic Thames flowing slowly beneath it...enough to make you forget all your worries. Do have an ice-cream cone from the many mobile vans flanking both sides. Very Brit, very grand.
A must see!. I wish next time i have enough time to enter it n visit the engine rooms n the museum. Its a lovely landmark. Next time ill conbine it with tower hill

Learn how it was built!. The biggest part of the tour is learning how it was built. You get to walk across the top to where at one point you can stand on glass and look down. Very impressive considering the time it was built. After visiting the bridge, you can then visit the engine room that worked the drawl bridge. Just keep in mind, the original London Bridge is in Arizona, USA. If you don't believe me, look it up!!! Purchased by an American for a tourist attraction, which made way in London for the new bridge.
Typical touristy stop, cool bridge. The weather was bad the day we went to see the Tower Bridge so we only looked from afar on the London Bridge. Very cool to have seen it in person.

Beautiful! . Astonishing and beautiful bridge, gives you the real London feeling! We decided to walk from Big Ben to the Tower Bridge, this was a very long walk so I recommend that you either take the underground to the Tower Bridge or simply have enough energy to walk the whole way because walking through the city is also something to see.
better from outside. I like it but the small museum inside is so boring. .. i wouldnt go again and you have to pay about 8£...From outside is beautiful anyway.

Something different!. Decided to book the Tower Bridge after visiting London for just 1 night, I have always wanted to go to The Shard however found the price a little high, therefore I booked 2 tickets for the Tower Bridge & Monument exhibition, I am very pleased I did this exhibition, it is quite a quick visit so I wouldn't expect to spend hours here however it is very interesting and good value for money, you get some great views and it is nice to be able to see through the glass floor down at the road! Visited 26th October 2015 . This is one of the more reasonable priced attractions, and the glass floor provides lots of fun for little ones, well those that are fearless. One tip take your time you Don,t have to rush, it is at your own pace, and take time to look at videos on your way round.

INTERESTING EXHIBITS. We visited the bridge in the summer after the glass floor had been completed. The tour is very well set out with many interesting exhibits and has amazing views along the river .There is the glass floor for those who are brave enough to try and the engine room is well worth a look . The site provides easy access for less able people . And there is a tea room and gift shop at the end .

Great view through the glass floors at the top of the bridge!. Also, very interesting to see the engineering behind the bridge - in the engine room. Would recommend to families with children but not only.

Walk over the Glass walkway and look down on the Thames. The glass walkways are 42 meters above the river Thames. The views from the top over the river is very nice. Also go down to view the engineering wonders of the engine room. Free with the London Pass

My Favorite Attraction In London. I set a goal to climb this bridge and see the views. As a native New Yorker - this seemed like seeing the Empire State Building - a must do for a tourist. I was surprised (dissappointed) that the top level of the bridge is not open air. It is closed in - but does have cool glass floors that you can walk over and look down on the hustle below. It's in a very vibrant part of the city with great pubs and restaurants near buy. The London Tower is right next to the bridge. Took the elevator up and walked the stairs down. We also took one of the river cruises under the bridge which made for a great photo op and the sky line and bridge were beautiful.

Great views from Tower Bridge. Had been to Tower Bridge during recent trip of London. We walked on it during the day and also walked over it during the evening. The views from Tower Bridge were awesome - River Thames & the Tower of London. We were also fortunate to see the Tower open.
Must for all. Great staff ,good views of area ,will come again,went over bridge .lift for disabled ,family's welcome.
Awesome. Can't believe the very exciting experience of being there, a nursery rhyme you only hear and see in the nursery books and to see it in person is an very awesome experience

Good place to visit. London bridge is a must see attraction at London. Try and cover both in the evening and day time. Evening lights are fantastic. Before visiting try and find when it opens from the Center to let the ships pass by. This happens several times a day.
You may also take river Thames cruise to cover it.
beautiful by day and stunning by night. iconic to london is Tower bridge i just love waling over the bridge at night, you and go inside and this is an experience too.

Worth the visit. While walking across, My wife and I decided to go and have a look around.Queuing to pay was only a couple of minutes.A quick search of women's handbags later and we were through.You have the option of a lift or stairs.Be prepared if you took the stairs option like we did.There are around 220 stairs in total, and seemed like we were walking up them for half an hour lol.Although you do get to see the inner structure from the taking the stairs rather than a metal box to go up in :DNext time I'd probably take the lift up, and the stairs down lol.Once up there, there is a guide that will give you some history on the bridge, and some tv's with a short program on the building of it etc. This is also has subtitles for various languages.Whilst walking along the top of the bridge there is some glass flooring that you can stand on and look down to the people, and boats etc under the bridge.You can download an app for your smartphone called raisingthebridge.This app couple with the postage shown inside the bridge shows the bridge opening etc.Worth downloading, only a small app, or download before you go.Worth a visit for the time your in there for.You also get to go and view the old steam mechanics that open the bridge.This is a short distance outside and down the stairs.Just follow the blue line :D

Another London Icon. Carol and I walked across the top level of the bridge. We also visited the workings of the bridge and saw the machinery that raise the "Bascules". A very interseting visit indeed.

Tower Bridge. If you got a little time, go and see this amazing building. Take the chance to WALK over and enjoy the sight in all directions. Sure it's pretty busy there and aall the time you try to take a picture someone walks by... *lol* take time.My plan was to visit the Tower at the other riverside, but i was too late...

Cool to see...and even better to walk across!. This was lovely, the nicest looking bridge in London. Walking across it have an optimum view of the Thames, the Tower of London, and all the views on both sides. We didn't go up to the viewing area, and don't think we missed anything. Walk across it!!

Glass floor is truly a new and wonderful addition. Tower bridge, being the icon of london, has to be visited. would recommend to visit about 10am where it is not so crowded. Also, in my previous visit prior to this, there wasn't any glass floor panel, allowing you to view people walking below the bridge. This is a wonderful addition, provided of course you are not afraid of heights. However, to know the engineering and technology behind the building of this bridge is truly amazing.

Great fun for children and bridge enthusiasts. This isn't a massive exhibition but this is reflected in the ticket price. Lots of interesting info about the building of the bridge, some interactive exhibits for the kids (big and small), and the fantastic glass walkway. Not too busy which is always a relief during half term in London.

Definitely Do it!. At the ripe old age of 63 I cannot believe I did not know that this was an attraction that you could do more than just look at! Take the lift or walk up to the walkways and marvel at the stunning architecture and engineering of this magnificent British iconic bridge. Walk across the glass floor and look down at the traffic below - who knew that red London buses had white roofs?! Then down to the Engine Rooms where you can see the marvellous steam engines that once powered the lifting device. It really is an eye opener and one definitely to put on the list of London attractions to visit! The guides along the way are excellent too.
Kids loved it. Kids loved this and the guide was very informative. Best combined with something else as it is a fairly short visit.
Beautifully lit up. Beautiful historic building so interesting and an amazing place to visit travel over and under and is lit beautifully
Stunning. In addition to the other parts of London that deserve a review tjis must be on your list. Enjoy the view, the history and the feel of the surroundings.
Awesome experience.. We did the tour. It was pretty cool! We downloaded the app and watched the draw bridge open from the top which was pretty awesome. Overall a cool experience!

Fun!. A fun, short attraction to include in your trip. We were there when they opened the bridge as well which was fun to see. A short "tour" of sorts got you started with basic information on the bridge, then in the exhibition up top on the walkway was a more in depth history of the bridge and its construction.

No trip to London is complete without seeing this. No trip to London is complete, without seeing this great British Icon. It is a marvellous feat of engineering. I recommend a boat trip on the Thames and travel up the river at dusk, the bridge is a sight to see and enjoy.

Informative and interesting. We joined the tour using our London Pass which we got. The tour comes with guide on the historical of the bridge and its stages of construction. Very informative. You get to walk from one tower to the other and great view of the Thames from there.

brilliant. fantastic history of the bridge. glass walk way left me with wobbly legs but a must!!! check out the times for the bridge lifting as thats good to watch. engine room steeped in history. good attraction well worth a visit!!
Nice to see the bridge in place!. The bridge was bigger and more spectacular than we expected. It is one of the must-places-to-visit in London!
Next to the tower. Nice place specialy if you have younger kids and want to show them how old water enginies and turbines worked in old ages.
Tower Bridge. Tower Bridge is a must see when in London!! The architecture is amazing and the glass walkway is fascinating!!

A must do. Good view, well explained, grea to walk up top for those with ahead for heights, walk on the glass floor and watch the traffic below. history of the bridge explained in some detail. Kids seemed to love it.

It's A Big Bridge. It's a pretty nice bridge.
You can get some great photos here up and down the Thames.
Still though; it's just a bridge... but a very good one.

Another London Icon. We were told that all throughout the second world war the bridge was never bombed as it proved an ideal location marker for German bombers. This is a beautify bridge and one of many that cross the Thames.

Take photos. Beautiful from any point of view, this is a masterpiece of British architecture, an iconic monument comparable to the Pyramids!
Usually crowded of people taking photos and a lot of selfies with a selfie-stick, so cross it with patience if you are in a hurry!

The views are awesome, loved the glass floors. The Tower Bridge and the Tower of London and right next to each other and I would recommend combining them if you have the time. Go first to the Tower of London, then Tower Bridge. They have added glass floors on the walkways above and it is very surreal to be standing on them and looking at the people and autos traveling below. They have a wonderful exhibit on famous bridges and I recommend taking the time to read them. Some have a wonderful history and many of the designers are names we have heard before. The views are wonderful from up there also. Take the extra 15 minutes to go to the engine room and see how this bridge works. I came here before many years ago and they had a much clearer demonstration on how the bridge was built and how it works. It is no longer there and I think that it is a major loss. The cost is reasonable, the views are incredible, and it is simply beautiful.
Just stunning. What can you say it's our history.A beautiful sight. Great to have a walk accross.See the sights along the river. Tower of London great too.Take a stroll around the docks

It's not just a bridge. its called the tower experience, and it is a great experience. Driving over the bridge was cool, but walking on the top platform with a glass walkway was very cool. And if you want the whole experience, go into the engine room for more history and complete the experience. The best part for us was when we happened to be on the water when they had to raise the bridge for the shop that was leaving.
Beautiful. This is my favorite place in London this bridge is amazing day and night and is a nice walk from the south bank .

Need to revisit. What a beautiful bridge my favourite. Lovely at night when lit up blue proper stands out. Would love to go back and see it up close. Out hotel was close but we never had a walk up to it x

An Experience!. I can see why the Tower Bridge is rated one of the top things to see in London! The architecture of the bridge is outstanding! We bought our tickets on the day and luckily there was only another family in the queue, so it didn’t take long to get up to the top. Once you get out of the lift there is a small exhibition about how and when the bridge was built, and then you’re out onto the walkway. There’s plenty of information all the way along the walkway and there’s even little windows that you can open to take your photo. Standing on the glass floor was pretty cool too; I even managed to get my mum – who’s afraid of heights – on it for a photo! Although it was a drizzly day, the views were still amazing! The bridge below is open at certain times to let taller ships to pass through – you can check these times on their website – which I’m sure will only add to the experience!
Beautiful. Of course you have to visit Tower Bridge while in London. Walk across it. Take pictures in front of it!

Unique bridge. Interesting but we didn't have do the audio tour so there was a lot of reading. If it's crowded that slows things down. The new glass observation floor was cool. Be sure to watch the movie & see the engine room.

Loved the glass bottom walk. We did this as part of our "London Pass". We especially like the glass bottom walk where you could look down on the traffic below. The view of the city was pretty good and I really enjoyed reading the history of the bridge itself. Glad we went, but not sure I'd go a second time.

Loved the pictures from that ''glass perspective''. If you are afraid of heights or not! you should definitely visit it! After 5 years living in London, just now went for first time and it was quite tricky! But really loved it!
Try to find some of the people outside the entrance as you got a discount with those fryers they are giving away

Special bridge. Tower bridge is very special. Watching it opening for the ships to pass is a great experience. It is one of my favorite bridges in the world. Worth mentioning that the exhibition on the top is nice, but the staff was terrible. i went in the last hour available, and everyone was pressuring me to leave. Had to watch everything fast and could not really enjoy the great story of this bridge.

Felt like royalty!. As if viewing this beautiful structure was not enough we were treated to a beautiful meal in the finest of historic settings. The glass floor took a bit for the nerves to get used to but I did it!

Stunning views. I worked in London for 4 years, and passed Tower Bridge many times, but I had never been inside, until a couple of weeks ago.It was well worth the visit. My only disapointment was that the lift was not working. I could not face climbing all these stairs. I was however advised that there was another lift, at the other side of the bridge. This meant walking right across the bridge, and a bit further, then crossing the road and walking back. The lift I got is normally only used for bringing people back down, so the lift attendant was rather confused when I said I wanted to go up.It was however worth all the hassle. There is an interesting exhibition at the top, of bridges all over the world. There is a glass floor at each side, which you really should walk over, even it you do feel slightly squeemish. The views however are wonderful. After taking quite a few photos, I noticed someone opening one of the small sliding windows, so after that there was no stopping me.On the return you ground level you walk a bit further, and you can visit the engine room. This is quite an amazing feet of engineering. Unfortunately there were no bridge lifts planned for the day I was there, so I missed that spectacular, but it is definitely worth a visit.
Fascinating place. Worth the tour, amazing history and views of London are really good. The glass platform gives a great view of the bridge raising

Stunning Views. If you can go by water taxi to The Tower of London, you will be rewarded with superb views of Tower Bridge & Traitor Gate. It is just stunning. The history just oozes from every angle.
Another must do on a London Trip!. This is an excellent exhibition! The glass floor is amazing! We saw the bridge lift from above too which was super!

Must take a photo. The Bridge on the river Thames is a must visit location. Guided tours are available if one is interested in details. The view from in front of Tower of London is very good. On the other side of the river from the walkway in the banks of the river Thames the view is much better and one should not miss this opportunity.

Tower bridge experience just ok. We had London passes and this was included. So we took the lift to the top and saw London from the top. Glass floor was the only real attraction here. Would not have paid extra for the attraction. Better attractions are available in London.

Enjoying history. Plan tp spend at least a couple of hours here. The tour guides are so interesting and its incredible seeing such a big part of England history. The Crown Jewels are here and the display is done so well. You haven't seen London until you visit here .
tourist must. I admit it I am a tourist. No matter where I go I am going to do the touristy thing. if you go to London you have to visit the tower bridge.

You have to see it from the Tower of London. Another of those icons you have to visit and have a photo in front of to prove YOU WERE THERE. Tower of London is one of my favorite spots and it has the best view of Tower Bridge from the parapets above Traitor's Gate.

Private Family Tour of Tower Bridge Worthwhile. Avoid the lines and crowds, and get the inside scoop and the opportunity to ask questions about Tower Bridge, its building, and the views of London from the top with a private tour. Had Peter and thought he was great. Very interesting, historic, and good intro to London skyline, as an alternative to London Eye.

This is the "real" London Bridge.. Looks just like it does in the pictures. Beautiful! The real name is the Tower Bridge but often this bridge gets mistaken for the "London Bridge". The LB is actually not pretty at all. This is the bridge to see.
Amazing night view. One of my favorites views in London. It's worth going there at night, many pubs and restaurants around.
Nice view and relax walk. I didn't go to the top, just walked over the bridge. Bridge is nice, walk is not bad. Nothing fancy! But it's a must visit

It is a bridge. Good when it opens!. It is cool at first sight and if you get the chance to see it open then you are in for a treat. But at the end of the day, it's just a bridge. Wouldn't mind checking out the engine room.

A beautiful bridge, and a solid tour. It is free to go on the bridge, obviously, but there is a fee for the tour. It is interesting to learn the history of its marvelous and ingenious design, but it is not mandatory. Make sure you are near the bridge at night so you can see it lit up, it is beautiful.
Take a peek at it from in front of the Tower of London.. You can drive over this bridge if you take a Red Bus Hop-on, Hop-off tour. It is also visible from the Tower of London

Amazing piece of Work. What Tourists normally do not realize is that a tour of the bridge is well recommended. View from the top is amazing and you MUST NOT miss the opening of the bridge to allow tall boats to drift through (check daily times on the website)
Seen from a distance. Would have loved to have the time to tour the bridge, good view of it from next to the Tower of London, added bonus for us was seeing it open for a boat to go through.
Great views from the water. We saw this from the hop on hop off bus but also from our inclusive in the hop on hop off ticket, River Thames tour.

Highlight of London!. We had less than 48 hours in London and wanted to do something that would be fun and give us some good views. We had thought about booking the London Eye or the Shard but neither would be worth the money if it was a cloudy or rainy day. We decided on the Tower Bridge because view or not, it would be a great time. We bought tickets in advance and glad we did because we skipped the line. We checked in, went into the elevator and headed up. When we got to the top, there was a small presentation and we were on our way. I had to say, walking on the glass floor was really cool. It took a minute to get used to but after that, it was so fun. There was a school group there and watching the little kids on the floor was so fun. The views were pretty good, could have been better but the weather didn't work out. I can't imagine our time in London without it!
Beautiful Bridge Architecture. Have to admire the bridge. Looks amazing when the bridge arms rise. It's not a very common sight but when you catch it. It's amazing.

The glass walkway is pretty cool. After doing the Tower of London, it's hard not to walk around the Tower Bridge, and after reading about the glass walkway, I knew I was going to go up. My sister is very afraid of heights and didn't want to go, and I'm not a huge fan either, but I had no problems with the walkway (there is wood flooring on the outskirts of the panels, so if you don't want to walk on the glass, you don't have to). There's also open port holes on the windows to the outside so you can stick your camera out and get some nice photographs. If you're interested in bridge architecture, there's plenty of information both on Tower Bridge and others around the world. The Engine room was a bit of an added bonus and worth the walk if you've already paid entry.This is a pretty unique thing to be able to do, despite all the tourists, and it's cheap, so why not add it to your itinerary?

Great tourist attraction for first time visitors. Visited this attraction mid-week in the summer. Pretty organized direction up the tower and through the upper level of the bridge. The bottom of the upper level is thick glass, so you can see the road bridge and the river below.
Beautiful view. Really beautiful view expecially in the dark. When you will have fortune the middle part of the bridge will be raised.

Looks even better up close. I had taken a river tour. You can see so much more details of this bridge from the water. It was nice to hear part of the history of this bridge. I like so many people thought this was the famous "London Bridge"

Great little lesson on the history of engineering but watch that glass floor!. As mentioned in my earlier review on the Tower of London, this was one of those place that we kept passing but never took time to go in.Glad we did now, I'm certainly not an engineering boffin (although my hubby is) but I found the history around the tower bridge very interesting, it was great to see it in motion and to see all the cogs and engineering parts work together, a great little couple of hours out for the kids.

We both enjoyed it!. My husband is an engineer and I thought this would be of interest to him...but I loved it too. Beautiful photos of bridges around the world are on display. Good explanations about why and how it was built. The views are great!
London's most beautiful bridge. Close to the Tower Of London and worth the 5-10 minute walk to see. A wonderful piece of history and design!
great view over tamisa river. the place is really beautiful. u have a great view of london: old and new city. u can go upstairs and enjoy on ethe best views of london.
The glass floor walkway and bridge lift experience!. Excellent experience. If you plan to see a lift make sure you are standing around the glass floor 15 minutes beforehand to get a clear view.

The Most Beautiful Bridge in the World. A must Do. Don't go to London without visiting this historic bridge. It is absolutely amazing and guaranteed to be your very best picture that you will take on your trip.

Put it on your visit.. this was 6.50pnd which was quite reasonable addmission price. the top bridge across has glass floors in it which are good looking down over pedestrians and cars crossing underneath you. the tour finished showing you the mechanics of the bridge both past and present. its wuite interesting and only 5 minutes walk from the Tower of London. so if your planning to do it do both on the same day. This tour only takes around an hour, maybe 1 1/2 if you really want to take it all in. But definitely worth doing.

great set up and nicely laid out.. I went here as a best man for my friends wedding in 2014 summer then came here again in the new year tohave another look at a great attraction the wedding was epic so if you are considering it, I would look into it if its what you are looking for. as for the attraction, well, what a lovely set up. clean and tidy, helpful staff and very informative, plus on a nice day a great view over the river. if you can its worth watching the bridge go up and down, maybe as I am a geek with this sort of thing, but I find in impressive. Then there is the engine room, another informative part of the day out and nicely set out. worth a visit for sure
Great photo moment. We drove across this bridge and took fantastic photos of it from the Tower of London. Made for fantastic photos of our trip.

Beautiful . Great view. Beautiful to take pictures. Great to visit and admire its beauty and presence. Great site for pictures of family as well as couples. There is a great site to photograph from the river front at the Tower of London.
Gotta walk it! And at night!. Go both day and night. Super interesting and iconic. Didn't go inside; kind of a waste and a super long line. Gives unique perspective from this angle on the Tower.
Glass Floor Fun. We took the short tour which takes around 45 mins. During which you get to cross the bridge via the walkways! The Glass Floor is great and the kids loved it. Well worth a visit

Great piece of architecture. It was amazing to see insides of this famous bridge. There was a short movie explaining building the bridge and we got to see many pictures with rich desriptions. Glad to go there.

Amazing at night. This was a must stop for me. My husband is not a big fan of heights and therefore we didn't climb to the top. But we did cross it and enjoyed it at night when the crowds are gone and its all lit up with beautiful lights. Well worth stopping by.

Great visit with fantastic views!. AFter 3 trips to London, we finally visited the bridge, and took the full tour. I walked a long the edge of the glass walkway, hwoever, my family enjoyed pictures standing over the Thames/road! Great visit, espeically for the younger ones!

Beautiful bridge. I love this bridge. We got to see the bottom go up for a boat while we were touring the Tower of London and it was very pretty to watch. Walking across it is like walking across any other bridge but this one is just very pretty to me so it's special. Also, they now have an area where you can pay to walk across glass so you can see down on it, we didn't do that as it's just another money trap. The bridge is fantastic without doing that in my opinion.

Very impressive. We only watched the bridge from one side of the river and didn't walk over it, nor visited the towers on the bridge. But still I thought this bridge is very impressive! We arrived in daytime and slowly experience the sky getting darker and the tower getting more lighted. You should definitely stay in the neighbourhood to watch the lighted bridge!

Amazing view!. If you are in the UK, you should definitely pay a visit to London Bridge especially in night lights. The view you see in night lights is super amazing. I had been there quite a few times as I live / work in London. Make sure you go with your partner as this is a lovely place to spend some time with the person you in love. Cheers!

Amazing Design!. One of a kind! Took the tour through tower bridge and was amazing reading the history behind its construction. The tour through the engine room was amazing also seeing the power required to lift the bridge. Definitely worth being in or just outside the venue for the bridge lift. Very Interesting.

Looka like Disneyland but it's real!!!. We live in London and after years we come accross the Tower Bridge by driving. Amazing experience; it's one of those places we think they exist only in dreams or films....but it's real!!!!
Beautiful . I went to see London Tower Bridge at night. The view was spectacular and I would not want to have missed it!

All I ever dreamed of.... This sight is everything I wanted it to be! It is just a gorgeous piece of history and architecture. Go over it, go under it, drive across it, and bike around it; it will not disappoint.
To give a different view on the world. Very informative, great historical data, fantastic views. Bit scary walking on glass floor but great fun.

Watched the bridge open from the river. Another one from my daughters wish listShe wanted to see the bridge open and I was worried we would miss it I knew it was opening at 4pmAt 3:40 we got on a st Katherine cruise at Westminster We arrived at the bridge as it was openingWent went under it open and watched it close which was brilliant and my 2yr old loved it And the architecture Is absolutely gorgeousIf you visit London check the website to find out when it open on your visit as it really is marvellous to see

Great way to make a live bridge into a museum. Tower Bridge offers a lot of information about the construction of the bridge, how it survived wars and how it technically works even today. Also a great view from the two walkways.

nice for a short visit. I enjoyed the bridge, however it was a little underwhelming. it is a self guided tour. at the time around $13.50 US for 1 adult. you go up an elevator walk across the bridge top on each side. it is completely covered. the glass floor is neat for a minute or two then it's kind of like okay I'm done. The views from the bridge were good but better from the London Eye. I would recommend doing it in addition to the London Tower.
Your must se in London. Go er by ay, go there by night. Go there by view from nother bridge. Really your must see in London. Perhaps see an exhibition in the bridge as well?!

Stroll by night along the River and witness the illuminated spectacle of the Tower Bridge. Romantic and moving : enjoy a meal and a drink next to this overwelming spectacle. Or just sit and drink-up it's glory and the engineering feat it represents.

make sure to check bridge opening times so you dont' miss. nice display specially for kids.taking pics from the glass floors. if you miss the opening time its just a view. i liked the info about other bridges in the world
what an iconic bridge. but I wouldnt book a tour as they are expensiveplenty of photo ops and cafe's around the base so you can watch the world go by

Lovely. When it is nighttime the bridge is all lit up and looks very pretty . There is lots of detail on the bridge and you get lovely photos if you stand in the very middle although it gets very busy

Nice view on the Thames. Nice short experience from one of the famous bridges in London.
The exhibition on the Tower bridge is very interesting. The view is very nice, Go there on a shinny day for a better view of london.

London for RWC2015. we booked the Tower Bridge and Monument experience as a joint ticket and really enjoyed both. The view from the top of the bridge are amazing. A few steps up but there are lifts. Lots of good information with very helpful staff. The Glass floor section is pretty special too.
One of the place to tick. You get a good view of the thames river . Its a place for photo stop withe Tower of london in the back ground
A must for visitors to the city! . Such an amazing landmark can't be missed with visiting London. Take the tour, enjoy the views and catch the sensational opening s.

Nice exhibition. One of the cheaper London attractions, this is well worth a look. The bridge has always been a landmark to see, and it is very interesting hearing about how it was built and how it works. Allow at least an hour for this if you want to get the best of it.

A must see for anyone visiting London.. Simply iconic! The backdrop to a million photos and selfies, TB is a must for anyone visiting London.The bridge is high Victorian design at its most thrilling,looming over the Thames like a pair of castle towers. Tower Bridge makes for a pleasant walk from Shad Thames to the Tower of London and should not be missed.

Great view, fun and tincture of history. Entrance to the gallery is from the bridge, the great london bridge. You have to buy a ticket to enter the gallery which is located on 2nd floor. Well there's lift to reach so dont worry. For student's there's discount on ticket if you show your id card. Well tour starts with a little movie which is shown and has history about the bridge. After knowing a bit you walk over to the walkaway. The two sides are of glass and provides a great view of city and thames. There's different information about different bridges across the globe. The most interesting thing is the glass floor in the middle of walkway. It's scary but fun. You can see water flowing, steamers over it and vehicles moving beneath your feet. It's really fun.There's also a gallery to buy souvenirs. So if you want to have a good look of thames and london, move up to the second floor !

My favorite place in London. I just love making a stroll and wandering around, it's wide and clean, you can enjoy a beautiful view on the City and one of the top landmark of London : Tower hill and Tower bridge, there are lots of restaurants and coffees shop to have a break. In summertime it's the perfect place to make a picnic on the grass. I just LOVE IT !!

Good mix of history, engineering and views. well worth a visit both for the bridge and engin rooms as well as the views. If you happen to be there when the bridge opens (like we were) then so much the better. Both walkways have glass floor to peer down onto the bridge (Go to the far one if the bridge is opening as this tends to be less crowded but has the same view), There are photo ports in the window, open one to get a clear shot of the city skyline, but do close it after you in winter!

Iconic London. Take a walk over Tower Bridge from the south of the river and visit St Katherine's dock for a drink once you reach the otherside. Take the steps down on the righthand side of the bridge.
If you are lucky you might even see them raise the bridge for a boat to pass under.

well done. I have always been a fan of the Tower Bridge, so it was a treat to finally go up inside it. I just wish that part of it had not been enclosed. It is hard to make some good photographs of it.The exhibit is really well done. It not only shows the history of the bridge itself but documents bridge architecture and the great bridges of the world.This is another must-see in London.

An obvious must for visitors. Have altitude walk across the bridge but I wouldn't bother with the tours unless you are some kind of bridge or British history enthusiast. The ambiance and a bit of googling and job's a good 'un.
Don't miss the tower bridge tour. We were shocked at all we learned and saw on this tour. It shouldn't be missed while visiting London
WOW what a great place to visit. Well worth a visit wheelchair friendly staff helpful, our kids loved it we were impressed the views over London were worth the visit alone

Good attraction at a very reasonable price. We popped in for a visit on a Saturday morning. No queues and because we booked online only £8 per adult. Friendly and knowledgable staff.
