We were lucky enough to be on the glass floor as the bridge opened to let a sailing boat through. Even the non-technicals in our group enjoyed the engine rooms under the bridge. Definitely worth a visit.
impressive. best viewed whilst on a ferry thrn one can take in the true nature of what an impressive construction it is.

Gorgeous bridge. We thought Tower Bridge was very striking to look at, and we enjoyed seeing it from many different angles.To see the Tower Bridge Exhibition, follow the signs to enter at the northwest tower, then go up to the glass walkways between the towers. The views of London are wonderful, but it's not easy to get great photos because of all the glass. The exhibit leads you down into the original engine room that powered the bridge lifts.We weren't terribly impressed with the exhibition, and standing on its glass walkway didn't seem exciting compared to the glass walkway that we had just walked on at the Eiffel Tower the week before. We were glad that we hadn't paid extra for this attraction, because it was included in our London Pass.Tip: Check their website for bridge lift times (when the bridge deck opens up to let ships pass through).
Amazing. I love all the architecture of London, the tower bridge is no exception to this. You have to see it.

Huge and charming bridge. Another symbol of London. Close to the Tower of London, totally worth the visit! If you are planning to cross it, make sure to save some time. It doesn't look as long as it is.

Scary but Exciting. When crossing the bridge be careful not to lool down if your scared of heights loool just stomach turning but wonderful you get to see other people from different nationality shock yet wow as your are over everything in London

best seen by the river. one of the best views is on the river! especially good at night! !! Fantastic & so iconic. i went by the river boat buses & was good value as you get a river rover ticket & can go up & down & across the river as many times as you like from The London Eye to Woolwich & back again.

Tower Bridge Experience. Iconic and beautiful bridge which you should definitely walk across at road level but the 'experience' on the upper walkway is not worth paying for. Very crowded and although it was fun to walk on the glass floor, there really isn't that much to see.

Beautiful sight!. It really is beautiful.. I admit that I was too cheap to spend on the tickets (having spent for entrance at castles). However it is not something I regret. Wish I did enquire for the 2-for-1 voucher at National Rail station because we took the national rail train a few times. So if you do have the opportunity to take a train, please ask about the voucher. You'd need that And all your passenger tickets to get tickets at half the price. It is also fine to view it along river Thames.. It is too beautiful to miss. But there are always loads of people around so vigilant on the most opportune time to click a pic ;)

Worth a look around (and Down!). Been itching to look around Tower Bridge since it was opened to the public, Be prepared for a tough climb up the stairs if you don't take the lift. The Glass Floor inthe galleries at the top take a bit of getting comfortable with, as a view 45m down onto the road deck makes your stomach flip a bit. £9 each isn't mega expensive for london either

Approach from northern end to do most efficiently. Walk over the bridge commencing from the southern side and on the lefthand side. Beyond the centre of the bridge you will encounter the entry to the Tower Bridge Exhibition, which is a must-see if you want to understand the history of the bridge and how it works. Save on the entry fee by having a 2 for 1 offer (see our review of Tower of London forcwhat this is).It's probably pot luck if you are there just before the bridge opens, but if you are, view the opening through the glass floor above the roadway - very spectacular.After the exhibits up high over the roadway, catch the lift back down to street level and continue walking north along the bridge to the other side where you can visit the bridge's old engine room to see the steam powered machinery which used to raise the bridge.

It's really spectacular in person . If you live in London you may take this bridge for granted but it's truly stunning in person. All the little details of the architecture are wonderful. Lots of tourists everywhere. Both sides of the river have fun things to find.

One of the most famous bridges in the world.. It is so recognizable, it defines London. It is definitely something to walk over and say you did. The south side of the Thames also provides a nice path to continue your walk. It provides awesome views of the river, and the Tower of London. I took a run one morning and this was my turn around point. What a great way to see the bridge (picture included in this review).
It is the tower bridge. It is the tower bridge, go there by cab and check it on your todo list :) No jk the glass bottom is really nice.
It's not London Bridge it's Tower Brideg. This is Tower Bridge not London Bridge, it's next to the Tower of London and has a tower at each side of the river and lifts in the centre -
best place. it feels so relaxed when go to see the tower bridge, i can sit for hours n hours. my best place to relax and draw some pictures.

Simply beautiful. We sailed under the bridge with the local ferry which was the best way of seeing it. Best view is from the North Bank of the Thames. You can walk over the bridge which is great and even bike if you want (I did this many years ago, you need to be a very experienced biker in the London traffic!). Fantastic is to see the bridge opening and closing down.

A lot of gruesome history and tales of olde .... Just go to see the Crown jewels girls!Leave the history to come in second ... there is quite a bit of walking and steps, stairs and uneven ground inside the grounds here so it's hard with a pram, buggy, wheelchair or person on unsteady legs.The crowds can choke the experience and make it feel somewhat stifling standing in queues or getting yourselfup and/or down the stairways so if you can get there early in the day you may have a bit more room to move.

Beautiful bridge. The Tower Bridge is a great attraction to visit. Near the Tower and close to the main transportation hubs, it is an easy and quick point to visit. The location has a nice contrast of old and modern architecture, and the bridge is at the center of both.

Bridge . The London Bridge is something I only seen on tv or movies never imagined I would get there. It's a fantastic bridge and the tour was great. Glass floor at the top was an interesting experience to walk on. Everything you wanted to know about the bridge is all there and well presented. Went back in the evening to see it lit up in purple lights. Hope to get back some day.
Very interesting and nice views! . A very interesting and pleasant activity. Very friendly staff. A must see in London, definitely for technique interested people.

Great Tourist Attraction - Go early to avoid the crowds. Its a given that you need to visit the Tower Bridge, even if its just for the view down the Thames on a good day. It's an essential part of any London Trip so make sure you grab your camera and start clicking. Look out for one of the tour operators so you can book tickets for an official tour including underground and at the top for an amazing view.

Good Experience, but would have like more information. Views are well worth the price of admission. The glass bottom is worth seeing once, but the views up and down the river are terrific. Follow the visit with a walk along the Thames to see Borough Market, Globe Theatre and the Millennium Footbridge. Hard to figure out where the entrance was ahead of time, but luckily the cab driver knew. The staff was confused by my prepaid ticket, but office help remedied that. The initial tour discussion is short.

Interesting, beware of glass floor. Beautiful bridge and architectural wonder. Did a quick tour. I am however scared of heights so the glass floor on the walk way scared me a bit. Must see for first time visitors.

"Look Mom, London Bridge". As we were in the car on our way from the airport to the hotel, we drove past this and my kids got so excited! The next day, it was our first stop on our walk. It is a must see if you're planning a visit. It's beautiful!
Tower Bridge is great!. Very beautiful bridge. Great to take pictures of and in front of. A great way to enjoy British history.
Impressive Bridge. The Tower Bridge is another of those "Must See" places in London! Classic place as well and worth the visit!
Beautiful. Good price, good for group visits, small spaces underground but glass corridors on a top, easy to find, beautiful scenery from above, ancient bridge parts....

London Landmark. This bridge , with all it's history and mystique, is really one of the sights of London. Still operational, the way it is maintained is really to be admired and visited. Walking across, a visitor is now able to go to the top and walk on a glass floor high above the Thames. Too high for me!
cool. enjoyed learning some history about the bridge, fun to walk across the fairly recently installed glass floor above the bridge/water, understand this in NOT the London Bridger

Iconic bridge. Visited because wife has a fascination for bascule bridges and I'm an engineer. Brilliant exhibition; the high level glass walkway is awesome, the history spellbinding and the views spectacular - all for less than £15 for the two of us !! Great value for money - seriously recommend

Not the London Bridge. Magnificent feat of engineering. Very interesting to learn how this was built. Great views from the top and a good video overview of the politics involved in getting it built. Worth the visit if you are mechanically inclined.
Interesting. It was very neat to walk the bridge from above, especially the glass floor. We went to it because it was an attraction that was included with our London City Pass.

Essential London. Just driving across this wonderful structure towards the Tower of London puts you into the frame of London. AND don't forget that an RAF Hunter flew through the upper central part to commemorate the 50th Anniversary of that splendid service

worth a trip. Combined this attraction with the monument of the great fire of London. You get great view from the bridge walkways right down the Thames and across London. Interesting information about how the tower was built even if your not an engineer and lots of pictures of other great bridges across the world. Tip... open the little windows above the information boards across the walkway to get a clearer photo.
Nice to walk across the bridge. We took a nice walk across tower bridge to the other side for lunch. It was a must-see experience in London. The walk itself is easy, great photo opportunity
Touring around London. We didn't go up to the viewing gallery just walked from one end to the other,the viewing gallery was closed on our day there
Always wanted to see this bridge. Not only is it a beautiful bridge, but I understand that they have areas in the bridge where parties are held and you can tour the bridge.

Into the depths we went.. We attended the Tower Bridge for a concert within the stone Bascule Chamber. The concert was a special event and showed the bits, below stairs. Very interesting safety chat as we were in the void that houses the bridges counterweight as it opens. Concert was exactly as I expected and a great venue to perform it.

More than just an iconic London sight. Tower Bridge is synonymous with most pictures of London. Its startling unique design has appeared in many books, films, photographs and televison but there is so muc more to see and learn about.Take this attraction in with the respect it desrves. Sure it looks amazing, especially when the bridge raises to let tall ships past. However its history, construction, engineering and place in the heart of London deserves to be experienced and does not disappoint.I went with my young daughter and we had a fantastic time marvelling at the mechanics, hearing about the history, seeing the stunning subterranian mechanisms and above all having a tour from a clearly knowledgable and enthusiastic tour guide.The walk way is a brilliant aspect of the tour and affords some special views.Give it a visit - you will not be disappointed
gorgeous. One of the gorgeous place. Go there by walk, by transportation, by Thames river boat cruise. I tried all these way :D

Valentines Night 2015 - Special Trip. This was a trip inside the tower itself and inside the walkway linking the 2 towers - The event itself was excellent with champagne and chocolate fondue with romantic lighting and the views from Tower Bridge are amazing - not recommended if you don't like heights as it has a glass walkway which looked amazing seeing the boats float past and cars drive beneath your feet - some people however, were clinging to the walls! so definitely not suitable for people with a fear of heights! but personally loved it, great views of London and would recommend
Definitely Worth a Look. It is worth taking the time to go and see this, it is pretty cool and a lovely walk along the river or you can catch the tube very easily if you prefer.
tower bridge. Wonderful historical bridge. Whether you view this bridge from a boat or bus/car you will not miss the sight when touring London, its just one of the many must see attractions of London

Tower bridge is a beautiful bridge... If you stroll around London, the Tower bridge is one of those bridges you should make sure you check out. With so many other attractions nearby it's almost a must.

Iconic bridge - worth a visit to the walkway above!. This is a super place to see London landmarks such as the Tower of London, the City skyline, City Hall, HMS Belfast & Canary Wharf. It also has a fascinating exhibition about the bridge construction and engineering inside. Walk along the upper walkways and look through the glass floor for amazing views of the bridge below.

Interesting . It's worth seeing the bridge from the inside, and the glass walk way is amazing.Offered an interesting history of the bridge and some amazing viewsWorth seeing after the Tower of London If you have kids make sure you get the passport and pick up the stickers at each station Make sure you use the bathroom at the beginning of the exhibit

Romantic. I visited this at night and it was very romantic strolling across the bridge at night. You can get great pictures of the city from here and the bridge is nicely illuminated. Bring a jacket if you go at night as there is a breeze off of the water that can be a bit chilly.
Iconic and stunning. I never grow tired of seeing this bridge and taking pictures of it. Its a true showpiece and Icon of London.

A day out with a difference. Not your usual thing to do on a day out especially in this are as there is so many other places, but this is well worth the visit.Perhaps not for the kids but it was a good walk and to actually walk in the walkways above is something that not many people have done, I personally don't know any one else who has done it!After you also go in to the engine rooms so you get to see the whole history of the bridge.
tower bridge. excellent feeling when i first saw this unfortunately i was not able to see the the opening closing of the bridge

Iconic Bridge. You must walk over this bridge if you go to London. It is beautiful and crowded. Walking across it should be on bucket lists. Right next to the Tower of course, so a good i/2 days outing between the two of them.
Amazing in the day and at night too!. Lovely walking over the bridge the views are great. Good to hear the different languages being spoken by tourists. It is more beautiful in the dark lighten up:)

Best bridge in London. Awesome bridge to walk across of you're going to choose any. The tower of London is on the north side of the bridge so you can fit that in too. Their is a tour to go to the top of the bridge but i did not do it. You can find a timetable also when the bridge opens which is cool too see.

Best bridge in London.. Seeing the bridge go up is always completely wonderful. It is strange to see but quite fascinating and adds a lot to any visit to London. Going underneath it is pretty special too and there is so much history to enjoy at that part of the Thames.

What a beautiful sight!. We took the river cruise offered by the hop On Hop Off bus and it is great to approach this beautiful structure from the water. Lots of great photo opportunities and then the boat turns and you see The Tower of London. Well worth the time!
amazing bridge. always wanted to see this bridge and it did not disappoint. even the walk through was worth it. Love the clear walkways t see traffic and the app that opens the bridge is really cool

Got your selfie-sticks ready folks?. Of course it´s an icon of London. What´s the point of "rating" it? Every first-time tourist will go there sooner or later. It´s better from the river itself (try a river trip down the Thames).
Love it. The bridge of the castle!It has come out of an age with knights,horses and honour!Beautiful bridge, nice area with many choices for a lunch by the Thames.

Unique Experience. This was truly a unique experience. The glass bottom floor at the top of the bridge allows you to watch the boats pass underneath. There were many children there who really seemed to enjoy sitting around the glass floor watching the boats pass by down below. We also got a chance to see them raise the bridge which we also enjoyed watching.
Unmissable Iconic London. Extra-ordinary experience, you'll have a closer look at great engineering piece. This attraction is included in London Pass.

My favourite bridge in London. I live in and am from London and every time I see London Bridge I am impressed. This is a lovely bridge to drive over and would recommend driving over it at night time. It is also worth visiting in the day time and you can get a great view from London Bridge. It is a special feature of London in my vie.

Bring your camera. There is so much about this bridge to photograph. Take a night time paddle steamer trip up and down the Thames - the colours are fabulous! Beautiful blues especially when the bridge opens to let the steamer through. Walking on it in daytime also has lovely views of London.

john Wayne drove over it.. It is almost impossible to add anything about the Tower Bridge Most people will have heard the legend that Americans who bought London Bridge thought they were buying the Tower Bridge. I ran across it during the London Marathon. John Wayne drove across it in a movie. Get a tour boat and sail under it. Get a tall boat and they might open it for you. Walk across the high level which has a museum and magnificent views.
It's Amazing. a wonderful piece of Engineering with great history a worth watching place. they have a glass floor over the river ...
Magical Experience. We were on a small ship (WindStar Cruise Lines), and sailed under the London Bridge at night. A very special sight indeed; she is beautifully illuminated.
A bridge of both the past and the present!. Beautiful bridge to look at! Reminds us of the grandeur of the past. I enjoyed sitting on the grass and adore the scenery around me!

Beautiful Bridge. Our whole family loved the bridge. Loved the view of the cars below through the glass floor. The exhibits explaining the history and construction of the bridge as well as comparisons with other bridges were nice. We also really enjoyed the Engine Rooms that were part of the Tower Bridge ticket. We even tried out the Raise the Bridge App which was fun. Would have loved to time it so that we could have actually seen the draw bridge raised, but the App at least gave us an idea.
The tower bridge London. Amazing for site visitors to see plus the dungeons where they hung people lovely day out along the river Thames
Party!. Book one here. Amazing on the outside and even more amazing on the inside when you see the mechanical guts of how the whole thing works. Extraordinary.

London Trip. Taking in the London attractions, we decided to try the latest Glass walkway on Tower Bridge.Interesting look into the history of the bridge and its workings, and the stairs is a wonderful way up, to see all the twists and turns and history that your wouldn't usually see.The glass walkway is not for everyone, but is a great way to view the sites below. You can still walk past the glass walkway without going on the top. I loved it.

Icon of London - Must Visit!. Tower Bridge is the icon of London and a must visit when you are in London. It is a beautiful old bridge and if you are lucky, you can see the bridge opens up to let the ships pass by. Amazing!

So Stately. You can walk across the bridge and there were a couple vendors selling snack foods so it's a very laid back area to visit. This is also a drawbridge. It is something that you'd want to see while in London
Interesting to see close up. We just walked across the bridge and admired the views. However, there also is the paid Bridge Experience which seems really popular based on the queue.

It's Fun. It's different to see the bridge from the inside, rather than from a distance. I certainly have more appreciation for the engineering now. After you've seen the must-see major sights, this is fun.

Another must see. What an amazing old bridge it is to see up close. Truly a worthwhile visit. This attraction is free with the london pass. Great view from the top and very amazing when the the bridge opens.

Amazing. We saw it close up, and decided to take tour. A lot of history I never knew. They have new glass floir, over the river, which is scary but amazing. Definitely worth a walk across it, highly recommend the tour inside!
Mandatory a Pic!. You have to take a pic of the Tower Bridge, walk through, see the view, hear the story of both towers then go to Tower of London.
Great Walk in London for views. The bridge offers a good stroll and lets you see beyond to all the other bridges in London... separate path available to walk comfortably...

Best Bridge, World. Was a great view at the top... Especially of the London Tower and below the bridge looking through the glass floor. Had a very good history of the bridge and other monumental bridges at the top. Also an opportunity to view the engine room. Must see location.
Outstanding experience . This is my favourite place in London. We chose to get married at Tower Bridge. It was a fairytale wedding day.

A London icon. Who doesn't know the Tower Bridge... except to get its correct name right...many people think that this is the "London Bridge" (In actuality just further downstream from it and very inconspicuous) but in fact it is not. Its the Tower Bridge to those who know. Anyone one who travels to London would recognize this world famous icon. It can be seen even from inside the Tower of London, just along the banks of the Thames. You can get a close up view of it from a River boat cruise. The boatman will tell you all about its history as you look at its height from below.Once seen it will always bring back memories of your trip here. Never has there been a bridge more grander then this one.

A really interesting and lovely bridge.. We drove across this bridge firstly on a hop on- hop off bus and then had to go back to walk across and get a closer look.An amazing and beautiful bridge. It provides great views up and down the Thames.It is free to walk across but you will need to pay if you would like a tour to the top.

Awesome bridge!. I loved this bridge. It is so pretty and ornate. I would definitely recommend going to the top. You get great views of London and the Thames. I loved the glass floor where you can see the cars and people and river below you. I would recomment getting the combined ticket with the Monument !
A must see. Tower bridge is an amazing bridge its very short in length so it is very easy to walk across it. it is also often confused with London bridge. A lot of people get these 2 bridges confused

Wonderful work of Victorian Engineering!. This bridge is just an icon of London! you see it, you love it! Please take your time to look at it at night when it has the lights on, it looks different and very romantic.

A Must See Architecural Gem. This is a stunning bridge and you must get somewhere on the Thames to view this beautiful bridge. We went to the Tower of London (Tower Hill Underground stop) and decided to walk across it this time. You can walk across the bridge for free. You can go up inside and walk on a portion of a glass walkway but there is a charge for that. We did not go up but glad we walked it. On the Thames, Tower of London side near the steps, there are a few steps into the river. You can not enter but read the plaque, interesting stuff.

VICTORIAN MARVEL. Anybody with taste for Victorian engineering will enjoy walking through this imposing mega structure that once made port activity possible in the city of London. It is admirable to find it still working with the original machinery after over 100 years.
Walk the bridge. If you are in London, you have to walk across Tower Bridge. If you are really lucky you will see it raised to let a ship through. The views of the city are fantastic.
Never gets old.... No matter how many times I see this bridge, it never gets old! I love taking in the colorful lights on a stroll along the Thames at night...

Great Experience. We done the Tower bridge experience and can highly recommend it, walking across the glass floors on either side is definitely an experience seeing all the traffic and people going across the bridge is very strange, well worth doing.

Prettiest sight in London. Love, love, love Tower Bridge. Combine a visit to Tower Bridge with a stop at Borough Market and the HMS Belfast. Make sure to not go on a Sunday to combine with the market.
very interesting. The new glass floors are a real attraction, but the history of how the bridge was built was very interesting. My husband in particular enjoyed the engine room.
Must see when in London. Must see when in London, nice walk along the Thames to get there. From the path along the Thames the best pictures can be taken.

The glass floor experience . For a treat for my sister's birthday we did the glass floor experience at the top of Tower Bridge . We took the stairs to the top which was rather interesting although tiering. However there are lifts which are maned by a helpful assistant. Once at the top there is interesting information about the bridge and how it was built etc. There are no time slots so it depends on what time and what day you go , to how busy it is. We went on a Saturday about midday. It was fairly busy but not too bad. There are great views of the Thames and the iconic buildings that edge the river and the skyline like the Shard. The glass floor is really good however I feel it should be longer as many people want to walk on it an take pictures and having the fascination of being able to look down onto the traffic, people and the passing boats below you need time. You feel you have to hurry along as there are other people also wanting to look.All in all I would recommend it as it is a good experience.
Nice bridge. Wales across bridge, nice. Jew if the Thames. Glad I did it, but not a must see. If you close by, definitely walk across it

What a lovely surprise!. Although I've walked over Tower Bridge on many occasions, I'd never been up inside before, so having taken a small handful of German exchange students up to London for the day, and finding the cost of getting into the tower quite prohibitive, we decided we'd climb up Tower Bridge instead. Now, while the bridge itself is awesome, and the glass walkways are great, the real treat is visiting the engine rooms underneath on the south side. Brilliant!If you get the chance, don't just photograph it, actually go inside. It's well worth it!

A London must do. Nice little excursion. The tour provides a great insight into the building and operation of the London Icon even though it is unaccompanied. Well worth a visit, not too expensive and only 5 minutes from the Tower of London

A Bridge Across Time. We went to Tower Bridge and enjoyed the modern touches to make the bridge experience more memorable. The lift was modern and the glass floor to look down onto the road below was large and clear. There are little windows to open to allow a clear vantage point to take panoramic pictures of the river and surrounding areas.

Beautiful.. Really beautiful place to visit.There are plenty of benches and areas to stand and look at this gorgeous attraction in London.There are also plenty of nice places to eat/get a drink and nice souvenir shops. I really enjoyed visiting.

Not the London Bridge - I'm the Tower Bride. Many people mistake the tower Bridge for the London Bridge, but you are soon corrected by tour guides or people walking by. We took a hop of hop off tour and drove across the bridge and it was amazing to look up and see the detail but to walk across it and take your time to really look at the detail and look down the river and all the amazing sites was very impressive.We had the privileage of seeing the bridge swing open while we were at the Tower of London and that too was impressive.
Watch it open!. Go onto the TFL page on twitter and find out when it's going to lift..I've seen it so many times but I always enjoy seeing it happen
Great views. We didn't go up, didn't feel the need, but just cool being on there and seeing everything. Caught a double decker bus going over, good picture!

Do the tour.. A sight not to be missed. Take the time to walk over the bridge and back and then pay the extra to do the tour of the bridge. Walk over the upper level and see the history of the bridge. The glass floor is kinda cool.

Glass Walkway. GREAT.. I've been to Tower Bridge loads of times but this time I decided to go up on the glass walkways. I loved it!! It's such a beautiful bridge and this was a really nice experience. So great to see it from that angle. I went first thing in the morning and there were no crowds. Make sure to time your visit with a bridge opening. Just ask them at the counter and they will let you know. It was terrific. Added a different dimension to the visit. The engine room visit wasn't my cup of tea but others seemed to be interested. :)
Very lucky in unlucky weather. Heavy downpour when we visit there but we are lucky to see they open up the bridge to let ship to pass through.
Iconic bridge!. Great architecture and iconic bridge in london.awesome photo taking experience and definitely will visit again in future travel.

It's Tower Bridge. A lot smaller than you'd imagine, but a must see for anyone who visits London. You can go inside, but we didn't. At one end is the Tower of London and you should be able to get the two in one photo.

This is the bridge you are looking for. I'm sure a lot of people confuse London bridge with this one. A very cool looking bridge. Walk across if you get a chance. Also you are right by the Tower of London so you can check out both. Very cool and ornate bridge.

Trip to London - Saturday Afternoon Visit. A superb attraction for the prices charged for entry.
Busy but not hectic. Visitors are given plenty of time to enjoy the views and to 'try' the glass floor - which was superb!
Timed our visit to coincide with the bridge opening. Viewed from above it was incredible.

Great views of London from an iconic landmark.. Interesting tour, which takes about an hour overall. Up the lift in one tower, walk across the bridge over the glass floor (or round it, if you're chicken) with details on the bridge's construction an history. Second part is in the engine room for the bridge, showing the old steam system for lifting it. You can do them in either order.

Classic London Visit!!!. What can I possible say? Tower Bridge is a London icon. I wish all the modern buildings were not built around it, but i'm sure people in the buildings around it love the view of this iconic landmark of London. I'm not from the UK and have only been to London twice, but both times went to the Tower Bridge. This most recent, my daughter and I sent up into the tower and walked the bridge over the glass floor. The bridge opened while we were on the catwalk and it was an amazing view. I'm terrified of heights, so for those of you like me, know that the catwalk is enclosed with glass and there are areas you can walk around the glass floor window, the whole catwalk is NOT glass and you will feel secure and be fine. I highly recommend going up the towers to the catwalk, it was a nice view and and very lovely experience. Did I say, I LOVE London??!!! :-)

Iconic- the symbol of London. It's the iconic architectural structure of London. A beautiful piece of architecture, which opens up in the middle to let pass bigger ships. I was lucky enough to see the bridge open twice. A very photogenic place too.

Is it up? No.. Want to see and impressive bridge - one of the few remaining quality old bridges. If you want to see it open you have to search online - a rarer occurrence nowadays. still worth visiting and next to the Tower of London.

Beautiful bridge with amazing walkway. Go on Tower Bridge is great idea, go on walkway where is iconic view on London and Themes, look down throught the glass floor is amazing and historical steam machine for bridge`s open system is interesting.

An Iconic Bridge. A bridge to be walked on and spend time looking around. The Thames flowing beneath, the crowd of people milling around, having a good look at the bridge especially at the joint where it lifts. It's a beautiful bridge with lots of history behind it. Standing on the bridge you take pictures--lots of them. Walked across it towards the St. Katherine's Docks from the Tower of London side. A must-visit.
Top places to visit in London. A must if you go to UK... one of the most iconic and beautiful places. You must wall around and cross the bridge to enjoy all the different views.
A beautiful architectural masterpiece.. We walked the Tower Bridge at night. It is stunning and peaceful at the same time. It made for a lot of good pictures.
Tower Bridge. This was by far the most famous (looks wise) bridge in London and it makes for great pictures. We even saw the bridge lifted which was nice.

Worth a visits!. I wasn't aware this was an attraction and thought so when I saw you could actually go up and see it from the top was so excited (Can you tell I love London) anyway, it was fantastic, the views across London were amazing. The history of how it was built is really interesting and it did make my children listen as it was a fairly short and easy listening with a video playing in the background which was perfect as my children did ask why we were bothering to go and look at the bridge. Nice pieces of artwork are on display which was nice to look at. Def worth a visit!

Iconic Landmark of London :). This is be surely An Iconic Landmark Bridge of London.Every Traveler can't go without visiting this Picturistic Tower.You can also go into the tower by purchasing a Ticket or if you have London Pass , it free for them.This tower is build on River Thames along with many Cafe's around including some best hotels.You cant miss this if you are Visiting London for sure:)

An evening walk. I was in London last year, Tower Bridge has something special in it, its unique of its kind, A evening near it is worth spending. I recommend to walk along the river and see all the bridges on the river during night light. If you are couples you would remember this evening walk.

First class meal. Excellent reception and meal in the tower for a friends ruby wedding anniversary. Staff all very attentive and first class meal - ideal for a small party with added benefit of being able to view from the walkway with great view both up and down stream and the glass floor allowing a good view below + a tour of the pump room machinery a great afternoon.

A Glass Walkway Over The River Thames. The Bridge Museum is interesting and fun. Found out why and how it was built and how it works when its opened. There is a glass walkway ( which is optional if one chooses NOT to look down at the Thames below) and information on many levels but there's a lot of steps!

Visit the sidewalks. Walk the bridge of course but don't forget to take the elevator to the sidewalks. It is amazing to look down through the glass floor at the traffic and the river 45 meters lower. You can stand on this glass floor and see it all. Also awesome views over London.

Mind the Gap. We walked on the East side so we could visit the St. Katherine Docks easily, but I bet the west crossing is better for iconic views of the Tower of London and downtown. I think any way you cross will be great at this iconic bridge.Had fun jumping over the gap where the bridge lifts. Not that it is a large gap, mind. Just thinking about it splitting in two at that point makes it exciting!It is a beautiful bridge and just standing on it and watching the barges crossing beneath was fun! A "must cross" when walking along the Thames!
Night visit. If u want to see this brigde i recomend do in it at night. It so beatiful with all the light on it. Dont miss it

Good value & great views of the city. We both really enjoyed visiting Tower Bridge. You get great views of the city from the walk-ways & there is plenty of interesting information to read. Afterwards you have the opportunity to visit the engine rooms (included in the entry fee.)
A bridge like no other. An amazing bridge got to see it in all its glory opening and closing once day the and once evening Definitely worth a visit
Nice to walk over.. It was an experience worth doing. It's incredible history to learn about. Would revisit again, in fact I plan on revisiting in the future.

On a good weather this place is awsome . A great variety of cafes and restaurants along the walking path.. really great view .. Highly recommend this place for you. .Just take note of the weather before hand ..On sunset the view is great try to adjust your trio near that time

Great views amazing landmark . Tower Bridge offers great views across the Thames . The bridge looks amazing both during the day and at night when the structure is illuminated.Go and visit this wonderful landmark! !!

Mesmerizing!. I was fascinated to know that the London Bridge is not the "pretty one," it's the Tower Bridge! We snuck a peek while at the Tower of London and were so taken aback. If only all bridges were so well-designed and aesthetically pleasing! You don't want to miss seeing this if you're in the area... it's a bucket list item for many!

Lovely Views & Cool Glass Floor. Definitely worth going up for the view of the Thames and for an amazing photo opp on the glass floor! Beware if you're afraid of heights!!!There are also some interesting videos and photos of the bridge being built, as well as some machinery.If you plan to go up, note which side the entrance is on before you start walking across the bridge. You can't cross the road once you're on it!

The best views are from the river banks. Check when the bridge will open for boats.. The best views of this bridge are from the banks either side or from London Bridge. If you are going to come here Google the times that the bridge will be opening to allow boats to pass underneath. There are places to eat and drink on both sides and footpaths as well so you can have a lovely walk wherever you choose.

Nice sightseeing. I went for a walk with my children. The weather was nice and we had a good time walking on the bridge and under the bridge. We walked on the riverside. Very clean and lots of tourists. Felt safe and good walk

Very majestic and well maintained . After we visited London Tower from where you can see the majestic Tower Bridge, we decided to walk there.Streams of tourists who never let up. We decided to go up to the top but the long lines helped us decide not to. I always thought this was London Bridge because it is so more impressive than the actual London Bridge. We stayed on it and watched ships go by beneath.

great view. I know you can pay to do a walk and tour across the top of tower bridge which I have not done. I have only ever walked across from the main part of the bridge.Its great on a nice day especially when its sunny. Great views of the thames and buildings around it. All the family of all ages would enjoy.Lovely at night when all the lights are lit.Its great to see when the bridge goes up but this can be very rare.Great photo ops.

Walk on Scary Glass Panels of bridge.. Not to miss this attraction, climb / go by lift to bridge & enjoy first a short video, explaining construction history then experience beautiful scene as well as walk on scary glass panels to see passing of traffic and boats too.When a big ship arrives, the bridge get lifted with the mechanism to create passing passage is wonderful experience to see.

Must cross bridge. Photo opp alert! Such an iconic bridge so a walk across it is an easy, free must while in London. Location is great for seeing other sites such as the London Tower. If you are down for a long stroll on a non-rainy day then cross over to the South Bank and walk all the way to the London eye for great views of the city.

Lovely walk. The walk between the Southbank over the Tower Bridge to the Tower of London is a lovely thing to do in the summer. There is also a museum in part of the bridge that costs to visit should that interest you. Not a very long walk and plenty of space on both sides of the bridge to relax afterwards if you need a break.
Steampunk on the Thames. Great views, info about the building of this Victorian engineering marvel, and tour of the original engine rooms that powered the drawbridges.

London Pass. We didn't have any line to wait in to go over the bridge. There is a see though portion that you walk over. It is covered by the London Pass which is a great deal if you are going to go to more than one attraction.

Beautiful bridge which many think is "London Bridge". Tower Bridge is a beautiful stately bridge which Is well worth a visit. We also had an evening dinner cruise on the Thames and the bridge is lit up beautifully at night. Some great photos from the river Nd as we went under it.

Great to Behold. We were on a Thames River cruise when the bridge got set to open for a tall ship to come through. The bridge on its own is special, let alone getting to see it rise for a ship. The ship was coming In from Columbia with the rugby players for the world tournament being held in England. Every mast had crew people in red white and blue uniforms which made it even more special.
Very Recognizable Sight in London!. Have always seen this bridge & recognized it, but I rode on tour bus under it this trip! So beautiful!
What a beauty. Cool to walk across and admire the architecture, what a beautiful picture it makes for a backdrop of this wonderful historic city!

Be Dazzled!. Even as a die hard London for the 25 years, there is always something magical about this bridge. We now the facade is false, but it doesn't matter. You can lose yourself in the majesty of the structure, or you can marvel at the engineering behind the mechanisms that lift the huge road decks. It's iconic and deserves to me. Everyone thinks it's 'London Bridge' and it kind of should be, but it's not. Take a bus over the bridge, any busy, and enjoy the staggering views. If you travel in the back of a car, lie back, look out and up from the rear window, and be dazzled by the spectacle that passes above you.The Tower of London end of the bridge is perfectly safe. The south side of the bridge is less safe when it is late and dark. This would not stop me going there, but just remember to keep your wits about you if you visit late.Oh, it's best view late when it's dark lol

Learned something new!. Fantastic view and photog site! You can go up on top of bridge for great views of the city. I confused this as the London bridge, but realized that the Tower Bridge is the famous, beautiful bridge and the London Bridge is just a plain old bridge.

Lovely sunny day for a view over the river. We used our train tickets to get a discounted entrance to the Bridge. We walked straight in and into a lift, no waiting, The staff in the lift and on the Bridge were pleasant and informative. The information boards were interesting and the short film worth watching. It was not very busy when we visited and we had plenty of time to take photos on the glass floor of the walkway. The views were great and it was possible to open some of the little windows to take photos although those taken through the glass were fine. We also went to the Engine Rooms which didn't do much for me but my Husband enjoyed. The toilet facilities on the bridge were very clean and modern - rather unexpected. Well worth a visit - especially if you have a 2for 1 voucher and it is a sunny day.....

Beautiful Tower Bridge. I love London! Tower Bridge by day or night, it's just so beautiful with the architecture. I am amazed with it and happy to be there too. I went for cruising at River Thames, the view of Tower Bridge just so stunning.

Towering above London. Visited on a fairly busy Saturday, with only one of the two walkways open. However, visitors were filtered through so it was easy to view everything comfortably. A very enjoyable and fascinating view of one of the most recognised London landmarks. It was fun to look through the glass floor at the traffic on and under the bridge below.
Great Views. Very pretty both outside and inside. There was almost no wait and the small fee was worth it. The views are spectacular, even on a cloudy day.

Eye catching, whether viewed from land or water. I’ve enjoyed this good-looking bridge, both day and night, while passing over it, passing under it, and viewing it from the embankments. You get the most dramatic views from a tour boat at night. The view from the Tower of London is a close second..

Staff need training. I went here with my wife on the 3rd October The West side was closed so they justified things by giving a free copy of the guide to everyone. I feel they should only be charging half price. The other thing we found out was that the staff kept directing us to different sides of the bridge for the main entrance hence we kept crossing the very busy road on the advice of staff from the bridge. The staff should be better trained and the venue should have prominent signs showing the way in to the towers...

The Icon of London. A visit to London is not complete without a visit to Tower Bridge. If you are lucky, you will even get to see it open to let a ship through!
A tour through the bridge is fascinating, including a walk high up on the glass floored walkway.

Tower Bridge visit, May 2015. This was also a dream come true, since most of us have grown up with learnign the nursery rhyme, `London Bridge is falling Down'. It was interesting to see the drawbridge, and watch the Thames flowing below.

Romantic evening plan.. Just a another highlight of Britain amazing architecture and character. Such an interesting history and intricate details. Worth the visit. Perfect date for a romantic anniversary for two people interested in british history.

One of London's best. Although I live in London, every time I look at Tower Bridge I am amazing at how beautiful the bridge is. No matter what time of day, rain or sunshine, this is truly a jewel in the crown.

Great view from afar if you don't have a lot of time. We didn't cross the bridge, if you walk around the back of the Tower of London, you get a magnificent view of the bridge if you don't actually have time to go all the way there. The views are great all time of the day as you get a clear view of the bridge from that particular spot

Not anything special to do, but kinda cool just to see!. So pretty, and historic. Not as large as I had imagined. We were able to walk across it to the Tower of London, and back again to our hotel. It's truly a magnificent sight.

walking across the bridge. Decided to walk across the Tower Bridge after a day spent at the Tower of London. Very crowded just strolling across on a weekend afternoon but well worth the walk. We did not do the tour as we had just plunked plenty of money down to see the Tower of London. Picture taking seemed to be best on the side across from the Tower of London where there were less crowds.

Must go in london . Tower bridge is a must see site in london. you can spend around 9£ and go inside and walk on thee glass floor too. Safe with kids and lot to see around. Recommended for all visitors going to london.

An amazing London site. . Tower Bridge is on my works doorstep and sometimes I love just watching the world go by from the Thames walkway. Something soothing about this place and it looks truly stunning at dawn and dusk.

All this history in such a condensed location. We walked the Southbank prior to going over the Tower Bridge visiting the Tate Modern Gallery then over the bridge to the Tower of London. The Tate is well worth a visit but you should allow more time than we had, suggest two to three hours at least. You then cross the famous Tower Bridge on you way to the Tower of London. Allow about two hours minimum in the tower and make sure you listen to the Beefeaters resitatation prior to your tour. If you simply walked this course from the strand to Southbank then a cross the bridge to the tower it would only take around 45-50 minutes

The riches of the Queen of England is a must see. This is a must see when in London The most amazing collection of the most magnificent jewellery. Some of the huge riches in the form of jewellery that belong to the Queen of England. You must keep moving and not stand still for security reasons

Tower Bridge London. This is one of those places I always thought I should visit, and I'm glad I did. It was interesting and fun walking on the clear, Plexiglas bridge portion, very high above the traffic passing underneath. There were great views of London from the bridge.

Lovely bridge to walk. We stayed near the Tower Bridge which is a lovely site and a great bridge to jog/walk over to get to the south bank. City Hall is just on the south side of the bridge and the Tower on the North side. It is a functioning drawbridge so occasionally it opens.
WOW ! That glass floor. Very nice experience to go up and walk on that glass floor so high up. Great views on London and very instructive also a must when in the City
So Beautiful to See!. This is one of the most beautiful bridges in All of Europe. As you view this bridge from all points of view it is so very lovely

Good value. We took the kids and grandkids on a family day out in our great capital. First port of call was Tower Bridge. Considering it was a Sunday there were no queues, and a healthy concession for us old 'uns (60+)!
And the glass walkways were a hit too.
In our humble opinion this was good value all round.

Stunning views and glass floor. We really enjoyed the tower bridge. The views of London were superb and it was fun to walk on the glass floors on the upper walkway. The exhibit on the the workings of the bridge on the South Bank side is worth exploring too.

Great Monument. This is a great landmark in London. The bridge is a wonder, water and so called marina close by is beautiful. Very easily accessible by underground. But be careful, the place around the bridge (mainly Tower of London) is flocked by several hundred people. Causing a bit of crowd near the bridge. A photo (taken away from the bridge) will serve as a wallpaper.

Tower Bridge - not to confused with the Tower of Londonm. One can go to the Tower Bridge and look at its priceless architecture. You can get a lovely view of the River Thames with the ship's, ferries, other vessels from Tower Bridge. From the walk towards the Tower of London one gets an imposing view of Tower Bridge.

Great views. Wicked, really top attraction. lovely story, good for children as they have a list of stickers to collect on the way around.Superb views. and of course the latest addition to ever growing list of 'glass floor' attractions.
Picturesque!. Wonderful bridge, easy to walk across and plenty of cafes and restaurants in the surrounding areas to soak in the Thames.

Must walk it. A beautiful view to wake up to. See all the traffic and gusto. Must read all the signs to get full info on the bridge. You wouldn't have guessed that a sea captain is in charge of it. Loved seeing the bridge go up and down and watch all kinds of ships sail under. The lights it has at night. Felt so good walking on it. A must

Great views of London. The Tower Bridge exhibition is a nice way to kill an hour and see some of London. You start by going up the lift on the North Tower where you will see some history of the building of the bridge. From there you can walk across the top of the bridge (which is enclosed) and get some great pictures of the Thames. You end up going down the south tower and of course can browse the gift shop for trinkets.

Worth a Visit. Make the effort to visit this iconic bridge. Very interesting to know its history & the construction. Great view from the top & view through the glass floor. Take your time to stroll across the top. Than head down to view the engine rooms to raise the bridge. Recommended visit.

Another London Gem. The Victorians certainly knew how to design and build. This famous London landmark is well worth visiting for the views alone. If you're an engineering boff, a visit to the engineering rooms is a must (included in the standard price).
A must. The museum is good but the glass path is a must. The views are a good oportunity for photos. But also just walking the bridge is worth

Great trip to Tower Bridge exhibition. My daughter had an inset day so I wanted an interesting day out. Our visit to the exhibition was perfect. Easy to get to by tube. The exhibition gave interesting info about the history, design and building of the bridge. Lots of social history as well as the technicalities of the design. Lots of information about bridge design and bridges around the world. The staff/guides were friendly and v helpful (although the young lady at the ticket desk was a bit grumpy). We then had a sandwich sitting beside the Thames watching the bridge raise for the paddle steamer. Easy journey back home, lovely day out with my daughter.
Beautiful bridge . I haven't been upstairs and haven't seen glass floor but still this place is awesomeness and you can see how it up to let boats go
Tower Bridge. The amazing experience of seeing below through the glass walkaway. good to see the cars below and boats beneath them. A very unique experience. price less.

Not just a bridge. Never thought I would consider taking a toru of a bridge, but this bridge is phenomenal. We had just left the Tower of London and here is this magnificent structure. Just a neat bridge. It was fun walking across and walking up to the top for the magnificent view. Wish we could have seen it raise and lower.
Amazing views. Great views from up top and great bits of history too. Worth a visit on a clear day to make the most of the views.

Worthwhile . I visited as fancied seeing what the views were like and the history of the bridge and wasn't disappointed. Brilliant views on the right day and interesting learning the history of the bridge. Got the lift up but walked down seeing the workings of the bridge. Great!
A true London icon. Such a beautiful bridge, a true icon of London. Love just walking across it! I have been lucky to see the bridge raised many years ago, which was incredible to see!

Spend some time around this beauty!!. I LOVE this bridge, and seeing it in person was one of the reasons I chose London for my first overseas vacation. It is gorgeous! To see it from both sides of the Thames river, to see it while at the Tower of London, to see it lit up at night, and to see if from so many other places during my visit was a treat. I did the Tower Bridge Experience which takes you inside and up to the walkway which connects one tower to the other. They have a portion of the floor that is glass, which is pretty cool to walk on and look down. Great views of London from up here, too.
Something for all. We had an informative and interactive visit. The kids 4,6,8 really enjoyed the climb, views and glass floors and us adults found the history and mechanics interesting
Tower bridge . A big bridge, one of London's finest. A must see if visiting London. Right next to the Tower of London which which we also saw

Glass bottom floor! . The only reasons I wanted to go, was to say I went and because of the glass bottom floor. I love the history and the architecture. If you've read any of my reviews you can obviously see I love the history of places and architecture. The views were great. I would recommend you stopping by.

The most impressive bridge in London. the bridge stands proud on the London sky line and it really is impressive. Whether viewing from a distance, bus tour, walking over it or visiting the inside museum it has impressive views from every angle. On this visit we did the museum visit, priced at £9 pp but we had a 241 offer. It passes an hour or so but isn't the kind of place you can spend a day. Included in the tour was a talk on the design of the bridge, a walk over the two walkways including a glass floor section and a visit to the engine rooms. I enjoyed it but I am pleased we paid 241 as I do feel they could make more out of it. More about the workers, exactly how it was made. It seems the experience relies on the impressive structure and not much info is given other than a few photos. A good way to pass an hour or so but don't go with really high expectations. The glass floor is a must.

River boat tour. We are on a river boat touring the beautiful river of London. And we saw the tower Bridge, and London bridge, and a few more bridges .. forgot the name.. was quite chilling up in the deck..

London's Hallmark. Depsite the fact that you won't be able to see the heads of criminals on the bridge anymore, it's still one of the most impressive sights for tourists. It is London in itself. Beware the crowds can be too much on the bridge, so time your visit wisely. A must see, of course. So much history in one square.
London tower bridge. Wonderful landmark in London. Easily seen as you walk along the river. A must see for all . Beautiful bridge crossing Thames

Amazing view. The Tower Bridge looks very beautiful both during the day and in the night... The view from the bridge is lovely and the buildings by the side of the river build a pretty picture... I was also lucky enough to be present there when the bridge opened up and the it was a nice experience to see the bridge open and allow few vessels to pass through
One of THE Stops. Of course you have to check it out. It is impressive without the tour. Just walk across after visiting the Tower of London.

Take the stairs and enjoy the glass floor. I had walked under the bridge before and have seen the raising of the bridge but this time around I bought tickets to go up and I am glad I did. For two people it was 18.00 and instead of taking the elevator we decided to walk the stairs. It wasn't that bad but don't do it if you're prone to getting short of breath!Once you get to the top there was staff to give some insight into the area you arrive at. But once you go to the center of the bridge you can get a nice thrill by walking on the glass floor. I have a new respect for heights now and the entry fee was worth the excitement. I am not sure if you can watch the raising of the bridge from the glass floor, I am sure you can and I can only imagine how awesome that would be. Just because it is such a common tourist site does not mean someone should avoid taking the time and money to enjoy it.

Visited in 2004. I was in London back in 2004 with friends. Picadilly circus, Trafalgar square and bridge are close by if I remember correctly. We were there at night and London just wakes up at night. There's so much going on in Picadilly area. A walk to London Bridge is must. It's more beautiful than in pics and if you are lucky you might watch it open for ships

Great Spot for Pictures!. It's one of those London structures that hit you in the face when you need reminding of where you are standing. Looming over the water of the River Thames, you see the massive history of the city. Also, bring a camera. The opportunity for amazing pictures is immense.

Lovely bridge. Was in London last week and went to Tower Bridge. It always strikes me how remarkable this bridge is. The numbers of tourists on the bridge taking pictures of the ever changing skyline of London bears testimony to the fact that this is indeed a great tourist attraction and city monument. The bridge is lovely - with it's beautiful blue hue and its suspension works - a visit is nothing short of spectacular. Views of London (the City, the Tower of London, The London Eye, etc...) from here are spectacular. Recommended!

Great way to spend the evening. - Wonderful structure- Time your visit to match the opening (lifting up) of the arms of the bridge- They also have a paid trip down to the machine room to see how the mechanism works...its very interesting for the technically oriented

Great view. We found this experience very exciting. You can go there for only £9 or for free with London pass. We caught a time when the bridge opened and it was fascinating.You can learn a lot of its history there.Very good spent 9 pounds

The Simbol of London. I love Tower Bridge. I alwais impressed when passing or even looking on it from different poits: London Bridge, Tower, The Shard, or HSM Belfast... Who didn't pass the Tower Bridge means never been in London...
Excellent view. This is a very good experience. Not suitable for people who afraid of heights. The view from the bridge is excellent, especially at the glass floor.
Make sure to see at night!. We visited London onboard a small cruise boat and were fortunate to sail under the bridge. Beautiful sight!

Worth walking over.. This history of this is less interesting than I would have thought. Nonetheless, great fun crossing over the upper deck. Worth it you have the London Pass because then you skip the lines.

awesome ,awesome,awesome. its so big and beautiful..but the best part was when it opens..its only for 2 mints..but that it the real time to see the bridge..we were fortunate enough to see the bridge open ..i have posted pix too..a must go and experince place..

Magnificent structure. What a magnificent structure it's got everything you want from history to architecture.
I have waked it drove over it and sailed under it and never get sick of looking at it it is London.

Spectacular views. Amazing views over London from the top of the bridge I even made it across the glass floor which is a big thing for someone scared of heights! Could do with a bit more telling of the story how the bridge was conceived and built. But all in all worth a visit just for the views
Must see!. You can't go to London without seeing Towar Bridge! Always a wonder...I strongly recommend a walk around St Katherines docks and a drink at the Dickens Inn pub for the full experience
Can't be Missed Icon. I don't think that you can visit London and not see this bridge. It is really lovely. The view as you cross over is very nice too!

Great experience value for money. However maybe an obligate destination, a great experience with kids. A good insight in the history in combination with the view on the city is worth the costs. As a great extra the glass floors makes this a great value for money destination

Superb views of London, magnificent glass floor. Great way to spend a couple of hours in London. Views up and down the river are excellent and it is amazing to watch the river traffic through the glass floor. exhibition details the construction [only 8 years, 1888 to1896] as well as details of other striking bridges around the world.My son noticed in my picture looking at the Shard that rather bizarrely it was looking back!The price is not outrageous, you take a lift up but it's a lot of stairs down. We then enjoyed a fine stroll along the river bank.For steam buffs the old engine rooms are open for inspection.TIP: If your are lucky you can time your visit for bridge openings, check their website. However be aware that these can change or like us you could be disappointed as we had tea booked elsewhere and could not delay.

Iconic London. Great location to see a lot of what London has to offer. We started at St. Pauls, then went across the river to the Globe, walked down to great views of Tower Bridge. Stopped and had dinner at Strada (great views of the Bridge). Then we walked across the Bridge and went to the Tower of London.

What a bride. This is the alpha of all bridges! Such an iconic bridge of British history. I love seeing it and walking or driving across it. Also did the tour once, very interesting to see the upper deck area and the engines to bring the bridge up. Great views of central London aswell.

Cheap history tour of iconic site. Enjoyed this. Wanted to put down an hour. Worth £9. Got complimentary guide book. Learned bout who built it. How it works and walked between two towers by walkway. Which has glass part floor which is cool. Then get to go to engine rooms to see workings of bridge.

Lifting times..... Within walking distance of London Bridge tube and plenty of facilities and other attractions nearby. You get amazing views of both banks and the buildings from the bridge, however you can also access the inside exhibition space at a reasonable charge that includes a glass walkway above the bridge. A nice stroll on a sunny day across the bridge was enough for my partner and I. Make sure you see it day and night and check online for bridge lifting times we were lucky enough to see it twice in one day.

Over the Water!!!!!. Kind of an odd way to get there with access only on one side. Quick entrance and an elevator ride up a little history of the bridge and then you get to walk on the glass floor. Somewhat not for the faint of heart. The engine rooms are at the other end of the bridge.
Pretty cool. It was pretty cool to see the Tower Bridge,we took some nice pictures of it after leaving the Tower of London,

You have to do this and walk across the glass floor and see all of the traffic below. This was absolutely brilliant and a bargain at less than £10 each. The upper level has absolutely breathtaking views......
A must visit in London. We didn't tour the exhibition that was at the tower, we just walked along the walk way and took pictures.

Iconic. Even though I have seen it hundreds of times on TV and movie it's really impressive to see it up close and walk across it. Combine this with tower of London and Tate modern and you have a day out

Great icon. Great icon , to visit and view , surrounded by other attractions such as Belfast and the tower . Worth the visit inside with the walkway , interesting and a classic sight . Remember as with everything in London its busy and its not UK bargain prices.

Glass walkway. We used our London Pass to do this attraction after being at the Tower of London and before the HMS Belfast across the river Thames. We quickly went through the exhibits and across the see-through walkway, down to the engine rooms. It was very interesting and different. There was a school group of 10 year olds who were having a blast; they were fun to watch.
London Trip. The tower bridge area of London is full of restaurants and bars, you can also do the glass floor experience if not scared of hights
A monument of older time achievement.. Though it is an old bridge, every single detail in its structure is a beauty in its own. It is highly recommended to visit this piece of art.
Must visit attraction. It is a must visit, not very expensive. The views from the west & east tower are awesome and especially the glass floor
Must see. When you are in London, you must see the tower bridge. There is so much beauty and history. There is nothing like it anywhere else in the world.

where history was made. simply loved it. Inside you are told the story of the bridge and shown haw they made it. You can also see the original engine and mechanism used to open the bridge for the passing os ships. It's just amazing how they did it with the technology of the time. Worth a visit.

Great view through the glass floor. We enjoyed this tour and the amazing glass floor looking down on to the road bridge, we actually got to see a bridge lift through the glass floor which was amazing. also good river views too
The most beautiful bridge.... This is, for sure, the most beutiful bridge in the world.What a view, day or night.An absolute icon of London.Extraordinary place. Must-see of the City.
Beauty at night. One of the best attractions to see in London by night. Looking outstanding with all the lights glowing down at the water underneath. Perfect for selfies too :-P Highly recommended

Walk the Glass Floor. Wow really enjoyed our visit I have visited London a few times and walked across this beautiful bridge a but this time I wanted to experience it from the top. I was not disappointed the view is amazing also as I had had a fall a few days ago and my walking was not great they gave us a wheel chair which helped so much.I think this is a must when you come to London
beautiful. A must to visit in London!! It is as beautiful as in the photos! WE only took photos from far away because we wanted to have its full shape.

The Tower Bridge Experience is not to be missed!. The walk to the Tower Bridge was delightful . The bridge itself is majestic and iconic symbol for London. Then there is the added "fun" of standing on the new glass floor overlooking the Thames River. A bit scary at first but once you stand on it you are thrilled to see the river and the action below. From this floor and high level walkways you can see stunning London views. Make sure to continue to the Victorian Engine Rooms to learn about the inner workings of the bridge. Our teen boys really enjoyed this exhibit! (We made reservations and purchased the combined tickets from home - NJ. I recommend purchasing in advance of your trip to ensure you can get in and to cut down on waiting time)

Iconic bridge and you can even climb the towers. Since we were staying nearby we had the opportunity to walk the Tower Bridge on our visit to London. For a modest fee you can even climb the towers. The bridge is interesting in its own right and best experienced on foot.
I love a good bridge!!. Worth visiting if just for the views up and down the Thames. The glass panel is quite something if you can get to it, worth a try. The bridge is beautiful and so iconic.

Hard to miss.... Regardless which side of the city you are on, if you are remotely close to the river it is a must to take a walk (if your not staying in the area) and see the bridge. If the walk is too much, hop on the tube, this is a quick hit to view the bridge, take some pictures and move on with your day as you choose.
Beautiful and Functional. Probably one of the most beautiful bridges on the planet and a must see if in the area. at night it is a spectacle in itself.

Get the London Pass and skip the line. I had the London pass which allowed me to skip the line and it was wonderful! The elevator is the fastest route up but can also be busy. You can take the stairs, but waiting in line for the elevator took only about 5 minutes for me.Try to plan your visit when the bridge opens, you can find this information online as to the scheduled opening times. On the bridge you can site near the glass windows and watch this all from an amazing view. I went close to closing time and it worked perfect for me! But earlier in the morning I went to the bridge which was neat because it wasn't busy and easy to take selfies, lol.

Great views.. This is a great place to do as a treat if you have a man who likes engineering and you can treat him to this whilst he treats you to the theatre, shopping or both!Just enough information without being bombarded and a nice way to link a walk around South and North embankments.
Impressive . We loved to see this bridge from different angles. We were walking from different directions towards it everytime we found impressive.
Go Visit. Stunning Sight to see. Worth a trip as it is right next to tower of London so you can visit both in one go.
Cool. Walking the length of the bridge is the only way to get a good impression of the historical value and impressive architecture.

Saw it lift up!!. When we approached the dock at the Tower of London the guide advised us that the bridge was about to be raised. After a few minutes we saw it lift and 2 sailing boats sailed through. My granddaughters were so excited as apparently the bridge only gets raised 3 or 4 times a week now.

Worth the visit to see the inside and different views of London and the river. Combined advance ticket with the Monument makes this a good tour. The "exhibition" at the start is almost non-existent, but that's not the main reason to visit. The views from the walkway across the top and the interesting insight into the construction of this iron and steel Victorian bridge makes it worthwhile. The original steam powered engine room is a great finale to the tour. Shame about the over-priced tourist shop at the end which has become unavoidable on almost all tourist attractions nowadays.

Definitely worth a visit. Had a 2 4 1 voucher as visited London by train so it cost us £4.50 each instead of the usual £9 entry fee....however even the full price is still very reasonable. We decided to take the stairs up....not sure that was such a good idea...there is a lift but we thought the exercise would do us good. Lots to see and the views are spectacular over the Thames....and not forgetting the glass walkway....not something I wanted to walk on! The Engine Room is also included in the entrance fee and is well worth a look. 1-2 hours is plenty of time to enjoy this attraction.

Great architecture !!!. Amazing architecture !!!Very unique & iconic built .One of a kind .... Great history for London .Watch this tower from day to night , it's just totally exceptional !!!Taking the cruise is also another way of taking its sophisticated view .
Must have. During your visit in London don't forget about Tower Bridge. It is amazing and shows u a beautiful view on river and city.
Tower bridge. Saw this as we traveled over it and other bridges plus went under it on our Themes River ride. Beautiful to see and use. It is a high light of the city

Bridge to another time. This bridge was beautiful! The structure is breathtaking. Such lovely work doesn't exist these days! For a real treat...you should view it at night! Read up on the history connected and it will mean so much more when you visit.
Beauty over waters. The beauty and the magnificence of this place makes it hard to believe that it was built so long ago.
Worth the detour. Close to Tower of London and easy access, the Tower Bridge is worth a walk accross and back. Good views down the Thames and hop on hop off bus stops nearby. Worth the detour.

Waste of money. Visited here and was so disappointed. It is virtually theft as you see very little. I would have like to have seen the lower sections of the bridge but yo9u don't. You pay to look at pictures of other bridges from around the world.
Only interesting part was when you see the old engine room. Avoid.

A fun visit to this iconic bridge with a plexiglass floor.. Tower Bridge, often misidentified as "London Bridge" is definitely worth a visit, particularly if you are a first time visitor to London. It's one of those iconic structures that comes to mind when you think of images of London.  You can easily enjoy this in about two hours. Go on a sunny day so that you may enjoy the view and see it in all it's glory. Tower Bridge is visually attractive because of its wonderful architecture and it's also quite interesting in terms of engineering. We happened to be there at a time when they were lifting the bridge for some taller marine traffic that was making its way down the river. Go enjoy the video presentation upstairs and look at some of the original equipment that used to raise the bridge. In addition, there's a silly bit of fun to be had when you go up to the top level of the bridge and stroll across a part of the floor that is clear plexiglass. Now, you know that you won't fall through because killing tourists would be bad for business, but it is still quite eery to be looking between your feet and seeing the cars passing way below.  Tower Bridge is one of the attractions that are included with The London Pass. This means that you do not pay admission when you get there and you can also jump on a relatively short line to take the elevator up instead of waiting in the much longer line of people who are purchasing tickets. If you want to hit all the tourist spots, save some money and not go through the process of paying as you go, this is a no brainer.  You may easily combine your visit to Tower Bridge with a boat ride up the Thames River and/or a visit to the nearby Tower of London so that you can see the crown jewels. The Tower of London is within walking distance of the bridge. By the way... on the way up the river, you can see the actual London Bridge, which is a very plain looking bridge and nothing special to see. It's fun, though, knowing that you are seeing the actual "London Bridge." Fortunately, it was not falling down.  As first timers in London, we had a great time at Tower Bridge and you should too.
tower bridge. a must see very interesting . I liked the glass floor . remember to take pictures from the top because of the great views

Who can resist a visit and a photo at Tower Bridge with the Tower of London in the background?. Along with the Houses of Parliament, Big Ben, the Tower and the dome of the St Pauls this is one of the must see places along the Thames. Plenty of tube stations nearby from the north, excellent walk along the south bank to see everything is an excellent setting.

Unmistakable. This is one of the most amazing sights in the country. The view from the middle of the bridge in any direction is wonderful, the view to the south is especially good when it is dark. Beautiful Victorian bridge. Hard to give 5 stars because its obviously something that won't take over an hour or so to do, but the experience of the bridge is wonderful. Some amazing views can be seen as well as walking along the glass floor which to most would be the highlight. For us however- it was about appreciating the Victorian design and engineering.

Wow. I had heard that Tower Bridge has a glass floor, so I thought I'll have to visit that, and yes it does have a glass floor.
