There is also a talk and display about the men who designed and built the Bridge which is fascinating. Well worth the entry fee.
A bridge "must". Definitely worth a stop, great photo opportunity! Great view from bridge! Great architecture! Very popular with tourists?

Wonderful Views from the Walkway. Used my London Pass for entry. There is wheel chair access to the bridge. They have a walkway across the towers part of which is a glass floor so you can look directly down on the traffic cross the bridge. The museum demonstrates how the bridge used to be opened prior to installing electrically powered machines.

The famous bridge. Tower bridge is a symbol of London and a must see in my opinion. The bridge offers an impressive view from the top, through the glass floors on both walkways. To avoid the lines, I recommend buying a ticket online or using the London Pass. The visit here lasts less than one hour if you do not want to see all the movies about making the bridge.

Fanstastic old building. The bridge is great. It is funny to see the bridge raised. Although the visit cost not little, I thought it was worthy.
Do not forget to visit the Engine room. The workers could known when was the bridge booked to raise.
A must see!. A must visit! Use you London Pass for no added expense. Went in September when the crowds were very small. Moved right into the attraction.

Amazing how it was built. It's a truly iconic piece of engineering and the short video is fantastic. The glass floor is pretty impressive, and for those that don't like heights, you can avoid walking on it, as there's a ledge all the way round it.
Lucky. Managed to see it opening and closing. Very lucky. Nice experience. Kids enjoyed it a lot. Took a couple of nice photos

Beautiful & Delightful. A glorious place to stroll across and the glass walkway made my knees weak (heights do that to me!) Stop, and zoom your camera onto the subtle details of the bridge, the spires etc. Very close to The Roman Wall too!

Spectacular to say the least. The monument which is like London's identity. Tower Bridge. Loved walking across this iconic bridge (although many confuse it with London Bridge). Wonderful photographic opportunities and great view of the Thames. Within walking distance of the Tower of London and is one of the Hop On Hop Off bus stops
London Landmark. The imposing structure over the river Thames is something a tourist can't miss, even if he visits London ever so often. Its a very pretty sight.

Wonderful Views. Well worth the cost. We learned about London and its bridges. great views and we all loved the glass walkway. Neat to see the Thames and cars pass by. Hint - Lie down on the glass and have someone frame the picture standing above you so you only see the person lying on the glass. looks like they are falling into the Thames.

Iconic London Photo Op. Walked on the bridge as well as cruised on the Thames Clipper. The nicest picyures are taken from the outside and are free.

THE OVERHEAD GLASS WALKWAY IS A GREAT ADDITION.. Since my family and I last visited here three years ago, glass panels have been added to the floors of the overhead East and West walkways, which have greatly enhanced the experience. The walkways can be reached by lifts in both towers.There are notices advising the times when the bridge will be opened to allow a ship to pass, and we were able to enjoy this experience. It is interesting to be able to look down on the passing traffic and the constant stream of pedestrians, when the bridge is open to traffic. We were particularly interested to see the hydrogen cylinders on the tops of the new hydrogen-powered double-decker buses.Before the bridge opens a warning siren is sounded and the traffic brought to a halt. The two halves of the bridge deck then start to open and you can clearly see the four twelve inch bolts, which lock them into place, when the roadway is open to traffic.You are then able to look down on the ship as it passes below.  You are also able to visit the excellently preserved steam engines, and the associated boilers and pumps which used to power the opening mechanism. These are situated in the engine room under the South side of the bridge.We found all of the staff welcoming and informative and I thoroughly recommend the experience.
Worth a visit. I like this bridge and its surrounding area. The view is nice close to the river, and good place to hang out when it's good weather.

London trip. Again a must if in London. They have a attraction which u can go up the Tower Bridge which on a clear day u would see alot of London but we were put off by the queues and the thought of the glass floor

Save your money and just take pictures of the bride. Very much a landmark.

Great pictures from glass walkway! Make sure you see the engine room.. Amazing engineering. Interesting tour. Make sure you see the engine room. Lovely views from the glassed in observation area. Great for taking pictures.

Buy the London Pass first!. There's 100s of reviews already...I'll just say £9 is a bit excessive for something that only takes 30min to visit, though its much nicer than my native San Diego's boring Coronado Bridge...but before you visit...BUY THE LONDON PASS!!!!! I only bought the 1 Day pass for £49($77ish), not cheap, but worth it! Get it at the Tourist Information desk at the airport or the booth near Leicester SquareThe CHUN P Power-Cardio-One Day Tour of London:£20 10am-11am Westminster Abbey£18 11:15am-12:15pm Churchill War Rooms...5 minute walk away from Westminster£18 Thames River Cruise...5 minute walk to the dock, grab a quick take away lunch at Tesco, which will be on your left. Eat on the boat while trying to admire the Thames's not-so-great scenery...£24.50 1:30-3:30 Tower of London...have a coffee or tea break afterwards.£9 4:00pm-Close Tower Bridge...this doesn't take long to visit, maybe 30-45 minutes.£89.50 TOTALTotal Savings £89.50 - £49 = £40.50($62ish)That's what makes this attraction worth the money...for almost half price!If you have more time and for a bit more £££££ you could buy the 2 or 3 day pass to see Windsor Castle(£19.20) and Kensington Palace(£17.50) for more savings.

Take a walk around the tower bridge and eat in a cafe closeby admiring its beauty and architecture. You can also watch it open at specific times - schedule available online
Not London Bridge. Not to be confused with london bridge. Nice views over the Thames and easy to walk across. With the tower of london behind it, lovely to behold.

One of the best attractions of London. A beautiful bridge to watch from a distance and to walk on as well.Try to visit it when the bridge is lifted up , interesting to watch big ships passing under it.

Must Visit. You can't go to London without seeing Tower Bridge. There are 2 ways to walk across. At road level for free or across the top walkway for a fee. Go across the top. Walk on the glass floor. You'll be glad you did. There is a short film presentation explaining the construction and history of the bridge. Try to visit when the bridge is raised (about twice a day) if possible. As part of your ticket you can go down to see the Victorian Engine Room which I found amazing.

Birthday trip to see the Poppies.. The first time ever on Tower bridge and I drove across, walked both ways across and walked over the Skywalk. The tour around and across the bridge was great. The view from the Skywalk gave a different perspective of the River and the tourists

Up and down. We were lucky enough to be at the tower bridge when the tall sail boats came through. I understand that it is rare to get to see the tower bridge raise and lower so we count ourselves as some of the lucky few. The bridge itself is beautiful and many people confuse it as London Bridge (you can hear tourists calling it London Bridge). It is worth a trip to see it, it is next to London Tower so if that is on your agenda, you can see them both.
A Bridge of Distinction. We went on a guided tour to this fascinating land mark. It has a very interesting history and the set up is very informative. It well worth a visit.

Beautiful!. Quite a busy place being one of the tourist attractions, but I can see why!Lovely views from the tower, especially at night. - Great views of the Shard & The River Thames. Also, good connections to the underground with Tower Hill & London Bridge Station both 10-15 minutes away!Would have liked to do the Tower Bridge Experience if I had more time, maybe some other time though.

Stand above the River Thames and feel its history on Tower Bridge. I love walking across Tower Bridge. It's not only a London icon but the feeling of being above the Thames looking down the river watching the buzz of London pass by is a truly special experience (even if you cross it over and over). This bridge is huge and tends to get crowded with pedestrians in the summer months but its worth taking your time to cross and enjoy the view. To walk across the bridge can be entered either north of the river by the Tower of London (worth visiting at least once in a lifetime) or from south of the river off Tooley Street. I would suggest making a fun day of the visit to Tower Bridge: lower cost outing would be a walk across the bridge with plenty of stops for pictures (make sure you get the Tower of London in the background!). To the north is the Tower of London, to the east is Canary Wharf, to the west is London Bridge, Blackfriars Bridge, St Paul's Cathedral and a little further down is Big Ben. You can also enter the Tower for a fee.Whether you being or end on the south side of the river, be sure to walk past London's City Hall and visit Hays Galleria (I'm told that was the first site of refrigeration in London during the days when the Thames was carrying a thriving shipping industry). At Hayes Galleria there are now some coffee shops and places to eat. There is also an area called 'More London' on the walk down the south bank closer to London Bridge which puts on various outdoor activities for free in the summer: films, concerts, beachside seating areas etc.
Tower Bridge Tour. Excellent shorter length tour. Interesting with lots of info in lots of languages for visitors. not expensive.

london bridge's beautiful cousin. Most people look for London Bridge when they come to London but at night, tower bridge is the place to see! It's beautifully lit up and has a lot to offer tourists and locals as well. close to wonderful restaurants and shops and walking distance to London bridge, London eye etc.

Want to learn how the Tower Bridge opens?. Around 20 years ago I first visited Tower Bridge and did the tour. I loved it. It was so interesting hearing about how they came up with the design of the bridge. Then last month I visited again. First of all, it was much more crowded than the last time I went plus the exhibits really changed. They now have a section of the floor that is glass so you can see the road or river below. So many people were trying to get pictures there that you could hardly pass by. There was a brief presentation at the beginning that touched on why London needed a bridge like this and there was another video towards the end. What I missed most was the presentation they use to do at the end where you felt like you were there the day the bridge opened. Even though things changed, it is still an interesting place to visit if you have the time.
One of the best bridges in London.. One of the best bridges in London. Walk across it some time during a visit. On the south side visit nearby Bermondsey St.

the most beautiful bridge. As a frequent visitor in London, I often stay at Tower Hotel just next to Tower Bridge. This has allowed me to view the Tower bridge from numerous points of views with all types of weather and all hours of the day. Not surprisingly Tower bridge is at its best very early in the morning, looking at it from the east, so that the rising sun hits it directly and at night when it is fully lit. It is definitely worth coming to East London to see the Tower and Tower bridge. Pass to the south bank and walk from Tower Bridge westbound. It is a wonderful stroll and you can see a number of iconic buildings on your way.

Awesome adventure . This is a historic landmark that has been opened to the public so you can see inside this magnificent bridge. If you time your visit correctly you can see the bridge open and close. Check the Tower Bridge site or their Facebook page. The attraction does cost to enter, we opted for the London Pass. We purchased this on a travel site at a discounted price. There is an elevator for those not able to climb the spiral staircase. There are attendants everywhere. Talk to them, they will give you the history of the bridge. On both walkways at the top there is a section where the floor is see through. You can walk on the floor, or walk around. While we were there several young women were sitting on the floor talking selfies with the bridge traffic below them. Also, follow the line to the engine room. The machinery used to operate the drawbridge is awesome.

Not the London Bridge. We sailed under the bridge, drove over it (in a double decker bus) and saw it from the Tower of London and other locations. Many tourists were referring to this bridge as London Bridge, but the real London Bridge is quite plain. This is an icon of London.
It is an Architectural Wonder. Lots to learn and so much to see! A must when you come to London! We saw it as part of the Thames River Cruise. We also walked around it on our own!

Iconic, worth the stroll ;). This bridge is iconic all over the world, take a stroll from the Tower of London side, if you have mobility issues, once you get to the end look for the elevator. It will take you down to ground level w a unique view of the bridge!

Great Sight. Tower Bridge is a great thing to see. If you're lucky enough to see it opening, you'll definitely be able to appreciate the engendering that went into this historic bridge.At night time the bridge lights up, often with a purple hue, but sometimes, during events, it changes colour. I have many wonderful photographs of the bridge and the river from it. I particularly recommend photographing the bridge once it's dark and the lights are all on.
Yes it's a tower!. Just viewed it from afar - nothing special to report. Looks nice at night when lit up-in a nice area.

Beautiful bridge but overrated as an attraction. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed taking the tour and learning the history of the bridge, seeing the display of all the various famous bridges around the world as well as seeing the engine room. But at the end of it, you felt very "meh". Seeing the raising of the bridge for cruise ships etc was a more enjoyable highlight, but that doesn't happen all the time and you have to check ahead for the scheduled time to ensure you don't miss it. Taking pictures of the bridge, especially at night, is a great experience as it really is visually stunning. However, overall, it's just okay.

AWESOME. Very cool tourist spot. I took the stairs instead of the elevator which was really cool to see all the "insides" of the bridge, totally worth being out of breath at the top. See threw floor is very cool
Must see. One of those 'must see' places. But a view from the next bridge or the shore is enough, no need to go on the actual bridge itself.
Worth the walk across it.. What a piece of history. Lovely... we also walked across for some great views. Only wished I could have seen it at night.
OK to visit once. We visited this Bridge in March 2015. It is ok to visit just once. It no longer belongs to UK. You need to go when it's nice and sunny if you want to take pictures.

A Walk Across a Bridge. A great place to visit with lots of interesting and fun facts, the walk between the two towers with its glass floor gives a great perspective, just wait for the lift as there are more stairs than you think.

Tour of Tower Bridge.. Do the Tower Bridge tour with the glass floor,great fun for all the family.Good price we paid concessions price of £12 for 2 adults .Well worth a visit to understand steam operation and we had a very knowledgeable tour guide who was humorous as well with different stories to tell along the way.Toilets available. Lots of steps..lots of people! Wish we had timed it with Tower Bridge going up. Not suitable for small children but good if school age children if doing steam projects .The usual gift shop on exit.
Nice Attraction.... Enjoyed visiting this attraction - which is great both at day and evening times. Ate dinner at a restaurant overlooking the River Thames and strolled back to our hotel.

So Beautiful. My friends and I rented an apartment just across from the Tower Bridge so it was the view from our windows. The bridge is lighted at night and is a beautiful sight. One of my favorite experiences on our trip in April was walking across the bridge. The views down the river are excellent and it is an easy walk across. Just do it.
amazing view .. Done a river cruise got to go under the Tower bridge.Nursery rhyme London bridge is falling down. Great view of the bridge
Nice view. Always nice to walk river side and so take a top walk over the Tower bridge, kids enoy it, and a bit scary to walk over the glass floor, my daughter think so,,

Great experience . This was a really good attraction and value for money. It's amazing to walk across the glass floor and look down at the traffic and the river. If you can time it right you could be up there when the bridge opens to allow the tall shops through.
Mind blowing . Didn't go to the exhibition but just standing there looking at it is simply stunning !...was lucky to see the bridge being raised which was nice ..just go and stare!

An amazing bridge. Whenever I go to London I love to take a walk across the Tower Bridge.It takes in a lovely view of the Thames down to Westminster, Tower of London and many more.Tower Bridge is a combined bascule and suspension bridge in London and it is great if you are there when it opens. The bridge is full of history and the walkway up the top has great viewsWell worth a visit and the walks either side of the bridge are very interesting.
A great place for photos.... We had been on the Tower Bridge on previous visits, but this time we were on a boat. Even though the weather was overcast with some rain, it was fun to see.

Still learning. Saw this bridge and learned that it is not the London bridge as everyone thinks. The real name of this grand bridge is Tower bridge. The London bridge is a small unassuming bridge that is far away from this bridge.

Great Views. Went to Tower Bridge to walk the Walkway and view the river from the glass panels. Great day out for only £7.40 each, old age pensioners so get a concession, booked online. This includes The Monument, which is just a little way along the river. Didn't have time for The Monument but the ticket is good for 7 days. Although it was a Saturday and lots of Tourists around you are not hurried or hassled. History of the construction is well documented and when you arrive at the walkways the views up and down river are great, The glass panels form about 6 metres and there is a narrow walkway alongside for those of a nervous disposition. We were fortunate that a boat was due under the Bridge necessitating it to be opened, good view through the glass panels. The visit is finished off with a visit to the Engine Rooms to see the magnificent machinery needed to raise and lower the Bridge, Good Visit, well wort it.

Worth visiting!. The Tower Bridge offers stunning views of a mechanical marvel and it is fun to look down into the river from the height. However, the Tower Bridge Experience has not much to offer other than the view. The film is silly, and the spaces very cramped.
Tower Bridge is very beautiful outside and interesting inside. Fine view from th Bridge... The machine room was interesting, for those who love "old" machines. Especially my husband loved it.
Amazing. Londons pride. Its much newer then it looks by choice to match the tower of london near by. Its the key site in london and a must visit

Worth a trip to the top. The tower bridge is very impressive. You can go to the top of the bridge which has a glass floor. This is worth the small fee to do so. You also get to tour the inside of the bridge and learn the mechanics behind it. A must do when in London.
The Tower.. Just to think about the history that has taken place here boggles the mind. I could have spent a lot more time here!
Brilliant experience. So much bigger than I was expecting, brilliant views of the Thames and London. I am so glad I visited

Where North meets South. My wife (born in South London) and I (North London) went with a party. The whole experience was well worth the £6.30 (Seniors ticket) or the £9.00 standard adult ticket. The exhibition showing the story of the bridge was fascinating; the engine rooms were interesting to all ages that we heard comments from and the views from the upper walkways were worth the ticket themselves, especially if you are a photographer of any standard. We jokingly said that it would be an ideal place for us to have got married being midway between N & S London. In fact, I know a couple who did get married there and they said that it was an experience not to be forgotten. Highly recommended.
5*. Beautiful colors! Great architecture! Worth the visit. Good place to start a walk on the river......

London's main and most historical BRIDGE. Cost to visit and it is located next to a must see site, The Tower of London, tour buses run by and stop here all day and you can get on and get off Amal day, plus take the river cruise with that bus pass. You are allowed to walk across the bridge and remember it's a draw bridge too

Proud to be British. Fantastic, awesome, breathtaking was my experience anyway! I adore history so I read everything! I love our heritage and am proud to be British so this was a must do visit. Again not too pricey for London with great views. Younger children may find this boring, depends on the enthusiam of parents to make history come alive!
Historic. Interesting from out and inside...lots of infos inside..and lots to see...well worth a closer look :-)

Amazing. This was an unexpected delight. There is a small fee that allows you to walk across the glassed in floor. The view down below is well worth it. Lots of information about the building of Tower Bridge.
Impressive. Many photo opportunities. Check online to see bridge opening times and tide table for the day of your visit. Many attraction nearby

Wow. In a span of a week, we went to the bridge thrice, so it was definitely the favourite. The bridge s extremely well lit up at night and is an amazing sight by day as well. The bridge has nice plaques with anecdotes. The walk between the bridge and the London bridge is cool. The lifting timings are easy to check at http://www.towerbridge.org.uk/lift-times My son enjoyed the lifting of the bridge the most, and this is best viewed from close to the city hall.
Tower Bridge - glass pathway. I walked on the glass pathway of the Tower bridge, really great and bit nervous (thinking It might crack)...wheeeew!

Fantastic . Great experience and views of London. Well worth a visit but you need a head for heights! We used a voucher from our local rail station as you can get two for one on the admission price. Staff were all very friendly

Outstanding views. An amazing experience on the glass bridge walkway, high over the River Thames.The bridge opened whilst we were there, which was fascinating. The staff were very helpful and supportive and the views are incredible.

Tower Bridge was open.. What amazing weather we got and we were lucky enough to see the tower bridge open to let an priate ship through. (Probably no priates) I built the Bridge as a kid out of Lego but this was maybe harder to build.

Great View of London. Visiting the iconic Tower Bridge and walking on the new glass skywalk was definitely on our list of have to do while in London. Loved getting pictures of London from up there and also looking down through the glass floor onto the road. Seeing the engine room was a nice added bonus, but we really wanted to do the skywalk.

Tower Bridge is Justly Famous. Tower Bridge is the prettiest and most famois bridge that crosses the Thames. You can combine seeing it when you go to the Tower of London. It is no more than a 1/4-mile away.
nice bridge. its a famous bridge and its on the way to the tower of london, so its nice to cross it and to take pics from of it from the distance.
Very nice. Beautiful , bridge, lovely to see, more impressive than imagined, do not miss it, So happy we were able to see it.

Iconic Symbol. The bridge crosses the River Thames close to the Tower of London, great views of it from the Tower of London. It is accessible to both vehicles and pedestrians. We like the nighttime views with the atmospheric colored lighting system and find it to be a good landmark for us to get our bearings.
BEAUTIFUL BRIDGE. This bridge (built 1886-1894) has amazing architecture. It crosses the Thames River and over 40,000 people use it everyday. Be prepared for crowds.

The most picturesque bridge in London. After the Tower of London, you have to cross the Tower Bridge. The glassed-in floor is cool -- you can see the traffic, including double-decker buses, crossing the bridge beneath you. And you have a gorgeous view up and down the Thames Rover.
Breathtaking Bridges. London Bridge Travel reminded which bridge to cross and which bridge to burn. Or where one needs to build a bridge between nations and hearts
Amazing view. Stands over the Thames River since 1894, breath taking views and great photos from any angle. again if you have the London Pass it is free entry :)
Unique bridge. Certainly one of the sites all tourist have to visit in London. Explore the bridge both structurally and architecturally and enjoy the time on the Thames.

Mesmerizing Beauty. A very beautiful and heritage place to visit in London, very well connected and closed to London Bridge and Monument. A nice trip would be to spend some money and go on top of it to experience the glass floor.

A must see in my mind!. Gives you great views of the city by going to the above walks and also allows you walk on a glass area that looks down on the road and river below. It is thrilling and there is lots of information about how the bridge works and one is able to tour the rooms of the operation of the bridge.
Nice bridge. Interesting museum to tour with background on the construction and use of the bridge. The glass floor panels on the walkway between the towers provides a unique photo opportunity.
Mon coup de coeur a Londres !!!. Even when it's raining, the bridge is gorgeous !!! The visit is very easy, the glass floor is a good attraction !!!

Experience the spectacular new glass floor on the high level walk ways of the Tower Bridge. The famous Tower Bridge has a new glass floor with spectacular views of the road below and spectacular view of London from the high-level walk ways. We continue to the Victorian Engine Rooms to see the machinery working to lift and close this famous bridge.

Superb. Superb,must say, breathtaking.We had gone in a tour group and this was one of the the things to in th itinerary.i must say it's awesome.though it was afternoon and the sun was up I enjoyed the same with the Thames river flowing and the view of modern London buildings in the backdrop and the old bridges over the river.Amazing and beautiful.

Tower bridge is definitely worth a visit. The iconic London tower bridge is one the most tourist visited bridges you don`t want to miss.Its worth a quick visit or having a tea in nearby cafes as the evening ambiance of the place is good.

"Riveting" in More Ways Than One. This was the last stop in our whirlwind day using our London Pass. I expected 'ho-hum' but was pleasantly surprised to be very interested in everything this attraction had to offer. Despite the fact that we were both quite tired by this point in the day, we were intrigued by the whole tour. I did not think I would like the overhead part of the journey through the bridge (height issues) but I was fascinated - even with the glass floor part. This is a well-conceived tour. In hindsight, we might have done this earlier in our day but nevertheless recommend it highly to all London visitors.

Beautiful bridge!. A beautiful piece of architecture, stretching over the river Thames between London city hall on the south side and Tower of London on the north side. It was opened in 1894 and is of new gothic style. The view from the park on the south side is greatand during a nice day it is relaxing sitting here watching the bridge and all the people walking by. The war ship HMS Belfast is also permanently docked close by serving as a museum ship.
Don't miss it. You cannot go to London and not do the Tower Bridge... wonderful history, beautiful bridge and views over the Thames and Londa

London Tower Bridge - Beautiful good spot. Tower Bridge in the heart of London, full of tourist enjoying taking photos, enjoy cool air by the river, people boating, ect. If you get a chance try to visit the Tower Bridge for memories.
Nice view. Enjoyed the glass floor- try to plan your trip around a time the bridge rises. Gets crowded though. The exhibit of the notable bridges around the world was nice.

Interesting museum. I wouldn't have gone, but it was included in the London Pass. It was interesting and worthwhile, but I am not sure I would have paid for it as a separate London attraction. If you have the London Pass and are at the Tower of London--go for it.

Great historic attraction. A very interesting hour spent above the Thames.A nice mix of the historic and the modern.The new glass walkway above the road section is great although it did frighten some.Well worth the trip.

Iconic. Tower Bridge is so iconic and very impressive. Everyone needs to walk over it - it is free after all !. There are tours inside it if you wish. Viewing areas as you walk over it to take in the brilliant view of the Thames and hopefully you'll see it open up to allow the larger ships through.

Great fun for the family. The Tower Bridge experience is informative and interesting. A lot of information is provided about this bridge and many others. There's a glass bottom panel that shouldn't be missed - kids will love it, adults maybe. Great views of the Thames River as well.

Different view. Having toured the bridge some years ago it was great to do it agin and walk across the glass walkway. A little nerve wracking to take the first step but then great fun to look straight down on the river and bridge below.

Charming and informative. The walkway above the Thames is really great and getting up the courage to walk on the glass is worth while, if just for a sense of self satisfaction. the information and presentations at the top are good and pitched just right, I felt, and it is most definitely worth going into the engine rooms to see all the magnificent Victoria ironwork and steam engines and engineering. I enjoyed our visit and would go again.

A unique 'Experience'. Get on up there!. At £9 for the two, if you use the 2 for 1 voucher from the Rail Booklet and show your tickets dated the day you visit, it's great value. Stay as long as you like up on the two walkways. A good number of small windows were open so you can get good photos both up and down stream. I got a good shot, through the floor, of an Open Top Tour bus crossing the Bridge. Plenty of slide and film shows as well as authentic displays to look at. The tour of the Engine Rooms, down below, provides the icing on the cake. Highly recommend, especially if you can get some form of promotional deal.

Its the Tower Bridge different from London Bridge!!!!. Tower Bridge is a combined bascule and suspension bridge in London. The bridge crosses the River Thames close to the Tower of London and has become an iconic symbol of London!!!!!! Tower Bridge is one of five London bridges now owned and maintained by the Bridge House Estates, a charitable trust overseen by the City of London Corporation. It is the only one of the Trust's bridges not to connect the City of London directly to the Southwark bank, the northern landfall being in Tower Hamlets!!!!!Must a visit....its lovely to see the 2 bascules raised at nite and see the ships passby!!!

Great self-guided tour. We found ourselves with a spare morning on our latest London trip so decided to do some 'tourist' things - and Tower Bridge was adjacent to our hotel. What a great place to visit, including the photographic exhibition of some of the world's greatest bridges. However the real highlight for me was the Engine Room - such beautifully restored and cared for equipment.Oh yes - we were there for the bridge lifting too!
Tower bridge. Great iconic landmark, wonderful artitecter olus it's amazing as the bridge opens up to allow the larger ships past through. Recommended for everyone to visit

Stairway to Heaven. Took the steps up to the top and strolled across the glass panels on the floor. Very busy but worth the effort to get to the top. Expect to wait a while to gain entry as it is very congested. Fantastic view from the top over the majestic Thames river. Very interesting history regarding the design and building of the bridge. Take the time to admire the truly amazing structure and laud the audacity of such an ambitious project so many years ago.

A symbol of London from the eyes of tourist. Jun and September I took my friends and relatives to visit there. The environment was beautiful. We could see River Thames and lovely Tower Bridge. The Bridge traffic was very busy and people crowded. They loved it very much because what they saw was the same as their perception (in all the picture). We did not enter to the castle (tower of London) because the entrance fee was very expensive to us. If it offered group discount, we would consider to go into it.

Don't miss the sky walk and the engine room. Even though it is a hike up a lot of stairs, the sky walk across the top of the bridge not only affords an incredible view of London, but the unnerving experience of walking (or at least trying to) across the clear floor that has you looking down on the traffic a 100 ft or so below.Not to be missed is the tour of the engine works that lift the bridge located beyond the South tour. In true Victorian fashion, the functional components are beautifully appointed with colors and gleaming metal I guarantee it is nothing like you have seen before in its intricacy and complexity.

The Tower Bridge. Not the London Bridge.. I saw the bascules raised yesterday when the flotilla in commemoration of the Queen's longest reign in British history passed through. Although it's not the first time I have witnessed the sight (including being held up when driving over the bridge) it's always great to see it happen.Some folk believe this is London Bridge and it's hilarious to view pictures posted on the review site for that bridge showing a smiling face with the big sign saying Tower Bridge in the background! 'D'oh!'Some people are surprised when I tell them this bridge only opened in 1894 as they imagined it was much older. I would love one day to emulate what Peter Cook and Dudley Moore did on their comedy series 'Not Only But Also' nearly 50 years ago, but I would probably risk being arrested!

The Buzz. This is such a lovely bridge to walk over. It was just a shame there were no big ships and watch the bridge being opened up. Just to see that sight would have been amazing. There are so many shops along the docks to see and just walking and sitting down and watching the people walk by is such a wonderful experience.
Tower Bridge. Just like the pictures show us. Stands magestically over the Thames. Great photo opportunity. East access
Wonderful Day. If you fail to visit Tower Bridge when you are in London you will truly regret it, amazing structure. Some amazing sights to see and the best places to eat you could ask for.
Iconic bridge. On our non stop London tour we had to visit tower bridge, my wife wasn't keen on the glass floor but it has to be done, one of the most famous bridges in the world and for good reason

Stunning Landmark and Location. The bridge itself is amazing. In addition, just walking across Tower Bridge (for free) turned into a surprisingly enjoyable venture offering spectacular views of the city and some wonderful modern architecture like the Gherkin, the Shard, etc. You can also stop to watch the boats and ships coming and going along the Thames. Great spot to take one or two treasured photos for the album. Well worth a visit.

Awesome!. Is just for the sight to enjoy it, but it is amazing! Bigger than expected! Furthermore there is a website (www.towerbridge.org.uk/lift-times) where you can have a look to the "lift schedule" and plan to see the lifting maneuver, which is impresive. Hope you enjoy your visit!

Riveting. It's hard to review a bridge, so here it goes. It's very old, and impressive, known worldwide by its design. We found it hard to try and standstill to take photographs as the pavements were crammed with tourists, us included, but it was worth the experience for the views of the city and river.

Iconic. This has to be my 3rd favourite brigade in the world the other 2 being dartford and the one on the river Kwai if your really lucky you might go on one of the days they are raising it to let the tall ships pass absolutely majestically through along with the odd people smuggling dingy and the yachts of the great unwashed of Notting hill and Islington these are the only times they raise it take your time and enjoy the bridge it has some of the best views to be taken in the whole of london smashing

Tower bridge seen up close. . Lots and lots of steps ... What did I expect really. I've seen London Bridge in lake havasu. Engineering fete moved to America.  And always looked at this on from the train and thought yay I must see it up close. Views good. Exhibits ok. Try and get tourist offer. As not cheap.
Sign of the past. Beautiful bridge that really gives one the idea of both the past and the present. Definitely go there and also visit the Tower of London close by.
Unique bridge. What a beautiful bridge. Took pictures at night with a full moon. This is not a place to visit for hours, just view and maybe walk across

The famous London Bridge. if you are in London it is a worthwhile trip to walk across the London Tower Bridge to the south bank. This bridge epitomizes all London is famous for. It is historic and very grand.

So unique. Really different looking bridge that makes it so great. You can take such a lovely pictures as it shows really nice features all around. Worth to take a walk there. I found quite really scary standing at the middle where you can see down to the river through the hole and also feel the bridge moving.

Time your visit to see the Bridge rise. http://www.towerbridge.org.uk/lift-times/ Before your visit check out this website so that you know the timings for when the bridge rises. I like to view it from just outside The Tower of London. You can then walk over the bridge and you end up near the Mayor's office. The Bridge has its own Visitor Experience but book ahead

Must have a Walk-over. Walk this bridge and see the mechanism of it: it can open for passing ships, best if you see a ship passing. This is the bridge to see, not to be confused with the London Bridge which is a concrete bridge of no touristic interest. This one is a must see and walk! Underground station: Tower Hill.

Glass walkways!. We took the stairs to the walkways above the street and it was well worth it! The exhibit is great - bridges from around the world. Very informative and beautifully done. Also, lots of history about the bridge itself. The glass portions of the floor were great! A bit disconcerting but really, really cool. The views (above and below) were just great.

Beautiful bridge in the evening. There are a few bridges in London. This is the most beautiful bridge! Definitely have to see it at night! The lighting on the bridge is so gorgeous. Great photo opportunity!Next to the bridge is the Tower of London. Totally can spend the whole afternoon

wow what a view. wow I love that place special st katharine docks the view is beautiful. Have a wander around the small boutiques and art galleries on the waterside. The Docks hohad a lot of restaurants and cafes positioned on the water's edge, perfect for dining. must drink ale at the dickens inn on the oposit side of st Katharine docks

Had one of the best pictures with my wife here. :). Needless to say, this is one of the most famous and romantic places in London. I had one of the best pictures with my wife here. And, don't confuse yourself - this is Tower Bridge, not London Bridge. "London Bridge is falling down, falling down"... :D

what makes Tower Bridge go up,. A true engineering marvel, even for the novice. The tour not only shows you how the bridge is operated you are able to walk the upper level of the bridge from one tower to the other. This affords a fantastic view of the Thames and parts of the city. Nominally priced.

Tower Bridge - no folks, this is NOT London Bridge. Beautiful historical structure and yes, you can actually walk over it! Tower Bridge also has its own museum you can visit for a small fee if you wish.

icon. So much history in this bridge. One of my favourite spots in London. It even looks brilliant when it rains. Do take time to walk in the areas surrounding the bridges as it's just as interesting.

Love this bridge. Love this bridge and finally took the tour inside. It was very interesting seeing the motors which raise the bridge and the other inner workings. Also, going to the top bridge to see the view is worth it - great view to the Tower of London.
Fun activity. This was a fun activity. Great views of London from the Bridge. Lots of historical information is provided. Loved the pictures of the various bridges around the world.
london. I have being to London twice now to be honest did not think much to it really, I looked at it never went on to it so can not comment,

London day trip. Visited with three children during the school holidays on a combined ticket with The Monument as well. Really good value, and a lovely river walk of 20 minutes between the two places. Tower Bridge is a really impressive building, there is a lift at the beginning of the tour followed by a short film. Very easy and informative. The glass bridge is amazing! Not for people who don't like heights. Lots of mechanical and engineering information,. Glad we went.
Tower Bridge. Very interesting trip. Especially interesting to see pictures of well known bridges in the world and how they compare. Good value.
Great views. Stayed near St. Paul's, but took an unexpected bike tour when the Tube station was closed. Crossing Tower Bridge was a harrowing experience, but the views were incredible!
Beautiful. Very good experience, good prices and amazing view of the city. It has a glass walkway worth the try!

A Favorite Bridge. This highly enjoyable attraction is one of my favorite bridges in London (along with Millennium Bridge) and is included on the London Pass. You also can visit independently. It is worth a stop after visiting the Tower of London. Just follow the the promenade turning left after you exit the Tower and go under the bridge and around to the left to the road that is perpendicular to the promenade and leads over the bridge. Stay on the right side going onto the bridge footpath and you will see an entry sign for the exhibit. There is an admission charge if not with the Pass. You are taken up in an elevator, view a short film about the history of the bridge and its chief architect, then get to walk onto the bridge and across it on two sides. There are beautiful views of the Thames and London in all directions. A nice surprise is the "see through" flooring like at the CN Tower in Toronto that allows you to look directly below on traffic and the river. You can visit the steam pump room too. Learn about bridge construction, take some great photos from on high and read about and see photos of other bridges around the world. When exiting on the south bank side of the river you can either walk back to the Tower of London side or keep walking off the bridge, to the right and down the south bank towards London Bridge where you will get more eye popping views of London and the Thames and see HMS Belfast docked in the river. Adults and families will enjoy this.

The Most Important Treasure In London. The Architecture of The Tower and Tower Bridge are spectacular. A visit to The Crown Jewels is a must. Anyone visiting London Including British people should not miss this Jewel in our Crown. Have A walk over Tower Bridge Also as the views of London are spectacular.A tour of The Tower is a must and take your time as their is so much to see.especially with historical content of interest.I suggest you take a packed lunch as the queues for food were lengthy and a visit to The Gift Shop is well worth a visit with a great selection especially for children.

It's a Bridge. It's cool, it's the bridge that everyone always confuses with "London Bridge"... in actuality London Bridge is just up the street and is fairly average.Tower Bridge offers tours (they cost money). You can either tour through the inner workings and see the machinery, or you can walk across the pathway along the top (bring your camera). You can always walk across it for free of course.The bridge is lit up at night. Make sure to walk 3 minutes up the river and visit the HMS Belfast. You can take a tour. Then it's only about another 3 minutes walk to London Bridge, and lucky for you... it's not falling down.
Visit to tower Bridge . very awesome place.. We have enjoyed a lot at that place. If you go through ferry from canary wharf to London Eye... You will pass tower Bridge in between of ferry ride.

TOWER EXPERIENCE. Nice tour with great views - the glass walkway was broken whilst we were there down one side but that didnt hinder our experience - tip get early to avoid the queues or you will be stood round the block.

Wonderfully restored, great piece of British history!!. One of the most beautiful bridges in the uk. The last time I actually walked on the bridge was when David Blaine decided to be stupid and hang in a box. A great weekend and walk down history of london.
Top view . Best views of London from here.Amazing piece of engineering. Great views walking by the tower of London underneath the bridge.

Visually stunning.. The tower bridge is visually stunning. If you are touring the Tower of London, then I wouldn't recommend touring both. You'll have a great view of Tower Bridge from many places in the tower. Free and Pay (unknown amount). no more than 1 hour commitment.
nice memories. you will get reminded of the nursery rhyme! you can walk from west minster abbey all the way to the end.
Awesome!. We climbed the stairs to the top and walked across the glass floor. It was very cool. You can also see the engine rooms once you exit the towers which is interesting. The kids loved it!

Good time. Well we had a great time here.
Reasonable price pleasant staff very attentive we walked up the stairs but you can use the lift. The glass floor at the top is good fun. Unusual views of some if London's landmarks, take your camera!
We loved it no queues when we went on a bank holiday saturday.
Best bridge in London!. Best to walk through on a sunny day for the best experience or if on a rainy day go in the morning for the best light! Book in advance though!
The great Bridge. We visit this site from the river by riding a river cruise. This is best way to see the over all greatness of this structure. The bridge is a great land make. It was forth seeing.
fabulous. we walked across two days in a row and still had many more things to see! hope to visit it again. so much character

Lovely bridge. We had the privilege of seeing the bridge open whilst on a river cruise. Fascinating site and thought so how many sailing ships have sailed under this bridge. Lovely bridge to photograph.
Key attraction of London. One of the key attraction of London. There is lot to explore on the Tower Bridge as well as its surrounding circle. An amazing place to spend 2 to 3 hours.

Great bit of history . We visited here whilst away with work on a week trip to the city, stooped in lots of history and we were very lucky to be there when they raised the bridge to allow a sail boat down. Definitely worth a visit

Wonderful experience. My son got married upstairs on Tower Bridge on the South Side. The organisation was faultless and the whole ceremony went off without a hitch. Would certainly recommend this venue.

Awesome sight. An amazing piece of history. Well worth the walk over, we didn't go on the glass floor as the queues were big and I'm a bit nervous of things like that, but we did hear people coming out raving about it.

Amazing. And I do mean Amazing.. Having always been a fan of Tower Bridge, I was especially excited to get the chance to visit the bridge.It lived up to all my expectations, and more.The staff were very friendly, efficient and informative. There was no push to get us out of the way and were allowed to progress at our own speed, there was plenty of information throughout the tour, as well as video clips to take in the history.The view from the upper platform was very good. Seeing inside the bridge, and seeing how it was made was quite awe inspiring. It that were not enough, the trip into the engine room just took my breath away. The machinery was so pristine, and so remarkable that they were able to produce such huge pieces of equipment and install them into such a confined space/A visit to the souvenir shop is a must, where the staff really go out of their way to be helpful.This is available for entry with the London Pass. Go for it, I would love to return.
Excellent attraction - for visiting and photos!. Great for those who want the perfect shot. We were able to drive over it and sail under it. Excellent attraction!

Great views. we had looked this up prior to our trip as we wanted to experience the glass floor. £9 entry. You take a lift up the tower or you can walk up the 220 or so steps if your feeling fit. We waited for the lift even though there was quite a few people in front of us but we didn't wait long at all. There are two glass floors. One on each side. You have to do it just for the photo opportunity. Well worth a visit

Tower Bridge make time for the visit. The glass floor looking down on Tower Bridge is spectacular. The tour ends up in the engine room. History buffs and general tourists this is for you. At £9 worth the money
Very Historic. The bridge is beautiful. Very historic landmark of London to see! I brings you right to the Tower of London also a location to go and see!
Interesting visit and excellent views. Visting this bridge is interesting, as you understand how it was built and it provides nice views, including the glass floor (althogh it's quite small).

An experience of a life time. To walk on the walkway on top of the bridge, and specially on the glass floor, is an experience of a lifetime. The photos of other famous bridges of the world add to the experience. The engine room visit is a must. This is a must see in London.

Nice experience! . I really love the exhibition of the bridges all around the worldwide... plenty of information. The view from the top is nice, we enjoyed it with the London Pass for free... Definitely nice experience!

Wonderful to experience such a landmark. We'd been planning to see this place for a while as we're considering holding our wedding ceremony here and I'm pleased to say it didn't disappoint at all.We booked online, so jumped the queues and took the stairs up to get into the Tower - if you can do this, do, as it's more ornate than taking the modern lift and you get to see other parts of the towers - we actually saw a wedding take place, which only reaffirmed our desire to host our own wedding here.At the top there is a small museum, but not too much to see or read - the real experience of course is the walkways with the glass floors, which were fantastic and gave you a great view below.The price of the ticket online was reasonable for London, but do bear in mind that its a very short experience, but then we didn't visit the engine rooms due to time pressures.I'd say a great way to spend an hour of your day, especially if you tag it on with HMS Belfast, which is what we did.

Wow!. What an experience. For £9 we paid to walk the parts above the bridge and gaze down to the busy road from above through a glass floor. The staff were helpful and chatted willingly. We times our visit to tower bridge right and were above the bridge in the walkway to watch it lift. No extra fee just good timing. My other half overcame his fear of heights very quickly. If you don't want to walk of the glass there is a walkway each side.

I never get tired of this bridge. No matter how many times I've been to London, I still love looking at this bridge. although it doesn't take long to see, I like the way it was constructed. Other than I like, I can't say anything that hasn't already been said by others.

A really interesting attraction to visit. A really good attraction to visit, well priced and very good value for money. You get some great views of London once you are on the walkways 43 metres above the Thames. Very interesting and informative visit and the glass walkway took a little bit of getting used to.

Cut above the rest. We decided to do this attraction on our last day, before our son has major surgery at great ormond street. We had a great time. Had a lift for wheelchair access which was good. Didnt wait long to pay and get up to the top. Fantastic views and no rush to come back down. The glass walkway is great. The kids loved it! Lots.of pictures and information videos about the bridge and its construction. Would recommend

Impressive!. A beautifully constructed bridge from times of our past. Good outlook to view surrounding buildings of both old and new architecture. Restaurants and walkways are situated next to the bridge, so it is worth having a look.
Fantastic!. Take the tour of the bridge. So interesting inside each tower but oh wow the views from the walk way at the top are just phenomenal. Really inexpensive too

Beautifu Bridge - postcard perfect view.. It's part of the beautiful sights to see while taking the Thames River cruise. Everyone mistakes it for the London bridge but it's way more beautiful. It's right at the exit of your London Tower tour.
Must see. Amazing view from bridge , also nice museum , the only minus ( like every where in London ) is very busy and ou have to wait over 30 min to get to the museum. :)
Beautiful . I simply consider this bridge and the area around as the best sight seeing spot in London, amazing views and a heaven for photographers to take beautiful photos all the day long

something to do. good to look out up the river,note certain land marks but not much to look at inside that intrested us,made a video post card, think that was the best part of the tripdepends what things intrest you

An iconic bridge. Combine this with a Tower of London tour to maximize time. It's right next door. You can actually get some great shots from down by the tower on the riverside. It's the iconic view of the bridge. You can walk the bridge too if you have time.

Great View from the River. We've walked across the Tower Bridge on a previous visit to London and while in London this Time (July 1-4), we took a river cruise and saw the bridge from a completely different perspective and close-up at that! Needless to say, it's a gorgeous looking bridge from this perspective or from the river bank. During a London black cab tour we took a day or two later, our guide told us the Tower Bridge is really not as old as it appears - only about 115 years old and the actual London Bridge (which many people mistake for the Tower Bridge) is much older. Truly one of the attractions to see while in London.
Amazing view . Amazing view especially through night though with all the lights. we were not lucky enough to see it open and close

Great Architectural Design and Character. The architecture of the bridge is splendid and unique in comparison to some of our American bridge architecture. It has been a few years, but I can still remember the dazzling fabulous jewels! Granted, I wouldn't really want to be wearing the weight of some of the larger pieces, but are they incredible to gaze upon and admire. Of course, the history and the the artifacts were spectacular also, but I can admire magnificent stones and design.

Great day and can be cheaper if you do monument on the same day. This is a great attraction and can be combined with a single ticket to go up the monument on the same day which makes it great value. The trip through the old engine rooms is interesting. If you are really lucky the bridge will go up while you are inside. This happen more than you would think!

The opening of the bridge is not to be missed. I saw it twice in one day!. Beautiful bridge, stunning views from it of the Thames and of the bridge itself. Well worth a visit and if you are lucky you will see the bridge open. I was very lucky to see it open twice in a day! You can visit the very top part of the bridge and walk along it but there is a fee. If you love engineering then visit the 'inside' of the bridge for an added bonus! Stunning bridge and a land mark of London which is dripping in history.

Historic Bridge with Insider view of mechanics and exhibition. It is one of most interesting places to be while you are in central London. You can get down at London bridge station and do a river view walk to Tower Bridge. The Bridge looks fab from every angle. You can check on the internet about the schedule of lifting the bridge. There is an excellent exhibition inside the tower bridge (ticket is 9 pounds) which showcases amazing bridges across the world and their mechanism and history including the tower bridge. You can go in to the engine room as well. Inside the exhibition there are glass walkways which provide you opportunity of thrill and crazy pics.

Excellent views of the Thames. From the moment we stepped onto the Bridge we knew we were in for a treat! Tower Bridge is magnificent. I'd booked on line (£8 for an adult), there was no queue so we went in almost as soon as we'd arrived. There were lots of displays/short films explaining the history and construction of the bridge - all very good. The views from the top were superb. And because it's not really high you feel very close to many of the landmarks. But the best thing about our visit was the glass floors on each of the walkways. They were really clear and big enough to take lots of visitors, so everyone managed to get a chance to stand/walk on them. All of the staff were friendly and approachable. All in all a really good visit. Recommended

Great views of the bridge rising. Happened to time my visit well so no sooner had I arrived on the glass walkway (great photo opportunities) that we were treated to the bridge rising and a ship passing beneath.Some of the displays are dated but, if you have a clear day, you will be rewarded to really good views over London
Go to tour the upper galleries!. A very nice exhibit! Enjoyed views from the upper galleries, and the glass floor for the brave ones! Worth it!
Nice view of London. A very nice view of London from the top of tower bridge, you need to buy ticket from the ground floor

Worthwhiile. Riding on the River Thames, Tower Bridge is one of the eye-catching outlook you would admire. We used the city cruise to Tower Pier, visiting Tower of London and Tower Bridge -all of them using London Pass with no admission/entry fee. (Fee for Tower Bridge Exhibition for adult is GBP 9.00)On top of Tower Bridge, there is a glass floor, which we can look down and see people walking directly underneath on the street level below, in additional to the surrounding views of London and River Thames. There is a video displayed the original of //tower Bridge, its construction as well as a visit to its Engine Room. With the right date and time, you can also witness a bridge lifts.
Picture perfect.. My favorite landmark in London. Makes a good picture everytime. Always busy. I go to the Tower Bridge everytime I visit London.
Love it!. I had seen it hundreds of times in photographs, but it is very impressive in person. I saw it while in the tour bus, didn't go inside the towers. It is beautiful.

Niceeeee. I just love tower bridge, I understand everyone does, but its just one of my favorite places for a stroll in London. Just happened, that I got time to visit the towers only now, and it was cool and scary! In a good way. All history of the bridges and if course the view, it is nice,and its only 9 GBP, definitely visit the engine rooms, and watch a quick video, even if ur not so much in bridge construction.
View the Bridge. The historic tower bridge offers a magnificent view of the River Thames located at the Tower Hill. The bridge opens and closes. A site surely to see, when scheduled.
Beautiful bridge . I went there with family who was coming from France. The view from the top is nice but not amazing. The best of this bridge can be appreciated from the outside.
We just looked at it. Didn't get in. but it's a must see!. Our hotel is closely. We looked at it from underneath by boat and from various angles. It looks magical at night.
Great views. Lovely to see the actual workings of the bridge, and walking along the top you get some fantastic views all over London. We were lucky enough to go on a clear day.
Tower Bridge. If you have the energy walk up the Victorian staircase you see all the iron work that way that you would miss by taking the lift

A True Landmark. Truly monumental ! give its best at night with lightings, take a walk from Embankment down to Tower bridge, lovely ! You can also climb up inside it. Tower of London is next to it. Alongside you have lots of shops, bars and things to see. Enjoy! A must see in London, of course
Walk over the old girl. You must visit this old girl if you travel to London. We walked across on a lovely sunny day, was total heaven.
the best london attraction. The best London tourist attraction by far. Great for history and nice views... Plus its so conveniently located!
The wonderful iconic Tower Bridge. Another iconic monument that is a photographic moment again and again. Walk across it and remind yourself that this is an iconic image of Britain seen by millions.

Cool. Very interesting walking around the engine room and walking over the top of bridge. They have a glass floor over the centre of the bridge, allowing you to look down on people, boats and vehicle's below or enabling you to see the bridge opening from directly above. Good experience.

London icon. Perfecto combination of ingeneering and art. You can't miss it, probably the best London icon. If you stand at the South shore of the river (the ir is a beautiful grass square wher you can relax and get the perfect picutre, framing the Bridge and the London Tower)
Classic Attraction. A classic British architecture structure both for UK residents and for tourists, it will take your breath away
Catching sunset !. It feels good to catch the sundown by the bridge. Be there when the sun sets with the London Bridge as one of its backdrop. Heavenly !

Walking on air!. Visited on a lovely sunny day in August - clear skies and good visibility. Had a problem booking our tickets online but brought photo proof that payment had been made and the staff were very helpful, quickly resolved the problem and issued our tickets. My grandchildren, 8, 12 & 15 enjoyed having a look round the various exhibits and video clips but the highlight for them were definitely the glass floors. Seeing that one of my grandaughters was a bit hesitant about stepping onto the glass (by this time the other two were laid on it to get a photo taken while a boat was passing below) one of the staff came to reassure her that the glass was 7 centimetres thick and could take the wieght of a 5 ton elephant! So I did eventually get photos of all three, plus my daughter 'walking on air'.

MUST SEE WHILE IN LONDON!!!!. You definitely need to make a stop at this iconic bridge during your trip to London, especially if its your first time! We went over the bridge while on the Hop-on Hop-off bus and then we got the best view of it from the water as we took a water ferry from Tower of London to Big Ben. You get a really nice side view of it while at the Town of London (the walkway by the moats on the water). Don't miss it!

Bridge is more than from outside. I think that many people just see the brigde from outside, take a picture and put a tick to the list of the sightseeings in London. But this bridge is more!There is a fantastic exhibition insight at the top about how the bridges are built and what are the most beautiful bridges in the world. Also there is an interesting video how this bridge has been ordered by the queen and there a discussion between her and the architecture. Nice one!
Bit of a let down. The Bridge is advertised to have a "Glass Floor" which is more like 4 small glass windows in the floor. Although it was a great experience to actually go up it!

Great for only £9. Good views and details on the building of tower bridge, get to go through the engine room too and for an extra £1.50 you can walk up the monument to the great fire of London too.Love the stairs as they have a smoke and mirror effect as your walking up, if you can walk up that is the best way

Picturesque. Do not miss the glass Walk. The place is beautiful more from a distance than actually over the bridge.The museum features the bridge history, and a glass walk. Glass Walk is amazing. They charge 9 Pounds for entry. You can see london bridge from the top.
Awesome view. Walk from London bridge to tower bridge, view was super and you have couple of restaurant where you can have good food.
Great !!. Great place to visit for all ages. Well organised and helpful staff. Lucky enough to witness the bridge being raised!
Beautiful. Take the time to see at both night and the day. Excellent view from within the tower of London. Its another site within London that doesn't cost a thing!

Iconic bridge and great landmark. There are all the stories about Americans thinking they were buying this when they bought London Bridge now somewhere it the Desert I believe but if they were using this as the blueprint it must have been very confusing.In any event this is the most fascinating bridge in London not just because it opens but just because it looks amazing

Good site. What a site well built and still standing after all them years. Good area to have have a look around tower if London close by. Would be good to see the bridge working but need to check the boat times.

A must!. Fab especially the glass floor. I'm scared of heights but felt safe on it I shinnied backwards onto it! Saw the bridge rise and fall from above and below fantastic. The engineering is amazing and the staff very informative.

TOWER BRIDGE is not LONDON Bridge ~ I learned that on my trip to LONDON. we saw this from afar in the day and walked up and had a chance to get closer at night if my google cloud worked now I could upload a few pictures of this ~

Good for any age. Our family love this. For the kids they provide books with stickers to collect along the way. For the adults it's a great place to see London in all its glory. We keep going back and back. There is a great animation of the construction of Tower Bridge. The views are completely phenomenal and then there are the engine rooms.
Worth doing the bridge experience. The bridge itself is beautiful. If you have the London pass, its worth doing the bridge experience which allows you to see the inner workings of the bridge.
A View from the Top. Lots of steps to climb, great views rom the top, well worth the effort to reach the top. A beautiful old bridge.

Wonderful experience!. This is a "must-see" place in London - interesting, educational and fun! Although it is more of a landmark in London now, it was actually a serious place with serious history during the time of newly industrialised Britain. It is definitely worth a visit when in London.

Wonderful to see the bridge lifting to let a ship through. We love to watch the Thames when we visit London so we were thrilled to see Tower Bridge being lifted and lowered to let a ship through. The iconic bridge is lovely to see next to the Tower of London. You could visit the bridge and see how the mechanism worked in the past, not sure if you still can, but that was very interesting too. Just walking over this bridge makes you realise just how familiar a sight the river Thames is, because it is featured so often in films and on TV.

A feat of engineering . Took the tower bridge tour and were amazed at the complexity of the bridge as well as its simplicity of function. 8 years to build and it has been in service since 1898! The engine room was very fascinating as well as walking over the glass floor.
Another Icon. A must see in London and is everything you read about.Yhe building construction and operation is amazing
Gorgeous . A must see part of London it's a breathtaking Kodak moment monument to visit! You feel like an aristocrat standing next to history!
Beautiful. Awesome landmark that everyone have to go and see! It's best to see it on a clear day. It's smaller than I had expected.

Photogenic monument right there. Great last day walking over the Bridge. Incredible views of the city and river. For once liked the other tourists, as everyone is willing to take a good photo for you (not a selfie-fan). The lorries were a bit distracting though.

After seeing all the pictures and reading about the tower in history books..... Seeing it in person was its only justice! This is one attraction that you want to make sure that you not only see from afar as part of the landscape, but also make sure you walk across!

Very interesting for anybody. Always a bit of a queu, but had the London pass for easy access. Very informative and interactive displays. Nice walk from north from to south with glass floors, great view of the river and street, and of the city. Then the tour of the power house was great for the mechanical type.
Great bridge.. Great experience, good to explore the inside of this beautiful bridge after seeing the outside so many times. Even better if you get to see it open,

A great experience . The Tower Bridge Experience is certainly an experience! Absolutely fantastic sights of London and some interesting facts about the origins and building of the bridge itself. There are lots of steps up to the top so I would advise you use the lift if you are not very fit or mobile. However if you do use the stairs there are some beautiful structural sights to see on the way up. The highlight of the tour is the glass floor so you can see the Thames below. It takes a bit of getting used to though and feels quite surreal. You also get to look around the engine rooms during the tour and the sheer size of them is quite awe inspiring. Definitely worth a visit and a great experience.
Up and down. Let's have a look on the informations on the bridge for the planning of elevations for big ships.One of the symbols of the town.

Don't miss this famous landmark. Best nighttime views of London. There are some quaint bars and eateries around the bridge which looks particularly spectacular at nighttime. We went to a great pub called The Horniman and walked down to the bridge past the Lord Mayors office. A great way to spend an afternoon.

Love it!!. What a fantastic piece of Victorian engineering. The tour is £9 and for an extra £1.50 a trip up Monument is included. There is a very short film about how the bridge idea began, then you are free to roam across the bridge. The glass floor section is not for the faint hearted. Great views over the Thames. I love this bridge.

Walking on (un)Broken Glass!!. Tower Bridge is, of course, London's most iconic and well-known bridge - I've also heard it referred to as "London Bridge" by tourists (when I've longed to butt-in and put them right)! Our visit included looking round the machine room underneath the bridge, which was fairly interesting to us non-engineers, but we did want to get to the glass-bottomed walkway over the River Thames. On entering the building we were pointed straightaway to the lift, which was quite upsetting for one of our group who is definitely a "liftophobe" and she found the relatively short ride quite hard. It was only when we were ready to descend to street level that we found there were stairs we could use. However, it was quite something to find ourselves looking down through the glass to the river and to the people walking across the bridge beneath us! We were all quite hesitant about standing on the glass, but once we had done so you couldn't get us off! It's definitely a brilliant photo-opportunity and we did all thoroughly enjoy ourselves.
Mindblowing. Totally worth a visit. Make sure you check out the bridge lift times beforehand so you can see the bridge lift from the top.

Worth the climb. What a surprise! First we took the stairs instead of waiting for the elevator. There's an interesting short movie at the top. You walk across both sides of the bridge & both have the see through part but take your pics on the 2nd side of the bridge. There's no crowd.

Majestic!. I have been to Tower Bridge before but this time we got to view the glass panels in the floor. After climbing the steps you watch a video of the history of the bridge, then move on to the bridge itself. The views are stunning and the glass floor gives you a great view of below. My children 8, 10 and 15 were laying, walking and sitting on the glass!!! We walked along both sides and then went down into the engine room. The ticket price is reasonable and its a lovely part of our history to visit.
Quite a sight. The bridge truly lives up to all the hype. Very picturesque and feels larger than life in person, definitely a must see.
Famous bridge on the world..... I will advise to anyone that will go to London to visit this place, it will allow a very good view over the river.

Great day out in London as a Londoner. We chose to go to the London Bridge exhibition as I've never been before great view even that it was grey but still niceOnly downfall that there are several tourists who will spoil the adventure for everyone while blocking the Birdseye view and not living on so everyone can seeApart from that lots to know and talk about, please don't be put off by wire as they move fairly quickly Lifts for anyone who needs it and stairs option too

Must see attraction. The view is really enjoyable as well as the walk along the bridge. The park and spaces all around are really well maintained and there's lot of options for buying food and drinks for the family.
Beautiful bridge!. Beautiful piece of architecture! You can have a nice view of the city. Maybe it's worth more to visit at night because during the day is very crowded.
Woolworth the time to visit. Well worth visit with reasonable entry fees to theTower bridge Experience. We were very lucky to see the bridge open 3 times durrign the day and once were above it.
One of the must sees of London. The Tower bridge is one of the must sees of London! Cross the bridge and check out the view from the bridge. You can even visit one of the towers.
A must-see.. I have walked, driven and cycled along Tower Bridge and it always gets me. So majestic and beautiful!

try to get there when the deck opens up!. check the sailing times on their website to try to get there when the decks will open to let a big ship sail throough, and most iportantly, try to be at the top by the glass floor when that happens. We did, and it was an amazing ! also the little film at the beginning is really good and the stickers that are handed out to kids along the visit were a huge hit with the kids!

Kids loved it. We only went here because one of my daughters friends had been and enjoyed it. We enjoyed walking across the bridge especially when we had to stop for the bridge to be raised. Inside we weren't interested in the films about the design and creation of the bridge and we barely stopped in the engine room. The best part was definitely the sky walk which my kids rank as the best moment of their London trip. Also there is a nice little postcard machine to take a family picture for only £3 which we did.

Recommended - cheap and fun. Went yesterday and really recommend it.
Staff very friendly on the ticket desk and entrance and on the walkways
The glass walkway is very different
Good price
An awesome experience touring the Tower Bridge. A great tour of the tower bridge. Great photo souvenir. Lots of history on the tower bridge. Great photo op while seeing the bridge open up. thumps up.

Poppies. we managed to visit tower bridge when the poppies were on display, words cannot say how moving it all was. The queue was too long to get into the tower, we had two small children with us. Another time perhaps.

Imposing - Beautiful - Great Photo Op !!. Beautiful structure and grand views of the River and parts of the city. Though we didnt go up to the viewing gallery, even visiting the towers was good fun. The hIstory associated makes it special. Lovely walk from here to the Tower of London and further all along the river. Can spend 30 mins here. Good photo op.

Great views, informative, and a workout.. Tower Bridge is a must. We went right after a visit to the Tower of London. Because we traveled to the city by train (Gatwick Express) we had a sweet 2 for 1 deal coupon that we could use. Saves a lot of money, just pick up a coupon booklet at a train station and keep you tickets/receipt.The views are fantastic, however you can see more from London Eye or the top of St. Paul's. There are stairs leading up to the walkway, but you could take the elevator if you're lazy... But there is a long wait, and you'll miss out on the bridge's inside architecture. Before you enter the walkway you are able to see a short film about the bridge's origin, which is fun. Once you'll enter the walkway you'll see some great views of the city. Both walkways have a collection of photos explaining the different types of bridges. Also, in the middle of both walkways there is a section with glass flooring. If you are afraid of heights, be aware, because you are looking down towards the road. Though, if you are lucky, you timed your visit perfectly and you'll see the bridge lift (we weren't that lucky). These glass floors are also a magnet for obnoxious tourists that want to suddenly lay down... :-( Tickets also allow you to visit the steam engines, which is a short walk away at the foot of the bridge. There is also a small shop and cafe here.
Awesome!!!!. We had a very nice day out. Nice to see the river thames. It was awesome and my daughter really loved it.
Very Majestic. Take the time to walk the bridge when at the Tower of London. Great place for photos. We did a boat tour through this area which was a great way to see the sites.
Cool looking bridge. The bridge is one of many that crosses the Thames River. It is a beautiful piece of architecture and the bridge is a functioning bridge.
