Beautiful at night!. Wanted to visit the tower bridge thanks to the famous son. However didnt manage to visit it during the day time and could only enjoy its splendor at night. The lights are beautiful at night!
Enjoy the view. This is a beautiful bridge that you can view when you leave the Tower of London. If time permits you can walk across the bridge or just sit on a nearby bench and enjoy the view.

G Marsden. This is one of the most stunning sights in London. A very beautiful landmark, set in an amazing part of the city. No trip to London would be complete without a trip here for excellent photo opportunities.

Great view. I used to think it was worthless to pay an entry fee for this attraction. But I had the chance to come here for my friend's birthday and visited this place from the inside. It was fantastic! What I enjoyed the most is the view it offers from the top gallery which now has a glass floor where you can see everything from the above of your feet!

Excellent. Visiting Tower bridge was part of a package deal we got along with the Shard and the Tower of london, this is a must if you are visiting the great city of London. You see all the workings of the bridge from days gone by too the present, a comprehensive talk on how it works, the people who work their now and back in the day. All in all an excellent experiance.
Amazing. The tower Bridge of London is an iconic piece of architecture. You can get excellent photos and selfies done if you are adventurous.
Very interesting . Had a very interesting day here. Throughly loved sterling back in time. Very enjoyable and good for both young and old

Amazing experience. Childhood dreams come true..!. Awesome and smooth experience. Definitely worth it to go up the tower for the exhibition..The best and scary part is watching down on the glass floor..

Good value for money - interesting attraction. Excellent value for money at £9 - We spent 1 1/2 hours exploring the engine room, museum and glass floor walkways at the top. We were lucky that the bridge was due to open whilst we were there so saw the barge passing underneath - times are online if you want to see this happen. Glass floor not scary as have been much higher (CNN Tower!) but fun to watch how some people would walk around it!
An Icon, how to miss it?. Of course it is an icon of London; I don't know if it is the best bridge in the World, but walking across it is an emotion.

See this at night!. Everyone of course knows (or knows of) the famous Tower Bridge in London. It's a very nice, picturesque bridge at any time of the day, but by chance, after strolling through central London in the late afternoon, we arrived at the Tower Bridge when it was starting to get dark, and the bridge started being lit up with this violet/purple light... We stayed until it got completely dark, walking along the Thames from the Tower Bridge to London Bridge (the next bridge up), and looking at the illuminated bridge. Quite a sight...

Great experience. We bought the London pass and got to go into the Tower Bridge exhibition. It was amazing!! We could see for miles out of the sides and then all of the traffic beneath us. It also has a lot of information about bridges and in particular how the bridge was built. We even got to see it raise. It was fun to actually get to see

Just stay outside of it to take pictures. We visited this place because it's near our hotel (Doubletree by Hilton), about a 5 minutes walk away. Nothing much to see in there, we stayed outside of it to take pictures.

Make part of your trip. All the main attractions in London must be included on your trip. Its beautiful to see so many beautiful attractions, in one place making all part of thousands of years of history

symbol of london, symbol of great britain. walk over or boat under, this bridge is the symbol of london, a symbol of great britain.
very interesting walking over it, lots to see

Spectacular bridge by day and night.. We have sailed through Tower Bridge many times when doing the Thames Cruise. This year we really could see the beauty of the bridge as we stayed in the a Tower Guoman Hotel. It is well maintained and the walk across it was amazing with good views up and down the Thames. At night it is a real landmark when lit up. Excellent for photographs.

Iconic place. Obviously it's the best when it's opening, however it's rare occasion. I was lucky enough to to see it twice. Don't know if you can check somewhere when it gone rise up, it would be cool if you could get this kind of information
One of the most famous bridges in the world.... I love walking across this bridge when i am in london, it is beautiful. walk across here and visit the Tower of London which is located right by it.
Must See London. Of course its a must see location for London. Take the time to walk across the bridge and soak up the views.
Don't miss it!. Tower Bridge is a beautiful monument, a landmark of London, if you're thre you have to cross it, or at least see it!
A must see !!. Wowee, what an experience this is. you will see all the horrors the 'Tower" had. See the site where Anne Boleyn met her be-heading, the ravens and more
Full of Hisotry. Tower of London, So full of History another must visit place. Take the tour you will get more out of your visit. Also the Tower Bridge experience is well worth looking at

well worth a visit. Well worth a visit. When you're up there their is a glass floor about half way along, and at the end you can see the old steam engine room. If you're planning a trip to London buy a London Pass, it gets you into all the major attractions and even fast tracks you past the queues on a lot of them. You can even see a film for free at some cinemas.

A London Icon. We took the tour and walked across the high level walkways. We enjoyed the views across London which also helped us as first time visitors to get acquainted with the city. The Victorian Engine Rooms were interesting and worth a visit if you enjoy engineering and like to see how things work.
Great . First time ever for myself and my 10 Yr old son to do the Tower Bridge experience. Loved the glass floor and engine rooms.

One of wonders. Every landmark or attraction has its own specialty. This building was made for necessity and ended up to be most unique bridge in the world.When you will walk in there are two corridors having the details of different bridges all over the world (kind of exhibition). The floor is made of glass in the middle so its unique experience too. Then there is small tour of engine rooms but no excess to room where you can see the real machinery. The times are also provided when bridge will open.For making tour lengthy and exciting step out on south of river and have a nice walk in front of Mayor of London office and beautiful buildings like shard around it. The market in front of HMS Belfast is also place to visit.

London day return on Virgin Trains... Fantastic.. Went by Virgin Trains from Manchester on a special deal £51.00 for three of us. We bought some day passes on the underground to get us around. To be honest, London seems a lot cheaper now than it was 20 years ago. We stopped at a pub on Tower Bridge Road for dinner , I had steak and baked potatoe, Hubby had the mixed grill, daughter had spaghetti , 1 pint of lager , a Vodka and coke and a fruit shoot all for under £20.00. There was loads of entertainment on the Thames river bank and we looked at almost all the places of interest, Big Ben, Houses of Parliament, London eye, Nelsons Column, Buckingham Palace, Harrods, you name it , we did it. We was there from 8 am till 10 pm great day out, great pictures and great memories...
Must see. Tower bridge is a must see attraction of London . Very famous we went there by tube . Really amazing experience.

Iconic bridge on the Thames with stunning views. Iconic bridge on the Thames with stunning views of the Tower of London, St Katherine's Dock. The bridge still lifts several times daily - quite something to see the tall boats going through. Plenty to do/ see in the area

Outstanding. . Walked from Southbank to The Tower of London...so exciting to walk across this bridge. It's so magnificent. Surprised to find that it's not that old...about 130 years I think I heard. Truly stunning.

Not to be confused with London Bridge. We loved the glass walkway that allows you to look down onto the river Thames. My 14-year-old son and 12-year-old daughter thought the steam pump rooms were cool.

Beware!. While enjoying the breath taking view along the promanade, beware of pick pockets theives acted as a couple follow you closely and open back packs that you are carrying. If you discovered, they say they want to warn you about the zip was open. Watch out!

Excellent, value for money attraction with the best views. A beautiful and interesting walk along the south bank to Tower Bridge, makes this attraction even better. We bought tickets on line so no queuing, friendly staff, really interesting and informative. The most amazing views of London and the glass floor gives a whole different perspective. The LCD pictures, history of bridges, engine room, all make this a wonderful attraction. We spent a great 2 hours on the bridge for just £20, a fantastic experience at an affordable price.

It's a must. If you go to visti the Tower bridge you will never regret your choice.We went there and were so lucky that the day was sunny enough to allow us to take wonderful pictures of the panorama. Skycrapers, river.. all clearly visible and enhanced by the shining light of the sun.What's more we visited the exposition inside the bridge and I have to say I would come back again. You will see there the story of the bridge construction, an exposition of the most famous bridges in the world and you can even have a walk on a glassy floor below which you will astonishingly see the river!!
Cool to walk over. We walked over the bridge after visiting the tower. It's a cool bridge and the kids recognized it from Harry Potter. We went over on one side and back in the other.
Go on 2 for 1 deal. Walk across the top on the 2 for 1 London attraction offer with national rail. Beautiful views. Rarely crowded.
beautiful. nice place to take pictures. There are a few interesting stories about some events in 1950s . Beautiful view

Tower Bridge London. What is a visit to London without a visit to Tower Bridge. This lovely bridge is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen. Take the time if you can to walk over the bridge and you will see just how huge this magnificent attraction is.
Loved the glass walkway. Excellent visit to tower bridge. Great views even on a rainy gloomy day. The glass walkway is brilliant. Sat on it.lay on it. Also the engine rooms are very interesting.

Great London attraction. Brilliant views and interesting museum.. Great visit with my two late teenage sons.Walked the 206 steps to the bridge.Great glass floor so you can take photos and walk across seeing the river below.Some short films giving the history of the bridge.You then go the steam pump rooms and see how all the mechanisms work.Good value and a bit different - well worth a visit.

Disappointing. I was looking forward to this trip but was disappointed. The view of London from the top is not as good as I thought. Walking over glass flooring to see the road below uninspiring. If you are after a really great view of London visit the Shard Building and leave the Tower
Not the "London Bridge". Confused by travellers as the London Bridge, the Tower Bridge is a lovely icon and spot to catch a Thames sunset and a great photo op!

Walk the glass floor from above the Thames!. We wanted to have the unique experience of walking the glass floor above the Thames. We visited after lunch, but had London Passes so we did not have to buy tickets. There was a 10 minute wait. You can take the elevator or stairs. When you get to the top there is a short video on the history of building the bridge. Then you walk the length of the bridge from above and part of the walk way is glass, so you can look down and see the bridge traffic, pedestrians and river below. There were interpretative panels along the upper walk way about historic bridges and bridge construction. The engine was room worth a walk through, but we didn't spend a lot of time there. Definitely a unique London experience!

Another major landmark u don't wanna miss. Make sure u bring your camera and tripod here during different part of the day (day and night). There are many areas for beautiful pictures and this is another major landmark of London that no one should miss when visiting England.

Interesting and fantastic views. This is the second time I've been to Tower Bridge, but the first time with the new gkass walkway. Interesting to see how the bridge was built and how they used to raise the bridge. The glass walkway is new and somewhat disconcerting to walk across, although it does provide a unique photo opportunity! Excellent value for money too. Plus, if you are lucky, you might get to see the bridge being raised like me! :)
So british. You can't say you've been in London without seeing Tower Bridge, you should ride the bus to take the experience to a whole other level! It's definitely a must!
Great attraction.. Really worth a visit. Well worth paying for the sky walk experience and view the inner workings of the bridge.

A must see attraction in London. Tower Bridge is one of the must see attraction in London. It is close to the tower of London and can be visited after the tower of London. Climbing up the stairs is not difficult and can be done with children. There is also a lift. Walking on the upper level of the bridge is very nice since there are parts of the floor which are made of glass. Also the engine room is very interesting.
Just as billed. It really is just like the movies. That said, I wouldn't plan a day around it. You will likely happen past it (or over it) on your travels anyway.
Good views. Good time at the bridge & with lots of information. Organised well with queues etc. Not too badly priced. Enjoyed the glass walkway & looking down.
A must see. One of the most famous site in the world, a total must see ! This is the site that represents London.

Don't miss, quick fun, cool views.. This attraction was very quick but very fun attraction. You climb up the bridge after watching brief film about the bridge and why it was designed the way it is. Then on the bridge they have GLASS BOTTOM floors. Really cool, as you are so high up. Our kids age 11-19 really loved this. Climb up was not bad, there is also a lift. Quick stop, lots of fun, definitely should be on the list.

Very Interesting. This was well worth a visit to. Our Granddaughter loved the glass walkway. You could see for miles around. Everyone should try and walk across. Husband was very interested in the engines. Engineer for you. It was immaculate downstairs where the engines were. The children can do a test and receive stamps on their way round.

Thrilling walk across the glass floor walkway. The Tower Bridge itself was an engineering marvel. They recently added another achievement with the glass walkway. The new glass walkway across Thames River is an experience not to be missed. But if you are afraid of heights walking across the 11 metres can seem like an eternity.

Iconic Bridge. Fun famous bridge with a great tour if you are interested in the mechanical operations of a huge bridge. Massive machinery powers this work of art. Great view and close to other attractions.

Better to look at from the outside. We decided to go up since we had the London Pass, and we're trying to get as much value out of it as possible. However, the exhibit inside was small, and not overly interesting. We also visited the engine room which was a disappointment as it is a mock-up advertised as the real thing.If you don't have the London Pass and need to pay admission, I would skip the visit inside and admire the views of the bridge from along the river. It makes a nice backdrop for the city of London!

nice walk across. views from the bridge when you walk over are great you can see hms belfast and tower of london, boats etc,..in the middle of the bridge you can pay to go up on top and walk on glass floor...its not very big complete rip off...

Fun with nice views, but small. We had a 2-for-1 from the national rail for this, which made it worth it. However, we wouldn't have paid full price for both of us. There are some nice views of the Thames and city, and a few interesting displays about bridges, plus a walkway with a glass bottom, but that's about it. You also get to go into the engine room and learn about how they would raise and lower the bridge, but my husband and I had little interest in that. If you have a two-for-one, are really interested in bridges, or want to learn about steam engines, you should go, but otherwise I'd say give it a miss and save your money for something else in this quite expensive city.

Tower Bridge. Not really a lot to look at, the children wanted to go to the top of the bridge but soon got bored. Nice views from the top level but unless you are into engineering not that interesting. I preferred viewing the bridge from outside.
Crowded, but worth the visit. Make sure you walk up Tower Bridge on the right side (City Centre) as there is no pedestrian crossing.

Great Views. This was my second time to Tower Bridge and I think I enjoyed it more this time. The area around the bridge is a wonderful place to take a stroll and, during some portions, really gives you the feel of stepping back in time.There are plenty of nearby points to take wonderful pictures of the bridge
Well worth a visit . Particularly impressive and unique, this massive structure had elegance and poise. Any tourist should cross it&Londoners should enjoy it frequently!

Another London Landmark Not to be Missed. My family and I went out of our way to see Tower Bridge during our recent first trip to London. It was well worth the effort, too, to behold this architectural wonder. It was difficult to take my eyes off this magnificent landmark and I highly recommend a trip to it should you be visiting London.

An Iconic Bridge. Such an iconic bridge must be seen when visiting London. It has a really safe pedestrian walkway and you can pay a few pounds to go up and get a tour which I did not do. Not much to say about this one, if you are doing the touristy aspects of London, this will no doubt be one or two on the list!
Iconic. If you travel around London, you will catch glimpses of this bridge most times you get near the Thames.
worth visit. During visit to London, I found opportunity to visit Tower Bridge. It was worth visiting for every person visiting to London.
Worth the walk. We walked a long way to see this bridge and I am so glad we did. It is absolutely beautiful and well maintained. Took tons of pictures of this bridge.
The Royal walk!!!. we walked across with 'Ben & Jerry's' to keep us company. The vibe, the view.fellow tourists, locals....it was just amazing. I recommend it highly. Leave the wheels & WALK across.

Dare to walk the glassfloor. We visited on Tuesday 25th Aug , i had booked ahead but am so pleased as it was raining so gave us somewhere to go.Book ahead online for discounts, its a cheap fun trip.There is a short film to watch regarding the construction of the bridge you then get to go across the Thames via the walkways - part of which is a glassfloor. Lovely informative helpers will answer any questions you ask.After you've walked both walkways you get to walk down to the engine rooms .
Tower Bridge. Very interesting attraction, even though I'm frightened of height! Loved the Glass Floor!! Would visit again.

Perfect to get to Borough Markets. Not to be mistaken for London Bridge. This is a beautifully kept treasure of London City. Nice to walk from The Shard to Borough Markets on a sunny day. The view of the bridge is better than the view from the bridge.

Magnificient. Tower bridge is a magnificent structure. It looks magnificent in the day and more in the night when it's lighted up. It will open up in the middle if tall water vessels need to pass through. However, Tower bridge exhibit which is included in the London Pass is nothing much. The so called glass floor for looking down at River Thames is not exciting.

fascinating and informative for families. I have often been inspired by this iconic bridge on my visits to London over the years but this was my time inside the bridge. There are fantastic views from the top , especially the glass floor. The exhibition on other bridges of the world was interesting. I have no interest in engineerig but I found the balance of information about how it all works about right for me and my 11year old son. Theres also lots of buttons / touch screens for kid and a sticker passport.
IMPRESSIVE. beautiful passage way, very impressive from the top with the Thames river at the bottom. Historical bridge
Must see. This was my second visit. The first time was in 1985 so it was indeed wondeful to visit again. The most iconic bridge in London. Must see.

Tower bridge.. Situated by the side of the tower of London, this historical bridge is best seen from the riverbank. If you are lucky enough you could witness it opening up to allow the ships to pass through.
Mega . Excellent vue you can see all along the river Thames all local hotels near by should you want to stay the night

A beautiful icon of London. This bridge is utterly majestic. I have lived in London for 17 years, and still feel so lucky to live here whenever I walk over it. It is so picturesque and such an iconic experience. Don't bother to buy tickets to go up it though: it's a waste of money as you really can't see much when you're up there. Go up St Paul's Cathedral instead which has a lot more stairs but much better views!
Love it!. A place to visit in your lifetime. I just love it and will go back. Take a boat ride and also a bike ride!

Really cool to take pictures of. We loved looking at the bridge and getting a bunch of pictures when walking to the tower of London. We did not go across it, but it was cool to see up close and take pictures of.

Great view from the bridge. Visiting this unique landmark was amazing, going up to the museum above the road was an eye opener with great views across the river Thames and london then with a little trip under the bridge to see how it works was well worth a look.
Lovely bridge. Didn't get to walk over, but got some great photos of it from bus and boat tour. What a lovely and interesting bridge.

Spectacular Views and you can get a history lesson too. An iconic London landmark the The Tower Bridge is even more spectacular when you see it up close. Strolling along the bridge (with all the throng of other Summertime tourists) is an thrill not to be missed. If you want to get up close and personal with the bridge consider doing the Tower Bridge Exhibition which tells you about the history of the bridge through films and interactive displays. You also get to visit the engine room (my husband found that fascination although to me that part was a bit boring). We were able to stand on a glass platform walkway and look down when the bridge was open to allow a cruise ship to pass through so that was pretty cool. We went late afternoon and there was a long queue (lucky we were fast-tracked as we had a London Pass) so if you do want to go maybe make it earlier in the day.

Stunning!. The iconic bridge of London, which many people mistaken for The London Bridge. Tower Bridge is beautiful in it's own way, the history alone about it makes it worth viewing! Easy to get to, since you can see it off the Thames!

Wonderful structure. What a wonderful bridge this is. We visited quite a few attractions while staying very near to london bridge. It is a striking bridge but very busy both with traffic and pedestrians.
Magical Tower Bridge. Breathtaking views over the Thames River and teeming with life as vehicles roar across from both ends, extending majestically into the London sky line

Amazing views through glass floor. Visited the bridge today as it was raining. Was very informative and interesting. The views are great. There is now a glass floor to walk over which was a little scary at first but it was amazing to watch the people, boats and vehicles below.

Beautiful piece of London history. We did the city cruise boat trip then walked past the Tower of London, over Tower Bridge which gives you great views of the Towers, Hms Belfast and The Shard. If your in the area well worth a visit.
Its just a bridge. Nothing special but a good location of memorable pictures. Well connected and a walk around the neighborhood gives a good indication of city life
Great Bridge!. very impressive and interesting. The views of the Thames and surroundings are marvellous and well worth a walk across!

A must see on any London trip. A must see up close on any London trip. It's an impressive piece of architecture, let alone a cultural icon. It's also adjacent to the famous Tower of London, so you can do both in one go. Get off the tube at either Tower Hill or Tower Gateway on the DLR.

A must for the first-timer to London but so much people. Beautiful of course and the Victorian steam room was beautiful and interesting. We went up into the Exhibition and while the first short film (3 mins or so) was interesting the rest is very difficult to take in because there are so many people. Even walking over the bridge is difficult since there are so much tourists. Cool with the glass floor so that one can look straight down on the traffic and into the river.
Fantastic views along the Thames. Iconic bridge close to the Tower of London offering excellent views along the Thames. Walking over the glass floor is an experience.

Tower Bridge. I have never been up the Tower of London before and felt a bit nervous. It was worth a few nerves though! What a view of London. It took another leap of faith to walk across the glass floor and convince yourself you are not going to fall through it and end up either in the Thames or under a London bus. Its quite safe though and you will be glad you did it. A very enjoyable and informative trip,

Joggers Paradise. Tower bridge is the most iconic image of london. Almost every movie with london as a backdrop had this iconic bridge. It is simply amazing to go for jogging on this bridge either in morning or during evenings.
Must-see. Beautiful, a must-see!It usually opens 2-3 times a week, when we have been there it opened 3 times in a row!

Blue Bridge of Beauty. Take the time and walk across the bridge. Many think that this is the London Bridge. However, it''s not. But well worth the journey. You can walk along the river, past the HMS Belfast and across the river to the Tower of London. Makes for a great afternoon.

The astonishing feat of engineering with new experiences for this century.. We then walked on to the Tower Bridge, which is right next door to the Tower of London. I have to admit I always called it the London Bridge, but I stand corrected.We used our London Pass, which allowed us to fast track through the line. There was a multitude of stairs to go up. There had to be at least 5 flights. They really worked my thighs and shins. I am glad we brought some water with us, because we had to stop at least twice. I also noticed that my friend and I weren’t the only ones having issues mastering the stairs – so were a couple of other people. When you get to the top there is a hologram regarding the history of the making of the tower. It was worth watching, and I would highly recommend it. You can also sit down after completing those stairs, to catch your breath. You then walk down a corridor that allows you to look at the city from above the bridge. Along the outer walls, there are pictures of other bridges from around the world. In certain sections, there is a sky walk where you can walk over large glass areas and look down at the bridge or Thames below. My friend and I are both afraid of heights, so we were so scared to do it and couldn’t fathom people just sitting on it like it was just another piece of the floor. On the second side of the walkway, my friend and I held hands to assist with our bravery. Needless to say, it worked and we walked a good portion of the sky walk. After you are done with them, you go down another flight of stairs to the Lift to take you downstairs. We then go back outside to follow a blue line to the engine rooms. There was a boiler, several steam engines, large black tools, and interactive exhibits for adults and children to try regarding the workings of the engines for the Tower of London.

A Stunning Bridge!. A beautiful bridge with stunning architecture which also includes a clock. We walked over the bridge and were lucky to see the draw bridge go up for tall ships. There were too many people in the middle of summer to see an exhibition and climb to the top of the bridge and also see the Victorian engine rooms. Cost is 9 pounds.
Standing on Glass floor is a must!. Loved this experience with the views from the glass floor being the highlight! Cannot visit London and pass this one up!

The Famous "London Bridge". You have to see this bridge from close, at least once. After all, it's famous & is actually very lovely. We enjoyed seeing the bridge & walking in the neighborhood. Maybe not on my list of the best places to visit, but I am glad we did.

Fantastic views. Had wanted to do the tower bridge for a while and it was well worth it, loved the glass floor even thou it was a lot smaller than I thought, the views over the Thames are fantastic, the history is very interesting and the fact this is a working bridge is amazing, there are plenty of staff to help or ask questions and it is very reasonably priced, I managed to get a 2 for 1 with a train ticket, worth looking at days out guide if travelling by train

Loved it! Long held bucket list item fulfilled!. We got there at about 1pm, so not great timing as it was busy. There are two routes up - stairs (lots of them - over 200) or lift (10 minute wait when we got there). The stairs are prettier; the lift is quicker. We took the stairs. I am not that fit but I made it without needing oxygen! There are places you can stop to take a break on the way up. There are 2 information films to watch. There are also lots of pictures of different types of bridges with lots of facts and figures about those and how they compare to Tower Bridge. Rather disappointed to find there were only 5 panels of glass on each side of the bridge and these were generally packed with tourists taking selfies and hogging the walkway. However, when you do get your go, it is a weird feeling and you have to do one thing every day that scares you! Great views of London too.Take the time to go across the bridge - follow the blue line, to the engine rooms. Very nice gift shop there too.We did our visit without really planning it. We just happened to be at the Tower and I suggested it. If you plan your visit see if you can get it to coincide with a bridge lift like we did. Great stuff!

A magnificent piece of engineering!. Tower bridge is an amazing masterpiece. There is so much to see whilst you are there from the workings of the bridge to the wonderful view of the Thames that you get. It is an excellent example of British Engineering. At night time, it is even better as you can watch all the lights on it flickering like candles. I think this is a magnificent item to visit and would highly recommend it.

Take the tour...walk on air . This tour is worth it for many reasons. The view is one of them. Greats views up and down the mighty Thames and a view of your potential death. It's not well advertised but they have installed areas on the floor with glass. Quite the view looking down. Tough to get a photo at times due to the number of parents who use the glass as a baby sitter for their children. This is a fine example of the Visual Cliff experiment not working.

Fun, reasonable day out . . Went here with my husband and nine year old Granddaughter. Because we had travelled by train we got 2 for the price of 1 on the adult tickets . Very reasonable price and did not have to queue at all to get in. After a brief introduction my granddaughter was given stickers to go onto a free passport she had been given with the chance to collect more during the visit ( all free) we watched a short video and then wandered on our own . Great fun daring to walk on the glass section of the bridge and fun to watch the traffic below. We then wandered round the engine rooms. The staff were all very helpful and informative and gave us the heads up that the bridge was opening a few hours later which we managed to catch . Would highly recommend a visit .

Beautiful. Tower Bridge is beautiful! The architecture and location. Fortunately we were blessed with great weather to be able to enjoy it for its beauty.The history behind it is fascinating. Very picturesque too.

Themes views through the glass floor. You will have a chance to climb up to Tower bridge, walk along the bridge, look at cars and people below through glass floor and visit machine rooms. Nice place to take photos. Free entrance with London pass.

watch the lights come on. You've likely heard how amazing it is to watch the bridge light up, and it is. We sat nearby before dusk watching the bridge slowly light up, very romantic too. For $ you can go up into the towers and cross over the vehicles moving below.

TO WALK TOWER BRIDGE IS TO FINALLY BELIEVE YOU ARE IN LONDON!!. We walked across tower bridge...which to me is the only way to experience the sights and sounds....to look around you as you stroll...to see Big Ben in the distance...The London Eye, etc. etc.....I had to keep pinching myself to believe i was actually here!!...A trip of a life time!!

Loved the glass floors!. We have been to London many times and had never visited Tower Bridge. I'm glad we finally did it. There are a few videos to give you a history of the bridge and yes, it's actually still a working bridge and opens up multiple times per day for boats to come in.At the top of the bridge there is a very large glass floor. I'll admit it took me a while to get up the guts to stand on that glass floor. I kept sprinting across it but when the guide there told me it was built to hold an elephant I felt a little better standing on it. When you look down you'll see either the people walking across the bridge or the water. Either one is terrifying but you just can't leave without standing, sitting, or lying on that glass because you'll regret it.Other than that, it's a bridge. You walk across it, take pictures, admire the view, and walk off. But that glass floor really gives it an extra excitement.

Don't miss the chance to go up. In researching what to do I really wanted the chance to go up the bridge and look down on the cars going under you. So glad I bought the tickets in advance and we were able to do this. This was one of our favorite attractions we saw. The overall experience was great and not overcrowded. Being able to take pictures on the glass looking down is so cool. You get to see everything from the top to the bottom, really really cool

How can you miss it.. The Tower Bridge is exquisite. Especially at night. Looks fantastic from many different viewpoints all over the city. The historical signs and information are also really interesting and well worth reading.

Tower Bridge Experience. Tour of the bridge was great. Staff very knowledgeable & helpful (not to mention polite--they are British after all). Glass walkway was dizzying & not for the height-impaired. Glass walkway is smaller than it looks online & you can walk around it if you can't handle the glass part. Admission price very reasonable.
Great day out. Had a great day it wasn't raining even though there was nothing but clouds and a lil bit of sunshine every now and again
Super Weather. Visited the icon complete with our labrador on Thursday 20/8/2015. Sat by the Thames and enjoyed the views across London.

King of all attraction. One of the beautiful piece of architecture. Amazing to see opening of bridge. We manage to see opening three times. Once from the top of the bridge, once from the road side and once from the river cruise and every time manged to shoot video. Entry to the top of bridge has fees but the same is covered in London pass. You should not miss this at any cost.

Great views and exhibit . The views from the bridge are great, but if you have problems with heights as I do the glass floors are a bit of a challenge. Noted down the bridge opening times a time your visit for the full experience
Bridge over murky waters. There was nothing too spectacular about the bridge. Maybe it would have been better if I visited at night? Its probably a nice place to walk in sunny weather.

Awesome Experience. Who knew a bridge would be so fascinating and tons of fun with its new glass bottom walkways! Interesting engine room too. (there is a fee to do walkway and engine room but worth it)Tower Bridge is beautiful and it's an awesome sight (we were lucky enough to see it raised TWICE). Take a walk across the Thames River - what could be better. Incredible views.Glad we took the time (pretty nice gift shop, too)

A bridge too far. London is always one of my favourite capitals to visit but this time round we visited Tower Bridge. What a marvel! The structure and framework, along with the golden crowned topped ends of the bridge are a must see. It makes the journey across it to the Shard, all the more, extra special .
It's a bridge next to a tower..hence the name. One of the most iconic images of London. Go and see a bridge that defines a city's image. It is something you need to see

Glad we had our passes . My Mum and I visited on a day that we had a London Pass and therefore free entry to a lot of attractions. We tried to get round as many in 24 hours as we could. I have to say not sure I would have paid the asking price for what you get. It is very interesting to see the history and machinery but that's all there is to it.

FABULOUS DRAWBRIDGE!!!!. REMEMBER you can check the original hydraulic machanism with water (nowadays It works with oil). The Bridge can support more than 2000 tons! An icon of London ......without religious overtones.

A view from the top.. Great views thou the newly installed glass floors. Sadly the view from the south walkway was only half available as one of the glass floor panel had a crack in it there fore it was closed off.It was busy but there was plenty of room to move around and see out of the windows. Once you get up there their is no time limit so you can take you time looking around at all the information panel that are about and the amazing views out of all the windows.

Tower Bridge Beauty!. This is a must see London attraction. Step inside the most famous bridge in the world to explore it's iconic structure, spectacular views, modern exhibitions and magnificent Victorian Engine rooms. There is a glass floor across the high-level Walkways - the most significant development to the Exhibition since it opened in the 1980's. This is stop #19 on the Big Bus Sightseeing tour bus. Adults £9.00 Children (aged 5-15) £3.90 Students (with identification) £6.30 Seniors (aged 60 +) £6.30 1 Adult & 2 Children £14.10 2 Adults & 1 Child £18.00 2 Adults & 2 Children £20.30 2 Adults & 3 / 4 Children £22.50 Under 5 FREE Disabled/Carer FREE Group admission prices (10 or more)  Adults £7.65 Students (with identification) £5.65 Seniors (aged 60+) £5.65 Children (aged 5-15) £3.40 Special Offer: UK primary schools are entitled to 1 adult FREE with every 10 children.

Don't just go up top, go down into the engine room!. This is a must tour if you are a person (probably middle aged guys! Hey, we are what we are!) that loves victorian machinery, industrial art and stretching the limit of engineering for its time. Do the tour, you won't be disappointed and make sure you take a good long tour through the engine room, so the guys can drool over the immaculately kept mechanism for opening and closing the bridge. If you have kids, take the older ones through this. they won't believe the decoration of the industrial machinery. Yes, I am a junky for this stuff, with a long suffering wife!

Great views and experience. Despite not being very keen on heights was keen to visit to experience the new glass walkway. The organisation outside wasn't great and a bit of an unorganised scrum to get in but once inside was fine. We decided to avoid the queues for the lift and walked the 200 stairs up instead which actually did feel too bad. The walkways are great, don't feel too high up and give excellent views of the river and beyond. Nice that they have small windows you can open to talk better photos. The exhibitions about the bridge and other famous bridges are really interesting and informative. The best bit is the glass walkway which is great to watch the people and boats below from, really don't feel that high but still leave it to the kids to sit on the glass! We finished by visiting the engine room which was also really well done and very interesting. All in all really enjoyed the trip and would highly recommend to others.

Tower Bridge Tour. Tower Bridge itself is really beautiful and a must-see for all who comes to London. But as far as the tour to the towers is concerned, there are better places to see a great view, such as for example The Monument. There is an exhibition about the history of the bridge, also showing some other bridges.

Lunch, with a view . Very excited we crossed Tower Bridge, by bus. As being disabled, wouldn't have made the walk across. Beautiful day, and scenery fantastic. Before our bus journey over the tower bridge, we ate lunch, just down from London Bridge, looking at HMS Belfast, and Tower Bridge. Beautiful meal and view. At Cote Brassiere. £ 35, food was delicious, and great service.
The best bridge in the world. We regular visit London and tower bridge is one of our favourite attractions! it is a must see for tourists in and outside the uk. Simply the best!

Walking across the history of London. Tower Bridge is one of the most recognised Iconic places in London, it has a draw that pulls people back every time they visit. if you combine a trip to the Tower Bridge Experience with it going up for a ship, you have a chance to do something many Londoners never have seen. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable on the history of the structure, the displays and films make the visit worth while. The new glass floor either has you looking down in wonder or making the walk across the bridge a fear you will retell to others.

Best place to visit once in a life time. It was in the month of September, 2014 and I was planning to travel somewhere overseas to spend some wonderful moments with my better half. And we finally choose
London because it was there in our bucket list wish and we had the most memorial time
of our life.

iconic landmark of London. Just seeing the bridge is breathtaking enough! Walking the length of it makes you feel small with the tall structures above you.We always come here when we are in London (and that is quite a few times in the past few years!). One of the times was when there was an exhibition on the history of the bridge.It was an excellent exhibition and also included views from the walkway at the top of the bridge.Check out what is on at the time when you visit. If possible, make an effort to go up (via a lift).

Surprised by how nice this was. We visited the walkways and engine rooms. The entrance was crowded and not particularly well organised but once past security we didn't wait for the lift we took the stairs. Not crowded and not that many steps. Plenty of little places to pause if you need to. Once in the walkways the view is great and there are films and facts dotted about to look at. The glass floor isn't the whole way through which is actually a good thing because it's quite a weird feeling. There are a couple of sections in each walkway. Engine rooms are worth a visit, amazing old tools and engines themselves.

Tower Bridge Exhibition is actually a working museum. Book online as the queues are long in summer. Quite a few stairs to negotiate to get to the top, and thus the views, however the stairs can be tackled at your own pace as they are wide enough for others to pass. The entire exhibition is a highly informative museum really, albeit a working one as the bridge still carries traffic and opens regularly to allow shipping to pass. The views are very nice from the top, and the glass floor is an amazing experience (see if you can walk on it without feeling just a little uneasy). One tip - note what time the bridge opens to allow shipping through and get your position at the glass floor early - people will not move to let you look! After that be sure to visit the engine room so see examples of Victorian engineering at its best.
Iconic bridge. The bridge includes a walk-thorugh gallery, moving boat passage and iconic design. Check the gate opening times
Beauty. One of the best view, at 2:00 am at night, the view is just undescribable.very clean bridge no doubt.

Very interesting . Had a brief visit to London before theatre so planned to walk along the south bank and see what we could. Popped into the London bridge museum good value at only £9 each compared to other London rip offs!!!! Glass floor is a little unnerving though

Great to see . Came here while visiting London Wow what an experience The glass floor proved a favourite with my husband however I'm more of a wimp and didn't enjoy it however you can walk down the side of it so it's not too bad but worth a visit

Steeped in history. This was peak season so was busy. Queues flowed quite well. You got the usual cheeky tourist who tried to jump the queue but they were swiftly put in their place by a few visitors. The jewels alone are worth seeing. Interesting stories. Maybe lacked interactive activities for children, hence my 3 star review. Probably wouldn't go back again but worth a visit.
Very nice view from london bridge. Awesome place to be and had good time with friends.we enjoyed the weather and nice food at indian restaurant and also visited palace while we were on the way
Don't drive over it Walk!. It has to be done. The walk is great. The atmosphere fab. A great London Icon. Just do it! Don't forget your selfies stick.

Beautiful Area. I go to London almost every month, and I love visiting Tower Hill area when it'd good weather. A lovely area to sit outside the Tower of London and see the view. Also lots of good eating venues nearby.

''Tower above the rest ''. This has got to be one of the best place to visit if your in london !! amazing views from the top , and now has glass ceiling :) please go if your in town . we've visited several times
highly recommend

London Bridge- a unique feature. It is one of the best spot that myself and my wife witnessed. At a point of time in the night it is opened to allow the ships to pass by the Thames River. It is so beautifully illuminated which is to be believed to be experienced.

A bit out of place. Great bridge, although we felt that it was very different to the other bridges in London. It didn't quite fit in with the surrounds. I'm still in two minds as to if I think it fits the rest of the river.

Historical Structure with disappointing views.. Old historical bridge but the view was disappointing. The best part, you can actually feel the bridge sway.
@instabuilt

The most beautiful bridge in London. Not much of a review as we were taking shots of the bridge from the Tower of London and the banks of the Thames and didn’t go to the exhibition. We also walked across it. The best place to get photos of Tower Bridge is from a boat on the Thames. The River Clippers are excellent.

Nice Happening Place. Well, it is almost like face of London, and rightfully so. Take tube to London bridge to go there, and I would suggest before start your awesome walk from London Bridge to Tower Bridge, visit Borough Market. very nice food market.

Iconic London Land Mark. This has to be a "must see" land mark attraction for any Visitor to London. Day or Night it is of interest to young & old both from an architectural and engineering point of view. Added attractions include the Glass floor and if you're really lucky the bridge being raised for river traffic.
tower bridge. The bridge at night is an amazing sight when its all lite up.good views down the thames.the glass bridge is fun well worth a look.

A MUST see.. Everyone knows about this bridge, so we took the tour which was really amazing. To see how it was built and see the giant Victorian boilers and engines used to lift the bridge was fantastic. Then to stand on the glass floor and look down on tiny people,car etc offers a great photo opportunity. Sit on the glass and have you picture taken. It looks like you are sitting in mid air. It is a steady walk up ,but you can get the lift. Toilets at midway points.
Tower Bridge. One of the big tourist attractions is the tower bridge. It´s only one of many bridges over the river Thames, but it ´s the most beautiful one, with it´s two towers at the side.

A must while in London. Easily one of the more iconic images of London, I love visiting Tower Bridge every time I am in London. Such a gorgeous sight. Not to mention it makes for some amazing photos. While you are there, be sure and take in the Tower of London.

Free - must be good. We walk across it both ways - many photo opportunities. You can go up the top for £9.We enjoyed walking along the bottom as were many others.You can see all the iconic buildings around the Thames.

One of the most beautiful bridges. It is beautiful during the day and even more beautiful by night. It is a very interesting engineering work and an ex-libris of London that you should visit if you are there for the first time. hen, when going back, I like to watch it at night. It gives me the feeling of being in London again.

The most famous Bridge in the World.. A must see Tour of The London Tower Bridge Exhibition.The Bridge was designed by Sir Horace Jones and it was opened on June 30, in 1894.The magnificent Bridge is 65 m in height .Enjoy the spectacular views of London and The River Thames from 42 metres looking through the glass walk way platforms and glass floors.You also get to see the Victorian workings of the Engine Room and watch movies that show a full history of the Bridge.There is also a great Gift Shop . We just had to bring back our own painting of the Bridge which we had framed that is now proudly hanging on our wall.You can buy tickets on line at a discount price to avoid being in a long Que. waiting on the day of your visit. We purchased a London Pass before we left for London so that helped reduce the cost also we didn't need to Que. at all.The Address is Tower Bridge Rd, London SE1 2 UP United Kingdom.As from May this year we can now say we have climbed it , walked across it then sailed through it.Enjoy your visit it's great for all ages as there is a huge lift.Whilst we were there we saw the bridge allow a tall sail sailing ship pass through. It was the high light of our tour.
The Tower Bridge Exhibition. The Tower Bridge Experience is well worth doing, lots of information and exhibits. Loved the glass floor over the top balconies.

You need to be OK to walk on a glass floor here!. Just visited again for the first time since 1982 when it had just opened and it has changed from somewhere to visit to a tourist attraction.The main element is walking over the upper bridges & the views, especially of the Tower of London, otherwise there is not a lot inside to see other than the wonderful structure. The special element is the glass floors on the walkways, that you have to cross over, that add that little extra.I found the staff quite friendly for such an attraction too.When you then exit & walk down to the engine room, there is a lift hidden behind the tower that is not marked on the left. Look out for it if you have a buggy.Down in the engine rooms you can see the old steam engines. They reminded me that I need to visit Kew Pumping station on a steaming day to see these engines in action!
Looks great at night. . Well worth a walk and tube to see at night. Nice to watch it lifting to let sail boats through. The architecture around it is anazing too.

Engineering Tour worth your time and money. A regular visit to the Tower Bridge is a must for any tourist. But if you are looking for something a little more in-depth, try to book one of the Engineering Tours. This tour is 2 hours long and not cheap (50 pounds) but it takes you to places most people never see: the bridge control room, the machinery room and - most impressively - the immense bascule chambers. The tours book up REALLY quickly. There is only one tour per day with a limit of 12 people and only during specific months (November to March, I think). If you can't get on this tour, the bridge is still worth a visit . . . but if you are planning your trip well in advance and you have an interest in the engineering aspect of this London landmark, this tour is amazing.

Best bridge in London.. This is a lot of fun and exciting. Kids will love the different displays and the views way up high. The glass floor on the pedestrian bridges at the top are exciting. Don't skip the quick movies at each end and be sure to go through the engine room. There are a lot of stairs to climb but there is an elevator if you wait.

A must-see of London!. As one of the biggest elements of London - I had to see this bridge. It was really neat to see in person and is huge! Great for shutterbugs to snap photos of and definitely makes a nice long walk to visit.
Absolute must . Probably the least expensive sight and one of the best We ran up the 42meter stairs..nearly died. The glass floor are awesome Book online and get it even cheaper

Great stuff. As part of our coach trip we had a guided tour of the bridge, it's engine room and the walk ways at the top. Our guide Danielle was knowledgeable and helpful. My mum has walking difficulties so she sorted the tour at the end to avoid stairs. We used the lift and she led us back to the start. There's quite a bit of walking involved but it's worth it. The short films help you to understand the mechanism and the history. The views are the high light - all directions and even down onto the river from the glass walkway.

Great History & Tour. Had a great tour of the Tower Bridge.The history is explained in an interesting way and the highlight is walking over the glass walkway above the normal bridge level.The mechanical workings of the bridge were very well explained all parts of the tour were very professionally organised.Would recommend for visitors to London

The bridge is great, the exhibition less. I'm giving only 3 stars for the "getting inside" thing. Obviously, the bridge is magnificient from outside and that is a must-see ! But when it comes to going at the top, that is not as great as I expected. The view is really nice, and seeing the architecture is interesting. But I found it a little bit overpriced.

attraction that you could not leave away. this is one of london landmark. go there is not only about the bridge but surround. beside the big ben, the parliament, this is one of place that you shoud visit.

great bridge to look at or to take time over..... I wish I took more time to take in the views from this bridge as it is pretty unusual in the UK and iconic. It makes for an easy cycle ride across. and from memory the museum (visiting many years ago was unusual and interesting too, but please see other reviews for specifics on the museum)

So Fun to Walk Across an Icon!. Be sure not to confuse the London Bridge with the Tower Bridge. The London bridge looks like any other bridge. The Tower Bridge is the iconic one we all think about and want to visit. We booked online the self guided tour which included the glass walkway and the old engine rooms. My husband was more fascinated with the engine room than I was but I'm glad I got to see it (perhaps just for not as long!) The booking was for anytime that day and that worked very well for us. It was raining the day we were there (not that unlikely of course) so our view was diminished but still worthy. There are two glass portions on the upper walkway and are fun to look down through. Most people however did not choose to walk across them, instead skirted around the sides! Ha! They are quite safe, but something unnerving about standing on it! I can see this area getting very crowed so if you get a sunny day, I'd be there at opening to try to reduce the crowd. We are glad we experienced it!
Iconic Bridge. . Right by the Tower of London, this bridge is the most iconic in the capital. You can even go up inside it if you wish. A must see in London.
Informative tour. In high season you fear lines. Even though there was one it went very smooth. We came around 11. The exhibition is great and informative and not crowded.

Iconic. This bridge is beautiful to look at from any side of the Thames or over under it walking upon it. I found the best views from a distance was from the tower of London. Then it is a must to walk over, if you need to use walking aids or wheelchair it can make the distance to get to it a little further as you will need to walk up the side street rather than go up the stairs.
Worth a look. Nice bit of English history with the old and the new areas right alongside each other. The ticketing area for tours is very poorly designed and getting in is a real hassle.

Terrific Tower Bridge. Tower Bridge is not only stunning in appearance but is also a working bridge built 1886–1894. A combined bascule and suspension bridge crossing the busy River Thames.Many ways to tackle this attraction, just taking a walk over the bridge offers fantastic views over the London Town, take time to watch the busy river and the might of the current. If you're feeling adventurous walk the glass floor and visit the engine rooms tour but for this there is a charge.
Wonderful Views.. If you go to London, this is a must.What amazing views over the Thames. We also did a trip up the Thames.Most enjoyable.

Love this HISTORY and EXHIBITS , and this TOWER BRIDGE looks so beautiful too !! . London without visiting TOWER BRIDGE is definitely insane !! Tower Bridge is one of the icon of London with all the history and some museum for Queen's jewellery . Visit this place, join the tour and walk yourself, feel the bridge, and feel the breeze from here, I was here on July, and the weather was soooo perfect !! Love every bit of it !!!! And beside tower bridge , you will see tower of London, if you love history, check it out inside, very entertaining too ...
My favorite Bridge. It is better to view from either side of the river than walk along. Much better perspective from the Tower of London. very beautiful bridge. Worth a walk to go and see.

Brigde. When I was on this brigde, me and my BFF, started to sing Fergie's song about this one.I didn'd had the chance to see the boats passing through and the brigde lift, but it's an amazing construction, for sure...
Nice place. Tower Bridge is one of the most sees in London, we did see it from the Tower. One of the good things about this sight is it is free to see.
intresting . in the tour inside the bridge is really interesting, they tell all the history of the construction and how it used to work and the view is nice and it's a worthy visit

Good value.. Booked online as a last minute trip its not a very long day so ideal for children. Very interesting lots of information and the glass floors are brilliant addition lifts available if you don't fancy the stairs or have mobility issues.Do book on line and print your tickets if you can because you can jump the queue.
Great spot. Great spot to stop and look over the city and the Thames. We had some snacks with us so we could slow down and rest on our walk over.
Walking on glass. We especially loved the glassed floor walkway. What a highlight! Be sure to sit or lie down on the floor for an awesome photo opportunity.

Great historical bridge and exhibit. If your at the Tower of London, you should swing by this exhibit which is literally next door. Fascinating history and interesting story how the bridge was built. The glass floor is both exciting and scary when your looking at the Thames below you! The exhibit was stroller accessible via elevator and the views of London from the Bridge were great. This is a London Pass attraction so is you have one, at least give yourself an hour there.

Walk the bridge. Not just a photo.. This was a fantastic tour. We were able to walk the span and have the most spectacular view of London. There is a see through floor that looks down on the road. The mechanisms of the bridge are explained in great detail. I'd suggest you go as early as possible as the entrance is very small and tickets and security share the same space. This makes it very crowded and slows down the numbers that can get in. London Pass applies here but because of the crowd numbers were couldn't be fast tracked.

Spectacular and ornate. We walked across and back at street level and looked up at the glass walkway. Great views left, right and upwards at the bridge structure. While we were sitting at More London we watched it open and close to let a boat through. One of the iconic London landmarks. Worth a look.
Great ! - my 3 year old loved it. Visited this and my 3 year old really enjoyed its a shame your have to que for so long but well worth a visit for what it costs !

Well worth a visit!. I did not go up to the top walk, but just being there at the magnificent bridge on a busy sunny day was a great experience.It is of course a big tourist attraction and very crowded on a good day but it is such an icon in London and so good to see. Walk down the side to Shad Thames and the charming cobbled streets of this reclaimed Victorian Warehouse area....also recommend the Design Museum at the end of the walk

"Listen, the Tower Bridge has the towers and is not the London Bridge, lol ". Okay, I must admit I was a bit disappointed and perplexed why the London Bridge did not look like the Bridge I had seen in movies, pictures and travel magazines. Then I discovered that what I was looking at was not the Tower Bridge. Oh, the Tower Bridge, that's what I want to walk across,not the London Bridge.It's funny now looking back on this experience. I mean I don't know how many times as a kid I've sang the song " London Bridge is falling down" while holding up a picture of the Tower Bridge.Well I actually learned a lot that day. Which bridge is which, the history of the bridges, and that you could actually take a tour inside the Tower Bridge. The Tower Bridge is fascinating, and if you get a chance to be in or around it when it opens, all the more better.
Amazing views. Went for a walk with the husband lighting brilliant very well done ! Amazing architecture and feat of engineering.

Nice all around. The Tower Bridge is a visit that you must take while in London, and not just passing by it or through it. The exhibition on top is fantastic and it shows you not only about the Tower Bridge history, but also on the other famous bridges around the world.The skywalk is fantastic, though it may be a bit frightening in the beginning! ;)The tour finishes with a visit to the machinery that makes the bridge operate and the shop at the end is great!Totally worth it!The tip is to try and time your visit to one of the many openings of the bridge every day, so that you may be on top when it happens and view it through the skywalk! ;)

Excellent quirky attraction. Visited with my 2 kids both of whom loved the trip out. Was busy but not a problem. Thoughtfully laid out and a the glass floor really did make everyone nervous when first encountered. Littlest spent 30 mins on train home doing the passport and stickers he'd collected.
London Bridge. Another of Londons iconic masterpieces. Interesting to watch the bridge open. The best view is from a boat ride on the Thames.
A landmark must. With it being such and iconic symbol of London, its a must for any visit in the area, walk across and enjoy the magnificent bridge and its views.
Visit. Very pretty looking bridge. Never been near this before so took a walk over, great view of Belfast and the tower of London.
.. Awesome building to go and see quite fabulous if you do a river cruise and go under it best time about 7pm sunset wicked

A great historical interest. Tower bridge is interesting especially the mechanism of how it works. You can get a real insight into the working and history of the bridge. It's also a great area the south side of the river has some great restaurants you can walk along the river bank and see some more of Londons great History. The Golden Hinde ship and the old Clink prison are in walking distance and a little further along you can see the globe theatre which is a replica of Shakespeare's original theatre

Surreal!. You know you are in London when you see Tower Bridge.Being able to go in and walk across the bridge is also something everyone should experience. It's not just a landmark but now a great part of history.

Must See!. Wonderful from start to finish! Short line to enter and bag check. You can take the elevator but I recommend taking the stairs up if you are physically able so you can get a feel for how old and magnificent the bridge itself is. There is a short film you can watch that provides information on the making of the bridge. It has amazing views overlooking the River Thames. The glass floors are so cool, especially when a boat is passing under. They have a timetable of when the bridge will be raised as well and great information on bridges all over the world.If you have kids, ask for a passport and collect the different sets of stickers :) There are 4 sets in all.
Go...walk over and back... . We didn't go on top to walk, as my husband isn't happy with heights, but you can walk the top. Just so.....London. there is a walk along the Thames.
Well worth a visit. Interesting exhibition. Great videos to explain how it works. Superb view. Particularly good if you time the visit when the bridge opens and watch from above from the glass floor.

Craftsmanship at it's best!. This is a 'must see' whilst in London. Fascinating history and craftsmanship at its best. The glass walkway was awesome.
We bought a few items from the shop after and were surprised by how reasonable the prices were in general.
We bought a family of 4 ticket for Tower Bridge and The Monument for £24.90- a bargain for 2 attractions.
Incredible bridge! . A must see in London especially if you visit the Tower of London. Take some time to view the bridge, the river and surrounding buildings.

The worlds most famous bridge!. I have not been to the top of Tower Bridge since they installed the glass walkway so I decided another visit was due and this time with my seven year old daughter. We brought tickets online a few weeks before we visited London which turned out to be a great idea as we flew past the ticketless visitors queuing and made our way straight to the top of the bridge.Once at the top, there are video's and displays on the history, design and construction of Tower Bridge as well as fascinating historical photographs and interactive screens. There are great views of London from the top looking down the Thames and the new glass walkways are a great addition, if not a little unnerving! My daughter loved them though and wasted no time lying down on them for a floating photo opportunity! The pumping rooms are also great and offer lots of information and the whole experience is self-guided so you are free to take as long as you want. There is a children's activity book which is given out free where they collect stickers throughout the exhibition which added to the fun and sense of adventure for my daughter.A nice little exhibition at a very reasonable price. I would recommend this for all ages although be careful if you are not great with heights! We timed our visit around the time a sailing barge was due to sail under the bridge so we got to see the bridge lifted just before we went in. Try and time your visit to coincide with the bridge lifting to get the full experience.
Love this :). The first thing I think about London is Tower Bridge :) It was always my dream to visit London! It was just like a picture what I dreamed!

What an iconic place. . This can never fail. The bridge has been beautifully maintained. It's a real symbol of London and should not be missed. To stand below it and imagine the history of the whole area is to feel steeped in ancient times and the stories therein. You simply must take this sight in as no visit to the capital is complete without it.

a must for tourists. My girls aged 7 & 10 loved the tower bridge experience. It isn't very expensive 12/14£ for the three of us - there's not much to do to be fair! But still they loved the video you watch at the top , the walk along the glass floors on both sides of the top of bridge and the engine room. we also somehow timed it without planning to see the bridge lift up to let a passing ship through - they really liked that too! Then there was the kids sticker book to complete along the way :) If you don't like heights you'll feel as sick as I did watching the kids jumping and lying on the glass floor above the Thames and the main road over the bridge! Lift or 200+ stairs to climb your choice!
Spooky stories to tell. I went on a ghost walk that took me to Tower Bridge and found out some interesting stories and facts about the bridge. A delightful sight in London!

Tower Bridge Experience - Glass Floor. Very interesting exhibition which cost the family 20 pound (2 adults, 2 kids). The movie on the building history was great and easy to understand for the children. The highlight was definitely the glass floor. The engine room is probably more suited for men but still interesting.

Smile, you can just look down on people!. Great place to take the teenagers and get a good view of the Thames.If you are coming from outside London look out for the offers on the railways with discounted entry. Don't forget your camera !

Amazing views - exhibition less impressive!. It's obviously a treat to be able to go in to any such historic landmark so you feel privileged to be walking across Tower Bridge. The exhibition was a let down however I suspect most people go for the view and history of the bridge which is well explained. I guess the exhibitions are used to generate more income however I don't think it's needed as it doesn't add value.The windows open to allow for better photography which is also a smart idea!Would recommend if you have an hour or so spare as would be just as good in the rain as a sunny day
Nice but overcrowded. This place is nice but it's so full of tourists from Asia with selfie sticks that it's sometimes difficult to pass through it.

Part Of LOndon. This is an obvious must see for any tourist who come to London. The history behind the bridge is fascinating and it is quite beautiful as well/ Worthy of a visit and either walk across or drive across, both are different experiences. Also a good idea to visit it both at night and during the day so you can get a feel of the way it changes .

A top site to see. Very cool to see. I recomend a guided tour of the area, especially if you have never been there before. You will get much more insight into the history, and see many cool things in association with the bridge.

A bargain compared to the shard and eye.. Second time we have been over tower bridge, came back to see the glass walkway. Managed to time it for a bridge lift which was good to see and staff talked us through what was happening below.
iconic. drove across it in a double decker bus on a tour, saw it from the water, and biked across it lit up at night. iconic London sight, can't miss.

A special piece of London.. We visited the bridge a couple of times for pictures. If you have time go on a clear day and also at night. This my favorite spots for pictures in London. From every angle and direction you have a beautiful back drop. Take some time stop and view the Thames and be in no hurry.

London landmark. The bridge is beautiful and is a London landmark. It was easy to walk to and walk on. You can go up in the tower but when we were there in July the waiting area looked so hot and the windows had steam on them and people were fanning themselves. Also I don't know if it would be worth it because you look down at the water and it is dirty brown and you see all the boats you would see walking the bridge.

You have to do the glass floor!. Just walking over it and walking over the glass floor was worth it. They also have a list of all the historic bridges in the world posted as you walk through. I did feel like the pushy crowd to watch the bridge go up and down was a little overrated. The bridge is beautiful and is a must if you're in London. I recommend setting aside at least an hour to complete it.

Excellent attraction. This is one of those attractions where the cost is worth trip. If you are at Tower of London, then this is just a hop and a skip to the attraction. We purchased our tickets online and were allowed to go right into the attraction.Be forewarned. We were told that the stairs are faster than the elevator, so we took them. Little did we understand that you had over 14 flights of stairs and my wife was very tired by the time we got to the top.The attraction starts with a video via Harry Potter style about the history of the bridge. It is done very well and worth watching. You then enter the walkway between the towers and can see up and down the river. The walkway also has a clear floor towards the middle so you can see down to the water and street below. You will then enter the other tower and can cross over to the other walkway or go down the tower and exit out.

Great value for money.... A wonderful insight into "what the Victorians did for us" - humbling in many ways! The engine rooms were of particular interest to my engineer husband. I liked the walkway and the "world of bridges" boards along these walkways.It was, if I am totally honest, a little dry for me - but - it is certainly worth the visit and represents excellent value for money.

Fun experience though not for the faint-hearted :). We went to see the Tower Bridge Exhibition with the new glass floor walkway and were totally thrilled by the experience! We were lucky enough to see the bridge raised right under our feet, so cool! If you'd rather not look through the glass floor there's also a great view of the London skyline including the Shard, London municipality, Gherkin, HMS Belfast, Tower of London and other landmarks. The ticket includes also a visit to the impressive Victorian Engine Rooms which instantly inspired me to write a Steampunk novel, well.. almost. :)

Thoroughly recommended. My children were immediately engaged by the video of the history of the bridge. Video doesn't really do it justice as it's a whole wall with three characters interacting with each other. My son had to firmly grip my hand as we walked over the glass part and looked/waved down at the people below. I also liked the facts about other bridges around the world - nice touch. Plenty here also for the parents and engineers as the inner workings of this bascule bridge are explained. Well worth a visit, I have no idea why I have only recently heard about it. Almost a tourists hidden secret.

The best in London. both views from the bridge and of the bridge from the quay side/park is very picturesque. Luckily during the time of our visit , it was nice and sunny so we could spend sometime at the quay side admiring the views of the bridge. must see place during the visit to London.

Tower Bridge, London . I visited the bridge on my own while my wife and kids went off to Madam Tussauds. The trip around the bridge doesn't take too long - you go up one tower (on the north side of the river) and watch a short movie of how the bridge came to be constructed, then work your way across the top of the bridge and down in the south tower. The video was OK for me as a native English speaker but I think a number of foreign tourists who were watching at the time found it difficult to follow - the acoustics are not great and the voices of the victorian characters in the film are not especially clear. The highlight is the walk across the top of the bridge to the other tower over the partly glass floor which really striking but not great for those with vertigo I suppose!When I was there a large sailing barge was passing through so they lifted the bridge to let it through. Great to see that from the elevated view above through the glass floor. Apparently the same boat passes through several times a day so worth getting the times right to suit. The important thing too is to go on after you've come down from the second tower to the engine/pump room. You follow a blue line on the pavement after the exit from the tower along the street and down some steps to the reconstructed pump room. The mechanism of the bridge workings is explained really well here and the old steam pumps that powered the bridge are still there and working (though not connected up to the bridge anymore). Definitely worth going to this part of the museum - I noticed a number of people coming out of the tower and simply walking off - they missed the most interesting part!Definitely worth the trip - it's such an iconic landmark in London.

Great views of London. Not everyone would consider visiting a bridge to be a great day out; neither did I till I got there. After buying your ticket, you take the lift to the viewing platforms at the top (or take the stairs up if preferred), and there you get unusual views of London. Of course, you are right above the River Thames, so you get a great view of the river boats, and the buildings along the riverbanks. But due to the two areas of glass floor, you also get a birds eye view of the road traffic across the bridge, and everyone with cameras was going wild. It is an unusual angle to take photos of the classic red London buses, but they come out really well. You don't have to walk across the glass floor, as you can walk around it, but it was surprising how many people summoned up the courage to try it. Best of all though, was a really interesting exhibition about the world's other iconic bridges, plus some lesser known bridges which are exceptional for some reason. Old bridges, new bridges, historic or brand new, there were interesting stories about all of them. Most people walk down the stairs at the other end, though a small lift allows a short cut down, and this is where you follow the blue line on the pavement to take you to the engine rooms. There are toilets (yes, inside the bridge structure!) and a gift shop (next to engine rooms), and although no cafe there are dozens nearby, and we would recommend St Katherine's Dock, just a three minute walk away, for sheer choice of restaurants. All in all, a great few hours in London with great views.

The pride of London . Tower Bridge is a unique Landmark of London in its great architecture and history, the engine room was amazing as it shows how complicated is the working principles of the Bridge.At the top of the bridge you can enjoy stunning views of the city.Definitely it's a must see attraction.
