Magnificent. I really loved the bridge structure. It was very enormous and beautiful, especially at night time you are able to see the light around it

Walked over and loved it. My husband and I walked over the bridge. It's truly a beautiful and iconic structure. Used by Londoners in their daily commute, it's a busy one. Fantastic to see it rise, as well!

Excellent Tour of Beautiful Landmark. The tour with walkways and engine room takes about 90 minutes. There are plenty of information boards long the way detailing the bridge mechanisms, the sights and the engineering. A little more interactive activity for younger children would improve their understanding - but the glass walkways and seeing the bridge open are all quite spectacular. (Bridge opening times on website.) Walkways are enclosed. It is all very safe - but some views compromised by cables and girders. Just as well they are there - and that's what the tour is about.

Well worth the money. This is not an attraction that takes hours to do but well worth the money. Family of five cost £23 which I thought was value for money compared to most attractions in London. The view was great and the glass floor was a great feature taking a while to get use to it. It was really good to see the bridge up close.

You can pop down to St. Katherine's warf which is magical..lots of restaurants, boats, really nice little marina. Worth a visit. Take a walk along Tower Bridge to Hays Galleria as so beautiful or pop across the road to the London Dungeons. One of the best experiences in London and worth the money.
Wow. I can't believe that I actually eventually visited this amazing site. The bridge is well worth the visit.I would encourage anyone travelling to London to visit this site.
Glass Walkway. Brilliant for an hours excursion , the glass walkway is great fun and very little queues , this is an expensive tour and a fantastic experience for all , good value for money

Wonderful views . First time of visiting and it was great! Lot of steps 206 in fact but well worth the climb as the views are amazing but the best bit is the glass floor! It's a bit unnerving seeing the river and traffic flowing beneath your feet! Definitely recommend it.Witchjackie

My wife decided that it would be good for us to take the stairs, which was nice of her.The best bit is the glass floor - there are glass floors in both the walkways so don't waste time waiting at the first one for a space. wow. it was the most beautiful bridge, i had ever seen.... this bridge is sooo hudge, amazing, and now i really understand why it is on magazines.. :))

Beautiful views, very informative. An attraction id recommend to everyone! With our without children, i went in december just me and my other half but id definitely take my little girl in a papoose! No pushchair.The views from the top and the glass floor are amazing!! Definitely a must try!

Amazing. Outstanding bridge on the Thames, beautiful, interesting for everyone. Take a break and walk to one of the symbols of London city. Easy to reach. Recommended👍👍
Wonderful Engineering. This is a wonderful structure. We were very fortunate to see the bridge open and c;lose to allow a sailboat to pass through.
Another must see. Tower Bridge is another must see, as it is next to the Tower of London, easy to include in both in one visit. Just to walk over and admire the towers and wonder at the way it works.

Must see. An absolutely musts see!, so impressiv, combined with tower of London! Spectacular, amazing bridge!!

By day it offers great views and by night a different London. Open to the public by day Tower Bridge offers you an insight into Victorian engineering at its very best , a great place for young people to become interested in structures , steam power and a golden age for GB. Why was it built ? A huge challenge faced the City of London Corporation – how to build a bridge downstream from London Bridge without disrupting river traffic activities. A special committee formed in 1876 opened the design for the new crossing to public competition. Over 50 designs were submitted for consideration, many of which are on display at Tower Bridge Exhibition. It wasn’t until October 1884 however, that Horace Jones, the City Architect, in collaboration with John Wolfe Barry, provided the final design. Go on line to see the History of Tower Bridge . If you ever get the chance hold a party on one of the walk ways- just do it . At night the road and river traffic takes on a fascinating detail and looking into the Tower of London offers a totally different aspect . The addition of the glass walkways again makes your visit memorable.

Somewhere different, glass floors great.. Reasonable entry fee. Inevitable queues. The children loved the glass floors, but little else to interest them. Great views. Lots of stairs to walk down at the end. Probably could have got a lift but too late once we had started walking down.
Amazing at night. Excellant to walk over in the evening as the lights of the city come on and it is a bit quieter and more atmospheric.

Wonderful views. We walked over Tower Bridge this week. It was a haven for tourists from every corner of the world! We were walking from A to B but what I would say is that it's a fab place to take in the views of The Thames and the city that surrounds it. Great photo opportunity, lots of history.
excellent. Coming to London for the first time this was one attraction I wanted to see. It is a good attraction as me and my boyfriend walk up southwark along the thames river.
Very beautiful bridge and country . Visited London for the first time. One of my favourite bridges in the world. We had a lovely time looking at Tower Hill and dining near by.

Glass floors!. It was really interesting to go up the Tower Bridge, there is an exhibition about the building of the bridge, with videos, but the main attraction is the glass floor high above the bottom of the bridge and the river underneath! It is quite scary and disconcerting at first, quite a few people were stepping around the side of the glass not wanting to step on it. The staff were encouraging, telling us that the glass can support a tonne or something, and informing us that it can't break at all! My kids had some great photos taken of them "flying" above the Thames (actually lying on the glass floor).The engine room at the bottom was really interesting, because you can see the inner workings of the bridge. It was amazing to see the huge machinery, along with the massive spanners too.A really good place to visit - great views and informative too.
Its not just the bridge. On either sides of the river there're amazing places to visit. And watch when a big ship passes the bridge, with your camera ready.

One of my favourite bridges. This bridge is like a toy even when you are just in front of it. Beautiful, Awesome, Historic. I really like this bridge and the area around it. Brilliant and one of the master pieces of London.

Better, and more to it, than you might think. The Tower Bridge has changed, in a good way, quite a bit since my last visit. Some highlights of the paid tour: walking on glass far above the roadway is thrilling/terrifying; a video on the tower's construction (past the end of the first walkway) is worth watching in its entirety; the steam engines which operated the drawbridge are in motion and make it easy to see how they worked; kids enjoy collecting stickers as they progress through the exhibits. Quite a bit better than we expected!
Best brigde ever!!!!. If you find amazing in the morning...wait to see it at night with the lights on...Its a fairy tale bridge and you cant miss visit it. Quite special for me!!!!!

London is not complete without crossing Tower Bridge!. Ok so I got lucky with nice weather on this particular day & I got to walk by water for few miles before crossing the bridge. As I got closer, I realized it is more beautiful than its photos.

Stunning . My god hell of a lot of stairs. But they do have a lift on one side I believe. But when I eventually reached the top. Wow what a view. Tower bridge. Definitely recommended walking over the glass walk way, can take some good photos! I went with my partner, however would also be good as a family outing.

London bridge is falling down, falling down...my fair lady....:). Great piece of architecture, bridge on River Thames...One can walk above the bridge traffic on a transparent platform so that you can see the water and traffic below - which is very exciting...Another iconic place in london

Interesting history tour. At this location you get enough history and engineering lessons to know about the bridge workings and why it was built. Well packaged video exhibition to get a lot of people through at once this time of the year.

Awesome architecture. This is one of the iconic monuments of London. It's well preserved and really cool.They have great tours it you can walk it yourself.Great observation area with a glass floor. It's a must see in London

Experience in the heights of the Tower Bridge.. The experience of seeing the Tower Bridge was fantastic as you can see all from above and learn how it was built. Also, there are educational areas on other bridges in the world and its location. Additionally, there is a glass floor from which you can see the cars passing by the bridge from atop. Important: this is NOT the famous London Bridge mentioned on the old song "London Bridge is falling down" , that bridge no longer exists in london and its parts are now in Phoenix, USA. Tip: check the schedules in the bridge to know when the bridge will be opening its two halves for Boats and Ships to pass by.

One of the World's Great Bridges!. The Tower Bridge (commonly mistaken for the London Bridge) is the result of a design competition and remains as a great piece of 18th Century British engineering and architecture.The bridge opens around 900 times a year, so there is a reasonable chance you will see it in action. I did the 'London Bridge Exhibition' which is essentially a self-guided touring through the inner workings of the bridge. On the tour you will have the opportunity to walk through the upper bridge supports and see through the glass floor onto the road deck below. It's up here that the bridge opening times are also displayed. You also get to go down into the old engine room to see how the bridge was operated up until the 1970's, when electric motors replaced the steam driven units. There are also a couple of short but informative video's along the way that give you a good understanding of the history of the bridge and how the old lifting system worked. Allow 1-2 hours to see the bridge properly. I had a London Pass which gave me express entry and as a result, bypassed the large queue.
"London Iconic". Few days back seen London's iconic place. Each visitor must see this place.Awesome architecture !!!!!!!!!!

NOT the London Bridge ; ). This is definitely a must see in London! You can walk above the bridge traffic on a transparent platform so that you can see the water and traffic below - which is very exciting! In addition, you learn about the history of the bridge. As you walk on the upper portion of the bridge you can view information about many other incredible bridges - engineering miracles - from all over the world.

Really interesting visit as long as you have a head for heights.. This was a really interesting visit and we were lucky enough to see the bridge open right underneath us as we stood on the glass walkway. Take the option to go up the monument to the Great Fire of London too, if you are up for the 311 steps. Great views.

Tower Tops. We stayed near the bridge and it was always a delight crossing over and back even though it is very busy with buses, cars and taxis. It is in very good condition and is a landmark which is a must see while in London.

Fabulous Landmark. The Tower Bridge is spectacular, although sometimes confused with London Bridge, the twin towers standing above the Thames, with the upper bridge between the towers and the lower bridge spanning the Thames. It is a great photo op if you are on a cruise of the Thames, and the photo I have of my wife, daughter, and I with the bridge in the background makes a cherished keepsake.

The Tower Bridge is both famous and a sight to see. The Tower Bridge is the focus of "London Bridges Falling Down" not the bridge named the London Bridge. It is a impressive structure that you can walk across or climb the tower and see the River Thames/London from the plank between the towers.

Beautiful!!. This bridge was amazing! Soo beautiful! The views from the bridge were very pretty but the bridge itself was the main attraction. An absolute "must see" in London!

Stunning!. On a beautiful day... there is no better place to be! There is lots of great cafes, shops and tourist attractions around. Iconic landmark. In our London trip, this was a MUST SEE of course, and we did it!, this iconic landamark is so beautiful, you can see it from very far, but from near is impresive, buses, cars and people can walk from one side to the other one, is a street crossing for pedestrians too, but also, you can take an elevator and walk to a clear floor (glass) amd you can seee people under in the street, is very cool and my daughterand I liked a lot.The nearest Tube station to reach this landmark is: Tower Hill.

A Must See. So iconic they tried to buy it. Very interesting. This is the second time I've done the Tower Bridge experience and enjoyed it as much as the first time

Wonderful views . We originally did not plan to go here thinking it was just another tourist trap. A visit here lasts 1-2 hours depending on how interested you are in the history. One of teh sites you have to see. I am not sure you are convinced that you are in London until you see a few key sites, the Tower Bridge is one of them. Beautiful at night, treat yourself and walk across.
London landmark. Great to see.make sure you find out when the bridge opening,as to see it opening is worth a visit in itself.popular destenation.

Spectacular. Tower Bridge is a spectacular sight especially from the water although walking across the bridge is a very special thing to do. The history surrounding the bridge is fantastic so it really is worth doing some homework about it before visiting!

Take your time to get the most from it. There is a lot to be gained from this visit but it is quite expensive if you just rush through it so consider this if taking children. Tickets are £9.00 but there is a small discount if you pre buy on line. This also allows you to skip the ticket queue once you are inside the entrance hall. The first room is large and has seats and is a bit Disniesque as Queen Victoria and the architect talk to you via a film. This was spoilt a bit by several non English speakers chattering all the way through it. The next two rooms are the high walk ways you can see from outside. These are lined with lots of information to read about famous bridges around the world. There are also lots of facts and figures about the bridge and the alternative designs put forward when it was proposed. These walkways house glass floors which are unnerving to walk on. A tip is to not linger too long on the first one, everyone stops there for photos, wait until you reach the second one, it is less crowded. Then you leave the bridge and walk along to the engine room which shows you how the original bridge was powered. Even for a non scientific person like me, this was really interesting and well explained. The really good part was being outside when the bridge opened. This, of course, costs nothing and you can look up on line to see when it is going to open each day. Usually only about three times a day. Seeing the gates being closed and being part of the hushed crowd was great. London at its best.
Unbelievable. Beautiful! If you have the time, go visit this attraction. Lots to see and do around this area. Our hotel was just down the street. Crossed this bridge a few times, fantastic views.
A must see.. You have to take this in as it is one of the things we all thing of when you think of London. Easy to get to and right next to the tower of London.

Very interesting. The bridge experience was very interesting and the glass floors were so much fun! You can either walk to the top or get the lift up. Lots of interesting information on unique bridges all around the world. Worth a visit if you have extra time up your sleeve!

this is a fun place to visit.. walk on the 'glass' floor~. loved seeing the tower, river, sites of London from the height of the bridge. Also had fun walking on the glass, looking down on the river. It is a beautiful piece of London fun! lots of tourists to mill through, but still worth the visit!

Dull and little information . I first visited about ten years ago which was fantastic. I went with the same expectation and was very disappointed. Very little information about the building, lots of information about other bridges in the world, no information about the other parts of the building like the morgue, or how it was constructed etc apart from a short animation. Save your money and watch it raise free of charge outside.
Brilliant History Lesson. Never knew that Tower Bridge had such an entertaining history. This tour does it justice. And the view from the glass floor is breath-taking.

Cool Exhibition, Amazing Architecture. We visited the Tower Bridge Exhibition with our London Pass, and it was quite an informing experience, not to mention, fun as well! You can learn about its history, all the bridges around the world, and (for the brave ones) walk on a glass panel where you can see the sea and cars rolling by- under your feet. Staff are quite energetic and enthusiastic. The bridge itself is stunning and this is definitely a place for tourists to take photos.

Afraid of heights?. The bridge is iconic and not to be missed. If you are not afraid of heights then include the "Experience". Go up to the top and walk across, beware, the floor is glass and not for the faint of heart! I edged along the side but my daughter walked right down the middle. You get great views up and down the Thames as well.
Glass floors are great. The glass floor experience is nice with great views. Only problem is the dreaded back pack tourists who bang into you all the time!the whole experience is about 20minutes.

Amazing view point. . My teenage son and I took the tour. You can either choose to climb the steps to the top of the bridge or take the easier option in the lift ! Once at the top there are different sections of the bridge showing information videos and display points. The highlight being the two glass walk ways on either side of the bridge. You can spend as long as you like on the bridge. You can walk round both sides of the bridge therefore getting amazing views over London. You can then continue on and go into the engine rooms of the bridge below ground. Well worth a visit for spectacular views of London.

Glass floor pics a must!. This is a site you can go to along with other close by. As with other London attractions everything was organized and pleasant to visit. The lines were short and the staff very polite and helpful. There are different areas to see and at each one you will find videos that will tell you about the bridges history. There is glass floor that is lots of fun and the pictures you can take are amazing. My kids loved it. The little ones receive a "passport" and at each area they will receive a sticker. My teen was amazed by the history and facts available throughout the site. There are places to sit and enjoy the experience. At the end there is a shop where you can buy souvenirs. We enjoyed it very much.

It's a legend. Although may people think this is the London Bridge it is actually the Tower Bridge. The bridge just before this is actually the London Bridge. It is fun to walk across this bridge and you can get a tour if you have purchased the London Pass that makes it free and skip the lines. The engines are of the past and you don't get to see what is used today. Kinda a bummer but still worth the tour.There is a cool acrylic platform that you can walk across and see the bridge traffic below and it feels freaky but a must do.
Beautiful. Totally iconic landmark in London and a must see! Walking up to the bridge and across it was breath taking

Beautiful!. We did not take the tour of the bridge but hope to someday. We were able to drive through the bridge on an open top tour bus (highly recommend) which was a fun experience. If you are looking to take pictures of the bridge, walk along the Thames by the Tower of London for great photo opportunities.

Nice, we went on a cloudy day and liked it. Passing Tower Hill we went to the Tower Bridge. Halfway we decided that we wanted to go up. A family ticket is about 25 pounds which suited our budget.My wife took the elevator up while my sons (11 & 15) and me took the stairs. It was quite a climb but we got there. Not many other people were on the stairs up....to be honest we met no one!Somehow we did manage to get to the top faster than my wife (can only guess that at busy days it will be quite a wait for the elevator). At the top you first can see a short video about building the bridge. If only about 7 to 10 minutes it is a nice film to watch.Moving on you get to the actual bridge (stretching from one side to the other). Also here you can watch a video about the history but the most impressive is the glass floor. Here you can watch downwards to the cars & busses driving on the bridge. If you have fear of heights you will not like this and you might want to pass by the brick part :-).You can walk up and down both sides of the bridge and when you want to exit you normally take the elevator. In our case it was very slow and the woman there led us via the stairs downwards and let us out via a backdoor. After exiting you can go to the Engine room (follow the blue line after exiting) and the giftshop.I must say we spend all in all about an hour and liked it a lot and took several pictures of the scenery and of course downwards through the glass.

Good for tourists. Historically important, it becomes less and less important once you get used to it. So, if you are in London, try to get a bus tour and pass through the Tower Bridge. Then you can start acting like a local.
Just Beautiful. It is simply a beautiful bridge. I have been here a few times, and it's been a different experience every time.

Most Picturesque Bridge. Walking towards the bridge and across it is amazing. There is so much history here that you have to wonder hundreds of years ago what it was like. Very ornate and a must to go over while visiting London (especially for the first time)

Different view. This is an excellent attraction to visit. We have 2 boys in wheelchairs and a lot of attractions are not always accessible however Tower Bridge is fully accessible it is also free which makes it very good. You get unique views of London and the Thames from the high level walkways and the glass floors give added excitement to them. It is informative explaining how the bridge was built and works. All in all a very good way to spend an hour or so.

Affordable attraction and beautiful view!. Educating and wonderful attraction you cannot miss when you're visiting London. The admission price is fairly cheap, especially if you combine your ticket with climbing The Monument a couple of hundreds meters in SW direction. They recently made a glass plates in the upper foot bridges on which you can walk and look down at the road and the water. Brilliant experience. Machine chambers are quite impressive as well.

Amazing work, and in perfect shape for the visit.... London never disappoints. This bridge is a Marvel from outside, and better still when you get inside, with all the original plans in show, the mechanisms, the engines, not to say about the view you get from the top of it. Really worth seeing.

Beautiful!. A lovely bridge, both from far and from a close-up! It's big, it's overwhelming, you never see it enough times! Go see it in the nighttime, the spectacle of lights is very nice. Get your camera ready even when you pass through it, in a Bus Tour or by foot. It looks amazing! There is an exhibiton in the inside, also, but it's true show is on the outside.

WOW!. I seriously squealed when I saw the Tower Bridge while on the Original Sightseeing bus. Our guide built up the excitement by telling us to get our cameras ready to see an icon in between building. And there, there it was! It was the Tower Bridge! This is one of the things I really really wanted to see in London. I am not disappointed at all. It is amazing from afar and amazing while you're walking on it. Amazing! The grey colour, the blue colour. Wow! We didn't get to go up the bridge. I was happy and content with just seeing it and looking at it at different angles. Lots of tourists, but I don't blame them. So iconic! Definitely a must see while in London!

Ok but......... Enjoyed the glass walkway but much prefer the view from other London bridges such as Waterloo or Blackfriars - definitely something you should see if you have a check list of London landmarks but was left slightly underwhelmed

One of the Most Unique Bidges in the World. Tower Bridge is a "must see" if you are in London. It is internationally recognised as a symbolic landmark of London. It looks a bit like a fairy tale castle ! very photogenic. Free to look at from the outside. On the inside there is a visitor attraction centre inside, not cheap but very informative and entertaining. You also get to go inside both towers and across one of the high level walkways that is way above street level. The last two times I have been here I have been lucky to see the bridge open to let taller ships in.
Must see. A brilliant experience so educational and interesting. Queues are long but with a London Pass you bypass the queue.

A lovely spot. This is one of the most beautiful bridges in the world, a must-see attraction and a great way to learn a little about architecture and engineering.
Walking along Tower Bridge can be peaceful exciting or romantic. The Tower Bridge Experience is absolutely worth it.

Beautiful bridge!. Don't you mean London Bridge?! :) Exclaimed the American.
Beautiful bridge, had no idea it was tiffany blue I like! You can walk it or get a great photo-op if you visit the Tower of London. Lots of runners too, how are they running on this cobblestone in shorts/tank in this freezing/damp London weather?!
Picture Perfect Icon for London. We were able to get some nice photos from atop the walls after having just visited the Tower of London. Beautiful piece of engineering.
British engineering marvel. the best of the best place to see in london when one sees this and walks from one corner to other, it makes them to remmeber "london bridge is falling down"

A excellent landmark of London. It is a most beautiful landmark in London. Although it was not a good weather day during my visit, when I saw the bridge that stood over the River Thames with such magnificent and historical outside, it let me totally forgot about the bad weather but just pressed the shutter. That's why I chose it was a most beautiful building in London.Tips: It is more beautiful if you visit at sunset or night-time.

Wow. Every time I see this bridge or cross under or over it, it makes me realise what a magnificent piece of engineering it truly is. To watch it open is a rare treat but fabulous nevertheless. Try the tour of the workings and the inside because it will stop you taking it for granted as most people do.

Pink for the new baby!. Must have taken about a 100 pictures of the bridge from all different angles. The day we were there the royal baby girl had been born and they lit up the bridge pink. What an iconic attraction when visiting London. Do not miss.
Tower Bridge. I have seen this attraction and I think it is the most beautiful attraction in London. Despite a lot of tourists, it was very nice experience.

Cross it. Iconic landmark great building to see up close very impressive, right next to the Tower of London and HMS Belfast a must for budding photographers and great position on the middle of the bridge for some shots of the river.there is a tour you can go on inside the tower but I didn't do it this time round.
The art of engineering!. It is the most beautiful bridge in London city. Get a chance to see it your own. One of the towers has museum. But even outside view is very beautiful.

Very Nice Bridge! Great Engineering and Place to take Pics(From and beneath). Yet another beautiful bridge (Wonderful engineering) along Thames River.. Great views from the bridge and off the road.. Glass bridge part was an awesome addition.. Really Loved the place.. had to see in day light and also in the night.. Take the Thames River Cruise (from (Near London eye)), you could enjoy all the bridges in London.. Book tickets in advance (We used London Pass). They close at 530PM.. so plan accordingly..

A piece of true Victorian London. We got 2 for 1 entry using vouchers from the British rail 2 for 1 web site so cost £9 for the two of us. I have walked over the bridge many times before and enjoyed the strole up the top. We chose to climb the stairs rather than queue for the lift. This we found easier than we imagined and strangely there were toilets available on the way up. The tour starts with a short audio visual presentation about the building of the bridge (English only) then you walk across one of the connecting walkways. These are fully enclosed and have information about other famous bridges around the world. You then get to walk over a glass floor which gives you views of the river and road below. By downloading the app you can see what it looks like as the bridge opens for river boats. If you are lucky or time your visit right you may see the bridge lifting (times on web) but I think watching the bridge open form the river side is best. At the end of this walkway there is another presentation/animation which shows how the bridge was constructed. Don't miss the entrance to the other walkway to your right. This second walkway gives views over central London towards the city. After this you descend back to the road level and walk following the blue line to the end of the bridge where the engine room visit starts. The steam engines are now turned by electricity but have the smell of coal, and oil which used to provide the energy for the bridge. This part of the tour is signed in multiple languages. I really liked this part of the tour. The tour is interesting and views of London can be seen that from any other vantage point cost a lot more. The highlight is the glass floor. I enjoyed the tour and would recommend using a two for one voucher if traveling to London by train.
Loved it. Really great to see all t he workings of the bridge. Little engineers will love it. It was a great view from the top too.

A great morning at Tower Bridge. Me and my partner visited Tower Bridge recently We had booked on line. we handed our confirmation slip to the counter staff and was given our tickets. We started our tour thinking there may be very little to see. How wrong where we. There is so much to see and do all very interesting. Well worth the money we paid for the visit

Not too busy. We visited on a Sunday afternoon and expected it to be very busy but were pleasantly surprised to find that this was not the case.We could take our time on the walkways taking photos and looking at the view.There are two walkways and both have an area of glass floor. I didn't mind sitting or lying on the glass for photos but didn't like walking on it.As well as the views there was information about the history of the bridge and other bridges around the world.You could also visit the engine rooms.There is a discount for over 60s.We had a voucher for the gift shop giving us £2 off any purchase of £4 and over. There were plenty of inexpensive gifts to choose from including a snow globe and dishtowel ( which we bought)

Beautiful Bridge - So So Tour. Tower Bridge is beautiful to photograph but the Tower Bridge Experience was just average. I was disappointed that we could not visit the engine room that controls the bridge movement.

Iconic landmark. This is an iconic landmark in London and one that you'll be happy to see up close. Most of the hop on hop off buses go right over the bridge so you can take some great pics or hop off at the Tower Bridge stop and walk across yourself.

Very Enjoyable. Since our hotel was located right by the bridge and we had a London Pass that allowed us to enter without further payment we decide to see what it was all about. You can of course walk across the bridge without paying, we wanted to see what is called the Exhibition. We were so glad that we went through the Exhibition. You are presented with a film of how the bridge was decided upon and the design. The walk up on the top level is really fun and you can get a good view from there. The glass part of the walk is fun and interesting to look down on the river. My husband enjoyed the engine rooms and the working of the bridge. They also try make a very special effort to interest the children.
Iconic Tower bridge. walk on the side of the tower bridge. You see many posh building and its very central area of London.

The tower bridge. Very worth while visiting, but at £9 I feel it was a bit too expensive. Worth more like £5. The engine room was noy very interesting, but the short video in the tower before going onto the glass floor of the bridge was very interesting and well presented

Stunning tourist site with great views. Well planned and informative attraction. The bridge is magnificent with exceptional views and architecture. The exhibition caters to many languages and there are tours available.
I arrived just as it was opening and the crowds were not excessive. Definitely do both the east and west sky walks.
I was very surprised it was blue.

Worth the price and time there. 2 adults/1 late teenager visited. We used to live in London and came back to include this attraction. It is worth the visit. Very well thought-out exhibition especially pictures of other bridges around the world. A bit scary to walk "on" the glass, but fun. Fantastic views of London and beyond on a clear day. I thought the "turn up and go" entry price Adult 9/Child 3.90 pounds (up to age 15 yrs) was good value. You can go online for a slightly cheaper price and book in advance. Really enjoyed it!

One of the icons of London!. It 'a bridge over the Thames a little special with its shape a little fairy. But it does not seem very long and follow it all back and forth will keep you busy. A must see.

Tower Bridge , a true feel of London. To walk across Tower Bridge is an exceptional feeling of exhilaration. The strong and sturdy bridge is a statement to the magnificent building and design skills of a bygone age. To stand on the bridge and look at the construction is amazing. We were privileged to see the bridge raised to let through a cruise ship while we were staying close by. The views from the bridge are fabulous. Just to stop awhile and watch everyday London pass byr, the Thames is so busy , the variety of boats and ships you can see passing under is vast. You can visit the engine room and the glass floor walkway to, it is an added bonus but not necessary , just stop and breathe in the sights and sounds of London from this magnificent bridge and you will fall in love with it

Memorable sky walk experience!. It's definitely worth thinking ahead for your visit and booking the sky walk/glass floor experience! We were lucky enough to be up the top when the bridge was being drawn which made for some great photographs. A very memorable experience if you don't mind glass floors and heights!

Great London tourist sight that will please everyone.. This attraction is a very interesting and accommodates most languages when describing its history. A must is the overhead walkway with in some parts a glass floor platform looking directly down onto the bridge below. Also included in the price, see photo, is a visit to the engine room that runs Tower Bridge. Lots of stairs but for the less able there is a lift.

Beautiful Day & Night. The bridge is very ornate and colorful. At night it was all lit up. I didn't take any tours but i did walk across it on my way to the HMS Belfast. It is a functioning bridge so keep it in mind when on it taking photos. There are great photo locations by both the Tower of London and HMS Belfast as well as the many ferries that cruise up and down the Thames. I got to enjoy seeing this bridge everyday as my hotel (Chival Three Quays) room had a balcony that had an amazing view of the bridge.
Worth a look. Walking across the top and the glass floor was superb as was the exhibition itself also the old steam engines below were amazing
A must see if you are in London. Iconic monument in London. When we visited there were a few Japanese Brides having photo shoots which was quite amusing. Lots of nice bars and restaurants close by

Well worth a visit. I lived close to Tower Bridge in 2012 and I loved it. It looks magnificant and has a real presence. I ran along it almost everyday and it was rather fun trying to dodge everyone. It's definatly worth a visit if you are around the area. It makes for a great photo and you also get some great photos being on the bridge.

Well worth a visit. I lived close to Tower Bridge in 2012 and I loved it. It looks magnificant and has a real presence. I ran along it almost everyday and it was rather fun trying to dodge everyone. It's definatly worth a visit if you are around the area. It makes for a great photo and you also get some great photos being on the bridge.

Great History, Great Exhibition, Great Landmark.. Absolutely brilliant. The history is well told and easily understood by our younger visitors in movies. The glass floors are great fun. You can skip around them if you don't have a great head for heights. Fabulous views of the city and major landmarks. There are a lot of stairs, which is worth considering if mobility is an issue, although, seeing the glass floors is accessed by lift. The Engine Room is included in the ticket price and is a very interesting part of the tour. After seeing the Bridge, fllow the blue line on the pavement, down some steps to the Engine room. Remember to keep your ticket handy, as you will have to show it again to gain entry to the Engine Room. Tickets can be prebooked on the website at a discount with various combinations of "family" tickets.
Breath taking view. Great architecture, innovative ideas , tourist in awe of the sight & great walks on the bridge top walkways, museum & pump room

A landmark from London. The Tower Bridge, which is easily mistaken as London Bridge, is a very nice attraction in the city.It is a beautiful construction that gives a hint of good engineering. It was built from 1887 to 1894. It has 2 towers and 2 horizontal walkways, one of them being able to be raised in order to let boats pass. It has around 240 meters length and 65 meters high.The bridge has also traffic of people, motorbikes and cars.

Not for the faint hearted!. I visited The Tower Bridge Exhibition on a beautiful summer day. The price is £9 per adult, but look out for 2-4-1 vouchers, which is a more realistic price point in my opinion. The tour starts the second d you step into the lift with the lift operator telling you what the tour involves.The exhibition starts with a clever presentation involving a short projection show of how the bridge design was chosen, then off you go to walk across the tower itself. The glass floor is a shorter span than I expected and is a section in the middle - but nonetheless, the effect is amazing. To look down on the traffic, both road and river, was stunning. But not for those of you who may be afraid of heights! If you are, keep your head up and enjoy the stunning views! When you've had enough of the views, back down in the lift and back outside, a short walk to visit the engine rooms (make sure you keep hold of your original ticket as you need to show it again to access the engine room). All in all, a worthwhile visit, and another thing ticked off my list!
Family Vacation.. Lovely place. We took a tour which included this. We drove over the bridge, Great pictures, grand feature of London. Glad we were able to see it.

More than just a Bridge!. I would highly recommend going inside the Bridge and doing the Tower Bridge Experience! The glass floor is a really good touch but it is nice to go inside the towers and see what is actually inside. Rich with history and cool facts it is a must for any history buff or anybody who just wants to have a picture led down on the glass floor (don't be afraid, we did)! It does not take long and is a lot of fun.

Great info. We took the tour that takes you up the tower onto the catwalk between the two towers. It has a glass floor that looks down onto the bridge. We were lucky enough to see the bridge opening while we were there. Lots of info to read, quite interesting.

Never gets tiring. A trip to the iconic London Bridge is a ‘must do’ for tourist, visitors and natives alike. I had visited the bridge years ago while living in the City and took the family there during a recent stopover. The bridge area is crowded with tourists, as expected. Most walk around the Tower monument and take pictures/selfies of the bridge before taking in the bridge experience.The minus? Most tourist places in and around London have limited wash-rooms (Loo’s) or water fountains. The few wash rooms around are coin operated. Remember to carry small change while visiting.

Do not miss the glass floor.. Tower bridge is a such a beautiful bridge to look at. However, you will miss a lot if you do not do the "Tower bridge experience".It allows you to go up in the tower and take a walk on the glass floor. This is exciting and it provides photo opportunities that you cannot miss.The kids loved it and it was great way to learn more about the bridge too.I would definitely recommend this attraction.
Engaged :). My favourite place in the world, made better alas I giot engaged on the bridge. The glass floor is great. Reasonably priced.
London Bridge. Visited on a rainy day over Easter weekend. Very interesting and you walk over the bridge on the walkways - videos of history. You can have your photo done too.

Loved the view from the glass floors. All of us enjoyed the Tower Bridge Experience! This was one of our favorite attractions we visited. A short history lesson followed by walking across the two walkways at the top. The glass floors allow a great view of the river and the bridge below! Definitely recommend.

Glass floor above the Thames!. This was an unexpected delight, visiting the Tower Bridge and going up to the pedestrian walkway high above the Thames. The glass floor of part of the walkway is both fantastic and creepy! But we got great photos sitting on the glass! The views are great, and the exhibit of the world's greatest bridges was super. Don't miss this sight.

Woah! A little scary up here!. Doing the typical tourist bit in London we simply had to walk the glass walkway. It was a little odd standing on the glass and seeing everyone below us waving knowing we had been down there moments before. But it was great! The information around the tour of the tower was interesting and the video before walking a nice touch.

What a view from the glass plated floor.... I didn't realise you could visit the inside of this global icon.. glad I did as it's well worth the entry fee.The initial history video is a bit naffly produced but interesting. The real treat is walking across the upper spans on the glass floor. Time your visit to catch the bridge opening and stand on the glass plate exactly under the rising bridge; you get some cool photos!Don't forget to visit the engine room at the end of the bridge, even if you are not interested in mechanics, you can't help but be amazed by how brilliant the Victorian engineering magnificence of this structure is. How many of today's mobile phones will still be around and working, 150 years from now?

Always the place to spend evening!. This historic and monumental bridge is surrounded by places to eat, play, shop or take a river cruise on Thames. The Tower of London is just next door and the Tower Walk on the bank of Thames is the best thing you can do to spend an evening!

Amazing bridge. Went to see the bridge as part of 3 tours we booked . The glass floor is nice I am so brave to be able to step on it and had a picture . Then we watched the video on how they planned to build the bridge . Last part of the tour is the engine room an amazing engineering. It's worth a visit

Tower Bridge experience. We weren't planning to do this but the youngest wanted to and as there was minimal queue and the price was very reasonable we did. We were probably only there for an hour max but it was interesting the learn the history of the bridge; then walk across at the top (with glass floors in places) and then marvel at the engine room. All agreed it was well worth the diversion.

Fascinating Bridge. The Tower Bridge Experience is well worth a visit. Lifts can be used to get to the top or, for the more energetic, there are stairs in both towers (allowing a fascinating view of their construction and also a bonus sense of achievement). The views are spectacular from the walk ways and the walk on the glass floor looking down on the bridge really gives a unique perspective. There are informative displays and films that explain the history of the bridge, its construction and mechanics. After crossing the bridge the experience continues into the engine room exhibition where the machinery that used to raise the bridge can be seen.The bridge opening times are available on the internet so it is possible to time your visit to allow you to have a birds eye view of the the bridge being raised.

Surpassed expectations. The experience includes a brief video of the need for the bridge, the glass floor experience which was amazing, display of some other great bridges around the world and finally the engine room. If you are lucky then you could also see the opening and closing of the bridge. Overall the experience was great and would recommend everybody visiting London.

Worth a Visit, even if its just a quick look. This bridge, which is generally considered as just a backdrop, actually has an interesting history and is fun to visit. The 'Tower Bridge Experience' is fun and you get some good views of the Thames.

Beautiful Bridge. The Tower Bridge was one of my favorite attractions. It is absolutely beautiful. I understand that there were tours of the towers, but we did not go on those tours. We simply walked across the bridge and admired the architecture and took plenty of pictures! We visited in May 2014.

Tower Bridge Experience. Booked a family ticket for the Tower Bridge Experience which was extremely good value for money. A short queue to the lift to take you to the walkways above the bridge. Great views from the top and interesting display boards & videos about Tower Bridge and bridges around the world. The glass floor was a great part of the tour especially for photo opportunities. Would highly recommend.

Magnificent i was so lucky 2 open & Closures in one day. I loved this, magnificent views. Saw the bridge open and close twice: once from the Thames Cruise the other time from inside the Tower of London.(all on the same day)

Interesting visit. A visit to this attraction was top of my 6 year old nephew’s wish list on things to do while visiting London this summer. We timed our visit so that we were there for a bridge lift (you can find the times online here www.towerbridge.org.uk/lift-times/ if you’re interested). It was a very interesting visit. We learned about a lot about the bridge and the kids were able to collect stickers along the way to put on a Tower Bridge passport. The glass floor was really fascinating, being able to look down at cars, buses and pedestrians using the bridge below. We also visited the engine rooms, before ending our tour in the gift shop.
beautiful. we crossed on our way through London and when at the middle the views of the Thames are amazing and the shard looks great

Interesting bridge. Very interesting and well thought out tour. The glass floors are a highlight. Lots of interesting stuff to learn how the bridge was built.The Victorian engine rooms are also quite impressive and worth seeing.

Walk across or Ride a cross the Tower Bridge on a hop on hop off tour bus. The Tower Bridge is a London Landmark that is known around the world. It is also a great photo back drop to share with your friends and family.

More Interesting Than I Thought It Would Be. The Tower Bridge is a gorgeous structure, but I didn't think the "Tower Bridge Experience" would be all that interesting. Turns out I was fascinated by the Bridges of the World photo exhibition on display and the glass floor of course is a draw. We weren't up on the top level when the bridge was raised, but we did see it twice from below, once from the side of the Thames, and once from a boat cruise on the Thames. You can look up the times that the bridge will be lifted.
Interesting. perfect to visit alone, not in a group. It takes you a little longer but you can appreciate the view and the building.

Great Victorian Engineering. What a spectacular piece of engineering the Victorians left us. If you are lucky enough to be there when they raise the bridge, you can really appreciate the power and strength of the mechanics involved. We didn't go in because of the endless queues of students - too noisy!!!

Unique architecture is even better than normal !. I liked the old bridge. Tower Bridge is even better than normal because of the very unique architecture. Travel to London without visiting it is a shame. Unfortunatety i didn't bring a camera to take photos.

Tour of the Tower Bridge. Our hotel was in walking distance to we decided to visit the Tower Bridges and we were very pleasantly surprised! The admission was very affordable and the line to get is was short and moved quickly. The elevator takes you to the top of the bridge where you can walk across the spans for beautiful views of London and the River Thames. About half way along are GLASS walkways. You can see straight down to the traffic on the bridge and in the River! Although a little disorienting, the experience is really worth it. As you go down the other side of the bridge there are wonderful pictures of London and you can also view the original engines that used to power the bridge. We enjoyed this visit - actually more than we thought we would!

Great site!. Loved it! As long as you could get up the stairs you were good. We enjoyed watching people not walk across the glass floor. I loved it and took a selfie. There was a short video that explained history of the bridge and you could go into the engine room and see how everything worked. It was great.
Love love love. I love this bridge. I live close by, am Australian, and it sums up london to me. Classic beauty!Walk over at sunset or better, drop by butlers wharf at bridge opening times!

Historical piece of engineering. Oh wow, I must say one MUST visit the tower bridge when in London. Im a student hence paid the concession fare at 6.30pounds. Definitely worth, value for money. The newly added glass floor makes it even more interesting and exciting! The place is also very informative and features a gift shop right at the end of the tour.

Watched the bridge open and close! Loved that!. While on the Secret Food Tour we went by to see this famous London icon and it's bridge of opening! Felt fortunate to see such an unusual site. It is mesmerizing just to look upon this masterpiece of design.

Tower Bridge - walkway with a view. Tower Bridge visit didn't quite have as many things to see or do as I had hoped for. There is a small movie about the competition to design a new bridge for London, then you go out onto the walkways. The views from the walkways, now with some glass floor panels added in, were very worth while.(why did they have to add black dots onto the glass panels? makes photography very tricky!)Many interesting facts about Tower & other bridges around the world are displayed. They should show videos of the bridge in action, like the London opening of the Olympics and the James Bond & Queens helicopter flying through for an example.

Not the highlight of my visit. It's pretty much just a bridge. Maybe if you are into old engineering stuff it would be more interesting. Steam, hydraulics, ..One piece of irony that is displayed at the bridge, I think 400 workers (seems low) built the bridge. The sign reads something like, despite no labor laws, only 10 people were killed whilst building the bridge. Only 10! Imagine that. I wonder how their families felt.I guess the wait wasn't too bad. But the express feature of the London Pass did not seem an advantage as people who walked right in and paid for a ticket actually moved ahead in the queue faster than those in the London pass line.

Great glass walkways. We managed to get his attraction on offer 2 for 1 which was excellent value. We spent a good few hours there and loved the glass walkways. Fabulous views. Thank you to the lovely guide on the second walkway, (sorry we didn't get your name), who gave us lots of lovely facts about hiring the tower bridge for private parties and took some lovely photos of our group.

A 'must' visit. Hubby and I visited at a weekend, arrived around 10.30 am and only queued for around 15 mins. ( bear in mind later in day queues were a lot longer) entry fee was very reasonable. The tower and information provided with the tour is excellent, along with the staff whom are very helpful and only happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the tower and surrounds.But it has to be said the best part is the latest addition of 'glass bottom' floors. Wow.. Hold onto the rails.. The views are great, with most people happy to lie down and take selfies, not for the faint hearted.
fantastic view.. one of the main attractions in the london city.we wonder how it made years back and its wonderful maintenance.

A Tour of Tower Bridge. Having visited London many times I was surprised to find there was something we hadn't experienced. The tour of the Tower is an amazing experience, high above the busy road overlooking the river, the view is amazing. The walk through tour tells the story of how the bridge was built. There's a glass walkway, for the very brave, a video presentation and lots of opportunities to examine the working mechanism. A must do when visiting London.
Panoramic views amazing. Fantastic views of London from the Bridge - very strange walking on the glass walkway. Value for money, very informative.

Lovely views, good value for money.. I loved tower bridge, loved the glass walk way, good value for money, compared to other attractions. I would recommend this attraction. We turned up on the day and bought tickets, didn't queue long.
get the song stuck in your head. Worth seeing, worth walking across. Excellent views and interesting up close bits. Impressive and near other sights.

Fascinating iconic bridge. Fantastic insight into how this iconic bridge was built. Impressive views. Reasonable value for money - £8 each adult, bought online. Glass walkway quite a quirky fun addition. However ... the glass is getting a little scratched and marked ... don't expect to take good quality, clear photos as suggested by the promotional literature. However, a truly stunning experience.
historic...collosal bridge..... massive bridge which spans the River Thames. Always read about it in books, but I got the opportunity to see and walk on the bridge twice

Worth the money!. We loved the Tower Bridge tour. The cost was around 9 pounds to tour the Tower Bridge. You have the option of walking up the stairs or taking an elevator. We opted to take the stairs, which was really interesting. Be warned, it is a lot of stairs! Once you are at the top, you can watch a short video about the Tower Bridge and how it was constructed. Then you walk across – there are small windows that you can take pictures from and a large portion of the floor is glass that you can look beneath at the cars and pedestrians walking. Once you are to the other side, you can watch another short video and walk across the other side of the bridge. There are amazing views of the Tower of London and the Thames River. When you are done with the Tower Bridge you can go to the pump room, but we opted to complete the tour after the bridge. It is a quick attraction, but the views were great and it was a well done attraction. If you are looking for a relatively cheap attraction in London, the Tower Bridge will not disappoint.

A surprising highlight of our London visit.. The Tower Bridge is a beautiful landmark, but I was surprised at how enjoyable the walkway attraction was. Very reasonably priced compared to other attractions, we spent quite a bit of time here and enjoyed both the views of the city as well as learning a bit of history. Going up on the walkway is a must.

By far the nicest bridge in the world . Stunning to look at from the riverside. Also stunning views when you walk over it. Always lovely to see the bridge open, even living in London for many years I haven't tired of it. By far my favourite bridge in the world. You can also tour inside and the engine room. A must visit site if you're in London.

Best landmark in London. For me, Tower Bridge is maybe the best landmarks in London. Really looks amazing, specially when its opening and closing. I didn't have time to see it by night, with the lights, but if it looks that nice by day I only can image how nice it is by night

Quick visit, although a bit expensive. Fun for families. Our boys (ages 8 and 10) loved walking and taking pictures on the glass portion of the bridge. They also have a fun "passport"/stick book for the kids and that made the visit more enjoyable. We visited the Tower of London first and then made the quick walk over to Tower Bridge before they closed. There are many restaurants nearby for a meal before or afterwards.

A must-see in London, advisable to walk inside.. Walking to Tower Bridge is great anyway - on one side of the river Thames there is Tower of London and Gherkin, on another - the Shard (tallest building in the EU). From the bridge you can enjoy a breathtaking panorama of London with all these landmarks and skyscrapers!We decided to go inside the bridge, which was cheaper than expected - £9.00 for adults or about £20.00 for a family with 2 children. Once you are there, the elevator brings you to the upper part of the bridge. Some parts of the floor there are made of strong glass. You can walk on it and see Thames and the traffic on the lower part of the bridge through it. A special experience (a bit scary but totally safe). The ticket also includes a visit to the engine room downstairs. There was some entertainment for kids as well - they get stickers to collect into a small album called "Tower Bridge Passport" (included in the ticket price). This was really a good idea, because it kept the children busy and they did not get annoyed by their parent's sightseeing.

Iconic experience. Being one of London's best known icons we visited using our London Pass. In the main Tower and walkway the view aspects were the best feature. People performing on the glass platforms bit off putting. The second part of the Tower was the below ground operating area with the old engine which used to lift the bridge. This was more interesting. The Tower itself is still best viewed from outside.

Tower Bridge Walkway. Enjoyed the tour of Tower Bridge & taking pictures through the glass walkway 42m above the Thames. Very informative tour going through the design, building & working of the most famous bridge in the world. Well worth taking the time to do while in London.

Interesting story and a great view. First of all I was surprised that there was no queue at all for this attraction, at a July Friday around 11 am. So I spontaneously decided to visit the Tower Bridge Experience and surely it didn't disappoint. You start on the 4th floor (lift available!) with a short film about the bridge's history before you enter the main attraction: the two connecting walkways with the glass floor. Apart from the great views up and down the Thames, the look down is a fun bonus! You can also open the windows on either side, so you can take your photographs without reflection. There's another short film before you go down to ground level again, and your ticket also includes a visit to the machine room at the end of the bridge (hold on to your ticket!), and of course there's a gift shop at the end of the tour.The Tower Bridge Experience is definitely worth a visit, the price is modest (£9 per adult), and you'll get enough history and plenty of views.

Fantastic!. We did the Tower Bridge Experience as it was very close to our hotel. I didn't have high expectations due to the price (£9 for adults and £3.50 I think for kids) but it really exceeded my expectations! I think we spent about an hour and a half and the tour was interesting and fun. There is a glass walkway which is fun to try! And the staff were all very friendly, would definitely recommend.

Great for a photo, tour a bit dry. Tower Bridge offers an iconic photo opportunity, as either a background for a picture with people or as an independent structure. It is absolutely worth a pause for the picture - and to note the lighting and angles. (You can get very different pictures at different angles: play and have fun!)I took a guided tour of the inside and history of the bridge. The tour proper was well organized and VERY comprehensive. There were portions that were interactive, but for the most part it was speaking, photos with text, and movies. I learned a lot about Tower Bridge (structurally, politically, and historically) as well as bridge mechanics in general. However, I found that for me, it did not capture my interest to the extent of many of the other options near it, in either topic nor how the information is presented. Employees were helpful and friendly, so this would be a fantastic couple of hours for someone very interested in bridges and/or Tower Bridge, but I would highly suggest that a typical tourist get their obligatory photos and focus their time elsewhere. If you want a taste of the bridge, the pictures and captions will likely prove sufficient.

Tower Bridge Experience. Tower Bridge Experience
A waste of money if you are expecting a cool glass walkway between the two towers. Instead you will see possibly a 4 foot glass walkway. The view s incredible but the glass portion is the new addition and it flopped. Still over priced.

One of the best parts. Make sure you go to the upper part and walk on the glass floors. It was one of the best parts of our trip, so cool! Even if you don't want to walk on the glass there are educational films to watch at either end. If you don't do the experience, at least go and walk on the bridge itself.

Wow! What a trip!!. We were looking forward to the glass floor walk between the towers and good though that was (pictures of the road and river between your feet are amazing) the entire experience was fabulous, informative and fun!!Don't forget to get the Passports for the children - they are great too!The pump rooms were amazing and the video clips and the 'experiments' too.All in all a great day out for all the family.

very beautiful. very very strongly recommended...specially at night times if you'd live to see lights like me...it was "Perfect"you should definitely go to view the bridge...you might be lucky to see the bridge getting opened...it will be beautiful to see at night times as well...

Love the view from the top of the bridge. It has a lot of displays about the history of the bridge and also the explanation of various bridge designs and pictures of famous bridges around the world.I had the London Pass so I could use the express line and bypassed the long queue at the entrance. I was lucky at the top of the bridge when it was going to operate. Took some nice pictures and videos through the glass section.
The View!. This bridge is the a must-see attraction in London! Details on this bridge is like no other. Also the view is amazing! Great to take photos on there!

An unusual view of the capital. Often photographed but rarely viewed close up this monument to Victorian engineering is a must for all visitors.Apart from the interesting engine room which houses the huge motors that raise and lower the bridge, the new viewing gallery with its historical information boards on the London landmarks you will find extremely interesting.The views from the bridge are stunning and offer visitors a unique photo opportunity of the the river in all its glory.

It's Hard to Miss!. There are many ways to enjoy the Tower Bridge, my first view was from the Tower of London property. Many people mix up this bridge with the London Bridge. Another way to enjoy the Bridge is from the water on one of the many tour boats.

Fascinating bridge over Thames. We visited this great structure as part of our London day tour. We had a break around this place on our way to the Tower Of London. We utilized the time to visit this great bridge.We walked along the river and went on to the bridge to go to the other side and come back. It gives a nice view of the river and the city. The bridge was crowded and naturally being a top tourist season. There is no entry fee and is worth a visit.

Great sight. This is an outstanding structure, both in structure and colour. easy to get pictures from London Bridge, just upstream, or from the sidewalks along river.The structure itself is very impressive, the way its built and profile etc. If you can, get there when the bridge raises to allow a ship to traverse the river.

Family day out . A most enjoyable day out learning the history of this famous bridge amazing views seeing the bridge being raised
Coming back soon

Something a little different.......... We hadn't planned to do this at all and only meant to walk across the bridge having never done it before...but then we saw the Bridge experience advertised. I would suggest going on a weekday as I would expect it to be too busy at a weekend.....bare this in mind for school holidays too. Having purchased the tickets we were given the choice of taking the lift or stairs. We took the stairs and they themselves are great. Wooden hand rails and the huge girders which is the skeleton of the towers. There are benches to gain your breath should you need it at various points. Then we got to the top walkway...the bit at the top with the lattice windows. There is a length of floor which is glass giving you the opportunity to take pictures from an unusual perspective. There are 'guides' all around to help and answer questions although there is plenty of information posted all over. There are even little windows that open to allow you to take a picture without the risk of glare from a flash. Then we returned to ground level, the turns on the stairwell each having a nugget of information about various London attractions. The price of the ticket also includes a visit to the original engine rooms. There is plenty of information posted around...and in several languages too as well as the cleanest shiniest steam engine I have ever seen. A talented photographer would have a field day in there!!! There is again a gift shop with very relevant stuff for sale. A great way to fill a couple of hours.
Interesting site in London. Be sure and get a ticket to cross on the elevated glassed in walkway. Crossing the Thames and watching the river traffic is impressive.
Very unique experience. tower bridge exhibition look at the views from the high-level walkways. Learn about the history of the bridge. Engine room not a miss for engineers or men/women intrested

Exceeded expectations. We decided to do the Tower Bridge experience after it was recommended by my mother in law and it did not disappoint! I suggest booking in advance as it's cheaper and easier. You take a lift up to the top of the bridge and the glass floor looking down is fantastic. We got to see the bridge open and the man who did the talk during this was great! For a London attraction it's cheap and really good value for money. I would definitely do the experience again and will be recommending it to all!

Walk on through. Mid-19th century bridge made to look like it fits thematically with the tower.Nice to walk across but don't spend a lot of time.(we didn't do the glass enclosed walk or the machine room - it was closed - that may make the whole thing more interesting)
holidays. the take vehicles inside the bridge, very designed bridge looking very nice and tourist attraction-able.

Most famous bridge in the world!. Definite must-see for all London tourists! There is an informative background video on why tower bridge was built and how its designer came up with the idea for the bridge's structure. After the video, you continue on to the 2nd floor of the bridge, where there are great views of the city as well as many posters with information about bridges in London. After you finish going through the first hallway, you arrive at the other end of the bridge(still inside), and watch a short video about how tower bridge was actually put together. Then, you continue on to a hallway parallel to the first one to get a view from the other side of the bridge. There is also a museum you can visit after you're done touring the actual bridge. The prices are great and it is free if you have the London pass, so I would definitely recommend a visit to this iconic bridge to everyone.

Beautiful view over the tower bridge. We didn't get in the museum. We visited the site at night and it was stunning. The colours and the reflection of it in the Thames, the boats. It was really great.

An awesome structure. I have been visiting tower bridge for 30 years. It's the place I always take visitors and nothing beats those special occasions when a Dutch barge passes underneath and the bridge must rise. An early morning visit before the crowds and rush hour is even more special. It's a defining image of London. My children now live examining the engineering behind the structure.
Good short tour. This is not a long tour to se in the workings of the bridge but very interesting and would recommend it.
Fascinating !!. I walked cross it three times taking so many pictures. .it was an amazing experience!! I'd so love to go again.
Not just another bridge. We walked across it and sailed under it. What a great iconic Structure so unique as well. Defiantly a must see when in London even from a distance.

Bridge over Thames waters. Tower Bridge was a most enjoyable visit! There is a small multimedia show to provide background on the bridge's design and construction. Taking the stairs (all 207?) is the best way to get to the viewing platforms as the elevators get quite crowded. There is a glass floor that is fun to walk across. We were treated with a bird's eye view of the bridge opening while we were sitting on the glass floor. The Victorian Engine Rooms were beautiful! We purchased a combined Tower Bridge Experience/Monument to the Great Fire ticket on the Tower Bridge website which allowed us to skip the queue.

Awesome views. Incredible views of the city and a neat historical tour. Our entry was covered by the London Pass and we truly enjoyed it. There is an elevator which you wait for, or the stairs, which we took, that will test your manhood.. haha. Worth a wait and the money.

Its A Bridge. Looks nice, it is a bridge. It isn't London Bridge so don't tell people you went to that one. You can walk across it and drive across it. Take a picture and move on unless you want a tour to learn more about a bridge.

Enjoyable . Although I have visited the Tower Bridge a few times, this is the first time I am on top and experienced the walk through the glass floor. It is scary for the acrophobia but thrilling for those who are not. Many lied on the glass floor and took picture. An enjoyable experience.

World's most beautiful bridge. My favorite site to see in London and all of Europe. A beautiful bridge and perhaps the best activity in London is walking beside the Thames and across it with great views in every direction. Tip: on the ToL side just past the bridge there's a hotel that serves afternoon tea and you have a great view of the bridge there as well.
Awesome!. We really took in the sights of the London Bridge and the London Bridge towers while we cruised the River Thames. Be sure to check out all the details which are so interesting.

Great view. Great view of London.You can spend a lot of time enjoying the view.Was there during the evening and the weather was cool.So spent a lot of time there.Dint get to see the tower bridge lift but will go again to see that definitely.

Truly amazing - day and night!. Having built the LEGO model of Tower Bridge (which is a great build), seeing it in real life was really stunning. The structure and the colors are absolutely amazing. Coming back to the bridge at night was even more stunning. If you can only visit one thing in London, make sure it's Tower Bridge.

Iconic London landmark. Arguably the world's most famous bridge, Tower Bridge is an iconic London landmark- A river side walk towards the bridge and a walk over the bridge across Thames- its an unforgettable experience and must do in London. Nearest Tube Station : Tower Hill or get down at London Bridge station for Thames Walk towards tower bridge. 19 min

Sky walk over the river, are you brave?. This was an inexpensive afternoon visit, entering on the southern tower and taking the lift up to the walkway, after a short presentation you are free to stroll over the high-level walkways and experience the Glass Floor 42 meters up. Look at their web site and try to time your visit to the planned lifting times of the road. complete your visit with the engine rooms an impressive view of Victorian engineering.
SIGNATURE PLACE OF LONDON. A signature place of london...........Often mistook as london bridge...... must visit and see the opening and raising of bridge...

Favourite of all bridges on the Thames. Impress your not-so-clued up friends by knowing that this is Tower Bridge and not London Bridge as some people think. An absolutely beautiful bridge, even for people that aren't normally in to bridges.

Wow! Amazing. I loved it! We had booked on line, and had spent the Morning at the Tower of London, we had lunch at the Tower Hotel, and after lunch we went to the Tower Bridge Exhibition. You go up in the lift to the walk way, you are shown a short film on the history of the design and building of the bridge, then you step out onto the walkway - and it hits you - the views are awesome!!! There is a section of the floor that is glass and so you can see the road bridge and the river below - it was amazing. If you don't like heights, you can walk around the panels and not look down. After the walkways you then go along to the engine rooms, it's not long maybe an hour in total, but definably worth it.

Splendid!. I really enjoyed our visit to the Tower Bridge. We arrived about an hour before closing and found it to be plenty of time to enjoy the views at the top and tour the engine rooms. We pre-purchased our tickets online.

Very cool and great view. This is fun because it is not too expensive, you can take as long as you want, and you get a great view of the Thames River. It is a very cool old bridge and fun to learn some of the history. It is just the right amount of history and entertainment.

Fantastic Value. We spent 2 hours at the London Bridge, great experience in the history of the bridge with the very novel and exciting views from the glass walkway. I found the Engine room very interesting, a great place to visit for a very reasonable cost.

Crowds at tower bridge.. Great way to see a lot of London history, but the crowds, lines, and places where you are not allowed to photograph make it less than perfect. Hard to hear the beefeater tour guides. The Crown Jewels are great but a 40 minute wait and going by on a conveyer belt is disappointing.
Breathtaking. Amazing experience seeing the beauty and history here. I am glad that I took the opportunity to visit.

My Favourite Bridge.. My favourite bridge. Don't miss looking at this fabulous bridge. You can walk over it or drive .We did both.You need to make time to just look at it and watch the boats etc.You could be lucky and see it open.

More Brits should visit. I travel the world and take to opportunity to visit every site of interest I can ... Except at home ... Normally... Friends took me here and I thoroughly enjoyed the tour and I now know what the blue trail across the bridge are for, I have wondered for years ..
Worthwhile visit. Enjoyed the tour, especially the glass sections of the walkway. Walked up to avoid the wait for the lift. Engine rooms are interesting. Good value with a 2 for 1 pass or similar.

Iconic. Iconic Tower Bridge such a good looking bridge indeed, a must visit when in London also. You can do tours in London that will take you here and other places in one visit and that way you get the history as well.

Take a tour for some interesting facts. This was my favorite stop in our London tour. Our guide told us tons of interesting stories about the history of this spot. If you're traveling without a guide, make sure to join a tour for this spot, or snag a guide book.
Gotta see. We took riverboat ,....passed underneath and walked up onto for a few photos. Right beside Tower of London...of course....monumental land mark you can't miss.
Stunning Bridge. One of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen. I wish we could have drove slower across it. A must see and do experience.

Well worth a visit. A great visit - one of our 8 & 10 year olds highlights of our London weekend break. A great walk around the towers and across the high walkways with the highlight being the glass floor on each side - not good if you don't have a head for heights but you can walk round it (or across it if you're brave). You also get to visit the engine room which is really interesting and there are a couple of hands on things to keep the kids occupied. A well spent few hours and good value for money.

The landmark of London!. This architecturally impressive bridge is a symbol of London and a must visit when in the city! The bridge is even more beautiful when viewed up close with the white and blue colors on the suspensions.

Get a Mr. Whippy afterwards!. Obviously, you have to see the Tower Bridge when you're in London. The queue to go into the Tower and across the walkway aren't too bad. They allow only so many people on the Bridge and walkway at one time which is really nice, it could get crowded. Once you are in the Tower, you go on an interactive tour of the buildings. On both sides, there are clear walkways in the towers so you can see down on the traffic below you. It was completely awesome. People were even laying down and taking selfies. At one end, they have one of those touristy photo kiosk booths and normally, my friends and I would have ignored it but it wasn't bad. There were plenty of options and the picture came out nicely.
