Down the stairs on the other side, you find the gift shop and you can go down into the engine rooms. The Bridge is great for pictures and is a true iconic landmark. On the right hand side, facing the Thames and the London Bridge to your back is an area for people watching. Mr. Whippy trucks also hang out in this area so you can get an ice cream cone to boot. Close to the London Bridge Underground.Tons of stairs though but there are elevators if you aren't physically able.

Well worth a visit. A very good experience to learn all about the history of the bridge from design through to construction & completion. Walking over the glass bottom floor on the upper span of the bridge is some experience . We were particularly lucky to be directly above the bridge as it was opened. Would recommend a visit.

Well worth a visit. The exhibition was interesting and reasonably priced (for a family ticket), great views from both walkways. We visited on a week day out of school holidays (an inset day) which I am sure helped as a limited number of people can go up in the lifts at a time, (the queues must be dreadful at the weekend).

Must Visit iconic monument. The iconic place in London, always on postcards, this bridge is worth visiting, also look for the bridge open timetable when ships and ferries pass by, this will give you a good view and experience, can be accessed by Bus and Tube, close to the bank station.
The Bridge. Nice view. It is like a story book panoramic view from afar. It is likened to a bridge in a fairy tale book!

Being there was an experience. This is the place to fulfill the long dormant desire to be on this famous bridge and be the part of the lore being in London . The well known landmark will never disappoint you . The iconic ,familiar lines of the famous song will come to the mind at the moment . Do not miss .

Room for improvement. Horrendous queue in the ticket office but as we had London Passes we could jump the queue. Still as there were so many people there, it wasn't easy moving around to the lift. The bridge itself is quite good, and loved the glass floor. Personally, I enjoyed the exhibition on the walkway about other meaningful bridges throughout the World. My personal favourite was the bridge which formed part of the Autoroute from Paris to Barcelona. One thing we weren't impressed with was that the lift on one side of the bridge was out-of-order. We ended up walking down the spiral stairs. Also at the bottom we had to exit through a grotty shop selling 'momentoes' of the Bridge, sad way to end a good tour.

Great visit. My 2 children are autistic they both love visiting well known places they've seen in pictures or on TV so as soon as we went to London one of the first stops was tower bridge ! The que wasn't too bad and it moved quickly , there was a member of staff that kept running in and out looking for London pass holders to take straight in and fast track , but when they've brushed passed you a few times it gets annoying ! They really need to sort that out . Once at the counter we found that disabled people and there carers were FREE ! Totally FREE !!! there's a lift up to the top floor and the kids loved the views and the glass floor looking down at the river , there's a short video of how the bridge was built and that's it really but you do also get to visit the engine room where you have to go out and around to get to it , so all in all the kids loved it ! And now when they see it on TV they can say I've been in there , so well worth a visit .
Iconic place to visit. Great bridge, loads of history and architecture. Lovely to walk across, a must do if you are visiting London.

Don't pay for it.. The bridge is indeed beautiful and iconic. You should walk across for sure. Take lots of pictures, too. But there's no reason to pay for a tour. We did ours through the London Pass, so I don't feel ripped off, but the tour is two short videos and a walk through the engine room. Not necessary.
Terrific Scenery and Views.. Terrific scenery and views from the bridge. Loved the history around it as well as the ease of visiting.

Glass floor. You must do the Tower bridge experience when visiting.
You get to go up on top and see how it was built. Walk across a glass floor and see below. You also get to see all the engineering behind the scenes and learn how they raised the bridge in the old days.
Beautiful!. This bridge really is one of my favorite landmarks in London. It's beautiful in the daylight and even more gorgeous at night.

Just Great. This was a birthday present - and probably one of the best - such a great experience to be able to go up on top of this beautiful bridge which I have travelled on numerous times - The whole is experience is well done and very informative - scary but brilliant to stand on the glass over the top of cars and the River.So very pleased we did this - must go place in London.

Impressive . One of London's most iconic attractions, the walk across the bridge is a highlight of the trip. Pay the fee to climb the bridge and walk across the top for great views of London. The glass floor is a great addition which adds an element of thrill to the experience.

So Iconic So Beautiful!. You cannot help but stare at this beautiful bridge. We stayed in this area and every time we left our hotel our eyes always were forced to look right at the Tower Bridge. We enjoyed walking over it too!

An hour worth spent. We just made it for the last admission at 5:30 and had enough time to explore the walkways, videos about the bridge, photo gallery and engine room. With 2 for 1 admission that we got with our travel card this was a perfect attraction: well organized, enlightening and reasonably priced. It's ideally paired with the Tower of London if you leave the Tower by 5:15.

Most beautiful bridge across the Thames!. Great view from the Tower of London and any of the Thames cruises! Check the lift times schedule on http://www.towerbridge.org.uk/lift-times/ (it takes only about 10 minutes but it is worth it!)

another iconic scene. next to Big Ben is this tower bridge, if you have that day bus pass, why not visit right?My advise is not to go to the Tower Bridge itself but take photos from the streets farther along the sides. The view is better. Also, do visit at night time when the lights are on (I'll have to get back because we visited at day time), they say view is really good.
Best Landmark in London. To me is the most beautifull bridge I´ve ever seen. You can´t miss that photo in a sunny day or a clear night !!!

Amazing architecture. Go and have a look! This is wonderful up close and you can walk over a glass floor ( not for long, though) and look at the cars below for £9. Read the plaques, learn about the dead man's hole and just enjoy the antiquity of this wonderful piece of British history.

The Bridge is beautiful - the "experience" is an almost waste of time. This bridge is lovely and fun to walk across. This trip we purchased tickets for the "Tower Bridge Experience". What a rip off. There are two small sections of the floor that are see through but otherwise you are in an enclosed area with not much of a view. Bypass the "experience" as it is not much of one. Just enjoy walking across the bridge free of charge.
Nice picture opportunity!!!. Nice picture opportunities, take the boat ride so you have and excellent view. A little bit crowded but great to visit.

A must see. Went just after Christmas, the glass floor in the walk way is brilliant. Lift up to the give you some brief facts and figures then there is a small show showing you how the designs came about and the when and how it was constructed. Also life size figures in eth rafters of maintainence crew back from when it was constructed. Pump rooms were good, only downside is that the way out is through a small and crowded gift shop

Must See. This is an iconic bridge next to the Tower of London. River trips go under it. For a small fee you can go inside and see the workings that raise the bridge, and also go to the top gantries and take some wonderful photos of London.
Must See!. This is a must see when in London!! The Tower Bridge is awesome. Must to the river cruise!! I love to go back!!

An icon must see. One of a kind in the world. So gorgeous and beautiful. Great place to take a slow stroll and walk. Beautiful scenery. Peaceful and pleasant area. Bridge is so well kept and clean. Wow factor.

A true landmark. Grand, Romantic and beautiful, this bridge holds a special place in my heart as the place my husband proposed marriage to me late one night, on his knees in the middle of an empty Tower bridge. I'm just glad it didn't open up with him on one side and me on the other.

Fun and amazingly cool!. This is for the Tower Bridge and Tower Bridge Experience - Took (2) seniors and (2) children (4 & 7) there on a multi-generational trip. We all LOVED it. Dad and granddad loved how the machines worked. Kids loved walking all around it. Don't forget to stand on Tower Bridge and take a video infront of London Bridge with kids singing "London Bridge is falling down...falling down". On the Tower Bridge Experience - go ahead and lay on the floor of the glass floor. My kids thought this was the coolest thing ever - laying down while the traffic and water passed below. Fun, fun, fun! Not to be missed.

Icon of London - include in your trip!. Tower Bridge with its blue and white suspension bridge is a picture perfect place to take your selfies and photos as memento from London. Many mistakes this as London Bridge, one that is next parallel to this is called like that and this one as Tower Bridge. Huge cruise ships cross this bridge now and then - if you are lucky you can wait to watch the bridge open in the middle to allow these giants cross that. For best views, start from Tower Hill and walk along the trees parallel to Thames river. Another one is across the Tower Hill on other side of Thames River where circle or Globe look building is present. If you are coming from Tower Hill towards the Tower bridge, walk past the bridge and you see old yachts and ships parked for some good photo opportunity. You can pay ticket and go inside to get some good views.. but if you are short of time.. spending time around the place is good enough for a beautiful experience. Nearest tube station was Tower Hill - District and Circle. Antique bus without doors (route 15) still runs near this place. You can also get down at London Bridge station and walk past the HMS Belfast ship to reach the Tower Bridge. Spectacular London Skyline can be seen from here.

Loved it. Who would have thought a bridge could be so interesting. I really enjoyed reading and looking at all the photos of famous bridges around the world and loved the clear glass!!Most of all I just loved the look of the bridge from afar- I could have sat and had a drink and stared at it all day! Just beautiful and so clever

Just like the photos. Tower Bridge really is just like the photos you see. It is beautiful. We had a fantastic morning walking along the river and along the bridge taking photos. I would recommend this outing for anyone visiting London. Just remember it's not the London Bridge from the nursery rhyme.

Historical Bridge. An interesting visit to this historic architecture of the 1800s. An amazing landmark with wonderful historical value for all ages. If you're able to walk across the bridge as well, it is a fabulous sight. I'd highly recommend this to travellers/tourist.

Great Views. I was walking on Tower at night at about 11.30 pm Feeling wonderful being there, many call it as London Bridge also but its tower bridge and has great views both in day as well as in Night

Spectacular Experience!. Perfect for all ages. Thrilling to view the river from this landmark. Try to fit in a boat tour as well. Most go under the bridge and back. Another interesting perspective and view of the river!

What a bridge!. Great bridge to see in London. A real landmark. If you go I highly recommend you take the extra tour where you go across the top. Great view, you also see the working parts and learn how the bridge operates. Well worth the extra time.

A Worthwhile Visit. For the money, there is a lot to do here and you can learn a decent amount about the history of the bridge as well as some other bits about London in general.Suitable for adults and kids aged 2+ with various activities, short films and interactive bits to do.If you're in London it's worth visiting.

Interesting and great views. This was a surprize, it was very well presented, the walk across the glass floor was great (if a bit scary). Lots of good opportunities for taking photos great views up and down the thames.
A great activity for the family. You can walk across the top part. Bet you didn't know that. It's is a beautiful site and worth the money.
Don't miss it. It's worth the time. Done miss taking pics sitting down on the glass bottom watching the Thames flow under and cars whizz by.

Its a wonderful place to visit. Tower Bridge is the most impressive landmark in London and has stood over the River Thames since 1894. the Tower Bridge is one of the most visited attractions especially the new glass floor walkway (with fee).

Important Historical Bridge. Great visit to one of the most famous bridges in London. Walk through the history, construction in the late 1800's. Walk in the glass floor looking down into the passing cars. Pass through the exhibition where is shown how the bridge opens when a ship will pass.
Tower Bridge. I didn't actually take a tour of Tower Bridge but did enjoy seeing it from the Hop On Hop Off boat tour! Stunning!

English History lesson at its best. An amazing landmark with wonderful historical value for all ages. If you're able to walk across the bridge as well, it is a fabulous sight. I'd highly recommend this
Worth it. If you are visiting London you just have to go there. I mean it's the Tower Bridge. If you like these kind of attractions or not, it does not matter. Just visit it.

Walk on glass. It is an ok story on how and why day builded the bridge, and you could walk on glass.
It was ok and nothing more. Don't plan your vacation around this activity.

Great Architecture. A must visit place in your London Trip. Great place for photography enthusiasts. you can take numerous shots from different angles. It is beautiful once the lights are up in the evening.

Love this bridge. We timed our arrival to watch a bridge lift scheduled for the morning. We watched from London Bridge in order to take some pictures. Amazing to watch how quick it is.
Definitely make the time to see a bridge lift.

Love it, every time.. Always majestic. Walk across, and back again. Great photos can be taken on the Tower of London side, but also the other side can be good. Try to get a photo when the bridge is down, halfway up, and completely up.
History of Tower Bridge. The walk across is tiring. The history of how the bridge was built and how it operates is a must read to understand and respect the genius.

Walk around Thames River. If you visited London Tower. Don't miss here!
From the bridge you can take the greatest photos the modern building in city of London.
Fascinating. I can see where families would enjoy this because there is something for everyone. From the Glass to the Views I do not think it can be beat. A must do when in London.

Great views - must see this London icon. Tower Bridge is just so much a part of London and should not be missed - the bridge has a good museum where you can see the inner workings of this amazing Victorian engineering masterpiece and high walkway right up over the top from one side to the other.

Historic walk!. I've been visiting London for 25 years and have only just walked across Tower Bridge. The views from the bridge are beautiful. We walked from the Tower of London side and visited the south bank.
Lovely walk and even lovelier spots to visit on the other side.

Great but only for one time. It's a great attraction but because of the price for what you get I would only do it once. The views of London from the bridge are stunning. The glass on the top walkways is really cool! A lot of good info on the bridge is available. You even visit the engine room! I recommend this attraction if it's your first time in London.

Dinner Cruise. The city cruise was by far the best value. We cruised up and down the themes River and saw a number of sites. The EYE of London, London Bridge, Parliament, Big Ben, Walkee Talkee, Cheese Greater, Tower of London just to name a few.

Fascinating insight into a great piece of history. My wife and I visited on the recommendation of a friend and found the tour very interesting, I wasn't too keen on the 1960's exhibit at the top of the bridge but the views were fantastic.The presentation on the construction of the bridge was very good and kept concise to keep it interesting.Don't forget to check out the old boiler rooms on the south bank of the Thames. Just follow the blue line painted on the floor when you come out of the main exhibit and it will take you straight to it.Afterwards we had a stroll along the north bank of the Thames and was going to go into the Tower of London but the queue was very long so we just hung about on the embankment which was lovely in the sunshine.A good day out that didn't cost the earth!!
Simply stunning. I simply love this bridge with all my heart. I love the design, the river, the area.. simply beautiful.

Put yourself into that famous picture!. Nice attraction. Change to see a short video about the bridge, walk across the glass enclosure above the bridge, and visit the engine room (and, of course, the gift shop). Great views of the city from the walkway.

Iconic bridge. Beautiful bridge with a lot of history. Went on the river cruise later in the day and decided to do Tower of London another day, so we opted to see Tower Bridge instead. Walk the tour of the bridge, worth it.

fun and interesting tour. We went up into the Tower Bridge because we had London Pass and wanted to do a quick tour that used it. It was surprisingly memorable and not at all claustrophobic. There was a nice description of how the bridge was built, the first steam engine, and an overall view of famous bridges around the world. We walked across the glass floors and watched the people cross the bridge below. I think of the tour when ever I see the bridge plus appreciate the view view from the top. It was a quick and memorable tour.
Lovely. Tower Bridge is looking lovely, nice and bright. Took a bus ride over the bridge with my children, they loved it.

The most beautiful bridge in London!. Amazing pictures can be taken from far away or close to it. During the sunset, the bridge looks outstanding!! It is definetely a MUST. It is also kind of romantic spending an afternoon walking near the bridge! We loved seeing it.

love the glass floor walkway on the upper floor!. nice bridge museum - interesting to learn about the building of the bridge and to compare to other great bridges around the world. but the glass floor walkway is awesome!

Very interesting visit. We visited Tower Bridge with friends and found it really interesting, there was so much to see here and with the glass area on the bridge a great tourist attraction, the views from the bridge were great and overall trip was so interesting even the boiler room....well worth fitting this is on a trip to London - ☺

really good. Took my 10 year old here, we loved it. Lots of interesting information on how the bridge was made. And wonderful views. I'd only do it the once, but it was well worth it. If you get tickets for this and monument it works out cheapie.
Good, Better, Best. Good, Better, Best. Very good and pleasant place to visit. Good Scenery. Cheap Ticket Rates. Loved this place. Will try to visit second time
Classic picture. As a London Eye, you should have some pictures at Tower Bridge. And wait there to see it opening when a big boat need to cross the river down.
Nice ride. Nice to get on a red bus and cross the bridge on a beautiful sunny day, which I was lucky to have seen in the UK.

Among the top 10.. I'm not a fan of attending aaaall of the famous buildings and monuments. I'm a freer kind of tourist. However, I really enjoyed this visit. I have been to other famous bridges and I really enjoyed learning about this one. The visit is amusing and fluent, not boring at all. The views from the glass walks are great and considering it is quite cheap, the overall conclusion is that this is a great outing. The giftshop is one of the best places in London to buy quality presents. There are really interesting souvenirs: maps, cards, books, and obviously pens and so on. My 13-year-old girl loved it!

very impressive. we saw London Bridge from the River Thames cruise ...we were very lucky to see it open which was impressive and my children loved it , it had opened so a Tall Ship could make its way up the Thames ....we were told that we were very lucky to see it open as its not very often that it has to

Yeah, it is a rebuild, still amazing!. The Tower Bridge, by my estimation, is one of the most iconic fixtures of the London Skyscape! It is an integral part of the sheer history of The City. I was walking with a doctor, who made it a point to show me the morgue that lays at its base.

The most beautiful bridge I've ever seen. The Tower Bridge is one of the city's icon and it looks more beautiful than a regular bridge because of the amazing two towers. The bridge also houses a museum and you can climb on the top and see from a glass floor.The most spectacular thing about this bridge is when is opening to allow a boat to pass, which I was able to see.

Pleasant Surprise. One of my travelling companions wanted to see the Tower, which was not high on my list. I found it very interesting, tour guides were excellent, and not many restrictions on where you can and cannot go.
Must visit place. This is a must visit place..... You cannot miss being here. Just walk on the bridge and then take a ferry to the big Ben.
London Landmark. Great time visiting London and Tower Bridge. One of those must see sights Although it does get busy.
great photo opp!. We didn't go on ar in the bridge, but it is majestic to view from afar. The line for the tours was quite long, and we had miles to go in our sightseeing. So we just looked around.

Must see!. I pre bought tickets to avoid lines. There wasn't a line when we went so wasn't needed. I had purchased the museum combo. I didn't realize the museum was off site. We never made it over there so I can't comment on that. We did love the glass floor! We were lucky enough to see the draw bridge in action. They list the times for that on their website.

Beautiful. We took a dinner cruise on the Thames River and enjoyed seeing the lights on the Tower Bridge at night. Also, we saw the bridge during the day. It is one of the most beautiful bridges, whether you see it during the day or at night. Don't miss seeing it while in London.

Worth the visit. We have walked past this location many times, without thinking of paying a visit. Well this last visit to London we decided to pay the bridge a visit. Wow it was worth it, we were lucky to have a 241 pass so only cost £9.00 for the two of us. Learning the history of the tower was great and the views even better. The glass floor is brilliant and the view the same. Well worth a visit if passing.

Spectacular. Why build a bridge, when you can build an art masterpiece that you can drive over. One of so many structures throughout London that were built to not only serve a purpose but, look amazing as well. Hat's off to the engineers and workers who constructed this bridge.
Very informative, kid friendly. Very nicely done, short points of information, lots of history and a bit of science in the adjacent boiler room tour. Sticker book and question answer for the kids.

Beautiful Bridge. You can go up in the towers or just take a walk across the bridge. Either way this is an iconic landmark in London so you have to see it at least once. One one side of the river is the Tower of London and the other has a lovely park and walkway along the water. From either side you can get great pictures of the bridge!

Impressive Sight. I had previously given the Tower Bridge a rating of 3, but on my most recent visit I had the opportunity to see the bridge at night. While the architecture of the structure is beautiful, I had thought "yes, pretty bridge, but still a bridge." It is, for those looking for the iconic, a "worth seeing" site, However, seeing it illuminated at night made this landmark all the more beautiful and a "well worth seeing" attraction if in its area after dark.

Charming. We went to this place on a sight seeing tour of london city.Infact this is one of the finest land marks of london and you get a very good view fromdistance.Built across river thames I suppose a very interesting tourist place on a london trip.
Good Place. Good plce to travel with the family and childrens. If you are lucky enought then the bridge may open. You get to see it.

This is London.. This is London! The experience of the opening bridge is hard to achieve but well worth doing some research online. The view down the Thames is great as you can see the Tower and the Pier .

Your Visit to London is Not Complete without This. I have been to London many times but somehow only now managed to visit the Tower Bridge. It is a beautiful piece of architecture and amazing masterpiece of engineering. I went to the top floor and walked on the glass floor. Simply amazing.My advise is not to go during weekends, especially in the summer.

spectacular river view. We walked the length of the bridge first taking in all the views then paid to go up the tower and get the amazing views from the top walkway.it was well worth the entry fee which included a guide and a visit to the lower old workings of the bridge - the bridge an icon of London and should not be missed.
Another one of London's must see-s.. Another one of London's must see-s.You have a choice of seeing it and walking over it..or paying a fee and taking a tour inside.

Masterpiece of engineering. Fantastic to see. Unfortunately doesn't raise up often anymore so you're lucky if you get to see it. Definetly worth a visit if in London. A boat tour around it would have been nice

Great view. Upon entry, you watch a short video about the construction of the bridge and then you a free to wander over the walkway. There is a section that is clear where you can see the road below and this is definitely a highlight for visitors. The view of London is great and definitely plenty of photo opportunities.

Awesome view through floor!. Tower Bridge is such a great place to see! Reasonable entry fee. Great fun and awesome views to be seen through the glass floor at the top. We found the view on the right side to be better - a more direct view of the bridge. We were there when they raised the bridge to let a ship go through. The staff was very helpful and gave us a lot of extra detail about the bridge. Don't miss the engine room!!

So impressed . It was a great day walking the streets of London not to be missed this magnificent bridge. Great part of London and one of the symbols of the city. The huge and magnificent, walk to the other his side will always remain one of the pleasant memories.

The symbol of London. This is the iconic symbol of London and is a must see at least one time while in London.You can certainly just walk over the bridge and see it, but there is also a tour inside which does have a fee. The fee was fairly reasonable and the tour is good for about an hour. You get to walk up into the bridge and it tells about the history of the town and construction.I would recommend the tour if you have time.

Worth doing. Adult ticket is £9 and it is a good visit, takes about an hour. A combination of posters, videos, staff and films explain the story of the bridge. The glass floors are amazing. Quite alot of steps at the beginning.

Good view - piece of history.. An inexpensive tour, with discounts for senior citizens and others. The glass floor is great as you can see the cars on the bridge below and then the cruise boats below the bridge! An interesting exhibition of some of the greatest bridges in the world. And a film on how the bridge was built and how the metal was encased in brick so that it would be in tune with the Tower of London. We also went on to the separate engine rooms building which was Victorian engineering at its best. We subsequently were lucky enough to see the bridge arms raise twice to let an old Thames Barge through, it could be interesting if this happened when you were on the walkway.

Real treat- great value, brilliant views!!. Taken here by my wife and 2 daughters as a belated fathers days treat. What a treat. Very well organised, very pleasant staff. Great value. Book on line and try to co-inside with a bridge lift, there are 3 a day so its not impossible. Remember, there are east and west sides to the bridge, and both will give you different views. Allow about 90 minutes for it all. The machinery room after is interesting, but abit of an anti-climax. Also, walk up if you can, don't take the lift. You will see more of the inside of the bridge.

An iconic landmark museum. An excellent iconic landmark museum, with high level walkways across the bridge and there is even a glass viewing platform allowing you to see the people and traffic crossing the bridge below. The engine room is very well laid out and informative. Would recommend a visit here.
better view from the river. We loved the bridge and the history but the view from on the river is even more exciting. I recommend it.

Impressive. Viewed from the river and on foot - impressive
Would recommend a walk around the river banks as there are some exception views available if you are looking for that special photo

Tower Bridge - London bridge for the outsiders. Tower bridge is a beautiful sight. you can see the various Yatch on river Thames. Most of the foreigners confuse it with London Bridge. a must see attraction for visitors to London

Just a bridge?. This was my 13 year old son's #1 must-do while we were visiting London in June and he made a great call. If you're visiting the Tower of London plan to leave 90 minutes at the end of the day to stop by Tower Bridge, which right next door. The tour includes seeing the original steam powered mechanism for opening the bridge and the breathtaking view from the glass bottom walkway that spans between the towers. And after the tour you'll end up at Shad Thames, a great spot for dinner!

Good value for money. Something my and husband and I had been wanting to do for a long while, it didn't disappoint. The entrance fee was very reasonable compared to attractions in other cities. Information given very good explaining building of bridge and all its history. Glass walkways certainly both amused and scared all ages! Engine room not so interesting to children. Well worth a look.

Marvelous. Another marvelous gem in London. History explained through pictures and videos. Breathe taking views from the top. We were lucky to be at the top when it opened. Do not miss the engine room.

Worth a visit. We visited this place while in London for the first time. View is excellent with river Thames flowing majestically. I heard that the bridge opens when the ships pass by but could not see for my self.

Makes for great pictures!. We really enjoyed seeing and walking across Tower Bridge. We also paid to climb the stairs to the top, tour the art exhibit, and see the view from the glass walkway. I honestly would probably skip this the next time. I was at 44 at the time and in relatively good shape, but I was literally about to fall over by the time we reached the top. We visited in late July and it was a warm day. It was really warm in the stairwell and also walking around the bridge/art exhibit area at the top. The views of that part of London (and especially of the Tower of London) were fantastic, but I'm not sure they were worth the climb. As I recall there was an elevator available if you are disabled or unable to make the climb for some reason. Tower Bridge is so iconic that I can't imagine going to London and not seeing it. It is literally around the corner from Tower of London so definitely plan on seeing both on the same day. Tower Bridge makes for great pictures...both from the bridge itself and also from the sidewalks that run alongside the river. There is no charge to walk across the bridge...only if you want to see how it operates and/or go up to the glass walkway that spans the top part of the bridge.

One of London's iconic sight!. One of London Iconic sight! Not to be missed. One of the most famous bridge in the world. Go see it close though. It has interesting exhibits and it is worth a close look if you have time.
Only average after having visited the Tower of London. Interesting to understand how it was built, but the walkways were very crowded with everyone wanting to take a picture on the glass floor.

nice walk. Walked across the bridge on the ped. path. Great views and a great bridge. It's a short easy walk. Stopped and took photos on the way. Nice to see the bridge on both the water end via boat and by foot.

Tower Bridge Exhibition. We visited the exhibition using Tesco clubcard days out vouchers, £7.50 become £30 which the family ticket costs so great value.We had a nice day out in London (as North East Londoners!) starting here. It took us about 90 minutes to slowly do both walks and take part in the interactive activities. The glass walks ways are amazing. The videos on both ends were also interesting and entertaining.We followed up with a picnic near city hall and walked to The Monument which our entrance ticket also covered. This was also fun for the kids (exhausting for the adults!).Overall, recommended.

Historic London Landmark. We took the London Bridge tour as included in our London Pass package. A good display of a world renowned landmark with adequate history info. Staff were very good and the facility was well kept. Plan for 1-2 hours.

Good for the whole family. Next to theTower of London. Often confused with London Bridge. This is a paid attraction. You would need about 2 hours. Great views if the city. You can either walk up the stairs or take the elevator. There are two glass floors. Many tourist lay on them, taking a selfie with a boat passing underneath.

The roller coaster ride of fun...!!!. I have stayed 3 years in London as a student and worked for the same but it gives me chills whn I had an opportunity to visit London anytime, what a better time to visit during New Years season.It's always a pleasure to be there by London bridge, it gives The immense pleasure to check out how beautiful and peaceful to stay around that monument. It took several years of hard work to complete that price of art to life. I would suggest to go around have some ME time and relax London's so beautiful and peaceful...!!!
as scene on tv. Great to be there! And know that Tower bridge is often mistaken as London Bridge. Will be looking for it in the British films now, and saying, I was there!

Grand Old Structural Marvel. Interesting and historical structure, plus the easiest way to also get a good picture of the Tower of London! Recommend going up into the two support towers to see how the old bridge worked. Impressive

Great piece of History. I've seen Tower Bridge many times and walked over it several but this was the first time I've crossed the walkway. It gives you an excellent view of the Thames and of the City. The glass floors are brilliant, we were lucky when we were there as they raised the Bridge to let a ship through so we got a front seat view of the workings. From the Bridge we went to the engine rooms where an old steam engine runs. The Tower and engine rooms are well worth a visit and if you book online before you go you get a joint ticket with the Monument and at a discount price.

Must-see landmark in London. It is one of the must-see landmarks in England. The view from Tower London is very nice, easily to get a nice group photo or selfie with it as the background. I love the blue paint and the royal logo on the bridge.

Worth doing. This was a fun stop for us in London. I didn't realize you could walk through the upper supports of this amazing bridge! Great views from the top! This bridge has some amazing engineering built into it...considering it's age. Great to get a behind the scenes look. It wasn't overly busy when we were there so that made it nice. This surprised me as I though people would be queing up to see this bridge particularly given it's proximity to the Tower of London. I would recommend taking in this attraction if you get to this part of town!
Iconic as London itself...... Fantastic, worth the money if only to find out how it was built and how it still work.Good piece of history and a good day out.

Worth adding to your trip. This was a short but great tourist stop. A beautiful bridge with lots of cool history. The view down the Thames was amazing. They also have a glass floor that was totally freaky to walk across

It's the iconic London landmark. Though named Tower Bridge, everyone still calls it London Bridge, while the actual London Bridge (ordinary looking bridge) is located near the London Bridge tube station or Monument to the Great FIre of London. Best view is by walking along the river Thames towards the bridge, and then crossing it to have a better detailed view of the bridge itself.

Take the tip to the top!. I have been to London before but did not take the trip to the top of the Tower Bridge. It is a must! You go up to the top where the floor is glass! It is amazing to look down at the water and the ships. The day I went there was not a big line an I only had to wait about ten minutes. It was well worth it. They even took a picture of me sitting on the glass. After that you can go to the boiler room and go through that. I would do it again!

The Picture of London. When you think of London you think Tower Bridge - this iconic bridge that spans the Thames river is AMAZING! Just a walk over or the tour you will want to make this a stop in one of the best cities in the world!
Beautiful blue trimmed bridge. It takes ALOT to impress me BUT this Tower Bridge is beautiful. And I love the fact that the red double decker bus is in this pic....lol...I love the little things

Great Experience!. This is a great way to spend an hour inside one of the most iconic bridges of the world. Go up in a lift in one tower to a brief film intro before walking along one of the high level walk ways to the opposite tower with fantastic views across London - quite a challenge for some one like me with vertigo - but there is a hand rail all the way for the 'vertically' challenged.In the south tower there is another film waiting or you can just go back along the other walk way - and then back again! Both walk ways have glass floors half way along - great for taking selfies on with your feet hovering over the traffic below.There is plenty of info about how the bridge was built but to be honest we just marvelled at the views.At the end of the bridge there is a short walk to the engine rooms.Good value for the £9/adult it cost.

Nce walk and site seeing. Wife and I took a Thames River cruise and exited at the Tower of London and went over to walk the Tower Bridge. It was a beautiful spring evening with the sun going down. The bridge is fun to walk and you get a nice view of the river. If you went earlier in the day you could then hop back on the Thames River tour and come back to the Big Ben area. The walk is easy and you can take your time. Would even be assessable for a wheelchair user.

Great Experience. I recommend visiting the bridge and experiencing the glass floor. It was really nice. My kids loved it a lot. Also, you can enrich your knowledge about the construction of the bridge
Take great pictures.. Looked kind of spooky to me, but it is definitely one of the must see in London. Ride tour bus up top so you can take great pictures.
Must see when you go to The Tower. Worth walking across to get some nice views of The Tower. Can be crowded at times. Some shopping on the other side from The Tower.

Best for Children. The tower bridge was pretty amazing in its structure and architecture. The tour and directions were pretty clear and the view was amazing. There is a stamp tour for children and they can get prizes after completion.

One of the most iconic monuments in London.. One of the most iconic monuments in London. This amazing bridge is a combined bascule and suspension bridge. The bascule, in the middle, is opened about one thousand times per year to let ships sail up or down the River Thames. I was fortunate to cross the bridge during the London marathon in the year 2000, which was also an incredible experience.

Wow!. Standing on, looking at and walking over was amazing on such an iconic structure. Tower of London nearby - all makes for a surreal and amazing experience with this part of London's history. Love it.

Gorgeous to photograph both in the day and night. The tower bridge is the most featured bridges in the world. Don't be fooled like me by the song "London bridge is falling down" and relate London bridge with this famous bridge.
Tower Bridge is not falling down. Thought the experience was good but could do more with the upper cross section and view. Seems to waste the space with having nothing up there except pictures.

Historic Tower Bridge. The Tower Bridge in London is a must see, and a must cross! The bridge reeks in history, and you can imagine yourself hundreds of years ago, what it must have been like to have lived and crossed it then in your daily life! Yes there is a ton of things to see in London, but I would recommend crossing this bridge to see what's on the other side!!
It is not Falling down.. You can take tours of the original mechanical structure in the warm months. Surely a modern marvel of it's time.
Must see site for London. what an awesome looking bridge, and very close to the white castle. This is not the London bridge, as that is now in Arizona I believe.

Great history, superb views. My students went for the history rather than the views. You might have problems if you have a thing about heights (as I do) but the sense of the city from here is unique. And the workings of the bridge are fascinating.
All the bridges are worth seeing. Walking across at night is awesome you see the sparkling lights of the city. Its an awesome view of the Tower itself.

One of the world's most famous bridges!. Tower Bridge is perhaps the world's most famous bridge. I suppose most people already have seen a picture of this bridge, but it is far more impressive to experience it yourself. This is one of the must dos in London. You can walk across the entire bridge, and this will give you good views of the River Thames and the surrounding buildings. You also can walk on a glass floor somewhere between the towers. I haven't tried this myself, but I can imagine it is worth the money it costs. This will give you even better views of River Thames and the surroundings. If possible, try to be near the bridge when it opens! You should visit the bridge twice. Once at daytime, and once when it's dark. The bridge is lit up in the dark and looks really nice!
Best Bridge in the World. Tower Bridge the most well known and best bridge in the world. The view of it in the London skyline makes you feel excited to go and see it. A must if you are in London.
Over and under. Been over the bridge several times , been under the bridge never seen it open. So, worth a trip back to make sure I do see it open!

Worth seeing . Friendly staff and lift or stairs to take you to the top. Try to plan for when the bridge lifts , it only takes a few minutes and seems to lift a few times each day. They list the lifts when you are inside. Tour doesn't take long so worth doing after Tower of London. On leaving St Catherine's Dock is near for a view
One of the most beautiful bridges in the world. Commonly confused with the plain London Bridge, the Tower Bridge is well recognized thru the world as a London landmark. It really is a must see.

I will return in the Fall or the winter when it will be quiter I hope to source what I did not see this time around. I found the lines were long. buying your ticket when the rain is pouring down on you with no cover is not niceotherwise most interesting one could spend hours learning about how detail the bridge was built.
A unique bridge. A bridge that you should either drive on or walk along to get a sense of London away from land. The parting is superb.

Getting high on good things.. A great London experience at a relatively low cost. Looking down, through the glass floor, onto the cars and buses driving over the bridge below is a fun. We were lucky to be there when the bridge was about to open and it was great viewing it happening from above. With our time being tight we weren't able to read and take in all the history and construction details which would be good to go back to. For very little extra cost your ticket can include your going up Monument tower which is quite a climb but well worth it! The two go together very well. :)
Most see. One of the must charismatic monument of London! Definitely a must SEE! Also has a museum to see that you can go!
Tower Bridge Great Experience. Iconic structure that defines London and is recognizable by anyone. View of Thames and surrounding building is amazing from Top of this bridge
Tower Bridge. My Favourite Bridge, absolutely beautiful and not that far from where I live. Looks fantastic when it is all lit up at night

Must see at night. This is definitely one of those attractions you want to see at night. The bridge is all lit up and it makes for a wonderful stroll. Also, you can't beat free! For a fee you can go up and walk above the bridge. We just missed the time cutoff on our trip.

history of bridge plus the fright factor of the glass floor!. Climb to the upper walkway and fool your senses by stepping on the glass floor and looking at the traffic and river below. Most surprising fact,when this bridge was built in the reign of Queen Victoria there was only one other bridge in London across the Thames.
Historical Landmark in London.. One of the Landmarks you have to visit as a tourist in London. You get a nice view on the Thames and parts of the Lodnon Skyline.
Tower Bridge is best seen on two feet. Tower Bridge is best seen by walking we have only done it a couple of times but its a must beats going over in a vehicle any day of the week

Awesome history. What a view, the walk up the stairs was worth it, we had the best luck in that the bridge closed to lift the road part and we were on top and able to look down through the newly installed glass floors to view it all. The history of the bridge and the videos were ok.

Tower Bridge. In summertime the line up is more than 1 hour. In winterseason you can get in almost immediately. In the summer the warm is very high so bring water and do not bring children, they can be a nightmare because of the waiting time. :o) You can go all the way up to the top and cross the bridge on the walkingpath on the top to the next tower.Awesome wiew from the top. In the bottom of the pillars you can see the mechanism that made the bridge go up, together with a small museum showing how things was operated at that time. with wax figures showing how. aroun 14 pound for an entrance ticket. But London on the Go. Can offer you package with dicount tickets for both museum and coffe and food. Together with the transport dicount, Buy one it is worth the money if you will stay more than 3 days.

Definately worth a visit very interesting. Brilliant tour. Walking across glass walkways brilliant. Timed it to see the bridge raise and boats go through definitely worth doing that. The engine room was very interesting. Staff helpful. Amazing views

The Thames As Never Seen Before. I don't like heights but simply had to do the Tower Bridge tour after hearing all about it from my cousin who'd been there last year. We were not disappointed. It was our Golden Wedding so we just had to do something different - all sorts of events take place there. It is possible to climb the steps up to the walkways, but we haven't got that sort of energy so used the lift with everyone else. Once up there, there are great views of the river. We particularly enjoyed looking down through the glass panels in part of the floor, but it took a bit of getting used to. If you time it right it is possible to see the bridge go up, but we caught this before doing the tour. There were several guides on hand for help and advice and one young lady was very kindly taking photos for everyone. There were panels full of information about the most famous bridge in the world, all along the walkways. The tour continues further along the road into the engine rooms. Much as we'd loved to have seen them, time was getting on, so we gave that part a miss. Maybe we'll do it another time when in London. Well worth a visit.
Very instresting the story of the bridge. Good value for moneyThe history and the story of the bridge came across very well and a great gift shop

Spent an entire day there! Beautiful. Firstly the "Tower Bridge" is the official LOndon Bridge. The other bridge called the London bridge on the map is nothing extraordinary. You can visit the tower bridge once you do the Tower of London. It's the most beautiful sight and stay until the lights come on. We spent almost a whole day just marveling at the architecture. You can pay and get to the next level of the bridge which we didn't. But the view of the tower bridge itself is magnificent. This is by far my favorite monument in London! The highlight was that we saw the bridge open and close many times during the course of the time we were there.

What a view!!. If you visit The Tower of London, then it stands to reason, you should walk across Tower Bridge as well. It gives you stunning views up and down the river. Easy to access and safe to walk across. Many people think this is London Bridge but it isn't! London Bridge is actually a tourist attraction in the USA (in Nevada)!
Beautiful place to meet. Tower bridge its an unique bridge! So charming, romantic. Loved the blue details! A must visit. Enjoy!
Tower Bridge Pics from Tower Castle. Beautiful views of the bridge from Tower Castle - great picture spot too. Meet the Tower Bridge operator if possible - he's awesome!

Check the website. Tower Bridge, one of our most iconic treasures in London. Well worth checking out the website for bridge opening times. This will give you not only the times but also what ship, or Thames barge will travelling through the uplifted bridge. Well worth going to see it, I went Saturday 27th to see the Thames Barge 'Kitty' travel down and up the river, my late grandfather captained the barge for many years. I asked one of the Tower Bridge workers where was the best place to stand to get a photo and he couldn't have been more helpful. Following his advice I was able to get to the front of where people are asked to stand and managed to get some wonderful photographs for the family. A beautiful summer's evening and a breathtaking shot taken of a wonderful barge. Remember to watch the lift and ship pass through it's free.

Beautifully cleaned Bridge. Visited Tower Bridge for the first time in 30 years. Most of the buildings on the bridge are now part of the tower bridge museum. It is accessible by foot via the "dead man's hole". Nice to revisit this magnificent icon of London. st Katherine's dockyard is also worth walking through to see the old style sailing ships.

Beautiful Historic Monument!. You can get a beautiful view of the bridge on the side of the Tower of London. There are park benches there where you can sit and admire the bridge. We walked across in about 10 min and took a double decker bus back across the bridge. It was a fun day!

Terrific Tower Bridge Experience - add it to your list for London!. "The most famous bridge in the world" is what we're told Tower Bridge is; so what could be better than getting inside & up it?! We paid £18 for a family ticket of 2 adults and a child aged 5-15 (the price it would be for just 2 adults alone). Tickets can be bought at the gift shop at the end of the tour (the Engine Rooms & Shop) which is situated below the southern end of the bridge (and had no queue) or the beginning (the North Tower) which had a slight queue. I noticed a possible £2 off something (not sure if it was for tickets) with people flyering outside the Main Entrance at the foot of the North Tower.You're given the option to go up in the lift or use the stairs. We used the stairs and I'd highly recommend that - you get to see the structure of the tower itself (seems a shame to waste that opportunity).Once on the walkways, I loved that there were small openings through which you could put your camera through to get a photograph either up or down river and with no glass in the way. Also, the glass walkways on both sides were brilliant.If you can, I'd suggest looking up the bridge opening times for that day and trying to coincide being on the walkway around that time; it would offer you a great view.Really recommend this.

Beautiful bridge . The architecture of this bridge is amazing I wish more then anything I had gone up in the tower but did not have time. I got to see it from the Tower of London area very cool if your already seeing the Tower of London it's right there don't miss it

Not to miss. When in London u can't miss going to this bridge. It's easily reachable and is also a part of the bus tours in the city. The view is great, picturesque to remember. Stroll here and breathe in some nice views of Thames and the ships passing underneath.

If I had to pick one bridge to love then I choose Tower Bridge.. Tower Bridge gets mistaken for the London Bridge by tourists so the first thing to note is that they are not the same thing. The architecture is amazing, seeing the drawbridge portion in action is impressive, the tour is interesting, and the view from the walkway is beautiful. If walk on the walkway and view London from this location then go on the London Eye then you will see London from some of the best vantage points available. When I go back to London I will definitely go to Tower Bridge. It only takes about 30-60 minutes to experience it and it is definitely worth it.
Weekend away . We went on the bridge walk and although it was scary it was also fun. Well worth a vist. And it's a good price

A quick fix. A little known tourist attraction it was quite an experience to walk over the top of this bridge and the views up and down the river were well worth it. Reasonably priced as well, it didn't take up a lot of time but I would go again.

Amazing chance to see London sky line. I would recommend this attraction. We travelled by train and we had a voucher for buy one get one free. So it only cost us £9.00 for two people. Normal entry is £9.00 per adult. I also saw people use the London pass. If you are not physically fit or have small children, I would recommend you take the lift to the top of the tower. There was and incredible amount of stairs to climb. Once you are up the top of the towers there is a glass walkway you can venture across and see the road and river Thames below you. It's incredible and great fun. You can take some amazing pictures. The views of London are spectacular. 360 degree views. There are lots of history boards and facts to read. Children love this attraction as much as the adults. Once you have walked down either side of the tower run ways you get the chance to follow the blue line to the engine room. Do not miss this chance. We nearly did not go and would have regreted it, incredible Victorian engine room full of facts. Gift shop has some gorgeous ideas for presents, This is a reasonably priced fun attraction. I would recommend it without a doubt.

Glass Bottom Walkway is a Must. This was one of the best sites that we visited in London. The videos are informative, the views are amazing, but the best part is the glass sections of the walkway. This is super cool and worth the visit in itself.

Landmark of London !!. Its definitely worth for a few photo shots! If you do not have derth of time then you can be here and enjoy the view when it opens and also the night view is good. We were here during the day time and it was worth a visit. To reach this point, take an underground to London bridge station and from there its a 10 mins walk. You get a good view of the entire bridge.
Scenic beauty, with history.. A place to stroll, feel the history, and watch the hustle - bustle of London traffic. You can also watch the traffic on the River Thames.

What a view!. You will never forgive yourself if you don't go up and see the view. From the large windows all around to the clear floors that give you a breathtaking view of the Thames below you will be enthralled.

A must see. If you are visiting London you have to see the Tower Bridge. It is the most famous bridge of the capital and one of the most beautiful in the world. The views from the tower are amazing. If you are climbing the towers be ready to sweat a little bit!
Great. Amazing this landmark, whatever the weather, and especially when timed for when it opens.A very enjoyable attraction.

You need good knees!. This is well worth a visit but if the lift isn't working you have a spiral staircase at the beginning of your visit, and a regular staircase at the other end! Its quite a hike but worth it for the views, and you get terrific photos.
Great tour with great views.. A short and sweet history of the bridge with magnificent views of the water. Loved the glass floor on both sides of the top of the bridge platforms.

Well worth a visit. The Tower Bridge Experience is great for a visit. Not only do you get to climb up the towers but you also get to walk along the walkways that join the two towers. There are some great views from the walkways and the exhibits explaining the history and the mechanism. There are some expensive photo opportunities but you're not pressured to buy. Suitable for all ages and there are lifts for those who need them.

Awesome - Exceeds Expectations. The Tower Bridge experience literally enables you to get inside this iconic symbol of London and the wonderful Victorian design and engineering, which still operates so effectively and efficiently to carry the A100 over the Thames, more than 100 years after it was built.And it's great to look down and see boats passing underneath the lifting roadway directly below one's feet, as well as to take in the architecture, the history of its construction and the machinery which has stood the test of time, including 2 world wars, not to mention the story of many of the world's great bridges.Awesome as well as being excellent value for money.

Nice. This is a global trend.... glass bottom monument or attraction. It started with the on line Grand Canon, than one in Aiguille du Midi in Chamonix France and now Tower Bridge.Beautiful bridge, very nice view on London.Go early so you avoid the queue.

Go for the glass floor!. The overall tour is quite interesting and enjoyable. My favorite part was standing on the glass walkway looking down at the bridge and passing boats beneath your feet. It was almost like walking on air!It is a relatively short tour and inexpensive.

The Most Iconic Picture of London. This attraction is well worth a quick visit, especially after spending time at The Tower. I didn’t really pay too much attention to the history, because I was so distracted by the glass floor. Without a doubt, I think this is the best attraction in London to get a picture that will be the envy of all your Instagram friends! My blog, Sunny in London features a full review and explains why.

Great for photos. The museum part of the bridge is interesting, but not very memorable, to be honest. It's one of those things that's better to take photos of as opposed to paying for the attraction part of it.
Good Experience. This was fun to walk across the glass walkway and the city views were nice from this vantage point. I would recommend. Grab a latte at the nearby Starbucks and then head over.

Worth a Look.... Tower Bridge its a symbol of London for sure. Officially open since 1894, its design and structure was made to synchronize with the nearby Tower of London. Even though it wasn't a favorite of the locals, it clearly grew on them and its a must see in London when you walk along the Thames River.Tip: You can get the best pictures from the City Hall park on the side of the Bridge.
Like in a fairy tale. This is so beautiful, when you see this, you realise you're in London. It's amazing and it has an amazing view on Thames and City!
Best way how to see London. the best option to see London is to visit my booking box best offers on home page, it will gives you the best price and options.

Wow this is the best sight in london. This is not only the nicest bridge in London but possibly in the world ... It is just iconic from every angle and an essential viewing for everyone visiting London

Glass walkway visit. Nice and friendly staff which were more than happy to take photos for me and my partner! Great fun and good views from the top however lots of walking! Very decent price for the overall experience, would highly recommend to do at some point if visiting the area! no food or drink facilities so wouldn't recommend spending long amounts of time here.

A quick but worthwhile stop. It doesn't take long to see Tower Bridge, so you might as well stop by! Plus it's right next to the Tower of London, so we visited them both in the same trip. It is such an iconic landmark that you shouldn't miss it!

Tower bridge. Went to tower bridge is was great we used a 2 for 1 voucher so I cost us less the £10 in which was good The best part of the trip was walking over the bridge and seeing the view of London we was lucky enough to see tower bridge open when we was there. It's worth checking the dates the the tower bridge website to see what day they open and vists when the bridge open. Would good again I loved it

The bridge went up. We were at the top, looking down when the bridge went up to let a boat through. The glass floor was so cool to watch this happen through. Going to the top doesn't take a whole lot of time, but it's really cool. If you can, go when the bridge is scheduled to go up. It's such a beautiful bridge to start with and getting another view is great.

Worth a trip. If you can I would advise that you walk up rather than taking the lift as you see more of the interior of the building. Taking the lift is very time consuming, we had to take the lift to return to ground level & we were waiting a long time for it to arrive. The area we waited to catch the lift got very full due to the time delay & people were getting quite fed up. Just a warning also, it can get pretty squashed in the lift. There are some short films that you can watch about thew building of the bridge which are ok but the screens up on the top area where the glass floor is are a bit pointless watching as visitors are constantly walking infront of the screen & it can be noisy. Not the visitors fault just a bit of a bad set up. The views from the top are very good & worth seeing along with a visit to the engine rooms which are a very short walk away. I would advise a visit but it is a shame that the set up isn't a-little better.

One of London's Prettiest spots. This is great part of town to be in and well worth an explore whether you are a tourist or just visiting for the day it is certainly a lovely place to be with so many great places in close proximity you wont be disappointed.

magnificient. the experience was magnificient...the entire journey around and on the bridge was nice. However I would have like to spend more time walking on the bridge . Also we could not see the bridge make way for ships.. as it was not the right time of our visitneed to check that before you travelthat is the crux of the whole visit or else it will be more of something you heard about and dint see than " I heard about it and saw it too!!

The jewels. It's also a place too see. Have not being for a number of years. But we are going again this august.I love the jewels. When we have being to london we don't go to the sight seeing things because we have seen them before and enjoyed. But this august we will be taking brother in law and wife for 60th birthday.
tower bridge. long history excellent views not a lot here but quiet local to get to quite a lot of other ATTRACTIONS
decent tell em lad. looked cool when it opened the bridge to let the ships through. probably the best bridge to look at in london. looks like a faff to cross though

Nothing much here except.... A trip here is very short especially there isn't much to see or learn about the bridge itself. The only thing worth coming here is the glass flooring where you can take photo of you lying on with the traffic or river below you.

Great view and facinating engine room. We only toured because it was free with London card and we had been to the Tower of London - but it was great. Impressive views of the Thames and city from the walkways (including a glass panel floor), well preserved engine room with historic steam engines - we loved it. So historic and one of the best attractions in London.

Awesome View. This is an awesome bridge on river Thames. We visited the Tower Bridge Museum and clicked many pictures from the top. The museum has an entry fee of 9GBP. We also walked along the gardens near the bridge. We saw a band performing near the river bed and it was awesome. Over all it was a nice place to visit. T

Walking the London Tower Bridge. Get a great insight into the design and construction of one of the iconic bridges across the Thames. Spell bound views thru the glass floor of the bridge opening up and allowing the ships to pass thru .Also walk thru the engine room displaying the gigantic engines .Splendid 360 degree views from the bridge -Land and Water !

Very Beautiful. What a beautiful bridge and we had the opportunity to see the bridge raised to allow a large cruise ship to pass thru. It is truly impressive and something you do not want to miss seeing and of course you can also walk across it. A definite must see.

What a sight!. Another must-see when in London and right next to the Tower of London so you can kill two birds with one stone. Luckily enough a cruise liner was passing through so the bridge came up to let it through.

Great London Landmark. We had missed visiting this iconic landmark on our last visit to London. We are very glad that we were able to see it this time.The British people can be proud of how well this site is maintained especially as it is an integral part of the city's transport infrastructure.

Beautiful. The Tower Bridge is one of the most famous bridges in the world and is arguably London's most popular symbol. It is majestic and grand. Due to its beauty, it makes for great photo opportunities. For London Pass holders, the Tower Bridge Experience is free and it is quite wonderful too. Others can get in for a fee.

Day Out. We visited Tower Bridge & were pleasantly surprised at how easily we purchased tickets without a wait. Price for a family we felt was reasonable for a London tourist attraction. The views are amazing & the children were very excited at being able to walk over the glass bottom floor. There are lots of very interesting facts and the engine room is fascinating.

The No 1 Iconic London Tourist Landmark. We celebrated my good lady's birthday with a Thames dinner cruise the highlight was going under London bridge and seeing it in all its glory in the day and even more stunning at night.A must see for every one.

Full of engineering feats. . One must marvel at the sheer beauty and practicality of this bridge. A must-see is its exhibition which also showcase the steam engines and notes on how it operates. One can also take photos of glass flooring at the top of the bridge. It is an experience to have a view of traffic moving under you!

When in London.... Is this the bridge that is falling down in my nursery rhyme? Cool, we're driving across it! We hopped on one of the infamous double decker buses and braved the elements. It took all of a minute to get across. The towers are pretty impressive.

ICONIC LANDMARK OF LONDON. One of the must see , this is one of the many bridges across thames but by far the most famous one.Did not get to see the cantilever open. Saw the tower bridge from the tower of london side, during thames cruise and also from the opposite side of the tower. Whichever side you viewed it it is amazing. Also crossed the bridge on foot top complete my tour of the tower bridge. Worth it,
Victorian Landmark. A landmark over the River Thames, this Gothic Victorian structure epitomises London. So close to the Tower of London you have to see it.

yeees. Tower Bridge was one of the first attractions I saw when I arrived in London. It was during the Olympic Games so it was absolutely crazy. Apart from that I was fascinated by the order and the buildings in this area. I love London and this part is absolutely a must see.

Tower Bridge London. Get your camera ready when you visit this place as the views are great. Check the weather before hand as you want to visit on a clear day to get the best camera shots. If you like bridges you can ready about the different bridges around the world and how they were made. (personally I liked looking at the pictures more.)I wouldn't go with really young family members as there really is not much for little ones to do, but go for the views and picture taking opportunities. The Exhibition is good for the history and you can watch a short video of how the Tower of London came about. You can take the lift but is quicker to walk, if you are feeling fit! There is a lot of stairs and you will be going up quite steep steps. So if you want to keep fit go up the stairs. Good thing about the stairs there are toilet facilities as you walk.

Iconic. One of the most iconic landmarks of London. It is so impressive and from the right angle you can get the most amazing pictures of the bridge and more modern buildings in the background to show the most amazing mixture of old and new. Walking on the bridge is like walking on a piece of history, Definitely worth a visit. I was lucky enough to see the bridge open while on a river cruise one time as well, which is an amazing sight to see and imagine how impressive this must have been at the time the bridge was built.

Interesting couple of hours. If you have the "how does it work" gene then this is very interesting. The method of construction and the method of lifting the road is described very well. The glass floor occupied us for five minutes and is well worth the trip, but it's - well: a glass floor...The steam engines at the end are magnificent even if all you do is look at the paint job!
A London landmark. Worth the time to visit this London landmark. There is a fee if you want go to the top of the towers and walk across the upper part of the bridge.

amazing isnt enough of a description. it is amazing how this bridge operates and the fact that it has stood the test of time over so long a period as our bridges here are falling apart. a true testimonial to the builders of time gone by a must see. Make it part of your visit to the TOWER OF LONDON it is just a few steps away.

Beautiful bridge. Beautiful old bridge, was fortune enough to see it rise as a big sailboat had to pass. Walked over it, but I'm sad I didn't do the tour in the upper floor and engine room. Will do it next time I'm in London.

Amazing! . I finally got around to having a look inside Tower Bridge and I wasn't disappointed. My advice is don't use the lifts use the stairs they are amazing to see! And now with the glass walkway it's only 42ish meters up so there is no need to be scared of walking on it!!And as for the engine room, well you just need to see it for yourself!

Great history and excellent views. great exhibitions and lots to learn about and see. Great feature of the disorientating glass walkways which offer a perfect photo opportunity for the brave. Fascinating history and facts to learn. Value for money and recommended.
Worth the walk. Due to the closing of a few tube stops, we had more of a walk than expected but it was worth it. Enjoyed getting closer to the bridge and then finally crossing it.
Beautiful bridge - spectacular view.. Worth a visit, especially around sunset. Right near the Tower of London, and easy walking distance to shops on Thames' West Bank.

Great look into history. Great to walk over the bridge and we also did the glass floor walk on the upper level of the bridge. We were lucky that the bridge was due to open whilst we were in the upper level so this was really special. A great look into history. Well worth visiting this attraction.
A little touristy, but worth it. We enjoyed walking across it and going up to the "glass floor." The views are wonderful. The bridge exhibit is interesting and it wasn't very crowded.

A fun experience. I wasn't really sure if paying for a ticket to tour the Tower Bridge would be worth it, but I am so glad that we did! Viewing the bridge from the top deck and looking down through the glass floor was quite the experience. You get a great view of the city and get to see the bridge from a whole new perspective.....and the glass floor is just fun! You can also tour the engine rooms which are quite remarkable. By the way, we used the 2 for 1 voucher that you can get by purchasing a travel card. A great way to save money!

Good but too many people. This is nice to walk across from either direction, you also get some lovely views. Perhaps pick your time to see it, during the day we went there were so many people! However, it's still beautiful and a must see when in London.

Informative, fun, and what a view!. I visited the Tower Bridge using the London Pass and came from the Tower of London (just within walking distance). You can take stairs or an elevator to the top where there's a video giving you the background information and history leading up the building of the bridge. Next, you walk across the top (it's enclosed) and over a glass floor allowing you to see the road and river just below. Signs along the way tell you about other famous bridges around the world. Another video awaits you at the other end, a d you can walk down the other side (again with a portion of glass floor). Once you go downstairs on the other side, you walk to the engine room. There are even some hands on act cities to show you how the steam engines/bridge types work. Kids (and adults) would love this attraction. Also, there a cute little square as you exit the gift shop that had some nice cafés- perfect for lunch!

The Real London Bridge. All the times we've sang the 'London Bridge' song, we should have been singing about Tower Bridge instead, which is the real icon along River Thames. Check the website for Bridge lifting timings and plan your trip accordingly! It is quite a sight to see the bridge lift whether from afar or via the glass floor up on the bridge monument.

Affordable, great staff, great for kids. Very affordable to visit engine room and glass bottom roof at top of bridge. You can save a little more with tourist brochure with a scan code for 20% off, every little bit helps. The staff very friendly and system works well. My son loved the glass bottom floor at top of bridge, needless to say if you suffer from vertigo like me just walk along sides and you will be alright, as long as other people get out of your way ( they can see your a little distressed and won't move but you get that in high tourist season). Great experience, look at bridge opening times and make sure you see it open as it makes the experience complete. Put aside an hour and half a little longer if you stay for bridge opening which they do 3 times a day.

Pride of london. Anyone visiting london, must see this tower bridge. It is worth spending some time on it. It is picturesque and majestic too. First timers generally walk the length of this bridge to soak the feel of london
Where the Jewels Are...... The Big Bus ride over the bridge was the highlight of my trip. The pictures I have are stunning. Can't say enough about this spectacular city.

An icon on the Thames. This is probably on of the most well known bridges in the world, but many people think it's London Bridge which it isn't. Tower Bridge is a unique structure and reminds us that the Tower was used to hold Royal prisoners and traitors to the realm.

Excellent views from the top of the bridge. We enjoyed visiting the bridge and climbing up to the top of the towers. The glass floored walkway linking the towers was very fun.An added bonus was the view of the river Thames and and the London skyline including the Tower of London. The history of the bridge and its construction was very informative.

Great experience. Being able to cross this bridge at road level then at the top and watch the traffic below through the glass floor was exciting, well worth it and to see the old workings in the engine room was interesting too,. Would love to have seen it open up, you can check the website to find out times.

Tower Bridge Experience. The Tower Bridge is a must visit if you're a tourist to London. Mostly,misintepreted to be the London Bridge,the view from top right through the glass flooring is beautiful .If you are lucky enough you might even see the bridge opening. It is also a great location with fantastic restaraunts all around.Overall a great place to visit .

Most beautiful bridge in London.. Spectacular piece of engineering. Bridge opens up for tall ship to sail through and close up for traffic in minutes. You can view the bridge from anywhere near The Tower of London, London Bridge, bus number 15, walk out from Tower Hill and Tower gateway station.. Go there at night and see the lights lit up, is magical.
amazing structure. amazing structure, you will feel like you are living the life you have seen in movie. should try once.

glas view. it was very crowded around the glass bottom view when the bridge lifted up, but seeing the barge sail ship go through is a memory that will stay with me. the bridge lift up is faster than i thought it would be. seeing it lit up at night was just beautiful and we also managed to see the bridge lift up again (this time from the side of it) so we saw two different lifting views. this is well worth the money especially when compared to other attractions. forget the other attractions, in my opinion this is the first and a treasure to england (not just london)

Beautiful bridge and a cute glass floor. Lets start by the very obvious thing - the bridge is indeed beautiful. It takes you a couple of minutes to realize that you were wrong your entire childhood when you pictured this bridge in mind and you called it the London bridge.The London bridge is in fact an ordinary bridge down the river.A new attraction was opened recently that includes going up the bridge and walking/lying on a glass floor.
