If you try to forget the fact that a couple of months ago a tourist dropped a bottle on the glass floor and cracked it you can start enjoying this attraction and start taking selfies of you lying on the floor "falling" to the ground.After a while you get used to this floor and the magic disappears.I was told that the bridge is packed with people when actual boats cross the river and require the bridge to open to let them pass. If you have a chance to be there at that time it is probably quite an experience.So to sum it up: cute glass floor, beautiful bridge. If you have an hour to kill, go for it, if you are short of time you can see the bridge, take a picture of it and continue to the Tower of London.
Beautiful ! Must see !. The famous bridge is beautiful ! Be sure to visit the exhibition which is nice. It includes a visit to the separate the engine room which is impressive.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. My daughter wanted to visit Tower Bridge as she had seen the glass floor advertised! So I secured some advance tickets and we made our way over there on a busy Saturday afternoon.It is very easy to find look for the massive towers over the river and you can't go wrong! Tickets checked and we were in. The glass floors are great fun but a little bit scary! Took a while before we would stand on them and take some pics!The rest of the attraction is very entertaining and informative.We really enjoyed our time there.

As long as you are in this part of town you may as well. There is not a whole lot to do on the tour, especially if you have 2 kids that won't sit through a movie. The glass floor was pretty neat so that you could watch the traffic below you. We got in free with the London pass, so if you get in free its worthwhile.

Must See, Obviously. I happened to cross the Tower Bridge a few times on my July 2014 trip. One of them included a bridge opening, and another a walk on top of the bridge. Here are the impressions: First of all, if you're in London for the first time, you must see this bridge at least once, obviously. This is the second most famous landmark of a top world city, so there's little excuse for not coming here. Keep in mind that it's a bit further out though, some pictures/collages digitally overlay it on top of the Westminster district (next to the Big Ben and London Eye), but in fact it's quite a bit to the east.For the bridge lift: it's nothing super-interesting, but worth it if you have the time. Check online for lift hours, and come a bit in advance. If you come in the morning, there is a place just to the east on the south bank which is accessible during the low tide (and with little to no tourists!), so you can take a perfect picture. In the afternoon there's the Tower of London area on the northern side (probably very crowded at any time), or the south bank promenade.The bridge exhibit and top of the bridge: it's a bit disappointing, but if you have a card like the LondonPass, then why not. You get to see some nice views from the top, the history of the tower, and the engine room.

Stunningly Beautiful. The Tower Bridge is perhaps the most beautiful icon in all of London. From the Tower of London, you can get a good view shot of the Tower Bridge. It is worth travelling all the way to this point, just to take a snap of this stunning beauty.

Nice view. We saw tower bridge from outside in Apr 2015 during our family trip to Europe. We saw it from the London Eye and thames cruise. We also saw it from outside tower of london. The view is superb.
Nice Place. A very popular tourist attraction. If you are planning to visit this place wait for a ship to arrive and pass by bridge and enjoy the opening and closing of the bridge.

A piece of history. Being able to head up to the top of the tower, hear and see the history behind Tower Bridge, walking across the top of the bridge....great!! Every time I see this in a movie, I think 'I've been there!'.

Superb attraction and excellent value. This has to be a 'must do' attraction for anyone visiting London. It is not only a famous London landmark but it is an excellent attraction, very reasonably priced (£9 for 2 if the railway 2for1 offer used), great views and very interesting to. The staff were extremely friendly too. A true 5 star attraction. :-)

One of the world's 500 famous buildings. Iconic landmark in the heart of London - brilliant to get a water bus and go under it. It's got everything - history, impressive architecture, moving parts (!), and the River Thames.

Beautiful view from the riverside!. I actually thought this was the London Bridge at first, but the London Bridge is just a normal bridge. The Tower Bridge is further down the river. I walked along the Thames River for several hours taking in the sites and the awesome street food along the way. I finally made it to this famous landmark. It was worth the walk. I enjoyed seeing it. They don't make bridges like this anymore.

Fantastic views through the glass floor. We visited the Tower Bridge Exhibition, the mini museum that can be found in the upper parts of the bridge. We loved it, but our 30 teenage students had had enough after about 15 minutes. That sure is a lot shorter than the 1.5 hours that we were told about by Exhibition staff... However, the views were great and so was the experience, so I would recommend a short visit anyway!

Best bridge to see in London. Very detailed bridge which gives some great photos from lots of angles. It is near the Tower of London so not near most of London's other attractions but it is worth the walk or tube ride to see it.
GREAT. Wonderful, great history, we walked over the bridge that many times, the tour and the view was amaxing.

Walking over the Bridge or going up in the Tower is worth it. This is something fun to watch esp. when they raise the bridge. you can go up in the Tower to see the workings of it. Or just walk across. There is a great view from the Top of the Shard of the Bridge.

Nice tour of historic bridge. The Tower Bridge is an iconic site in London. It is adjacent to the Tower of London and is relatively cheap to visit (£9) but is available on the London Pass. The exhibition is housed in the two towers and the walkway that attaches them. There is a glass floor which provides an interesting perspective on where you are on the bridge. A visit to the engine rooms (included in the price) helps you understand how the bridge operated. There is an entertaining short film that explains the history of the bridge. Well worth the entrance cost!

Not the best London attraction, but iconic none the less. The Tower Bridge Experience is OK. It's not quite as exciting as I thought it would be. The glass walkway is great - Ladies, don't wear a skirt for this!! The tour is informative but unless you have a real passion for bridges or the history of Tower Bridge specifically it can be done in just under an hour. Personally I think it's a bit over priced for what it is, but as with many London attractions it's iconic so can you really not see it while you're here?

amazing venue for an up-market london event - but check out that view :). Got dragged along to this occasion on the basis that it was a posh London event and essentially free as it was a friend’s birthday. We were sceptical at first but when you get to the top and check out A. what they have done the Tower Bridge Walkway bit (all very snazzy) and B. the view you get from the top. It’s totally worth it. The food served up there is ok, nothing to rave about but once you are up there you will vow to yourself to come back. I recommend you all check out their website if you are curious (www.towerbridgeevents.co.uk).

Great. I like the trip inside, it is cheap and deserve the visit, especially the glass floor that give you a great opportunity to take a funny photo. The short movie about the architecture is funny and filled by information.

Iconic and A Unique Experience. A must visit place on a visit to London. A unique experience. The view of the bridge is wonderful. The bridge opens up at evenings to let pass the ships. One can visit the bridge which is a paid service. One can plan to travel by small glass cruise ship to Greenwich which travel from below the bridge.

Tower Bridge glass floor. We took an 8-year-old boy to this new spectacular glass floor.This new feature offers visitors a never-seen-before view of London, above the Thames River. London is beneath your feet.Be aware: if you afraid of heights, it is not for you!

An old attraction but a wonderful new experience.. We were part of an organised party, therefore we had a guide to take us through a 1 1/2 hour informative tour, visiting the east and west walkways (complete with glass floor, 3 film briefings and a tour of the engine room, I as a trained engineer, found all the technical information terrific, but I was most surprised when my wife echoed my thoughts. If you wish to visit and look around on your own, as long as you have an I-phone, I-pad or other portable Wi-Fi device you can get most of the information from The London Bridge website. They do have their own free Wi-Fi on the bridge
Famous Site. The Tower Bridge is a must for those visiting London. It is spectacular in person. It is worth the walk to walk over the bridge. It is connected to the Tower of London.

Great views from several directions. We could see Tower Bridge from our Hotel, but we also walked along the Thames Path either side of Tower Bridge. We were on the south side, and so got a good view of the Gherkin behind it as well. Well worth making the effort to see it - it is unique.

Quite interesting. Visited this iconic tour and thoroughly enjoyed the informative info on the design and construction of the bridge. The glass walkways were popular for a photograph.Didn't really see the attraction of the boiler room.Well worth the lows entrance fee.

Unique experience - and not hideously over-priced for London. Well - I though that this was a great way to spend a couple of hours. You get to see - or rather walk inside an iconic structure, you can crap yourself by trying out the glass floors in the walkways, you see lots of brilliant Victorian engineering - what more do you want?£14.00 for an adult and two kids, or £17 with the Monument nearby - not too bad for London tourist prices I thought. The staff were helpful, the displays were enough to hold your attention. I notice a few reviews whinging about there not being enough "stuff" to see,- it's a Victorian bridge - where do you expect them to provide any more entertainment?The best bit really is about combining the views with appreciating the astonishing engineering. Pity Britain doesn't lead the world in this any more.

Tower Bridge Experience . Visited the Tower Bridge Experience this weekend. It was great. When you go up in the towers you get to see all the history of the bridge. The walkways at the top have a partial glass floor. When you stand on them you can see the road and river below your feet. Very scary but very cool.

Family trip. If you want to kill a couple of hours this is a great thing to do . The exhibition is very informative and the glass walk way is very good . View from the bridge is ok and if your lucky enough to be on the glass walk way when they lift the bridge Evan better . Something to do in London if its wet
Unique bridge, great view. Very unique look for a bridge. You get great views of London walking on it. A must visit when you are in London.

Tower Bridge Experience - thrilling and memorable.. I paid for the Experience (so I could access upper walkways and Engine room), and it was totally worth it. The glass floors are definitely the high of visit, but also the historical information, shirt films demonstrated and engine room itself was worth a visit.

The Most Well Maintaind Bridge I have Ever seen. The Beauty of the London lies in it here, yes i Said right as if see this Bridge you will feel how the Bridge is MAintaining that much well and really impressed with the clean and tidy. i even see it in night time also the lighting of the tower bridge is really amazing and when it comes to day time the colours of the bridge is awesome. toatlly i can say that i am worhty my to to visit this place for my London trip. and beside there is tower of london you can see and from there you can go to navy maritime musium which is in GMT by boat. and its free of cost to see the bridge

.....can be seen from everywhere.. Undoubtedly the bridge designed some 150 years ago is one with the Tower of London.The two engineers who devised these meet the two requirements for the realization: Bridge opening, architectural consistency with the nearby Tower.It is a must for the visitor and is a landmark that can be seen from everywhere.I was luck to see it opening !

Beautiful To Look At. I enjoyed looking at the bridge, particularly at night, it's so beautiful (see photo). However the tour inside was not that interesting to me, although my friend enjoyed it very much. I really liked the views though!

It is worth making an effort and spending time near this bridge at different times of day. I love this bridge and have fond memories of it from seeing it as a child, when I see it as an adult I still feel the same excitement which I felt as a child. I last saw it on a frosty November day and the mist surrounding it gave it an added mystical aura.If you are a tourist in London for a short period I recommend that you not only see this iconic bridge in daylight but make sure you see it at night too. It is an image you will hold in your mind when you return home and seeing it (and the nearby Tower of London) in different lights, I believe, is really worth the effort..

superb. this is no the traditional london bridge we all have heard / sung about but this has over the years become a symbol of london's architecture. a magnificent structure deserving a compulsory photo op point.

Great architecture!. First, please note that this is not London Bridge (that is now in Lake Havasu, AZ). Many people make that mistake. Now that we have that out of the way, on to the review. They just don't make bridges with this type of character anymore. It was great to see it up close and see all the details of the bridge. It was a real treat to see. Take the time to walk across the bridge, you won't be disappointed.
Best Bridge in London. Worthy of an hour of your time and the £9 entrance fee. Interesting history of the bridge and glass bottom of the walkway.

Interesting History. Beautiful bridge, interesting history, scary see through walkway. Bought the tickets online, and it's a very inexpensive way to spend some time. Again, beautiful views over the river

Evening beauty!!. You have to see it lit after sunset and the best way to see it is to eat outside at a restaurant which overlooks it. I would recommend the Corte Brasserie, London Bridge. Ask for outdoor seating facing the tower bridge. Looks gorgeous when it is lit and u will enjoy seeing it open up as well! It is one of the most amazing views in London and a must do on every trip!!

Included in London pass. I would not call this a must see, but it was a nice activity that doesn't take much time either. It's included with the London pass, and you have access to the fast lane, although there was not a big crowd when we where there.You go up to the tower and can walk to the other tower with a great view. It's all indoor, so you watch behind glass.The floor is glass as well, so you can look al the way down.Included is a visit to the old steam engines.

Breathaking views, stunning history, fantastic exhibition!. This is one of the best things I have experienced whilst in London. After seeing London Bridge from afar, not only was it a treat to walk across it, but to actually be inside it, and see the old engines etc, was amazing.The way into the Bridge Exhibition is easily signposted and easy to follow. It is actually a surprise when you get into the area where you pay/show your online tickets, as it's a really spacious modern looking ticket office. A small group of us where then taken into a lift at the back and a staff member operated the lift. I was a bit nervous as I really had no idea what to expect or how high it would be when we got there.Getting out of the lift we walked into a room that showed a film about the history of the bridge. We came to it right near the end, but what I liked most was the way the room we were in had been designed. Steel girders and all sorts of building materials were exposed, and there were models of men as they would have been working in various locations, to give an impression of what it would have looked like when it had been built.We then walked into the exhibition room which is actually the walkways that you see connecting the two towers when you look from the outside. I knew that is where the exhibition was held, but I wasn't prepared for how high up we were and it took me a few minutes to convince myself that it wasn't THAT high. It was even more unsettling because I could feel the traffic vibrating through the floor.But...the views were absolutely stunning. Looking down the Thames from both ways and looking out at London itself, I know there are higher places in London in which to get a good view, but for £9 for 2 people (using 2 for 1 train ticket offer) the price for that view alone was worth it, but with the exhibition and everything else that was to follow, it was a bargain, even at £18 it would be worth it.I love bridges, so the exhibition was perfect for me, showing all different types of bridges from around the world, full of fascinating facts and history regarding the building of bridges. There were many things to read and look at, but the view was what kept calling to me.  It wasn't really that busy either, considering it was early July and early afternoon and I wonder if this is one of the tourist attractions in London that maybe doesn't get quite as much publicity as say Buckingham Palace or the Tower of London. It was pleasant walking around the exhibit and there was no difficulty in being able to read all the information.When we left the exhibit area the next thing I couldn't wait to see was the engine room. I was actually so excited to see how the bridge used to be operated when it had to lift open to allow large ships to pass underneath. I really liked the benches they had so you could sit and watch the engines work. Seeing the steam pump engines actually working was just great. I spent way too long taking a video of how everything moved and hissed. Fascinating technology and the history behind the bridge is really one of brilliant British engineering. I know that will probably pass a lot of people by, but when you sit back and think what they achieved in the late 19th century, it is amazing.Pressed penny alert! For those of you out there who like collecting pressed pennies there are two machines, one inside the exhibit walkway and then one as you leave the engine room just before you head into the shop. They have some nice designs and the machine presses them well.I was quite surprised to find myself exiting the Bridge through quite a large shop, as for some reason I thought it would be smaller than it was. Usual London souvenir stuff for places that aren't the Tower Bridge, but there were enough items of the Bridge to keep me happy, if you buy a guidebook make SURE that whether you pick it up or one of the staff members, that you purchase the right one for you. It was only when we got back to the hotel that night that we realised we had been given a French book, and had to go back all the way from Greenwich the following day to swap.I absolutely love this place and am sorely tempted to go back again on my next London visit. It's a beautiful bridge, an icon, but don't let us forget the men who designed, built, toiled and created the technology that allowed it to become that icon of engineering. I hope that most people will not just see it as tourist attraction but as something more.

Impressive. London Bridge is the emblem of London, and not without a reason. The view is beautiful, the bridge is beautiful and if you are there when it opens for a ship to pass through, you will be granted an impression that you will never forget. Go there!!!

Super Fun!. After climbing many stairs to get to the top, we watched a short video that tells an amusing history of the bridge and then proceeded out onto the span that crosses the Thames high above the roadway crossing. For the record there is a lift if you need it, but the stairs a fun! Looking down through the see-through flooring you can see the roadway of the drawbridge and the river below! This was frightening for some people who refused to walk on that section, amazing for others (myself included), and even a bit unnerving. We got some really great photos on this section of the bridge! Tower bridge is just down the river from the Tower of London and makes for a great afternoon.

Brilliant glass floor. Excellent guided tour from Ian and Peter, made better by the bridge lifting and seeing it through the glass floor. Great views both up and down river and everything was pointed out by the guides, with interesting anecdotes.

My favourite landmark in the whole world. The Tower Bridge has been the favourite landmark in the whole world ever since I lived at a 2 mintues walk from it. It is exceedingly beautiful at night, when it is lit up and less crowded. The tour of the bridge, including a visit to the former bridge engine and an exposition of bridges, is certainly worth your while.

Spectacular. We walked there after visiting Borough Market. It takes us about 10 minutes to get a glimps of the Tower Bridge. On my 1st visit many years ago I never get a chance to walk on the bridge. This time we managed to walk on the bridge and marvelled at the structure of the bridge and enjoy the view.It is really spectacular. A must visit if you come to London.

Fun. We toured Tower Bridge mostly because it was included on our London Passes that we had already paid for. Otherwise, I'm not sure we would have done a tour but just looked from the bank of the river instead. The tour gives you a bit of history about the bridge and then you can walk the span across the bridge. There is a glass floor in the center where we were able to watch the bridge rise to allow for the passage of a ship. The tour concludes on the other side of the river with the engine rooms. This was interesting.
Walk it!. We walked over this bridge several times as it was very close to our hotel. Very impressive particularly when you know the history behind it.
Pretty cool. It is a neat attraction with a lot of history and a lot of people. The glass floor is great, people didn't even want to step on it.
Famous bridge in London. Just like the pictures. You can walk or ride across, go under from a boat ride. It is romantic and historical.

tower bridge and beyond. Iconic tower bridge just beside the tower of London , quintessential for any trip to London , if you get the chance walk on the gantry between the two towers for spectacular views of London it can be costly by well worth the extra for unforgettable sites , beyond I would also take a short walk to St Katherines Dock Just behind the tower thistle hotel /gouman enjoy a pint at the dickens inn and soak up the atmosphere and history a must with or without children as there is so much to see in this secret hide away
Beautiful. What a beautiful bridge! Is a pleasure to look at from the land or from the river. Don't miss it. It's right next to the historic Tower of London.
Fun walk thru history. We enjoyed our walk over the tower bridge and our views of London from the bridge. It was nice to look out and get oriented to the surrounding areas of London from the river.

Tower bridge. Not only to travel over a bridgeYou must sit down and spend time where you can have a drink or something to eat and listen to the guy who tell you all about the bridgeHistory and how tgey hang people there yes true and all other intresting stories about this bridgeIf you spend long enough time there you can actually see how they close the bridge for trafficFor a ship with tall hig mast to sail thruWow excelanto when they lift the bridgeAnd then lower it again!!
Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful!I went for a walk around and the sun was shining, took many pictures!The surroundings are very peaceful and nice.
Spectacular. We enjoyed our tour over and under the bridge,it has amazing views to offer and if interested plenty of information at hand.If your in London do visit here you should enjoy it as we did.

Awesome. The finest bridge in England in my opinion awesome. You can even pay to take a tour inside. The views are amazing. Fantastic engineering beautiful bridge. Looks amazing with those iconic London red buses and black cabs going underneath.

Interesting trip. If you are afraid of heights, don't worry. You can side-step the glass floor. Still scary, but the staff assure you that you can walk an elephant over the glass floor quite safely.
Good fun. The engine room is also very impressive, and the engineering skills needed quite magnificent.

Excellent views, beautiful bridge great area to stay in.. Every time I have visited London, I have stayed in the Tower Bridge section. It is very convenient to public transport (as is all of London) and beautiful with a great mix of new and old architecture. The Tower Bridge itself is very impressive and is my favorite bridge in London next to the Millennium Bridge. I was not there when they built the plexiglass overhead walkway, but I plan on walking it when I go back!

A different view of the Thames. We always try and do something different every time we visit London. The opportunity to walk across the top of one of the most famous bridges in the world sounded like a good idea. Despite fears of long queues, we arrived, bought a ticket and started climbing the tower in less than 10 minutes ( can't promise its always like that!!).Informative video displays on the way up give you a chance for a breather and to learn the history of the bridge. Then its the walkway across the top with the chance to look down onto the road and river through the transparent viewing sections.We were lucky enough to be at the top during a bridge lift. This made the visit extra special. Amazing to look down as the road lifted to reveal the river below. If you can plan a visit to coincide with a bridge lift do so. I think you can check for times on the website. Once leaving the Tower please make sure you take the short walk to go underground to the engine room display. The cost is included in the ticket price and is well worth the effort to see the some beautiful engineering.

spectacular views of the city. The views across the city are excellent from the bridge. The glass floor section to look down onto the bridge from above is really good as well if a little daunting for some people. Also very interesting to see exactly how the bridge works and also the exhibit on other bridges around the world was a different but interesting part of the exhibit.
Good London day. Visited with some other London attractions. Enjoyed walking beside the temez and view of London bridge. We didn't see the opening of the bridge,as didn't have time to wait for that.

Go for it - it's worth it. Tower Bridge is great. It's relatively cheap (under £10, or you go in for free if you've already got the London Pass) and this is what you get fot it: good overview of London panorama, a portion of the bridge's history delivered by a few short animations and you'll get to see the engine room from back in the times when the bridge was controlled by the steam power. Moreover, there's a glass floor fitted in the passage at the top of the bridge and it allows you to look through it and see the traffic underneath - you can even walk through it (provided you're not afraid of heights) - quite thrilling experience. The tour can be easily done within 45 minutes so it's ideal if you're in a hurry or don't have much time left but still want to cross a famous London landmark off your list.

Tower Bridge. Loved seeing the Tower Bridge from the boat on Thames River Cruise. It is so iconic. Did not go up in it because there were so many places to go and see in England. Not sure it would have enhanced our trip.
The Bridge of London. I love this Bridge. Its as pretty as the pictures show. You can just walk around or you can get a tour on the bridge. You will need about half a day to properly view this site.

Spectacular Bridge & Great Area to Take Photos!. On a recent visit to London we had the opportunity to both walk and drive over Tower Bridge. What a fantastic piece of architecture, located right near the Tower of London.There are a number of good restaurants on the bank of the Thames and we walked over the bridge to get to one of them for dinner. This afforded a lovely view of the bridge all lit up at night. We never had the time to go up in the bridge tower unfortunately but would love to next time we're there.Driving over the bridge on our hop on hop off bus tour, we had a great view of the Tower of London, the Gherkin, the Shard and the boat activity on the Thames. FYI, do not confuse this bridge with London Bridge.Well worth the visit if you are in London! If you have found this review to be helpful, kindly let me know by clicking below.

Fascinating to see how the Bridge works. We went here with 30 children from Charles Dickens Primary and it was such a good experience. Just the right amount of history, science, engineering and excitement (walking across the glass platform). I would highly recommend this to tourists and locals alike. I have lived in SE1 for 8 years and do not feel the urge to do tourist things but this is a great fun thing to do.

Get up there!. It is one thing to see it from the distance but it is completely different to see things from top of Tower Bridge. Glass floor provides very unique views down below the bridge. It is very unique and well worth the admission price. Besides that you can learn about the bridge itself, its history and how it operates and also see pictures and information on other famous bridges around the world. At the end of the tour you can get into the engine room and see the mechanism that lifts the bridge 3 times a day. And of course you have not seen the Tower bridge unless you saw one of those lifts. Make sure to schedule your visit so that you can see it.

you feel your in london when you see this.. It is a sight to withhold it is iconic London which maybe why lots of people think it is London Bridge but whatever it gives you the sense of wow. I think it must be the most famous bridge in the world. There is an exhibition area which houses different exhibitions fun for the family with stories of the bridge it has a modern high-level Walkways which includes a new spectacular glass floor. you can also visit the historic engine rooms. Another spectacular sight is when the bridge raises to let boats go through. I would say it is well worth a visit

An Iconic Landmark. Have been up the Tower Bridge experience a couple of time but have not visited for years and was very much excited to visit this year with the new attraction of the glass floor viewing sections which was awesome.Great for kids and all and good value recommend to all and good photo opportunities.

One of the cheapest family attractions in London.... Less than £20 for a family of three to visit makes this affordable.The tour is informative and unique. not overly busy,no mass queues.The glass floors are a great part of the experience including great views of the Thames.A must do!
most favorite place. Favorite place. Like Piccadilly Sq, we found many reasons to return here. Only went inside once. line to see jewels way too long. did not bother.
Interesting. Its is a great place to go if you want a history of the bridge through its stages of building. It has great views of the river and its surroundings.

Take photos from a distance. There is a nice area along the Thames river where people jog. From there, you can take nice pictures of the bridge. U can also see the tower of london from there. London bridge where borough market is near is around 15 minutes walk away.

Excellent experience. We went to Tower Bridge on a bright and sunny day. This helped with great views of London from the bridge as well as great photo-op around the Tower. Walking all around the South and North towers, reading all the interesting information about other World Bridges and London provides a lot of inspiration to become a World Traveller.If you can, I suggest taking the stairs up, that's a hike ! Don't forget to visit the Engine/Pump room.

I realized a dream!. I'd long wished to go along the top walkway on this bridge and I've done it! So interesting to be up there and then to see the workings etc. Truely amazing. We were lucky in that as we came out of the lift we were told that the bridge was due to open for a boat to pass. After a few minutes we saw the huge structure do it's 'thing'!!
Fab. Walking on glass floor was great , 5 levels to see ,and engine rooms film show and much more , The shop was great too.

Bucket List Attraction. We wanted to visit to try the high level glass walkways and to see the high level views. The tickets are about £8 for an adult booked in advance. The visit starts with a video of the history of the construction. There is then access to the 2 walkways with the glass floors. Great photo opportunity but very crowded. The end of the visit is a tour of the engine rooms which I found very interesting. Good for a quick visit

Amazing structure. One of my favourite bridges in London, you should definitely cross this to marvel the architecture up close. if you have time to go up the Tower and cross the bridge from the walkway, then do so! It's not the highest view point in London but is an interesting vantage point and gives you an opportunity to appreciate the engineering of the bridge. I visited shortly after the opening of the glass floor, which is an interesting addition. It was quite busy around the glass floor so you don't get much time to properly look down.The exhibition itself gives some information on the conception and construction of the bridge, and London at that time. I expected more information about Tower Bridge's modern history and usage, whereas a lot of the exhibition focused on famous bridges from around the world.Don't miss the engine rooms, this is included in your ticket price but easy to miss as you have to go outside onto the public bridge to enter them.

Such Fun. Be sure to walk across this fanpmous bridge while in London. All ages love this bridge and the history behind it! Lovely photo op. Also, there are historic sights to visit all around the bridge, plus one of the best views in town.

So cool!. This was a highlight! The glass floor is so phenomenal! The views are spectacular. A few of the employees down below that were directing people seemed a bit sick of their jobs. A bit abrupt and short with confused tourists. Other than that, it was really fun!

Great visit. A London attraction definitely worth visiting going up to the top and seeing the River Thames and London from a different view. Part of the flooring is now glass and not for the faint hearted but you can walk around it. We were able to buy 2 for 1 tickets by showing our train tickets (you need to ask at the station about these) but we would have been happy to have paid full price. Lots of information on when and how the bridge was built we found it very interesting would defiantly recommend the visit.
Very enjoyable. Although over 12 months ago we had reason to cross this bridge many times and thoroughly enjoyed the experienceWe would love to visit again one day
The Tower. This is a must see on your travels, take the time to go to the top and look around. It truely is a great scene to photograph. Just remember this is not London Bridge....

Tower Bridge Exhibition--must see for everyone. The Exhibition permits you to be shown around the Tower Bridge itself and allows you to walk across the 2 walkways at the top of the bridge. Fabulous views for London and the River Thames are present and a real surprise awaits you on these walkways. Small parts of the walkways have got strong glass in them so that you can now stand above the Thames and look down at the water and open top buses through the glass. Super stuff and not for some but if you do this you will be rewarded. The accommodating staff will take photos for you to prove you have done this!! Better than selfies anyday.Videos about the building of the bridge and the pictures of all 20 London bridges along with the most exciting bridges in the world are also shown. When you have seen this you can walk a short walk to the massive engine rooms designed in the 19th century to power this icon bridge. Marvel at the quality of the engineering of the day .Tip--take the family..good for allTip--take a cameraTip-allow an hour or two Tip--when you have seen the engine rooms continue crossing the bridge and turn left down Shad Thames for affordable cafes and snack bars.If you found this helpful please tick the Helpful box below..Thanks.

Walk On This Famous Bridge!. Walk this bridge and take beautiful pictures. Take time to appreciate the architecture, just amazing! There are parks around the bridge where you can follow the smell of grilled onions and find a hot-dog vendor for a delicious meal. Get outta the car and enjoy this area of London!
Must see. Myself and son took the boat ride far better view it really is spectacular!! Best way to get photos as well must see

By day or night. Bay day or by night the travel across the bridge is fantastic with some excellent views up the Thames. The photo opportunities are excellent.
There a few locks on the bridge

Well worth a visit. Not only is this amazing bridge beautiful to look at, but you can actually take a tour around the inside of it! I'm not sure how much the tour itself cost (we had the London Pass which included the price of most London attractions) but I definitely recommend taking the tour if you're visiting London. Not only to you get an amazing view at the top of the tower, but you get the history behind the planning, and building of this famous tower, including all the engineering side behind it as well. A great tour, and a great way to spend the morning.

Nice restaurans all around the Tower Bridge to eat & admire the view. This is definitely the most distinctive looking bridge along the River Thames and a favourite of any London skyline. And it is nice to walk along the bridge to see take a view of the Thames. However the Tower bridge is also a living and breathing part of every day life. There are cars passing through the Tower Bridge every day. If you are on the Tower of London side facing the bridge, there are steps on the left that will bring you to these marina area. (St Katherine's Pier). There are offices and also lovely restaurants to eat at while facing the yachts and bridge. If you walk over to the other side of the bridge and go down the stairs, there is the Butler Wharf - again shops and restaurants. Its a nice area because it was converted from the old warehouses so the buildings are very distinctive looking, shops around and the restaurants can again offer fantastic view of the Tower Bridge while dining.
Well worth a visit. An excellent attraction well worth a visit. Good fun for all ages. It was very interesting and informative

The power house was fascinating. There is now a glass see-through walkway at the Tower Bridge. For 9 pounds, I opted not to walk up just to look down. The bridge itself is quite spectacular. On the South bank is a display of the powerhouse, which has the old steam and hydraulic equipment that actually raised the bridge in the old days (it's computerized now). This was three pounds and I thought worth the time to see the displays. Very fascinating.

Wonderful history in the museum and great architecture and original steam technology to see on display. Well worth it!. Wonderful history in the museum and great architecture and original steam technology to see on display. Well worth the time invested. Really fun to walk across the top of the bridge with the glass floor! The museum has displays about varion types of bridge and the competition for the design of this bridge. You may climb the stairs or wait for the elevator!
Tower of fame. A lovely old bridge with charm. It is an adventure to walk on the bridge and the views are awesome! An experience to see the traffic passing through.

Looks are everything. It looks amazing seeing the towers and the iconic bridge itself, claiming to be the most famous bridge in the world. Although it looks fantastic when on it it is just another bridge, would love to see it open one day.
Tower Bridge!!. Classic bridge! If you come to London you must take a pic with the Bridge! The surroundings are also beautiful.

Top of the tower 😁. Me and my husband stayed in London for 2 nights and did some sight seeing! We did the tower bridge tour which was fab value for just £9 each with fantastic views of London at the top! The glass floor is amazing and provides an excellent view of the streets below! Worth while trip.

Great view. The tower bridge experience was great full of facts and working engines lots of history with a short fill on the creation of this skyline masterpiece , and new this year a glass floor on the walk over , it's fantastic just listen to your hart beat when you walk across the glass and look down on london buses and small sailing vessels,buy the combine ticket which is The Monument ,what is the worlds highest freestanding stone tower to commemorate the great fire of London, after you have climbed the 311 spiral staircase you can view the capitals landmarks , and not bad value at £10.50p per adult ,
Tower Bridge…very scenic from every angle.. Majestic. Take a leisurely walk around the bridge. There's a couple of nice little restaurants and coffee shops on the street leading up to the bridge.

A BIT BORING. Not very interesting just walk across the bridge nice site down the river and there is an exhibition at the end showing the machines that lift the bridge a look is really all you need save your money

Worth a visit - when in London. Even though it was rather chilly and breezy on my day out in London, I would not have missed visiting this famous landmark, even though I could only view it rather than explore in greater depth. The newly painted bridge is simply stunning. Unfortunately, it was not good weather on the day that I went, so I need to revisit some time and spend quality moments admiring the architecture and the magnificence of part of our heritage.

Tower Bridge. From my point of view is one of the best attraction in London. From the bank of the river you can take some nice pictures. Also you can go up in the bridge. Inside the bridge they have a glass floor with the view of the road and bridge. When you arrive there is an interesting video explaining how the bridge was made.

The Most Enchanting Bridge of All. I have visited London twice and I have to say I would go back again just to be able to see this iconic gateway. I took a tour up into the top portion of the bridge which serves as a museum. This particular bridge was one of the only bridges in London that was not bombed during WWII because as I understood it, the German forces used it as a landmark in aerial attacks. The bridge itself is awe inspiring. It looks like something out of a fairy tale and at night it is positively magnificent. I saw this bridge lit up at night several times on my first vacation to London. The top catwalk portion of the bridge has an exhibit of other noteworthy bridges from many countries around the world. I cannot recall if this was an exhibit found on the London Pass, I believe my friends and I paid an extra fee to go up into the bridge itself but it was well worth the cost.
Iconic bridge. Absolute delight.. Deservedly one of the most famous bridges in the world. One never tires if the sight of this magnificent bridge.

More beautiful in person! . Only had limited time in London and glad we chose this as our main destination. It's so much more beautiful in person, simply breathtaking. Take a walk on the bridge and walk down the stairs at the end of the bridge so you can get a FULL side view in all its majesty!

Love it!. It's a long family tradition to go for a night stroll to Tower Bridge, whenever we are in the area. So calm and beautiful and always a added bonus when the bridge opens. So nice during the day too, to have a picnic with family/friends. Love it!

Breathtaking View.. Traveling over the Tower Bridge, came near the end of our tour of London. It's breathtaking from afar, and enjoyable to travel over. I was able to take a picture from our tour bus before we drove over the bridge. One of the most outstanding Bridges in our day and time. Very picturesque for the London, England area.
unique experience. glass floor was a high light and was great to get inside the bridge and also to see the engine room, used tesco clubcard voucher as part payment, was value for money attraction.

Iconic "London Bridge". Location: Close by Tower of London.Train: Tower Hills Station, Tower Gateway Station, London Bridge Station & Bermondsey Station.A lot of people have mistaken Tower Bridge as London Bridge. Even though the distance between those two bridges are about 1km apart, but both bridges look so much different. Tower Bridge is a very beautiful bridge, with a upper level walkway that reward you a fantastic view of London city. I did not go up due to time factor, but I was already inspired and impressed just from its exterior. The freshly painted coat of blue and white somehow gave the bridge a fresh look from its classic pale stone design. It is no wonder Tower Bridge is admired by many as iconic London Bridge. It would be nice to spend a lovely afternoon just admiring and walk the bridge.

London Bridge is standing tall. This is one of the many "must see" London attractions. The bridge architecture and history is fascinating and a great way to visit via one of the double decker tour buses. You can hop on and off at will at designated stops and enjoy live informed commentaries from guides. Go over the bridge by bus and under by boat.

European Wonderland Travel. This is a great piece of engineering near the Tower of London. It is both a suspension bridge and a drawbridge at the same time that has been built over a hundred years ago. We got to see this bridge open up in the middle as a drawbridge in order to let a tall boat pass through.

A landmark of London. Beautiful for sightseeing and a landmark of London. Since it's a bridge, it doesn't take much time to visit. At night it has a beautiful illumination that makes some great photos.
Amazing views for the top. Our family of 4 had a great time -- but wait for the elevator-- we were impatient and it is a very long walk up. the views are amazing.

Well worth the experience!. Our visit to Tower Bridge was a pleasant surprise and one we would recommend others to do. It was only £8.50 and we bought our tickets on-line. The view is very good and you can see a fair distance of all the main buildings such as The Shard, The Gherkin and The Walkie Talkie. The exhibition itself is well run and easy to follow and of course there is the glass walkway high above the road offering a bit of daring in front of your family and friends. Well worth a visit and you get to be on a very interesting side of the river (you walk across the opposite side of The Tower of London).
Neat view of the river below. Walking across the Tower Bridge gives a neat view of the Thames below and the views out over the city are spectacular. I enjoyed learning the history of the bridge.

No queues in half term with e-ticket - great spot for selfies. Loved the views and the history - did you know 10 people died constructing tower bridge? If you don't like heights much you can avoid waling on the glass panels but the kids were all taking selfies while lying down so that the river and the road were behind them! You have to descend and walk a short way from the bridge towers to see the old engine rooms which is unexpected.

Stop by at night. Everything that people have mention is correct, but I add that it is fun to be there at night. Lots of colored lights on the bridge and of course the lights of the City. Also if possible, download the show Secrets of London and learn how the bridge actually works.

Tower Bridge. A beautiful bridge compared to London bridge. The architecture is simply wonderful. Getting to the top of the tower, you will be able to view London. Check out the bridge lifting time from their website.

Tower Bridge Experience. Me and my 17 year old daughter went to the Tower Bridge Experience. On showing my Blue Badge we both got in free...which I was amazed at....as usually it's just the carer that gets in for free.It was really good...lots to see on the history of the bridge...also a film to watch about the bridge being built.You can walk across a glass 'window' on the bridge (if you're brave). ....which was a bit different and I must admit I wasn't brave enough to do this!You go out of the building and follow arrows on the pavement which leads into the engine room...with the actual 'workings' of the bridge...which is also a sight not to be missed.All in all we had a good day...very informative.
You're right there anyway...why not?. It doesn't cost anything to walk on the bridge. It's right by the Tower of London. Much like the Brooklyn Bridge, you might as well do it.

one of London symbols. Visit of the Bridge is fruitful memory from London trip. We didn't pay for the entrance because of lines, just made a hundred photos walking across and around. It's definitely one of the most beautiful sceneries at both daylight and night time. Worth a visit!

My favourite bridge. I just simply love this bridge and, we had a great day out with my husband and parents in law.It is a great location to see more in London, we also picked a good day and were lucky with the weather. At night time is even nicer when lights up.
Fantastic views. Well worth a visit, but would recommend the lift!! The view is great and the glass viewpoint is a great addition.

Walk over this; the views are excellent. We did not pay for the tour inside, but the walk across is amazing. When you get to the south side, walk around some more. London is a great city for just walking around and absorbing the culture. You will have lots of company, however.

Up there is amazing!. It is one of the most amazing experience I had during this trip, although it was a busy time when I came, tourists are everywhere and queue was there, but managed to get in with my pass. I took the stairs going up a bit of hiking experience. Structures are unbelievable and the view are quite imaginable!
Over the traffic. This is a good way to spend around 90 minute of your time just to be above the cars and looking down.

London Bridge. Very good would recommend,was surprised for what we paid how much there was to see.The glass walkways and engine room were very interesting.would also recommend doing the tour with guide she was very informative.

Stunning views over the river and London City. So easy to get to and it dominates the river. What an iconic land/watermark. 50 metres up by lift, history of the design & engineering. Glass bottomed walkway at the top; not for faint-hearted! They can walk either side of the glass floor. Views are the best feature of the visit. We did it on a rainy day and it was still fun. We ran out of time but we must visit the engine rooms next time (maybe). It's £9 per adult but it's a once in a lifetime experience.

Londons best bridge. A great tour can be had, walking over, under and through the bridge.Then to the new and old engine rooms and if like me lucky, you see the bridge raise up.A great tourist attraction and low cost £6 I think it was ??Very enjoyable......

A Symbol of Strength. For as long as I can remember, seeing a picture of the London Bridge I always associated with strength. Seeing it in reality only confirmed this impression. Some may say it is only a bridge, but it is so much more..to me, it is a symbol of all that London is about. Fortunately, contrary to the fairy tale, London Bridge is not falling down.

Great place. The bridge itself is an engineering feat. All the machinery os there on show. The view from the upper walkway is simply spectacular. I found that the best way to visit the sites in London is by having The London Pass. This saves time and money You don't pay for most of the sites and also you jump the queue.

Different.. This attraction is not expensive and it caters for all ages. Once you are let out of the lift, the time is your own, Which is good as you can take your time and no one is rushing you. The glass floor is great, that being said I could not walk over it, as you are so high up. It wasn't very crowded which also was good. I do believe not many ppl know about this tour. We had a good view from top of the Tower of London. Once you have finished the tour you then make you way to the Engine room, I found this a little boring, but it was good to see it all and how it all works.

Great Tour. Amazing bridge and lovely tour. This tour allows you to see how the Tower Bridge was built, see the bridge from the inside, and how it operates. Not a extremely lengthy tour, but very informative and worth doing. Of course the tickets are a little overpriced, but so is nearly every other tourist attraction in London. I throughly enjoyed this tour and recommend it if you are interested in the history of London.
Tower Bridge. A London icon for a reason. This bridge is breathtakingly gorgeous. You can get some really good photo views of it from the Tower of London or an obligatory cruise along the Thames.

A very interesting visit. I have always been meaning to visit the Bridge but there is so much to do in London, this time I was determined not to miss it and I'm glad I didn't. The old Victorian engine's and a walk along the glass floor makes me wonder why it did take so long, and it was not expensive, you can also watch a video how it was built over the 8 years it took. the only down side for some people would the stairs to get the top.

The one bridge you must see and cross. Everyone sees this bridge in postcards, movies etc but until you've seen it in person and walked across it you won't appreciate its beauty. It's not a long bridge to cross and from the distance it looks huge, but when you get near it it's a lot smaller yet still such a grand structure.Definitely recommend a visit if you have time.
Great views. Great views of the city but didn't think the tour was worth the time. For a first time visitor, I would recommend it, but I probably wouldn't visit again.
Wow, highly recommend. Views amazing, staff very informative, glass floor breathtaking and overall excellent value for a great morning or afternoon out.

Very good and not expensive. Views were great and the glass floors work really well. Shame that the detail on the history and working of the bridge has been sidelined but as a viewing gallery was great.Very reasonable price compared to other London experiences.
Beautifull. One of my best spots in London. When I was a student, back in the 90´s I used to bike around London thru the Tower Bridge.

Fast Tour, but lots of info. You could really spend as much or as little time in Tower Bridge as you want to. They have plenty of information including history of famous bridges from around the world. They also show how the bridge opens and closes and you get a chance to view all the mechanics. The best part, though, is being able to walk over the glass panels in the floor and see the people and traffic beneath your feet!

You've got to do it least once..... This iconic London landmark has got it all, incredible history that keeps up with today's modernity ie. it's new glass floor on the upper walkway structure (accessed via lifts) with even parties &/or even holding wedding ceremonies. It is an interesting visit for kids as well as Mum And Dad. There are engineering tours to learn how the majestic Victorian machinery works and the views especially on a sunny morning when we went are sublime St Paul's, the Shard, the Thames snaking through the city, makes you very proud to be British!

Really good and great value for money. I have always wanted to climb through the towers and cross Tower bridge and now I have with my wife and three children, we thoroughly enjoyed it! If you are feeling fit take advantage of the monument upgrade at a small cost. As for the tower and glass walkway - superb!

Don't forget to visit the engine room, and watch the bridge lift!. The entrance to the Tower Bridge Experience is closer to the Tower of London side of the Bridge. We visited the Monument first, and purchased combined tickets for £10.50 and bypassed the lines waiting to purchase tickets at the Bridge. You can take the stairs but we'd just claimed 311 steps to the top of the monument so we took the elevator. Once at the top there is a short film, then you go out to the walkway between the two main towers. There is a glass floor part way over with great views of the traffic below and the river. The tower bridge has free WiFi so you can use your social media whilst you are inside. Once you descend to street level at the other side of the bridge you can go into the old engine rooms which are no longer used but are kept in immaculate condition and are well worth a look. The interpretive signboards give you all the information on how the hydraulics worked to lift the bridge before it switched over to electric power. Check the Tower Bridge website as it lists times when the bridge opens each day and you can time your visit to see this amazing, and very quick, sight.

More unusual. Expected to have to,join a queue (I thought that we needed to.book) but no, just went I and was so,surprised, a lovely experience, mostly the views, but they had an exhibition of photos on display, plus you get to go down into the 'workings' brilliant.

Nice to visit on a sunny afternoon. As a half term treat I took my 10 year old granddaughter to visit Tower Bridge. I had seen on the website that there was a draw lift at 12.30 and decided to view the opening of the bridge from the riverside rather than from the glass floor on the upper walkways. Nice photos were taken and we even saw the barge that had just come through moor in front of us at London Bridge City Pier. On the upper walkways which can be reached by a lift we particularly liked the exhibition about famous bridges of the world and of course the views of all the buildings around old and new.

Inside The Icon. Many people say this is not just the most famous bridge in the world, but the most beautiful, so to get inside it and walk along the overhead walkways is absolutely brilliant. There are fantastic views of the Thames along to St Paul's and Big Ben, and perfect views of the City and Canary Wharf's amazing tower blocks, as well as The Shard. And if you're there at the right time you will see a memorable sunset.But you also get the full history of the bridge, told through videos and pictures, a look at the majestic Victorian machinery that powered the bridge, plus there is always at least one art exhibition going on.

Bridge with a view! . Took this inexpensive tour with my partner. Got a 2 for 1 using a voucher/rail promotion. Great views with a good 10 minute pre tour information video. Didn't have time to visit the engine room as attraction was closing just as we left. Got lucky and saw a ship go under the bridge, make sure you ask at the info desk what ships are scheduled to pass during the day, then you can plan to see the drawbridge open.
Tower Bridge. Beautiful day with lovely views of the Tower Bridge and we even got to see the bridge raised and lowered. The best views and photos were from when we were visiting the Tower of London.

Great views. I visited with my 10 year old daughter and we thought it was great. Entry was around £13 for the both of us which felt quite reasonable for central London. We took the stairs and found the short film informative. The highlight for us was being over the glass walkway when the bridge opened to allow a boat through. The view was amazing and I would highly recommend if you in the area and have a spare hour.
Great view. Nice to stroll over,luckily enough we saw the bridge open for a large sail boat to go through, pretty at night all lit up great photos Moffat this historic bridge

An appropriately priced attraction in London - at last.. One adult and one child £14.10 during half term. No doubt I could have got an offer somehow but we just turned up whilst in London - it was the same price as booking online the day before.The attraction was interesting - lots of facts about the building and working of the bridge. The main attraction to the children was the glass floor and seeing the bridge opening for a boat to pass through. It was a lovely, sunny day and we made the most of it by sitting on the south side of the river just people and boat watching.My only criticism is that there could have been interactive displays and activities for the children (aged 7 and 10). However, as I have said in my title, it is refreshing to have an affordable and appropriately priced London attraction for once (and that's from a Londoner!).

Tower Bridge. This was a nice one to do with our girls, aged 5 & 10. Take the stairs, views are better. The children had passports and had to collect stickers at different points. This appealed to them and gave us more time to look at all the information boards for ourselves. Views of London were super, and the glass floor a real talking point and fun photo opportunity.

Great stroll on the River. Great bridge with awesome views of Tower. It is still a functional drawbridge. It is the most iconic bridge in London, so take a walk, and if you get cold, there is a Starbuck cafe at the end of it, on the Tower side, which is great for people watching

My walk home every night . A must see for all who visit London. Please do not dedicate too much time to tower bridge as it is beautiful but your tour and your walk across can be over in a matter of minutes. Incorporate the Tower of London and tower bridge in the same tour, and this would make your experience much better. Please see my picture of tower bridge at night.

unique perspective. a must see during a London visit. an impressive view on the walkway down to the River Thames, the Tower and a lot of other outstanding sites. And: the historical macine rooms are a visit worth for technical interrested people.

A novel way to see this iconic landmark. If only I'd seen the lift first... It's quite a climb up to the walkways, but wow what an experience once you're up there.The glass floor was incredible and great fun (especially if you jump up and down on it next to a nervous visitor!), while the view of the London skyline is unique from such a well-known place!The engine room is a joy to see, too, especially if you like a bit of engineering and well-polished brass.It's just a shame our visit didn't coincide with the bridge lifting, but I guess it would've been much busier then!
Pretty scary glass floor.... It is worth a trip to see this unique bridge. There is a glass floor that lets you see the traffic below... Included in the London Pass.

Superb view and experience. Came here for an afternoon as part of site seeing. It was quite confusing where you were supposed to queue and we had to ask as people were all over the place. Tickets were reasonably priced at £9, we took the lift up to the top of the bridge which also had a tour guide to explain the trip when going up in the lift. When at the top, you are free to walk around at your own leisure. There are spectacular views both sides of the bridge and the highlight of course has got to be the glass floor along one side of the bridge. There is an opportunity to sit for talks about the bridge and also entry into the exhibition at the end. Overall a great trip to do whilst in London!

Disappointing glass walkway. The Tower Bridge is definitely one of the wonders of 19th century technology, and an icon of London, so it is hard to give it less than 5 stars. The structure is beautiful and impressive, and the exhibition inside is very well arranged and interesting. However, their promotion of a “glass bridge” across the Thames is misleading, and that is why I gave the Bridge Tower less points. There is no glass bridge – there are some glass panels at the bottom of the upper level of the bridge, which make it possible to view the river and the traffic below. It is quite impressive, and worth while, but it does not provide a full crossing of the Thames from side to side on glass. London is so full of amazing places, that I would not put the Bridge Tower on top of the list. But if you have more than a couple of days, a visit here could be pleasant.
Excellent experience. If ur in London this is one thing which should not be given a miss. Takes back to childhood memories of this bridge in the famous poem.

Very interesting nice views . Had a lovely time some brilliant views very busy there is a extra attraction where tourist can pay a hefty charge to look through a glass panel at the Thames definitely over priced The bridge itself nice walk great views

Birds eye view. Interesting pre-show of the construction of the Tower Bridge and great opportunity to walk across the joining span and look down onto the roadway below. A visit to the original engine rooms is a must.

A must-see!. I wasn't expecting a lot except the view and experience of being there, but I was so surprised by the exhibition across the top of the bridge and up the supporting towers. If you go there, do not miss the Engine Room across the little cobbled street. Brilliantly kept machinery used to this day to raise and lower the bridge. Check the times the bridge opens - almost certainly every day around 4.0pm, but check! Then you can see the machinery in action. All those would-be engineers out there, you will be thrilled!
Interesting. Went on a river cruise to tower bridge , the talk whilst on was very good and pointed out lots of sites, the history of tower beige and other was very good

Excellent attraction. Whistle stop tour of attractions in the area,very interesting experience, went to the shard and the height didn't affect me but looking through the glass floors made my stomach queasy! Wimp!! Well worth a visit, book on line prior though

A unioque perspective. My wife and I happened upon the Tower Bridge attraction, whilst crossing the bridge looking for somewhere to stop for lunch. At £9 a ticket, we thought we would pop in and see what it was all about. The central attraction is the glass-floored walkways between the main towers. You are around 150-feet up, whcih is a great new way to see the city. There is also an extensive and detailed history of the construction of the bridge, other notable bridges around the world, a spot on London at the time of the building of the bridge, and I think maybe some sort of film. To be honest, I spent most of the time jumping up and down on the perspex floors, and pretending to squash the tiny citizens of London beneath my might feet, which was more fun that I imagined it would be.I'd suggest this is a good stop-off on any tourist visit, as the bridge itself must be one of the most beautiful buildings in all of London. Getting the chance to have a wander around inside is a great way to spend a few hours.

A must for everyone who wishes to visit the iconic sites in London. The Tower Bridge is an interesting site to visit for anyone who is interested in the development of both London and the bridge troughout the years, the development of machinery to operate the bridge and for anyone who would like to enjoy the view from the top.

A must see on a visit to London. Although we've all seen it a million times on the postcards we all feel that we know Tower Bridge but seeing it up close and walking across can't be beaten. It's also right next to the Tower of London so you yet 2 for the price of 1 - what more could you want? You can even go up into the bridge!

A mechanical marvel. The engineering considering the time it was built makes this attraction a highlight for me in London. The large steam engines were works of art. I love that kind of thing and would highly recommend it to anyone who has a interest in how things work. Outstanding.

Nice place to walk. The first night in London we walked over London Bridge, along the Thames (lots of shops, pubs, cafes, etc.) and back over Tower Bridge, around London Tower and back to our hotel. It was a nice evening. Loved the view from the bridge. We didn't go up, felt just walking it was enough.

Excellent views with its glass floor. The attraction is worth it even for 9 £, It can be a bit busy and getting some tickets in advance avoid the queuing tickets.Should you want to not wait for the lift, you can still use the stairs (less people and not that hard). The view from the glass floor is magical but of course a bit crowded. Note that you can see it in both section so you could walk to the other one if too many people when you arrive. The bridge is opened 3 times a days so you can plan your visit a bit in advance to be there when it opens (with of course more visitors up at that time).Note that you do have some small sliding windows on the side that allows to take excellent pictures from both sides (toward Canary Wharf and toward Town hall side). there is multiple sliding windows to explore.The engine part on the bottom is not to be missed as well with impressive machinery

Think of London, think of Tower Bridge. Each time I think of London I visualise the Tower bridge. It is an impressive bridge which is heavily used by cars, double deck buses, taxis, people, ...You have to cross it to have the full experience, don't get satisfied by simply viewing it.

Pre-book for Tower Bridge. Great trip to London and did Tower Bridge as had never visited this attraction before. Pre-booked on line before we went which said it didn't give you any priority - but it sort of does. You still have to queue to get to the doors but then the usher on the door fast tracked us with out tickets to a lady and then straight to security. Once in Tower Bridge fascinating exhibition and stomach churning (for me anyway!) glass floor! Lovely views.Didn't take the lift - walked up the 205 steps!!
Busy but a must see.. Enjoyed visiting as it is iconic, exhibition not so good. Glad we got 2 for 1 offers wouldn't pay £9 each. Not very busy up the tower just around it.

Well worth the trip. I have always wanted to do the tower bridge experience tour but when I found that it now had glass floor sections on the upper walkways it was a must. I was not disappointed. It was AMAZING.We prebooked so as not to queue but on arrival we had to for ticket collection. Although there were quite a few people there the staff were great in thinning the crowd out by suggesting other things to look at. When you do get to the top of the bridge there are glass floor sections on BOTH walkways taking up the full width and approximately 10 m in length.The best tip I can give is to look online for when the bridge will be open and visit on those times. We were lucky to be by the glass walkway when the bridge opened and a large vessel sailed through. At times like these staff ensure no one is on the glass so that everyone who is there can get a great view.

One of the world's most charming bridges. If out of the many I had to choose one sight that identifies London it would be Tower Bridge. It's an enchanting sight that all people in the world have seen in photos but to see it for real is quite an experience. The bridge is also very near to several places worth seeing such as the Tower of London and the little quint port of St Catherine Docks among others. Besides, it's next to the station that by mean of the elevated railway takes one to the Docklands and Canary Warf.
View from the Tower of London. It's a beautiful bridge, which you can view from the Tower of London. We didn't drive so we didn't go on the bridge but looking at it was pretty.

Historic London with a View. Went on the tour with the London Pass. The tour is, as most tours are, a combination of informative and, sometimes, boring, history of the bridge. The workings of the bridge, i.e., steam engines is nothing short of amazing. The view from the top is very good (no, not the best but very good). The touristy glass walkway was fun. Yes, I was one who sat on the floor (while others jumped up and down around me testing the strength) while my picture was taken but this was part of the experience. This is historic London and should be included in one's travels.

Amazing piece of machinery. Now includes a glass walkway, take the steps to the top level (if you are fit) otherwise the lift. The working engines are on the south bank, so you come off the bridge and then under the bank of the Thames. Two walkways, check out both as they allow better views of the river.
Favorite Bridge. A great bridge. Never knew you go inside it, got the chance to tour inside and even walk over the bridge. Also last year was it's 150 years.

Let the photos show you the iconic day on a busy day May 2015. We live an hour away from London but like other tourist, we love this city and its many sights. The photos were taken as we walked from London Bridge Station along the Thames to Tower Bridge.

Great Attraction. We went as a family of 2 adults and 1 child aged !0, When we arrived with our tickets we were asked if we would like the guided tour which cost nothing more. Our guide who was an Italian girl was fantastic and very knowledgeable gave us great info,The new walkway with glass floor was fantastic but the whole history of the bridge and how advanced it was for its time was truly amazing . We felt this attraction offered really good value for money compared to many others

Fantastic at night. The sights which you can see from this bridge are incredible, stand and look around and you can see some iconic landmarks. Well worth a walk across and also the views at night when all the lights are switched on.

Fabulous. From start to finish what a lovely experience, we have visited London on a number of occasions this was the first time that we were tourists what fun especially the glass walkways would definitely recommend
history in front of you. just to walk this bridge and think about everyone in history that's has also walked this bridge, beautiful and will be there forever

Enjoyed the visit a lot. The view upon the river and the city is amazing.The bridge is beautiful from the outside and fascinating from the inside. The history and the architecture of the bridge is told in amuzing yet informative manner.Engine room give a glimpse into engineering aspect of the bridge.Don't forget to check lifting times of the bridge - it is nice to watch, especially after being on it.

Take the tour over the top. Beautiful bridge, well preserved. The guided visit includes looking at the mechanism in the basement, and a climb to the top. Do not miss the chance to get excellent views over the river, and to learn the history of the first bridge of London.

London Tower Bridge Exhibition. This was an interesting exhibition of the history relating to the inner workings of the raising and lowering mechanism of Tower Bridge. You're also given access to the top walkway of the bridge with its glass panels in the floor, an ideal selfie opportunity... There are a couple of film presentations and also some old restored boilers. It was £9 adult fee, which for London attractions is pretty good. Probably a limited market but a lot of people seemed interested in the upper section without necessarily being too interested in the old mechanisms..

Enjoyable visit. Enjoyed the experience, Watching the bridge open through the glass floor was interesting, The most enjoyable part for me was the machinery room,all in a enjoyable visit. As we travelled up by train we were able to get 2 for 1 so excellent value.

London Icon Worth Seeing Up Close. We've snapped lots of photos of Tower Bridge on our visits to London, but this time decided it was time to visit the bridge itself. You can climb the stairs to the upper walkways, but considering our state of exhaustion after tramping through London all day, we gratefully accepted the offer to go up on the lift.There is an excellent introductory video that explains the origins of the bridge and the engineering that went into it. As you proceed along the walkway, 42 meters above the Thames, you cross the glass floor, where you can see the traffic moving below you. All along the walkway, there are information panels describing other significant bridges from around the world, as well as sign boards and video screens which give you more information about the views from the bridge and the history.Once you've crossed both walkways, you can continue your tour on ground level (and below) by walking down to the Victorian Engine Rooms to see how the bridge was powered in the past. Great for the steam or engineering buff. The tour ends in the gift shop, with all the usual London souvenirs. As with the London Eye, you have to be patient if you want to get photos without hoards of people in the way, but you're not hurried through, so you can take all the time you need.

A piece of art! Definetely a must see. A beautiful bridge, a work of art and engineering. Must see and if you're lucky a boat will ask to go under the bridge and you will see it part. There is an option of taking an inside tour - I didn't do that, just crossed the bridge on my way to the Tower.

Beautiful bridge. Impressive bridge good views of London and the thames.It is great to see the bridge when it is lifting up to let larger boats sail under it.Great Witherspoons just down the road from it.

Just okay. Went to this attraction because it was included in the London Oass - the only highlight was the glass top on top of the bridge where you can step on the glass and see the traffic below - not unlike the cn tower experience.

Glass walk - an absolute must do!. Apart from being one of the most famous icons for London, its fun to get to the glass walkway right at the top. Amazing views through the glasses of the city and feels eerie to look down... But great fun! Highly recommended....Then if you have time, sit by the side of the Thames and watch the bridge open to allow ferries and ships through. Good stuff!
Walkways were great. The Tower Bridge is beautiful. We did the walkways a few weeks ago and went over the glass floor, really weird but amazing. No trip to London is complete without a visit here

Better than the London Eye. If you're looking for some fantastic views of the city I would definitely recommend the Tower Bridge over the London Eye. Much more affordable and way more interesting. The Tower Bridge included a lot of information about the bridge, and entrance to the basement museum which shows how the bridge moves. Pretty interesting and worth the visit. Views at the top are spectacular and picture ready!
Interesting. If you have time to have a look at this it is interesting, you can walk over the glass floor 42 meters above the river & if you time it right you can see the bridge lift up.
