Best thing about London!!. One of the most iconic bridge and must see. It is grand and beautiful. The walk along the bridge is relaxing and scenic. It also has few best pubs along the way. The bridge is great and must visit!!

top class luxury event and quality catering. One of the iconic sights in world buildings and what a view once you are inside, as riverside venues go this is the best and the restaurant at the top is something else, never eaten with just stunning vista – top quality catering once you make it to the top (its al stairs – maybe s that you build up a thirst!) the food is perhaps expensive for what it is but then that’s London for you. still top quality catering but Tower bridge events still ranks as possibly the best place to eat with a sense of occasion.

No tour for us. We did not take a tour of Tower Bridge but the bridge itself is breathtaking. We stopped for a quick portion of caramelised peanuts and took in the sights and sounds, from the ground looking up at this bridge lit up in all its glory was the perfect end to a wonderful week in London.

my favourite Bridge. I love Tower Bridge, from the stonework, to the history of the Bridge, Tower and hangman's gate and the bars etc on the embankment. easy to get to, lots of nice pubs or cafe's along the embankment with nice traditional pubs nearby on the bridge or at London Bridge at the other end of the embankment.
the best bridge in the world. we spent 2 hours at this iconic piece of london history,great views of the river thames and parts of the city of london,a must for family visits to london.

Victorian magnificent s.. Tower Bridge the Iconic Bridge that spans the river Thames is the ultimate in Victorian Engineering, work started in 1886 and was completed in 1894 at the height of Queen Victoria's reign. This is a total must see even if only to take pictures but you can visit the walkaway for the views. But you will need a head for heights as the floors are glass. Best just take the photos to show you have seen this fantastic architecture structure. This is what makes London what it is. The Americans thought they had brought it but discovered they had purchased the old London Bridge,how could we sell something so fantastic.

What a Lovely Bridge!. While at the Tower, I had an exceptional view of the Bridge. And as I was daydreaming, the bridge began to slowly open. It was really an amazing sight and I was mesmerized. The sun was out, the bridge was opening and everyone was stopped, almost quiet, watching the bridge open.Highly recommend visiting this wonderful landmark.

Nice View. If you have a chance, go for the inside visit that includes a tour to the machine room and also a walk from both sides of the bridge (where there is a glass floor so you can view the ground from up there.
Lovely day :). We moved in to London some time ago and Tower bridge was one of those places to explore. It was lovely day :) . Worth to visit.

As Great as it Looks. Truly one of those iconic bridges you must see in you lifetime and certainly when you are in London. If you visit the Tower of London, you will have a nice view from there and a great photo opp. I walked across the bridge as it is a fun event to do with the family. I have spoken to friends who took the boat ride and said it was better--less crowds and better views.

It looks magnificently stately over the Themes River.... Everyone who has been there could say a lot... but seeing the Tower Bridge personally is worth thousand words & snapshots. When I'm next time in London I'll definitely book my stay next to it.

Worthwhile a visit. The Tower bridge is a most vissit if you come to London, inside the bridge you have the engineering tour if not sold out, also the you should have a look at the engine rooms and a most is the high level walkway with glas floor and stunning views on London. Very close to the Tower bridge you will find St Katharine Docks, its a small harbour with restaurants and shops, very cosy at night, its at the same side as the Tower of London but on the opposite site of the bridge.
Good view!. The dual ticket with the Monument was good value. The tour was worthwhile, the history was interesting and the view was great

A photo in every direction. Londoners aren't supposed to be proud of their city but I'll make an exception with the Thames. A walk from Westminster to Tower takes you past several centuries of history and ends with one of the most spectacular viewing points in London. Go on past Tower Bridge on the southbank to view from the classy Pont de la Tour (geddit) restaurant, cross to the middle to see the Thames stretching out either side or head to the north side to wander around the spectacular Tower of London. What's not to like

fantastic way to kill a couple of hours. Brilliant value for money, great views, friendly staff.my son and his friend didn't want to go at first but once they got in the lift they didn't want to leave.

A cheap price to visit an amazing landmark. As this currently only costs £9 for an adult I think this is a cheap price to pay to visit such a landmark. There are some good views from up on the towers and the glass floor is a nice addition to be able to look down on the traffic and river. There are areas down the side to walk on which is not glass if you don't like heights. The Victorian engine rooms is well worth visiting after you have been up the towers.

nice bridge but better to go for the resturant. Wasn’t all that keen or bothered about visiting this bridge, I’ve walked over it a million times - it’s not all the high is it! But my Mrs was determined so I played a long, the view from the top is awesome and worth a visit (£9 is actually quite reasonable for London I thought) but we stayed at the top for a meal – listed on Seasoned venues website as a prime and unique venue no less!! and unique venue is about right as the food was amazing and all served with the most spectacular view of the river. All in all well worth it.
Only popular because visitors are queuing to use the toilet.. You know what you are getting, shame that non customers come in to form a LONG queue, just to use the toilet, which is grotty and smelly.

Disturbing views. Loved this place - Not too much of a queue for this attraction (unlike others) and decent value at £9 per adult. Walk up the stairs (tiring) or get the lift up and experience some very good views of London with some disturbing ones below you as you walk across the glass floor - weird is an understatement!
Great Views and Glass floor over the Thames. A lot of history and a very interesting building - Near Tower of London and Shard so close for a lot of great iconic buildings

Unique! - a really worthwhile visit. There isn't really anything with which to compare a visit to Tower Bridge. It is, of course, an iconic global location but being able to walk across the high level walkways is a real bonus. It is a very good vantage point for taking photos because there are small windows (which you might miss) all the way across. Observing the traffic through the glass floor is also good fun. Don't miss the Engine House with the original Victorian machinery. Tower Bridge and the Monument do a combined ticket which is well worth getting. Lots of world class bridge photos on the way across as well. Try and see if you can be there when the bridge is raised and lowered - maybe only twice a day.
Must see and visit. this attraction has everything to see also with its history and to visit from both sides of the river at night is a must .

Tower bridge. love the see through glass bridge at the top! Nice experience, not too keen on the engine room though. Will recommend a visit, must get the London Pass as this is an attraction included for pass holders.

Great experience. For someone who wants to get the historic background, some understanding of evolution of bridges, this is a real treat.You are guided through the history if the bridge, its construction and other bridge designs. You get to see the boiler room and engineering room. Only thing missing is the counterweight rooms. They have an app, so you stand on the glass bridge and point your phone on a section of the floor, that will then show you how it looks when the bridge opens. A nice touch if you cant be there in person.

dirty bridge and too many gangs from tower hamlets. there should be police on the bridge to stop the gangs coming from where they live in tower hamlets, they sell drugs and driving their hired cars over the bridge while on drugs but the police do not do anything about this.

iconic tour. the views are stunning and the architecture is brilliant with a good amount of information regarding the history of the bridge on all of the walls and video's explaining this. the glass walkway is amazing but unfortunately tourists tend to sit around the outside meaning you have to walk across it even if you suffer from vertigo like myself, the Engine room is a must see as a sign of Victorian Mechanics at its best.
Absolutely beautiful. Take a stroll across the most popular bridge on planet earth. It is big, it is beautiful, and enjoying the scenery while crossing the river is a must.

Take a nice stroll on the bridge.... Take a nice stroll on the bridge... It is really beautiful and fun when they raise it. A great historical bridge. You can walk across for free or pay to go inside.

Not to be missed. The tower bridge exhibition is fantastic. Every part of the tour was very interesting. Loved the glass floor over the road and river! Don't forget to use the National Rail voucher website to get 50% off :)

More than expected. The Tower bridge raises a half dozen times per month. Look up the times and coincide your visit. The Tower Bridge Experience is worth the cost as you get to the internal workings and to the glass floored walkway overhead.

Symbol of London. For a long time I mistook this bridge for the London bridge. The london bridge is actually unimpressive. The Tower bridge which is an iconic symbol of London is a beautiful work of art. It opens up to let vessels sail through. We did a walk across the bridge after the visit to the London Tower and then went on the Queens walk. Interesting bridge !
A historical must. It is a must see when come to London. It is a bit pricy but the experience is once in a life time...

Symbol of London. Tower Bridge and tower of London side with river Thames in between. Visit to London is incomplete with out visiting tower bridge. The walk on tower of London side and on the tower bridge side is enchanting and mesmerizing. Give yourself lot of time to spend here. Refresh yourself and have some energy as you tend to get tired walking this huge area. On the other side, you also have the millennium bridge with again is a great experience.

tower Bridge London. Pure terror at the top! well for me who is terrified of height it was! A glass section of floor allows for those who wish, to walk on and look down. It was actually quite awesome, my wife tells me. LOL! I was up there and took a glance. That was enough of that part of the tour. We were also lucky enough to be there when the bridge opened which was very cool to see.An attraction I highly recommend!If you are going to London, buy the " LondonPass" it makes a lot of the attractions here free to enter.

The best part for me as an ex engineer was the old lifting engines and boilers.. Interesting to see that the exterior structure is only a facade as the bridge is basicalyAn all steel structure.Nice to visit the upper walkways for the view, and pass over the glass floor, scary.,
The Tower Bridge Expirience. It was very good & exciting to be so high on the glass floor of the tower to look down & to see the traffic & water underneath .

History at its Best. Tower Bridge is not to be missed. Tower of London was breathtaking. Have never seen more "Jewels" in my life! Took the passing of the keys tour at night. This tour is by reservation months in advance!

Tower Bridge is awesome!. Glad to see that walk through the bridge is free. The small portion of the bridge where you see the museum or history will be charged an admission fee which I bypass that. Good view from side of the bridge. Glad the bridge kept up to date with maintenance and paintings. SO I can't say what to see the museum inside the bridge tower.

Surprisingly interesting venue. I visited Tower Bridge last year with my brother and his wife and 10 year old daughter, the visit was very interesting, all the worlds unique bridges are shown on the high level walkway with details of each bridge. The old engine room that used to power the bridge is a fascinating place, and the photos were relatively inexpensive. All in all, a very enjoyable experience.

A beautiful iconic landmark. The bridge and surround area are perfect for wandering and enjoying the sights of London. Tourists are everywhere, but it will not phase you. Take time to "appreciate" the benches which are anti-homeless, a design which is comfortable to sit, but impossible to sleep - quite sad really. You can see some images on my blog: http://peak-exposure.com/adventures/2013/8/20/england
Iconic. If you want to get a good picture of the bridge, walk across London bridge across the way. Then walk across the Tower bridge for up close pics!
Just wonderful. It is beautiful , taking pictures from the river at sunset is just breathtaking . Highly recommend it

The great Tower bridge. Londons most famous tower bridge not to be confused with London Bridge this is still an eye catcher. It gets really busy on holidays so try and go mid week inside is plenty to see including the machinery and now the added glass floor from where you can have some very interesting views. It's always best to come visit while a bridge lift is expected you can check from their website for this. At night this really looks spectacular.
Landmark sight. Walk along this bridge, both a beautiful and spectacular sight, there is plenty to see and do around this bridge
Exciting. We went under the tower bridge twice, and both times the bridge opened, it was just great, good to see on land or river.
National Landmark. Looks great close up and really is a beautiful bridge. The souvenir shop and glass floor experience were a bit overpriced.
Enjoyable!. The glass floor of the bridge is great! Not sure its totally worth the price to go through it, just to walk through a bridge, but it was nice!

More interesting than expected. After having crossed the Tower Bridge a zillion times, last week for the first time, acted like a tourist and bought an entry ticket.
Intersting (small) show on the history, nice walk across glass floor with amazing views (down and "normal" left & right...)
Also the engine room was interesting to see.
Connection. The sound of partypeople when the bridge is open and the neon lights is glowing in the dark just makes everything worth it:)

The most famous bridge in all of Europe. A staffer told me that the Tower Bridge is the most famous bridge in all of Europe. The bridge, in itself, is a magnificent man-made architectural and engineering feat. In addition to its history and current function as a drawbridge, there is the glass bottom walkways between the arches. You'll experience some breathtaking views. Be sure that your camera battery is charged.

Went twice......just for the sake of it. Once in London, you ave to go to the Bridge, no excuse about it. We all grew up listening to rhymes referring to it, so going there is part of childhood fantasies. Its an engineering marvel in the timeframe when it was constructed. Indeed very well kept. I would advise to go up and look from inside, especially the galleries with glass floors.

The worlds most famous bridge. Walk across the upper walk way above the bridge and look down through the glass floor, there is a lift up to the top or you can walk up the 200 plus stairs, watch a couple of info films and the go down to the engine rooms

Must see Bridge. Start to finish the staff were very helpful. Both the lady and gentleman in the lift were very pleasant. BUt oh my days's when you get to the Glass walkway.. wow wow wow.. I have never experienced a feeling like it. TRemendous views from the bridge down below. full of history including the Engine room. Well worth the cost.

The engine room and the upper level exhibition. Fantastic tour and a unique view from above... Great guide, a good film about the architects of the bridge and the elevator guy was just funny. Enjoyed the whole tour.
Meh. I was expecting a little more, but London Bridge just seemed like any other bridge in the city. Definitely preferred the Tower Bridge and Millennium Bridge.

Don't miss seeing the old mechanism for raising the bridge.. Seeing the bridge close up is really fascinating but make sure you go inside and see the rest of it. The history is presented very well and there are great views from the top walkway. You can find out what time it will next be raised and it is worth waiting to see that. The officials nearby who block off the footpath when it is raised will tell you where to stand for the best view if you ask! The shop there has good souvenirs too.

Rats!. Don't panic! No actual rats found here. An avid Bones (Fox Network) fan, I had hoped to be able to see the little bistro they were filmed at from the bridge but was unable to do so.Easily accessible, tidy, beautiful views, what more could you ask for? My partner and I didn't go inside the towers but the experience was still great.

Ummm. Not worth a trip across town, but beautiful to see from the Tower of London. Best to view from any of the nearby banks of the Thames. Difficult to see much standing on the bridge. I could not find any plaques with historical information so it was somewhat disappointing. I'd go back if I were passing by, but I certainly would not rush back across town to see it.

amazing views. Visited here on 2 for 1 offer in association with Travelers/Railway offer. It was a sunny day when we visited and on approaching Tower Bridge ,you start to wonder why you(I) don't visit London more often,because it has so many things to see and the landscape is changing yearly!The attraction itself is well presented and informative,without it being a 'school lesson'!!!!!! You can read the info panels or watch the videos-i would recommend you do both as you can only get out of this attraction what you put in. The glass floor was a good added feature-although I did think it would be larger in size,from the photo's. A visit to the 'steam room's is approx 200mtrs from the main event but well worth going to see,so you can understand how it all works.Its a shame they do not open the bridge once per day,everyday of the year,at a set time for everyone to watch and enjoy. I do appreciate the chaos this could cause with Traffic but if they do it for Changing of th Guard-why not do it for the most famous/iconic Bridge in the World!!???

Favorite attraction from London!. Tower Bridge is my favorite attraction from London. It's a must if you are visiting London. If you are not afraid of hights take a walk on the glass floor situated inside of the bridge. The view is breath taking.

We walk across the bridge. Our cab driver had to drop us off on the opposite side of the bridge from the Tower of London. Glad he did. It was fun walking across the bridge. Great picture opportunities.

Your UK trip will remain incomplete without this one... I visited London bridge at night time, it was marvelous, the view of the bridge, like a tall knight in a shining Armour. nicely decorated. surrounding view s also enchanting. London's brightly lit skyline n Thames. Loved being there.

"Fear of heights" a must in the glass floor if you dare.. Our teenage boys wanted to do this after being on the bridge and looking up at the tower seeing people lying on the glass above. I must admit, I was not dissapointed. The view was amazing and a great price for family of four for £20 which in London is cheap. We separated 2 took stairs and 2 took the lift, (stairs quicker). View was amazing and my husband has a fear of heights. This was a great experience for us all as we all waked on the glass, kids has some great pictures taken laying down. Great experience and story of the history of the Tower. Glad we did it and amazing experience a view of the City. I just admit, I was a bit scared.

Towertastic! Never fails to impress.... Been fasinated by Tower Bridge ever since I was kid.After reading about the addition of the glass floors in the walkways, I knew straight away a return visit to the historic bridge was a must.Would recommend visiting on a normal work/school day as having visited at the weekend, the Bridge was very busy with the usual crowd of ignorant pushers/shovers/cue jumpers and some parents allowing their children to run riot, although this didn't dampen the experience.Short videos and the engine room provide background info to the building and inner workings of the bridge.

Well worth visiting. Unless you're scared of heights!. My partner and I were on a short stay in London, and this was definitely on our list to do. We decided to take the stairway to the top, which turned out to be a bad idea as neither of us like heights. It was quite scary to be walking up several flights of stairs in a Victorian building feeling the towers seeming to be moving in the wind. Probably an illusion, but nonetheless scary. There is a lift available, which is quite small, so we decided to be brave!There are stops on the climb up to the top with presentations of the history etc, but not enough places to sit to watch them. We also left quickly as we are both quick walkers and the slow moving tourists were quite annoying on the narrow stairs.When we went, the walkway over the Thames was still as it was. However, since going we heard that it is now glassed over instead. There's no way we would go back, especially as I read on the news that someone had dropped something on the glass and cracked it! If you don't mind heights, or walking over glass at height, you won't find this a problem!The engine room of the tower was interesting to me, but not so much to my partner. After leaving, we were aboard HMS Belfast, which is close by, and had the opportunity to watch Tower Bridge being raised to allow a large yacht to pass through. If you get the chance, this is well worth seeing.

Nice and worth visiting . One of the mostly visited tourist attractions in London which deserves its game. I wish the weather were much sunnier so that I would have taken better pictures but there is no ticket to nice sunny weather in London.

History and fun without being tourist overrun. It's a bargain. Walk up one of Britain's iconic landmarks, cross the bridge and look down (nay, stand!) on a glass walkway over the bridge, and in relative comfort as its not overrun by tourists. And only for £8 if you book in advance online. Bargain! Not to be missed.

Whistle stop tour of London. We visited Tower Bridge whilst on a short trip to London, enjoyed the walk up to the bridge an then descided to visit, after walking up the lots of steps to the tops, the views on the lovely Sunday day were great. I even managed to walk across the glass floor, a first for me!, back down the other side and a visit to the engine rooms that showed how the bridge used to be raised, a very informative tour. Well worth a visit.

Scary Glass Flooring. The Grandkids loved it crossing the glass floor they even laid on it !!! We did Tower bridge 3Yrs ago and the glass floor has really added a special touch worth the price you pay now well done whoever had this idea.Engine room interesting too.

Good Value for money. Visited this on a Friday afternoon, it was busy but the queue moved very quickly and didn't spend any longer than 10 minutes waiting.Bought a combo ticket to go up the Great Fire of London Monument (costs an extra £1.50)Decided to climb the stairs instead of take the lift - longer than we thought, but didn't take too long to reach the top.You can spend as little or as much time as you want going along the walk ways and both sides offer great views of the city skyline. After, you go down into the old engine room which is pretty interesting too. Lots of history here and was interesting to see the exhibition of the different bridges from around the world.
Excellent View. Booked online as it was cheaper only a short queue into the Bridge my Son enjoyed walking across the top which has a glass bottom got some really good pictures

Busy and beautiful. You must go. This bridge is used daily by Londoners and heaps of tourists. It is always hopping! The structure is absolutely breathtaking. I did not understand the negative reviews… How can you be negative, you're in London!!! Definitely take the time to walk across!
Uplifting. Interesting visit with glass floor on walkway between the towers, and visit to stem engine room that was used to lift the bridge.Good value.

Tower Bridge Experience - Great value fun. The Tower Bridge Experience is probably one of the best value attractions in London, particularly if you use Tesco vouchers (as we did). The queue was very quickly moving and the lift to the top was fast, with the attendants being helpful and informative.Once at the top, you can walk across and then back, and back again to continue the tour. There is a glass floor in both directions, and fantastic views. We found it very busy on the first part of the first walkway, but much quieter on the return leg. Views are great wherever you look! The various exhibitions are all informative, and the attendants quick to give the kids the sticker sheets, however as we didn't receive the main card, I ended up covered in small stickers!Once you leave the bridge, there is also the opportunity to visit the engine house, which I suspect many people don't do. Even if engines aren't your thing, it's worth a look here to just see the mechanism that operated the bridge originally, and a quick look in the gift shop.If you visit the website, you can also find out when the bridge opens, which is something well worth seeing!

Fantastic to see. What a great looking bridge, having seen that bridge in many movies it was great to see with own eyes.I very much enjoyed walking across the bridge and seeing the views of London and the Tower of London.

Walk across it and be part of history. Just walk across this iconic bridge and watch the traffic of the Thames river as it flows past.there is an exhibition in one of the columns but we can't comment as we just enjoyed the view
A walk around the bride. A walk around gives u a london feel......u shd do the top of the bridge to feel on top of this world

Glass floor!. Came for the first time to this attraction. Fantastic piece of design. Informative tour of the inner boiler room workings and best of all... The glass floor walkway! Not for the faint of heart!

TOWER BRIDGE EXPERIENCE. If you're travelling by rail then visit the 2 for 1 website as you can download a voucher that will save you the best part of £10! You have to show your rail ticket at the desk to get the discount.The displays are very good as are the restored machinery in the basement of the south tower. Views are spectacular and the glass floor is a good idea but spoiled by endless tourists wanting to lay on it and have their photo's taken by their family - this effectively bogs up the whole process resulting in log jams of visitors - it needs staff up there to keep things flowing

Excellent views for excellent value for money. I went here to see the views of London, and seethe skyline from a different perspective i.e. the middle of the Thames, it was well worth it for the views of the shard and st pauls etc., loved the views of the new skyline around the gherkin and walkie talkie, also loved the views of canary wharf. The walkway is good and is a good distance giving you space to enjoy it yourself and not get crowded. There are some nice pictures of other bridges and good info on how the bridge works - good value ofr money,.
Amazing!. Amazing, gorgeous views of London!!! Great experience. Cannot wait to go back! Didn't go to the top as it was very busy but hoping to next time.

Just amazing!. From the moment I saw the bridge, I was amazed at its beauty! From the colors, to it's functionality and the ability to walk on a cross section of the bridge is stunning! The bridge is located behind the Tower of London (depends of course where you come from). FYI, if you're afraid of heights, be aware that there is a huge plexiglass like panel on the floor allowing you to see below...if you don't like heights you may want to skip that portion of the tour. Also, there are a lot of stairs!!! A bucket list type of item! FYI, buy a "London Pass" to save money on this and many other tourist locations... you also get head of line privileges too!

Great way to fill an hour or so!. Let's put it into perspective, you ain't gunna spend half a day here as it is, after all, just climbing a bridge and back down again.But for £9 (not sure where the £75 & up comes from...) you get a great view of London both up & downstream of the Thames. Yes, the structure doesn't allow for it to be a perfectly unobstructed view, but that's part of the experience. Glass floor is great if you can stomach it too.Also, they have opened an engine room tour which adds to it all.
Would be wrong not to!. My first stop on a recent trip to London, such an iconic structure, one of the top 5 attractions in Europe, I would strongly assume!
Tower Bridge - London. Amazing place. A great experience watching the cars on the bridge and the boats on the river. Wonderful experience
Another "cannot" miss attraction. If you do a tour of London, you will see this site. Very nice as are a lot of the "must-see" attractions in London

Must see landmark. The Tower Bridge itself is palatial. Visitors who really want to enjoy a view from the top can pay the ticket (9 pounds) to go upstairs and see London from the top of the Bridge. Those who are courageous can also see Thames through glass floor and take pictures. Children love this. Also - engine room is nice to visit and watch the story of the Bridge.

Good attraction. Definitely worth a visit. The glass floor is amazing but stomach turning. The staff are extremely helpful and knowledgeable. All in all a good place to visit . It's fairly cheap to get in as well

Just love it!. Tower Bridge is magnificent in both day and night, close to the Tower Hill and there is a Starbucks under his left side, where we took coffee with a beautiful view. I recommend to check the lift times of the bridge on internet or in box office.

A walk to remember. I have a great fear of heights and bridges, but it all went away walking on this structure of history.
Love the views, a great exoerience

Well worth a visit. The Tower Bridge experience was well worth the money as the attraction provides a fantastic view of London from the top. The displays and media affects are excellent and provide you with an insight to the history of the bridge and the enormous importance its building made to the life of the capital. The new glass floors which allow you to peer down onto the road and river below provides the visitor with a spectacular view for those who unlike mean don't get 'jelly legs' when looking down from heights. The children however seemed to love it. The glass is 4 inches in depth and has 7 layers this fact still couldn't persuade me to stand on it but my fellow travellers did. Definitely would recommend it as a must visit.

Excellent viewing and photos, both day and night. There's nothing to, not like. It's clean, beautifully cared for both day and night. They maintain the lighting on the bridge so night time is beautiful. There are easy viewing areas on the West side of the river to take photos of the bridge and the bridge itself has beautiful views of London

A truly majestic landmark.. Tower Bridge is a truly imposing sight wherever you view it from, and it's visible from a fair bit of the Thames. We were starkly aware of the contrasting beauty of this magnificent bridge with some of the modern building constructions to have recently graced the London skyline; most of them eye-saws that have, in my opinion, ruined the look of England's fairest City. I personally don't like the Shard, Gherkin or Cheese Grater - which i think looks like a hood from a hoodie. these monstrosities do nothing for me. However; tower bridge is truly spectacular!!! There are 2 "towers" and 2 gatehouses, beautifully impressive and built from cream stone that glows in the sunshine. We spent a good half hour or more wandering from one side to the other and back to see from where we could get the best view, but decided in the end to go down onto the embankment and walk along in the direction of Westminster; the views just got better and better. We didn't go into the tower as we'd spent the whole day visiting London attractions, I would have liked to have walked across the glass platform, but we have some fabulous photos and wonderful memories of our week-end in London. Maybe next time I visit London I will go inside the tower bridge and walk across the glass walkway.
Not to be confused with London bridge. Exquisite fantastic views elegant - gorgeous at night - cant miss a walk across this landmark bridge -

Good attraction with glass floor. We went to Tower Bridge. Was good tourist attraction and not too busy. Went on a Wednesday about 4.30pm. Did the engine room first then up the tower, good short videos at each end. Glass floor is good if you don't mind heights! Good adrenaline rush! Worth the £9 spend and less for concessions. Worth a visit. Really friendly and informed staff in the elevators. Good that you can open small windows to take photos too.

Fun of glass walkways. Great value, only £9 & no fixed timeslots. Just enough info on why/how/who built the bridge. Liked the photos of other bridges around the world, makes you appreciate the different styles. The glass walkways were a lot of fun, even my nervous partner dared to step on them, overcoming his fear! It did get abit crowded though as some people spent too long sitting on the glass panels, taking loads of photos. Great views up & down the Thames. The engine room & explanation of how the bridge lifts is fascinating. Rounded off our visit by watching the bridge lift - both whilst looking down from the walkways & from outside. Tower Bridge is such an icon of London, well worth visiting to see what happens inside it.

Get lost in the surrounding areas and get amazed .... Walk in the backstreets between London Bridge station and Bermondsey and surprise yourself with charming corners with coffee shop and nice restaurants ... Or just admire the stunning Tower Bridge at sunrise or sunset on clear days ...

Tower Bridge - The pride of london. When you are in london, tower bridge is a must visit. People often get confused and call it london bridge. London bridge is different and is more of a normal bridge parallel to tower bridge.Tower bridge has its unique presence and looks wonderful at night.Your London photo album wont be complete with out your picture with the tower bridge in the background.

A Must-See in London! . On our recent trip to London, my wife and I of course wanted to get great pictures of the iconic Tower Bridge. We ended up making the attempt our last night in town, and spent a while wondering around before finding the best angle. We ended up on South Bank, on the small wharf just East of the Bridge. This gave us great unobstructed night views with interesting angles. The Tower Bridge is very impressive and definitely worth the trip to see it!

Superb!!!!!!!. Absolulty brilliant!!! The staff were fantastic and very informative as you went through each stage. The films were extremely interesting and not too long! The glass walkway was amazing!!! A bit unnerving but great if you are brave enough. The views from the walkways are breathtaking . The engine rooms are just brilliant!! To be able to see how the bridge opens is mind blowing!!!

Its ok- better places for your quid. The bridge first and foremost is spectacular and it is fascinating to see it open... but the actual tour is a little flat. Yes there is a nice view, but it is nowhere near the best around. If you really love bridges and civil engineering by all means this is probably for you. But if not then you will not be all that disappointed if you just view it from the outside.

Crossing Tower Bridge to the Tower. Another visit to London and another trip to Tower Bridge, by London Bus this time, fantastic architecture and engineering and a sight not to be missed whenever you are in London, even more interesting to travel through Tower Bridge by boat on the River Thames. If you go by coach tour or by the river the guide will tell you all history.

Very nice. Been here many times,lost count,Lovely bridge,wonderfully beautiful.its been built very well and still looks great after so many years.love how it lifts up for the boats,differently a view to see:-)

Glass floor great!. This is definately worth a visit, didn't take my children on the occasion but will definately return to take them. Think the price is very reasonable for this experience. My favourite part was definately the glass floor, great selfie opportunity!

Really Great Way to see the Bridge. I've walked across the bridge a few times on the "ground" level, but decided that for this trip, we would try exploring the upper levels and the engine rooms. We're really glad that we did since it was such a fun way to see the city and experience the landmark. We opted to take the stairs to the upper deck over the elevator which ended up being a nice way to see the insides of the bridge towers. Upon getting to the top, there were a few videos available giving the history of the bridge and then of course, the infamous walkways with the glass floors. It's surprising how intimidating it can be to go out on the glass even though you know you're fully supported. Still, we braved it and got some really great photos and videos from the experience. Would highly recommend!

An interesting tour. Take an hour and go on the tour of the Tower Bridge. You get to see the inner workings of the bridge and learn some of the history. You also get to walk along the upper portion of the bridge which has a 'glass floor' so you can look down over the bridge. It's an entertaining and educational tour.

An excellent insight. I have been meaning to visit the Tower Bridge 'experience' for some time and actually visited, on the spur of the moment, two weeks ago. I thoroughly recommend it. The entry cost is very reasonable with special rates for families ( I think £20 ) and seniors. The bridge itself is fascinating and the structure appears to be superbly maintained. There are audio visual presentations on the initial concepts, tendering for the project and the actual construction, all are well presented, informative and interesting. Both upper level walkways incorporate glass floors, enabling you to look down to the road and river some 200feet below. Do not miss the machine rooms which house the steam engines and ancillary equipment used to raise and lower the bridge, a separate display but included in the price. An added bonus was seeing the bridge raised just as we finished the tour.

A walk through the sky. A unique visit and if you have the time add the Tower Bridge Exhibition to your list. Our family enjoyed this tour. Plan on an hour or so for your tour. Easy to add on if you are visiting the Tower of London. This is an icon known all around the world and seeing the inside is special. The Victorian era had so many impacts in history and the building of this bridge shows how times were changing with the advances of the time period. A lot of stairs up and you will appreciate the structure of the bridge. A quick video at the top explains the original history about how the bridge came to be built. The view from the walkway is lovely. And you really do think you are walking on air when on the glass floor. The engine room is worth seeing at the end.

Glass Floor - great Photos. The glass floor has a good novelty factor and v. amusing if you have a Husband who doesn't like heights. There are a few films to watch on building and history of bridge and the children get a little passport book to fill out with stickers as they go round. Takes about 1-2 hours.
Love. My favorite bridge in the whole wide world. Perfect place for chill and the London's places that you have to see

Just impressive. This one of the visits we and especially our kids enjoyed. The fee is relatively fair (20 £ for a family with two kids). You should take the stairs instead of the elevator to get a good impression of the steel construction. Don't miss the machine room at the end of the exhibition.

Great historical achievement. This bridge is one of the best working bridges in the world. It still opens up at least once a day with traffic lights on the river for the boats and on the bridge for traffic and safety gates to stop everything passing through while the bridge opens.It has opened its bridge for even war ships and high sail boats.The upper part of the bridge can be seen by paying a small fee and you could see the museum up there and how the bridge works.Incredibly this is still working from old style machanics. A must see if you visit LondonI recommended 1-2 hours. The museum might take you a few mins to go up the stairs and tour but the rest of the time is used for loads of photos

Tower Bridge Walkway - A Great Place for a night party. I attended a private party where we had catering for the night & we were there as the sun set gloriously so we got day & night views also. What unsurpassable views.

Good value for the views. If you don't mind heights you get a fantastic view of the city and would save a trip on the London eye. You also can view the two glass platforms that give you a view directly down onto the bridge. Awesome if you walk directly onto the glass. I don't like heights but found plenty of room on the side to walk around.

Great Visit. The exhibition inside the tower shows a lot of information and pictures on the history and technology. It is such tremendous strength of Great British in 19 century. Take a beautiful picture outside the tower. You can walk along the river then go to borough market to get some food in 30 minutes.

Tower Bridge. Amazing bridge structure. It was nice walking along the walking path towards the bridge seeing it come up closer and closer and finally walking across it to the Tower of London. Definitely should not be missed as a popular tourist thing. Did not get a chance to go up in the bridge.

Really worth it. We did a walk up to get in - no problem - also lucky to strike a day with very few people so we were able to take our time. Great views. Impressive architecture. Very impressive engineering. Don't forget the underground part after you've been through the bridge itself - shows the workings of the bridge. The whole thing is a working structure so don't expect slick and pretty. It's a real operation without the shiny pap that a lot of tourist destinations have - so it's down to earth and real - worth the trip definitely

My best part of London's visit. The tower bridge was the best thing I enjoyed in London. It is a masterpiece of architecture on the Thames and harbors a lot of history in every brick. I repeated my visit during my stay as I could not get enough of it.

A chance to get inside one of the world's most iconic bridges. This is not your average glossy london tourist attraction but to me that's what makes it special. The inside of the tower maintains it's ornate victorian industrial structure - it's slightly shabby which makes it feel so genuine - and you can imagine the late 19th century visitors taking the same spiral stairs. For this reason - don't take the lift at the entrance if you can avoid it - walk up instead. The top is fun with the glass walkway being scarier than i expected, but once you overcome your nerves you can watch the world go by below. There are some attempts at films and info panels - it's not fluid, cleanly designed scenography so don't expect masses of multimedia exhibits - but this fits with the charm of the place and you can explore at your own pace. The trip to the engine room at the end is worth it, even if machines are not your thing. Just seeing the engineering needed to move the bridge is impressive. Went with a baby (in a sling - buggy could be tricky if busy, but there are lifts), 5 and 10 year old girls. A shame there's no café at the top...with the view, it would be great. The price was also good value for money (£18 for a family).

Don't miss it. I booked my tickets online and it was no hassle at all. We visited during lunch hour and there no queue. Loved the experience and the history of the bridge. Got to walk on glass looking below sooo breathtaking.

London's Identity Monument. Tower Bridge is a master piece of architecture. Crossing the bridge twice was a great experience. Knowing the history and many facts about it was awesome.View around the bridge is breath-taking.

Most iconic bridge in he world. Can't believe a bridge can be this beautiful and nicely made. And if the architecture isn't enough for u, then wait around to see the bridge open in the middle as big ships/boats pass through

Favourite London Symbol. This has to be one of the most beloved London symbols. Yes it is just a bridge and may not look like anything much. But on closer inspection, you'll see the handwork behind it. I didn't go to the top, but I can imagine the views from there being amazing. (You can get similar views from the Tate modern for free, so I opted for that). I did love walking back and forth from the bridge. And of course it serves as a great backdrop for some amazing pics on a beautiful sunny London day!

Unique and unforgettable. Tower Bridge and its surroundings is my favourite London sight. Beautiful during the day and wonderful at night. Once you see it you can't forget it. For me it with epitomizes London. However to enjoy it rather than taking a transport is good to walk towards it from Westminster or Embankment along the Thames preferably on the side of the Festival Hall. It's about half an hour to one hour walk but if it's a nice day is worth doing it. Once there one can also visit St. Catherine Docks and the Tower of London while on the way one passes through St Paul,. Monument and the Tate Modern. A lot of nice places to see in one go.

Good exhibition. we all thoroughly enjoyed the bridge tour especially the walk over the top of the bridge with the glass floor part very popular with the tourist some a bit apprehensive about standing on the glass. There is a lift to go up if you want but we went up the stairs.Merc

i liked it!!. I had a very good time in London, but the most special thing which i visited was the tower Brigde! It is one of the most beautiful "sightseeings" in London! I took some many pictures and i have print them! I suggest it to all of the visitors

Dizzy Heights. A great way to spend an hour or two seeing this amazing feat of Victorian engineering. It's ideal for young children up to oldies! full of interesting history and to top it all a walk on glass 40 metres above the road - not for the feint hearted. Good value for money £9 per adult.

Awesome Bridge. This was one of my favorite sights in all of London. The bridge looks awesome lit up at night, and is by far the best looking bridge on the Thames. There is a lot of stuff in the area near the bridge as well, like Tower of London, City Hall, HMS Belfast, etc So you could make a day out seeing the things in the area.

Truly Magnificent Site!. Tower Bridge is right next to the Tower of London, so it's logical to pair the two sites on your visit. The bridge is absolutely gorgeous. It's the only bridge like it that crosses the Thames, and it looks more like a beautiful building than a bridge.Definitely walk across the bridge on the pedestrian paths. It's worth it! (Note, once you cross to the the south side, you can explore the cobblestone streets with restaurants and shops in one direction or walk the Queen's Walkway in the other and see the more modern side of London development along the river.)I would also suggest the Tower Bridge Exhibition (get a London Pass and save money and time!) It allows you to go up to the top of the two towers and walk the glass-floor walkways that connect the towers. Looking through the glass floor onto the roadway and river below are amazing!

Beautiful Bridge. I love looking at the Tower Bridge, so beautiful compared to the others across the Thames. We always walk acrossmit when we visit and stare up where the tour goes. Being tightwads, my husband and I refused to pay to go through. Since this was a trip with my nieces and the London Pass was involved, up we went. For those with weak constitutions, take the slow elevator, the steps will knock you out! I went up with a school boy, who started skipiing steps and eventually stayed slow and even with me. Once at the top, a video about the bridge and spectacular views. The glass walk was neat. Now that I've done it, its worth the money.

Well worth seeing. We stayed in The Tower Hotel and decided to tour the bridge. We bought tickets from our hotel concierge for £9 each, stepped out of the hotel and we were there. There was a very small queue, then into the lift to the top of one of the towers and you're there. Very interesting to see the steel frame and stone cladding from the inside, the glass floors on both of the walkways, the various videos showing the process of building and various other bits of information. Once you're done in the tower, it's just a short walk to the engine room museum where you see how the road way used to be raised and some of the original machinery. All in all a very interesting place to visit and well worth the money. I hope this review has been helpful.

Free or not, you decide. It's surprising to some new visitors to London that Tower Bridge is a drawbridge! In fact, if you search online for "Tower Bridge Lift Times" you'll find a schedule of lift dates and times--boats don't just show up and beep, they have to make reservations. It's a very brief "show", but it's most interesting. Then, if you want to spend some money (quite a lot as I remember from a previous visit) you can go down into the bowels of the Bridge and see just how the lifting occurs, then take a lift up and walk across the catwalk at the very top of the Bridge. Wonderful views, of course, and not the sort of thing that your friends might have done, not that that's a reason to do something (hah!).

Very informative!. Very reasonable and informative. I loved our visit - fantastic views, very reasonable entrance fees and informative. One of the walk ways was closed when we visited so we could only see East but the views were incredible. Would recommend to anyone.

Iconic Wonder. Even if you don't go up in the Tower and take the "clear" walkway over the bridge, it's still an incredibly cool place to visit. Very busy with auto and foot traffic, there are lots of places to take great photos of the Thames, the Tower (not the bridge) and the skyline of London. A tad pricey (over $10) just to go up inside, but if you're into bridges, it's worth it.. Plus, there's the "skywalk" that lets you look down on the bridge traffic....but just walking across the bridge is free....

Glass Walk. I love Tower Bridge :for me it's the most stunning bridge ever.We'd dine the new Glass Walk and it's just fascinating! Quite secure up there and an amazing view.The Tour through the Bridge is very interesting.

A great icon of London,. Being pressed for time we did not have time to visit in side or do the raised walkway but no trip to London can be complete without walking across the best Bridge in London The views of the Tower of London, HMS Belfast and " Boris's house are some of the best that you can see.
Londons Iconic Bridge. Great architecture and design... This has become an icon of London...a every tourist wish to visit this place... Traffic is always peak usually...

amazing!. There are several things you can do in London, but you do not ant to miss this! Well worth the experience. Worth the cost to go up and learn all about how the bridge was built. And the glass floor was so cool!
Wow place to see . If you are in London must go this place. Every time I was in London I must visit this place . I love to visit again to tower bridge.

Enjoyable experience. On The London Pass so fast-tracked entry which was excellent due to the masses of French students waiting to get in. I found the walk up invigorating, though others may struggle (lift can be asked for). Excellent view along the Thames and over London. The Old Man certainly enjoyed the Engine Room, too.

Must see sight in London. Not to be confused with London Bridge, this wonderful bridge is resplendent with the Queen's blue paint. Such a pretty backdrop for photos, both on the bridge and from the river banks with the bridge in the background. It's an easy walk across it, and the view is worth it.

I like the glass floor on the bridge!. It was very rainy and windy the day we climbed the tower bridge. The most memorable part of the experience was the glass floor that allows to you see all the way down on the traffic of the bridge. I also enjoyed the animation showing the building of the bridge over time. Worth a visit! Also make sure you take the Thames River cruise to see the bridge on on the water!

Should see. I don’t know how many bridges like this exist in this world, but I guess this one is the most spectacular one with it´ s two towers on each side. We just arrived at time, when they lifted up the middle part of the bridge, so this huge ship could pass. I was a bit surprised if we were just very lucky or if they open it often, so I googled and got told, that this happens around 900 times a year! (So we weren´t the only lucky ones I guess ;)).

Living history. One of the most stunning bridges in london and the country ,the architecture and views are spectacular .Just walk across the bridge ,but stop and watch the river ,the traffic the views .this is such an important part of our capital and so beautifull .

Beautiful. We got a brilliant view of the Tower Bridge from the pier, as well as from the City cruise boat tour. Didn't get to actually visit the bridge, but make sure you at least get to view the bridge. It's the most beautiful one of all of them.

london for free. a great sight for free. the mighty tower bridge of london. we visited both sides and enjoyed the urban beauty of both harbors overlooking the chaotic skyscrapers of london. the ambience was very international.

Tower Bridge Experience. This was the first time we had done the "experience" which takes you thru the workings of the bridge up to the top of the bridge to the walkway. It was interesting to see all the workings and there was a video explaining how the bridge was built etc. On the walkway at the top they have put in glass floors which the kids loved to walk and sit on looking down into the river and road below. On the whole a good experience and worth a visit. Also really nice views of the river and Tower of London from the bridge.

Well worth a visit. This was actually more interesting than I thought it would be. Good info about the bridge, its design and construction but also about bridges in general - some really impressive constructions to find out about. The glass walkway is really good too. If you walk from the engine rooms to the South side of the river, there are lots of nice bars / restaurants to go for lunch too.

Great Value compared to other attractions. At £9 (and we got 2 for 1 tickets through London Midland Trains) this is decent value. Interesting information about the technology associated with the bridge, and the glass floor is fab especially for kids. And nearby are great eateries and coffee houses nestling in the old warehouses.
Top Attraction. Well worth the money, interesting and informative. This is a must do if you are in London, the glass floor is fantastic and takes a while for you to feel comfortable standing on it.

Very Enjoyable Experience!. It was about time we enjoyed this Tower Bridge experience after having lived in London all my life. Quite an incredible achievement in building this bridge. It's sheer presence in London still stands as one of our true Landmarks. All information given was interesting and the glass floors were brilliant.Very glad we came here finally!

Tower Bridge Experience. We had two for one tickets so decided to visit Tower Bridge. I was slightly surprised that the walkway was all enclosed in glass, I had imagined it would be open to the elements. It wasn't until near the end of the tour that I realised there were windows that opened to take photos. They were quite high so if you use a DSLR with no live view it is a problem. The videos were interesting and we all enjoyed our visit - but I'm glad we didn't pay full price for the six of us.

Interesting and amazing.. Well worth the entry fee (we got 'pensioners' concession rate, and an additional saving by booking in advance online.)We were lucky that the weather was fine, and the views from both walkways (up and down the river) were excellent.A very good exhibition of photos of this (and other famous world bridges), as well as the story of how this famous bridge was built.A couple of short film shows added to the information.Lift staff and other attendants were pleasant and very concise and informative.
You will feel wind of the Thames here!. You will feel that you came to the U.K. to be happy if you come here.You will feel the history of several hundred years and wind of the Thames here.
One of the Cooler bridges you will see. We took a boat tour up the river for this bridge. I can't remember what times but you can see the bridge come up at certain times.

The glass walkways are awesome!. A very reasonably priced attraction - £20.30 for a family of 4. The children get passports and stickers which keep them amused on the way round. The glass walkways are amazing on a sunny day. The engine room was fascinating with great hands on exhibits for explaining how the bridge works to the children.

Interesting history lesson. The views on top of the tower bridge were very nice however your view may be obstructed by the bridge itself (the support girders) depending if you can get a decent spot. They do have designated view spots to see some nice views of the river and surrounding London. It is also a mini museum, illustrating a brief history of tower bridge. Once you have finished taking snaps/looking at the museum, you can enter the engine room and also view a short video, again, about the history of tower bridge which was pretty interesting. I believe you can stay at the top as long as you want and after the video you can exi the top part of the bridge (and go to the toilet if needed) and proceed to the rest of the engine room at the base of the bridge.I believe by purchasing a ticket to visit the top of the tower, it also entitles you to visit the engine room for free. The engine room is very crammed but also another nice little museum-esque area. Once you have finished there is also a gift shop you can visit.

Worth the money. The ticket was well worth the money we paid 9 pounds for. Just to say you were there at such a World Famous Landmark was worth 9 pounds in itself. We got to see how the Tower Bridge came about and the history of it through pictures and descriptions throughout the Tower Bridge and by watching the 2 movies. We also got to climb the tower to the bridges (Elevators available for those who can't do 200 stairs). Walking across the 2 different glass floors was both amazing and very scary at the same time. Who can really say they walked in the Tower Bridge over a glass floor looking down at the famous Thames River? We also took a tour of the machinery room explaining how the Tower Bridge works. On the Tower Bridge there are little windows that open as well so you can take some great pictures from above with an unobstructed view. If this attraction was in the USA it would have easily cost at least $25+ for the same thing. With todays not so safe world we live in I was surprised this attraction was open to the public. I felt so lucky to be able to still go on such a World Famous Landmark and experience all it had to offer for such a great price.
Wonderful. Great place to visit. It takes around two hours in total and you can see the engine room. The view from above is wonderful if the weather permits. It's worth it.
Machinery heavan. Visited here with my wife she loved the views but not too excited about the machinery rooms, these are great if you are interested in steam power

Interesting landmark, overpriced ticket. I found the experience interesting. The visit to the engine room was good. The glass walkway is also good but quite small.I think the tickets are overpriced and visitors should explore the entry options such as passes which include multiple attractions.
Worth the money!. Inside the tower bridge was quite spectacular. The views from the top are great! The glass part inside is like a museum with tons of pictures and descriptions to read.

Tour the top of the Bridge: very nice experience!. The view alone is worth the time and minor expense, but the education about bridges of the world, and the design and construction of the Tower Bridge are the real payoff. Be sure to tour the engine room to learn how the drawbridge operated in the late 19th century!

great views. the views were fantastic, im not that interested in the construction side of things but if you do like things like that then it will bbe even better, tip - we arrived there for about 10 and didnt have to queue for long by midday as we walked back past the queues were huge

Beautiful bridge. Iconic bridge, fantastic photos from the Tower of London side, worth going to see. We went on the river cruise from Westminster Pier and approached the bridge from the river and got some good photos. It is a majestic sight of London well worth seeing.

Views of the Thames at its best from the most iconic bridge in the world. The most friendly and helpful staff I've ever come across. A really lovely trip - no massive excitement, no daredevil stuff, but well thought out and informative displays and films, topped off with splendid views of the Thames and beyond. The glass walkways are a fantastic addition to the attraction. Do take the whole trip, which includes the engine rooms below. You need at least an hour to do it all justice.

Walk a bit further to have a stuning view. Coming from the Medieval Castle, walk across the bridge over the river Thames and then turn left towards the HMS Belfast. After about a hundred meters of walking, you will already have a good angle to take a nice photo of the Tower Bridge. This is especially advisable in the afternoon as it won't be against the sun.
a landmark bridge. A very nice bridge to see or cross. It is not in the center but buses and subways take you there. I have never seen it open, but it must been an interesting site.

tower bridge in not falling down. there are tourist attraction that u won't visit twice, but the bridge is the one I always go back, as the surrounding is also interesting.
Direction: take bus 15 next to trafalgar square to tower hill, walk along the river and the docks

Fun and a view - Tower Bridge Exhibition. A great looking bridge and a nice view. The bridge also looks magical at night. We found the glass floor in the Tower Bridge Exhibition a lot of fun. Freaks you out a bit walking on glass and looking down on the Thames River and the bridge. It was also entertaining to watch others on the glass floor - their reaction and picture taking was amusing. We enjoyed taking a look at all the bridge pictures displayed from around the world, where they were located and if we had ever seen them.

Lots of stairs but more interesting than expected. We decided to do the top level glass walk for the kids. It was much more interesting than I expected. For some reason, we were not given the option to take a lift, so we climbed to the top- -which was fine if you are in decent shape but will definitely get your attention if you are not...the glass walkways were a big hit. The day we went was very windy and you could feel the bridge move which was quite exciting. Everyone enjoyed the informational plaques about other bridges. I would skip the machinery under the bridge. Unless you are really in to turn of the century engines, it's pretty boring.
Must see!!. Really liked the Tower bridge outside and also inside, nice viewing points for great pictures. Also can see how all the engine mechanism works to open the bridge. Highly recommended!!

Do not confuse with LONDON BRIDGE. Looks impressive especially at night. a very busy throrough fare across the Thames. Therer are lots of little pop up eateries in the north east side of the thames on the side of this bridge.

A must see in London but visit the Tower Bridge Exhibition if you can. We see this bridge on a lot of visits to London but there's always something magical about it and I always find myself compelled to take another photo or two. If you're walking over the bridge then check out the schedule of openings (or look Google for "Tower Bridge lift times") as it's really worth seeing if you can be around to see the bridge open.It's often quite busy on the bridge but you can walk over it for free. If you want to learn more about the history then it's really worth paying to visit the Tower Bridge Exhibition where you will learn all about the history and interesting facts as well as being able to cross the high level walkways - well worth the money.
Tower Bridge. Absolutely beautiful. The glass walk was breath taking and as are the many views. Reasonably priced and a must see when in London.

Tower Bridge - make sure you visit the exhibition. we had the London Pass so we did visit the exhibition - it was overwhelmimng!Make sure you use the steps up to the brigbes - great architekture inside.Next when you cross the bridges, the have glas floors - yous great to make some cool pictures, river, cars and people below you.

Unique piece of history. I used lift to get to the top level (waiting approx. 8 minutes - but horrible air inside, full of people); tickets bought with "2 for 1" (if you show a train ticket from the same day, you have one ticket free). The bridge is simply awesome with interesting exhibition (video how the bridge was built and how it works, engine room, bridges of the world,..). The most stunning is glassed floor on the top of the bridge, so you can see the river and way right under your feet. If there is fine weather, you have beautiful view around, so plan your trip if it´s not raining.Also souvenir shop is quite big with a lot of little things to buy for your family or friends...Mind that security will check your bags before you walk in.Anyway, this is one of the most interesting bridges in the world in my opinion.

You need to like bridges. the exhibition at tower bridge is worth going to see... The walk way across the top is good and the views are worth seeing. The glass floor is fun although be prepared to be tripped over by plenty of badly behaved and over excited children (for a better view go to the west walk way, its quieter)For me the highlight was the engine room exhibition. So much to see and a chance to marvel at victorian engineering at its best!
A place to check out after Tower of London . Having a London pass had its perk. You didn't have to wait in line; you could just go straight to the counter and get a pass. Nice view from the top.

One of the great London Icons. One of my favourite tourist places to hang out! The Tower Bridge is very close to my office place so whenever I am visit my London HQ, I always walk across this bridge. It's a mangnificent piece of work by the ones who built this beauty. Whenever I look at this bridge, I know I am in London, it kinds of represents the city to me. Walking across the bridge offers splendid views on both sides and I like to walk along the River Thames all the way to WestMinister especially in cool weather both daytime and nighttime, you should try it too! From far, you see how beautiful the Tower Bridge especially at night as it offers tourists and locals a chance to admire its beauty. At the bridge, you can learn the history of this bridge by taking the elevator up. You have to pay the entrance fee, not cheap but the reward you get to see a better view near the top, go when the weather is good! For discounted entrance fees, book online is a good option! So if you are a first timer in London, remember to drop by here during your visit!Cheers!BalwantNew Delhi, India

History, of course, and amazing works to move the bridge for river traffic. While visiting the Tower of London (at the south end of the bridge) for a small additional fee, you can go below into the workings of the bridge, and see the amazing machinery used to move the bridge for river traffic. It is not raised, but pivots to open passages on the river for larger ships. Not spectacular, but highly interesting, even for the technically-challenged such as myself. Oh, and don't call it London Bridge--that was taken apart and reassembled at Lake Havasu, Arizona, not far from Las Vegas.

Cool bridge and views, a bit pricey. Fun to walk up the winding staircases to the top level and see the exhibit, including the glass floor and learn about the history of the bridge and the mechanics and engineering behind it. However, it is a bit pricey...

To some it is just a bridge, to others it is the inside view of history. Tower bridge is one of most recognizable icons of London aside from perhaps Big Ben and the London Eye. It also has some rich history, from dead man's hole (where they scooped out dead bodies from the river) to the fact it was never bombed during WW2, and even its existence, coming from a design competition and some novel technologies that were put into place to have a bridge which can retract to allow ship traffic to pass. The bridge is open to tourists to climb up (or ride up) to the top and see the bridge from the insides. I recommend the climb as you get to see the old stairs and interior structure. There are a couple of movies up top which goes over the history of how and why the bridge was built, and recently they've added glass floors to the two walkways. Its great to watch people slowly step onto the glass, unsure if it will hold. Meanwhile you've got me happily jumping up and down on it - it isn't going anywhere (as long as you don't drop a beer on it). Great photo op.Don't forget the tour of the engine room at the end, and for a small additional fee you also get admission to the Monument to the fire of 1666.

One of the great London Icons. My wife had never visited Tower Bridge (she's from Lancashire) so on a day trip to the smoke, I took her to Tower Bridge. She doesn't like heights, but managed OK, including the glass floor (she walked round the edge)The is a must visit for every tourist to London, as it really is one of the great feats of Victorian engineering, and is one sight which most people worldwide would recognise instantly.My only gripe would be that for the visit, £9 is a bit too much. I understand that they need to upkeep the bridge, which isn't cheep, but the amount of visitors they get, they're making more than enough.I've visited now twice, would I go again at £9 a trip.....you bet I would :-)

Worth a visit!. The tower bridge exhibition is good if you are looking for something fun and cheap to do. The attraction only cost us £4.50 each with a 2 for 1 voucher. It is good walking over the glass floor and finding out about how the bridge was built and seeing the engine rooms.

city attractions. This bridge and nearby Tower Hill is real attraction. Specially walk around River Thames is great experience, with lots of choices for food, some pint of beer, catching sun (if not raining),...

Stunning bridge with a fun observation deck. The Tower Bridge is a stunning icon over the Thames River. The beautiful towers and blue paint are just beautiful. Those who walk or take the elevator to the top of the bridge are treated to a great view of the city including the view of the roadway and water below from the glass walkways. The attraction also includes a short film about the construction of the bridge, and entrance into the machine room at one end of the bridge.

the iconic image of London - Tower Bridge. It has been here for well over a century and still attracts crowds as it should - an amazing impressive strong symbol of London which is still a functioning crossing for vast volume of traffice daily north or south.If you have not taken in the views from Tower Bridge you have missed out. Crossing it by foot costs nothing - if you have time and a budget, consider going up to the Walkways for the views from up high - wonderfully refurbished and impressive but not cheap (what you pay for in London rarely is)!

One of the cheapest things to do in London. I really enjoyed going to the top of Tower Bridge, the scale of the upper building is amazing, it's not a huge attraction, an hour is more than enough time. Don't for get to look up, and enjoy...

fun !. Good to see a video how the bridge was build; good thing for the young ones was to walk on the glass floor from where we could see down to the road and also the river, pretty amazing! The engine room downstairs is probably very exciting for anybody interested in mechanics.

We purchased the wrong bridge. Well after doing the tower bridge tour, i dont understand why we purchased london bridge and not tower bridge we must have been conned ,the bridge is amazing the engine rooms fabulous and the informative guides go out of there way to help explain the workings a great value tour

London excursion.. Really great having the info about other world famous bridges. Very informative. The glass floor at Tower Bridge, on first experience, is breath taking. Having access to the engine rooms is a bonus. This was a trip that was very enjoyable and was well worth the money.

Suprising and fun!. With 4 people (2 kids) we went for the Tower Bridge Exhibition. The tour was short, starting with an intro film about the inventor of the bridge. A funny start. After that we went on the bridge between the towers with the amazing glass floor. The view was great. If you are afraid of heights, don't go there.

Really good value for money. £9 is an absolute bargain. The glass floor is really good, not too long and you could opt to walk around the side. There was a lot of information on other famous bridges and how they constructed Tower Bridge. The views from the top are great and well worth climbing 230 stairs to get there (although you can take a lift)

Could you believe. Could you believe how was possible to built this more than 100 years ago. If you see the machines inside and all the construction you are going to tell that it is a modern technology

Another lively symbol of London, UK!. This ought to be one of the must see attractions of England/UK! Why? Many calendars, postcards, or other photos already illustrated this image! You may take a grandiose view at the Thames. At night after the lights lit up, it's even more beautiful! You may also take a cruise on the Thames to take a closer and sharper view at the bridge. Also, this bridge is called "TOWER BRIDGE" NOT "LONDON BRIDGE"!! London Bridge is located in the USA. Visited in SEP 2009!

Great piece of history. Climbing the stairs used up the cooked breakfast! But the view was great, the information is very well done, the glass walkway is thrilling or scary depending on your point of view! Well worth the time.
Fantastic bridge but... Way too expencive to look down through the glass floor at the cars below. Infoboards with history should be placed so we can read while there.

Adrenaline ;). At first it was scary, but after I wanted more and more, to step on a glass floor. It was excited, amazing. I definitely recomend to visit Tower Bridge, it is beautiful and interesting.

The glass floor is amazing!!. Tower Bridge is an amazing structure going up inside it is very interesting as is learning more about how it came to be built and how it works. We went on the Saturday of the Easter weekend so it was very busy but we got on the second lift up and as there is a lot of space once you are on the walkways it didn't feel to crowded. The views are amazing from both of the walkways. The glass floor is a bit odd to start with but certainly adds an extra dimension to the visit. We had a great time and my kids (13 and 15) had great fun taking selfies on top of the glass floor.
Looks Great. This is an Amazing Bridge & was my second favorite site when visiting London, so pleased we went to see it.

Must-do in London!. We were a group of 4 adults and 3 children aged 8, 5, 3. We had a London Pass so that allowed us to go to the front of the line and not queue with the rest of the people waiting, which was a long line. The Bridge is beautiful and you can get some great pictures walking up to the Exhibition entrance (though there will be a ton of people behind you too as they are trying to do the same thing). Once you get your tickets, if you have kids they give them a really cute Passport booklet and at 4 different spots during your tour they collect sticker pages, then build the bridge with the stickers. That was neat. You can wait for the lift (elevator) or take the stairs. We opted for the less crowded stairs...be warned - there are A LOT of them! Like 200 or so. But it is fun to do. Once near the top you can watch (optional) a short 5 minute film about the builder which sets the tone for when it was being built. The star of the tour is getting to walk across the glass floor and look down to the cars crossing below, the people, and the Thames. You can get some great pics by lying down on the glass! There are great views of the city too from the crosswalks. The only thing I wish we could have done was climb higher onto the towers to get an even better vantage point. You can then walk across the bridge and go under to see the steam engine room as it would have been used, then exit through a small souvenir shop. It was a memory that the kids will definitely remember, and I would recommend anyone to do.

OK, but crowded!. Went on Easter Monday - so I guess we should have expected it to be crowded.Slightly miffed as we went in (as full payers) and a family were asking and receiving discount for 3 "Special Needs" children. The parents called themselves "Carers" and got in for free! The family then proceeded to act and behave as a normal family would be expected to - no sign of the "Special Needs" and they were very smug with themselves about the discount. Grr.The glass floors were interesting on the walkways, great views up the River Thames. Interesting display boards. Engine rooms very interesting and well mantained.

A great attraction, reasonably priced. A short walk from the train stop. We went in the middle of the day and the line was not too bad. Tickets were 9 pound for adult about 4 for children. There were many steps to climb but I believe there was lift access if needed. Restrooms were available. There were interactive entertaining exhibits at the top and the glass floors were fun. The engine room was neat as well. My teenager really enjoyed this attraction.
