Wow, what a sight. We saw the bridge from a cruise, then from the Tower of London then we walked over the bridge. A must do when in London and such an historical sight. Unfortunately we did not see the bridge open, but that was not an issue. We loved it.
A magestic piece of British History. What a great symbol of London it is! So grand and so beautiful. I recommend to see it both during daylight and by night, when it is illuminated.

The most iconic view in London. Want to capture the memory of your visit to London, then take a walk along the river and find your favourite bridge view. Both sides offer "pedestrians only" paths for your favorite stroll in the sun (or rain) and you'll find plenty of photo opportunities.

Visiting an icon. We visited Tower Bridge while on a short London break and I have to say, it was really enjoyable.If you get the 2 for 1 tickets, it will only cost you £4.50 each at the moment, which is fantastic value.The highlight is the glass walkway as you cross the upper span. The views are superb both up and down the river, and you can get your wife a bit worried by jumping on the glass ! I do hope that it is made by Pilkingtons, the guide up there didn't know :(It's a shame that you don't get to see underneath the bridge where it pivots as that would have been something else.When you have been here, take the short walk to HMS Belfast, another interesting site.

Beautiful Architecture and Great Place. Please take a tube to London Bridge Station. and go towards London Bridge.Starting from London Bridge to Tower Bridge, take a long walk. The atmosphere in the evening is simply pleasant.There is a lot is happening in the road and don't miss to enjoy them all. On the Tower Bridge go to the center and don't miss to see the marvelous architecture.The bridge open on specific time to let the big ship pass through on the Thames RiverSuggestions- Take a walk from London Bridge to Tower Bridge- Don't miss road side entertainment- Go in the evening to see the beauty of the site- Check web to find bridge opening timing as you must not miss the opened bridge

Well worth a visit.. We had been across Tower bridge many times but it had never occurred to us to actually go inside and have a tour until my daughter recommended it. So pleased she did as we really enjoyed the whole experience from the very informative history to the actual walk across the glass floor and the views. The engine room has been restored and also amazing to see. We booked a joint ticket to also include the monument which is also well worth doing and if you have travelled by train you can book on line 2for1.

Excellent Presenation and View of London. This is what I think a better way of viewing London from high as opposed to the London Eye (which I haven't been on). The expense is much less and you get a great view along the Thames and down through glass in the walkway. I would take the steps if you can manage, you get a nice view of the innards and you avoid the elevator line. You get to walk through both of the towers and on both sides of the road. There are multi media presentations which are well done. The mechanical room is in a separate location but easy to get to.

A bucket list event. I had always wanted to walk over the bridge and for some reason never had done so. Its a great feeling on being on such an iconic bridge and the views are great too. Close to the Tower and links to Borough market. Great day out.

Best bridge in the world. I love tower bridge & have always admired it from afar! I didn't know you can actually go up it too & look out over the thames...totally recommend it (if you're a fan of the bridge as I am).
Good. We went to tower bridge with prebooked tickets and was well worth the admission (deals available on line)Glass floor was highlight for the kids!

One of the best views in London.. especially at night. For me visiting tower bridge was one of the best things that I did in London. Definitely one of the must sees in that city. Go there in the evening !

most romantic place on planet earth. It beats Eiffel Tower for me hands down. The most romantic place. Till I reached London I always thought that it is called the London bridge after the famous poem we had in school ' London Bridge is falling down'. It carried the image of the ship passing and the tower opening up. Later did I realized it is the beautiful Tower Bridge. A great place to celebrate bday with friends, propose, spend quality time with your better half, a must visit for tourists.The weather is usually chilly in the evenings facing the River Thames.
Decent value. Decent value but it has got better since they put the glass floor in, gives quite a unique view of the Thames and all with some interesting information

week-end away. Our hotel was just a couple of minutes away so we had to go and walk across Tower Bridge. Not a lot to see actually, but again it`s an attraction. No tours available as far as I am aware, but it would not be practicable to have them. If you do go across the bridge look for the "Bridge Captains Dining Room" door, so called, I believe, because, after the bridge was constructed, it was manned by ex sailors.

Most beautiful bridge in London!. One of the must sees in London. The beautiful architecture alone warrants a visit, but when you add in the views; it's a no brainer. Be sure to walk it for the best experience. Also, visit the museum to explore the upper walkways.

Go there just to have been there. One of, if not the most famous bridge in London. The architecture is stunning and it looks its best standing on the walls of the tower of London. An iconic landmark which every visitor to London should see... Due to this it is very busy but definitely worth appreciating from a few different vantage points.
Value for money. Brilliant experience walking on the glass floors above the Thames. Great views of London and the history of Tower bridge was very interesting

A different perspective from inside. There are many attractions around london that give fine city views. Tower bridge presents not just that but also more with the glass floor. Once upstairs, there is also an exhibition on how tower bridge came about. husband loves to find out things behind the scene and so we walked to the other building and have a look at the steam engines that once powered tower bridge.

Definitely worth the climb! . Having walked over the bridge a few times I was really keen to explore inside after seeing the new walkway.First off make sure you are prepared for a climb as there are quite a few steps as you meander up the tower. Once at the top there is a short film introducing the bridge before you venture out onto the walkway and the glass floor which covers a section in the middle of the walkway. It's great been able to see the bridge from a different perspective and the views from the walkway are excellent (look for the little camera hatches you can open). There are also really friendly and knowledgeable staff on hand and info boards about what you can see and bridges in general. Following this you walk along the other walkway before descending by lift and out onto the bridge following the blue line to the engine rooms underneath the bridge (next to the gift shop). The engine rooms were impressive and well explained. All in all we spent a good hour and a half exploring everything and would definitely recommend it.
One of the pretty sights in London!. Even if you don't climb up the 200+ steps, just take some time out to visit this place late in the evening or at night. The banks of the Thames look spectacular!

A Must Visit. another lively place in the heart of London. a great view from the bridge with loads of opportunities to click awesome shots.. you may also enjoy the downtown kind of shops running along the Thames. a lovely tourist attraction and do enjoy the evening experience with all the lights "ON"

Fascinating experience. We found the history of the Tower Bridge very interesting. Never realised that when you walk over the high walkways there are glass floors to look down on the road and the Thames.When we came out of the exhibition we walked the blue line to go to the engine room. Amazing Victorian engineering all in such good order.Well worth a visit, only warning there are a lot of stairs to climb to get to the walkway but there is a lift to come down.

Great views, lots of steps. Visiting in March we found only a small queue. We used a 2 for 1 offer with National Rail, which was no problem. There are a great deal of steps to travel to the top of the tower. For this reason I would say that it would not be suitable for very young, old or people with mobility problems. The highlight was the glass floor which is above bridge.If you want to take a photo from the walkway, there are sliding windows which are easier to use.

Worth it…plus a little workout if you take the 200+ stairs. I loved this ! So exciting to stand on the glass floor looking down on traffic and the Thames River far below. My son loved this !!! It's a thrill!!! And good photos!

A must do. We have all looked at Tower Bridge but I recommend the Tower Bridge Exhibition going inside the Bridge, climbing the steps up to the walkway and seeing the glass floor that allows you to gaze down to the road and river from about 42 metres. There are guides,Tv displays and very informative travelog info provided throughout the experience. The climb to the top of the towers is quite strenuous so be aware, but it is well worth it. The same ticket then allows you to visit the 'Engine Rooms' where you get to see the steam engines that provided the power to lift the centre span of the bridge.There is also a 'Souvenir shop etc.
Interesting - Not spectacular. My wife and I went for a visit and thought this would be a cool thing to do. Nice for a feather in the cap, but not awe inspiring.

Great Tower Bridge Experience!. I come to London very often and always usually pass Tower Bridge, but had never been in it. But last year I did the Tower Bridge experience which was excellent.. The displays were very good and little films very interesting.Great experience!:)

Great photo opportunity. My 10 year old daughter was on her first visit to the capital. One of her best memories is going to be walking over the iconic Tower Bridge. It has to be the most photographed bridge in England and never fails to impress me. The old engine rooms are definitely worth visiting and you will learn some amazing history if you do.

A must see in London. Me and my wife visited Tower bridge during our anniversary trip to Europe. Even though it was raining in London, when is it not. We had to go see Tower Bridge, it gives you a great view of the city and the beautiful castle near the bridge, you just feel like youre in the heart of London when your there.

Iconic Bridge: Snap A Photo. So, Tower Bridge is an iconic landmark in London, which means that it is worth stopping by for a photo. However, it, like many bridges, serves more of a functional purpose than an entertainment one. Regardless, it's worth stopping by if you have some time to burn.
Iconic view great for selfies!. We took our photos of the Tower Bridge outside of London Tower. One of the famous London sights, it's blue cables show beautifully on a clear day.

Tower Bridge in glory. This is one of the most used shots for anything about London.I was very surprised as it looked smaller for some reason. This is also so close to Trafalgar Square, literally around the corner 2 mins away walking.On walking underneath it and looking up the towers look amazing but still has the effect of being smaller than it is. Never lifted for any water traffic but few and far between for that.Still enjoyed though
I loved it!. Not for those that have a fear of heights, but I enjoyed it so much, the view, the history and all the insides outs that you could appreciate!

value for money. A really nice surprise on the visit to London to find tower bridge open to the public with an exhibition as well for a really good entrance fee. Worth every penny to walk over the bridge with the glass floor and a visit to the well kept engine room.

Neat, Neat, Neat!. This was pretty neat! You get to walk through the overhead of the bridge, look over the entire history of the project, and even go into the retired hydraulic room, to see the original equipment that lifted these huge spans in the past. The tour itself is interesting and informative, and takes a solid hour if you are sticking with the group. It was one of the highlights of my trip, most notably the equipment areas, where you got to see the mighty engines that made this entire monster work.It's worth a trip!

Great attraction. We did the Tower Bridge experience which included a audio visual presentation and the chance to walk over the bridge including the glass floor! The presentation about the history of the design and build of the bridge was interesting as were the various exhibits and photos along the length of the bridge. When you have completed this visit you can go to the Engine Room to see how the bridge used to be raised when there was only steam power.

Interesting way to spend a free afternoon. The bridge itself is an architectural wonder and makes a great photo. It looks spectacular at night. Walking on it and up into the the tower is a nice experience. There are photos in the gallery on the history of the bridge and other memorabilia. Its not a "must do" in London where there are so many "MUST DO" experiences, but it is worth doing if you want to fill in some time.

Quick visit, interesting. I did the tower bridge exhibition. Elevator going up, a short movie, followed by a walk over the glass floor across the bridge, a look at the inside of the tower, and then down. The most interesting part are the Victorian era steam machines that used to operate the bridge. The machinery rooms are not on the bridge itself, its on shore and i almost missed the door. Make sure you keep your ticket to visit it. The steam machinery is kept in prestine condition. I am happy to have seen this historic monument. A nice way to spend 35 minutes as you exit the London tower, on your way to HMS Belfast and Tate Modern.

glass floors are great!. great little family trip...not a ripoff and my 4yo LOOOOOVED it! (especially the glass floors). The 'app' works well as well.Great way to spend an hour or so, maybe even two hours if you take your time looking around the engine rooms as well

Great landmark. Towe Bridge is one of the bridges to view whilst in Lodon. It is an iconic landmark and a must for a photograph and even better that it is still there as an American business tycoon bought the wrong bridge.

Beautiful! During the day and the Night!. We were so happy to be near the Tower Bridge. The architecture is stunning and is obvious that tourists love it as it took a while to be able to take a decent picture near the tower. We also went around it during the night as well. It was quiet and beautiful. all the lights like candles creates a atmosphere like in stories. after the walk we had dinner in a restaurant nearby. Maybe for locals is just a bridge but for some that seen this bridge only in movies, that feeling of joy when you are standing on it is indescribable. while we were there we read about it online to find out more about the history of the bridge.

Best site ever. What a beautiful place to take pics, it's romantic in the nights too. Millions of tourists and I have a lot of good memories here. This is just easily the best site to view a symbol of what London Is about.

Completely satisfied. Great experience. I really recomend to visit the bridge. Those who are afraid of heights must be carefully on upper level of the bridge as there is a glass floor. There is an interesting view from up there. I also suggest to see the short movies which will introduce you the history of the bridge.

A must visit attraction. It's worth the climb (or lift / elevator for those who cannot manage the stairs. The walkways, exhihibitions and historical informationand videos provide information that is not widely known. Walk between the North and South towers and brave the glass floor. The lift/elevator takes you back to earth on the South tower and a short walk leads you to the engine room and for the mechanical buffs is a sheer delight. The Tower bridge must not be missed when in London.

SOOOOO PRETTY. This is probably my fav must take a pic spot in London. It's very pretty. I just wanna thank whoever thought of designing and building this tower bridge because they're like apples to my eyes hahahhaa

What to say? It's a bridge. It's only a bridge. It has a beautiful architeture - great for taking pictures, it has a lot of history behind it, but it's a bridge! It may be the first or last part of your visit to London Tower, for instance. There is a deck view there, but I think it doesn't worth a visit - unless you have the London Pass (maybe it gives you access there) which the visit may be included.

Wow. We were on a cruise on the Thames and whilst there the boat stopped as the bridge was opening to let a tall vessel through it. It was a lovely thing to see as been to tower Bridge many times but never seen it open. It certainly made my day.Well worth checking on Google to see when bridge opens and add it to your visit.

The Old Lady of the Thames. Unfortunately on the day of our visit the Victorian lift was being overhauled, getting ready for the Easter crowds. We had to walk up to the walkway, I didn't count how many steps, but my wife had to stop a number of times to catch her breath! On the way up you can see the original ironworks, and admire the quality of work, and imagine the labour involved in it's construction. Just before going outside you can sit and watch a short documentary on the origins of the Bridge, which was interesting. The walkway is some110 feet above the roadway beneath, but at this stage you are not really aware of that. Roughly halfway across the glass insert walk is approached, so one is now walking on the glass viewing the vehicles 100 feet below, beneath them the Thames flowing at right angles to the traffic. Certainly a sight not to be missed, incidentally if there is a fear of heights you do not have to walk on the glass. A welcome lift takes you down to road height, we were lucky insomuch that at midday the bridge raises to allow one of the larger vessels to go upstream. It takes a mere 60 seconds to raise these enormous bascules to 86o, an amazing feat of Victorian engineering. Unfortunately we did not have time to visit the engine room, certainly a sight not to be missed.

new glass floors. been to tower bridge before but we wanted to see the glass floors it was a saterday afternoon quite busy but efficiently handled minimum queues the glass floors were well worth the visit
Well worth it....!. We have done this several times now and always enjoy it... Highly recommended, great views of the city and the Thames.

Tower Bridge. Tower Bridge one of the iconic views in the World, you must walk across and see the Gap in The Middle, looking down you can see the water and if you put a foot on each side you can feel the two halves bounce as the traffic goes over it.

Great fun !. The new glass walkway in the bridge makes the visit great fun. Also neat are the small slide windows that allow you to take decent photos rather than suffering the glass window reflections should be installed in ALL viewing platforms (hello, the Shard, London Eye etc!). Awful intro film at the start of the visit (ham acting is an understatement...) really worth just ignoring. Visit to the engine room fascinating, for those of you who love beautiful Victorian machinery. All in all, a visit that is worth repeating over and over...!

Great value, superb views all round. Including down. We had seen a program about the sky walk/glass floor a few months ago, and so off we went. Not much of a queue for tickets, and great value at £9. A lift whisks you up to the top, then a short film about the bridge. Then onto the walkways. You can spend as long as you like on the walkways before going back down to ground level. Then onto the old engine room, and the lovely old engines, in immaculate condition.

Great value, superb views all round. Including down. We had seen a program about the sky walk/glass floor a few months ago, and so off we went. Not much of a queue for tickets, and great value at £9. A lift whisks you up to the top, then a short film about the bridge. Then onto the walkways. You can spend as long as you like on the walkways before going back down to ground level. Then onto the old engine room, and the lovely old engines, in immaculate condition.

One of 100 places on earth you have to visit. We all have heard a lot about Tower Bridge, seen it on pictures, post cards etc but until you visit it, walk in it, read the details of its construction, absorb the stunning views, watch down through the glass floor you cannot feel this overwhelming feeling that takes you back in time and make you wonder how great Victorian Britain was.I am pleased to have visited on Valentine's day. It was full of couples, with colour LED lights, up from one side, through the two walkways & down from the other.Walk up & down, do not use the lift it is around 110 steps but you go through time.
Beautiful landmark!. You know you're in London when you see this beautiful work of art. It is absolutely stunning at night.

My fave place on EARTH and now you can go INSIDE of it. Tower Bridge is my fave place on EARTH. I don't know why, but it is. And as a kid we went on a school trip to the engine rooms and I haven't been back inside sinceAnd so when the walkways opened up, I was well excited for this!I went there as part of a 1st date and she loved it. It's a bridge at the end of the day so there are no thrills, but the views are spectacular and the thought of all them people and cars passing beneath is greatThere was a Bride, Groom and their wedding party up there when we arrived so Im not sure if they were married up there or what. If they were, they are gona last!It's just a cool place to visit and if you find Tower Bridge as cool as I do, you MUST visit

The most amazing Bridge!. Every time I come to London, I LOVE to see Tower Bridge. it is stunning. Great to walk over, and great to look at! Truly iconic London. No matter what you do in this city, make sure you do not miss the Tower Bridge!

Amazing. I never realised there was so much to see inside the Tower Bridge, we had a guided tour by Peter and it was excellent, he has a wealth of knowledge and will answer any questions you may have, he was also very friendly and made the tour very enjoyable. I must also mention Sean who was a charming young man and explained all about the controls for the bridge. I am not mechanically minded but I found this tour fascinating, we were even taken to the part under the bridge. The glass walkway was amazing seeing all the traffic go by underneath us. All in all a splendid tour.

Go for it. Enjoy a nice day out,walk along the enbankment, or better still go by boat ,take a boat ride on the water,enjoy looking at the beautiful tower bridgeGo to the many eaterys along the way, or just watch the water fountains dancing, no music this time,but they dance!if you stroll along the enbankment, take a towel, in case you get wet,or go on a hot day so you dry offquicker

TOP OF THE WORLD MA. This is a nice break from plodding around London, It's not Alton Towers its a bridge so don't expect any thrills, well you do get to walk over a glass floor, I went on Thursday and only a few school kids so also I nice break from the crush, You can do it in under an hour but take your time, take a few pictures'. at £9 its a bit steep but lots of two for one offers around so have a Google, would I do it again yes, enjoy the peace.
Gorgeous. A fantastic piece of architecture that out stands from any other bridge. During the day the colors are nice but its during the night that its beauty shines with gorgeous illumination

A truly unique experience. My husband and I did the Tower Bridge experience using Tesco clubcard days out vouchers. We bought a combined ticket to monument too which was not much more than the entrance to just Tower bridge.I have to say I thoroughly enjoyed the Bridge experience, even the climb up the stairs (there is a lift too for the less energetic). I thought the whole thing was informative and unique. The glass floor is a work of genius as a tourist attraction and many were taking full advantage of the photo opportunities. There are lots of info. boards around and videos which add to educational value. There is also a bridges of the world hall of fame. The engine room is well worth the walk across the bridge to it. The entrance fee is usually £9 per adult and I would have been happy if I had paid it. The views are good even on the dull cloudy day that we had. I was glad to have walked up the monument too but it is a really monumental climb at 311 steps, only do it if you think you can manage it. There are not any stop off points as such and you have to pass the people coming down/up on a narrowish spiral staircase. The views are good although there is currently a lot of building work going on nearby, it was actually interesting to watch the cranes though.
Amazing atraction. That is very beautiful construction. The view on the bridge you can to see whole London town . There is full with tourists who is from a lot of countries.

Interesting up to a point. Sort of place that will interest engineering types. Think it was £9 for adults. Gives a good overview and history of the bridge, and also provides some good views down the Thames. A grown up sort of attraction, kids not likely to find it that interesting.Glad we went though.

simply fantastic. interesting visit in this Historical location.
Queen's jewels worth the ticket by themselves! the particular atmosphere you can breath here is something unforgettable. Really reccomended

A good exhibition. The highlight is the glass floor in the walk ways high over the bridge. The exhibition is interesting and the views from walkways are spectacular. The exhibition is self lead and involves reading information so is not very interactive but on the whole is worth doing.

Company meal . We were fortunate to be part of a company outing that hired out one of the upper walkways for a dinner party and it was fantastic. It was a beautiful setting with a fantastic view and the glass panelled floor took my breath away! It's 30 meters off the ground and it takes some courage to do the whole length!! Well worth the visit
Can't visit London without going here!. Great to say you've been here but remember it is a bridge!! Got some fab pics of the bridge from the clipper boat ride so try and get a few different angles.

Spectacular. From the distance it looks like somthing out of a book. The breath taking view is worth stopping for. I have to get a picture everytime I am in london. I would reccomend walking along embankment on the side of the thames and enjoying the views.

Go to the Top. It's seems silly to rate a historical monument and I don't usually do so. However; it is worth noting that it is worth it to do more than take photos of Tower Bridge from afar. As picturesque as it is, purchase a ticket and take a ride to the top. Walking on the plexiglass floor was intriguing and the views FROM the bridge are wonderful. Walking through the exhibit showing how the bridge works might be more interesting to those into engineering, but it is a quick walk through to the gift store.

It is a bridge!. Whilst the title might seem flippant, it is intentionally obvious. While we visited there were several voices from other visitors who clearly expected this to be something else, possibly they thought it was the Tower of London. But it is a bridge, albeit a brilliant one! Even the walk up is good, there are some "mini-exhibitions" on the way (as well as toilets, should you need them)and once at the top there are two sides to walk along, enjoy the views and learn an awful lot about the history of the bridge and surrounding area.If you weren't actually intending visiting the bridge, but find yourself nearby, especially in bad weather, then you will not regret going for a visit. It should take no more than two hours and you are already located well for the Tower of London, Shard, Borough Market and others. This is an inexpensive attraction, which has the ability to interest even the most uninterested. It does get busy, but it is worth checking out the timetable of bridge lifts to see if your visit can coincide.

Worldwide Favourite. Tower Bridge is my worldwide favourite! It's majestic beauty is second to none. If you are travelling through London definitely take a cruise down the Thames and go under this exquisite bridge. Stand in the middle of the bridge and admire it's elegance. It is perfect!
WOW!. We took the full tour of this bridge and it really was fascinating to look back through the history of the bridge. Well worth the visit

Great for the Views. It is worth it for the views. The glass floors are cool as you step over traffic flying by underneath. Try and aim for a time they raise the bridge. We didn't, but I'm sure that would have been cool. Didn't case much for the other stuff. The first video they played for you about the process of the design is cool and fun. Engine room is cool. Worth the price for the walkway.

Excellent insight into a global landmark. Tower Bridge is a global landmark and an internationally recognized symbol of London. It's amazing that you can visit it, travel across the top walkways with great views over London and then see the original engine room - not working these days, but still fascinating. Wherever you go there is a host of great information: bridges of the world; information about the construction; and details on how it operates. An absorbing and worthwhile excursion.

Dominating London Landmark not to be missed. It may be just be a bridge :)But its the equivalent of not seeing the statue of liberty when visiting the states.Brilliant architecture which silhouette dominates the Thames

must see.... We took a boat ride from the Parliament area to the Tower Bridge. There is a short elevator ride up to the top and then a self guided tour of the bridge exhibitions. There are two short films to watch.

Great London Attraction. It was a great tour very interesting as there is a glass floor in both of the upper walkways and the view is stupendous when looking down on top of the traffic and people walking across the bridge. The engine rooms are also very interesting and the machinery is kept gleaming. I would thoroughly recommend this tour as it is suitable for all ages old and young alike.

Great Bonus to our trip. This is a must if you have time. You get to go up in a lift in the north tower to watch a short film then walk through the walkways which after 30 odd years I didn't realise you could!! They have just had a glass floor installed it is awesome check out my photos

Tower Bridge. Was great to do and see to learn the history of the bridge. It doesn't take very long to do, we did think we wouldn't have been bothered if we didn't do the tour inside. The glass walkway isn't very big, only about a metre by 2 metres maybe, you can get some photos of outside through the windows. We also went to see the engine rooms which was an extra cost. The tour was well done and very interesting, the staff all had great knowledge. Anyone that likes learning about history or how things were built will enjoy this tour.

legendary bridge. This is the symbol of the city, which can't br missed during the stay. With Tower and surrounding buildings it represent very eclectic face of modern London and gives very good impression, of what city looks like. On feet doesn't make that good impression because of traffis and polluted air, better enjoy from the bank of Themes

My favourite stop in London. By far the best tour We had in London. Great views, great architecture! The film at the beggining of the tour was short but full of the higlights needed to understand the history! A must do better priced than the London eye and much much worth it!

A iconic place in London. It's so nice to see something, that you only was saw in the internet.
The tower bridge, it's so beautiful, was so nice to walk in this bridge. And a really like this blue color in the bridge. WOW, Very beautiful

Iconic symbol of London.. I don't know what the 15th March reviewer Raymond M is on about as I've never met any Briton who refers to Tower Bridge as 'London Bridge', also London Bridge is not '2 miles down the road'. 'Actually' that is the next bridge upriver, less than half a mile away! And, the MI6 Building is at Vauxhall Cross, beside Vauxhall Bridge, and nowhere near any 'Shakespeare theatre'.I have never read such a load of misleading balderdash in all my life!The Tower Bridge is a true icon of London and to many is THE symbol of London. It was completed as recently as 1894 although many people think it's much older, as the towers are built in such a style as to complement the architecture of the Tower of London nearby.I have not yet paid to enter the exhibition, an unforgivable omission I soon hope to rectify.But I have viewed, or walked across it many times and seen the bascules raised on several occasions. I once took a river trip from Tilbury on the 'Waverley' to the Pool of London and back and they were raised for us twice.

Chance visit that turned out to be a highlight of the weekend. On a "tourists in our own town" weekend to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary, my wife and I came across the Tower Bridge tour whilst exploring the South Bank section of the Thames Path. We decided to check it out and were not disappointed! The history of the bridge is of great interest and is brought to life by a collection of films, images and information boards as well as the engine room/bascule walk-through tour and friendly knowledgeable guides. The views from the towers are spectacular - East towards Canary Wharf and West towards Central London and the glass walkways are a must - once you've won the battle of mind over matter and plucked up the courage to step onto the glass that is all there is between you and the roadway and river 120 feet below! The guide helpfully pointed out that each walkway could support the weight of 6 adult elephants but this still didn't stop early trepidation! Well worth it in the end though. This attraction is not at all expensive and has some great deals for families. Recommended.

The Tower Bridge is an interesting tour.. The Tower Bridge is an interesting tour. The sights from the glass walkways are worth it.The information posted along both walkways are done very well. You can do the tour at your own pace. The price is reasonable.

An attraction you must see. Nothing more iconic than the Tower bridge in london.A worthy visit at any given time of the day.Avoiding a visit to the bridge on weekends is advisable but if you're in the city for a short visit, don't worry about it too much and go ahead.

Nice View from the Tower Bridge. Interesting self-guided tour. It's a beautiful attraction with great view of the Thames. It's even better at night with the glow of lights shimmering off the water. Kids really enjoyed walking across the bridge in the glass enclosed walk way. Buy the London Pass and take advantage of the great discount on many attractions (London Bridge, Tower of London, etc.).Well worth it!

A true London Landmark. An Icon of the London skyline - this bridge is a beautiful piece of architecture and you should visit if in the area. If you are lucky the bridge will open to a passing vessel - take time to walk across and view the River both ways. Good photo opportunities are available from the bridge

Interesting. We all call this place London bridge , but London bridge is actually 2 miles down the road and for those James Bond buffs that's is were MI6 is . And is near the Shakespeare theatre is. A fascinating place this bridge and the guides are really good and make it interesting to participate in .
Great views. Interesting hour or two both looking at the bridge and the views from it. Website gives bridge lifting times.

A view from the bridge. Really enjoyed walking over the glass floor and the views from the bridge were worth the trip. The film at the start was not that well produced, but there are some interesting facts and figures on the information boards on the walkways. The bridge itself is beautiful and it was a wonderful experience to be able to walk along the top of it.

Interesting. First of all, Tower Bridge is beautiful. I enjoyed looking at it both during the day and at night. We did the exhibition as part of the London Pass, and it was interesting enough, but I found it a bit boring. I'm really not interested in architecture of the history behind the construction of bridges, buildings, cities etc. but my companion thoroughly enjoyed it. Along 2 long corridors there are information boards detailing the history of the bridge, and photographs of other famous bridges around the world. Probably spent an hour there.
Must go. Must visit if you ever visit London. Stand at the center of bridge and you will fell the movement when bus or lorry pass by.
Different. Not what I expected. It was ok although not to interesting. the original wooden staircase was something to look at and I did enjoy the engine room though.

Great views and a Fun Glass Floor. Enjoyed the visit. Despite living near London in the past and then visiting several times we visited Tower Bridge for the first time in February. Well worth a visit. good views and the glass floor was fun. My wife decided she couldn't even walk over it despite the many tourist lying on it taking their selfies.Only issue was the lack of lift down as my wife had a bad knee. Although I am sure if we had asked disabled access could have been made available.

Good day out . Spent a good few hours here and enjoyed it. Used the 2 for 1 voucher from virgin trains so the ticket prices were good too. Loads to see, maybe limited if you can't walk so well -alot of steps. We had lunch here and it was alright average London prices. Would recommend for families or couples who enjoy historic facts.

Loved the floor !. Only wanted to go in here to experience the glass floor over the Thames..and with a bogoff voucher for me and my son the money we paid was worth it just for the views and the glass floors . We spent longer in there than we thought trying to get photos from every vantage point. There is other points to the experience videos and explanations of how the tower was constructed ..which we only briefly glanced at and then you can go through the engine room and see the amazing working of the bridge . Wish we could have seen the bridge lift that would've topped it off . Was a brightish dry day when we went and quiet as a Thursday in March , not sure how this would be at peak times ??? We loved it though ...going inside history .

Cool. We went with my doughters and my husband .we loved it.its the biggest symbols of London.it wes very exciting going inside the bridge.and there is glassfloor.which is little.scary but cool.and i liked 3 minute shows in the both towers which is giving info about bridge.especially my doughters loved sticker book and stickers.
Glass floor. great landmark to ascend, especially to walk across the glass floor and see the traffic below. We bought tickets online and didn't have to wait, but I didn't see a line really anyway

Not Worth It. Apart from being able to say that I've been to the top, it was not worth it at all. The view is greatly limited on both sides by the structure of the bridge, also making near impossible to take any photos.

Great spectacle to see it open, wonderful Victorian engineering. Just seeing Tower Bridge opening is memorable but if you can go on a tour inside the Bridge itself. You get to cross the river on the high part across the river and see the wonderful Victorian motors that power the mechanism that opens the bridge. It's all kept spotless with wonderful shining brass fixtures

interesting for those who are into engineering. A very iconic place, with an exhibition about bridges of the world that is quite interesting. The glass floor is the best thing about it, in my opinion. Those who are into engineering will enjoy the engine rooms.

Iconic building. Had a lovely dinner on the upper walkways of Tower Bridge, there is a exhibition centre where you can visit the old lady. fantastic views of the city and a must see if you get a chance, look down through the glass panelling below on the bridge road, and the river..

Touristy but enjoyable. I wasn't expecting much from this attraction but felt that I had to do it since it really is one of London's great icons. Actually we were pleasantly surprised. It was a really enjoyable attraction. There are movies explaining why the bridge was built and by whom, who designed the bridge and how the bridge was made. Quite amazing when you think of how long ago it was built. The walk along the bridge offers beautiful views of London, especially since it was a gorgeous sunny day. The glass panels on the floor are a cute idea but I didn't have the courage to walk on them....
Legendary. Loved it :).it represents london's / Britain's rich history.a must visit when in london. One can have a nice photosession :)

Beautiful Landmark. Tower Bridge is best seen from the walkway in front of the Tower of London. The bridge is beautiful and great photo opportunities can be had near here. We went to the Tower and that's where we figured we would see the bridge as well. A good way to cap off a good day at the Tower.
A must see in London. It was a sunny day but this bridge is magnificent, see it from the south bank on the opposite side of the tower of london so you can see both of them.

A beautiful icon that should be seen!. A beautiful bridge and iconic symbol of London, it's hard to imagine any trip to London could be complete without making the effort to see it with your own eyes. It's rich history and unmistakable lines make it immediately recognisable, even from a distance. HINT: enjoy the safe, scenic stroll along the South bank then stop at the plaza in front of City Hall to enjoy the best bridge views before crossing Tower Bridge on foot to the north side for a visit to the Tower of London. Free to cross, but fee to enter.

Better than expected. Only included this experience as we were killing some time but was delighted we fitted it in as my 13 year old son was with me and he thought it was really good. You get to go right up to the top where they have a pathway between the two towers with some glass panels which we had great fun standing on and taking photos looking through to the bridge. Then we went down to see how the engines work the bridge and out through the shop at the end where we bought lots of cool souvenirs which I thought were very reasonably priced. We didn't have time to do the tower of London which is only across the street but will definitely do it next time as it looks equally as interesting.

good photo opp. Go on and walk across one of the most iconic bridges in the world. There is a good view from the bridge onto the Tower of London and Thames river. No charge for walking on bridge and plenty of photo opps.
Beautiful. Went there for an evening walk was such a beautiful site, the night time lights make it extra special

One of my favorite sightseeings in London. Last time we were in London we decided to walk on the Tower Bridge since it was a beautiful day.We really enjoyed watching all the people get photographed with the bridge (we even saw a newly wed couple doing their photo shoot there!) and we walked over the bridge to get to the other side.Apparently there is a way to walk on the top of the bridge on a glass floor, for a fee I don't remember right now. Went to the other side and had our coffee. Lovely area to walk!
Awesome. Tower bridge is an awesome place and everyone who visit London should make sure that they see Tower bridge in day and night time. Night time lightings are very good.
I like it. Special Bridge symbol of London. Special view during the night and the day. I saw it several times, just walking or driving a car and every time is a surprise. I like this bridge so much

Stunning. What most people mean when they say London Bridge. Worth the trip to come to this part of town to see it lit up at night. You can combine it with a Tower of London visit, of course, if you forego the night illumination.

Icon of London. Tower Bridge is a MUST see while in London.It is the most iconic bridge in the World, I reckon. I visited in Feb with my sister and my daughter(9).The Tower Bridge experience is fantastic and the glass walkways are fabulous.The kids will love it. The entry fee is reasonable and can be combined with other London attractions. This bridge looks fantastic during the day,even on a damp February day ,but looks incredible at night. Bring a packed lunch as there are no eating facilities. The engine rooms may be over the kids heads but well worth the visit.You will see budding engineers of the future.Well worth the visit

A must-visit. I guess that Tower Bridge is something everyone must visit at least once in their lives, together with the Tower of London alongside and St Katherine's dock nearby - all important parts of London's history.

Enjoy a lot . Very nice beautiful place spe in night view I came here with my family n friends enjoyed that was bit hot nights so the open air gave so much relaxing effect we walked there for long kids were enjoyed also I would like to go there again n again

Boring. Maybe its because I am female but I found the whole experience totally boring. You cant take a decent photo because of all the obstructions e.g the iron zig zags of the bridge on the outside. The glass walkway is very short on both sides of the bridge, it runs about a fifth of the entire floor, once you have looked down once, that is about it. Very poor films showing how the bridge was constructed and boring photos of other bridges around the world. Dont bother. There are better views of London, like from a riverboat or on the London Eye. We couldnt find a lift to come down, there are not enough staff to find and ask where the lift is, we had to walk halfway down then wait ages when we eventually found the lift. Bad organisation, staff just dont seem bothered at all.

Fantastic Tower Bridge. We visted the Tower Bridge Experience. Very interesting and the walk across the bridge was very interesting with lost of displays and now the glass floor, lovely to watch the London buses from above. So interesting to see the Engine Room. Very good value.

Quite a sight!!!. My husband and I came here our first day in London...it is a lovely bridge!! We did not pay to take the tour though, I'm sure there were many interesting things to learn and see, but we did not have the time that day.

very nice. My second trip to London, Our trip will not be complete without tower bridge or London bridge is falling down, but we are not lucky during our visit because the Bridge did not open and close, but the view still amazing freezy February 2015.

What an experience!. I really enjoyed this, we've all seen the bridge from passing by, movies, TV and photos but to go inside and see how it works is great. The glass floors in the high-level corridor are slightly vertigo inducing but once overcome are fun. I only did the east corridor as I went down to the engineering area but I really wish I had - views towards central London.The engineering room was great, massive steam engines in all their victorian splendour.I got the combined ticket with the London Monument, only £1.50 more and valid for 7 days. Be aware that you do need to walk from the south tower to the engine room and the day I went it was raining so take an umbrella.

Stunning. The bridge is stunning when viewed at night from the south side of the river . It is well lit , so easy to take photos . Never tire of seeing it against the skyline . Always a pleasure to walk along the thames .

Nice diversion worth visiting. we visited through pre booked tickets. Excellent overall spectacle, made better for not being too busy. One of my favourite items was the various Bridge displays and information boards scattered around. Very apprehensive on the glass floors but great way to watch people hurrying across the bridge. The videos were slightly dull but only took a few minutes. The engine room us a definite must with the engines all immaculate and lovely to see working. Took about 90 minutes of time well spent.
amazing!!!!. just seeing the size of this bridge is incredible!!!!! one of those things you must cross over well in London, take some pics!!!
This Site in Unreal!. The Tower Bridge is majestic, especially at night and does not even look real. No trip to London would be complete without it.

The Tower Bridge Experience. Good views from the upper walkway, the highlight being the glass floor through which you can see the road and the river. Also fascinating to see the original machinery (you have to exit the bridge itself to access this) and a couple of interactive videos showing how the bridge was built. Price of entry (£9) very reasonable (best to pre-book).
Views from the water. Took a cruise that took us by the bridge and was able to get some wonderful photos and have a great cup a coffee to enjoy the sites

How many people stand in Ore of the Bridge. We have stayed in the Tower Hotel many time while visiting London which is up river of the bridge within spitting distance of it, and I still stand in ore of this magnificent feat of Victorian Engineering. Its such a world known landmark of London recognised all around the World. We have walked across many times and stood on and watched the boats and pleasure cruises pass under and go through when the bridge is raised, London wouldn't be London without Her.

Great value London attraction. Interesting history, great views and unique glass floor experience (not if you don't like heights...) Good value for money (£9) per adult - cheaper if you book ahead online. Definitely recommend this.

One of 'The Bridges'. Visited during the winter is more appreciated as there were no massive crowds and we could see the exhibiton of the top 40 bridges all over the world in relative peace, not to mention the attractive walk over the glass floor. Engine rooms ale also worth visiting.

I wouldn't wanna miss this experience!. We didn't wanna spent so much money on entry fees on our two day stay in London. So a visit to the Tower Bridge was one of a few. The entry fee is only 9 GBP and it was absolutely worth it. We didn't have to queue long to get in. The staff was overall very friendly and helpful. You go up in an elevator and first sit down to watch a short and quite funny movie. Because only a few people fit into the elevator it is not crowded and you definetely get a seat for the movie. Then you go straight to the glass floor and can look down one side of the Thames and when you arrive at the end you can go down the other glass floor and look down the other side of the Thames. It was not crowded and we were instructed to take as much time, as we wanted, sit or lay down and read a bit about the construction of the bridge. There were also pictures and information about other interesting bridges around the world, which was cool. The speical thing about the whole experience is not only the excellent view over London, but the glass floor. It absolutely freaked me out and I had to go along the narrow wooden floor at the sides, but if you're not afraid of heights, it must be great :). On your way out you can watch yet another short film about the construction of the bridge, then get a chance to use the bathroom and go on the elevator down. Hold on to your ticket and go a short walk of 2 mins over the bridge to the engine rooms. This one is especially for everybody interested in the technology of the bridge. Overall rating: Highly enjoyable, would always do this again. Go for it!

Very good value for money. Would highly recommend doing this. At just £9, you get a short presentation on the building of the bridge along with walks along both corridors as well as a visit to the engine room. The glass floor is a fantastic innovation and makes it fun for all age groups. The staff throughout were very friendly and will calm anyone's fear of the floor. If you want a picture of the bridge, dusk is a brilliant time to do so.

Great location perfect pictures. We visited Tower Bridge on a shiny day. It was a marvelous visit and we took great pictures of the Bridge and of course beautiful fotos of the scenery when we were on the bridge. You must visit it.
Iconic london. You must see the bridge if in London as it's just so iconic.get your photos,soak it in and just enjoy this historic landmark.
Loved it. As we were staying close by we thought we would have a visit. Glad we did the views are stunning and the glass walkway quite an experience

2 Adults and a 12 year old. Another fab icon ofLondon. We visited the Tower Bridge Exhibit on 28 Feb 15 straight after seeing The Tower of London. We bought the combined ticket for Tower Bridge and the Monument which was very reasonable given London's elevated prices.With a choice of lift or stairs, naturally we decided to get some 'free phys' and opted for the stairs. Once to the top we enjoyed the views from both walkways and also walking along the part where the glass floor is. There are a few films to watch em route which a short but sweet and your tickets allow entry into the engine rooms of the Towers which is worth a visit.Definitely advise going and now my family can say we have been up the Tower Bridge.
Got to take a pic with the bridge!. The bridge is just a bridge. Maybe that is true for some people but if you use your imagination you can step back in time.

Nice to just say you walked across. Tower Bridge is an iconic symbol of London and a short walk from The Tower of London. After spending a day at The Tower we didn't have time to do the tour and exhibition at Tower Bridge but instead decided to walk across the bridge and take in the view up the Thames and that was really worthwhile.On the opposite bank to The Tower you can see HMS Belfast and there are quite a lot of restaurants in that area.Well worth a visit just take photo and to say you were there.

Interesting tour. A drizzly morning in February is a good time to visit as there are no queues.We used the Days Out Guide 2for1 offer with our rail tickets to get in half price.A good audio visual show gives you an insight into the building of the bridge and how it works.The last part of the tour lets you see the old Victorian steam system that used to drive the bridge.There are glass walkways that allow you to see the traffic going across the bridge below.You can check when the bridge is due to be raised on the web site, but when we went it wasn't being raised for a couple of weeks (then several times in a few days).The guides have iPads with an app (which you can download) that shows what the view would be like as the bridge is raised if like us you are not able to see it live.

A must if in London!. Visited the Tower of London While vacationing in England. Took a tour of the grounds and learned a lot about the rich history. If you enjoy learning and are interested in history, this is a stop that you need on your itinerary. The view is pretty spectacular, too!

Iconic bridge and great views. A London "must" see. For just £9 for an adult the ticket gets you up to the elevated walkways and an immersive experience inside the most famous bridge in the world. The views are fantastic - make sure you go on the east and west walkways to see all of London. The glass floors, looking down 150 ft/ 50m to the river below are really good fun. At the end you walk along the road level and then go under the south approach road into the former boiler rooms - all beautifully polished and restored. Really very interesting.

Landmark of London. If someone asks me what truly stands out as a landmark in London I would say it's 'Tower Bridge' without any hesitation...The bridge which was built in 19th Century is truly massive and very beautiful...I have walked multiple times on the bridge and am amaze every single time by the rich architecture of the bridge...none of friends believed that the bridge opens until they saw the bridge open to enable passage of a cruise ship on river Thames...

Not enough information itself.. The walkways are covered with information about OTHER bridges, which is not what I paid to come here and see. The engine rooms have information pitched at a primary-school/American intelligence level, and were entirely insufficient to actually learn anything useful, informative, or interesting. More data about horse power, capacity, numbers, explanations... Would have earned more stars.

An insight into Victorian Engineering. When you look at the iconic Tower Bridge and perhaps a little chuckle at our friends from across the pond that thought they were buying this wonderful bridge back in 1967 you must marvel at this great structure and how our forefathers realy did change the face of the modern world. A walk from the north bank to the south bank on the high level walkways is a must to see East London from a different view point.

Great views from Tower Bridge.. I went to Tower Bridge with a friend, which is a great London landmark. Tower Bridge Exhibition cost £9 for adults, which is reasonable, we got to walk across the high lever walkway, which had great views of the river Thames & the Tower of London. Also got to see the mechanics / engineering of Tower Bridge in the Victorian Engine Rooms. Was great to see one of British greatest landmarks, which was built in 1886 - 1894, and brilliant to take photographs.
Not the London Bridge. The Tower Bridge is the one you have always thought about in London. Walk it, Take pics and return at night to see it again. Then enjoy a pint at a nearby pub.

Great with kids. We took our granddaughters up Tower Bridge and across the glass floor. They absolutely loved it; it is a unique experience for London, and the glass floor is a brilliant innovation. We timed it so the bridge was lifted when we were there - awesome! It's well worth checking on line when it will open.

Good but could be better. The tour is good, but whoever has put it together seems unsure of the target market ----- adults or kids. The explanations are sometimes too simplified, and in the film presentations facts are sacrificed for gimmicky graphics and music.But the engine rooms and walkways are well worth it.

Awesome experience. We went up the tower bridge to walk across the glass floor and I am so glad we made the time to do it! It felt like I was flying when I was on top of the glass floor. The engine rooms were also really cool. It showed you what happened when they are lifting it up. Overall I thought it was awesome!

Excellent. Took the teenage kids along to this and they loved it. The glass walkway was a real hit. We all enjoyed looking at the pictures of awesome bridges from around the world. The view was something else.

Brilliant. The Tower Bridge experience is really worth a visit. After paying your enterance fee you enter a lift and travel up the North tower. Here you will see a short film about why Tower Bridge was built. After the film you then walk along the East walkway with marvellous views of East London. There are plenty of information boards with photos and lots of relevant information. Halfway along the walkway the floor turns to glass with great view down below. You will see another film in the South tower about how the bridge was built. A great piece of Victorian engineering. You can also walk along the West walkway with views of the Shad, Tower of London and many more features of London. You then return to the South tower and descend back down to the ground floor. Your ticket will also get you in to the engine room. This is a brilliant place to visit.

Well worth a visit. For £9 you cant go wrong. Felt strange initially walking on the glass floor. Good views both ways along the river of the changing london skyline. Woukd certainly recommend a visit.

I've got the power. OK.. so you have made it to Tower Bridge, its great.... and of course not to be confused with London bridge which is the next one up the Thames, the hidden attraction is all.. well..hidden..! The engine rooms below are a must see, its truly amazing how clever the Victorians were. The bridge was powered by beautifully engineered static steam engines. (however its all electric these days) Well worth a long visit.. and truly inspiring for anyone interested in historical engineering. I loved it.

Super experience. I think this was one of the best values for the cost in London. Terrific fun especially since they now have glass panels in the floors of the walkways so you can look down on the roadway and to the river below. Check the schedule for raising the bridge. Very fun.

Exhibition Review. We did the Exhibition that was included with the London Pass. It is worth the price of admission purely for the views and 2 separate glass floors. Other than that, there is a 3 min cheesy movie at the beginning, information and pictures of famous bridges throughout the world and a view of the engine room. It is cool to say you did it.

Great View of London. During the February half term we took our grandchildren aged 6 and 10 to London to see a show. We always try and show them something different each time we visit London so before travelling back we took them to the Tower Bridge experience. They loved the glass floor and spent ages sitting on it (I wasn't that brave). We enjoyed seeing the different buildings along the Thames. There is a lift to take you to the walkway or if you are really fit you can climb the stairs. There were a couple of films to watch showing how it was constructed and how it opens. The boys found this interesting because we had been lucky enough to see the bridge open on our last visit to London. You can also visit the engine rooms (in with the ticket price) but this didn't hold their attention very much.

fantastic. We treacly enjoyed a trip to the tower bridge and we paid the £9 each to go onto the tower walkway which was really impressive. You get to learn about the history of the bridge and walk along a section of it via a glass walkway which was great fun.
Great British landmark. A trip to the Bug Smoke should always involve a visit to this fabulous bridge! Wonderful structure and very distinct! Never tire of looking at this bridge.
Looks amazing!. We only seen this in passing when we where in London, but it looked amazing!The next time i visit i will be making sure i take some time here to fully appreciate it!

Second Visit. We had to go back to Tower Bridge to see the newly opened glass walkway. The exhibit itself was still as interesting as ever, with the history of the bridge and the wonderful photo view points, but the glass floor was a bit of a let down. It was only a small area and most of it was taken up by young (twenty-something) tourists lying full length on it while their friends took seemingly endless photos. But having said that, the exhibition is well worth a visit, and is good value for money. Make sure you visit the Engine Room at the end.
Tower trip. Bought our tickets online, but didn't really need to, there wasn't too much of a queue. The glass floor was good, very odd feeling, but you got used to it. Great views across London.

Not as big as you think. You have to see this when your in London its such an landmark that it a shame to miss it.Smaller and narrower than you might think, but still a must see and wonderful piece of engineering for its time...didn't do the glass walk as the queue was too big, but still enjoyed it a lot.
Forget London bridge. An amazing bridge, so much more than its better known cousin - London Bridge. An ornate bridge that never slows down no matter what time of the day/night it is.

Good value and interesting. We went February school holidays. Queued less than 5 mins early afternoon. Walked up the stairs have heard it is 200 stairs, easy for us and a 9 year old. Videos were short and sweet, I liked that as some attractions have long winded videos. Glass panels were scary at first but then we did stand on them. Think price was reasonable and thought shop was also reasonable with good souvenirs not normal rubbish. Was enjoyable, approx hour to hour an half depending how long you spend looking at pictures and at each part.

Went for photo op. Unfortunately we didn't have time to go to the exhibition but of course we HAD to see it and HAD to have a selfie ;) We took the Tower Hill underground, walked across the Tower of London Park up to the bridge for a closer view, then went down to the wakway in front of Tower of London. Perfect site for photo op with the Tower Bridge.

Walking on Glass. An amazing attraction at Tower Bridge awaits you. The recent inclusion of glass floors which allow you to look down on the Thames and the bridge itself are a huge asset. Some amazing photographs of other fabulous bridges are included in the exhibition. The glass floor can be a bit scary but one of the guides reliably informed us that each glass panel can hold the weight of one big and two small elephants. If you have an hour to spare visit the Tower Bridge Experience.

Have a look.... I have been there for a few times, at first about 7 years ago and was lucky enough to see when the bridge was opening up then closing down. It is amazing. Unluckily was not any camera with me, and later in the years I never had more that luck to watch it to be open. However I walked through and took other pics. Still missed the Tower Bridge experience when can walk up to the top, hopefully soon I can get that, too. Because that part of London is full with modern buildings, a bit odd to have this old fashioned but beautiful bridge with The Tower of London which is also staying there from centuries, the image is a bit strange. But to worth while.

Don't bother when the bridge is opening!!. We visited the exhibition on one of the rare occasions that the bridge was opening up to allow a boat through. Despite pre booking you still had to join the queue with everyone else. We got to the top of the tower 10mins before the bridge opened. There were no staff to be seen near the glass walkways. People had parked themselves around the edge of the glass so if you didn't want to walk across you had no choice because no one would move. People were laying across the glass so when it came to the bridge opening you couldn't walk across. There was a rather unhelpful tannoy asking people to not block the walk way to allow other people to see which everyone ignored. I ended up watching the opening of the bridge on someones phone which they left filming in the middle of the floor, I could have saved myself the trouble of going up there and watched it on youtube. Very poorly managed. Would not visit again.

i want to give this a 6!. Visited after a last minute change of plan. In london on a busy half term friday & wanted to do something we hadn't done before so thought we'd head here. Very glad we did.The entrance is on the bridge, it was pretty busy but the lines were going quickly. All the staff we spoke to were really lovely, which always makes a difference. We paid £20.30 for 2 adults & 2 children.When you get in you need to wait for the lift although you are offered the stairs. I asked how many & was told 200 so decided we'd wait for the lift! My eldest son & daughter got in the lift which made it full up, my other son wanted to walk up so we decided to meet them at the top. I can confirm 200 steps, it's not all spiral though as i thought it might be & there is a level where you can sit & prepare yourself for the next lot of stairs! It wasn't too bad lol.When we got to the top there was a short video playing then staff directed us along the walkways. Lovely & bright with great views along the thames, both walkways have facts & info about Tower Bridge & also pics & info of bridges from around the world. They also have a big strip of glass down the corridor, where children stand, sit or lay completely unconcerned about the drop below & parents stand on the side away from the glass! The majority of us parents had the same idea! I did stand on it eventually!Once one corridor is done you go through & go down the other. We actually thought that was the end of the attraction but once finished went down in the lift & were directed to the engine rooms, these housed 2 very large steam things (i'm sorry i wasn't listening & engines aren't my thing!) that raise the bridge. The boys (being boys) were very interested in this. Another film playing just through the corridor, some more facts & little activities for kids or adults down the hall & the trip was over.We really really enjoyed this, the kids (teens) loved the glass floor & the engine rooms and the gift shop wasn't too expensive either. Totally recommended

Just don't. I've lived in London for the last 7 years and I'm a little bit hurt that something so badly organised and average is around. The bridge itself looks good but there are plenty of good views of it which are free. You begin by queuing up, outside in February with a cold wind blowing down the river. This is regardless of whether you have booked ahead. Once you are inside after around 15 mins you join the next queue for the lift. At the top there is an awful movie, I lasted 30 seconds. The viewing galleries themselves are big. The view isn't amazing. You get a better view for free up the top of One New Change, Primrose Hill or even on DLR. The glass floor is a bit of a gimmick. All I could see was the feet of the crowd around me, a few children's bodies, the murky brown of the Thames (again, free elsewhere) and the top of a queue of traffic. If you really want to queue up for a crèche and pay for the experience then go for it. I only have it 1 because I couldn't give it 0.

Fascinating. Visited this exhibition on a C2C two for one deal. Very informative and the short films were good. Interesting facts about other bridges around the world. Lift up to top and great views. Glass floor was very popular. The engine room was great. Staff friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend especially for children

great experience. Well thought out tourist experience. Booked online (its a bit cheaper). Glass walkway/floor fascinating. Engine rooms well explained. Try and go on a clear day. Loved the information boards about different bridges around the world.

Great place to visit. The bridge was an eye-opening experience. The only adventure for me was part of the floor was a glass floor which allows you to see the ship passing through, and for someone who is afraid of height, that part was a challenge. But definitely informative visit.

Busy!. Visited here on a joint ticket for the monument during Feb half term. Queue was about 20 mins, and we opted for the stairs as the lift was really crowded. The short films are quite interesting but ultimately everyone just wants to get onto the glass floor! The augmented reality from the downloadable app is good and there is opportunity for photos whikst on the glass section of the bridge, probably won't visit again but worth it as a one off.

What a wonderful bridge..... FAB FAB FAB DAY OUT. Tower Bridge makes a brilliant day out for all the family, we all liked the glass floor and wonderful views, the kids enjoyed the sticker book and I loved the engine room. I have wanted to visit the bridge for years and I still can't believe I have been inside Tower Bridge, but it made a FAB day out.

A truly remarkable piece of architecture. The tower bridge is one of the must-sees in London, and I honestly preferred this attraction to e.g. the Big Ben. The bridge is all lit up in the evening time, and even during the day its really interesting to see it open. The bridge is quite unique in Europe, so you really must go and see it during your trip in London. :) Keep your camera ready, you can take some really nice photos here!

Mesmerizing!. The view of it is totally mesmerizing specially when you watch it during sunset and the shade of the water, the aura around just takes your breath away. Do stay for a longer time just to see the ship passing underneath it and bridge opening up for giving the way to it.

A really neat tour. £9 and worth every penny. The bridge is fascinating, and getting to walk on the glass floor way high up is fantastic. The engine rooms were really neat too. I only wish I had gotten to actually see the bridge go up and down.

Fun on the walkway . I have been looking forward to going up The Tower Bridge for a while and I wasn't disappointed. We decided to take the stairs because it is quicker than waiting for the lift, be warned there is a lot of stairs! Once at the top there is a video you can watch about the history of the bridge. Once past that you can go on both walkways with the glass floors which are great! We liked the bridge facts from around the world that were in the walkways. There is another video as you go to the next walkway. The engine room is interesting to see how they used to move the bridge. Overall we thought it was good value for money, it wasn't too busy so we were able to lie on the floor and take silly photos!
boat trip. went on a boat trip meal and drinks of an evening tower bridge and other places of interest it was all lit up. looked really good will be going again.

You must, must, must!. Thank you again to Tesco for including another fantastic attraction on their reward scheme and thank you to the Tower Bridge Experience for their different types of family tickets! I took my 2 daughters with a £10 voucher and only had to pay just over £4 on top.This is well thought through and the glass floor is amazing - although it turned my tummy a bit!!We really enjoyed the beautiful prints of world famous bridges on display.Afterwards, we walked underneath to wave up to the people on the glass floor who waved back - the kids loved it.We got there for ten am, were in Kensington for lunch at one pm and spent a couple of hours at Kensington Palace before heading home. A busy day but we didn't have to rush.Highly recommend it.

Great day out!. Really enjoyed our visit today despite the weather being poor. Glass floor and viewing platforms spectacular. Information presented in a user friendly manner. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Cool attraction. They don't tell you about all of the stairs LOL when they ask if you want to take the elevator or the stairs up, but it was fine, although I had just walked all of the stairs at St. Pauls Cathedral. The kids will love the glass walk way. I skipped the movie talking about the bridge but I walked both sides of it. If the glass walkway is closed on one side don't be alarmed it's probably open on the other side. They confused us at first and I think many people left thinking it was closed but they rotate and the other side was open.

Great Views. Great day out lovely views from the bridge ... Interesting history ... Have loved the events in GB seeing the Tower Bridge being lit up Lovely walks along the river lots of food,drink stops along the way

The glass floors are so cool. My partner and I used the London pass which helped speed us up through the queue. The glass floor of the tower bridge is the best part and its hilarious watching other tourists taking funny pictures on the floor. Definitely worth a visit!

Tops tips for busy school hols visit. Half term visit so expected crowds.Buy tickets in advance online. I didn't even have to queue at ticket office to pick up the actual tickets. Just took paper print out to the gate.Get there early. We arrived at 11am.Go straight to Crown Jewels. In half term week we still only queued for 10 mins. If we'd waited til 12 queue was massive.Eat in the onsite cafe but go early. We went at 12 and no queue. Lovely small portions of decent food for kids, pasta etc. by 1pm there was a queue.Do the beef eater tour. It's included in price.Great place and you can do it in half term without queuing if you are cunning.

Great views but not much better than from down below. The entrance is quite pricey and there can be a line. Up there, it's fun to walk on the glass floor and to see examples of stunning bridges around the world. However, the views on the surrounding urban landscape are not much better than from the - free - ground level. The engine rooms are interesting and included in the 9 pound ticket.
Amazing Glass Floor!. The views were excellent as we visited on a sunny morning. The glass floor walkway was very good, even though it was a little crowded.
YOU MUST VISIT IT. Intersting to visit the old steam machines to move the bridge. I consider the price to visit it a little bit expensive.
YOU MUST VISIT IT. Intersting to visit the old steam machines to move the bridge. I consider the price to visit it a little bit expensive.

A couples own time. Took train to London Bridge, came out of entrance on low platform number side, towards London Dungeon. Across road and right into a lovely huge space with a scrap iron pirate ship in the middle and cafes and shops all around. Head to the river, turn right for Tower Bridge (you couldn't miss it.) walk east past County Hall and onto the small stair case leading up to the bridge, sorry not sure about disabled persons but I'm sure there' s a way up by ramp or slope.Once over the bridge, come down the stairs, taking in the view of The Tower of London. Double back under the bridge and follow signs for St Catherine's Dock grabbing an Ice cream on the way. The Dock is very inspiring, probably the oldest in London, beautiful boats from barges to luxury. Good places to eat, snack or just have a coffee or drink. Worth a look at the shops too.My Wife and I love this walk and have done it many times, with something different each time.

Tower Bridge. I have never been inside the museum of Tower Bridge, but I love sitting on the south bank of the river in front of the Town Hall and just watch the Bridge. Especially in the afternoon when the lights are on. There is a lift if you are in a wheelchair or you have a stroller. Don't miss the Bridge Lift. you can check here for the lift times- www.towerbridge.org.uk/lift-times/

Great photo op. The Tower Bridge, across the Thames and beside the Tower of London, makes an attractive picture whether viewed from the river bank or a tour boat. It is a draw bridge and if you're fortunate you may get to see it open for passing boats. One may also walk across the bridge, providing a good view of boat traffic on the Thames and of the city adjacent to the river. Built in the 1890s, it is not nearly as old as it was designed to appear.

A bridge full of wonder. Whenever we take a trip to England it HAS to include the Tower Bridge. It is truly one of the most beautiful and iconic structures in the world. Walking along the river, when it comes in to view I get such an overwhelming feeling of happiness. It really is beautiful and regal and not to be missed. Any time of day is worth going there, but especially in the early evening. Walking along the river, the lights from the bridge are beautiful. Not to be missed!!!!
