I couldn't fault the music, though!Back on the ground you can look around the engine rooms, showing how the bridge was powered when it was first built, with everything shiny clean and quiet and looking more like beautiful sculptures than like engines built to do a job of work.Even if you have no real interest in history or engineering, Tower Bridge comes highly recommended for the views alone: from the two viewing platforms you can look up and down the River Thames and across London, with displays on each platform telling you what you can see. Even on a rather grey, gloomy day the views are truly memorable, and worth the entry fee by themselves.
Fantastic. the machary alone is just so interesting and everything the bridge has been though, its such a wonderful london icon. I have even thought about having a function there,

Breath taking up close.. It's like any big iconic attraction, it's breath taking when up close to it. The architecture is fascinating. Walking along it is nice as well but you really see it's beauty when standing back and viewing it from the side of the river.

Must see this grand architecture (Tip Included). Amazing architecture of this grand bridge. We didn't get a chance to go in it but it's definitely on our todo list for next time. But just traveling over it is pretty awe inspiring. TIP Hard to take decent pictures of it at night though, so catch it in the daytime.

An hour well spent. We took advantage of half price tickets from East Coast Trains and visited the exhibition. A lift takes you to the first part of the exhibition - a short, amusing video about the history of the bridge, then you go on to the wlkways at the top of the bridge, one of which has 'bridges from around the world'. Views are very good and present great photo opportunities. You have your photo taken against a green screen, with the option to buy (bit expensive), but there's no pressure to buy. You then go to the engine rooms which are impressive. All in all, a good way to spend an hour, and you can do the exhibition at your own pace.

A great experience. It is a must see attraction, the tour was very informative and the views from the top were amazing then you get down into the engine rooms which power the bridge which is quite amazing.

One not to miss. Really good place to visit, starts with a film showing how the bridge was constructed, great views, can open windows for photographs, interesting gallery, well worth the money, don't forget to go and see the engine room.
Simply beautiful. The Tower Bridge is iconic and a must see when in London. Simply a beautiful sight. With a little luck you'll be able to see the bridge open up as well.
Beautiful place to visit. This is one of the best places to visit in London. Would advise to visit during night as the effects of its lights add to the grace it carries.

Many history but little to do. You up in elevator to do the halls where the view to the outside is very bad. The corridors have photos and story about bridges in general, important characters of England. If you think take this tour to see the city from the top, bad choice. After low to the quarter of machines.

Beautiful!. A Must see!! London is the best touristy place in the world!! There's so much to see and do!! And tower bridge is one of those exquisite sights!! Oh btw the peanuts sold out there are yumm!!!

Worth a look. We had the London pass which I recommend to everyone... It was nifty to go into and walk around the bridge and read all the info that said how the bridges design came about and similar bridges of its kind... We didn't get to see the bridge moving tho :(
Simply Beautiful. No matter what angle you view tower bridge, the sight is magnificent. The scale is just breathtaking from the castle, the Thames, or the bridge itself. An easy walk from the tube!

Gorgeous Bridge. This bridge is simply gorgeous, I totally fell in love with it. The reason for 4 stars is the fact that we paid £9 each to go into the exhibition they have and that was a bit of a disappointment. Way too expensive for what it is, so I don't recommend the exhibition, just the outside of the bridge. First we went all the way up to the bridge where there were some big pictures of different bridges around the world and explanations about this bridge itself. It is an enclosed space so you can't see much outside if you are short like me; then you go down and you can visit the space where the engines are. My husband was quite interested in that bit but to be honest, I wouldn't recommend spending £9 just to see that. If you take pictures outside of the bridge, that's where the fun is. We also experienced the bridge being lifted for a ship to pass which was quite nice but then again, you don't need to pay to see that. All in all, a lovely place.

iconic tower bridge. This was the most fascinating item in our trip to see and pass through this iconic bridge, we should have spent about half day enjoying the view from the riverside and spending time simply watching this iconic symbol.
One of the best London attraction. This is one of the best attractions in London. Visited with family. Nice views from side of the Thames river. Would visit again definitely when Back there

Brilliant bridge. Like some of the previous reviewers, I never get tired of looking at this wonderful bridge. We were lucky enough to see the bridge lift to let a boat pass by and that was great to see. Great historical information available and brilliant views from the glass walkway. Well worth a visit.
Great views & great history :) . Loved visiting here. GREAT views. Staff were very friendly. No stairs just two large lifts. :) losts of history and I learnt so much about London that I never knew :)

Tower Bridge. Stayed in this area while in London, and never tired of seeing the bridge. Its beautiful and impressive, always a bit startling when it comes into view. The tour was interesting, the views from the top were great, but I did think it was a bit overpriced. The nicest view of the bridge is from the south bank, I believe the walk along the river is Queen's Way. Gives great views of the bridge and the Tower together.

Great piece of history. I have to say I was very surprised how interesting this was. There is so much history and story behind this bridge and that's without how the thing works. I won't spoil it for the visitors but I didn't realise what a 'folly' this was, I guess I hadn't given it much thought as it looks so old and in keeping with the tower of london that I just bought into it's 'ancient' history. I would definately recommend this visit and feel it's well worth the entrance fee, and I guarantee you'll get a stab of nostalgia every time you see it on ANY picture of London. Enjoy.
Fascinating.. The Tower Bridge exhibit is fascinating and well put together. The stairs can be a chore but the climb permits yiu to see the inside of the tower.
Boring and waste of money. boring and expensive tickets... not worth it at all. waste time and money..could use some guides to explain some juicy story.

Great Price and Great Views. We did the Tower Bridge on a whim, and it was great. We got to see some great views of the city from there. The exhibits along the walk ways also had some great history of the city. It was also need to see the room where the bridge still opens and closes for large boat traffic. There a ton of stairs to the top, so prepare yourself for a bit of a hike.
Great tourist attraction. Wonderful for locals and tourists, it's a beautiful piece of architecture on London's landscape. Visit it in person! You won't be disappointed!

lots to see. Good value, especially when booked on Tesco deal. Lots to see, some interactive stickers for the children to collect although not all of the staff gave them out. Gallery of images of famous bridges, great views.
must see in london. next to London tower, another must see/walk on in London. I missed it last time so this time I went there twice :-)

Not as exciting as expected. The Tower Bridge is right next to the Tower of London and promises a great view from the top, which is why we ended up climbing the bridge. If you feel brave you can take the stairs but I believe there is an elevator available as well. The view from the top is not really spectacular, we were quite disappointed and left pretty quickly. You get to wander from one side of the bridge to the other on one side (and back on the other side I believe) and there are lots of pictures of bridges from all over the world displayed as well. You also get to see the old steam engine room but for that you have to leave the bridge and walk for a couple minutes before you get to the entrance to that. It's very small and doesn't take up much time to view but it is definitely worth it. We enjoyed it much more than the actual bridge. So if you have a couple more minutes to spare, keep your Tower Bridge ticket and take that stroll to the steam engine rooms.
great view from top. enjoyed looking around as I didn't realise you could visit it, great views from the top and had plenty of stuff to keep the children entertained
Tower Bridge. A bit out of the way but what fun! You have access to much of the towers and the Beefeaters in their grand costumes are very accomidating. The views, oustanding.

Incredible History. Along with the Tower of London, this place is a treasure trove of history. I visited and did a tour later in the afternoon but probably would have preferred the morning. Such an interesting place.

Not just a bridge. The bridge has an amazing history, this is all told within the attraction. There are videos showing explaining the reason for the bridge and the various designs put forward, as well as the construction of it.The views are slendid and accompanied by interesting facts about other bridges throughout the world. The ticket also includes access to the boiler rooms as it was once coal driven. It is great to walk through and experience the boilers first hand and up close. A great achievement for civil engineering.If you have some time to kill in London, this is once attraction that should be experienced, if even just once.

better off viewed from a distance. well what can I say. Your better off viewing from a distance in my opinion as when you finally get there you wonder why you have walked up the steps and why you read this and chose ignore advice to walk across it unless its on your way to the tower of London..defiantly a tourist thing but a great view from a distance and great photo opportunity.never seen it open up but that would be great to see.
Gorgeous. Best attraction in London. This bridge it's simply gorgeous, it stays right near Tower of London and it has a good view to the city,
Beautiful. Beautiful bridge and a great piece of engineering. A must see highlight of London; at least from the outside
Excellent tour worth it just for the views. Good fun and not too long. The kids enjoyed doing the sticker book while we enjoyed seeing how it all worked!!

Good tour.. The Tower Bridge is free with the London Pass. It has several floors to explore and you also take a short walk underneath as well. The highlight however, is walking across the walkways where you can see the views of London.

Very pretty and cool exterior. A gem of a bridge. Easy to get to by metro (Tower Gateway or Tower Hill). Bridge itself is nice and picturesque area. Lots of good resto's in the area I would recommend. You could spend a nice 2-3 hours here for photos and a bite to eat.

Tower Bridge. What can I say about Tower Bridge that hasn't already been said? It's one of the most impressive works of civil engineering in the world. The bridge is raised and lowered electrically but when it was built it was coal-fired. In the shop I mentioned an interest in Lancashire boilers..they virtually ran industry in the north in the fifties and sixties...and I was taken on a tour of the old boilerhouse. The staff were wonderfully cheerful and helpful.I've been to the bridge many times since and I'm always drawn back to it. River trip from Westminster, get off at the bridge, amble across and back, stroll up to the Tower and back to the bridge..it just draws me.There's even a Starbucks on the riverside to relax and take the bridge in.
Fantastic views. London bridge again is of of the famous landmarks you really should see whilst in london, as the views of the capital are fantastic.
Landmark of London. This Tower Bridge of London is the landmark of the City. It is worth walking on the bridge over historical Thames River. A miracle of British Heritage Architecture.
Nice Bridge with Great Views. This is bridge is an archetectual marvel giving great views of the Thames and London. This is a nice bridge to walk across.

A signature place for photo taking in London. One of the signature landmark for photo taking in london. nothing too special about it. we did not manage to see the bridge being raised up, which is a pity. Should hop over for some photos, it's near to Tower of London.

Bright Night. Visiting the tower bridge is stepping in the past...you have to be there during the day to see it together with the Tower itself. At night its a picture taking moment with the bridge well lite...

Don't Miss This!. For a long time, I didn't even realise that this existed, and when I found out, I wasn't really sure what was there and for a long time building up to it I kept thinking, "What will this actually entail?"What it actually entailed were stunning views over London, an amazing feat of engineering and some very interesting facts thrown in there as well.When we went, we started with the actual brig experience, being over the water was fantastic, and we particularly liked the part where when you looked up, you could see how high the builders would have had to stand above the Thames to build it. It made me feel sick just seeing them as I'm scared of heights.It was only then that we realised that there was another part. How it used to work. This was also truly fantastic and we love the whole experience. (Especially seeing the steam engine!)Thank you, Tower Bridge.

Remember to check "bridge lift time". Everyone will come to visit this landmark, but I highly recommend to check the "bridge lift time" on website first. Then you can see the bridges lifting up and allowing the vehicles pass through.

Tower Bridge Experience. Friendly staff as soon as you get there and reasonably priced compared to some attractions - definitely improved greatly over true years and good for all aged with video presentations etc. Great views if London

Tower Bridge Exhibition and Steam Engine. Super Exhibition - you walk across the top walkway of Tower Bridge, with great views of the river and tower of london. The steam engine room that is used to raise and lower the bridge is well worth the trip too. Use the Rail Network 2 for 1 ticket offers for a good discount. Not too crowded.

A London landmark not to be missed!. Along with Big Ben, the Tower Bridge is a well-known London landmark that most people think of. It is an awe-aspiring bridge spanning the Thames, and looks very regal (especially at night). Any London visitor should go visit this bridge, and see other nearby attractions such as the HMS Belfast. There are many bridges in London, but this is one not to be missed!

Great Views. It was great being up on the Tower and great views. The Tour was a little lame, but still is a must. The best part of the tour is the Engine Rooms at the end. When you think of how this was built and when it is Impressive. Fantastic views.

Amazing Bridge. The tower is a great place for amazing view of the city. I loved to hear the history of the bridge through animated screen. Tower Bridge is one of the most amazing places when visiting London.

Central London. Central London is one of the happening place in the world!! And this Tower bridge of London is one of the fame of this area. With awesome view of the Themes river and the London Eye, this is a place that one must visit...

Larger than Life. You've seen it so many times, but until you've stood on top and looked out over the River Thames, you have no idea how amazing it is! Take your time strolling across the bridge and take in all the beauty of the view surrounding. A London must!!

Stupendous. A fabulous tour of what is probably the most famous bridge in the World. The views from the high level footways are stunning and the information boards help you find the various highlights both near and far. There are also exhibitions on the 2 walkways and, 'being of a certain age', the 60's exhibition particularly brought back many happy memories. To see the old engines and the displays on how bridge was built were very interesting and informative. It would have been good to go down to see the space where the weights that help raise the bridge are but, I suppose, Health and Safety issues prevent this. I would highly recommend anyone to go and learn about this world famous, iconic feature.

Insight of victorian skill. Did not realize you could actually go up in a lift and walk across the top!! Also to then go down below to see the original steam engines. a fascinating tour, full of information. Also linked cost wise to the monument, also well worth the visit

Iconic!. This bridge is so beautiful and worth the visit. I recommend stopping for a coffee (there's a starbucks right next to the bridge (go down the stairs on the lower level and it's to the left) and stroll across the bridge. it's really beautiful!

Get inside a historic site. Walking across the top of Tower Bridge is something else !
Inside is quite overwhelming as you can look out of the windows of the towers and across the Thames. No longer do you need to be James Bond or Q to get inside !

Clever presentation.. The Tower Bridge is one of the most recognised icons in the world. The engineering is remarkable and it is still as functional as it was about 120 years ago (completed in 1894). The video presentation at the start of the experience was both educational and entertaining. The walk across both of the spans offers outstanding unimpeded views of London but also has some great information about some of the other great bridges of the world. Upon completion, take the time to go across the bridge and see the engine rooms...immaculately clean and provides a real understanding of the brilliance fo the steam engineering that was used to drive the bascules to permit the passing of river traffic. A 'must-do' when in London.

Great Photo Op. The Bridge is iconic and the area around it was wonderful, with the Tower of London on one side and a fairly new and modern area on the other side filled with eateries and sites. Definitely go back, had a beautiful sunny day which only enhanced the experience.

Iconic!. Of course you are going to go and see this bridge! It's cool, it's iconic, it's up the river from London Bridge. I suggest walking from London Bridge, past the Tower of London, and the over Tower Bridge. The Tower Bridge Experience is also an option.
Wonderful site. We enjoying views from the bridge and the bridge itself was wonderful. Fairly congested area. Great views and wonderful place to take pictures

Trademark of England. One of the big symbols of London and British pride! I personally love this place, and I go there many times for a walk. I could tell you more about it, but its so brilliant that the only way you have to understand is just to take a look at it!
London in 5 days. 4 nts/5 days, visited twice, fantastic. I can't wait to visit it again. Went inside to view the exhibition. Amazing photo opp.

Great scenario. The traffic is ghastly but the view was great. The surrounding area is a little like visiting DC which to me was somewhat interesting. Spires, steeples, gardens and what is up with the Blue Chicken.

Coolest bridge anywhere. What's not to love about the Tower Bridge? Iconic London at its best. The Bridge Experience tour is not all that great, but it's cheap (free if you have the London Pass, which is why we did it)and it does offer some neat views. But it's obviously free to look at the bridge and get some great photos from both river banks or from a boat.

A little disappointed. The bridge from the outside is amazing. From the inside it is merely an average museum & the photo opportunities aren't that great. The engine rooms are by far the most interesting part of the place, but its disappointing that it displays the process in a bit of a haphazard order. Worthwhile doing if you have a London Pass & visit the Tower of London as well. The pub underneath (opposite engine rooms) has good food too.

One of best attractions. Parliament and tower bridge are my favourite attractions in London. Tower Bridge looks really impressive both during day and night no wonder it is one of the most famous bridges in world . Must see for sure !
Fantastic. This is next to the Tower of London and a great site to see. We enjoyed the eateries around the area too.
Great place to hang out . This is a must visit place if you are gong to London. Great surroundings and very lively atmosphere. There are a very nice restaurants around this area too.

Time your trip over the bridge. if you check on line you can find out when the bridge is scheduled to be raised and it's worth timing your visit to coincide with it. A little bit of history being brought to life. I've worked in London for two decades and I still get a buzz crossing the bridge.
excellent. This is a huge tourist attraction and a definite must see for anyone visiting that is interested in the large attractions.

So interesting!. In doing the tour, you get to go up along the walkways! There,are 2 movies which show how the bridge came to be. Also there is lots of information in the walkways to learn about bridges and London with lots of interesting facts. Then, you get to go down in the engine room and see how the hydraulic lifting devices worked to raise the bridge. It left me with a feeling of appreciation for what it would have taken for these men to build this kind of bridge with the machinery they had in those days! I loved it!
Great!. It's a very nice place, you can take amazing pictures from there. You can get there very easily using the subway.

Must see in East London. You should definitely stop by it or on it if you landed in City Airport and are commuting to the West End. My children loved the engine room with all the mechanics and the view is rather breathtaking as you can see the city, the london eye, St Paul, etc..

The iconic bridge!. I went with friends after I bought the tickets online with tickets for London Eye and Madame Tousoud. We enjoyed the ride in the lift to first floor where we watched a little film about how the bridge was build and designed.On the top floor was an expozition with loods of picture of faimous and unicque bridges. Plus the wonderful views of Thames.We had a great day!

A Tower-ing Bridge!. This is a destination best seen at night. When I am in London and friends come to visit I have a special night walk that I take them on that includes Westminter Abbey, Big Ben, the London Eye, St Paul's Cathedral, the Tower of London, and Tower Bridge, finishing up with walking the Queen's Walk along the Thames toward London Bridge with dinner along the way at Horniman's. This bridge is absolutely amazing, and a landmark of London. I'm surprised as to how many people visit the city and yet never make it to this marvelous bridge. It's definitely worth your time and it will provide you with some of your favorite photos from your trip. If you're serious about photography, it's worth bringing a tripod so that you can get some great slow shutter shots.

A Tower-ing Bridge!. This is a destination best seen at night. When I am in London and friends come to visit I have a special night walk that I take them on that includes Westminter Abbey, Big Ben, the London Eye, St Paul's Cathedral, the Tower of London, and Tower Bridge, finishing up with walking the Queen's Walk along the Thames toward London Bridge with dinner along the way at Horniman's. This bridge is absolutely amazing, and a landmark of London. I'm surprised as to how many people visit the city and yet never make it to this marvelous bridge. It's definitely worth your time and it will provide you with some of your favorite photos from your trip. If you're serious about photography, it's worth bringing a tripod so that you can get some great slow shutter shots.

A Great Historical Tour. This, in my opinion, is a must see if in London for more than an hour. It is not as touted as the Palace, Oxford, Westminster Abbey, or London Eye but for us it was fascinating and satisfying. It is well timed and conducted the whole way although it is self paced. You move from room to room on your own time and get to walk along the bridge on both sides to see views of the city through plexiglas enclosures. There are small sliding windows for clear picture taking. There is a short film that shows the inception, design, and building of the bridge structure and drawbridge features which are large enough to let cruise ships pass. The fun part to me was going down into the engine rooms where you can walk around the drawbridge motors and see the mighty engine powered mechanisms that open and close the center spans. Cool stuff and very educational.

Iconic Bridge. I visited with my two children. The entrance fee was reasonable and it was great to view London from the bridge. My daughter was thrilled to stand so close to where One Direction had when they filmed their Midnight Memories video (and to have walked up the same stairs!). Got some great photos from the bridge and of my children with the bridge as a stunning backdrop. The engine room was fascinating. My children would love to have the opportunity to open the bridge one day. That would be so cool!

Very Patriotic. Tower Bridge is a very beautiful and worthwhile attraction in London. In the middle of everything and easy to get to. Whilst at Tower Bridge, you are able to look out on to the Thames, and from there you can see Big Ben, the London Eye, which really gives a patriotic feel. If you want to get a vibe of London without visiting every part of London, then Tower Bridge is ideal.

Unique. Should be on elf the wonders of the world.Stunning; the history, architecture, views.An Icon of London.Amazing that it is still a working bridge rather than being enclosed in a glass cage.A treat.

Historical and breathtaking. Bring a student ID on vacation with you because this is one place where a discount is available. The tower bridge was cold but the historical video was memorable and interesting, the view walking across the walkway (glass walls) was unparalleled of the River Thames architecture and London's city skyline, including the Eye. It's a nice way to retrospectively end your trip if you like. Great for SCIENCE and PHYSICS-lovers if you remember that your ticket also admits you to the engine room after you come down (fun open-mechanics of the bridge).

Great Views at Night!. I walked over half of the bridge at night and it lends itself to great picture taking on both sides. It is also very majestic from a distance both by day or night. A real classic and worth a look. There is a tour you can take and It is supposed to be really good. The Tower of London is right there, so why not do them both?
Wonderful. Great pleasure to walk over the bridge! Beautiful and famous! So dirty river doesn't spoil the view!
Must see place. Of you're in London this is a must see iconic place of Britians reflection of history and architecture. Very easy to locate via google and ask any tube guy.

Good View. I Visited this place last year that was nice whether and really enjoy the trip. Good View in day and in evening as well. My hotel was very near to the palace and can see the beauty any time from my room and i feel awesome to have a look in night before go to sleep.

Better than expected. Tower Bridge itself is open for walking across the river at road level, sometimes, if you are around in the evening you can see the bridge open, which I can remember happening during the day when I was young.The Tower Bridge Experience is a visitor attraction, and a very interesting and well organised one. The tour takes you along both of the high level walkways, which are glazed in but have camera windows so you can take pictures of the views up and down the river. On the opposite sides are exhibitions, and in each tower there is a short film and more explanation. The real gem of this, however, is the engine rooms, containing the beautifully cared-for lifting mechanism, and good explanations about their workings.

Iconic Bridge. Tower Bridge has to be one of the most famous sights in London. You can walk across the bridge on the lower level where the vehicular traffic goes. A better idea is to pay for the tour that shows you in the inner working of the bridge. The tour includes access to the upper walkways which provide a nice view of the London skyline. The tour also includes an opportunity to view some of the machinery that is actually used to raise and lower the bridge.

Free and Iconic...a must see. Walking across Tower Bridge is free and gives you a great view down the river. The iconic bridge is a must for any tourist to London..if you are lucky the bridge will be raised to allow a ship to sail underneath it.

A London Must. One of the most famous bridges in the world, it cannot be missed when in London.The walk across the top of the bridge is pretty good. Info about the London Bridge and other bridges in the world.The ticket also includes the old engine rooms which were good too.Try to time your visit with a Bridge open and close time so you can watch that.

Breathtakingly beautiful - especially at night. A definite must see when visiting London. Walk along the riverside and over the bridge and take time to look down the river. Costs nothing to do this - fabulous views. Worth visiting at night time too when it is all lit up as it looks even better than in daylight.
Do the tour - it's well worth it!. I did the "London Pass" thing, and this was part of that. This is an amazing piece of architecture... Totally worth the tour. The view from the top is amazing.

Must!. If you are in London, you simply can't go back home without walking along the Tower Bridge. The bridge is buzzing with people from all places. You can walk along the bridge on safe footpaths and enjoy the views of London city. When you get to the other side, grab an icecream and just relax, taking in the view of the whole bridge. Personally, I enjoy people watching and this is a fab place to do so. Remember to take lots of pictures as you walk along. Try to check on the internet for times when the bridge opens and closes as it's a fantastic sight.

watch. watch the boats on the water, cross the Bridge, walk up the Towers, watch the opening and closing, you must bring time with and Research via Internet what the perfect Timing is, otherwise it is not worthwile

Fantastic views. This was your first time to tower bridge. Our group opted to climb the stairs. There are lots of them but you can look out at the different levels for great photos. The displays talk about various other bridges and building techniques. The engine room was super! It has to be on your to do list! Try the hot nuts from the vendor at the bottom. Very yummy.
Beautiful. An amazing bridge, amazing piece of engineering. We biked across it but walking would be recommended as you can stop and take photos.

Wow. So beautiful it's breath taking,an amazing bridge, at night or by day steeped in history
It's a must to see

Just as amazing as I remember. I haven't been to this landmark since 1994 and was shocked to see that 20 years on how much I remember.The bridge is a beautiful bit of architechture and the exhibition and information on tour is great to keep you informed on how it has worked over the 120 years that it has been in operation.The attraction was quite quiet for a Saturday which gave us a more intimate experience and the views were spectactular!Would recommend anyone who visits London to come here to see the most famous bridge in the world!

A must see attraction. For first timers in London, this is one place you must go to. It is a good idea that you include this in the itenerary when you go around the places at the River Thames. This is included in the London pass, so we went in pretty easily, without going through long lines.First there is an elevator ride that will bring you up to the top of the tower. Then, you get to cross the bridge from above, and get a sight of London from the top of the bridge. When you walk along the 2 pathways, there are a lot of articles about the history of the Tower Bridge, as well as other famous bridges around the world. There is also a presentation that you can watch that narrates how the bridge was constructed. There is also an Engine exhibit which gives people an idea how the bride was operated during the early years.Unfortunately, we were not able to witness the actual opening of the bridge's gate for ships to pass underneath the bridge. But it would definitely be one good sight if we had the chance.This is a very nice sight to go to, especially in the night where it is nicely illuminated. A definite symbol of London.

Tower bridge. Nope not the london bridge i thought it was... again another sight I see just in the movies is now right in front of me... I am in awe and also can say that "that's the Tower Bridge not the London Bridge a lot of people mistake it as such!" lol

beautiful landmark. Went here with friends. It is very nice to look at but very interesting inside. Seeing how it works and how it was built. Also seeing the different pictures of all the famous bridges in the world. The view from inside is wonderful. The view from the outside looking at it is amazing. It is a must see if you make it to London!

Amazing piece of British history. Visited here with my husband while on honeymoon, he used to work on the bridge so for him it was a trip down memory lane.......for me it was wonderful to find out about this iconic part of London's rich history. We had 2 for 1 vouchers as well which made it a great value-for-money trip.

Iconic. It was so nice to view the bridge from both sides, under the bridge and over the bridge. Of the many "must sees" in London, this rates near the top. Funny how many folks confuse this structure with the London Bridge, famous in song. This bridge is far more interesting.

beautiful with the Olympic rings on it. We went across the bridge during the Olympics. There was a lot of traffic during the day. Because the wind had knocked the rings off at one point, they put them up/down according to how strong the gusts were. The bridge was quite beautiful at night! Have some very nice pictures of it.

The nicest bridge in London. Another landmark which is a must-see in London both during the day and during the night when it is lit in a very artistic manner. It is safe for pedestrians even during the busiest hours. The surrounding area is clean, well kept with some good restaurants as well. Do not miss it!

Mr Big Ben. well one or maybe the best attraction in london..is amazing to take pictures over there...the bridge, the tower, the london eye, the arcitecture , the red buses who goes up and down, its magnificent.
Exhibition boring and forgetable. The bridge itself is very impressive but your not missing much if you skip paying 8 pounds for the exhibition just to walk across the bridge
beautiful. although very busy during the day not always something you would look at and think wow but at night lit up well different thing it looks amazing definately one for the album

My Favourite Bridge. A fantastic and a must do experience. There is so much history to this beautiful bridge and it is so humbling knowing the effort the workers put in to achieve this iconic structure. The price is great value, the view is amazing, and I will certainly return to do it all again soon.

Better than expected. Not expecting much for the £8 entrance fee (very reasonable compared to other London attractions), we were pleasantly surprised by our visit. I think it helped that it was a lovely sunny winter's day in London and the city looked gorgeous from the top galleries. You get to these by lift operated by a friendly guide and via a short film of the history of the bridge. The galleries have pictures and information about various landmarks and opening viewing windows (including some at lower heights for kids and short people like me) to take photographs through. Finally at the end is a "photo opportunity" where you can have a novelty picture taken to be collected later.After another short film about the construction of the bridge it's down to the next level by stairs. There is one loo and what is laughingly called the refreshment area, which consists of a vending machine. Before descending by lift you can purchase your novelty photo which costs roughly an arm and a leg.Another friendly guide advises you to hang on to your ticket as you exit onto Tower Bridge and walk along to go beneath the other tower. Handing in your ticket you are immediately into the old engine room, which fans of steam will enjoy immensely. Then on to various displays on how the bridge works followed by the inevitable gift shop. All in all, excellent value for money and a very pleasant way to spend a bright Saturday morning.
Tower Birdge London. If you are visiting London it is well worth taking the time to view this famous landmark and take a walk across the bridge
Brill day out. The history telling was brill thanks Clive? Very informative good humour very clearly spoken so much to see and do

Beautiful Bridge. This is a beautiful pedestrian and vehicle bridge. Walked along the bridge on a clear, beautiful day. Took beautiful pictures. We were even able to view the draw bridge go up when a sailboat crossed underneath.

Worth seeing a famous landmark. The bridge was very interesting, as was its engine-room.The exhibition part was about bridges in general all over the world. I didn't see the point of that. I came to see Tower Bridge, London.

What a view. It's worth vsiting this attraction just for the view of London and down the Thames, however you also get to learn all about how the bridge was built and the amazing engineering that went into creating it.

very interesting. as its one of the most iconic landmarks in London we thought we would give it a visit, firstly you get to walk across the top walkway to the other tower and they have information on all other bridges in the world, and the different types of bridges. the short video films are interesting as it explains the history of the bridge, and how the bridge actually lifts up so the ships can go through.once on the other side you get access to the engine rooms which used to power the bridge through steam, there are also a few interactive screens for the kids and upon entry the kids get given a passport and have to collect sticker from different areas in the bridge, my daughter liked it.overall we enjoyed it, the history was good and its not too expensive, especially if you combine it with your ticket for the monument (£9 for both)

Good for a rainy day. I took my 5-year old grandson here during half-term week as the weather was lousy and I wanted something out of the rain. At his age his attention-span is short and I didn't want to pay a small fortune for something he would quickly be bored by and guessed the free museums would be rammed. This is affordable and you can move through fairly quickly if necessary. According to the lady on reception there were plenty of grandparents there with the same idea, possibly tempted by the reduced entry-price of £5.60 (down from £8) for over-60s!He was reasonably engaged by the filmed introduction and happy to look at the views from the crosswalks, but not really terribly interested in the various displays and artwork as he was a little too young, although he liked some of the models. Some fascinating stuff there for adults, but I would suggest going without any little people in tow if you would like to linger and take in all the historical stuff. However all the children are given a cardboard 'passbook' on arrival, and collect stickers to fill it in as they go round. He really liked this and was very pleased with the finished result.The parts he enjoyed most were the engine room - he loves anything to do with wheels and machinery so was happy to watch the pistons go round - and the couple of child-sized demonstration models where they can wind a wheel and it shows how the hydraulic system raises and lowers the bridge.Nice gift shop, not cheap - are they ever? - but when we initially went into the exhibition we were given a voucher for £2 off a £4 spend which was a nice touch and sugared the pill somewhat. Overall a good choice - older children there were generally more engaged with the exhibits and they all seemed to like the sticker card, regardless of their ages - and by the time we'd walked back to London Bridge along the nice wide stretch of embankment (enough room for him to run off any latent excess energy and thankfully it had stopped raining) it was probably the right amount of time and concentration for a child his age. He enjoyed the experience and so did I.
Great Bridge. A very interesting Bridge and a great construction. Also the history is well explained. Better if you come not in holiday. We had not so much visitors and had no stress.

Great Hour or So Indoors .... Is what it is on the biscuit tin, an interesting hour or so indoors learning about the build and engineering with fantastic views and photo opportunities from the walkways. Great sight for great sights and felt value for money at £8 for an adult.

Enjoyable Visit. Visited The Tower Bridge on a nice winters day and they also had a bridge lift booked on the same day. Something you don't get chance to see. Had a good look round. The gift shop is a little over priced compared to other London attractions.
Exactly as pictured. What an amazing sight!. It looks exactly like the pictures and the puzzles, lol. The museum was very informative and the view was amazing.

Surprisingly good!. My husband and I were in London for the weekend last week but had no plans for our last morning. We strolled along the banks of the Thames and it was bustling. We saw the Tower Bridge Experience and nearly gave it a miss. We went for it and found it really interesting. There were great views of the Thames and the landscape of the sky scrapers. It included lots of information about the bridge and the added attraction of the machine room was great. Sorry but I must say even the loos were a surprise! The staff were friendly and knew their 'product'. It was £8 well spent. Thank you for rounding off a fabulous weekend!

A View from the Bridge. You get great views from the viewing galleries up and down the river. There's information about how the bridge came to be designed and built and you can finish off with a trip to the old engine rooms to see the original steam engines. Get a combined ticket and visit Monument too - if the weather is being kind! We planned our visit to see the bridge opening - you can check on-line for days and times.

Beauty at Night!!!. Visit it at night to see this architectural beauty. You don't have to pay anything to see it and hopefully you might just get a glimpse of the bridge open up while you are there. Beautiful!!!

Interesting and mostly indoors for a bad weather day.. Very informative with some good views from the bridge, you realy can touch the history, remember to walk along to the engine room after you have climbed the bridge as the workings and engines are fascinating.

great day inside. great histroy,adn showing you all about how it was made,and the views were great too.it also showed how it was powered by steam engines,how it never opened,all togeather great value.

A beautiful piece of engineering. Amazing views of London and a super cool, close up look at one of London's most famous landmarks. The iron work, stone work, and engineering are amazing. Well worth the price of admission.

Pride and Dream Bridge of Every people. Tower Bridge which is commonly called as London Bridge by people who have'nt seen it originally. I went in London and i was one of the attraction in my List of Places to see in London.
This Bridge is mechanically made which operates on Coal and thermal power to open it from middle when big size boats

Visit to worlds favourite place. M so luck to say dat i hv been visited that place for more den 100 times.. U felt so lucky isn't it.. I hv seen museum hundred times.. Its place where u can spend your whole day without doing nothing.. Specially in summer time.. N even in snow fall.. U can hv a cup pf coffee in ir hand or a red bull can n hv some food to spent whole day.. Its a heart of london on the river thems.. Hv some speed boat experience or take a ferry ride..Amazing place to visit atleast once in ur life...

Great value - Great visit. We visited Tower Bridge on a day trip to London. This was extremely great value, especially as we bought a 2 for 1 Greater Anglia train offer and the cost was only £4 per person.The exhibition was excellent, and the staff were very helpful. The bridge walks between the two towers was spectacular with great views overlooking the river Thames. There are lifts so access is easy. The ticket price also included a visit to the original engine room which powered the bridge, this was a feat of engineering and left you marvelling at the skill of the early day engineers, designers and builders of London Bridge. Suggest you allow 2 hours for a leisurely visit. The only comment is that I would have liked to have seen an information board giving times of the bridge lift. Well worth a visit.
History. This is one of those historic places you just have to see. We did the river boat tour and would not recommend it. Waste of money.

Great value exhibition. 2 for 1 with Greater Anglia train ticket meant the exhibition worked out £4 each. We bought our tickets at the gift shop on South side which looked quieter than the main exhibition office on North side. We viewed the engine rooms on the South before going over to the North side to go up the bridge - there was a queue there but because we already had our tickets they let us go straight through to the lift. Good views at the top (its all enclosed/indoors so you dont get cold! apart from the little windows that you can open to take better photos). Not too busy on Sunday morning/midday.

Great piece of London's history. This is a must when in London. The tour is very interesting and the views of the river are wonderful. A fascinating structure that shows London's historic glory in the 19th century.

Stunning. We walked across. Stunning. Beautiful. Historic. Views are fabulous. Just do it. Windy wear a coat. Tower of London on the right the shard to the left. Military boats. What more could you want. We walked from Tower of London over bridge to borough market for lunch. Recommend it.

Iconic London Landmark. What a bridge and a wonderful landmark to visit, the engine rooms are great and the views from the galleries high above the Thames fantastic, great value too, with 20% off map voucher only £6.20 to get in.
Great Bridge. You can walk on it. Get a nice pic from The Tower on London. To get here, go to Tower Hill tube station.

One of London's best. Simply put if you are in London for a short break, or long holiday no trip is complete without a visit to Tower Bridge. On a good day there are great views of the Thames and for those thrill seekers among you I would suggest the Dungeon experience!

Great attraction. We didn't even know about this, someone told us. It was well worth the trip out there, and not too expensive.Entry is via the north tower, a lift to the very top where you see a short film. You can walk freely along both the east and west gantries which have been glazed in so you're out of the cold. Excellent views up and down the river, with prominent points shown on notice boards. Another interesting video at the top of the south tower before you walk back down to the ground level. New toilets have been installed half way down, not very big but clean and smart.At the bottom, you then follow a blue line along the pavemtn to the south bank where you visit the engine rooms which used to drive the bridge's lifting road. Well laid out, with a small gift shop.
It's a top atraction!. The great view of Thames River and the Old Castle, the impressive details of the bridge and the nice walk around até the main reasons to visit the Tower Bridge.

Good for views.. As a Londoner I am used to seeing the world famous bridge on a daily basis. The tour however is quite disappointing and the staff quite useless. The views on the other hand are spectacular. They have windows that open specifically for cameras which I thought was a nice touch if you are a keen photographer like myself. The engine rooms boast magnificent Victorian marvels in industrial machinery and of course the bridge itself is spectacular. Its just a let down with the rather pathetic videos. I recommend combining your ticket with the Monument as it works out slightly cheaper.

Engineers Tour Reveals Secrets. We took the behind the scenes engineering tour. It was the normal Tower Bridge tourwith extras, with a guide. We were taken to the control bridge, under the bascules and the the engine rooms. The tour only takes 12 people and you must book in advance. The guides are engineers, so know it very well. It is one off off tour.Tere were 2 bridge lifts on the days we went, this added to the overall experience.
Beautiful. You must see this and walk across it! Go in the day and then again at night- the lights are gorgeous and changes it completely!

Exhibition with an interesting Engine Room. Wonderful structure from the outside. The views from the inside are not great as it is tremendously hamperd by the cross-beams. The pictures of bridges from across the globe is great. However the best is the visit to the Engine room if you are mechanically inclined. Very touristy. There was a 20% off when I visited. I did not have the 20% voucher with me as I had printed it off but forgot to take it with me. So I told the ticketing staff that I forgot to get it and they gave me the discount anyways. Very nice !!!
Tower Bridge. Tower bridge is a great piece of enginering , it is a landmark of London that is Known threw out the world , i enjoyed my time i was there.
Just a landmark. A good place for photography. Only if the weather will cooperate. There is no shelter if the rain is heavy.

Epic landmark but see it from the outside ... The bridge itself is spectacular and a must see. You can walk across the bridge itself and you should do that to get a sense of the history and majesty of the bridge. But we are a bit undecided on the value of walking between the towers of the bridge itself and the exhibition (and paying for that). We were not too interested in the engine room aspects of the bridge and skipped that - if you were into engineering, that would probably interest you. Both the walkways were entirely covered (you walked from one end to the other, then back on the 2nd walkway, then back again on the 2nd walkway to get to the engine room) and had great views of the Thames on either side. There are little windows which you can open to get grille-free photo's of the Thames. The exhibition started OK when focused on the history of the bridge but once that was done and dusted, the rest of the exhibition focused on other bridges of the world, the City of London bridges etc ... it really felt like they ran out of things to exhibit on the bridge itself. On hindsight, I don't think we would have missed much if we had skipped the tour altogether and just appreciated the bridge from the outside. Our teenage kids and little one were quite bored after the initial wow!

Tower Bridge. This is a fantastic looking bridge. It is a must to go in it, at least once. My favourite part is walking around and seeing all the different views. The best view is that from the back of The Tower of London. This bridge has been in TV shows. The small screen does not do it justice. Did I mention it lights up at night? There is a fee if you go in, but not if you walk around.

Now that's a bridge!. Compare this to London Bridge, and there is no comparison, I actually felt bad for London Bridge, as it is pedestrian, a generic-type bridge, and Tower Bridge is magnificent. Had a great time taking pics of it and ourselves as it as the background, and then being on the bridge. At a basic level, a bridge is there to allow travel over a natural barrier, but it helps when it is as good-looking as this one :)

An epic landmark.. What else can be said about this magnificent bridge?It's quite simply one of the most amazing bridges in Europe.If you're not that keen to wait for the line going to the upper level, buy the tickets online.It sure worth the wait, as the visit is lovely with great view of the Thames and London.

Tower Bridge Exhibition...great. Purchased tickets online at home in New Zealand for this tour... not expensive. Up in a lift...and a walk across the upper deck with lots of information, photos of bridges around the world, and great views of London along the Thames. You can just take your time looking around, check out the video then down to see the engine room. Glad we did it.

Lovely views up and down the Thames. The bridge is a neat little attraction. Going through the line to take the elevator up to the upper deck took a while. There are videos they show giving history and information, there is an exhibition along the upper deck showcasing different bridges around the world. We really just spent our time taking in the views along the banks of the river. All in all, it's a nice little attraction. Nothing spectacular, unless you're a bridge fanatic. We want because it was free with our London pass card but if you are here only a few days, or visiting on a budget, I'd skip the exhibition.

Bridge-tacular. THE bridge to go and see. If your in London and you don't see tower bridge then come back. It's such an amazing beautiful feat of architecture with such an interesting history. Go see it!!

Lovely. The tower bridge, popularly known as the London bridge in India which is not correct, is one of the main attractions in London Must visit place.. recommend you all to visit this place. I had been to this place several times in 2009 and 2010.

Great. We visited on a Sunday morning and it was almost empty. This is a great 'museum' brimming with information not just on the bridge itself (which is fascinating) but on London in general. Great for tourists who have not visited this wonderful city before. Take a camera - the views are magnificent.

Unmissable. A iconic London architectural landmark. Good views over the city from the two high level walkways. Informative panels on the bridge's construction and also on other remarkable bridges around the world. The tour brings you down to the basement where you can see the hydraulic machinery, a bit dry in my opinion. There's a gift shop at the end.

Definately the most interesting piece of architechture in London. Not to be missed on a visit to london - a nice romantic spot for an evening stroll. Unfortunately I didn't have the opportunity to go inside -but may do that on my next visit to London.

Beautiful symbol of the city. Great to see. Tons of traffic. Best pic is from a distance. The Tower Bridge Experience is cool but can get very crowded. So thankful the elevators worked when we were there. We were told sometimes tourists have to climb all those stairs. Can't imagine that. Would have been a deal breaker.
Just fantastic..... Take your time and don't look at your watch. I went with two friends and we spent a good two hours just looking at London all around us...loved it!
Walk over this bridge and take it all in..... amazing architecture and lighting...go at night..crowded but worth it....just go...I can't say enough....

Wonderful Exhibition and Tower Experience. The attraction and exhibition was family friendly. Though on the day of our visit, the lifts were not operational due to maintenance - meaning that we had to climb hundreds of steps to get to the top of one tower to view the exhibition, and then down hundreds of steps for the other tower to get to the bottom. Engine room exhibition was good - however we were informed that the bridge is no longer run by coal and steam - which the engine room showcased. Rather the bridge is now run by grid-electricity. We found it amazing that the bridge could be opened in 30 secs, and the entire open/close traffic hold and release process will take under 10 mins. Definitely worth a visit!
Great views. Fantastic views, could of sat admiring the views for hours, great to learn the history of the bridge before we got to the top.
great visit. Very interesting. I must say I was a bit surprised by the amount of stairs I had to climb. But boy it was worth it! my family & I thought it was worth every penny

Iconic!. When in London, a stroll by the River Thames near Tower Bridge is a must. There are many benches in the area where you can sit and admire the scenery - and if you're lucky, you can actually see the bridge bascules rising for a boat (which we did once). If you fancy some ice-cream, there's a Ben and Jerry's store that shares its space with a Subway on your right, when you're coming to the shore, across from the Tower of London. We went up the bridge for the exhibition and the walkways and it was slightly interesting. There are facts about the construction on the walkway, but we didn't think the view was that great - the glass around it can be a little smudged. It was actually a bit disappointing. You can also visit the engines. If you're really interested in engineering, it is definitely worth it, for us, it was just OK. We always regret not visiting the bridge at night, when it's all lit up.

Waste of time. Much ado about nothing! Magnificent to see from the outside, a world beater in terms of the visual impact of the whole bridge but I thin they try to make money from the insides of it and its not u to much. My 16 year old son wanted to walk across the high walks so we visited it. We had the London Pass so it was covered in that cost wise. The walkways were disappointing, all covered in with glass and the views obstructed by the trellis metal work. Give it a miss, there's too many better places to see in London.

Not to be missed. The Tower Bridge is one of the icons of London. One of the best ways to see it is to take the Thames Cruise, and you will go right under it. After, take the tube to Tower Bridge, and walkon the bridge. There are a lot of great photo ops as you stand on the bridge. Be sure to visitthe London Bridge Experience, and you can visit the turbine rooms, view a movie about the Bridge, and a few other things. Be sure to visit it at night, all lit up.

What a pleasant surprise. Did you know that you can walk across the top of Tower Bridge. We didn't. What a pleasant surprise! There is an interesting exhibition about the history of the bridge and excellent views up and down the River Thames. I would definitely recommend this attraction.

Most beautiful bridge, great view. A quick tour, worth doing in London. Anyone interested in engineering or architecture or history will enjoy. PLUS, great views from the upper walkways of the bridge. You can open the window slides up there and get photos of the Tower of London, queens walk...St Paul's portion of Thames River London. There is an elevator, and you can walk the stairs--easy walk even for healthy older folks. With photo time, this is about a one hour to 1.5 hour tour.

Glad we went up. Having lived and worked in London for all my life and never been here I thought it was about time I took my family and went up this iconic bridge! With 2 for 1 train tickets the entrance was very reasonable, even so I think it's only around £8 per adult in any case. In this day and age not a rip off for an 'attraction'. The trip is fairly simple - a long climb up (no lifts today), a quick video at the top then onto the bridge for an exhibition about its history, construction and other iconic bridges. Plus the view and the feeling of actually being on this iconic bridge. Then a trip down and then to the engine rooms for a look at some of the mechanics behind it. Very glad we went and all the family enjoyed it (me, wife, 9 year old and stroppy teenager!) I read someone else's review and they said going up was pointless - 'not worth the money, we can study the history of bridges aound the world cheaper at the internet' - that's I guess the same sort of person who complains about the cost of eating out in a restaurant against how cheap it is to eat frozen pizza at home! Well worth going, seeing the exhibition in context at the bridge and the views!
More Beautiful At Night!. If you can I highly recommend taking this tour at night as the lights all lit up show off a different side of the beautiful views.

Nice to see from the outside. Save yourself the 8 Pounds per person and admire the bridge from the outside. The ticket lets you walk along the bridge in the inside which had nice views but not worth the money. The information within the walkways were repetitive and not all about Tower Bridge.

Sightseeing must. Seen the tower bridge after finishing at the tower. It's so iconic and got some great pictures with it as a backdrop also. Really busy up there and attracts a lot of people. A must see sign in London

Unique insight into one of London’s most recognizable landmarks. We chose the guided tour option on 31/12/13 and had a fabulous guide, a guy who had been working there for over 10 years and was super-knowledgeable. We started by climbing the staircase inside one of the Towers to the walkway 200 feet above the river and that runs parallel to the road beneath where we saw the first of two videos on the history of Tower Bridge. We were free to take photos throughout the tour and our guide provided both technical explanations of the workings of the Bridge and funny anecdotes and interesting stories about the Bridge and its surroundings throughout our tour which lasted over an hour. We saw everything from panoramic views over London from the walkway to the inner workings of the Victorian lifting mechanisms. It really was a very interesting experience and a unique insight into one of the most recognizable of London’s landmarks.

a ridiculous tour. we 3 spent 24 pounds in an ridiculous tour showing us just some simple videos from the history of the bridge, otherwise not worth the money, we can study the history of bridges aound the world cheaper at the internet.It's a pity, one of the most famous bridges in the world.....and the view was great.

'The Most Famous Bridge (Landmark of London)'. The walk-ways are a major tourist attraction, containing an exhibition about the history of the bridge and offering unique views of London. Experience the stunning views of London from the highlevel Walkways whilst learning the history of the Bridge's construction. Continue your journey down to the Victorian Engine Rooms where the original steam engines, beautifully restored, can be seen.
Excellent place to visit. Excellent and so romantic specially in the evening. Had a cup of coffee with my husband and enjoyed the nature of beauty. It was really superb.
So beautiful!. Have not seen anything more beautiful than this. I think it beats the golden gate of San Francisco. Visit here when it is dark :)
Nice view from the top. We all know Tower bridge, but from the inside it's amazing, you get to understand better how it works and more generally its architecture.

Beautiful. This was worth the trip to see it. It was beautiful and we took some amazing pictures. It is fun to drive over it and we ended up eating nearby. The Tower of London is also near it of course and this was also a great place to visit.
Stunning!. Lovely place for photos. At night, all lit up the Tower Bridge is spectacular. We walked across the bridge an took a lot of pictures. So beautiful!

Could do better. Visited this for the second time and was rather disappointed after enjoying the first visit nine months ago. The lift in the entrance hall was out of order and rather than face 250 steps with an ankle injury, we were redirected to a secret lift on the other side of the road and river - inconvenient to say the least. This meant that starting the tour half way round, we had to walk back across the first upper gallery to the beginning and then retrace our steps before walking the length of the second viewing upper bridge twice again. The explanatory audio visual presentation was Ok but could have been more comprehensive. However, the engine room was truly excellent with clear explanations of how the wonderfully preserved massive steam engines with the aid of some very clever Victorian engineering and hydraulics raised and lowered the bridge.

Great photos. This is an iconic bridge in Europe, if not the world and if you are lucky you will get the chance to see it open up for a boat that passes through. This is a rare site at only about once a day, but shows it is still a functional bridge like that. Take some great photos from various different angles.
Fascinating. I had no idea the upper part of the bridge was open to tours. Fascinating tour and well laid out. So interesting in every respect.

Well worth a visit. A very interesting and informative tour of Tower Bridge including the engine rooms still fitted with all the old gear used when the bridge was built. It's great to be able to walk across the walkways at the top where you can get some good photographs. Only £8 to get in too which is a bargain considering the price of some other attractions in London.
Iconic. The most iconic Bridge in the world.... so much history, a stunning place to stand and look over London

Short visit only required. I was a bit disappointed to find the walkway between the 2 pillions is all fully enclosed with no outside access. for some reason i expected to be able to walk out onto a viewing area. My husband really enjoyed the engine room which has lots of old gear when the bridge was operated by these big machines for the openings. Was some interesting information to read and some nice pictures along the enclosed walkway. The corny movie at the start was okay and would be great for those that haven't heard any stories about the bridge. Would be a good spot for a rainy day visit option. And it is a bit exciting to be actually inside the very famous iconic bridge. so yes do visit if you have an hour or so to spare.

Worth it as part of london pass. The only reason we decide to do the tour as it was part of the London pass. It was a good experience but i wouldnt pay directly for it but its up to each individuals choice. The view was excellent , glad it was a clear day.

Beautiful bridge. The Tower Bridge is well worth a visit. Although I didn't do the (crowded) tour, it's really nice to just walk across, take photos of or take photos from. It's also very close to the Tower of London. A good starting point for a river walk including the HMS Belfast, London Bridge, Tate Modern, Borough Market, Southwark Cathedral and so on.

A big climb but the view was worth it!. It was a bright sunny December day and we were looking for things to do and found ourselves here, reasonably priced and no queue so off we went. The climb up took some doing but we made it, the little shows and exhibits at the top were interesting if you took the time to read them but the real gem was the view, 360 degrees across London, you could pick out most of the well known monuments and building as well as see the developing city. There was a lift down to the bottom which was a welcome rest (could have done with one going up) to the gift shop which was again, reasonably priced.

Go there for two reasons and at two times (of the day)!. First reason to go there: for pictures. Go there once during the day and once at night(or evening). I promise you your pictures will be fabulous!! Bring a good camera with strong flash for the night/evening shots.Second reason to go there (do this only during your day trip): compare with the London bridge next to the Tower Bridge (take photos!!) and have a good laugh hearing the old story of how one bought London Bridge at a very high price but thinking that it was Tower Bridge... Who would think that such a beautiful bridge is not actually named after the city that it is in? Just brilliant!!We didn't actually go into the museum nor the exhibition this time round (we went in many years back but didn't remember it as very impressionable). Just the outside was good enough.

A Must See Landmark. The Tower Bridge is a must see landmark for the London visitor. Located near the Tower of London, the bridge provides many great photo ops and sweeping views of the London skyline.

Amazing building but exhibition is boring. It's an incredible building but the exhibition is such a dissappointment. It feels like a throw back from the boring museums of the 1970s. There is a lack of information for adults and very little thought has been put into making the experience interesting for children - a few steps to allow children to have a good look from the walkways would be a start.

Spectacular Historic Venue for modern entertainment. There are many venues in London available for special celebrations, so if your having a grand celebration or important corporate event consider Tower Bridge. The space is located hogh above the river Thames, between the two supporting columns of Tower Bridge, spanning hundreds of feet in lenghth with unsurpasses views of the river below and historic and modern buildings all along the riverTwo spaces available with one side accomodating a stand up reception while the adjacent span can be set wthe tabes of six for up to 200 guestsCatering availble from established caterers familiar with the venue. Was told that its popular for weddings, receptions and Anniversaries as well as Corporate events
stunning architecture. well i thought this bridge looks really awesome and stunning.its a must visit in London.view is amazing!

A must see icon. If you come to London you must come to see this landmark. It is only a short walk from Tower Hill Station and close to The Tower of London so you usually combine the two landmarks in one trip. I would recommend crossing the bridge at night and it's a romantic walk on the south side of the river where the better views are to be found before heading back over the bridge to Tower Hill.
Great views...lots of steps. Went here after we toured the Tower of London. The climb to the top is a tough one...lots of steps...but the views at the top are worth the climb.

A nice walk. A very lovely walk on a beautiful bridge. We went when it was already dark and it was very nicely lit so we really loved the experience. Next time we will certainly pay the £8 to climb up it too, this time they were unfortunately already closed. Nearby you'll find the tower of London and the Queens walk so this is a perfect place for a lovely walk.

Views from the top are the best in London!. As a Londoner myself, I'd strongly recommend climbing up the bridge - it's only £8 for an adult. Go at dusk on a clear day and once you're at the top, the views are stunning and probably the best in London for some great panoramic photographs. The price also includes looking around the museum of famous bridges around the world. Tip: If you want to get a great photo of London Bridge itself with less crowds head to the North East side. Very quiet and romantic. Once, you've got your shots, you can then head for a bite to eat or drink around the beautiful st Katherines' Docks

Great view with a place to stay. I stayed at Think Apartment, Tower Bridge. The view when passing by the bridge was really great! So beautiful! It is near the tower of London too. Some halal food if you know where to search and convenience stores are located nearly everywhere.
Drove past looks great. Really cool and fits nicely next to the tower of London. Was easy to uturn and go back under again. Newish paint job makes it look like new.

True Landmark. Yes it is a bridge, but find me a better one anywhere. There is not much I need to write about it. It is a grand old bridge and one of London's most iconic landmarks. A visit to London is not complete without seeing Tower Bridge.
London Bridge. Fabulous bridge, very enjoying walk over to the south side. Entry to exhibit inexpensiveVisit in conjunction with Tower of London.

The best bridge on the Thames. The wife learned to drive in the area around this bridge so it holds special memories for her. One of the most beautiful bridges in London, especially at night. Amazing standing so close and looking at the detail and mechanics, amazing.

Amazing.... Most people think the Tower Bridge is London Bridge. Well London Bridge is rather boring, and nothing impressive. in fact if someone doesn't point it out, you will miss the real "London Bridge." The Tower Bridge is amazing and worth the trip up to the top.
Great bridge. I Will never forget THE tour we had in THE machine room of THE bridge and we did walk over THE bridge

Great visit. We went on the guided tour,which was very interesting and comprehensive. It consisted of a walk around the upper walkways then a trip around the underground workings and power systems that drive the raising mechanism,conducted by a qualified guide. Recommended.

Great views, great price!. At Only 8 euros, this must be one of the cheapest attractions in London! You have views both ways of the Thames river and can learn about the history of the bridge as well as go underground to the engine rooms! :-)

Most beautiful bridge on our trip!. I loved the Tower Bridge, so named because it is adjacent to the Tower of London (MUST SEE!!). Sadly, we spent too much time at the Tower of London and got to the bridge just as the tours ended. still, it was fascinating just to walk across the span to see the structure, the river, and the sights around the bridge. It is a lovely structure, and so beautifully maintained I never would have guessed how old it is! When we next visit London this attraction will be on my to do list!

A must see!. If you only have time for one area, visit Tower Bridge. The bridge itself is amazing but there are some little gems in the area to eat, drink and just take in the views. Proud to be British!
Fantastic. I think it would be the best to see it at night.Looks Fantastic when it lits up.I think it would be the best to see it at night.Looks Fantastic when it lits up.

Will never forget. There are a lot of sights to see in London, and this, Tower Bridge, is the one you've probably seen a picture card of.Now, this is real.Back then, in 2010, I couldn't believe I saw the Bridge with my own eyes, which is, true, a breathtaking view, indeed.When I saw it for the first time, the Bridge took my breath away, actually, so beautiful, and gorgeous.Will never forget.
Must see. We had a day to spend it London so it was a but hasty, but Tower Bridge was definitely the highlight. Great sight.

Must visit this place. London tower bridge is the topmost attraction which does not cost you penny. :) This structure has built beautifully and looks great both in day and night. Next to this bridge is towel gateway museum where you can find kohinoor diamond, but this attraction is not free. :) If you have train tickets (not underground) then you can get 2 for 1 entry. Coming to the London bridge this bridge gets open during any big boat passes by. This generally happens once or twice if you are lucky in two hours. :) On the other side of london bridge you can egg shaped building which is mayor house. This is completely open space where you can take absolutely any number of pics . :)

Makes you proud to be a Londoner!. One of the most beautiful locations in the world - I work near this wonderful place and never tire of the view. Especially spectacular in the dark :)I have visited and taken a tour inside - been lucky enough to get the most popular Beefeater tour guide and loved every second of the tour, just wish you could visit more areas inside than are available.Beautiful place, well worth a visit.
A bit of a cliché but a must see. Truly a site to behold, and a must see for visitor, both as seen from all around London as well as up close from the bridge itself.

time well spent. My wife really wanted to see the Tower Bridge up close and herded the family even when it was already a bit late and cold. Had to spend a bit of time at the London Eye as we were unfamiliar with the bus routes but finally got there close to 9PM. walked around a bit to find a nice spot to take pictures and was lucky enough to find a route to the side that afforded a nice view of the tower bridge. Got great shots in and a quick respite from the cold at the Tesco express just across.

Most famous bridge in England. The story goes that this is the bridge the Americans wanted to buy. Instead, they got the historic, but much less impressive London Bridge, which used to stand upriver. The twin towers conceal an elaborate system of gears that gently raise the central section when tall vessels need to pass through. It is an interesting sight, if you get the chance to see it.

A must see Landmark of London. I consider this as one of the most important landmark that should never be missed, due its History and yet another Engineering marvel, when you know that this suspension bridge was constructed in the year 1886( 1886-1894) when the present modern lifting tackles were not present. In addition the two sections of the bridge can be raised to allow the passing small ships in the River Thames makes it something unique worth seeing. I never miss to visit the Bridge when ever I visit London and take some photographs. This is very close to Tower of London Museum and many snack shops and souvenir shops are available nearby. If you go by the under ground train ( circle line), you can get down at TOWER HILL station. I was surprised to hear that the sections were raised with the steam power in the earlier days and later converted to modern hydraulic system. As a Mechanical Engineer, I always admire such Historical engineering structures.

Never get bored of that beautiful view!!!. Very close to Tower of London too - so you can always combine and do both at the same time. You don’t have to pay to walk over the Bridge either, it is FREE of charge and you can get some amazing up / down River shots too of the Thames and if you are lucky to know some who lives close even better views !!!!!!!!!!!!!! Never get bored of that beautiful view!!!

Tower Bridge Experience. A bonus as we witnessed the last lift of the day by tower bridge :)a must to visit the exhibition if you're in town as it showcase the history (e.g. built to relieve the stress of the 'falling down' London Bridge, further up the river) and infrastructure of it; coupled with the view overlooking river Thames.

So Iconic. We grabbed some caramel coated peanuts from the little stalls around and took a lovely summer stroll around and across the bridge for some amazing views and priceless photos to accompany them!

Stunning!. The tower bridge is one of the most beautiful places in London, you can take great pictures from the close by bridges, but crossing it to see all the details is also mandatory.
