You can enter the tower for a fee and also see the machines that control the bridge. As everything in London, the fees are a bit steep. But seeing it from the outside and crossing the bridge if you are on budget is worth it. You will also be close by the London Tower and the bridge also provides good views of it.

Possibly the most photographed bridge in London!. Here it is, the World Famous Tower Bridge. There isnt that much to say about this other than if you are in London then you really must visit this and get some amazing photographs. The viewing will be even more spectacular if you get to catch it going up / down and seeing the traffic queueing and the boats sailing through! Get down to here during the day and again at night if you have the time, for some amazingly spectacular photograph opportunities and some real tourist sites.Very close to Tower of London too - so you can always combine and do both at the same time. You dont have to pay to walk over the Bridge either, it is FREE of charge and you can get some amazing up / down River shots too of the Thames.
Beautiful Bridge. We visit Tower Bridge on our trip in London. They show you how the bridge itself works.The engine room is spectacular! Also the guides are very nice to you.

Beautiful bridge!. I love Tower Bridge, I think it's a beautiful construction. Great views over the river too!There's a lot of history around it so it's worth reading up about it and seeing it for yourself!
Beautiful especially at night.. I know it was so cheesy but I couldn't stop taking so many photos on the bridge. The bridge was beautiful and it was romantic. =)

Interesting construction. Worth to visit, you can learn about how the bridge itself works. It has a "museum-part" with video and drawings about how the bridge itself works. Also there is info about famous bridges worldwide. Don't forget to visit the engine house of the bridge.

Beautiful architecture!. No visit to London is complete without a stop at Tower Bridge and nearby Tower of London. These are exciting architectural feats with great history, and I find it hard not to get impressed by them. Walk across the bridge for some great shots of the Tower of London and the Shard, Europe's tallest building (they are complete opposites!) We did not go to the bridge museum this time, but it is definitely worth-visiting. Do not miss out!

Its not London Bridge. I remember when i visited this bridge for the first time back in Sept 2000 I was surprised to learn that this bridge is called tower bridge coz most people believe its called the london bridge, the one we read about in a beautiful poem. London Bridge is the bridge close to it. anyhow Tower of bridge has a museum which is worth a visit. one could walk on either side on the bridge and get a good view for the pictures. theres lot of activities around it. nice pubs and restaurants on one side and Tower of London Fort on the other.

Better than the London Bridge. I've always seen pictures of this bridge and assumed it was the London Bridge. It was quite interesting to learn that this is a totally different bridge AND more appealing/attractive than the actual London Bridge itself. It was great to see it in person and learn the history which was explained on the City tour my friend and I were on. Great for pics!

Go at Night. One of my favourite places to take visitors to London is Tower Bridge at Night - especially riding across in a car looking up at the floodlight bridge is very spectacular. There is also very easy access from the bridge to the South Bank path and of course to the Tower of London. Not much to do on the bridge except enjoy the amazing views of London and of the bridge itself, and that is enough. A must see attraction in London!

it was OK. after being in London lots of time this was the first time we went to tower bridge.its a OK thing to see but i was not that impressed as i was hoping.the start is about the time when it was created and by hoe.then the nice walk over the tower, but then they try to take your picture for selling.... i dont like that.finishing with the engine room.all and all it was OK.

Very good to see but the Exhibition is boring. It's impossible to see London without visit the Tower Bridge but I found the Exhibition very boring, with 8£ i expected something more than a good view....The Engine rooms are not bad but not so exciting...

must go if you have extra time in london. Having very short amount of time in London during my last 2 visits, this time I took the opportunity to go up to the west and east walkways of the Tower Bridge. It was well worth the effort as an elevator actually takes you to the top. They show a quick video of how the bridge was built and then you head out in the walkways to view the River Thames and surrounding areas. They have a nice photo exhibit on various famous bridges around the world on the east walkway and a special exhibit on the author, Ed Lasko who wrote the famous "This is" books-- the one on exhibit here is "This is London." Bought back a lot of memory from my childhood school days as we read this book. Was a great experience and many nice photo opps from the walkways. The tour ends at the Engine room where you can see they big wheels at work and then a video on the building. Well worth the visit here.

Great place to see. Having been to London literally hundreds of times, I thought it was about time to check out this landmark and we weren't disappointed. Incredible place, great tour with loads of fascinating information about how it was built. The overall experience is wonderful and I would certainly go back. Walking along the bridge and the views are awesome, don't forget to take your camera :)
Good day out.... Lots of things to do here. Explore this ancient castle, see where king Henry's wives were beheaded. Lots of other attraction close by.

The biggest of big boys toys. Definitely one for the dads and the kids! The Victorian engineering and machinery are superb. The explanation & information panels just right. You take a lift to the top and then, after viewing the galleries in the main spans that link the towers, you work down floor by floor. There are proper lifts for wheel chair users with attendants on hand. It's worth it for the great views up and down the Thames.

Family trip - Good value. Once you have overcome the silly website booking issues this is a really good value trip for the family. Try and go at dusk as you will see the docks side of London first then by the time you have made it to the north facing side of the bridge it will be dark and prepare to be amazed!

Must see in London. The Tower Bridge deserves to be on any serious traveler's itinerary when visiting the city of London. It's iconic and the views of the night skyline are spectacular. The night we went, the crowds were fairly heavy and I assume it stays pretty busy year round. There is some type of visitors office on the bridge itself but we were there after it closed. It's a fun walk to the bridge, as you'll pass the Tower of London directly to the right and you can see it lit up from the bridge views.

Very good, well worth a visit!!. Thoroughly enjoyed a recent visit to the Tower Bridge. The entrance fee of £8 is quite reasonable for a London attraction, and a very good one at that. The Tower Bridge is a significant British landmark, which makes for an interesting couple of hours. The tour starts with lift ride up the north tower, followed by a short video about the bridge. From there you tour the 2 bridge sections across the top, where you get excellent views of London, and some superb photograph opportunities. With plenty of info and art work on display, you can easy spend over an hour at the 'top of the tower'. With a tour of the engine room to finish off with, this really was a very good and worthwhile visit, which I would highly recommend!!

Nice View Of The City. This attraction is well priced for what you get, for around £8 per adult, you get the novelty of walking in the top of the bridge. There are some interesting facts in the walkways about the history and construction of the bridge, as well as information about London. As part of the visit you also can go into the engine rooms to look at how the bridge used to be operated. Not too busy and a nice way to break up a day.

Interesting. Anyone who visits London on vacation should take the Tower Bridge tour. I see it almost every week, but going inside, learning it's history, seeing the machinery and getting a great view of the Thames was very interesting and worthwhile. A "must do" on any trip to London.

Good tour - not 'too touristy'. Visted today on a day out to London, wasn't too busy, nice touch that you can walk along both sides of the upper bit of the bridge. Went as a couple, but could see a few families with kids aged 5+ also having a good time. Husband isn't keen on heights usually but not a problem here as no open air bits, and no see thru floors! Good to learn the history of one of the most iconic london landmarks.Went with the standard £8 entry (per adult). For an extra £1 you can get tickets to go up The Monument, but didn't bother with that as its about 300 steps!

Tower bridge. Have not been to tower bridge for some years decided to take another tour around ,not disapointed well worth a visit back just as I remember it , walking over the Thames on walkways gives you a different look on London would definatly recommend it

Nice to be able to say you have been inside it. Went on the 10/11/2013 with my wife and had not booked before hand. The ticket office is on the Tower of London side of the bridge on the on the main upright of the bridge. This is clearly marked. There is a lift that takes you to the 4th floor and you walk into a room where a short film is played about the decision on the bridge being built. After this you then walk across the alleyways above the road and there are a number of photos exhibitions being shown. The views are nice from this level. you then enter the other side of the bridge and you can then watch another short film, before going down the levels and being able to see a bit more of the structure of this bridge. There are toilets and a chance to get the lift down to ground level before walking along the blue line to the engine rooms. The engine rooms a lovely to see how this grand bridge worked. This is all on one level and then takes you out into the shop before exiting the engine rooms. This is not a long visit from my view and took about 40 minutes, which is fine if you are getting to see a number of London's sights. The cost is not expensive and for the time that it takes you get to visit a great London land mark, before moving on to other sights.

Well worth a visit. Definitely worth paying to go up inside Tower Bridge and to walk along both walkways - amazing views in both directions - and you can admire the Tower of London surrounded by modernity!I was expecting to be cold up there, but it's all glassed in now except for some panels that can be opened to take camera shots through..brilliant bit of planning there!We were pounced on by 2 women taking photos, for a price, but they quickly left us alone when they saw we were not interested - especially as the background view is actually superimpossed onto a green screen. The engine room is included in the price and is also well worth a visit as they're far more interesting than I anticipated.

Beautiful bridge worth seeing. Took the kids to Tower Bridge exhibit today and we all enjoyed it.Magnificent views both direction and lots of information about the bridge and surrounds.Definitely worth a visit from there you can walk along the Thames and soak up the London atmosphere.

Beautiful sight. We went to London for two days and went here to finish the second day. The tour is excellent, couldn't ask for any better. When you get to the walkway, you don't realise how much you can see, from the shard to the O2 arena. The service is very good, answering any questions. They have an activity card for children if they want, collecting stickers to make a Tower Bridge collage. The engine rooms are very interesting better than you expect to see. It is definitely worth the price, recommended.

A walk across this icon of London. You can of course decide to go for the Tower Bridge Exhibition inside the Tower Bridge structure, but this is of course for a fee. Walking across this well known icon of London is an experience in its own right and it is free. What the Rialto Bridge is for Venice, is the Tower Bridge for London. Not to be skipped, especially for the first time visitor. Just feel the history. Further good news is, that you can combine the Tower Bridge walk with a visit of the Tower of London and St. Katharine's Dock at the North side and the Thames South Bank walk on the south side. The view over the Thames from Tower Bridge is stunning with the new Shard skyscraper on the left and a glimpse of St. Paul's on the right. See the pictures.

Tower Bridge. We thoroughly enjoyed the tower bridge. We walked across early in the morning when one of the tube lines wasn't working. It was so neat to see the hustle and bustle of the business people, who usually ride the tube, walking across the bridge. It was such a different experience from the time before. As we walked back over that evening, we met the business men and women walking back home. We we always going in the opposite direction against the wave of humanity.Just standing in the middle of the bridge and watching the water traffic was so neat.

Great Views. It's worth doing the Tower Bridge experience and get to see the Bridge from the inside out. The views are great on a clear day and you get to see the Engine Room as well. Interesting wandering along the east and west spans finding out the history of the bridge, comparisons to other bridges, and how the bridge mechanism really works. Did it as part of the London Pass as it is very central and easy to get to from other attractions.

Worth a look at a very reasonable price. Very enjoyable hour spent looking around the bridge. Well informed displays and video presentations within each tower. Good views on a clear day. Engine room also worth looking at.Nice gift shop.Good coffee shop/bar under the bridge opposite the engine room.Lift access to the top of the bridge.

Great views. The Tower Bridge Exhibition is very interesting with some great facts about the historic landmark. Views from the walkway are excellent with some great photo opportunities. The children enjoyed the touchscreen quizzes and the cameras. The engine room is impressive but an audio guide would be good as there is so much too read. We went about 14 years ago and you were guided round and got to see so much more. A good way to spend a couple of hours in our great capital city.

Nice little museum. I wasn't sure what to expect with this museum. I had seen it from the ground many times, but never really knew what was inside. You enter through the bottom of one of the towers and into a large lift that takes you to one of the upper levels. From there you watch a little video introduction with some charming talking paintings before heading out on to the horizontal beams where the galleries are. From here you can go back and forth along the beams taking in the views and the history of the tower.My favourite bit was the second tower. Don't forget to look up and see the model workmen on the rafters. You then head down another elevator into the gift shop where you can buy the usual keyrings and memorabilia that is much cheaper outside the tower.It doesn't end there. Afterwards you have to follow the blue line and you get to visit the Engine rooms and the giant steam engines that control the drawer bridges. They are no longer used, but are in excellent condition and make an exciting wander around, if you like that sort of thing.

Views and history!. Good experience for all ages. The history is told in an easy to understand way, you go round at your own pace so can enjoy the views over the river both ways. Engine room is interesting for old and young alike. Only issue is quite a few stairs going down. Allow an hour at least to enjoy.

Beautiful and very interesting. I enjoyed a lot this experience. Absolutely, its one of the touristic points where you can not miss the opportunity to visit it. You will be able to take some nice pics, have a very nice view of the city, know about the bridge, the history and how it used to work, the system and so. After that if you want u can buy some souvenirs. You have to pay a fee to check this out but its worth.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful bridge and well worth visiting,you can get some great pictures of the bridge from a distance

A MUST SEE!!!. My husband & I spent 4 days at a property right close to this amazing Tower Bridge! We loved our time here and spent many hours walking back and forth over this bridge and have so many awesome pictures, both at day time and night time when the bridge is completely lit up!! So many attractions in this area, including the Tower London, Touriing the Belfast, Boat tours up and down the Thames River, and of course, the Tower Bridge itself!! Our highlight being, finding cute little bistro's along the Thames where we could enjoy the best views ever of this amazing Tower Bridge while sipping on wine and enjoying our meal!! I 100% recommend this a MUST SEE if you are ever in London...you won't be disappointed!!

London landmark, must see.... We got there by tourist bus, Golden Tour. The bridge is fantastic and just near the bridge is Tower of London. The view is lovely, it is a mix of old and modern buildings. We had a free ride with the Thames Clippers from Golden Tour bus and it was useful to go back to the heart of the city at London Eye and enjoy Thames by boat in the same time. We skip visiting the Tower Bridge engine room, but we will definitely do it next time.

One of the best bridges in the world!. This is a fantastic bridge. Even if you don't go Inside it is worth going to get a close up view of the bridge as it is really impressive and you get much better photos than from a distance.unfortunately I didn't have time to go in the museum this time but will put it on my list for a future visit.

What a view.. This is a lovely and well worth visiting place. We did not go in the museum but the photoes you can get from different angles will be lovely to look back on. The view as you walk towards tower bridge will last a long time in your memory. It's a nice walk along the river too and all the time the tower is getting closer- a must visit.

An amazing view Iconic to London. Tower Bridge was the first sites I visited when I got to London. It was breath taking. I am glad that it was the first site I saw. I loved it. And will always remember it.Tower bridge is one of the most beautiful bridges in not only London, but the entire world.The tower bridge definitely an iconic landmark associated with London one sight and anyone can tell you that is London The tower bridge tour also worth a visit,the sight was so good that i visited it at night and during the day . The glimpse of the Tower bridge from the boat was also amazing. A must visit for all going to London.
Must-visit spot in London. London Tower bridge is one of the most famous tourist spot in London and it is a must-visit in London. The view is great. I didn't go inside the museum.

More than just an icon.... The tower bridge definitely is a part of London blood stream... one sight and anyone can tell you that is London... my daughter can't stop singing "London bridge" and this Tower Bridge look too good from land or from the river cruise.... just too fabulous design !The tower bridge tour also worth a visit, as you can learn alot more and to look down from the top. and dont forget to follow the blue link all the way to the engine room...
First View. One of the first sites I visited when I got to London. It was breath taking. Absolutely breath taking. I am glad that it is the first site I saw. I loved it. And will always remember it.

A beautiful place to roam. Tower bridge is one of the most beautiful bridges in not only London, but the entire world. I have visited London from July 20-28, 2013. I have witnessed the historic day (July 22, 2013) - Kate, Duchess of Cambridge, gave birth to a Royal baby boy during my stay. It was 22-July night & I was coming from my Business place to hotel (International hall) & I have taken the river side walking route to reach Helborn. The tower bridge was lightened with blue glow to celebrate the occasion so beautifully. It was an amazing experience. Later I have visited Tower Bridge Exhibition. The view of the Tames River from the Tower was beautiful. The engine room is very interesting.

Beautiful Ride or Walk!. This is a must see in London. Also take a moment & read the history of the bridge before visiting! You'll be amazed at the time spent exact year maintaining this workable piece of history!!
Better go inside. Had a better deal with London Pass, no lines just quick and easy in express lane. Very nice exhibits in the second floor and have a best view of Thames.

Interesting. I visited the Tower Bridge with my kids (7 and 10 years old) and my parents. It was overall very interesting. The old machines are impressive and the hands-on experiments for the kids well thought.
Overall I really liked it!

iconic viewing. Well we love this, it's pretty to look at, our kids think it's cool that the bridge can go up and down to let ships through, and they were happy to walk across, have a look down the hole in the middle, and take lots of photo's to show their friends. It never fails to impress from a visitors perspective. If you get to it via the tower of london, expect lots of stairs.

Great attraction, exhibition OK. Tower Bridge is an impressive historic structure and well worth a visit. Some great views from the walkways and the engine room is very well presented. The exhibition is OK although some of it seems quite dated and there could have been more about the story behind the bridge and its construction.

A magnificent bridge. Enjoy a magnificent view from the high level walkways, stunning panoramic views of East London and down the river.A very interesting visit into the victorian engine room showing how the bridge lifts. Don't miss the section on Great bridges of the world too.It's not cheap at £8.00 per adult but if it's the view you are after then it's cheaper than the Shard.If you want to see the bridge lift from the outside check the Tower bridge website it gives you a list of dates and times when it will be lifting.

A must see. Tower Bridge was a fun few hours, great visit was not hurried. Watched video of the building process, the view from the top of the bridge was awesome. Engine room was interesting. Would visit again.

Lights!!. We stayed very close to the bridge so we were lucky enough to see it lite up! Looked like Cinderella's' castle. The colors were beautiful. Just north from there on the same street is a collection of restaurants that we enjoyed each night. From pubs to Italian...great food!!

Enjoyed the visit. Interesting exhibition about the bridge itself and other famous bridges around the world. Some short videos. Good views up and down The Thames, Tower of London, the Shard, the Gherkin and St Pauls in the distance. Annoying obligatory photo taken which of course is then way overpriced. Short walk along to the engine rooms. If you travel by train look on the days out 2-4-1 offers that you can use meaning it is £8 for two which is good value.
My view of Tower Bridge. Needs better upkeep, let in too many visitors inside at the same time - no surprises as such, if one has already seen photos from there - entering expense much too high!

Great, but needs a makeover. As a piece of Victorian engineering, it is absolutely fantastic, but as an attraction, I agree with a recent reviewer that it needs a major upgrade. I last visited the bridge around 20 years ago, and other than a short film show at the beginning, very little had changed - other than the price, which was free when I went last! The lift up was quite slow coming, and was a bit of a crush, but otherwise there was plenty of room to wander over the bridge spans and take in the sights.Across the bridge and into the old engine rooms revealed the original steam engines, which were well presented, but with limited information.Look out for leaflets and people giving out discount leaflets - we got 20% off bringing the cost down to £6 per person

Great use of a few Tesco CC points. To say you have been up in both towers and walked across the high level walkways of Tower Bridge is really not a bad thing to have done as it really is the most iconic bridge. And even better when courtesy of Club Card points. Swap £2.50 of CC points for a £10 Days Out voucher and when you get to the Bridge they will exchange it for a combined ticket so that you can visit the nearby Monument of London as well (and climb 311 steps to the top and the viewing platform). So you actually get to tick off doing two exciting things for £2.50 of points. The exhibitions are simple but informative, the engine room impressive. I went just so that I could say that I have been. They even give you a £2 off voucher for the gift shop - which is one of the best, and not overpriced, gift shops that I have been to.

Could be awesome. The display and exhibits need updating and enhancing desperately. We expected some great views but they were amazingly not there! Only glimpses out through displays and bridge structure. A glass floor overlooking the road would be amazing as would observation decks looking out over each side. Display of "London today" was based on a children's story book. Downstairs "Art exhibition" featured only five (most very dubious) prints only one with anything to do with the bridge. Terrible display showing the main London buildings made with Perspex and lit up in neon lights! Very interesting to see the inner workings and staff pleasant.

Stunning. It might be an old bridge that's out dated technology wise but the simple engineering touches of the bridge is superb, sold metal couplings, connections on display, a joy to walk on and look at the engineering touches.Oh and it looks pretty as well, especially at night when it's all lit up, good photo place is on the north side of the river on the key side in front of the tower hotel with the fountains outside.

Beautiful Bridge .. Walked over the Tower Bridge and took the night Sightseeing over it. Its very beautiful this iconic bridge, did not see the exhibitions but would love to next time. Fantastic colours on the bridge, and very cool that it is a drawbridge. Very special bridge in London Town!
Great Experience. I had a visit to Tower bridge of London in last week. Such a beautiful creation & Must visit in Lifetime. You can also visit tower exhibition for more site seen.

Beautiful. The famous Tower Bridge!We went to the exhibition and it was well worth it, learnt alot of things about the bridge and some of the crazy designs the Londoners came up with for it.The views from the 'catwalk' are great and there wasn't any lines.

Tower Bridge Exhibition. We went to the Tower Bridge to see the views from the walkways (about 138 feet above the Thames) and the exhibition featuring the history of the bridge with illustrative photos and a film. We learned a lot and loved the views. Also don't miss the Victorian Steam Engine Room -- the engines and brass are polished and fascinating (even to me!) It was well worth the trip. I believe the fee was around 8£. We took the Hop On/Hop Off to the bus which included a river cruise, so we walked down to the dock from the bridge and got on the boat to go back to our hotel.

A bridge with stunning view and history. We visited this most famous Victorian bridge in London this July. It looks so gorgeous in the day light. We were also lucky to see the bridge opening up for tall boat to go pass. This bridge was designed by John Jackson and opened 1894. No sightseeing tour in London can be completed until you visit this historic bridge that crosses river Thames. Day or night this bridge looks wonderful. The nearest tube station can be Tower Hill or London bridge. View from London bridge is astonishing. The tower bridge exhibition is another option there if you would like to know about the history of famous bridges around the world.

She's Majestic!. Rounding a corner, from the Tower of London, if you look towards the water, you see the Tower Bridge. You can't miss the grandiose structure over the River Thames! It's a big piece of history, it's beautiful and definitely worth a visit!
Amazing views in interesting exhibit. Pros: Views, no lines, exhibit, location (proximity to Tower of London)Cons: One elevator down (we had to wait quite a while), closes early

Icon of London. Not many attraction here, but the view are awesome. There are little park beside the bridge for photoing spot. As the oldest drawbridge in Britain, it should be placed in your visiting list in London. Just walk within a minute from subway station.

Tower Bridge Exhibition. I went on the Tower Bridge Experience in August 2013. It is a self-guided tour and the visit is worth the cost if you are interested in all things related to the Tower of London. It will take a couple hours to fully see everything without rushing. There is so much history of London connected to the bridge. In the walkways there are displays showing where different London sights are as seen from Tower Bridge as well as placards telling the history of the bridge. The view from the top as you stand over the middle of the River Thames seems to go on forever. The engine room was quite interesting, giving information about how Tower Bridge began operating and continues to operate today.

Very Underrated Attraction. This iconic structure normally gets over looked in modern day London. The entrance fee is one of the lowest out of all the attractions and is included in the Museum Pass (You should get this away). This is fun for the whole family and a tribute to one of the oldest drawbridges in the world.

Iconic London. Every-time I pass Tower Bridge it links me back to the history of this beautiful city. Really want to see it when it's raised for ships.It looked great with the Olympic rings last year. I did the tour a couple of years ago and it was interesting to find out the history associated with the bridge. A must see when in town

Tower Bridge. We did this in August 2013, it was a spur of the moment, but it was very well done. It was only 7or 8 pounds. The engine room was very good & the movie they showed had a lot of information a good place to take photos. It was good to learn some of the history.

Britain's symbol. One does not simply visit London without visiting the Tower Bridge.It's not necessary to take the tour up to the towers, just walk it through and feel almost British :) Fun fact! In London river transportation has a priority over the land transportation so even former American president Bill Clinton had to unexpectedly wait for some ship to pass before his car could continue his official visit.

Even the bomber pilots thought it was iconic!. Great for learning something about the engineering and history behind the bridge. It was not bombed during WW2, because they used it as a navigational landmark from the air!

lovely scenery. I vistited the bridge in the evening, when it was dark, and it was so beautiful to look out over london! The scenery was lovely and it was nice to see all the buildings lit up in the dark.

It's ok, rather dated tour and videos. Pleasant afternoon visit, paid for a private tour but not really worth it. Probably best to have a much about by yourselves and read the placards. Fairly interesting, history is fantastic but you can find it out yourself. not one of the top attractions I would recommend but worth walking up to for some fab photos.

Loved this Exhibition - very interesting. So glad I decided to do the Tower Bridge Exhibition. Entry cost was £8 for adults. It was fantastic. A lift took my group of tourists up one of the towers to the top of the tower, adjacent to the walkway-span.Once out of the lift, we walked into a room where we watched an interesting film about the bridge design and how that particular design was selected. After watching the film, we walked out onto the walkway between the two towers, to walk across the bridge to the opposite tower. The walkway is fully enclosed with a solid floor. The view is fantastic both up and down the river. This exhibition is self paced which was great if you wish to take lots of photos or to just admire the view. When we crossed to the second tower and as we walked from the walkway, we each had our photo taken with the Tower Bridge in the background. We were given a ticket to pick up our photos later if we wanted to them - cost £15. We then moved into a room and watched another short film on the building of the bridge, before walking out to the second walkway to take us back in the opposite direction. Again I took lots of photos down the river. Big Ben, Westminster and St Paul’s could all be seen in the distance, as well an excellent view of the glass sky-scraper called "The Shard" and the oval shaped building known as the "Gherkin". We then took the lift down to the bottom and were shown through the original “Engine Room", which still houses the old machinery. Originally the spans were lifted by steam operated hydraulics. In this room, there were big hydraulics and all sorts of mechanical stuff. It was very interesting. We then watched another short film on how these engines worked. Today, the bridge spans are lifted by electric powered hydraulics – approx. 3 times a day. I found the entire exhibition totally fascinating and I loved it.

Fascinating Glimpse of the History and Construction of the Bridge. An excellent 1 hour teaches you about the reason for the bridge, its construction, and leads you across wonderful viewing stations looking up and down the Thames and affording great veiws of London skyline. The Engine Room is quite impressive.

Visit an international icon. It is really astounding to be able to get inside this tribute to Victorian engineering but do try to visit on a day with when there is good visibility. The external views both up and down the Thames are excellent and are worth going in themselves. They are probably more spectacular and certainly more panoramic than others on offer.Watch the introductory presentation. The characterisations of the main players, including Queen Victoria, are a bit tacky but it gives a very good history of why and how the bridge was built including the more outlandish proposals for providing a Thames crossing.Having lead you along the walkway the tour then takes you to the engine room where there are the original machines that lifted the bridge and for the technically minded an explanation of how the whole thing worked.

Not worth going up the tower. Tower bridge is a terrific place to take a photo, with it in the background. However, you can skip going up the tower (6 pounds). We thought it would give us a very nice view of London - however, the "exhibits" were uninteresting, and our view of London was limited and not 360 as I had expected. The experience appeared to be more geared towards school groups, as evidenced by the two extremely loud groups that were there at the same time as us.

The bridge is not falling down. Having heard the song of London Bridge is Falling Down since I was small, certainly creates a sentimental feeling when I, at my late thirties, finally cross the phenomenal bridge. Amazing how far I have travelled to see the bridge that becomes witness of some of my favorite movies. Go on a hop on hop off tour to get the idea where you want to stop, the tickect is valid for 48 hours. Good deal.

Beautiful bridge. I only spent a few hours in Central London, but was happy that I had the opportunity to stroll across this bridge. I wasn't expecting the color at all. Whether from a distance or up close, it's lovely. There are great views from both sides.

Worthwhile. You can easily miss this attraction but would recommend a visit. The whole experience is well organised, the exhibition extremely interesting and you can take your time. The views you get from the bridge walk are absolutely fantastic and it is great to see the location of other landmarks.

Lovely views from an iconic bridge. Take the time to walk across this bridge so that you can really see all its details. A great spot for taking photos of upstream, the Tower of London, or just selfies!

Must See. The Town Bridge is just stunning, very grand. You can easily find a great angle to take a picture of the bridge. There's usually a crowd from the people who visited the London Tower, so if you want a picture with less tourist, I recommend you to walk to the other end. Our pictures turned out great!

Great views & a Fab London Landmark!!!. Ive lived in London a long time & have viewed, walked & driven across this bridge for years. Today decided with a friend to visit the Tower Bridge experience & wow what a visit...The reception area was busy but the staff were friendly & informative, actually all through the visit. Yes you take a lift with a member of staff to the bridge's high level walkways, 42 metres above the river Thames, showing spectacular panoramic views of both East & West London. However before that you view an informative short film, as to how it was constructed, by whom & why...(people have said its boring, but being a City of London guide,i didn't think so!!)..there is also lots of information on both Walkways, concerning other bridges (worldwide)..the City of London & other buildings you can see on the London skyline!...i really enjoyed my visit, especially the views & also visiting the Victorian 'Engine rooms' on the south section - follow the blue line lolGhosh i wish i'd done this years ago....lol!!! Do visit folks...

Icon of London. Tower bridge is the beautiful icon of London which is often confused with the London bridge directly west of this bridge. Tower bridge is arguably one of the most beautiful bridges in not only London, but the entire world. It consists of two identical towers and a drawbridge in the middle to allow boats to pass. This historic bridge, just off the Tower of London is a tourist Mecca and one of the busier parts of the city with tourists.You can get great views and pictures near the City Cruises next to the Tower of London and on the opposite bank as well.

Cool. This Bridge is everything pretty cool. It's a must see when visit London along with Buckingham Palace. We saw it from one of the various river cruises available that cruises down the River Thames. We did this to get some great pictures of the whole bridge plus the cruise up the Thames was pretty cool in itself.
Interesting. This is an interesting thing to go and see. Some people may find it boring but it's really cool to learn the history of how this bridge came to be plus the view is great.

A nice view from the catwalk. Not as high of a view as the London Eye, but better in my opinion. Which reminds me, skip the London Eye unless you don't mind paying an exorbitant amount. The engine rooms are kinda cool too. If you have the London Pass, then it makes it worth your time.

Amazing and worth the money.. On a last day in London we decided to visit Tower Bridge, with booked tickets in advance with 10% off for doing it online. We dent during the day and there was no queue or anything which is a big bonus when visiting London. When you enter you will be screened by X-ray, frisking & metal detectors however this is standard when visiting large important infrastructure. You will go up with a lift conductor in a small group, when you arrive at the top you will watch a film about the bridge (a little boring when you know it already). After being freed from the film you are able to walk along the top of the bridge on both side. The sight is amazing, you can see all the way across London which is great for photos and a different experience. The fact that you are above the river also allows you to see famous ships and buildings which you would not otherwise see. you can walk across both sides of the tower for up to 1 hour so you have lots of time to enjoy the sights.When you come back down you exit through a small gift shop and out a small fire exit which takes you down to the river.

Free attraction!. We walked the bridge and took pictures just to say we did. Nice photo opportunities and it's free. There is an opportunity to pay and get the history and a tour but we enjoyed our free tour. I'd say save your money for The London Eye.

great value for money. We had this attraction as part of a multi ticket, however I think it's only about £10 if paid for individually. we tied this in with a visit to the Tower of London which is directly adjacent.I hadn't realised that you could actually go up and across the bridge until I saw this as part of a multi ticket.I was so happy we found this and took part. there is so much history, so much information to look at. the views from up here are fantastic as well, it helped that we had a beautifully clear day as well. you can look around at your own pace and spend as much or as little time here as you like. upon exiting the bridge, follow a walk way as instructed by the staff (who were all very nice and helpful) along the street and down into the engine rooms, and see how the bridge is operated. this really is a great and informative experience that I really enjoyed and would recommend for any visitors to London, especially since its right next door to the popular Tower of London.

Great. One of the characteristic landmarks of London and great exhibition and films inside (quite reasonably prices as for London attractions). You pass through the footbridge giving you nice views over Thames and London. Ticket is also valid for the visit to the engine rooms on the riverside. The views from outside are spectacular - a stroll through the bridge is a must. We happened to come across the opening of the bridge on our way to the exhibition. A lot of fun. According to the information inside, the opening occurs 15-20 times a week. One of the best places in London for sure.
probably the most famous landmark of London. probably the most famous landmark of LondonGreat view. It is great combined with a ride in the london eye

Lovely to see a few times walking by. I first saw the bridge visiting the tower of London and thought it looked pretty cool. Then I started walking over it for my work and really enjoyed it.I liked the fact that it was painted blue in quite a few places which is not what the average boring bridge is painted. The architecture is pretty cool. Also if you walk along the waterfront a little but, by the Mayors office, you can get a really nice view of it which I suggest you do if you have the time!

Historical Landmark. Tower bridge is probably the second most photographed Bridge in the world after The San Francisco Golden Gate Bridge. Among several visits to London i visited the Tower bridge last year in October. It was a gloomy dayand after just picturing it for some time from a distance i decided to take a tour of the bridge to see it from Inside. The entrance is from the North Tower and you start by seeing how the Bridge was designed. after this you can walk the walkway across the bridge where you will have the opportunity to see the River and City from high above the Bridge. As you cross the walkway you will reach South Tower where you can see you the Bridge was built. The tour doesn't end there. There is a Blue Line marked and you can follow the same to see the Engine Rooms. This is where all the Historical engines and machinery is, which used to operate the opening and closing the bridge. I liked this part the most as you get first hand views of some of the best engineering feats of British history.

what views. We have been to London many times but never done the bridge .This a definate must doYou take the lift to the walk way.The film is lighthearted in the way it tells the story.The views are wonderful .On one wall there is information on all the other famous bridges.You then come down and round to the engine rooms where you get a fell for the work involved to lift the bridge.This is an attraction to see again as the views at differnt times of the day are sights to see and capture on film.

Tower Bridge Experiance and Tombs. This was not the Tower Bridge Exhibition on Tower Bridge,this is 10 minute walk from the bridge and right facing tower bridge tube station,we had a 2for1 offer on this attraction and i'm glad we went because it was really good.They take so many in a group and you go round the attraction while they tell you things that happened to people and what they did then later you have to put your hands on the persons shoulder in front of you and they take you round the scary tombs and while your going round people are jumping out at you and following you in the dark and trying to scare you,it was actually really funny and I couldn't stop laughing at the other people that were screaming their heads off,it was quite fun and i'm glad we went.Not really for under 12's.

Seen it open. Last time I was in London (2 years ago) I done the whole tour of the Bridge, and it is amazing. Definitely go up and over the top section, gives you a history of how it was built, points out areas of London. Then you can go into the engine room to see how it lifts. This time I looked on the website for the bridge, and it gave you times of when the bridge will open for boats going through.Time wasn't exact, but did see the bridge open and the best bit. I'm from Kent and 2 Kent Barge's went though. Was the best thing to see. Next to the bridge open.

A beautiful bridge with lots of history. Well worth a visit and to walk on. do the tour as well. We spent a lot of time here as the bridge is a great place to sit and has great views across the Thames. We sat and had lunch looking at the bridge. We walked over it twice as we really enjoyed the history. Lots of history here.
Great view. We did this tour as part of our London Pass. It was very informative, and the views were spectacular.

Tower Bridge is great, Exhibition is nice and simple. Tower Bridge is fascinating just like in the pictures. We have taken the exhibition as part of the London pass. Basically first stage of the exhibition is watching a video depicting the history behind the bridge with queen Victoria, the architect and civil engineer as the main parts. Following which you pass two hallways crossing all the bridge showing an exhibition about the history of the bridge and bridges around the globe.Finally you also get to visit the engine rooms which is very interesting showing the way the bridge operates mechanically. I really appreciated the way children are greeted with a passport and set or stickers are collected in every stage of the visit.TIP: Take note of the time(s) when the bridge is planned to open and its spectacular to assist at this. Bridge usually opens at least once sometimes even 4/5 times. There is board just outside.

Up one side - down the other. Very nice tour of Tower Bridge, going up one side you get to see all the old building parts inside the tower, so much history must be within those walls. Once at the top a lovely walk over the bridge, then down the other side and a look at the old parts and inner workings.

You can climb the tower bridge and walk over the top. There is a fee to climb the tower (discounts for students - bring your college ID) your can ride the elevator up. and view the exhibits as well as the view as you walk across the top cross section of the bridge. There are some cool photo opportunities from the top of the bridge. your go up one tower - walk across and down the other. your entry ticket also allows you to walk back across the bridge and see the engine room (how they raise and lower the bridge) located under the road surface. great gift shop below road level too. Well worth the time and money. Exit the bridge if you wish to flag down a London Cab. Taxi's are prohibited from stopping on the bridge.

nice view. Tower Bridge (built 1886–1894) & collapsed because the king OK great of Britain the the bridge take fee using which for maintenance & give the money to his wife .The bridge is 800 feet ( in length with two towers each 213 feet high, built on piers. there are good deal to visit the towerpay 8 GB but i advice you book online & came early because it crowded area & many people want enter the tower . the bridge tower open limit time per week , i advice you know the time before you came. i like London view from the bridge.it informative , history & nice tour.
My favourite spot in London. I have lived in London for 10 years and this remains my favourite spot. A must for any visitor. Great views across London and a beautiful bridge.
Wonderful view. Iconic London. They have now cleaned up tower Bridge even more. The lights are fantastic. Great place to visit on any occasion

Go at sunset for great photos. This was great value at only £8pp. We decided to go just before sunset so we were able to get some great photos both as the sky was awash with pink and after the tour ended great shots with all the lights. It was a very informative tour 'behind the scenes' of the engine room.

Tower Bridge Exhibition. You ever wanted to know about the buildings on the Tower Bridge? Then go to the Tower Bridge Exhibition! The entrance is right on the bridge. You go on an elevator inside the buildings on the bridge. You can also see the engine rooms and pictures of beautiful bridges around the world. Also, they give you a lot of information on the bridge through the years. It was one of the most interesting places we went to in the UK.
Excellent Value for money. Really good value at only £8, very informative and really friendly staff. The gift shop also had very competitive prices.

Tower bridge - iconic landmark. Highly recommend visiting the exhibition. The information provided in the tower and two walkways is sufficient to tell the tale of the bridge's construction without being overwhelming. The engine room was also interesting, particularly to my husband.Priced at £8 it was good value, especially as we took advantage of the train company's offer of 2for1!
Not bad. I've heard of the London bridge all my life in nursery rhymes so I finally got to the see infamous London Bridge. Thats about it.
Amazing and beautiful. We stayed over looking the Thames and enjoyed being around the Thames there was a lot to do and it was a short journey into the centre of London.
Good exhibition. A bit expensive, only good enough with London Pass.. Nice view, movie with explanation was clear. A bit expensive, good with London Pass. Good preservation.

Walk on the South Bank. We walked to tower Bridge on the South Bank from London bridge with views of the Shard and other 'glass' buildings all reflecting the clouds of a rather changeable sky included was Boris' office. You see the HMS Belfast and the Tower of London too. Then walk over Tower Bribe with great views of the glass buildings on the south bank

Simply Amazing and Beautiful. Tower Bridge....the main attraction of UK.....Its very beautiful around the bridge...tall buildings, River Thames and all...very pleasant....We went at tower bridge sometime around 5pm..for 2 hours we were taking only photographs with tower bridge.... awesome :)then we went over the bridge because the bridge was closing and we had to cross the bridge towards our hotel at around 7:30pm. There we came to know that the bridge will be closed for 30 mins and there would be boats crossing the bridge with some celebrations and noises of the boats....it was amazing.....worth an experience..don't miss this part specially....in the night the bridge looks simply amazing....a must visit N number of times...

Overlooking London - an overlooked gem!. Lived or worked in London for 30 years but never got round to doing the Tower Bridge walkway, exhibition and engine room - until prompted by reading about it in TimeOut's 1000 things to do in London. This was a great experience - not just for the views but the informative film and exhibition about the creation of the unique bridge - complemented with a fascinating history of other notable bridges from around the world - and the engine room. A great reminder of the vision and skill of Victorian engineers and architects. Superb value too - only £8 entry (and you can get a 20% off voucher on the web), or £9 with entry to the Monument as well. Seeing the bridge lift at close hand is wonderful too - so serene! The bridge lift timetable is on the Tower Bridge website. Enjoy!

Definitely the icon of London. The Tower Bridge, which is at time called as London Bridge (because of its fame) is a must visit attraction in London. Try to be there with lesser crowds. Pictures taken from side roads cover it fully. Must see both in Day-time and night when it gets lightened up.
Beautiful. As with everything else is London this was a beatiful landmark! With the london pass it was free and we go to tour the engine room. It was nice to know the back story

Awesome View - Interesting Info. We really enjoyed visiting the Tower Bridge Exhibition. We traveled there by train and tube from Reading with our son and two granddaughters. Although living in the UK for some time they had not gone to the exhibition before, so it was new to us all. It gave us the opportunity to take a lot of photos over the city of London. They provide for children as they had a little sticker book getting more stickers at different points through the exhibition, which kept them interested. A lot of information is provided, in a very interesting way, as to the concept and building of the bridge, including some plans that never made it off the drawing board - probably a good thing. It also includes visiting the engine room to see how the bridge goes up and down - particularly interesting to my husband and son. Would recommend it.

Need to visit to really experience Tower Bridge. Like most who visit London, I had seen Tower Bridge before. Even walked over it, and taken a boat under it.But this was the first time that I experienced it so closely and intimately.From the Ticket Office, you get wisked up to the top of Tower Bridge in an elevator ensconsed in the tower closest to the Tower of London, where you enter a large "auditorium" at the top of Tower Bridge. Here you pause to watch a very short, entertaining video clip depicting Queen Victoria discussing the need to construct Tower Bridge with the architect and engineer responsible.The you walk along glass-encased walkways from the one tower to the other, enjoying magnificent views of London, and some very informative boards, including a photographic exhibition on some of the great bridges of the world, some trivia about London Bridge, as well as alternative designs for thr bridge, which were considered before settling on the iconic lifting bridge that still stands today. You can spend as much time as you want here, before you visit a second auditorium in the tower closest to the "Armadillo" on the South Bank.In the second auditorium, a short video presentation on the construction of Tower Bridge allows youto marvel att he inginuity of those in charge of this project while looking at the sheer majesty of the steel frame, stairs, etc. which is hidden from the outside world behind the stone finishing.You leave the bridge itself by elevator in the South tower and then make your way to the engine room where the large hydraulic engines which lift the bridge are housed. Another magnificent testimony to the ingenuity of the engineers and designers of the time!This is most definitely worth a visit!

My husband loved it, and so did I. We were lucky enough to be there when a big boat came through.... and it was amazing! The tour is totally worth it too. You get to go the whole way up, where the have an exhibit of a bunch of other boats, and you can take some fabulous photo's too
Awesome. We didn't take the elevator to the top, although it may have been worthwhile. The place is still amazing to see. Take some pictures from the river near Tower of London.

Tower Bridge, London.. I visited Tower Bridge along with my family and enjoyed a lot. The history of Tower bridge is that it took years of discussion and after an open public design competition, it took 8 years of construction to make Tower Bridge a reality. Over 50 designs were submitted and the design of Sir Horace Jones, the City Architect was approved. Construction started in 1986 and the bridge was officially opened on 30th June 1894 by the Prince of Wales and his wife. It is a combined bascule and suspension bridge in London, England, over the River Thames. It is close to the Tower of London, from whitch it took its name. It has become an iconic symble of London. The total cost of construction was £1,184,000 which comes to (£100 million as of 2012).
Fascinating. Terrific way to fill in an hour or so. A bit of history, fantastic views from the corridors between the towers and an interesting trip to the engine room to finish.

Inside and out. Tower Bridge is just about as well known an icon as you can get, it’s instantly recognizable, even in silhouette. But did you know that there is as much to see inside the bridge as there is from outside?If you’re interested in heavy engineering, a visit to the bridge is a treat waiting for you. Get right up to huge machinery, watch videos on the history of the bridge, how it was built, both towers have something worth viewing. Then go up one of the towers and do some sightseeing of London, from within an enclosed area. After that, take in the intricate work that was done on the outside of the bridge. All in all, it’s an impressive work of engineering.

Old is Gold!. So beautiful, about 200 years old and this bridge is yet so damn beautiful. Its clean and well maintained and also visitors can walk on it for pictures etc. I dont know why the London bridge is given more importance than this magnificent monument. Even when you walk away and look at this bridge it looks awesome. A must see in London!

Unforgettable Experience. Tower bridge itself is an iconic and historical structure, which defines the antique and marvelous history of England. Its a place where you get actual feel of London, by walking on the Bridge or by sitting at the nearby areas in front of Tower Bridge. Its a sign and symbol of England's pioneer architectural technology. When you are on the Bridge, just stand and face the River Thames, you'll get a Feel, you wont forget.Nearby there is Tower Museum, where Famous and Pioneer Diamond of India "The Kohinoor" is kept inside, makes it a must to visit place.

Amazing, beautiful with incredible views of the city. It was incredible to see the beauty of this bridge and its such a historic landmark of the city. I took many photos of the bridge and the surrounding sites. It really was better than I imaged it would be. If you visit London it should be required that you walk across it at least once!!

Interesting icon!. Film shows on how they built this bridge were very interesting. Views from the upper walk ways were amazing. Then you have to walk over the bridge to see the pump rooms etc on how the used to lift the bridge (men folk extremely interested in this part)!Had 2 4 1 on rail card, excellent value for money!

Tower Hill Memorial. Went to visit this memorial in August . We wanted to pay our respect to a grandfather Loui Stephen Farla lost at sea whilst serving on the ship Hatimura.It was right next to the Tower of London.
Iconic .... While we didn't get to see the London Tower nearby, seeing the Tower Bridge was great. It is one of the iconic places to see when visiting London.

Superb Value, this one. This attraction is £8.00 pp. With your rail ticket it is two for one which is exceptional value.Two hours is ample, it's not an all day job.You walk at a high level between the two towers and get amazing views over London.You can then go down into the workings of this great bridge.The icing on the cake would be to be there when the bascule bridge opens to let a ship through.

One out of three absolutely musts in London. The Tower Bridge is one out of three absolutely musts in London (beside the Tower of London and the St. Paul's Cathedral). The view is very nice. Unfortunately, the windows somehow a handicap for the view. But you can walk on the top from one tower to the other and seeing ships passing. There is also a short interesting movie about how the bridge was constructed. But most impressive is the engines room.
Colossal. I was there and I heard that it opens now just 2-3 times a week. Lucky me that I was about to cross it when they opened it. I recorded the event and a very solid construction. Very nice!
Fabulous view. Excellent tour of Tower Bridge, interesting exhibition and fantastic view from the top of the bridge. The engine room was a real treat.
SpiceG. It's just so beautiful! I dreamed about it since I was a little kid with Spice Girls and all. Oh, it's just pert, I'm telling you. Go there!

Great to see. We did the tour bridge experience tour which I found to be very so so and almost boring. For a man or n engineer it would be far more interesting. It is a sight hat I would say you must see while in London but going inside is not one I would recommend The view is quite spectacular so it could be worth it or that

Tower Bridge. London Bridge as I've always known it to be called was from a far and close quite impressive even on a not so sunny day. Fortunately the day cleared to see it with a back drop of blue skies. It's most definitely a stop for any tourist in London.

Special place. This bridge is extremely special to my husband and myself...he proposed on it back in 1968. It is very popular and when we walked over it l latish on a Friday evening there were many, many people doing the same

Truly awesome. I guess it's difficult to say that much about a bridge, but this really must be up there with the most beautiful ones in the world. A real London icon, the scale and design of Tower Bridge never fails to impress me whenever I see it. The true definition of "awesome".I wouldn't recommend doing the museum/tour. It's not the most interesting (unless bridge history is your thing), plus you should really view this bridge from afar, not from the inside.

Bucket List. How I forgot that the Tower Bridge is close to the Tower of London, I do not know. So it was a very pleasant surprise to see the Tower Bridge on my visit to the Tower of London. Both places were on my bucket list, and are now ticked off. Not only did I get to see the Tower Bridge, I got to see it open to allow some vessels pass beneath on the Thames.

Iconic view to and from Tower Bridge. We had a beautiful clear day to view from Tower Bridge. Tour up lift and quick video detailing history was good. The business of giving kids maps to hunt down items I am not sure is so good. Competition rifes, and instead of enjoying the spectacle of TB, they are running around trying to find stickers. That said, it was excellent and unusual place to view London skyline.

nothing major. we walked back and forth on the bridge. there is a little museum you can visit but we heard that theres nothing major to see there so we decided to skip it and try something else instead

I like it so much. Stand on london bridge and take photo with tower bridge. I love the view of it. Damn pretty and beautiful. Really a good attraction for london trip. If got chance, I ll go there again.
A night time wonder. Even though it is beautiful anytime I reccomend getting a boat tour or ferry and going at night. Wow. Its so hard to review something so simple yet so must need to see!

Excellent value in an expensive city. While the view from The Shard may be good, not everyone can afford the £30 per person to see it. So, for great value I recommend the Tower Bridge and Monument combined ticket (£9 adult). For this you not only get access to Tower Bridge with it's great views and informative exhibitions but you also get the experience of climbing the 300+ step spiral staircase in The Monument - and after you've been over the walkways don't forget to visit the Engine Room to see the power behind the bridge and how it all works.

Not too exciting. Nice views from the top. Hot on the walkways. Not very personable employees. Silly movie at the very beginning with the architects and queen Victoria. The engine room was the best part.
great history great views. I absolutely everything London had to offer... the bridge was extremely nice in the night when everything was all lit up...
did the tour, no regrets. I did the tour, and I have no regrets. very beautiful during the day, even more during the night. If you go to the London Tower, also check this out.
A must do when in London. Do try the Tower Bridge tour by day or night. The views are absolutely amazing and well worth the entrance fee. Very informative staff and a great experience overall

Good exhibition. The exhibition was interesting, informative, but nothing too exciting. Children were most interested in the old engine rooms. If you have extra time on your trip, after you've seen all the 'must see' stuff, or in between two 'must see' attractions, then go. Nice views of the river too.

Nice views from the top.. We walked into the very crowded and disorganized lobby, through security only to be sent back because the woman scanning the London Passes had not engaged us as we walked by her. To us, she just seemed to be standing around. Once past security again, there was no organization for the lift. So I took them up on the offer to use the stairs. After walking the 300 stairs to the top, I listened to a very dry presentation on the engineering of the bridge. The views from the walkway were beautiful and worth the confusion.

Fantastic views. My kids aged 11 and 9 enjoyed being able to climb to the upper level of the bridge and look down on everyone walking underneath. Not something you could spend all day doing, we took about 30-45 minutes. Kids get to collect free stickers for a free fun passport along the way.
Well Worth a Visit. Breath taking views and very informative exhibitions. Fascinating to see the machinery and engineering of the Bridge, a good visit.
A must!. As an iconic landmark in London, you must see it. We grabbed an ice cream and took a nice stroll across the bridge and back.

Neat Views!. Visisted the Tower Bridge while in London for our Honeymoon. It was included as part of the three day London Pass we purchased (Would buy a London Pass again!). The desk people are very friendly and explain the exhibit to you. You wait in line, they pack you in an elevator & take you to one end of the bridge. There you watch a short film or you can choose to skip the film (That is what we did) and continue onto the bridge. You can walk back and fourth freely across the closed in/glass portion of the bridge. There are different labelled signs, exhibits, etc which explain the history of the bridge, etc. There are also pointers to show historical places you can see from the bridge. It is great for taking pictures of the London Skyline. When you decide to leave you come down by either elevator or stairs on the other side of the bridge and exit. Was a neat experience & something we can say we did while we were in London.
Interesting. You get to see inside the bridge, with great views of London from the top walkways, and interesting facts about its history. Great value to, pay for two adults and one child is free.
Good attraction, very good value.. Spectacular views of London up and down river and really detailed, interactive attraction, worth the money, and spectacular value if you use a 2 for 1 voucher.

Great Views from the top!. I never realized you can walk the top of the bridge, but on this visit back home to the UK, we went to London and did all the sights. We ended up doing this too, much to our surprise, as we only found out about it as we walked by it - we went to the top of the tower and walked over the bridge to the other side and back again, fantastic views - then we went and looked at the original workings of the bridge - had a great time

Towering Trip. The whole operation is very smooth, whether you arrive at the south side or at the north pier. This is an engrossing exhibition using film, photos and well labelled artefacts and interactive exhibits. The views of the Thames, walking across and looking down at the Thames where the two bascule pieces meet, Try to explain the science of a bridge that rises in 60 seconds and needs a steam engine to produce hydraulic pressure to lower not raise the bridge. This is a triumph of Victorian architecture of which Sir John Soane would have been proud had he lived to see it. A wonderful solution to a difficult problem.
Great value for money. Good exhibition, very informative and great views of the city from the bridge walkways, excellent value for money and a good activity for children to do. Lovely gift shop.

Beautiful bridge, boring exhibition. The bridge itself is beautiful, I loved hanging out around there, especially on a sunny day, best place to take pictures too!! Now I'm not a big achitecture fan or bridge fan I don't know... but I did the exhibition and really didn't find it worth it. It talks about all the different bridges in the world and how the bridge was built etc... I don't know, to me it wasn't worth it. The views from the top are not that impressive as the windows are small and blurry.Unless you are a huge bridge/engineering/fan or have a lot of time and money to waste, it's not worth the visit.. !

Fantastic View. The view from the London Bridge was beautiful and I will certainly recommend that you visit! It afforded you a nice view of the River Thames and the history of the bridge from the commentator on the River Thames Cruise was very interesting!

On Top of the World. If anyone would've told me, when I was a small boy, that one day, I would stand aloft the World's most famous landmark, I'd have scoffed. But, I had to eat my words when, at 2:00pm on the afternoon of Friday 9 August 2013, I did set a pioneering foot inside this towering tribute to mans engineering ingenuity over the problems of the River Thames. Both fascinating, enthralling, exciting and educational was this magnificent attraction found to be. Amazed at each twist and turn to learn of a new fact or a startling superlative associated with this legendary and functional structure. I beg all tourists and residents of London Town to visit this remarkable and mind expanding place. I was stunned, for example, to learn that this Victorian curio still, to this day, continues to operate as a serviceable bridge, 24 hours a day, continuing to allow Londoners safe passage from one side of the river to t'other. Whether they be on bus, in car, on tractor, on go-kart, by foot or by wheelchair. Amazing and astounding both in equal measure. Towering over the mighty River Thames, flowing steadily from one side of the bridge to t'other. Who knows which came first, the river or the bridge ? One of life's eternal mysteries, but, there again, who cares ? This still makes for a glorious and worthwhile exhibition, that I would urge visitors both near and far to pay attention to. Keep up the fantastic work, gang !!!!

best thing to see. there are lots of things to see and do in London but among them tower bridge is best thing that one can experience went there few weeks ago really loved the view and enjoyed my time next holiday this will be my first place to go worth a trip.

Tower Bridge London. After many trips made to London this was the first time we visited Tower Bridge. Amazing view, interesting photo gallery and fantastic machines. It was really a worth while visit, shall come again.
victorian genius. reasonably priced and very well presented well worth a stop for an insight into an amazing structure and history.

Excellent victorian engineering. The tour comprises all parts of the building. Especially the machine rooms with the major machines in perfect condition and slowly revolving are unique and not to be missed. The videos were ok/average, no less, the rest excellent. The exhibitions in the walkway were also very good and covered all aspects of the building. A must have seen.

A real London icon. We were planning a visit to the tower bridge exhibition between touring the Tower of London & our evening booking at the view from the shard, basically because we had to cross the bridge to get to where we wanted to go so why not do the tour as well ?But it was much more than just a diversion or a way to fill some time.We used 2 for 1 vouchers to gain entry so saved a few quid as well which is always a bonus.Before we entered we were lucky enough to see the bridge opening twice, once from the riverboat on the way to tower pier & again as we were headed to the exhibition itself, which was a real treat as we were right at the front of the barriers and had a ringside seat to see how effortlessly & quickly the bridge opens.You can tour here at your own choice of pace and its all interesting from the short video presentations to the walkways to the engine rooms at the end of the tour.Some people say the views aren't good from the walkways and you don't get a totally clear view from them but you can see all the sights and I'd say its worth visiting the exhibition, it's reasonably priced and doesn't take too much time from your day.We enjoyed our time here viewing a real London icon !

Not London Bridge. Often mistaken for London Bridge, it is Tower Bridge that symbolises London. Built in 1894, this is a combined bascule and suspension bridge.Tower Bridge consists of two towers tied together at the upper level by means of two horizontal walkways, designed to withstand the horizontal forces exerted by the suspended sections of the bridge on the landward sides of the towers.The Bridge looks at its best from a distance but it gives visitors a special tingle just to drive through it.

Wonderful views. Enjoyed the views up and down the Thames once we had arrived at the top of the bridge. The tour was informative and well worth the entrance fee of £8 per person. The downside was the time waiting to go up in the lift to get you to the tour start location.
Poor. Better views from the bridge itself for free. Not worth the money imo. Not at all interesting. The bridge itself is lovely though. Definitely walk across it.

A long walk but a must. It was a long walk from the part of London we were stopping but as one of London's iconic land marks a must. We have walked the Golden gate bridge so had to walk London's most famous.

One of London's finest sights. This is our favourite location in London. Although we live in London, this place is very special since we were married there in the North Tower.It's not just a tourist location, it's also a venue and a beautiful one at that. They do tours of the bridge itself and engine rooms. Well worth the visit and very interesting. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. Whether it is for a wedding or simply a visit, don't pass this wonderful place by.

A sneakpeak in one of the world's greatest constructions.. I didn't knew to much about the tower bridge, it was actually my husbands desire to go there. But once we entered the bridge, it's construction amazed me. Once inside, doing the tower bridge exhibition i saw so much about the bridge that really made an impression on me. I esspecially liked the short films about building the tower bridge, such an amazing piece of technology at that time. And the view from the gallery is very nice as well, of course.The pieces of art hanging in the gallery give you the oppertunaty to see the bridge from different perspectives, very well done.Afterwards i was really gratefull that my husband took me there.

Nice tour at your own pace. Really enjoyed this tour. I like the ones that you can do at your own pace. There were some short, but informative video clips that discussed the building of the bridge. Got some great photos from the upper walkways of the cityscape. A really beautiful and classic bridge that you see in all the shots that show London. Glad I can say "I was there!!".

Interesting. This takes you over an internationally recognised landmark. I must admit I had not realised how the mechanism worked to raise the bridge. There are good views up and down the river and of the Tower of London from the walkways in between the towers.

Must-see. Either take the tube to Tower Hill or even better, the boat from Embankment to Tower Pier. Lovely plaza to see the London Tower from before descending to the bank to take photos of the Tower Bridge from an excellent vantage point.

World famous. We had a tour finish near here so we had to go see this beautiful, famous bridge. This Victorian gothic style has to be one of the worlds most famous, so it's worth to have a look. Photo's from the top and below from St Katherine's wharf look great.

Stunning bridge, great at night.... There is something that draws me to Tower Bridge every time I visit London. It's beautiful bold gothic structure standing over the Themes is truly breathtaking. I particularly like to by around Tower Bridge area when it's lit up at night!! Well worth a look!!

Famous landmark, great views. Short walk from Tower of London, we visited the bridge as part of the London pass.It's worth it to take the stairs or the lift to the top of the bridge. Learn the history of the bridge and have great views of London from both sides of the bridge.Overall, it was a nice walk on the historic landmark.Unfortunately, we didn't see the bridge going up.

Good Value London Attraction. Looking for something to do with an overseas visitor in London and not wanting to spend all day in one place or £20++ we decided to try the Tower Bridge exhibition. It costs £8 for an adult, which is good value by London standards. You can take the lift or - as we did - walk up the stairs (there are quite a lot of them) to the exhibition, then across the walkways, which have great views up and down the Thames and various photographs and displays with historical facts. This is followed by a visit to the engine room. Overall, good value and interesting.

Best views of London. A hidden gem in Londons tourist trade is the Tower bridge exhibition and it didn't cost a fortune-especially if you are able to use the 2-1 offer from TFL. To start you travel, by lift up the north tower, where you can watch a short film about the bridge, My 11 year old son loved that as well as the main screen, what at first look like paintings was actually screens as well, so they interacted with the character in the main film. You then walk along the East walkway and enjoy the amazin views! Their was also an exhibition of bridges around the world here. In the west tower, as well as the amzing views there was an art exhibition.You then descend the south tower, down the grand staircases, and make your way back along the bridge (follow the blue line on the ground) to the engine rooms and gift shop.The whole tour took about 90 minutes and the time flew by.In the words of my 11yo-it was amazing, can we go again?
