get the secret out. This is certainly a well kept secret, I had never heard of the exhibition at the Tower of London until now and its certainly well worth a visit. The exhibition covered a wide range of topics in a very small space, very informative and interesting.

An overlooked tourist attraction. Many people simply take a photo and leave. Why not just do the experience well worth the cost and a novel trip. Walk over the sky walkway for a different view of London. Dads will fibd the engineering stuff interesting.

Wortht the visit. We saw the exhibition at Tower Bridge and really enjoyed it, although we did go through it very quickly. I'm not sure if I would have been disappointed if I had paid - it is included on the London Pass and we stopped for a quick visit on our way to the Tower of London. It is a nice history of the bridge. They give the kids stickers to collect along the way which helped to keep them entertained.
Disappointed. Bad views from top, nothing really worth investigation. Would not pay to see it. Use london pass if necessary.

A must see even if you are just 1 day in London. Really spectacular, I could not stop looking at it. Also if you are lucky and get to watch the bridge go up, it is pretty amazing as well. Did not paid to go to the top so I can not comment on that but walking by it was worth it.

Beautiful bridge, nice exhibition. Don't just cross the bridge, but buy a ticket and go up and take the special walkway. There is an exhibition in both walkways on the top, which is nice to do. You will also be able to see the engine room, which is well maintained and interesting.Nice view from the walkways to both sides.

What A Bridge.. What a landmark, spanning on London for centuries. Great to see, full of history and character . My wife and I bought our tickets online. Views are great from the top. Lots of tourists about, but this adds to the character of the landmark.

beautiful landmark. This is a beautiful thing to see from river and land. You should always make sure to look online to see when it will be raised as it rarely happens and is great for a few photos. The exhibition itself is a bit pricey but is good if you like to learn the history and to see the views.

There is Nothing Redeeming About this Attraction. What a disappointment. Bought tickets on-line, only to have to still had to line-up to exchange the print-out for tickets, movies about the bridge were as hokey as they come, enclosed walkways offered limited views and the views you could see were boring at best, exhibitions in walkways were amateurish and you had no opportunity to walk up or down the towers. This was the worst experience of everything we did in London. Walk across the bridge and take pictures of it, but do not waste your time and money by going inside, climb St. Paul's Dome instead.

Best Bridge in London. There are many bridges that cross the Thames, but this is by far the best. It looks classic in the sunlight, and is beautifully illuminated by night. It is also quite easy to get on the bridge and the majority of the people on the bridge are tourists. Getting a nice photo is on the bridge is hard so either get a river cruise or go to another bridge to get a nice photo with the Tower Bridge. Must see for anyone who hasn`t seen it yet!

Brilliant landmark and good value. I took my six year old daughter as she is doing London for a topic and wanted to show her a famous landmark. The exhibition was made more interesting for her as she was issued with a passport and collected four sets of stickers. The views are great and it was interesting to see how the bridge came into being. There are a few interractive exhibits in the engine room. We had problems with the coin press (and don't think that we were the only ones!) However, I mentioned that to one of the staff who messaged over to the gift shop. When we got there we were able to collect one there. It lasts about an hour and you can get in at 2 for 1 if you pick up a leaflet at Rail stations or go online.

Great value and cracking views. One of the cheapest things to do in London that charges a fee. We booked online and got straight in. For the sake of enjoying everything it had to offer we took the 208 stairs up to the top where a short film played. We then walked the 2 concourses at the top and saw another video at the other side where a knowledgeable member of staff also gave us some interesting facts about the bridge. There isn't much to see or do in truth but the views are amazing and the history of the bridge interesting so we still felt it was very good value. You could take as long as you wanted to explore and our ticket also included the bridge engine room. This was interesting but would not be worth visiting on its own. All in all a good hour or so and for not too much expense.
Informative :). Lots of information on why it was built and the history of the bridge. Good old steam engine room below and views above.

Great view, cheap to enter. Nice views from the top towers of tower bridge and at £8 adult its worth doing this as opposed to the London Eye. The exhibition at the top is alright - lots to read about different bridges and the construction of tower bridge but not particularly exciting.

Mythical. One of the most mythical bridges in the world. Great views from the bridge to tower of London.
If you're coming to London and not visit this bridge you should stay at home...
Interesting. A really interesting visits with great views up and down the Thames.if you have an engineers brain you will enjoy the engine room,

Good view, good value, and good exhibition. The exhibition was great!
The price was not much expensive, compare to the other place in London.
The view was very good indeed.

Great day out!. We loved the historic tower bridge steeped in history. The setting is fantastic and just a stones throw away from the Tower Of London. The riverside bars are lively and there is a great mix of places to eat and drink. If you walk along the South Bank past London bridge and keep going towards the Millennium bridge there are more great bars and places to eat and we ended our walk with a visit to the Tate Modern. Excellent day out!

One of my favourite place in London. All year around looking at the bridge is a breathtaking experience, You just can't get enough. Once to go in a enough, nice history review and view over the city:) Once You see the beauty, You will visit it every time You go to London

London Icon. Interesting to go up into the bridge and get a panoramic view from this iconic London attraction. The exhibition involved reading facts about the Tower Bridge and the engine room. While some facts were quick and easy to read with children, I preferred the short video clip at the beginning which seemed to sustain my children's attention. We took a family picture with a Tower Bridge background for an additional cost. I did buy this nice keepsake. But most of all, we enjoyed watching the bridge go up and down for boats and barges. And this is free and easy to watch from many vantage points in the area. Just check online for times. Overall, it's nice to visit the inside of the Tower Bridge once and check it off your bucket list!
London's best bridge. Most people confuse tower bridge as the London bridge. But the tower bridge is a must see. Just a great piece of London history.

great views and affordable. pair with a ticket to the monument for a great value and visit both of them.nice views of the city.interesting exhibits about the bridge and the history of bridges in London.crowded elevator to get up, but once up there its not bad, with space to move around.very pretty and amazing that it is so old and still in use

Tower Bridge, London.. Tower bridge is a great part of British history. My house guests always request a visit to see the suspension bridge in person and take photo's.I live a small train journey away.Tower bridge is close to the Tower of London, from which it takes its name. Easy to get to on the underground or ferry boat.Tower bridge opened on June 30.1898. Family guests and I walked right over the bridge, stopping to look at the views. (no charge).

Tower Bridge Experience - cheap, worth it, good on a rainy day.. It's £8 - less than your beer at the restaurant near by :) Walk up the stairs and watch the short video about the bridge history - clean restrooms inside - friendly staff. Walk over the top and snap a few photos of the skyline, the exhibit is just about all types bridge design and a brief history of London - DON'T MISS THE ENGINE ROOMS- it's after the tour - you actually exit so hang onto your stub to re-enter on the other side - just amazing example of stunning Victorian engineering. Took less than an hour and it stopped raining by the time we were done. You can do the outside for free but this little tour is worth it :)

Architectural Genius. It really is remarkable that this was built in the late 19th century. It's as beautiful in person as it is in movies. You can take a lift for incredible views in the top tower, but it was too pricey so we declined. You can still take in exceptional views of the city for free on the main level!

Beautiful!. During our hop-on-hop-of bus tour we drove over the Tower bridge, it is beautiful! For some reason I didn't think the paintwork to be that blue! The bridge gives a great view on the Thames and riverbank.

Shut your eyes!!!. Tower Bridge is my favorite building in London. As a child I lived a stones throw away in Tooley Street. Where the London Assembly Building is, that used to be Simon's Wharf where my dad was a docker. As a kid I crossed this bridge many times to play on the bomb ruins that is now the city.There are great views from this bridge, especially of the Tower and Traitors Gate. I even played on the little beach under the Tower and swam in the Thames. As children we would always go to the centre of the bridge and stand on the Join or crack as we called it. If you stand on the join with both feet on 2 parts of the bridge and close your eyes you will feel the bridge move as traffic passes over the join. It is a very strange feeling, you may see other people doing it.The bridge is a classic example of Victorian engineering made of Cast Iron and clad in stone. It was originally worked by water pressure from a pumping station about a mile away in the East End. I have great memories of being on the set and meeting John Wayne on the bridge when he was filming "Brannigan". A fantastic bridge in a great city.
Impressive. Good value for money. Excellent for children and adults alike. Staff friendly and helpful. Well worth a visit.

not very exciting. We walked over Tower Bridge, what more can I say. The views were stunning but apart from that it's not very exciting. I am sure other tourists would love it but it just wasnt for me

A London symbol. It's a true symbol of London. The tower bridge hosts two exhibitions (pictures of world's most famous bridges and London pictures). It's quite amazing to learn about the conception and construction of the building. The visit ends wih the machine room. Very impressive. You can have the a nice walk by the Thames.
great views. do this after tower of london. it's nearby but be sure to approach on the proper side of the bridge or you'll be doing some extra walking. great views of the thames.

Broken Bridge. Found the experience very disappointing. Entered by one tower and went by lift to upper level. Short film was interesting. Walked across to other tower in a enclosed corridor which gave limited photo opportunity.

From Shard to Tower Bridge. Loved the whole experience as did my grandson aged 16. We walked over the walkway on top of the bridge and the views were spectaculare. We then went down to the see the workings of the bridge. Admission price is most reasonable.

Special bridge, ordinary visit. For free you can walk onto the bridge and admire it. If you are lucky, the bascules will raise to let a boat pass on the Thames. That is a free 5-minutes show. (only happens 2-3 times a day) . The official visit, with a fee, is not expensive, but not extraordinary. You get info about the building of the bridge, its history, also an exhibition about the world's most famous bridges. The main thing is that you get the opportunity to walk in the upper part of the bridge. Thew kids did not show much interest in the exhibitions.

Worth the price. Took a self guided tour inside Tower Bridge.Price ,at writing,was £8 for an adult but as it's on southwestrains 2 for 1 offers it costs a mere £4 each.What can keep you busy in London for well over an hour (longer if you read all the information boards!!) and offer superb views (not as good as The Shard but that is £25 notes!) from the walkways ....you walk along both. You take a lift to the walkways so there's no excuse for people with a fear of exercise :-)

up high. really good insight into how the bridge was first commissioned was good to see the view of London from up in the gallery and see how other bridges compare in size on the wall of bridges was really good to see the engine room as well and to see how life was back in the days

Iconic photos. I lacked the time for a tour but instead took some great photos of this wonderful landmark in all its glory.It truly is a majestic structure and should be on every tourist's must visit list.

Worth a visit. When we visited the Tower Bridge the guided tours had finished for the day. So we just walked across with the rest of the foot traffic (local's) and still managed to take some great pics up and down the Themes. I would recommend doing a walk across the bridge even without getting the tour. There are info panels all along the tower explaining the important points.

Great experience. I've been to London m,any times but never around Tower Bridge.It was great, excellent views, good historic background and knowledgeable staff. The only downside was the incredibly rude and surly man on the desk going into the engine rooms - he managed in the space of 2 minutes to be rude to the people before us, my party and some people who simply stepped in from the street to ask a question - quite a feat!

Terrific tower. This tower will provide a terrific view of the Thames river. The best pictures you will get are of city hall (the armadillo) and the London Tower. I would go to the London Monument if you wanted pictures of St. Paul's. Of course it is all suicide proof, so the images you get from here will most likely be really glossy from the plastic windows. The engine rooms below the bridge are a pretty cool feature and definitely worth a visit.

Iconic Landmark of London. A tour of London would not be complete without a visit to London’s Tower Bridge. This bridge should not be confused with London Bridge, which is the next bridge over from Tower Bridge. As my wife and I strolled along the banks of the modernly developed Southwark area, we were taken back by the sights and sounds of London. As we walked along the path, we were amazed at how London kept its historically majestic feel while at the same time embraced modern development. We counted a number of construction cranes looming over the city, which is a sure sign of growth and development. Coming upon the Tower Bridge was an awe – inspiring experience, especially since we arrived there just as the sun was setting and the nightlights of London were illuminating the picturesque city. A stroll along the Southwark bank of the River Thames, crossing the Tower Bridge around sunset should be on everyone’s London itinerary.

Great view of london . Climbed to the top up 300 stairs but there was a lift . staff well helpful friendly and very knowledgeable. The views are incredible . the tour comprises of history of the bridge a walk across the two walkways and a look at the mechanism . really interesting . and we thought a more enjoyable cheaper way of accessing views of London compared to the London eye.
Tower Bridge. Beautiful bridge, leading to the Tower of London. Magnificent view over City of London, London, United Kingdom.

Iconic London. This is the picture everyone has in mind of London Bridge, but it isn't. It may be in everyone's mind, but the Tower Bridge right at the Tower of London is an interesting site. It was mid day when we toured and there were plenty of people. Lots of photographic opps. You should visit it if you are in London.

Brilliant. Love the Tower Bridge. One of the best place in London. You have everything : water, rocks, cars, smiling people, tilde wave of chinese taking pictures of everything (even you) and it's great.

Great views. I liked learning a bit about the history of the bridge but I mostly just loved being inside those walkways I've always wondered about! Get some lovely views of the river so good on a clear day. I would recommend because it's a good experience. We got a cheaper ticket as we bought it with the Monument entry so thought it was good value.

Boring. We hoped to get a good view of the city from the bridge but the view was impeded by the bridge itself.The computer demonstration of how the bridge was built was interesting and the staff have done their best, but we were pretty bored really.

not worth it. We thought the price was extravagantly high, and every part was crowded with a long line. Not worth it. The tower is iconic, so of course look at it and take pics from the outside but the inside and the crown jewels is not much for the money. The ticket people are nice though and tower bridge is nearby.

Tower Bridge--Brilliant!. Although not on the must see sights in London, it should be. We stayed very close to the Tower Bridge, and I was in awe every morning when we walked past it on our way to the city. Great views when walking over the bridge that leads to charming shops and pubs below. Cheers!
Looks great in pictures; but better to experience it.. The architecture, the size, the majesty and the wonder of this magnificent building is worth experiencing.

A great view. We booked tickets for this on line and hence they were discounted , and we were not sure what to expect as we were not really into engineering feats. However the story of the design and build were well told via film and graphics, so we picked up more information than we expected. The highlight of course were the views from the viewing gallery running both sides of the bridge span high over the Thames. The only niggle was the fact we were ( very) crammed into a lift for both start and end of the experience, not sure why as stairs were there, crowd management I guess

We Saved The Best Till Last. After doing our epic tourist trek over the last 2 days we decided to give our Oyster cards one last bash after a quick bus ride to hammo we got the underground to Tower hill .To have a Skeg at the one and only top London landmark "Tower bridge" I've seen it many times but every time you see it it has that jaws dropping moment .For me the 3 top London landmarks are Buckingham palace , Big Ben & Tower bridge .I photographed the bridge from every angle and I was lucky to see the bridge being raised all in all I photographed the bridge to an inch of its life.We ended up getting a few cheeky cold beers from M&S and sat down with the crowds to take in the lovely evening weather and to people watch.Plenty of multi national tourist all living the dream and taking in all London can offer ......our daughter lives in London and its been great to go sightseeing together .Next time we pop over we are going to go for a fast rib boat ride on the Thames ......but until them we are going to re- live our sightseeing memories over the last 2 days .Tower bridge being my favourite .

Tower Bridge. Great day trip, take your camera and good batteries because you will take lots of photos.
Great views from both sides, view of the London Tower, London Bridge, Belfast-War ship,
City Hall etc. Lots of places to buy water, juice, ice cream etc.
Great views and great for kids. The price was great for us. Quick to get up and it has some great views. Do after Tower of London since it is right next to it
Nice Tour. The interactive tour made this very interesting. Great videos at various parts of the tour helps to make this less like a traditional museum and more of a multimedia experience.

Beautiful at night!. We went to see this at night time and it was worth it! Bridge looked very beautiful with colored lights against the dark sky. Wide walkway so it was nice to walk over the bridge. I would definitely recommend visiting this by night.
Give it a shot. Everyone has to visit atleast once if you are in London to the Tower Bridge and the River Thames... You will be really lucky if the draw-bridge goes up... A must see stop in London
Great piece of history. Well worth a visit with very interesting presentation on the history of the Bridge. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable and the views from the bridge are amazing!

Nice to walk over, close to other attractions. Worth a stop if in the area. Exciting to see after all the pictures ive seen. There is also a nice wide walkway, so you dont feel endangered at all by the traffic zooming by. Also an exhibition on the bridge, which I chose to skip.

One of the landmarks you just have to walk over. By far the most beautiful bridges over Thames. It is one of the iconic landmarks you have to see and without which the trip to London is not complete. Access is straight forward and a short walk from both Tower Bridge / Tower Gateway and the London Bridge tube stops.If you would like to see the bridge opening and closing to let boats through then the times are listed on the following linkhttp://www.towerbridge.org.uk/TBE/EN/BridgeLiftTimes/ Tower Bridge also provides a museum right on top of it for those curious about history.Go if you can on a sunny day when it is at its best but I guess thats true for most outdoor places in London
Best Photo Opportunity in London. Everyone has to get a shot of the Tower Bridge and the River Thames... and a real treat if the draw-bridge goes up...A must see stop in London.
Amazing place to see. You must see this place in evening when it is about to get dark. The illumination and surrounding gets lively and looks very very pretty. It's fun to be there.

Just spectacular. This is one of the iconic bridges in London on the Thames River. We were walking along the shores of the Thames one day and we were lucky enough to actually see the bridge open up to let a ship througH. We got talking with a guy from London and he said he had lived in London all his life and that was the first time he had ever seen it open. What a sight

Nice view (inside & outside). To watch this bridge from the Thames river banks is a beautiful view, but you can go into the bridge to hear about its history and see a lot of photos of its construction. From the top of the bridge you will have a wonderful view of the city (a different one of that you can see from the London eye). At the end of the trip you will see the the equipments used to lift the bridge (a very interesting in engineering point of view). When you leave the trip go for a walk along the Thames banks where is a very amazing place with many bar and restaurants.
An icon, must-see. You must see the Tower Bridge while in London, its an icon and just beautiful. The architecture is amazing, try going at sunset I got some amazing pics!

Makes London into London. Like Big Ben the tower bridge makes London into the beautiful city it is. You can get great views of the river Thames and of the city of London. I did not go to the museum part of the bridge as I was only walking across the bridge. I would recommend walking across London bridge at night to get a great view of tower bridge lit up at night.

Get what you pay for!. Went here yesterday and it was quite disappointing. Take a lift up to two closed walkways across the river. A film gives info about the history of the bridge, and along the walkway there are lots of pictures with more information - lots of dry reading; not great for kids or non-native English speakers. Nice views - not as spectacular as I thought they would be - along the river. Lift or stairs back down again then follow a blue line out along the bridge to the engine room which is more dry reading. There was nobody to ask questions from. It would have been great if there were people hovering around able to answer the millions of kid type questions my 12 year old had which the dry reading didn't answer. It was cheap to get in (UKP 8/3.40 adult/child about) but not really worth it.

Great views from the bridge. Did this as part of London pass and glad we did. It only took less than an hour, but you get to see London from another viewpoint. You take an elevator to the top and can watch a quick video about building the bridge or go on to the walkway. The walkway is a long path with glass windows, so you are never outside. You get some great views for the top of the bridge. Then you take stairs (many stairs) down to the engine room. This was informative and interesting to see. After that you are done. Honestly, it was 90% better than I thought. This is near the London Tower and can be done after you visit the tower. That is what we did. Well worth the hour we spent.
Famous for photographs so had to see. Beautiful icon of the world. Excellent photographs early morning in the right conditions and weather. Be patient!

A surprisingly enjoyable walk. The walk over the top of the Tower Bridge was one of our highlights in London. It is such an unusual attraction that it is well worth doing. There is no particular view from the top gantry, but the displays and the engine house at the end are very interesting.

Watch the videos. I was on very limited time in London, so I didn't really go through the exhibit as intended. I did what I call the whirlwind tour and went through as quickly as I could without knocking down the people around me. It was very interstitial, but I'm sure I would have gotten much more out of it if I had gone through the whole exhibition.

Beautiful bridge, amazing sights. My family and I walked over to the bridge after visiting the Tower of London around sunset and got phenomenal views over the Thames. The bridge itself is GORGEOUS- definitely worth checking out. The paint is bright and gleaming and the detailing is marvelous.

Tower Bridge Exhibition. This was an enjoyable visit. The bridge from the outside is remarkable piece of architecture however do the exhibition as you see it from a whole new light. Well worth the 8 pound entrance fee with excellent views of the city. Don't skip the engine room as you need to make your way there after visiting the towers and the walkway between the two towers. Good for all ages and there is a lift for those who do not want to take the stairs down, however the stairs are not hard and you also get an interesting view of the passing traffic as you are walking down. One tip, go to the toilet before you enter as the only toilet is in the far tower after you have seen the majority of the exhibition and you will need to walk back and forth between the towers and numerous stars.

An attraction of 2 halfs. The entrance is not fantastic but it is under a bridge, we had to wait awhile for a group to build before the tour could begin, we were lead by I believe an East European lady who made no effort to at least sound like a Londoner, we arrived in a long room with a few exhibits and a model of the bridge in times gone bye. We seemed to spend an age in this room just waiting which was made harder by a couple of young Australian kids whose parents seem to have forgotten to teach them any social boundaries and later in the tour their behaviour was to some extent ruining the experience. After the victorian pub (wait and see) this family were separated away from the group, this showed the staff in a very good light. The lady who operated the lift (is it a lift you decide) was believable but why were we squeezed into a long narrow room sitting on a bench in front of a TV that didn't show anything worth seeing and left waiting for a few minutes, I guess it was for another group to cross our route. My wife screamed several times as well as a group of 4 young ladies from the US during the remainder of the tour which was very entertaining, the revolving drum messed me up for a bit but I'm not good on roundabouts anyway. A special mention to the slightly camp chap who explained the execution method used in England's passed who was brilliant and dealt with the 2 unruly kids remarkably well, also the young man who did the young English wide boy of old, he started rather slowly but he grew on you as he told his story. To the both of you, you made the experience. And very abruptly it was over and besides a few vending machines your back under the bridge.Nearly forgot if you are travelling into London by train don't forget there is a 2for1 offer available online, search 2for1 London days out!

Mouth of London. A bridge worth seeing at all angles. Must appreciate the aesthetics craved on the structure. No trip to London is complete without a snapshot of this bridge in background. Well maintained.

The main picture of london , whwn you see it from a forreigners point of view. This is a fantastic building structure and going through the historical trip inside , you just have to adnmit it , the Tower bridge is the sybol of lindon

Perfect selection for a London walk. More history behind this bridge than the average country. Beautiful. Would recommend walking over it and seeing it from the south side. No matter the weather it is breath taking .

Trip of a life time. Breath-taking! Big, blue & beautiful!! The walk across was exciting, seeing the vendors, hot roasted nuts (my fav) and hundreds of ppl sharing in the excitement of Paris!! Looking over the waters, seeing Big Ben and walking over to the London Eye..one excursion you must do!!

skip the movie. go for the views from the walkway, for they are spectacular in either direction. If you're really into history and engineering, do the tour all the way, otherwise go up and gawk at London.

Excellent. A great way to while away a couple of hours. It was very good value. The staff were excellent. Lovely views from the top walkways across London. The engine rooms were very interesting. Had a great time here.

Experience the Tower Bridge!. An engineering marvel in its day, and it still is! I had NO idea how a steam-powered bascule bridge might work, or why it might be interesting, until I visited this place with London friends (I might have skipped this entirely) - now I know! The tour is very informative (it's covered by your London Pass), and you get some great views of London and the river from this vantage point.When we went this month there was a fascinating exhibit of types of bridges, and their locations all around the world - if you have present or future engineers in your family, they will really enjoy, and learn a lot from, this part of the tour.

WOW. Such a beautiful bridge with great views. Looks gorgeous at night when the lights come on. People think this is the London Bridge ( which is just a simple bridge without any charm) and are pleasantly surprised when they realize this is the Tower Bridge. So beautiful to walk over and so nice walking along the other side along the Queens Walk. Definite must. Restaurants and shops galore.

Good tour. It was interesting to go inside the building and read about the history and the way it's been built. We enjoyed the view from the bridge and enjoyed the museum. It was as well nice to watch the machinery.

70% of the exhibition is boring, but the ending is worthed the whole. First we had to wait for the tiny line, usual, no problem. The trip consist 5 part. There was part where they played video about the history of the bridge. After it ended the guide said something in 3 sentences that (i think) no one could understand, nevermind, we went forward, exhibition on one side, then we had to go to the other side of the bridge, another exhibition, great... then we could go downstairs exit the exhibition, cross the bridge to the engine rooms where the fun begins, magnificent all i could say. I would suggest to buy ticket then head to engine room :)

Another London Trademark. Definitely a London trademark and a must-do if you're visiting London. We had some wonderful photo opportunities (even better photo opportunities of the bridge from the Thames river-walk though). The museum itself is neat and interesting but in my opinion unless you have a London Pass, invest your money on other attractions and just walk over the bridge, take some pictures and it should be more than enough.

Must-do iconic bridge. I checked up on the website and saw the bridge opening times so we watched this from the 'banks' of the Thames. We then did the tour which was good but not a huge deal, there are many places to get a good view in London. It was interesting to look at the mechanics of the bridge a bit though.

Famous London Icon. Tower Bridge is probably one of the most iconic views of London that is recognised the world over. A walk along the south bank towards Tower Bridge gives fantastic views of this iconic British feature with lots of photo opportunities - even better when the bridge is opening!Even if you don't have the time to do the tour itself, a walk over the bridge will undoubtedly prompt numerous questions from the kids - our own still love to walk over this bridge when we visit London as it is such a symbol of the city of London and our heritage.Well worth a visit.

Nice to Look at- Don't worry if can't do the walk through.. Like it says above...Great to photograph. Along the water beside the Tower of London are great views. If you have 45 minutes to spare, Take the trip up to the walkway and do the walk around. There are some "bridges of the world" exhibits etc. The engine room is mildly interesting, probably more so if you are an engineer or something.We had a London pass and was free, but if you are cash paying, not sure the value is really there.
Kids enjoyed trip to top. Elevator to top then long walk across bridge. A little disappointed no commentary or guides to explain history or mechanics. Just wanted to add to our "did that" list! :)
Glorious. Great views. Insight into the Tower. Infinite photo ops. Great historical and tecnological information. Definitely go check her out.

Best bridge in the world.. If your on holiday in London then I am sure you will be visiting the Tower of London so while your at it give the Tower Bridge experience a go. The bridge itself is beautiful and by doing the experience you can walk the the walk way and find out all of the history of the bridge. The views from up top should not be missed and the price reasonable.

At least I can say I've walked over the Tower Bridge. We went here after visiting the Tower of London. Going up to the walkway was great and the view was great. Other than that I wouldn't have bothered going.

Beautiful place, interesting exhibition. Nicely made tour in this great bridge from Victoria time. Wievs are worth watching. Fee is not too big. Not too horrible crowds of people morningtime - at 10.30 Sunday. Enjoyable.

Worth it for the view,the rest maybe less so..... My wife and I had London Passes (recommended) which covered the entry cost for the Tower Bridge Exhibition. It is very close (as you would expect) to the Tower of London, so it's a good option to pursue after your ToL visit.You get access to the top walkway that traverses the bridge and the exhibition inside that explains the construction and Victorian history. The walkway itself may also have special exhibitions to see..The view from the top walkway is stunning and you have great vistas looking both east and west down the Thames (I have included one of my photos with this review.)The Exhibition entry fee also gives you access to the Machine Room which controls and powers the bridge movement mechanism. Fascinating for the mechanically-minded but less so for other visitors. (I've also included a photo of this too.)In summary, if we'd had to pay for entry (instead of using our London Pass) I suspect my wife and I may well have questioned the expense.

Very interesting. Going inside the bridge was very interesting. You can see the metal construction that is behind the stone towers. There is an exhibition of pictures, facts and descriptions of other bridges from around the world. These pictures are located on the pedestrian walkways 42 meters above the river! The best part however was looking round the engine rooms. well worth a visit.

Not what I’ve expected.. I went to the Tower Bridge Exhibition (up to the bridges that connect the two towers - where you can walk) there expecting to see and understand a little better the complex of the London Tower. Unfortunately, you have a very limited view from inside and up the bridge. It’s not worth the money to get in.You can learn a lot about the history of London and know about other interesting big bridges around the world. However, the view from the top of the tower is very limited, due to the iron crossed of the bridge. It’s more informative than a panoramic view. If you don’t have much time, don’t worry about it. Your time will be better spent around the Thames and its bankside where you can have a view OF the bridge and not FROM the bridge.
Tower Bridge Walk. Real great value, full of surprises, really enjoyed a couple of hours looking and learning, and of course the view.. Dont miss it on your London Trip.
Take the few minutes. The tour only takes about half an hour and is pretty interesting. The view from the walkways is very nice.

Memorable visit. Fantastic visit - full of history, beautifully maintained and a wonderful Beefeater as a guide (Billy Beefeater). So knowledgeable but entertaining at the same time. I wish all my history lessons had been so enjoyable. Last visited the Tower as a school girl but so proud to come back after 46 years in Australia.

Beautiful Bridge. Here is a secret for the photographers out there. On the southeast side of the Thames there is a narrow side street. On your left side of the street there is a set of stairs that go up. Go up these stairs and you will see that they lead back down onto a little piece of shore on the river. Set up your tripod here at night and get some great shots of this iconic bridge. We also did the tour which was good - there is a walkway along the top of the bridge and at the end of the tour you get to see the mechanics of the bridge.

Good Experience- not worth full price. It is quite an experience to go up and wander around Tower Bridge; there are good views and some info on the history of the bridge but this could be improved!Nice little gift shop!

The best bridge in the world. It is one of my favourite views in the whole world, no matter which side of the river you are, no matter whether it's daylight or dark... it's a fantastic bridge with a grey-skyblue color mix that I like a lot. If you are lucky enough you can see the bascules raise for a best memorable moment. Take the exhibition so you can pass the upper walkways and have some shots to the city. At the end, you can buy souvenirs at a reasonable price, cheaper than outside. Another great view is if you stand at London Bridge facing Tower Bridge (about 1 km).

Beautiful bridge but tour just ok. An iconic bridge, beautiful bridge but the tour itself was just average. Up in a lift, shown a fairly interesting short film about the structure and its history, then through to the walkways where (if the weather is decent you can get some ok pictures of London. You get much better views from elsewhere though (London Eye, St Paul's, The Shard etc). Then down to engine room, you'll see some victorian mechanics and that's it really. Obviously, there's only so much that a bridge can offer but it just wasn't fantastic in my opinion. Others may love it though.
go see it at night. amazing view when lit up. so many people forget that night viewing of a city adds drama and flair to photos. plus, no crowds.
Beautiful Bridge. A fabulous testament to the past. It stands proud and glorious, the exhibition is well worth the entrance fee.
Very interesting.. The bridge tour was very interesting and informative. My only complaint was up top the views where a little restricted. The engine room was pretty awesome as well.

Breath Taking beauty!. Splendid - The most iconic bridge in London. Staying less than a mile away from it ensured that we came walking as often as we could to enjoy the beauty of the bridge. It is right next to 'The Tower of London' which is also worth a visit, though it has an entry fees.The Tower is bridge has a great view, with the openness of Thames on the side facing the Tall buildings of Canary Wharf and the line of bridges starting from London Bridge, Millennium Bridge etc on the other. Both the banks also have world famous buildings, with Tower on one side and 'Shrad' (the tallest building in London) on the other.Cross it and then walk alongside Thames to enjoy the beauty of the surroundings!

Dissapointing. We booked this attraction before leaving home along with other things we wanted to do in london on our 4 day trip and went to Tower bridge when we arrived after booking into our apartment as it was within easy distance This was 10th june 2013We didnt have long to queue as being Monday lunchtime it was quiet you were led into a lift that took you 40+ feet up to the upper walkways you can see from road and wasthen left to walk across at your own pace ther was photos along the walls to viewyou then went onto the other walkway to look the other way across london lovely views i must say but then it was a walk down 110 or so steps back to the road outside we then had to ask where the Engine room was and was pointed in the right direction i am sure many have missed this and its in with the price of 8pounds each Rip Off nothing to shout about at all!!!! the only good part was there was cannons being fired to celabrate the Duke Of Edingburghs 92nd birthday on edge of thames

Interesting experience. There is quite a lot of information to take in, a lot of reading involved. There is an opportunity to take pictures though the views are restricted on top of the bridge. You will have to plan in advance if you want to see the bridge drawn.

Worth the tour!. Very interesting engineering, good views. At the time of our visit there was an excellent photo exhibit of other bridges on display at the top of the bridge. Worth the visit just for the photo exhibit.

what a view. a great way to look across london and see the way the city has spread.an interesting and informative afternoon great for kids with an engineering aspect to their education.if the victorians can build this to last why is the modern age so bad at getting it right?
Really really really boring. not worth the £8 to get in. The views are great - but I would go on the London Eye rather than this....

Tower Bridge Experience. It is a good event to do - not amazing but an experience to say that you have wasled over Tower Bridge - views of the river are great and if the weather is wet outside then a good place to dry off! Max time 1hr !

Impressive. The solemn and gothic architecture of this bridge makes it really stately. I had the pleasure to cross it at night, a time when the atmosphere is probably even more magical. It's one of the structures that still retain the old world charm of the city and preserve its "damned" atmosphere .A must see within the city, it would be sad to miss it!

Better to just look at the bridge from the outside. This was a rather weird tour. You go up to the top of the bridge and it offers lovely views but much of the views are blocked. They also provide information about other bridges around the world instead of tower bridge...

A marvellous and quick attraction... We spent about ten minutes crossing the bridge and taking photos, although it can be crossed much quicker, if you go slowly and soak in all the marvel there is to see on the bridge and around it. You can get some rather epic sights of London Tower, HMS Belfast amongst other things.

Beautiful architecture. My family and I walked across the Tower Bridge on the way to the Tower of London. Loved the architecture but unfortunately, we missed the opening of the bridge. We didn't explore the museum either. The views from the bridge were pretty.
Check it out. If you go to London you must check out Tower Bridge and take the tour. Go to the top and look out...stunning views.

Iconic landmark. It's an icon and an emblematic landmark of the city. It's the equivalent to Paris' Eiffel tower. You can't say you've been to London if you haven't set foot on the bridge. Totally recommended taking a visit after sunset and enjoy the beautiful colors of the city's sky.The bridge is in pristine conditions!

view, light and engineering. My favourite bridge. Light and weather are good from the Thames and this is a good spot to see it, with good variety of buildings, and ships.Fun to see it raised for regular barges - annoying if in a hurry - but worth a photo
Visit with tower of London. Short walk from Tower of London. The tour was indoors so we could enjoy the Tower Bridge and the scenery and stay dry at the same time. Great views from the bridge.

Not impressed. The views were good, but the walkways were more enclosed than we thought. We thought the displays inside could have been better. There was lots of information about other bridges around the world and even lots of info on the staff that manage the bridge! So it seems the displays were put together on a low budget. We thought a lot more could be made of the build process and history. The engine rooms were good, but the signs explaining the 'way it works' was a bit disjointed and could do with an overview of the process (but we might of missed something).

inside and above. We did it for pure nostalgic curiosity,and thought afterwards that it was worthwhile.We did learn about the famous "Bascules" that used to raise it,long since replaced by modernity.The tour is guided and presented well.The history of the bridge is interesting to London admirers,ourselves included,but the treat for us was the opportunity to walk above the lower levels.There are good views on a good day,and after all,you can claim to have walked up and over Tower Bridge.;;
Tower Bridge. Tour did not take long but was interesting and we got some great views. Viewing areas in tour are indoors so we stayed dry despite the rain. Worth a visit.

Better than we thought.. A must see with the Tower of London. As we were leaving the Tower of London we decided to go over to the Tower bridge and see what it was like. We saw the price was fair and decided to go in. Wow what a good choice, you go to the top of the tower bridge and learn a lot about the history. Plus the views are amazing. We were very glad we decided to go to this places and suggest others will like it too.
Visit to Tower Bridge. Like - Great piece of engineering, excellent up keep, photos of other famous bridges, video of bridge construction, good directions to see all the exhibits, courteous staff
Iconic bridge. Located next to The Tower of London and St Katherines dock, an iconic bridge well worth a visit. The muuseum on the upper level well worth a visit.

Wow. We were hitting most of the sights in London and this one shocked me. i was expecting a massive bridge, when in reality its alot smaller than it looks on TV. But still just as impressive if not more so.

Great value for money. This is a fascinating visit inside one of the world's most famous bridges. We had hoped that the bridge would be lifted that day, but we were unlucky. The views from the walkways looking both ways up and down the Thames were brilliant. Fab photos taken!
Icon of London. This is like Eiffel tower to Paris. Without this , you visit is incomplete. Hope to see the bridge open and close. Visit during the evenings to see the bridge during day and night.
Tower Bidge,London. It was my Dream and lastly comes true.It is really a big one and I strange to see the navigation under the deck.

A must see. Seeing the Tower Bridge is beautiful. Extraordinary really. The exhibition is neat though don't expect to be wowed. There are some nice pictures and information to be had, if you feel like reading. The views were obstructed by safety features and bars for me. There are a couple of short movies played before each attraction. The original engine room was informative and interesting and a gift shop area following. A beautiful and relaxing time to be had.

Could not believe we saw 3 lifts!. One of the most impressive aspects of this magnificent bridge is to see the lift. During this visit we were so fortunate to see 3.One was early morning to allow a tall-masted ship through. The speed with which the lift occurs is amazing, a tribute to the hidden engineering involved. It literally takes only a few short minutes for the whole event to begin and end. Probably just as well, given how busy the bridge is with both pedestrians and vehicles.The most dramatic occasion was during a beautiful sunset, as the whole bridge was beginning to light up. A wonderful sight.
TAKE THE TOUR AND WALK ON THE HIGH WALKWAY. Its an experience to be so high. Good views of HMS Belfast and other attractions. Good Value at £8 for a major London attraction

Value for Money!!. A worth while trip here! It cost us £8 for the two of us, as we had a 2 for 1 voucher fro the national rail 2 for 1 website when showing our rail tickets. The lift was ok and the two informative films were produced well. In the corridors connecting the two towers, there was further info and exhibits about other bridges. The views were amazing and I enjoyed getting the views on both sides. We had particularly bad weather, so didnt see as much and the photos werent as good. You can stick your camera out of the viewing windows to get a better shot. I could have left my hubbie watching the CCTV cameras on the side of the side though for hours!! Not far from the tower hill tube station at all
Best tourist attraction. It is amazing place to visit Tower Bridge and also the cheaper places to spend more time in the London

famous for a reason. it's a nice bridge to look at and the walk on it is enjoyable as well-- we had a run of good weather on our visit and enjoyed the views from the bridge... it was great seeing it lift also to allow river traffic to pass through...

Good to get the history on a land mark. This is typical tourist attraction but nice to go inside and across the bridge to see the history and construction. Then imagine all those heads on poles back in the day when you really got told off for misbehaving in public!

nice to visit. Enjoyed the visit to tower bridge. the videos at the top of each tower was nice to see and told the history of the bridge. It was nice to see the original lifting equipment also. It was also one of the cheaper places in London to go. It is nice to see the views from the high level walkways also.
do the Tower Bridge Experience. Dont just look at it or walk over it, take the trip up to the exhibition good views of the river and history of the bridge.

St. Paul's cathedral. Me my husband and my 14 year old son we went to have a look at St. Paul's cathedral it was amazing. Place to see. And the sun was shinning. On our way around the cathedral. We see people from a roof top so we headed over that way it was like a shopping moll. We go into the lift and went to the top. We could see over St. Paul's and much more. Had a bear. In the SUN.
Great views. Did this at the end of the day and it was really interesting and good value for money. Great views from the gantries up and down the river.

Worth a visit. This was a fun exhibit. We were expecting a little bit more, but it was still fun. It was neat to see the engine room and see how the bridge was built. Walking across the tip of the bridge was interesting. We didn't get to see the bridge open. The upper bridge is closed which makes it warmer but does make it a little harder to see the view. They do have windows that open so you can take pictures but they are few and far between. It didn't take us long to see everything as there really isn't that much to see. If you don't have the London Pass I wouldn't recommend paying for it.

Surprise of our trip - upon high. We had the London pass and wasn't sure what to expect from this attraction... But got to admit we loved it ...what a piece of engineering...You go to the top in the lift and then there is video on the bridge, I would say take the time to listen to them from the beginning interesting...The views of London from high up on the actual river were amazing and there are small windows for photos. while we was there was an exhibition of bridges from around the world which again was interesting. You then get access to the engine rooms which again were eye opening and full of info.The only down size I would say is the shop was small and could see it being crampedWe would go again outside of the pass
Take the Tower Bridge Experience. Watch the videos, walk across the elevated spans, tour the engine room that raises the draw bridge, and walk back across at street level.
Well worth a visit. Well priced exhibition, very informative, would recommend a visit, the engine room was unbelievable a fantastic design and achievement in engineering
It's awesome!. It's really impressive how people managed to build something so brilliant such a long time ago. We are lucky to be able to see the bridge open! :)

Katherine Dock and Tower of London. It is nice to take a stroll on Tower bridge when you dont want to go much away from your apartment.. Nearby Katherine Dock is too good. Going down towards Tower of London gives a beautifule view where you can enjoy the beauty of the bridge + see it opening for passing Ship.

The Gate to London. It's not the oldest bridge but it is a thing of beauty. I would not recommend paying to go up top, we did that last time, this time we enjoy the bridge with a free walk across. If you happen to dine nearby, it is nice to go back through at night. Things have a way of changing character in the dark.

Stunning. The most stunning landscape in the world, day or night Tower bridge is stunning, impresive, even I've been there more than 100 times I just can not get enought of it's beauty and british charm, Located in the heart of London Tower bridge is surrounded with other main attractions of London so everything about the area is simply wonderful.
Brilliant.. Such a lovely place, very beautful at night time. Would gladly return here. So many lovely people around this area too.
King bridge in London over the Themse. a nice and also lovely older bridge over the Themse, nice to see, when the bridge will open and than close

Meh. We paid for the tour of this bridge and exhibit. I think a free walk across the bridge would have been more exciting. They have pictures of bridges from around the world with a bit of information on each. Then there's pictures of stuff around London with no explaination. I found the engine room boring, but if you're into looking at that type of stuff you might enjoy it. However there wasn't alot of information. Overall, I say save your money. Take a walk across the bridge, take your pictures and go enjoy a pint somewhere with the savings.

Good for engineering enthusiasts. We bought a ticket to enter Tower Bridge because my husband is an engineer and loves to see how things work. Our ticket gained us access to the exhibitions inside (some videos explaining the history and construction, photos and timelines for both Tower Bridge and other innovative bridges around the world, a very cute presentation--via story board type posters- of the children's book This is London!) and to the engine room.I am not an engineer or mechanical enthusiast but enjoyed the tour. Husband loved it, says it was a highlight of our sight seeing. Admission was only £6, and I felt that was a reasonable price for what you see. The elevator was broken, which they advised before we bought tickets, and there were many steps to navigate. We enjoyed the challenge.
The greatness of london. What a sight, the marvel of a moving bridge, over the Thames, so amazing as it lifts, and you can go inside and over the top as well,

try the eve sundowner trip. great to watch london come to light up at sunset from the glass walkway. good views and quite interesting history . nothing else to actually do once up there apart from the views.worth going though

Its a bridge. Its a bridge. walk across, take a picture. nextIts a bridge. walk across, take a picture. nextIts a bridge. walk across, take a picture. nextIts a bridge. walk across, take a picture. nextIts a bridge. walk across, take a picture. nextIts a bridge. walk across, take a picture. nextIts a bridge. walk across, take a picture. next

Interesting. This was really interesting- Some good displays and hands-on stuff for the kids. I didn't get to see the bridge open- I wish I had been more organised and looked up when it would open. But it is still worth seeing, you get to see the mechanics and the history of it all.

excellent. I loved the video at the start of the tour that told guest the history of the bridge very well dont and funny too. Being able to walk over the walkways at the top was brilliant as well and there are lots of pictures and things to read along the way a history lesson and sightseeing tour in one! photo points were fab loved that there were windows you could take pictures through so there was no reflection - fab!. The engine rooms were great very interesting and well done...my only complaint was the amount of stairs to get back down again!
Beautiful. Although we couldn't visit the Tower bridge exibition, I woul say that this is a must-see ! Amazing architecture .
Dont get confused!. Dont get confused, this is not London Bridge like most people think, Love it when the bridge is drawn open, its a tough spot but if you come past enough you will catch it one day!

Historic, Interesting & Well Run. My son and I recently spent a weekday morning touring the Tower Bridge Exhibit and it was time well spent. The two and half hours required to thoroughly see everything was just right. The views are great, the exhibits were well done and interesting.

Iconic world famous landmark. The best bit about this is actually being part of such an iconic world famous landmark. Before our visit I never knew that you could ascend one of the towers (via lift) walk through the connecting walkways between the towers and down the stairs at the other end ( I guess the less able could return and go back down in the lift, best to check though). You pass through several permanent exhibits about the history of the bridge, as well as changing exhibits on the theme of London, bridges etc, all with a fantastic view along the Thames. Don't forget to follow the trail from the second tower to the former engine rooms that used to control the opening and closing of the bridge as these are as interesting as the bridge itself. Good value (£18 for a family ticket at the time of our visit) which kept an 8 & 10 year old, as well as their parents interested for over 2 hours.
A nice attraction, reasonbly priced. Nice view on the motors and nice videos telling the story of tower bridge, but nothing too special, worth the ticket's price

Great History..Fabulous Views.... This is a great exhibition and well worth spending the time to really look at everything on show..It is well set out and the history of the site and the photographs of bygone eras was capitvating..

Sight everyone should experience.. Were with a friends, so we were more excited about the view rather than history. It was amazing and you can made a coin with a Tower bridge on it. I cost only 1£. Great to see how it actually works.
Great path. Love crossing the Tower Bridge fro/to South and North over the Thames. It's always special to see when the bridge opens up for ships to go under. Views at sunset are magnificent!
Iconic. tower Bridge is an Iconic bridge and makes up part of Londons must see's. Its one of manay bridges across the Thames and a lovely bridge to see.

Just fun to see. I would say just see the bridge from the river side of the Tower of London, or from a wall inside the Tower of London for best pictures, and walk across if you want, but it's just a bridge, the picture is what's cool.

Even more beautiful now. With the wonderfully gaudy new paint job (restoration of an original Victorian one?) Tower Bridge is even more fun to walk cross on the way to the south bak museums and shops.
Beautiful. An easy walk to take (up and back). I love it's appearance. It's a busy pedestrian and vehicle bridge, so take care if crossing to the other side, or when stopping to take pictures.
Worth a visit. A great view of the best bits of London from an iconic building. This is a unique view and well worth the money.

Great views. Loved the views, bridge pictures, reading about he history.
Buy together with a ticket for Monument, it's only £1 extra and saves a few quid. Bargain.
looks cool. This landmark doesn't only look good in photos, it looks truly grand from a distance and up close. We had quite a lot of photos taken here.

Not worth £8. I did the exhibition as I love Victorian engineering. However I found most of it disappointing. The views of london were great but the exhibition was just pictures of other bridges. The films were poor. The best bit was the engine rooms. Overall I thought it was overpriced.

Worth a visit. Did enjoy the bridge. Missed it opening though which was a shame. Looked at all the displays. I went up and across so saw and read all about the bridges throughout the world. Very interesting. Did the engine room, loved it. So massive. Glad I went and did this.

Great view from the top of the bridge. A really good experience to take the walkway with its great views. And all the information in the walkway was also very interesting. In both towers there was a little film about how the bridge was build, which was really interesting. Also the maschine room down below was of great interest.But over all i went there for the views over the city, and that for sure didn´t fail.

Sightseeing. We visited Tower Bridge and The Tower of London whilst visiting the capital in April. I'd never been before and really enjoyed it, not only the history of it but also found it very interesting. It was very busy down there and a real buzz around it, the staff were always very accomodating when it came to taking photo's etc and really help to make our day. Must see

iconic view of London. well, it's just it - the Tower Bridge, a must see in London. View from both sides - from Tower of London and from City Hall are good. The south bank (City Hall side) offers more options for photographs. Make sure you see it both in daytime and at night - the view is spectacular.
It is fun to see at night. Does not impress too much during the day, but it is fun all lit up at night. It is a place to see in London, and people should not leave without seeing it.

Not to be missed. Visited the Tower Bridge in April, 2013 with my husband and two young sons aged 7 and 3. It is a very well presented attraction. Staff are friendly and efficient. There is a spectacular view of London from the viewing platform. The information video was entertaining and informative. A great lesson in history and in engineering. A must see attraction for anyone visiting London.
Go see this.. Everything you have seen or expected, until you see it at night. Breath-taking becomes stunning when they light this bridge at dark.

Tower Bridge with my boys. Visiited in June 2012 just before the Olympic Rings went up. I visited with my 60 something parents and my boys aged 5 and 6. We all enjoyed the trip up the elevator, across the bridge, watching the film of how the bridge was built, back across the other bridge and down the stairs. My boys espcially enjoyed the interactive elements back down on ground level just prior to exiting. They have an appreciation of Tower Bridge that they didn't have before. Unfortunatley the bridge wasn't schedule to raise that day but I think standing on the bridge and watching it raise up afterwards would have been the icing on the cake for them, so try and plan your visit around that if you can
Iconic land mark. never ceases to impress me, particularly at night time when lite up,not a lot to do mind but great to watch a boat go through while having a beer nearby.

Unique bridge offering a great view if London. Who has never seen a picture or anything related to the London tower bridge. It is the Eiffel Tower of London. It is important to understand the history of the bridge to appreciate it entirely. On the bridge the visitor can enjoy an unique view of almost entire London.

OK. Checked this out only because it was included in the London Pass and that seems about right. I would not make a special effort or pay extra money for this attraction. I was disappointed that I didn't actually get to walk OUTSIDE once we took the elevator up to the top of the bridge. . Short little movie and some London history along a time line that is much better represented in the Museum of London or other museums. My son (the engineer) enjoyed the Engine Room.
Amazing. It was a lovely day, the weather was good so while waiting we could sit outside and have lunch, we walked over the bridge a few times while in London it was amazing

Outstanding for the views alone. Tower Bridge is an iconic landmark. The beautiful Victorian bridge (that looks as if it could be medieval) is also important as the first low bridge on the Thames from the sea, but few people realize it is a drawbridge. The Tower Bridge Experience has explains its construction and operation, both of which are fascinating. But even better are the splendid views in both directions on the Thames. Go on a clear day and the sights are amazing.

Great views, amazing to think you are in this iconic structure. Lots of history. Loved the information about how it operated, as well as the machinery. Loved feeling above the world as you walk around the top arms of the bridge. Reasonably priced - and included in the London Pass. Recommended

A Surprise. The museum and engine room inside the bridge are a surprise. A well organised and informative little tour, self-guided. The engine rooms are most impressive. £5.60 for a Senior ticket - not bad at all. This might not be a very interesting attraction for children - too remote for them - but a good hour's stroll for adults.

London's Iconic Tower Bridge. Be sure to visit this beautiful bridge while you are in London. If you are interested, there are tours that let you see the mechanism inside that allows the bascules to be raised to allow river traffic to pass through.

Worth a trip and doesnt take long to do. As we had a london pass, we visited for free, so we went. Its still fairly cheap,otherwise, and as its such a famous london mark, its worth a look. There isnt much to see up stairs on the way over to the other side, but i highly recommend seeing the engine room on the other side, very impressive.

1 hour excellent attraction. Many attractions in London takes half a day. This is 30 to 60 min only and very well executed. You start by elevator up in the first tower where you see a short movie presentation about the history of the bridge, then a walk across to the other side on the elevated walkway, with an excellent view over Thames. On the other side another short movie how the bridge is built and how it works. It is one of the first steam powered bridges ever built, so for an engineer this is very cool. Then you go down to the old engine room with the steam engines and of course a souvenir shop. This tour was way better than expected.

A bit pricey for a short visit. you start from the North tower Where you can see a short historic fillm, go across both East and West bright top beams for more historic and geographic facts and enjor this view of London.Then you go down the south tower where this a last factual on the way to the machine room, which for me was the best part.

Night or day a great location. Such an iconic landmark, my friend and I had a great time walking in and around London's Tower Bridge, every angle seems picture perfect. Just a short walk from the Tower of London it offers a spectacular view of the tower grounds, the river Thames, and the city itself all lit up at night. A perfect place to wander or people watch. Benches down along the river provide a different view than that above.

Worth a visit. Using our 2 for 1 voucher this was well worth a look at only £8 for 2 of us to enter. The views from the bridge are fantastic both East & West and it was interesting looking around the engine room!If you have a bit of time spare and don't know what to do, I would recommend a visit.

Elegant , impressive.... I have been there many times. This time, maybe because we were a group of friends, we enjoyed more. I recommend to visit it after Tower of London , together they match in a very impressive and elegant english atmosphere .walk along the bridge and just after you cross it(coming from Tower of London to the other side) you find good fish & chips places..

Best View from the Tower of London. Have your cabbie drop you off at the Tower of London, walk down to the water for the best view of the bridge. (A bit of a walk if you want to actually go on the bridge) But for pictures, this is the best place.
Good!. One of the best landmarks in London. You can see tower bridge from City Hall.

Great Mind. This is a lesson, the bridge is an achievement. First of all achievement by mankind that if we think out of the box, nothing is impossible.Secondly achievement of 'Great Britain', something for everyone to look at and motivation for the future, and do better.Truly Majestic, unique experience and i never thought i will say this about a Bridge.
Surprisingly cool!. The view from the top is fabulous! There is also a little informational video done in a lovely Victorian style.

Excellent Little tour. Not too expensive and a great way to a different side to London. I don’t know anywhere else you can see the Thames from the middle of the river so high up.Lots of history and you see the mechanics of how it works (as well as how it USE to work).The kids love it.TIP - Choose a clear day for when you up on the bridge at the top, and stop in the middle and look out over the Thames.

A go to IF you have a London Pass. As we planned out trip, the Tower Bridge Experience was not on the top of our must see list. Learned about the historical significance of Tower Hill and changed our minds. Admission is overpriced, but it was on our London Pass, so we went. The tour was mostly self guided. A short video, a look at the equipment once used to operate the bridge, and an elevator ride to the walkway. Some information about the construction and operation of the bridge is presented, but we enjoyed the walk across more than the rest. Great skyline views of London and the Thames. Not really certain if you can walk the bridge without the museum.... but it seems like you could ? ? We were there in March and there was no line and no waiting. Based on the set up off the place, it seems that lines could be long and a lot of waiting involved. In that situation, I'd give the Tower Bridge Experience a pass. There is so much to see and learn in London your time could be better spent elsewhere.
Tower bridge exhibition. Very interesting on the history of the bridge and the views are great as you walk across. The entrance fee did not break the bank unlike many of the other London attractions.

Beautiful bridge. I never thought I would describe a bridge as being beautiful but it is, Great photo opportunities. One of the best ways to view the sites of London is to use the Hop on Hop off bus which allows you to explore at your own pace.
VERY INTERESTING. We liked all of it.... If you are in to Mechanics you would definately need to see this... You would never believe what made the Bridge open up....

Well worth the £8..... but get a combo ticket with the monument for 9...both are worth your time if you like views, like I do. We visited early in the day during spring break and had no queue. I liked the little windows you could open up to take photographs and the informative display boards. I found the whole experience to be delightful and I enjoyed going to the engine room.

If you are true fan of how bridges work, this museum isn't for you. I went with a structural engineer who designs bridges. While we enjoyed it, it does NOT show you how the bridge currently operates. It only shows you how it use to operate. While interesting, if you are someone who wants to see it's current inner workings you will be disappointed.That being said you do get a glimpse of how it was designed (enough information for the layman, but not for someone who actually understands structures). The top part of the bridge ddoes offer nice views. Is it worth the price? I think it depends on how much interest you have about bridges. Otherwise the bridge itself is wonderful to marvel out from the outside.
Check it out at night. Great to just walk round the Tower of London, and Tower Bridge at night when it's all lit up, no cost involved, and nice way to spend some time.

Great Family Fun. Reasonable prices and easy to get to made this the ideal attraction for our little ones. With 2 9yr olds a 7yr old and the baby at 5yrs old we wanted somewhere that would appeal to all of them and the Tower bridge exhibition managed that. Passport and stickers were handed out at different checkpoints giving them something to look forward to and the displays were clear and well spaced out. They all loved controlling the CCTV cameras and the interactive quizzes. The only negative is that there are no steps or platforms for the little ones to stand on meaning that they could not a good view out of the walkways. Holding them up is difficult now, they are getting heavy!!!

Magnificent. This is one of the world's most memorable bridges . It oozes with history and is just so beautiful . You can 't go to London and not get a photo of yourself with this bridge in the background . It is the definitive statement of " I have been to London England " . Fantastic view of the river from here as well as many other London landmarks .

Not much to see. Historic bridge Iv been meaning to visit inside for along time. This marvel of the bridge and all fantastic exterior architecture are the best parts this bridge. Inside there isnt a whole lot to see, apart from the novelty of being on the walkways and getting a new view of London. The Engine room is the most interesting showing all the old machinery used, however id liked to have seen the modern day mechanisms too. Still its inexpensive at £8 and makes for a quick tour of a place you always wondered how it looked on the inside.

Free to cross. It is a nice place to go. Don't expect too much it is a bridge. You can visit the museum but I liked just staying on the bridge and looking out to the different places. This is a must do just for the view on the docks. Even better at night with all the lights!

A must when in London. Gives some great views along the Thames, by St Katherine's dock, and Tower of London. A must is to cross at night as it is all illuminated and some great views from the bridge at night including the Shard.

Lovely piece of architecture. We went to see the Tower bridge for the first time on the Easter weekend. It is truly amazing and a great master piece of architecture. We walked through the bridge and then again crossed it while in a tourist bus. It never fails to impress and stands with all it's grandeur. Every one should see it while Visiting London as it's an iconic landmark of London.

Not worth the money. You of course need to SEE the Tower Bridge, and maybe even walk across it, but the actual paid Tower Bridge Experience is a waste of your money, unless you are really into Steam engines and machinery. I went to this because it was covered in my London Pass, and I still felt like it was a waste, I can't imagine paying money to go in. You watch a very brief 3D-ish video in the first tower, then you walk across the top which is completely enclosed.You have to look between beams to get a good view behind the plexiglass. The rest of the walkway just has pictures of famous bridges from around the world. Then there is another very brief video in the second tower, and that's it. Then you can exit the bridge and your ticket will get you into the engine room, but unless your really interested in machinery, it's not much to see. Just save your money and walk across it, don't pay for the exhibit!

Iconic Walk. Walk down the far side of the river and across the bridge toward the Tower of London. It is always beautiful and there is a lot to see along the river banks. I've been to London many times but this ws the first time I went into the Bridge museum. It was interesting but was disappointed in the lack of clear views.

Most notable bridge on the Thames. With beautiful Victorian architecture and bright paintwork, this bridge is an awesome sight for great photo opportunities. The tour is interesting and offers insight to the history of the bridge, a great view from the top platform you cross as well as the engineroom tour at the end. The gift shop had reasonably priced nick-nacks and stuff but there was a rather long queue to pay for items with only one person serving.

Novel experience. At £8 for adults less for students etc etc , this is great cheap fun thing to do...something different. walk across both viewing platforms and get good views. Visit the engine rooms if you wish and travel back in time watching the films about why it was built. Great fun, easily gave it couple of hours. It's website doesn't do it justice...give it a go..buy tickets Tower of London side at the bridge, don't be put off by a queue...it's for the lift and moves quickly. Access for wheelchairs and pushchairs.

Tower Bridge london. London has a number of bridges crossing The River Thames. If you are a tourist and are coming here for the first time please don't be mislead and seek out London Bridge as although there is a song about this bridge 'London Bridge is Falling down' the truth is it fell down hundreds of years ago and it was then rebuilt as a grim looking dull inspiring piece of architectural eyesore.Tower Bridge on the other hand is beautiful and is painted blue so stands out over all the other bridges over the River Thames . It has some very detailed work within its metal carvings and the bridge is opened apparently three times a day to let in passing water traffic [ships etc] There is also a tower you can climb for a fee to get a great view of london.
fun time crossing. what can i say about one of the key landmarks of London? a truly incredible structure and well maintained. good old English engineering

You are in London...do it but don't expect too much. We hesitated at first, but said,,Hey we are in London why not? I am not disappointed but don't expect too much. You will learn about the history of the bridge...etc. If you are into engines, then you will want to view the engine room that powers the draw bridge. Great views and photo opportunities on the bridge towers. All in all I would recommend this.
at night. good illumination - must see it in the dark - is even better than the view from a boat on the thames
