Form the south bank its a sight to behold.We also did the bridge tour which was good fun, some nice video shows and absolutely great views from the pedestrian walkways across the river (dont forget you cant see the roadway lift from the walkways). We also returned to the bridge at night, it is illuminated and looks great. Not so keen on all the technical steam driven engine room stuff... but the rest I would recommend.

London's most iconic bridge. The unique architecture of this bridge makes it immediately recognizable. It looks like it was freshly painted for the Olympic games, so it looked like new. It is right next to the Tower of London (which gives it its name).
Fabulous. It was much better than i thought it would be,both night and day.Excellent for pics.Very beautiful and imposing.
Historic place.. Lots to see and do. Lots of bars and restaurants and by the way your photo shows Tower Bridge and not London Bridge.
Another DO NOT MISS experience. The most famous bridge in the world did not let itself down, excellent displays and the walk across the gantrys and views were great.
The tower Bridge. Fantastic to see at night with all the lights. Big tourist attraction that is a must see and drive over. On occasions you can see the gate open that is a fantastic sight
Tower Bridge is London. The Tower Bridge is one of most typical images of London. It's very nice when the bridge goes up because there is a high ship passing by. Pretty nice to see.
Tower Bridge. This is a great place to visit. It is on the London Pass and is a great piece of architecture as well as engineering. It is a self guided tour and can be completed in about 2 hours.
Have to see it up close!. We took the Thames River cruise and it was great to come up on the bridge. Too bad the Olympic circles had already been taken off, was hoping to see them
Great!. I loved the atmosphere of Tower Bridge and it is so nice to take a leisurely stroll along it and soak up the experience, enjoying the river and the sights too.

The Most Beautiful Bridge in the World. Tower Bridge is one of the most iconic images in the world, in my opinion. To see it in person will give you chill bumps.It is located right beside the Tower of London (hence, the name "Tower Bridge"). We were lucky enough to get to see it raised not once, but twice in the span of about 30 minutes.Beautiful architecture made all the more amazing due to it's age. Absolutely breathtaking!

a bridge too far. I love this bridge, to me it screams London, more than any other landmark. It is the first place I go to when I arrive just to look at it makes me feel good. I have a great picture of the bridge which I took in 1981 on my wall, makes me feel I am in London when I'm not.
Tower Bridge Experience. Good view of the Thames. Very interesting to see how the bridge was built and how it works.Good value using 2 for 1 vouchers which can be downloaded from New Zealand.
Worth a visit. I was quite surprised at how large it is once you get inside.The views from the top were fantastic.It was very interesting to find out the history of London's iconic bridge.

An Architectural Masterpiece. Never get tired of seeing, and using, this beautiful bridge.Finally got to drive over it listening to 'London Calling' by the Ramones. Yeah its cheesy - but dam n it was fun!

beautiful thing to see while in London. It was a bright sunny day. We were standing on the London Bridge taking pictures of Tower Bridge (of course they always get confused). The pictures are some of our favorite. It really is a stunning structure.

Excellent views, informative and great value for money. I didn't even realise this attraction existed and I have been to London many times. This is a great low cost attraction in a spot on location with excellent views of London. Very well designed and easy to find self around, children have also been thought of with little activities throughout. Very educational and as mentioned great views. Highly recommend! You could also add on the monument for an extra £1 which equally has great views of London. I will be visiting again with my young daughter as think this plus tower of London would be a great family day out.

The Tower Bridge is A Must See. We enjoyed seeing the Tower Bridge, especially from the water - the views were excellent. Be sure to get out and walk across it, you might be lucky and see the bridge rise. The Bridge Experience is OK but not necessary to enjoy the bridge itself. This is not the London Bridge which is a new concrete structure, this is the Tower Bridge located at the historic location next to the Tower of London.
Choose the right name. My opinion was based on the Name - London Bridge is further up river and a plain open bridge. your picture for the review is the Tower Bridge - Differant thin altogether

Stunning piece of architecture. The Tower Bridge is well maintained stunning. The views from the bridge are amazing and walking around the river banks along there is so relaxing. You have a great view of the Tower of London from the Tower Bridge. Highly recommended.
Larger than expected. The Tower bridge was amazing. It dwarfs the London Bridge. The best pics are taken from the London Tower.
Deffinitely worth a visit. This is a good thing to do. Walk up to the top for some lovely views of the river and city, so take the camera. Also interesting talk about its construction.
This is London. Beautiful bridge that epitimizes London. Don't miss out on the exhibition which explains the history and is good value.
fantastic. great few hours spent very intresting for both us 40+ and our 11year old son a must if u in london great veiw of the city

Inside the Bridge. On my recent vist trip to London i saw a flyer about this Bridge tour and decided to have a look. You enter the bridge and you get into a lift up to the level above the traffic below, theres a short history on how the bridge was built and most of the time is your own taking pictures etc.The tour ends in the engine room excellent and well worth it and i would go again.

Awesome View. Check the view from More London. This is an office complex just East of London Bridge Tube Station. You head past Hays Gallery and make a left through More London. You will see the retail pitch. If you go during the week it is full of busy restaurants both quick serve and some of the normal high end brand like Gaucho. Again the view and photo ops are amazing from here.Walking to the bridge and walking over the bridge is fun as well, but immeadietly you will be looking for a pub/ restaurant to... do something. That is why I recomend skipping the walk accross and just enjoy it from More London.

historic landmark!. The tower bridge is one of London's landmarks that are a must-see! The bridge and the exhibition are both wonderful. You get to see how the bridge operates from the inside and also a brief history. From the walkways located above the bridge you get fantastic views of the river and the city. We were luck enough to visit while a ship passed under the bridge! Wonderful experience!

Not as good as expected. We used Tesco club card tokens to enter this attraction in October. We found it a little disappointing. You just basically covered 5 floors with different rooms overloading you with information. When you get to actually walk along the bridge overhead its on a wooden floor with info on either side and windows. We felt we couldn't see as much as we had hoped and it was quite hard to take photos. We didn't get the feel of being high up with the wind in our hair!Overall not bad but not as good as we had hoped.

Trip to london. If you are going to London for a day' sightseeing don't miss the Tower Bridge experience on entry you are taken in a lift to see an audio/visual presenstation of how the bridge came about then you can walk across the gantry, which is fully enclosed in glass, for some remarkable views also when in the south tower, look up for a surprise.ensure that you also visit the engine rooms to see the workings of this famous bridge.

Interesting exhibition; Beautiful Bridge. Everyone should see the Tower Bridge up close and/or walk by/across it when in London. It is beautiful to behold. However, the exhibition, while good, is not on my must-do list. The whole thing takes about 45 minutes to an hour, depending on how carefully you read all the signs. The exhibition begins with a short film about the building of the bridge. Then you walk across it two times, on the east side and the west, where there is a display about all the famous bridges of the world. There is another short film and then you come to an engineering room at the end. It costs 8 pounds admission.

View the Thames from above. Great views of the Thames and London landmarks from the bridge. There are two walkways above the bridge and housed within the confines of the walkways are exhibitions that tell the history of the bridge (and other famous bridges). You can visit the engine room and see the inner-workings of this structure. You must pass through a security check to venture into the inner sanctum of the bridge, but given the state of things in the world, it is a small price to pay to protect such an iconic landmark. We visited the bridge on Tuesday and crowding was minimal.
Magnificent. Words and pictures almost can't accurately describe or portray tower bridge. You must see this on a visit to London.

Not bad. Cool bridge. But there are many cool bridges in the world. Bridge itself is rated separately. This rating is for the "experience", paid admission to the upper deck and engine room of the bridge. In fact, the most inspiring part of the visit was seeing the displays of other historically significant bridges in the world. But as other reviewers have mentioned, this is basically a poster gallery.Price was not unfair. Top level bridge walkway was enclosed with only a few very small windows open-air for picture taking. I found that disappointing because I enjoy heights especially open-air.When I return to London, I'll just walk across again and take pictures from sidewalk. I don't believe I gained any better vantage point from the exhibition or upper deck.

Decent views. It's cool to walk across the elevated walkways, but the views aren't that fantastic. I wouldn't make a special trip just to do this, but we were going from the Tower of London to the Borough Market so figured we'd use the 2for1 offer and see this. The engine room is a bit dull as well.
Great views over London from this iconic landmark!. Fantastic views from both walkways and interesting exhibitions, you can even visit the engine rooms!

Tower Bridge-Take the Tour. We really enjoyed our tour of this iconic bridge. We started by taking the elevator up to the top, and watched a movie about this building and history of the bridge. We enjoyed walking across the top and enjoying incredible views. You can see how much new construction is going on in London right now. We decided to walk down the stairs, rather than take the elevator back down. Then we were back outside before going to the engine room below. It is no longer used to open and close the bridge, but it is incredible to see. All of this is included in the ticket price of 8 pounds, (5.60 over 60). We also enjoyed walking across the bridge at street level for different viewpoint of the river and city of London

The Only Bridge with a Tower. The tower bridge does not only bring history to London, It represents London and what it stands for. Its sight is also very beautiful in the architectural sense and whether you see it near or far, morning or evening with all its lights, via bus, and cruise on the river Thames, and even on the London Eye. An experience worth sharing.

Best bridge in the world. One of the most iconic structures in the world, with instant recognition and association with London by millions across the globe, to the point where many people believe it to be erroneously called London Bridge. This led to the legend that an American millionaire bought London bridge thinking it was Tower Bridge and only realised his mistake upon it's re-construction in America, but this is untrue. An impressive structure, especially when the bridge going up to allow boat traffic through. A marvel of Victorian engineering, where building things to last was practically a mantra

Great apart from being invaded by Jedward!. Arrived at Tower Gateway tube station last Wednesday, and had a short walk to Tower Bridge.Admission price was reasonable especially as our "2 for 1" voucher was accepted, braw.The tour guides were knowledgeable and low key.Views from the walkways were stunning despite the cloudy weather outside.The pictures and charts displayed in the walkways (showing the history of Tower Bridge plus details of other famous bridges throughout the world) were interesting. However, before we were able to complete the walkways part of the tour, we were invaded by... wait for it... Jedward!Jedward complete with entourage and TV crew, started to set up TV recording equipment accross about one third of one of the walkways, and telling the paying public to keep out of the way, thus preventing us from completeing the walkways part of the tour. The punters, consisting of mainly foreigners and "mature" persons were not impressed...There was no warning or apology about this. They might have at least given us a free gift (Tower Bridge that is, not Jedward!).We were then forced to move down to the engine rooms part of the tour which was very good.Highly reccomended.
Great view of London. We weren't in the room in which are machines..just on the path which conects to towers and it has amazing view!
great tour. I really enjoyed my tour of the tower bridge. It was great to see how is was built and all the inner workings.

Favorite place in London. If renting a car, park in Epping. Take the tube there to anywhere downtown London. Walking around down there is the way to do it! Once you get to the Bridge. You will miss gardens and the Sherlock Holmes restaurant if you don't walk around. We went on a Sunday and everything was open and just as exciting as any other day. We also went on a Wednesday. It's beautiful!!! For the attraction you need 1-2 hours. For the whole area you need 3-5 hours! Exchange your money at the airport or somewhere other than the Bridge area. Exchange rate is high! There were some public restrooms that did cost money.
Awesome. I live about 10 mins from Tower Bridge & am enchanted with seeing it every day, the no1 tourist attraction in London in my opinion.

No need to go inside. The tower is an impressive landmark. I would definitely look at bridge and walk across cross it. But there isn't anything worth seeing on the inside plus not very good views. Avoid yourself an entrance fee.

The Inner workings. We enjoyed stunning views of London from the high level walkways before journeying through the Victorian engine rooms. I'm not a techie but I loved the whole experience as clearly did every one else on my tour. I recommend this experience unreservedly to all, whether male or female

One of London's gems. A beautiful structure that is also an engineering feat. If you can arrage a tour to see the machinery that works the brige do so. Even better if a ship is passing through that requires the bridge to be raised.

London's loveliest Bridge and the only cantilever one. This is the Bridge that a group of American businessmen thought they were buying to place over a lake in Arizona. Guess they should have taken the time and trouble to visit it first. Close by the Tower of London, which is how it got it's name. You can not visit London and not visit it. You will also see City Hall and the Shard. Still you can see this from miles away. HMS Belfast is just a short paddle away too.
Have to rate this twice!. We have already submitted a revue for Tower Bridge which covers many of the points. But this is one of the gems of London that many people miss. The views are amazing..
One of the Iconic sites of London. Tower Bridge is simply one of the most amazing sites anywhere in the world. The views from the areas up stairs are amazing.

Iconic. Great to see it from the Thames River Tour...I did not cross it by foot, but felt I saw it .Great story behind it. It's not the original London Bridge. Something about it kept falling down. LoL...definitely research about it to get the funny story behind it.
At least walk across. I didn't go inside the exhibit as it cost money and time which I didn't have ,but to walk across it felt really good and that I accomplished something.
Amazing landmark. Love this bridge from every angle, the backdrop of the Thames helps but I love visiting the tower bridge

Such a beauty from far away and up close. What a beautiful bridge, iconic. We did the tour of the bridge, it was educational. It was a great view of the city, you can see the Eye and the Thames. We used the London Pass for it, so it was worth it.
London Tour 2012. Excellent Bridge, great attraction, take the bus tour, you get great views and drive over, great architecture.No Fee unless you take the Bus tour.

Interesting 1-2 hour visit. For those new to London this is such an iconic structure which is not what it seems. Good views from the walkway and the "experience" lets you see what is behind the folly towers and the original mechanism is preserved. I took my French friends, who had not been to London before, and they enjoyed the visit a lot.

So you thought you kinda liked steampunk?. The engine rooms beneath the bridge are an absolute must see. All the steampunk hipsters should be flocking there like pigeons to a bakery. All the machinery looks like stuff straight from Jules Verne's books and makes great photographic material.
Avoid the crowds. Beautiful bridge that is stunning when the sun is rising behind it. Go really early in the morning to view it from the banks of the Thames without all the crowds.

View. We decided to give this a go after completing the Tower of London. We were pleased to find out that you take an elevator to the top! No stairs! The tour of the bridge took us about half hour to 45 minutes to complete. We could have lingered and took longer, but did not. Great views from up above and they take you on both sides so as to see up the river and down. There are interesting things to read about while up inside. It is also enclosed with a few small windows open for a breeze. After you can choose to view where all the mechanics are going on to raise or lower the bridge...that was boring for us 5 girls. We went through it but didnt really enjoy that. As always, souvenier shop at the end was pleasant and we bought something!

One of MOST beautiful Bridges in the World!. The Tower Bridge is one of the iconic symbols of London, it is in proximity to the famous and historic Tower of London. For me the best time to go to the Tower Bridge is in the evening when it looks more beautiful because of its colorful lights. The varying colors create an aura that makes the Tower Bridge sparkles like a precious gem in the middle of the City. It's great to walk accross it, it affords you a bird eye-view of the Thames and of the high-rise buildings populating the city nowadays, but despite its modernity, London has been able to perfectly blend the old and the new, or it's old magnifiscent history with the present.

Meccano Bridge. A visit to Tower Bridge (adjacent to the Tower of London) may not be an immediate tourist site on your list, but it is worthwhile. Built like a Meccano set, with the use of modern technology, one can see how this iconic London landmark was constructed. A large lift whisks one up to the top level of the North tower, from here one walks along the enclosed gallery (great views of the City) into the South tower and then along the other gallery. There are currently displays of famous world bridges and Olympic sites as well as information about the Bridge itself.On descending by steps or lift to the base of the South tower there is the opportunity of visiting the Engine Room showing how the arches are raised to allow large vessels to pass though into the Port of London.

Interesting displays for History buffs. Have been to this exhibition a couple of times in the last few months with US visitors, a well laid out display and lots of history. Obviously great views of London and their are many surrounding places to visit.
Great experience. Really enjoyed the tour. Doesn't take long to complete but great view from the top.. They also do wedding!!!
SEE IT EVERY DAY, LOVE IT EVERY DAY. You asked me to review. Nothing to say other than it is a masterpiece and a wonderful sight for all to enjoy. On land, on the river or in the air it looks great.

Perfect if you have kids along. Great to see and tour. Plus if you have kids, which I don't, I think they would really like this tour. Seeing how the bridge works, and how the bridge was built is very interesting. If you like seeing how stuff is built, which I do, you will like this experience. The walk across the top of the bridge is neat, unfortunately it is enclosed so it fells like you are in a long room.Neat to see and great views fron the top.

Really great! A must see. The Tower Bridge is great. I love London and have been many times (almost yearly for a number of years). This is the first time to see the Tower Brudge Exhibition. It was great and I highly recommend it. You learn so much about it and you get to see it up close.
Tower Bridge. Another fine tourist site to see when in London. One of the many we go to view every time we are in London.

Tower Bridge Experience. This is a fantastic way to spend an hour or two here. The staff were informative and patient, brillant for all ages and the views from the top - breath taking. My daughter and her friend found it very informative and educational. We then went down to the engine rooms and again it was very educational. A must for children and engineering students alike. There is a small admin fee and we used our clubcard days out token.

Bet seen from the River. Read the history of the Bridge before your visit. Iconic sight of London. Viewed best from the river, or walking along the Embankment. Close to HM Belfast, and walking distance from Tower of London.
historic bridge. Amazing history surrounding this can be very busy but a must for seeing if your in london if your lucky you may even see bridge ope up to let large ships go through

Good value for money and great view. Got 2 for 1 voucher due to fact we came by train, which made it only £4 each, excellent value for money, we were lucky enough to be there when the bridge opened. Stayed in the area until nightfall and thought the new bridge lights looked lovely

What a sight!. We drove on Tower Bridge on the topless hop on hop off bus we were on top deck and what a view we had,if you visit london id advise you go see Tower Bridge its a splendid structure and just the experience of being in London makes it all the more special, and before you drive under the fab arches you are touring opposite what fab pictures you can take. Make sure you take your camera for plenty of snaps.

Worth seeing if you are in the area and have a London Pass. The Tower Bridge Exhibition offers insight into an iconic Victorian bridge. It really is quite a marvel with a fascinating history. You start by viewing an animated video about why the bridge was needed and how it was constructed. It was quite a feat for its time. You also get to go up on the walkways which offer some grand views of London. On the East Walkway there is a photo exhibit featuring information on the great bridges of the world. Nice to see Brooklyn Bridge so well represented! The exhibition also features some of the original equipment which powered the Bridge long ago. . I probably would not have gone to this exhibition if it were not for us having London Passes, which would have been our loss. While there's not that much to see, per se, it's still nice to visit, I think. That’s especially true if you’re at the Tower of London, as it is right next door. As this was a BD trip to London for my mom, she really wanted to see this beautiful bridge. So for that alone, it was worth going. So, go take a look. You don’t need a lot of time, maybe 45 min’s to an hour, tops, but it’s pretty much worth it.Hope this helps!

Terrific Views during corporate event. You can hire the top of the tower for events. Went to a corporate one - terrific views, bit cold up there though. Food at the event wasn't great but don't know who catered for it. I'm actually going back a good 10 years on this though.

A must see aspect of our capital city. When visitors come to London there are a number of landmarks that are uppermost in their minds. One of these has to be the Tower Bridge which is so different to anything else in the world it stands out so well. I have seen it from a distance during a previous visit but never had chance to get up close. With further research we found that it is possible to go along the walkways above the roadway getting a magnificent view of the river and being given a history of the bridge design.We took advantage of this using the London Pass which enabled free access and it was such an invaluable experience. I wasn't aware of the manner that the bridge was selected from others during a competition to find a suitable design. We saw all of this explained in a wonderful manner but the icing on the cake for me was a visit to the original Victorian engine rooms designed to lift the bridge. Having been trained as an engineer I appreciate this aspect and to be able to see the beautifully designed mechanicics so much more attractive than modern hardware. I strongly recommend this complete trip. Many people don't realise it can be done and it's a worthwhile experience. Especially so if you have a London Pass.

It was worth my time.. I was just passing by and suddenly wanted to see the interior. For me it was a good call, as there are detailed information on how it was engineered and designed. Besides, it was really cool to walk inside the towers and see London from up high.

The Exhibition is Boring. Visited the Tower Bridge exhibition as part of a honeymoon trip to London in early September 2012 with my new husband.As a piece of architecture the bridge is lovely to look at. It's an iconic part of London and to actually see it up close and to cross it is a must see. It's also fun watching the bridge lifting up to allow big boats through (and it was nice to see the paralympic rings which were still in place when we went as we didn't get a chance to see the full Olympic ones).However, the exhibition inside is simply not worth it. It usually costs £8 each to get into which is astronomically overpriced considering how little you actually get to see in the exhibition (more on this in a moment). We visited because we were in the area and had The London Pass and wanted to utilise it as much as possible. I'm not sure we would've bothered otherwise!Upon entering Tower Bridge you have to go through ridiculous airport style security checks and scans and wait in line for the elevator that takes you 42 metres above the Themes. The elevators are packed like sardine tins so if you're claustrophobic I doubt this attraction will appeal to you. Also while waiting for the elevator at the bottom there's one of those 'have your photograph taken in front of a green screen and buy expensive products at the end with the tower superimposed in the background' thingies. There's no room for this at all in the Tower. Space is limited as it is and to cram a photo area into the middle of the queue for the lifts is ludicrous.Anyway, once out of the lift at the top you watch a really hammy video about the design and planning process of the Tower which really doesn't tell you a great deal and the acting is so awful it puts you off the content anyway. This part of the tour seems compulsory, possibly to make sure there's enough space for new groups on the walkways. Fair enough I suppose, I know I wouldn't have enjoyed an overly packed journey out there but they could've at least made the video better. It's like one of those awful things you're made to sit through at secondary school.The walkways themselves are okay, the views spectacular although the views from one walkway is better than the other (on one side you have the spectacular St Paul's Cathedral, The Tower of London and HMS Belfast etc and on the other you get the unspectacular old docks, people's houses and the boring Canary Wharf complex etc) but the windows are a little dirty and some of the views are thus obscured by filth.There are two exhibitions. The one in the West Walkway is about cities of the Olympic Games (really just a series of photographs) and the one in the East Walkway features an exhibition on great bridges of the world (which is, again, a series of photographs). Really these have no bearing on Tower Bridge at all and are boring. They add nothing to the experience and once you've looked at a few of the photographs it all gets a bit monotonous. I suppose your main focus isn't supposed to be on these though but on the views outside the windows (and if that's the case then why aren't they clean!) but it still doesn't justify the £8 per person admission cost.There's a few other bits and pieces to view once you get off the walkways such as a video showing the construction of the bridge (I liked this and thought it should've been done earlier in the tour) and a few random metal plaques with neon lights as you go down the stairs towards the exit.Didn't visit the engine rooms as we were pressed for time but I'm sure they would've been more interesting than the Tower itself. Mercifully the whole thing didn't last long but I won't visit again as it was a huge disappointment.

Iconic Site. This is just an iconic site in London, definitely a must visit. I have not done the tour of the bridge, simply viewed it and walked across it. Certainly worth a stop and photo opp at the least.

Meh.... I visited London recently on business and took a few extra days to do some exploring around London. At the top of my list of course was the Tower of London and the Tower Bridge. Overall, London is VERY easy to get around via both the bus and metro. Although you will see much more of London if you take the bus, traffic can also be very congested, so for me my preference was to take the Metro. Public transportation in and around London is safe, efficient, easy and cheap.Having said all that. Tower bridge and the Tower of London are within walking distance of one another, so if you plan on seeing one you might as well see both. You should give yourself about 2-3 hours to see the Tower of London, and maybe a 1/2 hour to see Tower Bridge.My personal opinion is that Tower Bridge is absolutely beautiful. From the outside, and most especially at night when it is all lit up, it is well worth seeing. As for taking a tour on the inside, I thought it was just ok. The windows are very cloudy and it's rather difficult to get a good view of London without feeling as though that view is rather obstructed. Inside there are photos and background information on other famous bridges throughout the world. Not that it wasn't interesting-ish, but I don't think there was really enough to make this walkthrough worth the money. I had the London Pass, so it was covered so I didn't have to pay an entrance fee, but if I had, I think I would have considered it an even bigger dissapointment. So having said all that, if you have the London Pass and your at the Tower of London, give it a go. If you have to pay for it outright, it might just be nice to view it from below because it really is quite exceptional to see.As for the London Pass which I referenced earlier, depending on the amount of time you have in London, it might not be a bad idea to get the London Pass. If you are staying 3-5 days, the pass becomes much more economical and essentially grants you 'free' pass to almost all attractions in London. Place your order for the London pass before you go and you will be able to either pick it up right there in central London or possibly have it mailed to you. It saved me quite a bit of money on the trip. You can find it quite easily with a google search. Also, buy a day or week pass to the metro - it covers both buses and the underground, and is fairly inexpensive. I was able to take the metro from the airport to the hotel. Cost me about 8 euro (for a day pass). The business associate I met up with at the hotel got a taxi from the airport. He spent 65 euro and it took him roughly the same amount of time to get to the hotel as it took me. Just some food for thought. They have an excellent (and safe) public transportation system.
During the Olympics, I went. Awesome, this is! Walking through it, was interesting. Views, are splendid! With the Olympic Logo, it was fantastic for photographs!
nice day out. was due to go elsewhere but this being London on a weekend tubes were messed up, so went here. staff were happy and helpful. views were great and bathrooms spotless

Olympic travels. Walking and riding around on the Underground we had to visit and see the Olympic rings on the bridge. Walking around to get there were all the Olympic logos of the sports on the sidewalk. As we got to the bridge it is pretty amazing to actually see it instead of on TV. Passing over it they have tours you can pay for to see the history of the bridge. On the other side is a ginormus castle I didnt get to go to because we were pressed for time. Nice place!!

One of my favourite bridges.. If you like bridges this is one of London's finest. Great architecture and views across the Thames. Near Tower Bridge underground station & plenty of places to eat and drink in the vicinity.

Historical stroll. It was cook to finally witness this historic bridge up close and to stroll across it sbnapping pictures every step of the way. We did not take the advantage of a tour, but just enjoyed the views. The lovers messages inscribed on padlocks that were locked in the middle of the span were especially moving.

Great Views. Tower Bridge has got to be one of my favourite buildings in London. We were there when they lifted the centre to allow a sail boat to pass under. Seeing the road upright was weird. The videos they showed were informative. And the views from the walkways were amazing. There was even a game of quoits going on at the end of one walkway. Great for the kids to have a go at.Look out for the "Men" sitting on the beams as you look up into the Towers themselves. Gift shop was a bit poor. But the staff were friendly. Totally worth the entrance fee.

Best Bridge for Fireworks. This is one of the best bridges in London - you can see for miles and the recent fireworks display held from the bridge was brilliant. You can hire the walk way that runs across the top of the bridge and light it up with your own corporate colours, a great place to host cocktail reception particularly now the christmas season is upon us!
And if lifted as I sailed underneath!. A nightime boat ride, and the bridge lifted - what an awesome site! Just need a few fireworks now and it would be complete!

Amazing views of Olympic Games preparations and Olympic rings on bridge. We adored going to Tower Bridge in July 2012.We went inside first for the Tower experience and saw amazing aerial views of London from the highest points inside the bridge .......There is history of London Bridge given and is well worth the experience and the views .......There were giant Olympic rings attached to the bridge and there were also giant Olympic rings in the river Thames in preparation for the Olympic Games. We were lucky to see the bridge open to let a tall ship through while we were walking away along the river towards City Hall and later in the night we saw Tower Bridge lit up that was truly magical and made the whole experience very special!

Iconic structure of London City. There is nothing much to see from the inside of this, its best to see from a distance. Make sure you have a good DSLR camera to get quality long range shots of this structure. Its a must see bridge in London.

London Bridge. I heard it was falling down? sorely disappointing. The actual Bridge is quite nice and scenic. The Olympic banners were still up when i was there. Its nice to check out in conjunciton with the london crown jewels.

An iconic symbol of London. Tower Bridge is possibly the most photographed bridge in the world and im not surprised considering its beauty. Just like most things in London, it is an ornate and old and the design and architecture is amazing.It was built in 1894 and took 8 years, five major contractors and the labor of 432 men to construct It is close to the Tower of London, from which it takes its name.While walking across the beautiful Victorian Gothic style bridge , you can enjoy panoramic views of London, a great experience for anyone visiting London.
A must-see attraction. Something you simply can't miss if you head to London - see it from London Bridge, and then walk across it to get the full experience.

Amazing experience!. It's great to see what history goes behind such an amazing building! It was brought nice, too! You could see a movie of the 'maker' of the bridge! Very nice! We had a London Pass so it was good that it's included in a citytrip to Londen! Awesome!

Sky walk the Thames. We arrived expecting to queue but straight up on the lift to walk across the Tower Bridge and have panoramic views up and down the Thames. Good information on how the bridge was built and works presented. Worth a visit

Not to be Missed.. I have visited the bridge many times and I am always glad to go again.It is so unique. To stand on the point where the two sections of the bridge meets as a bus crosses the bridge and feel the movement is as much fun now as it was when I was a child. The view along the Thames in front, the Tower of London to your right and the river walkway to your left with the Belfast (ship) anchored there, magic ! Real London,and so much more to see than I have mentioned. A tour of the Bridge and how it works is so interesting, don't miss it.

Glad we went. A little pricey but nice views, interesting film clips and friendly staff.Athough views not as good as the London Eye, they are different views and it was interesting to learn about how it came about and the building of it.My daughter found this interesting and loved the games and stickers.Child friendly (although I would recommend 4+). Not easy for those less mobile but there is a lift if you are prepared to wait for it.
an iconic bridge. one of London's best sights. never ceases to impress me. the sheer size and intricacy of the steel work. and the Tower of London close by. great place to while away the hours.

Iconic, with great little boutique shops nearby. The Tower Bridge experience speaks for itself really, iconic with the WOW factor but the trip was made for us by the little boutiquey shops in the nearby small streets (possibly known as Shad Thames?)

A must see attraction in London (we got to see Olympic rings!!!!). I think the Tower Bridge and Big Ben are tied for the most famous London landmarks. We took several photos of both. We were thrilled to get a pic while the Olympic rings were on display for the 2012 Olympics. The rings came down on the last day of our trip. We loved seeing this bridge!

Surprised that I enjoyed it!. I thought it would be a really boring and "family-like" exhibition but it was actually really interesting and a quite in-depth study of the Bridge. However, I think they could have spend more time on the videos and less on the engines room that is too complicated for children and even adults sometimes.
Incredible architecture. Just see it from afar and take pics of it. Look at it with great detail and walk over it. Look at the Thames while crossing it and above. What a sight!

Not really worth it. Check the tower out from the outside rather than paying for admission. There's much better views you can get around London, and the "exhibitions" inside the bridge are basically just information boards with a couple of nice pictures, telling you about other bridges aroudn the world and other olympics which have been happening.If you've got a limited time in London, don't bother (unless you've got a london pass) - just check it out from the outside without paying!
Best time to visit Summer.. Here you have a history with real picture which will thrill you always forever.Its better if you bring your child and show them around the history with information.

just skip it. you know you are in trouble when a very cheesy video starts the tour. very poor animated sequence.a case of irony: the exhibitors claim the tower bridge to be the most famous in the world - hah! - and fill the walkway across the bridge with pictures of other bridges, including the far more famous golden gate bridge, reveals the sad truth: you go for the view. it is still not the best view in london, try the top of st. pauls.

A lovely stroll across.. We went to see the tower bridge after we walked around the Tower of London. When we left the Tower of London we were hoping to see the Olympic rings still on the bridge but alas they were taken down and the Paralympics symbol was up instead. We decided not to visit the exhibit in the bridge instead we took a lovely stroll across the bridge. While somewhat crowded there were a ton of picture taking opportunities. Great views of the city and of the outside of the Tower of London can be had. This is great to do before or after the Tower of London so make sure to add it on that days itinerary.
This is a good filler...... if you have only an hour or so to spare. Very interesting and the views were spectacular. Go on a 2 for 1 offer and it is amazing value for money.

Stunning landmark!. I love Tower Bridge, a real landmark and lovely to view from the river side as well as to walk over, we couldn't go up inside the bridge which was a disappointment as we were too late but I have been recommended to do this!
A Little piece of History, London. Fab seeing the Olympic rings, went on many ocassions and watched people take pictures. Also took pictures of couples on their behalf. Lots for peopleto see

What a landmark!!. Wow - so breathtaking - during the day and at night - recommend taking the number 78 bus across and walk back as gives a better impression and even better if you can time a bridge lift into it!! This information can be found under a google search!!
London Bridge. London Bridge is a beautiful bridge to walk over and it is lovely and looks like it has been having people walking over it for centrys and centrys and its a good experience!

Tower Bridge. The Tower Bridge is a nice bridge and is in the outskirts/centre of London and it just looks lovely!
The only drawback is that we don't see it go up often enough!

Quick attraction. Visited here on Sunday 26th August with my husband and 13 year old son. We had a 2 for 1 voucher so paid £11.40 for the three of us which was a fair price. I might have felt a bit ripped off had we paid the extra £9.00.It doesn't take long to do this attraction, we queued for about 10 minutes to get tickets then took the lift up to the top. The views are great and there are two walkways with opposite views. There are some interesting facts and pictures along the walkways. There are a couple of short film clips to watch at the top and then you get the lift back down and go to the engine room. All in all this probably takes 30-40 minutes to complete.I am glad we did this attraction but doubt I would revisit any time soon simply because once you have seen it there is nothing more to see. If you haven't been before I would recommend going but try and get a discount from somewhere by searching the internet first.

Excellent attraction and a decent price for the city!. We stumbled upon this after a cruise up the river on one of the boats. The children wanted to go in and we were pleasantly surprised by the fact the cost wasn't extortionate. (£18 for 2 adults and 2 children with 2 under 5's free) Initially you are offered a picture you can purchase later on. We didnt bother with this as we had our own camera with us. You go up in a lift to the top of one of the towers where you are shown a short and interesting film about how the bridge came to be. The children were given quizzes to do which they found quite exciting, and there were at least 2 interactive games for them to play, manned by tower staff. The walk across the very top meant a stunning view, and some of the literature on bridges was actually quite interesting. The other side currently has an olympic display which in all honesty we didnt find that great, but the second short film was again quite interesting. We had the pushchair with us and were able to use lifts to all areas. It was then a short walk back across the bridge and down to the engine rooms. (Note: the lift is signposted with a little blue sign but is not at the end of the blue walkway you are asked to follow, instead being two thirds of the way along) The engine rooms were very impressive... and for families with young children its worth noting the WC's are just by reception! And the children also liked the giant boilers. There were more games for the kiddies to play whilst we watched a film on how the lit the towers. Finally the gift shop gave away free choccy medals for the completed (or semi completed) kids quizzes and we were able to purchase a few souvenirs at not too great a cost. Its not a long exhibit, probably 1 - 1 and half hrs tops, but it was very interesting and we are glad we came across it.
Good views even on a dull day!. Pleasant staff. Good exhibition. Well-thought out quiz for kids. Good 4 min explanatory film. Make sure you buy the joint ticket with the Monument!

Marchoness. I remember a few years ago, I was on the Marchoness! and it was a week before the tradgedy! I actually loved my evening on this boat, and actually took the steering wheel, and steered it under this bridge, so really fond memories for me! until the tragic disaster! Even though I saw the horrific tv, I will not let my four girls travel on the thames, only because of my memories! and my "close call". The bridge looks amazing! and shouldnt be put off by my close encounter with tradgedy! So many people, travel on the river every day, weekend, and should not be put off by my review!

Worth doing. Very interesting thing to do. Gives you the history of the bridge and other world famous bridges. The views from the walkways are brilliant and seeing the engine rooms is another interesting part of the experience. The staff are very good and informative which all helps to make it a very good place to visit.

Great View !. Tower Bridge, one of London’s most famous landmarks, it has a two sided suspension bridge combined with a spectacular drawbridge completely accessible, surrounding areas are rich in culture and heritage.I should get up early to witness this soft, backlit view of London's illustrious icon and photograph it before everybody show up from every direction, as you know some of us travelers are not always a early riser. Walking on the Tower bridge is fun, people smile at each other, when the traditional red double deck bus goes by, people yell and wave at ya ! It's fun yet bit silly. LOL. I thought I could walk all around the bridge and photograph it from all different angles, till I realize it is very BIG area to cover in one day. On my next trip to Tower Bridge, maybe I should rent a bike instead.UK weather been good to me during my entire visit, therefore, I could take many photos in good light. Too bad there's not much to do on the bridge but soak in the great view!
Walking The Tower. Fantastic views from Tower walk way. What a thing to do walk around inside Tower Bridge.Informative videos show the construction and working of the bridge.

iconic. it is hard to miss tower bridge if you are in london for any amount of time, and it sits right next to the tower of london...a cool place to go to get some cityscapes, and a beautiful and unique bridge in its own right.

A London Bridge. This should not be confused with Tower Bridge. London Bridge is just an ordinary bridge accross the Thames. Nice views from it, though.
You can see Tower Bridge and various London buildings. Certainly not worth a spcial visit.
Superb!. So worth going to have a look at, boat trip are really good too, you must walk across it! Lots of people so keep child close.

Stunning Tower Bridge. Tower Bridge experience is just wonderful! The Exhibition at Tower Bridge has some stunning views of London from the high level walkways. The Victorian Engine Rooms gives a learning experience about the inner workings of the Most Famous Bridge in the World. There is a fee to enter the exhibition.Night views of the bridge is just stunning, especially during the London Olympics 2012. Lots of people and buzzing place with lots of light shows on the tower itself.
Links London. You see it in most London shots but the tower bridge over the thames was a wonderful sight to see and go over. Old stone charm that you must go over.

A must in London.. You can see only from the outside if you decide to, but pay 8£ and go inside because it's totally worth it, the show you a little movie about the bridge's history, you can cross the bridge in a upper level (Inside only) and at the end you can see the backstage (Machine room) where the motors the lift the bridge are. It's a very good attraction.
Excellent view!. Our hotel was situated right by the bridge, and on it the views were just spectacular. You can see lots and it's stunning on a nice sunny day.
Beautiful. Love the view of the bridge. It was during the olympics and the olympics logo was on the bridge. However I dislike the construction work beside the bridge which spoils the view.

Do the tour!. Although seeing the outside of the Tower Bridge is free, and absolutely beautiful, it's not very expensive to also tour the Tower Bridge Exhibition. You get to climb up to the top of the bridge and walk along the connecting walkway! There are historical plaques and presentations, but it's worth it just for the view from the top. Definitely consider it!
OK but stiflingly hot in the walkways. Good views from the walkways - especially when the bridge opens. Engine room fascinating - really clever these Victorian engineers

Worth a visit. A surprisingly good couple of hours spent with a group of excitable school kids suspended over the Thames. Loved the views and the wow factor when the bridge went up! Bridge goes up once a day at 11am so time your visit carefully.

Surprisingly good attraction!. For some reason, my two sons (age 14 & 11) really wanted to tour the Tower Bridge...I was thinking, yawn, how boring will this be? I couldn't have been more wrong! The sights from the bridge, the informational section on other bridges, the games after the workings of the bridge...it was very interesting, interactive and fun. My younger son was completely thrilled that he earned a "gold" medal while the older boy got "silver"!. Just last night, when talking about the trip, both mentioned the Tower Bridge experience as a highlight of London.

London landmark. We enjoyed seeing it both at night and during the day. It looks a bit different depending on the time of your visit. During the Olympics it was all lit up with the 5 rings, and I heard that when the paralympics started, they changed it to 3 crescents. What a great way to celebrate the athletes. We also went from here to Katherine Docks and also to the Tower of London. Great walking tour within reach of the bridge.

iconic. the scale is amazing and it gives to a very great sense of solidity a really great piece of architectural history a London landmark the all tourists should make a bee line for the views are wonderful and at night it is magical .

The emblem of London. When you in London you will visit the place for that all important snap. But there's more to the area. Make sure you visit in the day and again at night as its totally different. Other that the usual tourist sites around, make sure you go to St. Katharine's Docks....it always blows me away and you would miss it if you don't look for it..great place to eat and drink during the day and late into the night. Have fun !

Tower bridge Never disappoints. Something about it, go over it from the south bank, and instead of going straight on to the Tower of London, take a right and go through the arch into St Catherines dock.. Well worth a visit.

Great value. A great opportunity to learn about this wonderful landmark and iconic bridge. The engine room was very interesting and their were activities for children. Family tickets available which provide good value.

Captain on the bridge. Even though it is theoretically a must see, it is actually a disappointment. The tour is not fantastic and the exhibition not worthy to take a look at. However, the view is stunning and you should take some pics from the bridge.

The most beautiful bridge in the world!. Tower Bridge is one of THE must sees in London. Instantly recognisable and famous.Never have paid to do the tour but their are stunning views from the pier and fromon the bridge itself. The bridge has so much detail and is worth a visit day and night as it looks just as stunning after dark.Try and fin out the opening times to tie in with your visit.A must see!

Drive or Walk Across or Travel Under by Boat. I always love a bridge that can be accessed by foot. This bridge offers great views of London and makes it easy to walk from the London Eye, or the South Bank Lion to the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey, and onward to Buckingham's Palace.
It's a bridge. OIt's a tourist a ttraction but it's a bridge! Try Butlers Wharf / Shad Thames on the South Bank of the River for some great restaurants.
Tower Bridge in all her Glory!. Wonderful free walk. The Bridge is best visited early morning or late at night! Any season any time of the year.

Views of London and the Thames. Great views of London ancient and modern from this location. Exhibition of the cities of the Olympic Games on the walkway was excellent too. Beautiful day on our visit gave an impression of blue and white all around.
One of my top five favorite bridges in the world.. Tower Bridge is often mistaken for the not as pretty London Bridge. This bridge is a wonderful part of the Thames riverfront.
Iconic Bridge. If you are going to cross the Thames at some point in London then do it via this one. In my opinion this is the best bridge in the world to look at.
Great bridge. Terrific views and very interesting explannations and illustrations of bridge types and famous bridges Round the world. Basic but informative Olympic exhibition.

What a bridge. Wow the bridge done 100 yrs ago is a royal masterpiece of architecture. The structure is huge and offers exhibition of its facilities. The exhibition of Tower bridge gives insight into its inception. Enjoy the bridge in the evening at 7pm when it is opened on river thames for ship movement.
Gouman hotel. Stayed at the gunman hotel room overlooking the dock great place to stay central for sightseeing lots of restaurants close by and easy parking below

Best photo spot in London!. I think this is the best photo spot in London! My cousin and I were here during the Olympics, and it especially looks cool with the rings. We also went up on the bridge, which provides and excellent view of the river and a nice summer breeze. A must see in London!

Iconic bridge, great views!. So glad we made it there on time to visit. The London Pass is full of so many great things to see it's hard to pack everything into 3 days. The views are great and the engine rooms are interesting.

Gorgeous with Olympic rings. We had some great photo opportunities of the colorful Tower Bridge with the Olympic rings during the Olympics. It's easy to visit here as it's close to Tower Hill tube station. We walked across the bridge and were able to walk the Olympics on a huge screen on the South side of the Thames with locals and other tourists. It was a wonderful experience. To top it off, while we were watching the Olympics, the bridge went up to allow a boat to pass through, which is apparently does not happen often. It's an easy walk across the Thames for any reasonably fit person. We also took a boat ride on the Thames (highly recommended) from Westminster and went under the bridge for a different view of the sights.

I love this Iconic bridge. Tower Bridge is such a stunning piece of work. The fantastic design which incorporates ample walkways and vehicle trafic to use it is just great. I always try to visit when I'm in London. And its even pretier at night when its all lit up. A truely great visitor attraction.
Wow Tower Bridge. We were so impressed at the awesomeness of London in general this year, Tower Bridge with its lights and Olympic rings was a huge scenic highlight of this.

Unique Bridge. Look from both sides of the river. The views are great. From the North see the London Assembly building and The Shard. From the South side, see the Gherkin and other London Landmarks. If you have the time and the energy, walk all the way to Westminster. It's a great walk!Nearest station is Tower Hill on the District Line

Typical London. A London trip is not complete without seeing the Tower Bridge. If you have enough time, you can enter the tower, but the exterior is nice aswell. Maybe leave the interior for a next visit.
London Bridge. The real London Bridge right across the Thames. Level 1 with the short video was interesting. The rest is just a walk through. But to be seen atleast once when you are there.

Beautiful!!. The bridge is a must see when sightseeing in london! The is beautiful especially with the special olympic rings hanging from it. It is a even more beautiful sight at night when the lights are turned on. For the best view of the bridge I recommend booking a famous Thames river cruise that take you from tower bridge all the way to westminister pier where big ben. The view is divine and I would recommend anyone there for sightseeing to go see it.
This is "London Bridge". Of course it's not REALLY London Bridge, but this is what we all think of as London Bridge. Its big and beautiful so be sure to stop by and get a closer look
Worth a visit. We went round Tower Bridge last year & really emjoyed it, especially the Victorian engine mechaism. This si no longer in use, but is on display and akes youproud of our heritage.

Fantastic value for money. £8.00 per person to go in and money well spent on an attraction, information, interesting and great views across London, and down below.
Steam engines are kept in fantastic condition.
Tower Bridge experience. A great visit and must with the Tower of London just there a combined visit is a must but make this the first stop of the day

Tower Bridge. I was there during the Olympics and to see the rings on the Tower Bridge was amazing. I had been there a few days earlier when the rings were up due to strong winds, but it was definitely worth going back to. Great atmosphere in the area aswell

Great place to watch the Olympics. Good Big Screen TV to watch the Olympics...with a green grass area and the lovely backdrop of the bridge and River.....close to Pub and other eateries. Very nice area to enjoy sitting and watching!

Worth going inside. It is a fantastic iconic landmark in London and always worth just looking at but actually going inside, down in the Pump Room or up on the Gallery across the road is even better and worth a trip

Great experience. The entrance to the exhibition is on the bridge itself, you then take a lift to the top of one of the towers. A short video plays telling you who built the bridge. Then you can walk across one of the walkways to the other tower. Although its an enclosed walkway you can still see out along way and take photos well. Another short video plays in the other tower and then you can walk Dow he other side giving you views of the other direction. A lift takes you back down to the street and then the second part of the exhibition is just a little way along the road. Here is housed the steam engines which used to lift the bridge. Very interesting and we were lucky enough to see the bridge open afterwards. Well worth a visit.
excellent. this place is great and must visit. London visit incomplete without visiting this place. we were too amazed with this place and visited 3 4 times during my whole stay in London
A London icon. Tower Bridge remains the most iconic of London bridges and it deserves the title. Whenever I return to London it is the sight of the Bridge that reminds me that i am home.

Great History With A View. Very informative and interesting with a nice little video at the begining. The walkways have some pretty good views up and down the river. Good for short visits for people of all ages. Lower price than many things in London too.

Great History With A View. Very informative and interesting with a nice little video at the begining. The walkways have some pretty good views up and down the river. Good for short visits for people of all ages. Lower price than many things in London too.

Discovered this by accident. We had wanted to visit the Tower of London, but got there with only an hour before close, so had to postpone to another day. So, we walked over to the iconic Tower Bridge for a look. Yes, it is good for some pictures, and views of the Thames, but there are exhibits here as well. We got to see the original steam machinery that raised and lowered the bridge, go up in the towers, and walk across the HIGH part of the bridge. An interesting diversion.

STUNNING!! FIVE STARS!!. I was hoping to get good photos of the bridge and the Olympic rings.I ended up with great photos.This place is amazing at sunset and absolutely stunning at night, with the array of light changes on the bridge itself, wait for your favorite be it red, green, blue, white, or combination.The Olympic rings are equally as stunning.HINT-- walk down Thames river from the London Bridge, and talk the Queen's Walkway. You'll pass the HMS Belfast and pubs on the walk and pause for some breathtaking views of the bridge from the west side.Take your tripod for night photos and have a pint at a nearby pub. A perfect night!!
London Bridge and the Monument. the best thing about it is that there is a lovely little model of the old bridge in a church nearby (the victorian bridge is in lake havasu city, USA.)

Tower Bridge. It's an iconic architectural masterpience that commands that it factor. It's a palace rising out of the river or a fortress dark and ominous. It's grand like few other bridges are. It's a one of a kind part suspension and part bascule. It opens 3X per day. The times can be checked on the bridges website. Easy to get to by the tube (hop off at the Westminster Station). If you have a London Pass it can be used here. Costing 8 Pounds at the Bridge ticket booth, discount tickets are available online of 20%. 2 for 1 coupons are also sometimes available. It's also on the Hop On Hop Off bus tour. The Tower Bridge Exhibition Tour includes: a video about how it got started and it's design, walkway on the top with wonderful views and information posters about the bridge and other bridges around the world, and a tour of the engine room that opens the bridge. You can be Photoshopped in front of the bridge. I can't remember the price.

Good attraction. The bridge always looked great, but I decided to go up to see the exhibition. Totally worth it, starts with a video of why the bridge was built and later on there is another showing the scematics on how it was built. in between there is this exhibition on the great bridges of the world, which makes an interesting vieweing. They have started an exhibition on the Olympic cities as well, with small nuggets of info. The views are great as well, especially since I had gone on a rare sunny clear day! :) After this, you go down to the engine room, below the bridge. Fascinating to see how they managed this during the Victorian days and how they have changed to modern electric engines. All in all, a great visit.

A must do attraction!. A lovely way to spend a couple of hours.I was really impressed by how accessible the attraction is for wheelchairs/pushchairs.Large lifts and plenty of space to enable you to take a pushchair on the whole tour.Staff were very friendly and helpful and happy to chat if there was anything you wanted to ask.As you travel up in the lift the guide tells you to take as much time as you need and enjoy the views at leisure,which is a refreshing change for a London attraction as you don't feel rushed.Once at the top the views are spectacular with plenty of room for everyone to get a good view.Lots of interesting, easy to read information on Tower Bridges history and clear and simple photographs and signage to make it easy to identify all the buildings and landmarks.At the moment Olympic rings are decorating the bridge and there is an Olympic activity trail for children to complete with a chocolate medal at the end!.Will definitely revisit,combining it with a trip to the Tower of London next time!.

See the Tower Bridge lift up. We were visiting Covent Garden Market purchasing a watercolor from artist John Pester www.johnpester.co.uk one was of a view of the Tower Bridge he suggested we go see the bridge lift up 3:30pm and 5:15pm. We planned it just right to see the bridge go up at 3:30 went and had lunch at the Nicholson's pub at Hay's wharf and back in time to see and be on the bridge for the 5:15 raising. You can go on line at this website to see times the bridge will go up to plan your day. http://www.towerbridge.org.uk/TBE/EN/BridgeLiftTimes/ It is really a beautiful site. Especially if a Tall ship is going through.

Fantastic bridge to walk over with an ice cream!. After visiting the Royal Academy of Arts in London, my friend and I decided to walk down the Thames to Tower Bridge. As this was a few days before the London Olympic Opening Ceremony, the Olympic rings were displayed hanging from the top of the Bridge. They looked fantastic and gave the bridge a new, spectacular appearance. Living just outside London, this was not the first time I had visited the bridge, and as usual, it did not fail to impress.

Always a treat.. This is the prettiest bridge in London and if you're really lucky you'll get to see it rise it's draw bridge. Right now it is decked out in Olympic Rings which is a sight to behold. You really should see it both in the night and day to get the full effect. I'd suggest cruising under it as well on the boat to Greenwich.

Great attraction. Tower Bridge is loads of fun. It has a nice little movie introduction to set the scene on the history, and it has very detailed plaques around the site. At the end there was also the option to do a video message to family and friends via email which was a great little attraction and for free!

Potters field park. The best place to enjoy this is from Potters field park accross the river from the Tower of London. Not only can you sit with a picnic with a fantastic view of the Bridge, but it is fairly peaceful and also has a great view of the tower and the river.

Gorgeous bridge with gorgeous view. The Tower Bridge experience was something I’ll never forget and I recommend everyone to visit the inside of the Tower Bridge! The wonderful view from the bridge’s walkway is amazing and great for photos. We watched to short clips about the bridge’s history and on the bridge’s walkway, we learned about many bridges from around the world and saw the great photographs! Also we got to see the engine rooms, which were very interesting because we saw the Victorian style machines and gears that operated the bridge! We were also lucky enough to see the Olympic sign hang down from the tower and to see the Tower Bridge open up twice to let boats through! The cost is reasonable (around 8-9 pounds for 1 adult and two children) and it’s worth the visit!
Interesting!. Great view over the Thames and interesting walk in the former engine rooms. You are not allowed to take pictures inside.

DON'T Miss this one!. London is my home away from home. I spend 3 days a week here. There are more attractions in this city than you could see in two weeks but if you only had one day I would go see the Tower of London. Take the tour with a Beefeater. See the crown jewels. Hear the stories of the famous people kept and killed in the Tower. Take the underground to the Tower of London and plan to spend a 2-3 hours. It is worth every cent and minute. It is absolutely a "Not to be missed" destination.

Unplanned trip. Went for a walk over the bridge with the intention of finding a bar in the wharf but ended up paying to walk around the engine rooms and going up the towers and admiring the views across the city.Worth the money, and on a clear day (which we do have in England) the view from the covered walkways between the towers is a photographers must.A well put together display

Great if your interested in engineering etc. 2 of my friends were really into this and im sure if your into building and engineering its great. I personally was bored to death but thats just beacause I wasn't interested!! They both loved it and it did have some nice views of London.
Views!. You can write to the Prime Minister to ask to climb Tower Bridge as everyone in Britian has the right to climb free of charge there is a 6mths waiting list or you can pay once you arrive.
The most famous bridge in the world!. Sydney? San Francisco? They're certainly great, but Tower Bridge - it's just no contest!

Well done to London municipality for the signs on the road. One of the symbol of London- very heavy, impressive, full of life. Very nice view from the bridge or to the bridge and it reminds you a scene from a James Bond movie. Signs on the road help you to arrive in one piece - well done to London municipality.
Bridge. God only knows what I was expecting. I specifically went to see the bridge open up. Well did that and it left me a little flat.
Great Views. I have been up on the Bridge and the views are amazing, absolute genius piece of engineering and such fine architecture.

Superb views of the River. Originally powered by steam, the drawbridge is now opened by electric rams, when big ships need to venture so far. The twin drawbridges weigh about 1'000 tonnes and it takes just 90 seconds to rise. All the original machinery is used except that electric motors have replaced the steam engines. A must for a walk,
Unique Design. I love the bridge itself which is an London icon and I love the surroundings but thenuseum experience isn't great

well worth it. you get to walk across the top of the bridge, make sure you haven't done too much walking that day as it's over 300 steps up and then again down, we did it at night, London looks amazing at night
Bridge. It's really nice place to visit ..I crossed that side a few times but still wanted to c more of it ..
history at your feet. trilling to see it in person and actually walk across the thames.
don't miss it. really informative, interesting, worth the time and cost.
Nice to see. It is nice to see but then you just move on. It is a landmark so you must see it but don't go out of your way.

Worth the Price of Admission. I know that some tour books about London will say that the price to enter the inside of Tower Bridge is high, but it is worth the every penny. The views from the walkways above alone are worth the price, but the other portions of the tour are well worth your time, and the price of admission. You have the opportunity to see the Victorian-era machines that kept the bridge operating efficiently since from the moment it was made operational, as well as other areas of the bridge. This tour is definitely a must when you are in the area of the bridge.

Did lots of learning!. First, I laughed at my utter stupidity when i found out that London Bridge was actually the plain, stone bridge across from this bridge, the Tower Bridge. I took a tour of the top of the bridge and marveled at the engineering needed to create this spectacle of the bridge. I then recommend just strolling along the bridge, watching the cars and the view, especially nice during sunset.

Tower Bridge Exhibition.. Visited Tower Bridge in July 2012 with my 8yr old Granddaughter and we both really enjoyed the visit,loved reading the history`s of all the bridges from around the world that are displayed with photographs on the walkways,the engineering is wonderful too see,views are great of the thames,east & west of the bridge,just pray for a sunny day!!guides are helpful and stay in the background unless you need information,the cost is very reasonable especially if your a senior or child,well worth a visit.
Great views. I didn't take a tour, but walked around on my own which was great. Amazing views and a beautiful walk.

Best of Bridges. As a Londoner, Tower Bridge never becomes boring to look at, but I had never actually been in it until last week.The tour costs £8 and the views from the top are stunning. It was worth the money as it goes towards the upkeep of this stunning structure. The tour was very informative and it was fascinating to hear of other designs that were originally put forward when a new bridge was needed. If you time it right, you can also be back at the bottom to watch the Tower rise toLet boats through. I love this bridge. Fantastic symbol of London!
Beautiful view. This is NOT London Bridge! Fascinating engineering for the times, beautiful view of the Thames.

Very interesting!. Really liked the tour of the bridge. We basically came to see the Olympic rings and saw that there was a tour. Hubby thoroughly enjoyed the Engineering Room!Views from the bridge were great and the history of the Olympics and construction of the bridge were interesting. Length of video just right. There were things for kids to do as well.
London Pass the time :). If you get a London pass then its worth a visit. The best bit is getting to walk across the top to the other tower.

Love it.. Real London landmark. Spectacular seeing it raised! HAve been lucky enough to be in boat when the bridge has gone up makes you feel like royalty. By the way my now husband of 21years proposed to me on this bridge so views mya not be independent.

Old bridge. It's a symbol of London, so you must see it if you are in London. There are so many stories about murders, suiciders and ghosts around that bridge that, even if you don't believe in them, you might feel having a paranormal experience. Leaving the joke on the side, you must see this construction. It's a perfect place to take facebook profile pics :) and it easy to access. You may even cross it by walking, bus or car. If you use a travelling way, make sure to stop and spend some time on the bridge. Unfortunately, it is closed to the down side of the bridge so you can't go down anymore and see the catacombs.

Beautiful structure. It was an interesting trip for us group of 4. We visited London on a weekend trip and we walked from the train station to London Bridge and made a round to the Tower Bridge. It is a beautiful design. Highly recommend anyone who has never been to at least make a quick visit while in London.

A drive over the bridge. Only last week I drove over this amazing bridge and if you are lucky to go slow over it and at dusk you can enjoy the splendor of this beautifully stunning piece of workmanship at its best

FUN AND INFORMATIVE. I visited Tower Bridge and enjoyed the leisurely stroll across the bridge and the views from it, I then enter the exhibition and paid eight pound entrance fee and there was a small video included in the cost. You then walked thru the Tower Bridge exibition at your leisure and had a self guided tour as all information was at each point of interest. The view from the top level of the tower was fantastc as was the wheels in the engine room at the bottom of the tower -- This is something everyone should do if they visit London

Excellent, great views.. My second visit to the Tower Bridge. Having gone about 12 years ago, there is much more to see. When we visited, there were free olympic games for the children, ring tosses, etc. And medals won at the end of the tour. It's a one way in, one way out tour, with a few videos, and lots to see and learn. The views from the bridge of the Thames and London are lovely. You can view the Gherkin from the bridge. Not very pricey either. One of the lower fees for attractions in London. Definite MUST do.
A very interesting tour. This was a very interesting tour - especially relevant with the upcoming Jubilee celebrations. I would highly recommend it

Worth having a look at !. We went to London for a long weekend and did most of the tourist sites, we didn’t intend on visiting tower bridge but ended up buying a ticket outside after having a offer, the bridge is one of the most recognisable landmarks in London, and its history is fascinating, the tour takes about 30 minutes total and the view from the two viewing platforms is impressive, top tip though, the Photoshop pictures can be replicated by walking down the embankment towards HMS Belfast. Overall may not appeal to everybody, perhaps not for those with very young children, but older kids with a fascination for mechanical objects will be fascinated.

Bridge in Time. Tower Bridge is one of London's most iconic images, but beyond that it has now become the centre for a great culinary and drinking experience. Around Tower Bridge and between it and London Bridge (foreigners often confuse the two) are at least 27 pubs serving England's great traditional 'real ale'. Try the Draft House, on Tower Bridge Road, just south of the river, or the Dean Swift, around the corner on Gainsford Street, or the Shipwright's Arms on Tooley Street, The Market Porter or The Rake in Borough Market. As for the bridge itself go into the museum and see the great hydraulic engines once used to raise its bascules (now down electrically) or climb up the staircase to cross the river the way people used to do up until the 1920s when it was closed because of overuse by prostitutes for 'quickies' in the alcoves.
worth a visit. Visiting the bridge and taking the tour through the towers is worth the time and cost.

Lots of good information - if you can be bothered reading it!. The tour started in the lift up to the top with a tour guide rattling through where we would be visiting on the tour. This gave me the mistaken impression that she would be accompanying us all - but this was not the case. We were left to watch a video (which was good and informative) and then ushered to see some pictures of bridges along one of the enclosed walkways inside the bridge (great for photos though!). There was then another video and then a walk up the other walk way showing pictures of Olympic cities over the years. No guides. Nothing. We were then ushered downstairs to see some of the equipment used for working the bridge. This would have been fascinating, had there been someone there to bring it all alive. Instead, we had written information to read. . . which is all well and good but you can't beat having a human to tell you little nuggets of information. There was an Olympic inspired game/information hunt for the children, which was nice. But, to be honest, we all left a little disappointed.
